description: White-citrus aromas are fresh and pointy. Punchy citric acidity and a lean body make this a racy Sauvignon Blanc with little depth. Simple grapefruit, orange and celery flavors continue on a bright finish.
title: Wapisa 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Rio Negro Valley)

description: Flat candied red-berry aromas come with an artificial coating of clove. This mystery red blend is fleshy and smacking on the palate, with herbal flavors of tomato, red plum and red apple. Sticky tannins fatten up the finish.
title: Sayanca 2017 Red (Mendoza)

description: A rusty tint and unconvincing aromas of clove, mushroom and dried leaves lead to a thin palate with hardly any body or weight. Odd flavors of sour red fruits, spice and chicken fat are vaguely citrusy on the finish.
title: Cruz Alta 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Mendoza)

description: Earthy plum and berry aromas include a fair amount of oak and tobacco, while this blend of Malbec, Bonarda and Syrah feels plump, with cutting tomato-like acidity and rubbing tannins. Wood-spice, pepper and baked plum flavors finish with mild black-fruit notes and stronger hints of clove and baking spices.
title: La Posta 2017 Tinto Red (Mendoza)

description: Cherry and blackberry aromas are accented by tire rubber. A tight linear palate is a bit scratchy, while herbal plum and currant flavors fade quickly on a finish that shows an oaky note of clove.
title: Argento 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Blackberry aromas are friendly and not forced. This is a fresh-styled Cabernet with some smack to a palate with firm acidity and notable tannins. Flavors of berry fruits and plum skins finish tight and mildly tannic.
title: Santa Julia 2017 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Valle de Uco)

description: Berry aromas include a cool minty note as well as a touch of animal. Like most Mendoza and Uco Valley 2016 Cabernets, this is tight and snappy in feel due to a cool and rainy year. Lightly herbal berry flavors are slightly woody, while this is clipped and dry on the finish.
title: Bodega Catena Zapata 2016 High Mountain Vines Cabernet Sauvignon (Agrelo)

description: Dense berry aromas come with notes of clove and nutmeg on a baked nose. Pulling tannins make for a rubbing mouthfeel, while this Cabernet tastes largely of oak and clove, with berry undertones. Spicy oak and minty green notes are both notable on the finish.
title: Valentin Bianchi 2016 Famiglia Bianchi Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Slightly murky and herbal berry aromas are a click less than fresh. This blend of 80% Cabernet and 20% Syrah feels heavy and tannic, with a shock of bracing acidity. Woody, slightly roasted stewed berry flavors finish with a barbecued note and beefy weight.
title: Dralion 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Mendoza)

description: A deep purple color and gummy aromas of blackberry and raisin lead to a full but collapsed palate with a hint of volatility. Blackberry and herbal plum flavors come with bitter oak notes, while this Malbec blend doesn't project much fruit on a short finish.
title: Trivento 2016 Amado Sur Red (Mendoza)

description: Leafy berry aromas include notes of iodine and dried blood. A severely dry and clamping palate is light in weight but rough, while a toasty earthy flavor profile is low on fruit. A finish with rubbery tannins and leafy flavors of tomato and spice is dry and scouring.
title: Marcelo Mira 2016 Joven Pinot Noir (Patagonia)

description: Gritty aromas of red fruits and spicy oak are a touch stalky at first but come around with airing. A fresh, healthy palate is slightly pulling and raw, but not coarse. Red plum, currant and tomato flavors finish with modest oak and length.
title: Luigi Bosca 2016 Pinot Noir (Maipe)

description: Light generic red-berry aromas include a hint of sandalwood. While this is fresh and easy on the palate, it's also thin much like tea. Leafy plum and currant flavors include a touch of licorice, while this ends with a note of cocoa on a finish with residual tangy acidity.
title: Familia Colombi 2015 Private Selection Pinot Noir (Mendoza)

description: Mint and grass aromas blend into blackberry scents. This feels lean, dry and grabby. Sappy flavors of red plum and tomato are more raw than full, while this is fittingly dry and short on a finish with woody notes.
title: Proemio 2015 Reserve Petit Verdot (Mendoza)

description: A mostly neutral nose includes a hint of soupy berry fruit. A sticky palate is gummed up by heavy residual sugar, while this tastes like cherry candy without acidity.
title: Dos Familias 2017 Balcon de los Andes Sweet Red (Mendoza)

description: Gritty roasted red-fruit aromas set up a thin choppy palate emboldened by citric acidity. Weedy foxy raspberry and plum flavors finish with high acidity and not much body.
title: Pindal 2017 Made With Organic Grapes Red (Mendoza)

description: Foxy berry aromas are candied, jumpy and not serious. This blend of Malbec and Cab Franc is edgy on the palate, with questionable structure. Herbal, sappy and saucy flavors finish without much to savor.
title: Santa Julia 2017 Reserva Mountain Blend Malbec-Cabernet Franc (Valle de Uco)

description: Grapy blackberry and black plum aromas come with oak spice on the side. While this is more lazy and horizontal in feel than upright, the palate is packed with fruit flavors, blackberry and cassis in particular. Chocolate and toast notes grace a satisfying finish. Fans of Argentinean wines seeking something other than Malbec will be well served by this.
title: La Posta 2017 Armando Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: Apple and fresh pumpkin aromas announce a round, healthy palate with bracing acidity. Dried tropical fruit flavors of mango, papaya and pineapple are clean and solid. Everything about this partially malolactic Chardonnay is pleasing and of good quality. Drink now.
title: Mascota 2017 Unanime Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Resiny oak is the chief aroma, while vanilla completes the aromatic picture. As in previous years, a heavy application of oak and fairly low acidity combine to create a weighty, flat-planed Chardonnay. Wood resin, vanilla and coconut flavors are more prominent than fruit, while this is soft on the finish. Drink now.
title: El Enemigo 2017 Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Opaque in color and full of plum, cassis and blackberry aromas, this is a very good Bonarda. A full palate shows plenty of grape, blackberry and cassis flavors. For a ripe, everyday red wine for pizza, burgers or flank steak, pour this with gusto.
title: Argento 2017 Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: Savory aromas of currant and red plum are smoky and roasted. This is a punchy, medium-bodied PN with fresh acidity. Red currant and cherry pie lavors come with spicy oak notes, while this is direct on a snappy finish.
title: La Posta 2017 Glorieta Pinot Noir (Mendoza)

description: Plum and dark-berry aromas are slightly minty and mildly green. A dry edgy palate qualifies as fresh, while this tastes largely of fresh plum and black currant along with a hint of toasty oak. A high-energy finish is snappy and fresh, much like the rest of this cool-vintage Cabernet.
designation: Gran Reserva Vista Flores Single Vineyard
title: Finca El Origen 2016 Gran Reserva Vista Flores Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)

description: Foxy berry and plum aromas rattle around before settling on scented hand soap. A tight palate owes its feel to grape skins, while staunch acidity sticks out. Said acidity makes for narrow plum flavors and a drawing finish with controlled tartness.
title: Alta Vista 2016 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: A big oaky nose smells of animal and Brett as well as blueberry and blackberry. This Cabernet is chunky and full but not all that structured. Savory gamy berry flavors finish with touches of mint, earth and leather.
title: Proemio 2016 Reserva Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Mildly oxidized, oily aromas are low on fruit and play up haystack and stalky notes. This unusual organic-grape blend is Sauvignon Blanc, Viognier and Chardonnay, and it's yellowish in color as well as full and almost creamy on the palate. Dry apple flavors turn bitter on a flat finish.
designation: Inkarri Made With Organic Grapes Estate Bottled
title: Chakana 2016 Inkarri Made With Organic Grapes Estate Bottled White (Mendoza)

description: A cloudy tint and gritty pulling aromas of underripe berry fruits make for a challenging start. Raw and scrubbing tannins frame slightly green berry flavors, while this is dry and scratchy on the finish.
title: Mendoza Vineyards 2016 La Vida d'Argentine Gran Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Ripe black fruit aromas come with hints of prune and fig. A lush but sturdy palate is well balanced, with soft but present tannins. Earthy, salty plum and wild berry flavors are deep and satisfying, while this Bonarda is toasty, firm and fairly long on the finish.
title: El Enemigo 2016 La Esperanza Single Vineyard Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: Clean black fruit aromas are pure and flush. In the mouth, this Bonarda feels bouncy and fresh, with good build and structure. Dark plum and blackberry flavors are tasty despite not showing much nuance or complexity, while this is steady, clean and smooth on the finish.
title: El Enemigo 2016 El Barranco Single Vineyard Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: Spicy oak, floral notes and incense aromas are more profound than any particular fruit scent. This is a full and grabby Pinot with some aggressiveness. Oaky plum, currant and baking spice flavors are carried over to the finish.
title: Luca 2016 G Lot Pinot Noir (Tupungato)

description: Raspberry and plum aromas are fruity, slightly jammy and a touch medicinal. On the palate, this is tight but with fleshy depth. Plum, wild berry and baking spice flavors finish firm and bright, with a healthy kick. Given that 2016 was a difficult vintage for red wines in Mendoza, this qualifies as a success.
title: Salentein 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Valle de Uco)

description: Ripe berry aromas include desiccated notes of raisin and prune, but even so this Bonarda doesn't smell cooked or overripe. A plump body is friendly and smooth, while oaky berry flavors are pleasing even if they lack intensity and length on the finish.
title: El Enemigo 2016 Los Paraisos Single Vineyard Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: Saucy plum aromas are lightly herbal and suggest paprika or Spanish pimenton. A plump, grabby palate is tannic but not rough. Gamy dark fruit flavors display grip across a structured, fresh finish, and overall this racy CF is a big success given the rainy El Nino conditions of 2016.
title: Finca la Celia 2016 Pioneer Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

description: Smoky, charred aromas sit atop meaty, savory berry scents. Structurally speaking, this Cab Franc from a rain-plagued vintage is edgy and a bit lacking in the midpalate. Oak flavors combined with saucy berry and plum notes end with dry tannins and snap.
title: El Enemigo 2016 Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

description: Stewed berry aromas are oaky and a bit murky. On the palate, this is chunky and wide, with tannic rub. Roasted berry flavors come with a whole lot of oak, which means the finish tastes pasty, creamy and chocolaty, with herbal plum as the lasting fruit flavor.
title: El Enemigo 2016 Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: Creamy oak creates vanilla-like aromas to go with plum and berry scents. This Bonarda is raw and pulling in feel, with severely dry tannins. Blackberry and oak comprise a limited flavor profile, while this tastes mostly of oak and wood grain on a grabby finish.
title: El Enemigo 2016 El Mirador Single Vineyard Bonarda (Mendoza)

description: Rubbery berry fruit aromas are a bit pinched and narrow. In the mouth, this is chewy and dense, with tomatoey acidity. Savory, lightly herbal plum, spice and tomato flavors finish with snap.
title: Chakana 2016 Estate Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Cherry-cough-drop, cassis and licorice aromas are bright and right, while the nose of this 90% Cab Franc (with 10% Malbec) isn't over the top. A full palate, like the nose, doesn't bulldoze, while this tastes of well-oaked berry fruits and chocolate. With a good piece of meat, this will do you right. Drink through 2026.
title: Luigi Bosca 2015 Gala 4 Cabernet Franc-Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Stalky berry and plum aromas come with a rugged scent of burning brush prior to a palate that's sinewy and acidic more than filled out and fruity. Leafy herbal flavors of red plum and red currant are fresh, racy and taut on a reserved finish. At only 13.5% ABV, this is a much lighter version of Alta than in the past.
title: Bodega Catena Zapata 2015 Alta Historic Rows Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Woodsy aromas of black fruit and gingerbread create a friendly nose that lacks exactness. This is bulky on the palate, with dense berry flavors that are foresty, minty and oaky. Spice and chocolate mint flavors blend with lightly herbal berry notes on the finish.
title: Bodega Catena Zapata 2015 Alta Historic Rows Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Smooth aromas of berry fruits, fig, tobacco and chocolate signal a well-oaked blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Malbec. This signature wine for Catena is powerful and lusty on the palate, with flavors of toasty oak, fig, blackberry and spice all rolled into a fine whole. Long and toasty on the finish, this should be at its peak in a couple of years. Drink through 2026.
title: Bodega Catena Zapata 2014 Nicolas Catena Zapata Red (Mendoza)

description: Chocolaty blackberry aromas are at the center of a deep nose that's also creamy from lactic oak. Juicy acidity bolsters the palate, which is full and balanced. Black plum and blackberry flavors include a smear of chocolate and mild herbal notes, while this Malbec is chewy and chocolaty on the finish. Drink through 2024.
title: Durigutti 2015 HD Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Roasted berry aromas are rubbery, herbal and slightly weedy. This feels chunky and heavy, with flavors of stewed berry fruits, forced oak and clove. Creamy weight, rubbery tannins and a note of caramel complete the finish on this basic red blend.
designation: Signature Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled
title: Zolo 2017 Signature Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Red (Mendoza)

description: Plum and cassis aromas are not overwhelming or oaky, and instead are more elegant and fresh. This Cabernet feels firm and pulling, with rubbery tannins. Flavors of berry fruits and chocolaty oak finish dry, with an emphasis on peppery spice.
title: Antucura 2015 Pukara Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Vista Flores)

description: This Tannat from Salta smells a touch mulchy and meaty, which is normal for the variety and region. A full fleshy palate offers soft tannins and little resistance. Toasty blackberry and cassis flavors wrap up on a finish with dense tannins and some excess weight and heat. For an authentic taste of Tannat, this is where to go.
title: El Esteco 2016 Don David Reserve Tannat (Calchaqui Valley)

description: Soapy grapey aromas fail to round into anything more specific or elevated. On the palate, this is clampy and rubbery, without much give. Flavors of grapey-berry fruits and rhubarb veer towards green, while rough tannins on the finish are grabby.
title: Pena Viva 2016 Roca Lisa Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Rubbery berry aromas are gamy and suggest tar and asphalt. A full and saturated palate fits the Enemigo mode, while pulling tannins push down the palate feel. Charred flavors of dark fruits become more peppery and wood spicy on the finish.
title: El Enemigo 2015 Gran Enemigo Agrelo Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

description: Earthy roasted berry aromas are smoky and derived from copious oak, which also provides notes of tobacco, cedar and vanilla. A full and layered palate offers flavors of earthy plum along with wood-based vanilla and tobacco. Pepper, marzipan and vanilla flavors lead a finish with reasonable complexity. Drink through 2022.
designation: Gran Enemigo El Cepillo Single Vineyard
title: El Enemigo 2015 Gran Enemigo El Cepillo Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

description: This is another in the Enemigo single-vineyard series of Cabernet Francs, and it's big up-front, with smoky black-fruit aromas that are gamy and smell like a desert fire. A wiry palate is more clampy than other wines in the line, while this tastes of plum skins and feels raw and rubbery on a drawing finish.
title: El Enemigo 2015 Gran Enemigo Chacayes Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

description: A full, lusty blend of dark berry aromas mixed with tomatoey notes and herbs leads to a strong-boned palate with snappy acidity, freshness and depth. Heavy oak has mostly been absorbed, allowing for plum, raspberry, tomato and herbal flavors to express themselves. This is a ripe, meaty New World Cab Franc that fits right into the Enemigo mold; drink through 2024.
title: El Enemigo 2015 Gran Enemigo Gualtallary Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

description: Aromas of tree bark, cola and chocolate hide the fact that the fruit here isn't distinguished. A high-acid palate lends flash to gamy berry and red fruit flavors, but also a screechy sensation. A salty finish is once again gamy in flavor, but also seemingly pumped up by acidity that doesn't come naturally.
title: El Enemigo 2015 Gran Enemigo Red (Mendoza)

description: Tobacco and mocha aromas help soften lemony high-toned notes on the nose. A grabby palate shows acidic pinch, while berry flavors are peppery, chocolaty and display caramel and coffee from oak. A drawing but tasty finish says this will last through at least 2022.
title: Weinert 2013 Carrascal Cabernet Sauvignon (Lujan de Cuyo)

description: A saturated purple color and dusty but concentrated blackberry and cassis aromas set up a lush palate that's stacked with fruit. Plum and berry flavors are big and fruity, while this blend of Malbec and Syrah with a touch of Cabernet is steady and smooth on a plump dark-fruit finish.
title: Domaine Bousquet 2017 Gaia Made With Organic Grapes Red (Tupungato)

description: Meaty plum and berry aromas are gamy at first, then more full and round with the benefit of airing. A full and grabby palate displays muscle and tannins more than finesse, while savory berry and plum flavors finish with residual dryness. Drink this authentic Cabernet through 2022.
title: Domaine Bousquet 2017 Reserve Made with Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Tupungato)

description: Roasted berry aromas are initially leathery and earthy, then slightly animal influenced as this Cabernet breathes. Rubbing tannins and a compact mouthfeel eschew elegance, while flavors of plum and berry fruits are dry, peppery and slightly medicinal all the way through the finish.
title: Alta Vista 2017 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Earthy plum, currant and herb aromas form a classical Pinot Noir nose. In the mouth, this is fairly full but also fresh and balanced. Chocolaty oak flavors sit on top of plum and currant, while this is long on a finish with notable but well-applied oak.
title: Domaine Bousquet 2017 Reserve Made with Organic Grapes Pinot Noir (Tupungato)

description: Spicy plum, berry and dry herb aromas are accented by cheesy oak and a hint of barnyard. On the palate, this worthy Tempranillo is plump, juicy and balanced. Lightly baked spicy plum and berry flavors are uncomplicated, while this tastes meaty and savory on a dry and focused finish.
title: Zuccardi 2016 Q Tempranillo (Mendoza)

description: Pure berry aromas lean toward black fruits. On the palate, this cool-vintage Cabernet is fresh and firm, with a tight grip. Cherry and berry flavors are quick and punchy, with a touch of supporting oak, while a dry finish with crisp acidity includes plum and cherry notes.
title: Chakana 2016 Inkarri Winemaker's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Jammy berry aromas are clean and cheerful. This cool-vintage Cab Sauvignon feels tight, fresh and bursting with energy. Black-plum, wild-berry and peppery flavors finish crisp, dry and lightly toasted.
title: Lamadrid 2016 Single Vineyard Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Agrelo)

description: Spicy black-fruit aromas are in the lead, backed by mild notes of tomato leaf and green herbs. A tight and juicy palate features bold acidity, while flavors of blackberry, black currant and black pepper wrap up on a fresh finish that's slightly raw and tart.
title: Zuccardi 2016 Q Cabernet Sauvignon (Valle de Uco)

description: Grapey aromas are exotic and unusual for Mendoza, which makes sense seeing that this is a blend of Malbec and Corvina, the latter an Italian variety. A plump fleshy palate is more globular and chunky than finessed, while this tastes dark, blackened and like stewed black grapes prior to a slightly bitter finish.
designation: Passo Doble Made with Organic Grapes
title: Masi Tupungato 2016 Passo Doble Made with Organic Grapes Red (Uco Valley)

description: Cassis, cherry, animal fur, sugar beet and raisiny aromas are telling in that they struggle to come together, much like the rest of this hard-pounding Cabernet from a difficult vintage for late-harvest reds. Clipped plum and olive flavors are uncomfortable on a chippy palate with acidity and astringency issues.
title: Las Vertientes 2016 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Jumbled aromas of roasted fruits and road tar come around with airing but are never fully convincing. This Cabernet feels sappy and mildly abrasive, while foresty berry flavors are modest, as is a fleshy finish.
title: Ricardo Santos 2016 Una Seleccion Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: The combination of skilled Winemaker Hector Durigutti and this particular vineyard usually results in excellent Cab Franc, even in a poor vintage like 2016. This smells spicy, leathery and a touch earthy and green. A tight palate of firm tannins offers flavors of dark cherry, black plum and chocolate.
title: Lamadrid 2016 Single Vineyard Reserva Cabernet Franc (Agrelo)

description: A lively nose is saucy and lightly herbal, with plum and berry notes. A firm, slightly raw palate features pointy tannins, while this tastes of tomato, plum and berry fruits. Drying tannins and snappy acidity are the main factors on a fresh finish. Given that 2016 was a rainy vintage, this deserves praise.
title: Bressia 2016 Monteagrelo Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

description: Animal, dried berry and prune aromas lead to a reserved palate featuring rubbery subdued tannins. Savory dark-berry flavors are earthy and herbal, while this is short and minty on the finish. While nothing miraculous, this blend of Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah rises to a fairly high level.
title: Chakana 2015 Estate Selection Red (Valle de Uco)

description: Earthy, slightly stalky berry aromas include a note of ground leaves. This Tempranillo is full and flush, with typical Mendoza size. Blackberry, plum, olive and brown-sugar flavors finish with all the weight this tasty honest red can handle.
title: Bodega Calle 2015 El Olvidado Reserva Tempranillo (Mendoza)

description: Aromas of lead pencil and wood shavings share space on the nose with rubbery berry-fruit notes. This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Merlot is pulpy and fruit forward, with tension to the palate. Spicy berry and plum flavors are a touch cheesy, while this tastes savory and roasted on a dry lean finish.
title: Nieto Senetiner 2015 Don Nicanor Red (Mendoza)

description: An opaque black color and grapy, blatantly ripe berry aromas open this chunky Malbec from a difficult vintage. A scratchy palate displays scraping tannins, while this tastes blackened, charred and low on vivid fruit. Peppercorn spice and other dark flavors take this overripe but manageable Malbec home.
title: Luca 2015 Nico Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Earthy, meaty berry aromas are accompanied by notes of iodine and iron. A sturdy palate shows very dry tannins, while this tastes of peppery berry fruits prior to a savory tasting finish with wiry acidity, pushy oak and firm residual tannins.
title: Amaru 2015 High Altitude Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Calchaqui Valley)

description: Earthy blackberry aromas are slightly murky and thus lack precision. This Malbec from a sketchy vintage feels chewy and a bit heavy across the palate. Berry and cassis flavors are a touch gummy and stewed, while this feels tannic and tastes of blueberry and green herb on the finish.
title: Pascual Toso 2015 Reserva Barrancas VIneyards Malbec (Mendoza)

description: A full blast of cassis and blackberry aromas conveys ripeness, while a side of murky earth is a barrier to greater excellence. On the palate, this is chewy, tannic and rich. Plum and blackberry flavors are familiar for quality Mendoza Malbec, while this feels a bit rubbery and tannic on the finish. For a marginal vintage like 2015, this deserves praise. Drink through 2023.
title: Chakana 2015 Estate Selection Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Aromas of blackberry, mocha and oak spice ring true and are in harmony. A flush palate displays fine balance, while spiced berry, plum, soy sauce and savory tea flavors land smoothly on a finish where subtle spicy oak returns and holds court. Drink through 2026.
title: Mi Terruno 2013 Icono Red (Mendoza)

description: Mature berry, dusty barn and slight volatility tamp down the nose on this flush muscular Cabernet. Spiced plum flavors are savory and fruity at the same time. A steady finish with honest but hard tannins are a plus and suggest this as a good dinner wine, especially for meat dishes.
title: Antis 2013 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Leafy, earthy red-fruit aromas show a hint of animal. Tightness drawn from tomatoey acidity and rubbing tannins make food a requirement, while currant and berry flavors are tight and reedy. This is a dry red-fruit Cabernet that emphasizes freshness and tension.
title: Carlos Basso 2013 Vina Amalia Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)

description: Beefy plum and blackberry aromas are a touch roasted and soupy. This Malbec-led blend is full in body, with a mild sense of berry syrup offset by notable but welcome tartaric acidity. Chocolaty black fruit flavors finish toasty and lively for a ripe wine that's now more than eight years removed from harvest.
title: Antis 2010 Gran Reserva Red (Mendoza)

description: Baked berry, root beer, cassis and licorice root aromas set up a firm and solid palate that's in good health. Slightly salty and roasted flavors of cassis, tobacco, root beer and braised beef finish with heady warmth.
title: Wild Iris 2010 Reserve Malbec (Mendoza)

description: The award for the funkiest Tempranillo this side of Spain goes to this herbaceous number with the heavy pine, juniper and feline aromas. On the palate, this is heavy and soupy, while the flavor profile is green and sharp, with briny pickled notes throughout.
title: Altocedro 2017 Ano Cero Tempranillo (La Consulta)

description: Red-plum and raspberry aromas are lean and come with a note of cinnamon. Astringency and tartness are notable issues on a high-acid palate that's dealing strained flavors of plum skins and currant. On the finish, this Patagonian Cab Franc is sharp and even a touch sour, with rubbery tannins and a persistent tang.
title: Verum 2017 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Alto Valle del Rio Negro)

description: While no other wines from this label have stood out in prior tastings, this blend of Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc is attractive and shows pretty aromas of blueberry, savory spice and graham cracker. A structured palate is sinewy and in good shape despite its age, while this tastes of savory, roasted berry fruits and chocolate. On the finish, this is chewy and doesn't waver. Drink now.
title: Argenses 2011 Grand Blend Block #12 Red (Mendoza)

description: A deep-purple tint sets the stage for fleshy blackberry, cassis, fig and cinnamon aromas. On the palate, this blend of Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon, Tempranillo and Syrah is wide and jammy. Beefy berry, cassis and black-plum flavors land on a fleshy finish with just enough tightness and focus. Drink through 2022.
title: Altocedro 2017 La Consulta Select Red (La Consulta)

description: A saturated purple color along with stalky, slightly reduced black-fruit aromas lead to a fully extracted palate with grabby tannins and not much finesse. Burnt, roasted plum and berry flavors are savory more than fruity and ripe, while this Malbec-Tannat blend is smoky, peppery and tannic on a drying finish.
title: Piattelli 2017 Reserva Malbec-Tannat (Cafayate)

description: Jammy aromas of red-licorice candy and red currant get a boost in complexity from brick dust and spice notes. Like most wines from this producer, this Cab Franc is big and jammy on the palate, with some flatness. Ripe flavors of blackberry, raisin and prune finish minty and lightly herbal, with mild heat.
title: Benegas 2016 Arraigo Benegas Estate Wine Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

description: Jammy raisin and fig aromas are less than resolute, while a hard-driving, intense palate is less than refined. Forward plum and berry flavors come with toasty oak as a backup, while on the finish this darkens up and takes on a peppery flavor profile.
title: Benegas 2016 Arraigo Benegas Estate Wine Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Berry and plum aromas are a touch jammy and raisiny. A smacking palate with pulp and weight offers plum, currant and herbal flavors. This Cabernet turns over no new stones, but it's savory tasting, fresh and in good shape on the finish.
title: Trivento 2016 Golden Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)

description: Ultraripe aromas of raisin, oud wood and musky men's cologne are attractive and complex for a young Cabernet that's putting out at max level in terms of lushness and extraction. Deep oaky blackberry and chocolate flavors hold onto a cafe-mocha note on a full finish. Drink through 2024.
title: Vina Cobos 2015 Bramare Marchiori Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Perdriel)

description: Oaky black-fruit aromas run heavy on the clove, chocolate and wild herbs. This Malbec blend is fleshy on the palate, with blackberry, leather and roasted flavors. A warm finish shows savory notes of barbecue sauce and clove to go with black-fruit flavors.
title: Lamadrid 2015 Begani Premium Blend Red (Agrelo)

description: Earthy berry aromas are herbal and floral, and overall this smells, tastes and feels different than most Mendoza reds. The palate is both saturated and freshly grapey, while black-plum, cardamom and mint flavors conclude on a reedy tasting and rubbing finish with coffee notes.
title: Flechas de los Andes 2015 Punta de Flechas Red (Argentina)

description: Rubbery fishy aromas are low on fruit. A choppy palate ranks as rough and grating, while this tastes oddly greasy and strange. A flat chunky rubbery finish is fitting given what comes beforehand.
title: Tomero 2015 Reserva Petit Verdot (Mendoza)

description: Black cherry and blackberry aromas share space on the nose with varietally familiar herbal saucy notes. A firm grip and tight tannins make for a structured palate, while this is minty, spicy, oaky and herbal more than outright fruity in terms of flavors. Tightness via pulling tannins remains on the finish, meaning this has time to evolve. Drink through 2025.
title: Matias Riccitelli 2015 Vinedos De Montana Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

description: Black plum, blackberry and sandalwood are the aromas on this fleshy, bulky blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Cab Franc. In the mouth, chunky, sappy weight is cut by tartaric acidity, while this tastes of berry fruits and oaky coconut and vanilla. A jammy finish fades away slowly.
title: Mascota 2015 Unanime Gran Vino Tinto Red (Uco Valley)

description: Concentrated aromas of dark plum and blackberry are what serious Mendoza Malbecs are made of, and this has them. Although this is wiry on the palate, there's enough depth, pulp and weight to handle punchy acidity. Wild berry and black plum flavors hit the road on a finish that's crisp, fresh and showing slightly scratchy tannins. Drink through 2024.
title: Pampas del Sur 2015 Gran Malbec (Mendoza)

description: Soft berry aromas start off this red blend. A thick, full-bodied palate is a touch soupy in feel, while this tastes of stewed blackberry mixed with baking spices. A full finish with mellow tannins is the conclusion on this five-grape blend.
title: Clos de los Siete 2015 Red (Uco Valley)

description: Earthy blackberry aromas are intense, deep and softened by a note of oak-based vanilla. On the palate, this high-end Petit Verdot is full bodied, with firm tannins. Creamy berry and cassis flavors are overtly but nicely oaked, while savory spice and game notes add complexity to a black-fruit finish. Drink this fine example of varietal PV through 2022.
title: Finca Decero 2014 Mini Ediciones Remolinos Vineyard Petit Verdot (Agrelo)

description: The black-fruit aromas on this Malbec-Cab Franc are impressive, and while the palate is tight, drawing and powerful, there's a sense of correctness about its size and strength. Blackberry, cassis and plum flavors are primed by strong acidity, while overall this is a broad fruity Argentine red in all its glory. Enjoy with a good steak through 2028.
title: Trapiche 2013 Iscay Malbec-Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

description: Woodsy foresty berry aromas are charred and gritty, with gamy funky Syrah notes in the lead. A pinchy palate with squeaky tannins delivers a big blast of fully toasted and herbal black-fruit flavors and chocolate. On the finish, minty oak and wood-grain flavors have not yet settled. Drink through 2025.
title: Trapiche 2013 Iscay Syrah-Viognier (Mendoza)

description: A closed nose bubbles to life with tones of coconut and ripe berries, while the hefty palate is built by gripping tannins. Black-fruit flavors reign, with notes of hoisin sauce and licorice on the side. Drink through 2022.
title: Salentein 2013 Pr1mum Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)

description: Classic Uco Valley aromas of deep berry fruits are touched-up by cheesy oak that lends tobacco and vanilla to the nose. On the palate, this blend of Malbec, Syrah and Cab Franc is choppy, acidic and still raw after years in the bottle. Cherry, plum and raspberry flavors are Bordeaux-like, while staunch acidity returns on the finish. Drink through 2028 - this will last for ages.
title: Flechas de los Andes 2012 Gran Corte Red (Argentina)

description: Soupy plum and berry aromas are thick and suggest tomato and basil, while overall the nose on this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cab Franc and Merlot is stewy. A thick, syrupy palate holds stewed black fruit flavors, while this is heavy on the finish. No two ways about it: This is a thick, stewy wine made in the house style. Drink now.
title: Benegas 2011 Arraigo Benegas Estate Single Vineyard Red (Mendoza)

description: Dark aromas of olive, brambly spice and berry syrup lead to a medicinal palate that's sticky but cut by tartaric acidity. Chocolaty-berry and black-plum flavors are oozing mocha and coffee from the sides. On the finish, this still-lively Cab Franc is hard and tannic yet thick in texture.
title: Benegas 2010 Arraigo Benegas Old Vines Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

description: Deep berry and plum aromas are dark, ripe and come with a hint of tire rubber. This blend is led by Cabernet Sauvignon and is backed by Cab Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. The palate is chewy and dense, with rubbery tannins, while this tastes of baked black fruits and prune. Chocolaty richness is a key component of a lush finish. Drink through 2020.
title: Benegas 2010 Arraigo Benegas Estate Old Vines Red (Mendoza)

description: A rusty color and aromas of root beer, maple and scented soap indicate that this mature Cabernet is not about fruit. Fig, chocolate and overripe base flavors end with strong suggestions of Port and Sherry. This is interesting more than anything else at this point. Drink now.
title: Weinert 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Ripe berry and fig aromas come with oak-based vanilla, cedar and tobacco notes. This Malbec-led blend is full and saturated on the palate, with measurable core acidity. A mix of oaky berry, vanilla and tobacco flavors finishes short, with more mocha and chocolate than anything else.
title: Piattelli 2015 Trinita  Grand Reserve Red (Lujan de Cuyo)

description: Saucy herbal aromas are similar to an oregano-rich spaghetti sauce, but don't let that be a turnoff. On the palate, this Uco Valley Cab Franc is round, full and balanced by good acidity. Flavors of baked plum, chocolate and nutmeg finish with creamy weight and minty notes. Drink through 2024.
title: Vina Cobos 2015 Bramare Chanares Estate Cabernet Franc (Valle de Uco)

description: Hailing from a hot vintage, this mature Malbec smells ripe, baked and much like raisin and chocolate. A huge palate is creamy and lush; balsamic berry, chocolate and stewed fig flavors finish slow and steady, with chocolaty richness. Drink through 2020.
title: Antigal 2009 One La Dolores Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza)

description: An opaque color announces this highly saturated and fully extracted wine. Smoky, grapey aromas are matched by a pulpy palate that's thick and jammy. Up-front plum and berry flavors are exuberant but lack backing on a mellow finish.
title: Franсois Lurton 2017 L'Esprit de Chacayes Red (Uco Valley)

description: Herbal berry fruit and baking spice aromas are alert and forward. This Cab Franc is tight in stature, with some resiny thickness from oak. Heavy oak is key to spicy berry flavors, while this tastes woody and feels firm on a solid, mostly well-balanced finish.
title: Alpasion 2015 Grand Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

description: Jammy berry aromas combined with fine oak result in nuances of chocolate, forest floor, mushroom and cool earth. This Malbec-heavy blend comes out screaming with tannins and tartaric bite. Big flavors of black plum, blackberry and vanilla spread out over a wide but youthful finish. Give this more time to integrate and settle; best from 2020 - 2026.
title: Cheval des Andes 2014 Red (Mendoza)

description: An opaque purple color and inky aromas of blueberry and cassis introduce this bold Malbec blend that also smells of char and maple. A fully packed palate is on the cusp of overextracted, while this tastes of jammy but generic black fruits. A mild toast flavor simmers in the background of a plodding finish. Drink through 2022.
title: Franсois Lurton 2014 Chacayes Red (Uco Valley)

description: Right away, this Cabernet Franc puts up a red flag in the form of heavy raisin and burnt wood aromas. A soupy palate is thick but lacking in acidity and structure. Overripe flavors of black fruits, raisin and wood finish hot and heavy, with residual notes of root beer, licorice and prune.
title: Luna De Esperanza 2014 Barrel Fermented Cabernet Franc (Uco Valley)

description: Cherry and blackberry aromas are intense and chocolaty, while the palate pounds with tannins, acidity and angular berry and plum fruit. As Cabernets go, this one is massive, but with a short finish where the fruit fades and is replaced by maple-like oak and heat. Drink through 2024.
title: Terrazas de Los Andes 2013 Single Vineyard Los Aromos Cabernet Sauvignon (Lujan de Cuyo)

description: Berry aromas are a touch stalky, with a hint of coffee grounds. This Malbec-led blend is edgy and tannic in feel, and a bit lean in the middle. Herbal black fruit flavors wrap up on a finish with choppy tannins. While nothing in particular excels, as a whole this is high in quality. Drink now.
title: Topografia 2011 Reserva Red (Valle de Uco)

description: This tasty expression of Vermentino is a bargain. The few years of age have slightly honeyed the juicy citrus and fig tones. They're tempered by talc and fresh herbs and lifted by florals. There's a delicious harmony between the slippery texture and prickly acidity on the palate.
title: Yalumba 2016 The Y Series Vermentino (South Australia)

description: Apples, pears, lemon citrus, white spice and a tropical base note all lead this wine into palate that shows some textural fruit weight, minerality and the region's characteristic knife-edge acidity. This is approachable in its youth and will pair well a range of food, but could also hold through 2026.
title: Silkman 2016 Semillon (Hunter Valley)

description: There's a cool, crisp quality to this wine, reminiscent of icy river water flowing over stones, with lemon zest, wool and a core of herbs and spices. The palate is austere, with the stoney minerality showing in both texture and flavor. The acidity is crisp but not searing, and the lemon fruit shows its face just for a moment. Drink now - 2025.
title: Silkman 2015 Blackberry Vineyard Semillon (Hunter Valley)

description: This wine offers bright elements of flowers and lemons that are highlighted by white pepper, lemon thyme and a fresh green vegetal note. The palate is laser focused and tightly wound, with a strong line of acidity beautifully balancing a silky smooth texture. Still very much in its youth, this will age well.
title: Tyrrell's 2012 Vat 1 Semillon (Hunter Valley)

description: This wine offers delicate notes of tangerine and flower blossoms backed by white spice and a slightly waxy, kerosene note. The palate shows exceptional poise in flavors of river stone, orange and flowers.
title: Best's 2017 Riesling (Great Western)

description: This wine is an austere, almost Riesling-like version of this often fruit-forward variety. There are restrained aromas of waxy lemons and limes alongside stone fruits, blossoms and nettles. The palate is tightly wound in crisp acidity. It's lacking in some fruit generosity and textural weight but a few years in bottle should bring forth intriguing honeyed characters. For now, this needs rich, fatty foods, like a buttery lobster or creamy risotto.
title: Mitolo 2017 Jester Vermentino (McLaren Vale)

description: Pale gold in color, this is a young, dry wine that offers aromas of lemon-lime popsicle, apple, flower blossoms and a touch of rubber. The acidity is searing at the moment, the kind that feels as though it will strip the enamel right off your teeth. Overall this is young and austere on the palate. Give this a few years in bottle for the acidity to settle and the flavors to gain some honeyed nuance. Drink 2020 - 2028.
title: Dandelion 2017 Wonderland of the Eden Valley Riesling (Eden Valley)

description: From acclaimed Aussie winemaker Ian Riggs in one of Australia's most historic wine regions, this seven-year-old wine is a lovely example of the age worthy Semillon. Rich, waxy lemon and honey notes give way to a herbal and flinty streak. The palate is seriously focused and tightly wound around a line of zesty, crunchy acidity and a waxy texture. You could happily enjoy this now, but leave it in the cellar for another five to 10 years and watch it evolve to a whole new level of complexity.
title: Brokenwood 2011 ILR Reserve Vineyard Selection Semillon (Hunter Valley)

description: This bright, aromatic Semillon comes from deep in Western Australia's Great Southern region. Notes of flowers and stone fruit show in this still youthful bottling. The palate offers a mineral streak and a stoney texture. Drink now - 2023.
title: Alkoomi 2013 Wandoo Semillon (Frankland River)

description: This wine sings a quiet tune of lime, flower blossoms, orange peel and talc. The talc continues on the palate in the form of a powdery texture and the delicate citrus flavors are enhanced by mouthwatering acidity. Drink now with spicy cuisine or cellar for another few decades.
title: Henschke 2017 Julius Riesling (Eden Valley)

description: Medium gold in color, this wine is starting to show touches of honey amidst waxy lemon, melon and wet wool. The palate is chalky-textured but a little on the flat side with mild acidity slinking in towards the end. Drink now - 2022.
title: Hope Estate 2016 Estate Grown Semillon (Hunter Valley)

description: This offers a full spectrum of aromas, from waxy lemon and stone fruit to a nuanced honey tone. The palate is juicy and citrusy, with a chalky texture and just enough acidity to suggest this could age for a few years more. Drink now - 2022.
title: David Franz 2012 Marg's Blood Semillon (Barossa Valley)

description: Kudos to this producer for thinking outside the box. This skin-contact white wine is fermented with native yeast, aged in fudre and bottled with minimal sulphur. It is a divisive style that yields a little volatility with its notes of sour lemon and tropical fruit. There's a nutty, butterscotch-like oxidative note too. The palate is rich but not as much as the nose suggests and a fine line of acidity keeps it lifted.
title: Koerner 2017 Gullyview Vineyard Rolle Vermentino (Clare Valley)

description: One of the Yarra Valley's most celebrated small-batch winemakers sources this Riesling from an area at nearly 2000 feet altitude. This vintage remains austere but is showing hints of honey-flecked bottle age. Delicate notes of lavender, lemon-lime, talc and wild yeast are there too. The palate is equally delicate but texturally intricate in flavors of wet wool and river rocks. The acidity isn't as razor-sharp as you might expect from an Aussie Riesling, but there's nevertheless enough for this to age gracefully for many years to come.
title: Mac Forbes 2016 RS10 Riesling (Strathbogie Ranges)

description: This wine is fruit-forward in aromas of citrus, green apple, kiwi and lychee. There's chalky minerality in the background, along with a white pepper spice. The palate offers a powdery texture, with racy acidity and crisp, crunchy fruit flavors.
title: Chalk Hill 2018 Wits End Vermentino (McLaren Vale)

description: This vintage is a more perfumed, almost candied expression of Riesling than the previous few vintages. It wafts intense tropical fruits, lychees and rose water on the nose. The palate is dry and not as fruity as the nose, but it's missing some lift and refreshment.
title: Chateau Tanunda 2018 Grand Barossa Dry Riesling (Barossa)

description: A graceful nose of grapefruit and orange starts off this wine and melds with salt, smoke, toast and crushed stone. The palate slithers along with a slick textured but crackling with crunchy acidity and a long, oyster shell finish. Drink now - 2023.
title: Snake and Herring 2017 Tough Love Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: This natural-leaning producer delivers once again, this time with a Sicilian variety from the up-and-coming Riverland region. This wine offers cran-raspberry fruit, drying leaves, earth, meat and drying herbs on the nose. The light- to medium-bodied palate brings more cranberry tang, with savory, sinewy tannins and an earthy core. This is a textural wine perfect for charcuterie or roast meats.
title: Unico Zelo 2017 The River Nero d'Avola (Riverland)

description: Made in small quantities, this is only the second vintage of this wine and so far the results are promising. The nose is heady and aromatic in tones of lemon-lime, peach juice, florals and touches of white pepper and wild herbs. A rush of racy acidity on the palate is balanced by a chalky, stoney texture. This is a refreshing, summery drop perfect for shellfish or Southeast Asian cuisine.
title: Jim Barry 2017 Assyrtiko (Clare Valley)

description: As is the case with many Italian varieties, Vermentino triumphs in McLaren Vale's warm, maritime climate. This version is bright, bouncy and delicious. Apple, peach, lemon-lime, white pepper spice and a chalky minerality glide delicately from the nose to the palate. It's light to medium bodied with a talc-like texture and bright acidity. Easy to knock back with or without food.
title: Chalk Hill 2017 Wits End Vermentino (McLaren Vale)

description: In this winery's typical reductive style, this Chardonnay begins its journey on the buttery, oniony side. Keep smelling though and melon fruit starts to appear, along with a salty, mineral streak. There's a creamy, toasty weight on the palate that's sliced through the middle with lemony acidity and chalky minerality. The fruit is still in hiding at the moment. Give this another year or so to knit together. Drink 2019 - 2023.
title: Vasse Felix 2017 Filius Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: The 2017 version of this southern Italian variety is still finding its way. Light gold in color, it's wild fermented, unoaked and spends 24 hours on skins. Fruit-led aromas of ripe pineapple, lychee, peach, along with a touch of florals lead into a slippery-textured palate that shows quite a lot of fruit weight and just enough acidity to prop up the richness.
title: Unico Zelo 2017 Jade & Jasper Fiano (Riverland)

description: From a small, natural-leaning producer in the Barossa, this Riesling starts off on quiet tones of waxy lemon, apple skin, yeast and wool. Unexpectedly, there's some sweetness on the palate and the waxy texture continues. It's lacking in some much needed acidity to offset the sweetness.
title: Geyer 2017 Springton Riesling (Barossa Valley)

description: A Chardonnay in ballerina slippers rather than combat boots, this wine is smoky, mineral and salty, with delicate yet juicy lemon-lime, orange and floral tones. It shows oak influence but balances it with a satiny texture and mouthwatering acidity. A long citrusy finish makes you want to take another sip. Drink now - 2023.
title: Sidewood 2016 Mappinga Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)

description: The fruit for this wine comes from the Karridale district in Margaret River's cooler south. The nose is fruity but delicately so, with a medley of tropical, melon and citrus fruits, salty sea air and toasted nuts. The medium-bodied palate displays juicy fruit, bright acidity, toasty oak and a saline streak that makes it easy to enjoy.
title: Snake and Herring 2016 Corduroy Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: This traditional method fizz offers aromas and flavors of juicy red apple, lemon zest, blossoms, a touch of honey and water crackers. This spent 30 months spent on its lees. Drink now.
title: Streicker 2014 Blanc de Blancs Brut Sparkling (Margaret River)

description: This is aromatic in a rush of fresh blackberries, florals, cinnamon and a streak of hot stone. The palate is light to medium bodied and brings a stalky, stony crunch to compliment the soft, silky texture and juicy fruit. It finishes savory and tangy, with the lifted acidity urging you to take another sip.
title: Luke Lambert 2017 Syrah (Yarra Valley)

description: This wine is still very much in its youth. Currently the butterscotch and vanilla notes jut out a little on the nose, but there's plenty of ripe fruit in the form of melon and pineapple to back it up, as well as a herbal, white pepper character. The oak gets a little chunky again on the palate, particularly on the finish, but with citrusy, mouthpuckering acidity balanced by fruit weight, this shows promise for a bright future. Drink now - 2025.
title: Clairault 2017 Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: Offering a lot of bang for buck from a relatively cool vintage in Margaret River, this wine has a waxy citrus fruit profile. Lifted aromas of lemon balm, citronella, herbs and sea spray are back by just a touch of oak-derived vanillin. The palate is tightly wound and solidly medium-bodied, with zingy, lemony acidity, a chalky texture and a soft spine of oak. The acidity is still a little sharp, however, so for more generosity, cellar for another year and drink 2019 - 2023.
title: Swings & Roundabouts 2017 Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: This wine is all about fruit and texture. Lifted aromas of apple skin, orange, pineapple rind and florals march straight into a light-bodied palate that is waxy-textured and cut by youthful acidity. Verdelho generally ages nicely and this should gain honeyed characters with time in bottle. Drink now - 2025.
title: Ashbrook Estate 2017 Verdelho (Margaret River)

description: Pale strawberry-hued, this wine flutters in tones of bright cherry, raspberry, florals, cracked pepper and allspice. The palate is silky in feel, with crunchy fruit and a decent streak of acidity.
title: Running with Bulls 2017 Garnacha (Barossa)

description: From a cool vintage, this wine is restrained in aromas of lemon, pink grapefruit and orange peel, along with a toasty oak note. The oak is more prominent on the palate while the fruit takes a back seat, but the wood takes the form of flavor rather than flabbiness. There's a composed quality to this wine that suggests it would be lovely on the dinner table.
title: Kangarilla Road 2017 Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)

description: This wine delivers all of the sea spray, melon rind, gunflint and oyster shell characteristics that Margaret River Chardonnay is known for. The palate shows power but not heaviness, textural weight but not richness, with a long line of salty minerality and mouthwatering acidity to boot. Drink now - 2028.
title: Vasse Felix 2016 Heytesbury Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: This is a reductive style of Chardonnay that leads with notes of struck match and celery salt. It only take a little swirling, however, to unlock the peach and mango aromas. The palate has weight and roundness but is propped up by a chalky texture, focused acidity and a mineral streak that finishes a little savory. Drink now - 2025.
title: Murdoch Hill 2016 Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)

description: This is a ripe barrel-fermented Fiano, with a touch of skin contact. Medium gold in hue, it offers aromas of lemon drop, ripe peach, pear and flower stalks. Creamy in texture, the palate has a more wild, floral feel, with a copper penny tang and a herbal, wet hay finish.
title: Alpha Crucis 2016 Fiano (McLaren Vale)

description: The 2016 vintage of this wine is a more vegetal affair than the previous year and is showing some reductive notes of onions and salted nuts, as well as a licorice-like oak sweetness. There're plenty of grilled nectarine, herbs, flint and toast notes too. Medium-bodied, silky textured and laced with a salty, mineral character, the oak creeps back in towards the end, but isn't overpowering.
title: Clairault 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: This extrovert Chardonnay offers ripe aromas of mango and lychee backed by a touch of toast and oyster shell. The creamy palate carries ripe fruit and toasty oak notes that are balanced by a mild vein of acidity.
title: Wicks 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)

description: This is a perfumed and youthful Chardonnay showing notes of candied pineapple, banana and melon with vanilla and a touch of spice. There's decent acidity and some herbaceousness on the medium-bodied palate which lifts the fruit weight but is also somewhat bitter on the finish.
title: Miles From Nowhere 2017 Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: Made in a reductive style, this wine initially shows aromas of onion skin and nuts, with grilled tropical fruit, brine and toasty oak in the background. The palate is full and slippery in texture, with plenty of fruit weight, citrusy acidity, a toasty oak note and long, lemony finish.
title: Wildberry Estate 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: This pale, nearly translucent wine, which could almost be mistaken for a rose, takes Grenache to the far opposite end of the spectrum. Aromas of rose water, strawberry juice and touches of meat and white pepper lead gently into a softly-textured palate of ripe but still delicate fruit and florals. Drink chilled on its own or with a cheese and fruit platter.
title: Koerner 2017 Cannonau Grenache (Clare Valley)

description: This is a likable wine that offers notes of ripe blueberries, plums and strawberries held together by a floral and earthy core. The palate is light-bodied and soft-edged. The fruit feels a little watery but there's enough acidity to prop it up.
title: Innocent Bystander 2017 Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)

description: This is ripe, almost candied Pinot, with notes of cherry, vanilla, dried green herbs and a slightly stalky character. Medium-bodied and soft-edged, the palate is as ripe and fruity as the nose suggests. There's nothing syrupy about this wine, however. It's fresh and easy-drinking with a herbal finish.
title: Fowles Wine 2017 Are You Game? Pinot Noir (Victoria)

description: From Ryan Walsh and Freya Hohnen, whose families have been wine farming in Margaret River for decades, this Chardonnay is refined, age worthy and just plain joyous to drink. Medium gold in hue, the aromas are heady and complex in tones of orange, grapefruit rind, salted nuts, mushroom, gunflint, honey and copper penny. The palate is viscous yet chalky, sliced through the middle by crystalline acidity and more complex, mineral-driven flavors. Drink now - 2026.
title: Walsh & Sons 2016 Burnside Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: Medium-gold in color, this wine takes a little time in the glass to open up, but when it does you can't stop smelling it. Delicate aromas of grapefruit, pear, apple, cashew and brine are sewn together on the nose and carry to the palate alongside buttered toast and toffee flavors from barrel influence. The palate is silky, slinking seamlessly along an saline spine of oyster shells, toast and citrus, with a delicate line of acidity. Drink now - 2028.
title: Cullen 2016 Kevin John Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: Pale gold in hue, this vintage offers up faint notes of oyster shell, lemon zest, honey and buttered toast. It is soft in texture, with lifted acidity and a salty mineral note singing in perfect harmony. The oak rears up a little on the finish, and it needs some time in glass to open up, but overall, this is a gentle wine.
title: Voyager Estate 2016 Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: This well-priced example offers plump cherry, cassis, potpourri, cedar and licorice. It's silky in texture and wound in ultrafine tannins that reign in the juicy, tangy fruit. The oak shows a touch on the finish. Drink now - 2023.
title: Leeuwin Estate 2016 Siblings Shiraz (Margaret River)

description: In this vintage of Prelude, the vineyards' proximity to ocean couldn't be more apparent. Sea spray, shells and all manner of beachfront smells are at the fore, backed by grapefruit, white spice and gunflint. The palate is salty and slippery. It's a little austere, the acidity on the lean side and the oak a touch apparent, but pair this with a wide array of dishes, particularly seafood, and it should come alive. Drink now - 2024.
title: Leeuwin Estate 2016 Prelude Vineyards Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: From another of Australia's young gun stars, Gary Mills, this wine is not labeled as Shiraz to denote the style difference between South Australia's richer versions of the grape. The nose swims in tones of blackberry, blueberry, cola, soy sauce and black olive with an earth and baking spice core. There's plenty of purity and ripeness to the medium-bodied palate that's balanced by sinewy tannins and an earthy spine.
title: Jamsheed Harem 2016 La Syrah (Yarra Valley)

description: Fans of reductive styles of Chardonnay, which Margaret River excels at, will love the melange of aromas that reveal themselves in this wine after some swirling in glass: grilled pineapple, salted nuts, brine and toast. The palate is tangy and full bodied, with a grilled fruit flavor, slippery texture, crunchy acidity and wet stone minerality. Drink now.
title: Walsh & Sons 2016 Little Poppet Chardonnay (Margaret River)

description: This is a full-bodied, silky-textured wine that skillfully shows off how well Shiraz and Viognier play together. It bursts with aromas of tangy blueberry, plum, warm stone, baking spice, fresh tarragon, thyme and violet. It's full and plump on the palate but tangy, with superfine, seamless tannins and a long, blueberry-laden finish. Drink now - 2025.
title: Yalumba 2015 Hand Picked Shiraz-Viognier (Eden Valley)

description: The nose shows ripe plums, licorice, damp earth, coffee, dried herbs and a woody note. The palate is full throttle, oozing more ripe primary fruit and less secondary characters than the nose suggests. The tannins are big and muscular and oak is fairly prominent for the moment, but this should cellar nicely. Drink 2020 - 2027.
title: Thorn Clarke 2015 Eden Trail Shiraz (Eden Valley)

description: This vintage shows notes of red currant, raspberry, violet and a peppery, cedary spice. The palate offers plush, juicy fruit and silky tannins with more peppery spice and a tangy finish. This veers more towards the full-bodied end of the spectrum but has a textural softness that makes it drinkable now. Drink now - 2025.
title: Yeringberg 2014 Shiraz (Yarra Valley)

description: This wine is rustic and just a touch funky. Bright, crunchy red fruit, minerals and earth are bolstered by raspy, savory tannins and lively acidity. Somewhere between light and medium bodied, this is a restrained yet juicy-fruited table wine that's a joy to drink.
title: Unico Zelo 2016 Cherry Fields Dolcetto (Clare Valley)

description: This is a simple but thoroughly drinkable wine offering upfront raspberry, pepper, violet and eucalyptus notes. The fruit is a little sweet but there's enough acidity to prop it up, as well as chalky tannins and a smooth mouthfeel.
title: Jacob's Creek 2017 Classic Merlot (Australia)

description: Grenache's upfront sweet fruit is at the fore in this classic Aussie blend from one of Barossa's top organic producers. Red berries and plums mingle with florals, baking spice and game. The palate shows the same ripe fruit and a freshness that comes from aging in very old hogshead to eschew any oak flavor. Medium-bodied, bouncy and with a tangy finish, this GSM is majorly drinkable.
title: Kalleske 2017 Clarry's G-S-M (Barossa Valley)

description: Pale rose in color, this is a light, aromatic version of South Aussie Grenache, swimming in tones of ripe red cherries, strawberries, rose petals and cinnamon. The light-bodied palate offers an earthy core and soft, rounded tannins for structure, with juicy fruit and salt running from start to finish.
title: Geyer 2017 Sands Grenache (Barossa Valley)

description: This exciting young producer delivers another highly drinkable drop. It comes in the form of this palatable pasta wine, which oozes brambly blackberry fruit, tobacco, dried herbs, chocolate and coffee. The palate is silky smooth and medium bodied, with a soft line of tannins and a spicy, savory finish.
title: Delinquente 2017 The Bullet Dodger Montepulciano (Riverland)

description: While more of a whisper rather than a shout, there's no shortage of bright cranberry, rhubarb, florals and licorice in this wine. These tones are reined in by taut, stony tannins, sharply focused acidity and an earthy spine.
title: Robert Oatley 2016 Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: The nose offers lifted red and black berries, cranberries, florals, white pepper and an earthy, herbal touch. The palate has a pulpy texture, with chewy tannins and ripe fruit, but the oak is on the prominent side, especially on the finish. Drink now with a bowl of spaghetti and meatballs.
title: Turkey Flat 2016 Butchers Block Red (Barossa Valley)

description: This wine, true to its variety, is inky in hue and equally dense in style. The nose is brooding and closed at first. Time in glass reveals aromas of ripe dark fruit, dried herbs, mocha, vanilla and dusting polish. On the palate, powerful, drying tannins act as a vice on the tongue. If you can get past the whack of tannins you'll find plush fruit and and oak, too. This is a massive wine that needs plenty to time to settle. Drink 2020 - 2033.
title: 5OS Project 2016 Is The New Black Durif (McLaren Vale)

description: This is a chunky, ripe Cab that shows plenty of plum, red and black fruit, violet and cola. The palate is tightly wound, with a chalky mouthfeel and grainy, vice-like tannins that overpower all else. Drink 2020 - 2030.
title: Davey Family 2016 Aficionado Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)

description: This is a powerful, plump wine, with ripe tones of plum and cherry alongside dried flowers, dark chocolate, coffee, and ground black pepper. Powerful oak tannins threaten to overpower but they're just barely kept in check by the luscious fruit. Drink 2019 - 2030.
title: Davey Family 2016 Aficionado Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: From one of the Yarra's most historic wineries, this wine takes a bit of swirling in glass, but once it gets going the aromas and flavors keep on coming. It offers brambly dark berry, cola, cumin and floral nuances, with an earthy, savory spine. Reflecting its cooler-climate origin, it's medium-bodied, soft and round, with juicy fruit, silky, savory tannins and a sappy, savory olive character running through the finish. Drink now - 2028.
title: Yeringberg 2015 Shiraz (Yarra Valley)

description: This is a blend of Grenache, Mourvedre, Cinsault and Carignan. Soft, pretty and lifted aromas of raspberry, rhubarb, dried herbs, florals and graphite lead gently into a light to medium body. The palate shows plump red berries, flowers and a savory spine of gentle, chalky tannins.
title: Hewitson 2015 Miss Harry Red (Barossa)

description: This is a rich, powerful wine, but it's a poised and balanced one as well. While it doesn't succeed quite as well as the 2013, it nevertheless shows attractive notes of ripe blackberry, plum, licorice, violets and oak spice, with a herb and black pepper spine. The silky-textured palate is full and concentrated but avoids being jammy. Tannins are soft but structured with a savory finish. Drink now - 2028.
title: Yalumba 2014 The Octavius Old Vine Shiraz (Barossa)

description: This is a ripe, full-bodied wine embalmed in French and American oak that, despite several years in bottle, shows no sign of mellowing. Aromas of ripe blackberry, black pepper, coffee, vanilla and dusting polish lead into a palate of plush fruit, cola and grainy tannins.
title: Paxton 2014 Jones Block Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: This wine is a five-grape blend with Grenache leading the pack. There's ripe black currant, licorice, earth, cracked pepper and a little smoke on the nose. The palate is medium to full bodied, silky in texture and shows juicy fruit and savory, chewy tannins.
title: Two Hands 2016 Hopes and Dreams Red (Barossa Valley)

description: This inky-hued wine is still tightly wound and youthful considering its age. On the nose it offers a deep well of tangy berries, damp earth, black licorice, dark chocolate, violets and a touch of iodine. The oak is there too, in an almost charred form, but it doesn't stick out. It's rich and satiny smooth in texture, with fine-grained tannins that show a softness, gliding rather than gripping. Drink through 2028.
title: Yalumba 2013 The Octavius Old Vine Shiraz (Barossa)

description: In typical d'Arenberg style, this top-tier red is deeply hued and in need of many years in the cellar. Currently, it's emanating aromas of Black Forest cake, dried mint, licorice, warm pavement and tangy cranberry. The palate is plush and chocolatey, with sinewy tannins and balanced acidity. Drink 2021 - 2033.
title: D'Arenberg 2014 The Dead Arm Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: This wine offers a summer fruit salad of blueberries, watermelons and strawberries beneath a cherry blossom note. Thanks to bright acidity it's also fresh, juicy and light on its feet, wound with lithe tannins to keep it from veering into flabby territory.
title: Tim Smith 2017 Grenache (Barossa Valley)

description: It's unusual to see Mourvedre as the dominant variety in Australia's classic GSM blend, but here it works and the variety shines. This stalky, spicy wine oozes red currants, black licorice, cracked black pepper and graphite. On the palate, the Grenache plays a larger role, bringing in some much needed lightness and brightness. Crunchy acidity and sinewy, earth tannins add complexity and drinkability.
title: RedHeads 2016 Princess of Thieves Red (Barossa)

description: Tightly wound and somewhat closed, the plump plum, blueberry and spice tones of this wine unravel with time in the glass. The palate brings taut, earthy tannins and fairly prominent oak. Drink 2020 - 2026.
title: D'Arenberg 2016 The Footbolt Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: The Grenache is dominant here at 55%, with 30% Mourvedre and 15% Shiraz. This blend offers bright, bouncy blueberries and plums, with white pepper, game and florals. The palate is light to medium bodied, with plump, juicy red fruit, a satiny texture and a slightly savory spine.
title: Schild Estate 2016 G-S-M (Barossa Valley)

description: Made from fruit grown across the appellation, this is an easy-drinking wine that offers upfront aromas of plum and mocha, with earthy streaks of mushroom and damp soil. It's satiny and juicy in texture, with a long finish of plum and earth. Drink now - 2022.
title: Angove 2016 Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: The amusing play on words is apt here. This wine is clearly a homage to the famed Northern Rhone region, with extra helpings of Aussie sunshine. It bursts with baking spices, tangy red currant, rhubarb, raspberry, dried herbs, soy sauce and mocha. There are florals and warm stone tones there, too. Full-bodied but not heavy or rich, there's a strong savory streak on the palate that compliments the tangy fruit and fine-grained tannins. Drink now - 2023.
title: RedHeads 2016 Coco Rotie Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: Aromas of cola, cherry, chocolate cake, pepper, drying green herbs and a slight roasted quality lead a parade of plush ripe-fruit flavors. The tannins are fine grained and propel a savory note on the finish. Drink now - 2028.
title: Kangarilla Road 2016 The Devil's Whiskers Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: This is a full-bodied but balanced wine that starts off with ripe plums and blueberries, with flower, spice and a savory, stalky streak. The palate offers a more savory profile than the nose implies. The plush, tangy fruit is there but is made more interesting by sapid tannins and linear acidity. Drink now - 2026.
title: Chateau Tanunda 2016 Grand Barossa Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa)

description: This is a muscular wine that announces its presence loudly and assertively, oozing ripe cherry and blackberry notes, along with cola, eucalyptus, and oak. On the palate, there's just enough tangy acidity and plush fruit to balance the huge, chewy tannins and oak. This is structured to go the long haul. Drink 2020 - 2030.
title: Kangarilla Road 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)

description: This is a rich, full-bodied wine that offers much of what many big red lovers look for in a South Aussie Shiraz: blackberries, plums, chocolate, olive tapenade, green herbs and drying oak spice. It is more austere than some more ripe, fruit-forward versions, with tart acidity and powerful, raspy tannins. Give this time to settle. Drink 2020 - 2030.
title: Kangarilla Road 2016 Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: This is a sturdy, full-bodied wine that offers up aromas of ripe plum and cherry laced with dried green herbs and a savory streak of raw meat and mushrooms. The savory, drying tannins pack a punch, but the acidity and fruit weight back it up. It finishes on a note of tangy blueberry. Drink now - 2023.
title: Schild Estate 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa Valley)

description: This ticks all the South Aussie Shiraz boxes. It offers up notes of plum, dark chocolate, black olive and a dusty, dried herbal character. The palate feels a little extracted and heavy, but the plump fruit and savory tannins hold it all together.
title: Alpha Crucis 2016 Titan Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: A blend of 50% Shiraz, 28% Mataro and 22% Grenache, this medium- to full-bodied wine offers lifted aromas of ripe cranberry, blueberry and peppery herbal notes, with some oak and a streak of graphite. The palate, however, isn't on quite the same level. The oak gets clunky and a little flabby, but there's also a pleasing silky texture, juicy fruit and dusty tannins.
title: Langmeil 2016 Three Gardens SMG Red (Barossa)

description: This is a big but not overblown old school style of South Aussie Shiraz, offering up notes of plums, black cherries, chocolate, coffee, dried herbs and black olives. The first sip yields a mouthful of tight-grained tannins and slightly hot alcohol, plus plenty of ripe, juicy fruit. Give this time for those tannins to loosen their grip. Drink 2020 - 2028 at least.
title: Thomas Goss 2016 Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: Any wine blended with Durif, Cabernet Sauvignon and Touriga is bound to be a beast. This wine charges out of the gate with plush plum and brambly berry fruit, cola, dried herbs and a vanillin, charred-oak aroma. The palate is unsurprisingly full and rich in muscular tannins and ripe fruit. It's a touch hot and the oak feels a little chunky for the moment.
title: RedHeads 2016 Night of the Living Red (Australia)

description: Dandelion's top wine is inky in hue and heady on the nose. The nose swims in aromas of dark cherries and plums, tar, dried herbs, mocha and violets that are held in check by a savory spine. The palate is equally rich and bold, suggesting this is poised for the long haul. Tar and herbal characters are particularly prominent here, along with a streak of oak, wound by chewy, leathery tannins. Drink through 2038.
designation: Red Queen of the Eden Valley
title: Dandelion 2015 Red Queen of the Eden Valley Shiraz (Eden Valley)

description: This blend offers a harmony of red and blue fruit, black pepper, floral, graphite and spicy aromas wound delicately into a silky-textured palate that crunches with wet stone minerality. The tannins are fine-grained and almost seamless.
title: Henschke 2015 Henry's Seven G-S-M (Barossa)

description: This offers a dense, heady mix of grilled plum, dark chocolate, coffee, mint and a slight meaty, charred quality. The palate comes with big, chewy tannins alongside plump fruit, herbs and cola flavors. Drink 2020 - 2030.
title: Chapel Hill 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)

description: This is a firm, full wine that needs some time. It's led by ripe plums, blackberries, mint and baking spices. There's sappy, soapy element to the oak and a savory, soy sauce note. The chalky tannins are big and blocky, driving the wine but nevertheless integrated with the plump black and purple fruit. Drink 2020 - 2030 and likely beyond.
title: St. Hugo 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)

description: This wine comes out of the gate with mint and graphite notes over a core of ripe blackberry, raspberry, dark chocolate and woody, earthy spice. The palate is laced with drying, grainy tannins and a good lick of acidity to balance the ripe fruit. Coonawarra's classic power and richness are tempered by a bouncy, youthful approach in this wine. Drink now - 2028.
title: Penley Estate 2015 Phoenix Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)

description: This blend is lead with 71% Mataro, a k a Mourvedre. Spice and savory tones shine on the nose, along with floral and red berry notes. Ripe plums, earth, mint and black olive characters are also in the mix. The plush, silken fruit continues on the palate where a lick of acidity and sandy, savory tannins gives the wine much needed lift and structure. The finish is short and fruity.
title: Tim Smith 2015 Mataro-Grenache-Shiraz Red (Barossa Valley)

description: A straightforward and relatively approachable Cab, this offers notes of plums and currants set with a savory, earthy back drop. The palate is full-bodied, with grainy, muscular tannins that coat the tongue and are only just saved by the juicy fruit.
title: D'Arenberg 2015 The High Trellis Cabernet Sauvignon (McLaren Vale)

description: This blend offers ripe, almost candied strawberry and cherry aromas, along with vanilla and floral soap. The medium-bodied palate shows more lift from the bright acidity, along with a soft bite of tannins. The juicy fruit lingers onto the finish making you want to take another sip.
title: Dandelion 2015 Menagerie of the Barossa G-S-M (Barossa)

description: This is a beast of a wine made for the long haul. At the moment, despite a few years in bottle, it's nearly black in color, the nose broody, almost impenetrable. With some time in glass, notes of black licorice, mocha, coffee, dusting polish and shriveled dark berries are revealed. The palate is full and rich but firm and focused, with plush fruit, powerful, chewy tannins and a long finish. Drink 2020 - 2033.
title: Ulithorne 2014 Frux Frugis Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: This wine offers all of the cherry, tobacco, floral, and herbal notes we've come to love from Tuscany's most famous grape variety. And like many Italian reds, it's not shy when it comes to acid and tannins, the latter being raspy and tightly wound. There's fruit weight, however, which gives your mouth some relief from the tannic grip. This wine needs food, preferably a steaming bowl of pasta and meatballs.
title: Loom 2014 SV Sangiovese (McLaren Vale)

description: Despite the hot, early 2013 harvest, Australia's most famous single-vineyard wine is once again a thing of beauty. The nose croons to a medley of ripe red berries and plums followed by eucalyptus, black pepper, pencil lead on a core of damp earth and iodine. The palate slinks with a satiny texture and primary fruit. Charred wood, leather and graphite are knit together with threads of fine, silky tannins. The finish is long, tangy and a touch savory. In this historic producer's signature style, power and elegance reside seamlessly beside one another. Drink now - 2038.
title: Henschke 2013 Hill of Grace Vineyard Shiraz (Eden Valley)

description: From a 106-year-old vineyard, this is a dense wine but it nevertheless walks a seamless line between power and grace. Tangy plum, blueberry, dark chocolate, coffee, wild herbs and grated nutmeg glide together on the nose. The palate is full and concentrated, silken in texture and intricately woven with sinewy tannins. Its best is yet to come. Drink 2020 - 2035 and likely beyond.
title: Henschke 2013 Mount Edelstone Vineyard Shiraz (Eden Valley)

description: This is a medium- to full-bodied Cab shows notes of red currants, raspberries and florals, with a distinctive savory core and a mineral, graphite streak. The fruit is concentrated on the palate, laced with structured, sinewy tannins and an earthy, stony finish. Drink now - 2023.
title: Elderton 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa)

description: American ex-pat Brad Hickey's 2014 vintage of this small-batch wine is fruity and concentrated. Intense, upfront aromas of raisined blackberry, rhubarb, mocha, spice and warm stones follow through to the palate, which is rich and powerful from sturdy, savory tannins. Don't touch this wine yet. Its best is yet to come. Drink 2021 - 2028.
title: Brash Higgins 2014 SHZ Site Specific Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

description: For a Coonwarra Cab, this is downright light, but by more global standards it's in the medium-full bodied range. Blood red in hue and a little sanguine in aroma and flavor as well, this wine shows lifted aromas of red and black currants and iodine. The palate shows more plush berries, a lick of woody oak influence and tannins which are fine-grained and brawny but silky, too. The finish is long, juicy and savory.
title: Penley Estate 2015 Scottsburn Cabernet Sauvignon (Coonawarra)
