description: Notes of salty miso, celery, lemon and green pear unite into an intriguing nose. On the palate, it is ripe, juicy pear that takes the lead, but that salty zestiness, that edge of peppery savoriness is always present, adding freshness and allure to this fluid, slender, concentrated and zesty wine. The finish echoes with citrus and white pepper. It will take some time to come into its powerful own. Drink 2020 - 2030.
title: Domane Wachau 2017 Ried Achleiten Smaragd Gruner Veltliner (Wachau)

description: Pear peel, miso and yeast on the nose immediately promise a savory wine. The palate delivers with an almost fizzingly fresh zesty core and a yeasty, salty texture that is both fruity and spicy. There is concentration and strength despite the slenderness. The finish is lip-smacking and long and reprises that lovely pear note.
title: Forstreiter 2017 Ried Schiefer Gruner Veltliner (Kremstal)

description: Something floral and summery hovers on the nose of this fresh but rounded Gruner. It is on the palate that it packs a punch with vivid and juicy notes of ripe pear and peach but above all with its yeasty, rich texture. Lemon brightness brings it all in line. The finish is long and salty.
title: R&A Pfaffl 2017 Reserve Hommage Gruner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

description: The nose suggests very ripe fruit, full-blown yeastiness and wet earth. The palate adds bright, fresh lemon notes to this earthy, intense mix and presents a very textured, concentrated midpalate. This is a wine that needs hearty food to do its muscular structure justice.
title: R&A Pfaffl 2017 Reserve Golden Gruner Veltliner (Weinviertel)

description: Russet pear peel and yeast are subtle on the nose. It is on the palate that the concentration becomes apparent: There is zesty lemon backed and countered by salty yeast. The pithy freshness and rich yeast echo till the finish.
title: Fischer 2017 Privat Smaragd Gruner Veltliner (Wachau)

description: Pear peel, lemon zest and lemon balm combine into a nose of ripe greenness. The palate is concentrated and has that lovely edge of mandarin zest that enriches the yeasty texture with juicy, vibrant freshness. This is mouthwatering, tense and moreish.
title: Salomon-Undhof 2017 Ried Lindberg Gruner Veltliner (Kremstal)

description: White pepper, pear, miso and yeast on the nose promise freshness and texture in equal measure. The palate adds a good dose of tingling white pepper spice to the yeasty core. The body presents zesty, pithy concentration and plenty of mouthfeel with a lip-smacking finish.
title: Fischer 2017 Ried Frauenweingarten Smaragd Gruner Veltliner (Wachau)

description: Ripe and powerful, this wine has weight and concentration. Its tannins are an important element at this young stage where the fruit is also right up front. Like all good wines from this appellation, the wine needs to age and fill out with secondary flavors. Drink from 2020.
title: Baptiste et Laurent 2017 Le Meilleur des 2 Mondes  (Morgon)

description: The result of a collaboration between a grower and a negociant, this wine is softly textured and has rich black fruits. Generous tannins are fully integrated into the berry flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Baptiste et Laurent 2017 Le Meilleur des 2 Mondes  (Brouilly)

description: For a Beaujolais-Villages, this is an impressively structured wine. It has tannins as well as enticing red-berry fruits that are still young. Fresh with acidity and still with a firm backdrop, the wine needs to age. Drink from late 2019.
title: Domaine Richard Rottiers 2017 La Sambinerie  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Pale in color, this fragrant wine is fresh and crisp. Acidity and red berry fruits show well against a background of light tannins and a juicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine Franck Besson 2017 La Rosee de Jullie Rose (Beaujolais Rose)

description: A simple, fruity wine from southern Beaujolais, this has attractive red fruits and plenty of fresh acidity. Drink now.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2017 Domaine Pignard  (Beaujolais)

description: A light and fruity wine with crisp red-berry flavors and a soft texture, this is immediately attractive. Drink now.
title: Chateau de Javernand 2017 Rose de Gamay (Beaujolais Rose)

description: This juicy wine is fresh and very fruity. Lightly textured it offers plenty of acidity and a tangy aftertaste. Drink this wine now.
title: Domaine Versant au Soleil 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Tangy and juicy, this attractive wine has a good future. Bright acidity and spice shine through the citrus zest and perfumed quince aftertaste. Drink this ageworthy wine from the Guinard brothers from mid 2019.
title: Chateau d'Uza 2017  Graves

description: Softly textured, this is a fresh and fruity wine. It has a tangy edge as well as bright acidity and herbal flavors. The mineral, taut texture will allow it to age, so drink from 2020.
title: Chateau Perron 2017  Graves

description: Herbal with some richness, this wine has a warm but crisp feel. Acidity sustains the ripe green-plum and white-currant fruits. Drink now.
title: Franсois Lurton 2017 Domaine les Fumees Blanches Sauvignon Blanc (Cotes de Gascogne)

description: Made without added sulfites, this is a lightly oxidative wine with ripe melon and honey flavors. Full bodied and packed with rich fruitiness, it has a rounded aftertaste. Drink this wine made from organically grown grapes now.
title: Bedouet 2017 Cogito Melon de Bourgogne (Vin de France)

description: Delicate aromas of crushed white peony, lemon verbena, chalk and apple flesh dance in the bouquet of this attractive sparkling wine, while flavors of green apple, yellow plum and lemon zest are direct and mouthwatering. The palate is fresh and zippy, with a lively mousse and bright acidity that lead into a medium-length but seriously refreshing finish.
designation: Clos des Demoiselles Tete de Cuvee Brut
title: J. Laurens 2016 Clos des Demoiselles Tete de Cuvee Brut Sparkling (Cremant de Limoux)

description: This cremant shows superb balance, purity and focus from start to finish, with lively effervescence and a brisk character throughout. Notes of green apple skin and lime zest are spiced by a subtle toasty accent, while the finish is crisp and refreshing.
designation: Les Graimenous Tete de Cuvee Methode Traditionnelle Brut
title: Domaine J. Laurens 2015 Les Graimenous Tete de Cuvee Methode Traditionnelle Brut Sparkling (Cremant de Limoux)

description: Made from 70% Chardonnay, 20% Chenin Blanc and 10% Mauzac, this leads with toasty notes of grilled apple, dried orange peel, yellow melon and a hint of wood spice. It's brisk and lively in effervescence, countered by ample, rich fruit tones of wood-grilled apple and orange cream.
title: Sieur d'Arques 2013 Premiere Bulle Brut Sparkling (Cremant de Limoux)

description: With a few years of age, this wine is richly ripe in character and soft in tannins, making it ready to drink. Cherry and red berry flavors are concentrated on the palate, honed by an edge of dryness. Drink this very fine, mature wine now.
title: Domaine Fond Moiroux 2010  Moulin-A -Vent

description: An innovation for Beaujolais Nouveau, this rose is made from crisp, fruity Gamay with good acidity and bright flavors of red berries. It's an attractive wine that is refreshing and packed with fruitiness.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2018 Nouveau Rose (Beaujolais Rose)

description: Grapes from southern Beaujolais, the land of the gold-colored stone buildings, are the main source of this wine. It's a typical, bubbly banana- and red-berry-flavored wine with a good streak of tannin and acidity. Of course, drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2018 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: Named after the cherry orchard adjoining the vines, this wine is perfumed and full of fruit. Partial aging in old wood barrels gives a smoothness to the texture of the wine that will allow it to age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Pascal Aufranc 2017 Les Cerisiers  (Julienas)

description: This structured wine is full of ripe tannins and juicy acidity. Its dense texture is cut with attractive freshness, giving lift to this wine with potential. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine de Colette 2017  Fleurie

description: Structured and full of tannins, this wine has a good future. It is not ready yet, but the density of the wine will soften to give great richness, with layers of black fruits, acidity and spice from the old-wood aging. Drink from 2021.
title: Lucien Lardy 2017 Les Thorins  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: In this structured wine, some firm tannins sustain the rich black fruits. Its freshness and dark core are still very young, meaning the wine needs to age. It is heading to be a fine wine, so wait until 2020.
title: Domaine Chardigny 2017 Le Clos du Chapitre  (Saint-Amour)

description: The vines in this 2.25-acre plot are more than 100 years old, densely planted and producing this impressively rich wine. Juicy black fruits and powerful tannins are still present even after two years. The wine needs to age further and will be impressive from 2020.
title: Lucien Lardy 2017 Les Moriers  (Fleurie)

description: The single vineyard, less than an acre, is planted with 65-year-old vines. The result is this spicy, structured, dark-hued wine, with tannins still intact but promising much. Drink this lightly wood-aged wine from 2020.
title: Yohan Lardy 2017 Le Vivier  (Fleurie)

description: Schist and granite rocks are behind this big, mineral and structured wine. Its tannins and black fruits are young and demanding aging. The wine has a juicy aftertaste, with black-currant flavors. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Ruet 2017 Grands Cras  (Morgon)

description: Named after the single vineyard from which it comes, this wine is juicy, generous and full of ripe berry flavors. The fruitiness and acidity shine through this balanced wine, with added complexity from the wood aging. It will be ready from late 2019.
title: Yohan Lardy 2017 Les Deschamps  (Chenas)

description: Vines that are nearly 70 years old form the basis of this rich, generous and concentrated wine. Still young, it shows fleshiness and needs to soften and smooth out. The wine has potential and will be better from 2020.
title: Lucien Lardy 2017 Les Roches  (Fleurie)

description: Named after the amethyst crystal that lies as a layer in the soil of the vineyard, this is a tightly structured wine. Rich tannins and black fruits are brought into relief by the young, tight acidity. Age at least until the end of 2019.
title: Les Freres Perroud 2017 Amethyste  (Brouilly)

description: This vineyard lies on the steep southern slope of Mont Brouilly, which gives the vines plenty of sun, hence its name "scorching place." The wine certainly is warm, with rich tannins and intense, juicy red-cherry fruits. Its structure and concentration will allow the wine to age, so drink from 2020.
title: Chateau de la Chaize 2017 Brulhier  (Cote de Brouilly)

description: The Balloquets slope is so steep it is regarded as hell (enfer) to work. But it produces good wine, like this rich, lightly tannic offering. With the structure and acidity in place, and with some wood aging flavors, the wine is smoothly textured, juicy and ready to drink.
title: Robert Perroud 2017 L'Enfer des Balloquets  (Brouilly)

description: Black-cherry aromas and flavors are typical of this famous vineyard. They sing from this wine where they are balanced with serious tannins and acidity. The wine needs time and should not be drunk before 2021.
title: Lucien Lardy 2017 Cote du Py  (Morgon)

description: A smoothly textured, perfumed wine, this is packed with black-cherry fruits. Richness is balanced by the tannins that are still present, suggesting a wine with potential that will be ready from 2020.
title: Domaine Chasselay 2017 Les Balloquets  (Brouilly)

description: elicious and perfumed, this wine offers touches of toast as well as ripe tannins. It shows intense fruitiness, with bold black fruits and a velvet texture. Drink now.
title: Les Freres Perroud 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Brouilly)

description: Fresh berry flavors and acidity give this wine a fruity side that contrasts with the tangy, mineral edge and structure. The extra altitude of Chiroubles vineyards shows in the crispness of the wine.
title: Domaine Meziat-Belouze 2017  Chiroubles

description: From 70-year-old vines planted on a single parcel, this wine has richness and just the right amount of structure to sustain the ripe black fruits. The wine is all fruit, with a full aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Jean-Michel Dupre 2017 Vignes de 1940  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Seventy-year-old vines add concentration to this rich wine. Full of berry fruits and ripe tannins, the wine has excellent potential. It is already delicious in its young fruitiness, but let it soften further and drink from late 2019.
title: Domaine Nicolas Boudeau 2017 La Grume Grain d'Expression  (Brouilly)

description: This wine from old vines in a six-acre vineyard has firm tannins as well as ripe fruit. Everything is young and exuberant at this stage, with tannins and spice dominating the fruits. Let this wine age until 2020.
title: Domaine de la Vigne Romaine 2017  Moulin-A -Vent

description: Zero sulfites and natural yeasts are hallmarks of this crisp and fruity wine. Its acidity and red-currant flavors are boisterous at this stage and need to calm down. The wine will be best from 2020.
title: Chateau de Javernand 2017 Indigene  (Chiroubles)

description: Salmon pink in the glass, this concentrated yet spry rose suggest tart raspberry and cherry flavors with delicate hints of rose petal and bramble. It's still quite fresh a year after bottling and should drink well through the end of 2019.
title: Lavau 2017 Rose (Cotes du Rhone)

description: From grapes planted on volcanic soil, this wine has intense minerality as well as dense tannins. It also has plenty of blackberry fruit that needs to develop further before the wine is ready to enjoy. Drink from 2020.
title: Emmanuel Fellot 2017 Les Cailloux  (Cote de Brouilly)

description: This single-vineyard wine is firm with the tannins typical of this appellation. It has good structure and concentration, with supporting layers of blackberry fruits. The wine finishes with fresher acidity.
title: Domaine du Gry-Sablon 2017 Douby  (Morgon)

description: Vines planted in 1939 are the essence of this rich, concentrated wine that offers solid tannins as well as ripe fruits. A touch of spice adds further complexity. Drink from 2020.
title: Pascal Aufranc 2017 En Remont Vignes de 1939  (Chenas)

description: Aged in wood and bottled without sulfites, this wine is rich with tannins and red-berry flavors. Acidity and spice add to the fruitiness of this attractive, ripe wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine de Colonat 2017 Naturabilis Ancestrale  (Morgon)

description: Vines in the first flush of youth, are behind this ebullient, fruity wine. A crisp texture and lively acidity are attractive and refreshing. The wine is lively, fresh and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Franck Besson 2017 Les Chardonnerets  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: Fruity and juicy but with layers of firm tannins to give structure, this wine shows promise but also needs some aging. Its rich fruitiness is right up front, packing in acidity to keep everything fresh. Drink from mid-2019.
title: Domaine Nicolas Boudeau 2017 La Grume Grain de Sable  (Brouilly)

description: All about berry fruits, this wine is ripe and juicy. It comes from a nine-acre vineyard of old vines that give concentration as well as bold, juicy black fruits. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Agnes Pegaz 2017 Plaisirs de Pegase  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: A single-vineyard wine from a parcel called Les Peloux, this is smooth, velvet-textured and ripe. Fresh acidity and a crisp edge give the wine a lift and will allow it to age a few months. Drink from late 2019.
title: Lucien Lardy 2017 Vignes de 1951  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This comes from the home vineyard of Katy and David Duthel. It is a structured wine with firm tannins that will take time to open. Blackberry and red-cherry flavors will come forward as the wine develops. Drink now.
title: Domaine Ruet 2017 Voujon  (Brouilly)

description: This wine is bright with red fruits supplemented by light tannins and acidity. Made to be drunk young, it succeeds well, the forward fruitiness backed up judiciously by a drier edge. Drink the wine now.
title: Chateau Grand' Grange 2017 La Cascade  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Named appropriately after small lizards that come out in the sun, this wine conveys a warm, sunny feel. It has acidity but the main thrust of the wine is for ripe berry fruits and a touch of tannins.
title: Chateau de Javernand 2017 Les Gatilles  (Chiroubles)

description: Old vines at the top of the Moulin-A -Vent slope give this wine its rich, tannic structure. The fruit is fresh and crisp, with a smoky character from old-barrel wood aging. Age this wine for a few months and drink from late 2019.
title: Yohan Lardy 2017 Les Michelons  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Packed with fruit, this wine is both richly structured and fruity. It has a juicy core of berry flavors filled out with young tannins that need to soften.
title: Domaine Ruet 2017 La Fontenelle  (Chiroubles)

description: This soft and juicy wine comes from southern Beaujolais in the region where buildings have almost gold-colored stones (pierres dorees). It is rich with attractive cherry flavors, light tannin and plenty of acidity. Fresh and fruity, it's ready to drink.
title: Domaine Pral 2017 Les Pays des Pierres Dorees  (Beaujolais)

description: Some barrel aging has given this wine spice and ripe fruitiness. Coming from young vines planted in Regnie vineyards, it benefits from the granite soil that gives an edge of minerality. Drink this fruity, crisp wine from summer 2019.
title: Jean-Michel Dupre 2017 La Ronze Blanche  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)

description: This wine is crisp and fruity, with fresh acidity and a touch of tannins. Still young, it needs time to calm down. It will turn into a bright wine, ready to drink from mid-2019.
title: Jean-Michel Dupre 2017 Haute Ronze Vieilles Vignes  (Regnie)

description: This wine has a tight character, with considerable acidity and ripe, perfumed red fruits. Still packed with tannins it has excellent potential. Drink from 2020.
title: Laurent Gauthier 2017 Grands Cras  (Morgon)

description: Sixty-year-old Chardonnay vines have given an intense wine with yellow-fruit and ripe quince flavors that are balanced with acidity. Fresh and still a little young, this wine will be better from summer 2019.
title: Lucien Lardy 2017  Beaujolais-Villages Blanc

description: Ripe, juicy fruit shines from this softly textured wine. It has a rich character while keeping plenty of berry flavors and acidity. An attractive, fruity wine, it is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Saint-Cyr 2017 La Galoche  (Beaujolais)

description: This simple wine is packed with fruit and acidity. It has a fresh character with juicy red-currant and berry flavors and a light texture. Drink now.
title: Domaine Duperray 2017 Glou-Glou  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Bright juicy red fruits shine out of this attractive wine. It has a fresh feel, with only a light texture and with acidity and juiciness already in balance. Drink the wine now.
title: Domaine Nicolas Boudeau 2017 La Grume  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This light, refreshing wine comes from a four-acre parcel. It has a creamy texture with apple acidity and a spicy pear aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine Duperray 2017 Grains de Chardonnay  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: This wine from a six-generation estate is ripe, juicy and fresh. The bright acidity will soften into the generous black fruits as it ages.
title: Christophe Savoye 2017 Cuvee Ma Confidence  (Regnie)

description: A ripe, perfumed wine with black fruits and generous tannins, this is rich and juicy. It has structure as well as layers of delicious fruits that give the wine density while keeping freshness at the end. Drink now.
title: Chateau du Chatelard 2017 Cuvee les Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Bottled without sulfites, this wine was aged in clay amphoras. It is juicy, intense and tight with acidity that underlines the crisp red fruits. The wine needs time, so drink from 2020.
title: Domaine de Colonat 2017 Naturabilis Antique  (Morgon)

description: A wine that is all about fresh red berries, this is soft and refreshing. It has an attractive, crisp edge that adds tang to the fruitiness of the wine. Drink now.
title: Laurent Gauthier 2017 Vintage Rose (Beaujolais Rose)

description: This rich wine is lightly structured and full of black currant and plum flavors. Juicy, fruity and with an edge of tannins to allow it to age, the wine is worth keeping a few months. Drink from mid-2019.
title: Florent Descombe 2017 Cuvee B  (Brouilly)

description: The structure and smokiness of this wine will allow it to age. These balance against the ripe fruit that is cut by acidity, giving freshness and richness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Guenael Jambon 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This wine has concentrated fruits and good density from lees contact. While fresh, it has a mineral edge, tangy orange-peel flavors and lively acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Agnes Pegaz 2017 Plaisirs de Pegase  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: This yeasty wine offers fresh acidity and a mineral texture. Bright with lemon and white-fruit flavors, it needs to settle in for a few more months. Drink from summer 2019.
title: Robert Perroud 2017 Terres Blanches  (Beaujolais-Villages Blanc)

description: This gentle wine has acidity and attractive, simple, white-stone-fruit flavors. A warm wine, it shows a smooth texture with an attractive tang of minerality at the end. Drink now.
title: Christophe Savoye 2017 Collection  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: This perfumed, fruity wine has been bottled with no added sulfur. Its red fruits and acidity are right up front, backed by enough dry tannins to give the wine structure and a chance to age.
title: Chateau de la Terriere 2017 Vin Sauvage a  Poil  (Regnie)

description: A simple, red-fruit and banana-flavored wine, this has a soft texture and easy acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Clos Saint Roch 2017  Beaujolais

description: A lean wine dominated by acidity, this is fresh and crisp but lacks fruit weight. It will soften but the fruit will still not be there.
title: Domaine Romy 2017 Vielles Vignes Les Pierres Dorees  (Beaujolais)

description: Banana aromas don't help this wine. It has soft tannins and banana and red-cherry flavors, giving freshness and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine du Gry-Sablon 2017 Emeringes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This purple-colored wine has soft young fruit, which is unhappily dominated by banana flavors. Touches of tannins lie underneath along with acidity. Drink this wine now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2017 Collection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Soft, ripe and rich, this is a juicy wine with simple red-cherry fruits and soft tannins. An easy wine to like, it is ready to drink.
title: Louis Jadot 2017  Beaujolais

description: Bright fruit with just a touch of tannin give this wine both structure and freshness. Its acidity and red fruits are spoiled by the touch of bananas. Drink the wine now.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2017 Special Selection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Ripe red fruits and a light structure of tannins give this wine shape. It is balanced, full of fruitiness and acidity with a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Flower Label  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Red cherries and touches of banana are the hallmarks of this fruity wine. Brightly textured and crisp with acidity, it is a light wine that is ready to drink.
title: Domaines Chermette 2017 Griotttes  (Beaujolais)

description: Bottled without sulfites, this wine has a farmyard character, giving off an unpleasant aroma. The red-cherry flavors are more attractive, balanced with acidity. Let the wine breathe for a few minutes for the odd smell to blow away. Drink now.
title: Chateau de la Terriere 2017 Vin Nature a  Butiner  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Light and fruity, this crisp wine is full of raspberry flavors and acidity. Its freshness and juicy character are right up front. Drink now.
title: Domaine Saint-Cyr 2017 La Galoche Rose (Beaujolais Rose)

description: This wine is on the lean side, with tannins rather than fruit up front. It has acidity and a tight texture, missing out on weight and fruit.
title: Domaine Ruet 2017 Douby  (Morgon)

description: Spicy and with attractive cherry flavors, this is a juicy, open wine. It has some structure as well as bold fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Vignobles Bulliat 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This wine has a firm edge behind the red-cherry and banana flavors. It has a fresh feel, with a light touch and an attractive, perfumed aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine Ruet 2017 Les Bois  (Regnie)

description: Ripe and fruity, this soft wine comes from the southern part of Beaujolais. It has an easygoing character, with black cherries coming together with acidity to produce a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Colin Bourisset 2017 Louis Bourisset Les Pierres Dorees  (Beaujolais)

description: Soft and fruity, this is already a delicious wine. It is packed with red-cherry flavors that are underlined by a touch of tannin and plenty of acidity. Drink the wine now.
title: Chateau de Pizay 2017  Beaujolais

description: Lightly textured and with plenty of acidity, this wine is gently fruity with an elegant character that brings out both freshness and a mineral edge. Drink now.
title: Domaine des Nugues 2017 Gamay (Beaujolais Rose)

description: This wine has great fruitiness but also some ripe tannins. It is refreshing and juicy with red-cherry flavors and plenty of crisp acidity. Not a wine for aging, it is ready to drink now.
title: Albert Bichot 2017 Chateau de Jarnioux  (Beaujolais)

description: At the top northwestern edge of Beaujolais, this high-altitude vineyard has produced a rich wine, all fruit and with concentration from 65-year-old vines. The wine finishes with attractive juicy acidity. Drink now.
title: Jean-Michel Dupre 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

description: An aromatic wine, this is fresh with citrus acidity and gently textured. It has a light touch, with attractive freshness and a crisp, tight aftertaste. Drink this fruit wine now.
title: Mommessin 2017  Beaujolais Blanc

description: This wine from a 20-acre estate is lightly structured and fruity. It is ripe with black-cherry flavors that are still developing, suggesting the wine should age further. Drink from late 2019.
title: Domaine des Cotes du Berchoux 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

description: A rich, spicy wine with toasty flavors and a creamy texture, this will develop well. Ripe fruits are just a part of this complex wine that offers perfumed acidity and a fragrant aftertaste. Drink from 2020.
title: Chateau des Places 2017  Graves

description: Ripe and rich, this full-bodied Sauvignon Blanc/Semillon wine also shows freshness to balance the generous white fruits. Spice and good acidity give the wine extra complexity and an excellent future. Drink from 2020.
title: Vieux Chateau Gaubert 2017  Graves

description: Spice, nutmeg and cinnamon from 50-50 Sauvignon Blanc and Semillon give this wine a warm character that is enhanced by the generous fruitiness. Bright citrus and red-apple flavors finish with a perfumed aftertaste. Drink the wine from 2020.
title: Chateau Haut Bergeron 2017 Chateau La Fleur des Pins  (Graves)

description: This classic blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Semillon and Muscadelle is crisp and layered, with bright acidity and spicy fruit. The wine does need time and will be better from 2020.
title: Chateau du Mouret 2017  Graves

description: Soft, fruity and generous, this wine from Helene et Amelie Durand will develop well. It offers weight, density and plenty of fruit. Drink from 2020.
title: Chateau Doms 2017  Graves

description: This soft wine from Vignobles Denis Lafon is shy about showing its fruitiness. It suggests yellow fruits with a crisp, textured edge. Drink this ripe wine from 2019 when it will have revealed more of its attractive lemon flavors.
title: Chateau Gardut Haut Cluzeau 2017  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Spicy as well as fruity, this is an attractive, smooth wine. Underneath the acidity and crisp texture, the wine discloses a warmer, creamy character as well as delicious orange and citrus fruits. Drink from mid 2019
title: Chateau d'Arricaud 2017  Graves

description: The structure, acidity and green fruits are all in place in this wine that has a touch of spice. It is young and needs time; drink from 2020.
title: Chateau Rahoul 2017  Graves

description: Aged in barrel for seven months, this wine is muted at this stage, just hinting at a fruity future. The spicy richness shows in the full texture and will open out over the next few months. Let the wine age and drink from 2019.
title: Vignobles Arbo 2017 Chateau Puyanche  (Francs Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This perfumed wine has a smooth, oily texture. Ripe touches of lychee and a warm character are attractive features of this wine that will be ready from mid 2019.
title: Chateau Puy Boyrein 2017  Graves

description: This amazing wine comes from vines that are more than 100 years old. Its richness and concentration are impressive, while the black fruits offer juicy acidity, spice and ripe tannins. This complex wine is well worth aging. Drink from 2020.
title: Yohan Lardy 2016 Vieilles Vignes de 1903  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Wood aging in old barrels has helped tame the bright fruits and introduce structure. Those tannins, still firm at this stage, are the passport to wine's long-term future. With rich fruit, a dry core and acidity, the wine will mature slowly. Drink from 2021.
title: Lucien Lardy 2016 Les Chenes  (Fleurie)

description: One year in older wood barrels has given an extra dimension to the ripe berry fruits of this wine. It adds richness and a smooth texture that lifts the fruitiness and acidity, providing further aging potential. Drink from late 2019.
designation: Domaine de la Croix Barraud Cuvee Prestige
title: Domaine du Granit 2016 Domaine de la Croix Barraud Cuvee Prestige  (Chenas)

description: This smoothly textured wine is full of ripe fruit, with a perfumed texture. A light touch of fruitiness balances with the smoky hints of wood and spice. The wine is named after the parcel of vines, literally the "magnificent lovers." Drink now.
title: Chateau de la Chaize 2016 Les Amants Magnifiques  (Brouilly)

description: Legend has it that the Roman Emperor Probus introduced Gamay to Beaujolais, hence the name of this wine as a tribute. It is a beautifully smooth, perfumed wine, benefiting from wood aging as well as generous tannins and black fruits. The wine is capable of further aging, so drink from 2020.
title: Pascal Aufranc 2016 Probus  (Julienas)

description: This comes from the estate of the ornate 17th-century chateau of Chenas. With its rich tannins and balance between spice and fruitiness, the wine is already open, full of berry flavors and acidity. Drink now.
title: Chateau de Chenas 2016  Chenas

description: Run by Katy and David Duthel, this estate's 60-year-old vines have produced this ripe but structured wine. It has good density, with a firm backdrop of tannins and acidity to balance the ripe berry fruits. Drink now.
title: Domaine Ruet 2016  Cote de Brouilly

description: Named after the winemaker's father, Romain, this wine grown in the Saburin vineyard is packed with juiciness and acidity. Smooth tannins integrate into the fruitiness of the wine that has been softened by 12 months in old-wood barrels. Drink now.
title: Robert Perroud 2016 Romain en Saburin  (Brouilly)

description: Ready to drink, this rich wine is perfumed. Black-cherry and berry flavors blend with the soft texture and acidity. Ripe and fruity, it has a fresh aftertaste.
title: Domaine Bergeron 2016  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Aged in large wooden casks, this wine has a smooth texture as well as juicy red fruits. The structure is balanced by the intense fruits and good acidity. Drink this wine now.
title: Chateau de la Chaize 2016 Rien de Trop  (Brouilly)

description: This tannic wine also has attractive fruit. It is still young, with its rich structure right up front. Behind that is a fresher character, red-cherry flavors and a bright aftertaste.
title: Chateau de Chenas 2016  Moulin-A -Vent

description: This wine is aromatic with ripe cherry fruits and gentle acidity. Packed with fruit, it's attractive and juicy, with a light texture of generous tannins. Drink now.
title: Domaine Ruet 2016 Cuvee Vieilles Vignes  (Brouilly)

description: Soft tannins and ripe, juicy black fruits make this an attractive wine with layers of acidity and light spiciness. It is named after the blue veins in the granite subsoil. Drink the wine now.
title: Domaine de Bel-Air 2016 Les Granits Bleus  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This bright, fruity wine is produced from fruit grown organically in a walled vineyard. Fresh acidity balances the smoky fruit flavors. Drink now.
title: Anthony Perol 2016 Les Pierres Dorees  (Beaujolais)

description: Big, bold fruits and tannins are already coming into balance in this concentrated wine. It revels in the richness of the vintage and also its structure. Acidity breaks through the tannins and berry fruits to add freshness at the end. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Metairie Neuve 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A ripe, full and juicy wine, this is rich with tannins as well as black-currant flavors. Power and concentration are balanced by the fruitiness. Acidity and hints of wood aging add final complexity. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Seguin 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Jean-Christophe Darriet has produced a rich wine with black fruits from this tiny vineyard within the ramparts of Cadillac's 15th-century castle. Juicy acidity and blackberry flavors balance with the solid structure and firm tannins. Drink from 2021.
title: Vignobles Darriet 2016 Clos du Chateau de Cadillac  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Ripe, smoky and filled with black fruits, this wine has all the elements for aging. Not for the long-term, but over the next few years, its tannins will develop to support to the full berry flavors. Drink from 2021.
title: Les Vignerons d'Alliance Bourg 2016 Baron d'Estey  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This richly fruity wine offers great tannins and layers of black-currant and berry flavors from the Merlot/Cabernet Sauvignon/Cabernet Franc blend. With no apparent wood flavors, the freshness of the fruit is palpable, partnered by the supporting tannins behind. Drink the wine from 2020.
title: Chateau Dubraud 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This ripe, delicious and fruity Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon blend has enough acidity and tannins to give it a good future. Densely structured now, its richness will allow it to develop well. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau le Bonnat 2016  Graves

description: A ripe and spicy wine, this has warm tannins and juicy acidity. Its soft structure allows the red-berry flavors to speak strongly. As it develops this fruitiness will become even more pronounced. Drink from 2021.
title: Les Vignerons d'Alliance Bourg 2016 Haut Peyrefaure  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This firmly structured, limited-production wine also has plenty of ripe, black fruits. Bold tannins and dark-chocolate flavors are balanced by black plum fruits that are developing underneath. Drink from 2022.
title: Les Vignerons d'Alliance Bourg 2016 Closerie du Bailli Grande Reserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: From organically grown grapes, this wine is rich in wild-berry flavors, juicy acidity and silky tannins. Its fresh aftertaste brings out the fruitiness. Drink the wine now.
title: Anthony Perol 2015 Bien Eleve Pierres Dorees  (Beaujolais)

description: Whiffs of blackberry preserve and licorice contrast with a rather restrained palate full of crisp plum and cherry flavors. It's an elegant wine muted by shades of bramble and autumn leaves. Brisk acidity and fine, velvety tannins linger on the finish. Enjoy now - 2025.
title: Marlene & Nicolas Chevalier 2015 Les Voleyeses  (Crozes-Hermitage)

description: A blend of 50% Marsanne and 50% Viognier, this crisply composed white offers demure red apple, honey and apricot flavors. It's not deeply concentrated or complex but lovely now for its refreshing, youthful vibe. Enjoy now - 2020.
title: Lavau 2015 La Decelle White (Cotes du Rhone Villages Valreas)

description: This rich, smoky wine comes from vines surrounding the early 14th-century castle of Landiras. At this stage, it has too much wood flavor but the bold red-berry fruits should come through strongly. Drink this ripe wine from 2020.
title: Chateau de Landiras 2015  Graves

description: Notes of smoke, charcuterie and dried lavender introduce velvety layers of black cherry and plum in this wine. Briskly composed and light on its feet, this vibrant but penetrating Syrah is encased in fine, integrated tannins. Still quite youthful it should improve through 2035 and hold further.
title: Ogier 2014 Village  (Cote Rotie)

description: Violet petals and pristine black cherries perfume earthier tones of garrigue and bramble in this brisk, freshly composed Syrah. Light bodied and robed with fine, firm tannins, it's a vibrant, youthful wine that should improve through 2025 and hold further.
title: Domaine Champet 2014 Grand Vin La Vialliere  (Cote Rotie)

description: From vines on the north-facing slope of Mont Brouilly, this wine has plenty of rich cherry flavors as well as the fresher acidity typical of the vintage. Deliciously fruity it is ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Briante 2014  Cote de Brouilly

description: Light and fruity, this wine is crisp and fresh with red-cherry flavors. It has bright acidity and an edge of tannins. Its bright, refreshing fruits are very ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Briante 2014  Brouilly

description: Medium-intense aromas of apple flesh, white melon rind and yellow flowers open the nose of this fresh and inviting sparkler. Made from 60% Chardonnay, 30% Chenin Blanc and 10% Mauzac, it's brisk and lively, with final hints of green apple and lime leaf.
title: Aimery NV Grande Cuvee 1531 Brut Sparkling (Cremant de Limoux)

description: Part of Duboeuf's extensive range of classic Beaujolais single-vineyard wines, this is bright, young and fruity. But it also has some structure to go with the red fruits, banana and perfumed acidity. Drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2018 Nouveau Domaine des 3 Vallons  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This Beaune negociant has produced a ripe, black-fruit-flavored wine that has tannins as well as richness. With its structure along with the acidity and brightness, the wine could age, but is also delicious now.
title: Joseph Drouhin 2018 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Bright and crisply fruity, this tangy berry- and red-cherry-flavored wine has light tannins and a fine texture of acidity. It's attractively juicy and ready to drink now.
title: Mommessin 2018 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: This is a ripe style of new Beaujolais, with red-berry fruits and a series of tannins that give the wine shape. It's not all serious though, with plenty of bubbly acidity as well as a bright aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Bouchard Aine et Fils 2018 Nouveau  (Beaujolais)

description: This wine, of course, has plenty of fruitiness with red-berry flavors. But it also has a tannic edge that could allow it to age, an unusual thought for a Nouveau Beaujolais. It will go well with food, even with Thanksgiving turkey.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2018 Nouveau  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Acidity and richness give this wine an opulent character. Ripe blackberry fruit are shot with acidity, still young and exuberant. The wine needs to soften and fill out to reveal its true intensity. Drink from 2020.
title: Albert Bichot 2017 Domaine de Rochegres  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: The name translates as "heart of the winemaker," recognizing owner Anita Kuhnel's place among the few women producers in Beaujolais. The wine is complex and intense, while also well structured and full of smooth fruits. Velvet tannins give a sense of structure while leaving the freshness intact. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Anita 2017 Coeur de Vigneronne  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Night harvesting of grapes for this wine has preserved freshness and fruitiness. It's also allowed the tannins to have great play and density. Structure and beautiful, juicy black fruits have a good future ahead of them. Drink this powerful wine from 2020.
title: Domaine Anita 2017 Reine de Nuit  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: From one of the top vineyards in Fleurie, this wine is elegant, conveying a floral character as well as an opulent backdrop of dark black fruits. A rich wine with concentration and dense tannins, it needs to age further to become balanced and stylish. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Anita 2017 Les Moriers  (Fleurie)

description: From a three-acre parcel, Anita Kuhnel's wine is structured, firm and juicy. Dense and rich, it offers black fruits, solid tannins and layered acidity. Still young the wine will be best from 2021.
title: Domaine Anita 2017 Premium Les Brureaux  (Chenas)

description: Vines that are more than 80 years old are rare even in Beaujolais, which has many longstanding vineyards. This wine shows firm concentration and ripe tannins that are balanced by fresh acidity and black-currant flavors. Age the wine further and drink from 2020.
title: Jean-Michel Dupre 2017 1935 Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

description: Old vines are behind this structured wine, giving bold tannins as well as rich black-currant fruits. The wine is concentrated, ripe and needs to age. Drink this black-hued wine from 2021.
title: Pardon et Fils 2017 Domaine Pardon Cuvee Hugo  (Fleurie)

description: A blend of three parcels giving three different aspects of soil, this wine is firmly structured, still developing its tannins and solid fruit. The ripe black fruits are showing well, full of acidity and spice while the dry core is just beginning to soften. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaines Chermette 2017 Les Trois Roches  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Named after the large barrels used for aging, this is a perfumed wine. Ripe tannins are a balanced part of the rich black fruits and intense spice that are setting the wine on a course for long-term aging. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Richard Rottiers 2017 Foudres  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Big tannins and firm extraction mark this wine. Its structure and dry core are, at this young stage, as important as the fruit. That will change and it will develop into a rich wine that is well balanced between structure and black fruits. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Lathuiliere Gravallon 2017 Les Charmes by Cedric Lathuiliere  (Morgon)

description: This balanced, structured wine comes from the slopes of Mont Brouilly. Its tannins match the ripeness of the black-cherry flavors as well as the crisp acidity. A streak of minerality reflects the granite terroir. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine de la Voute des Crozes 2017  Cote de Brouilly
winery: Domaine de la Voute des Crozes

description: The negociant side of the Gellin family's Domaine des Nugues has produced a richly structured wine, showing the density and tannins of this appellation. It also hints at the fruit that is beginning to show. Let the blackberry flavors develop and drink the wine from 2020.
title: Gilles Gelin 2017  Moulin-A -Vent

description: Powerfully structured, this wine has rich tannins and ripe black fruits. Concentration gives the wine strength and density, promising good aging potential. Drink this wine from 2021.
title: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2017 Roche Bleue  (Julienas)

description: Produced from old vines, this special cuvee is richly endowed with powerful tannins as well as dense fruit. It is still too young with its broad cherry flavors and acidity. It will develop into a well-constructed wine with concentration and potential. Drink from 2021, but the wine will age further.
title: Chateau de Pizay 2017 La Centenaire  (Morgon)

description: The schist soil of the vineyard has given this wine intense minerality and great structure. Behind this firm character, black fruits and acidity promise a wine that will be rich while also solid and structured. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine de Bel-Air 2017 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

description: From a two-acre vineyard, this no-sulfite organic wine has big tannins as well as generous fruits. At this stage, tannins dominate giving a wine with great structure. The fruit will come later as the wine develops. Wait until 2020.
title: Domaine Chasselay 2017 Corcelette  (Morgon)

description: From vines close to the 19th-century chateau of Bellevue, this wine comes from one of the top sectors of Morgon. Still young, but properly structured and dense, the wine has considerable potential. Aging in wood has added spice and rich tannins while leaving blackberry fruit right in place. Drink this wine from 2021.
title: Jean Loron 2017 Chateau de Bellevue Les Charmes  (Morgon)

description: This oak-aged wine is smoothly textured, full of ripe black fruits. Spice as well as the layer of tannins give richness. Black cherries and berries add depth to the wine that is likely to age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaines Chermette 2017 Les Garants  (Fleurie)

description: This single-vineyard wine comes from an area that produces small berries and great fruit concentration. Rich in both tannins and bold structure, the wine is also packed with generous fruits. It needs to age and will be best from 2020.
title: Domaine Anita 2017 Chateau-Gaillard  (Morgon)

description: Old vines are the backbone of this ripe, concentrated wine. They march with the still young tannins to give a powerful wine with density and richness. It is still structured and likely to age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Colin Bourisset 2017 Domaine de la Garodiere  (Morgon)

description: From one of the specified cru vineyards of Morgon, this firm wine has all the structure of the appellation and also the rich fruit. It is powerful and will develop well as it matures. Don't even touch this wine until 2021.
designation: Henri et Colin Bourisset Les Grands Cras
title: Colin Bourisset 2017 Henri et Colin Bourisset Les Grands Cras  (Morgon)

description: This wine's name refers to the ancient granite soil found all over Beaujolais. The wine is all about red berries and firm tannins. Still young, it has a bright feel, full of fruitiness. Give the wine time to fill out. Drink from 2020.
title: Chateau du Chatelard 2017 Cuvee les Vieux Granits  (Fleurie)

description: Eighty-year-old vines trained, in the old Beaujolais tradition, up individual poles, give this wine a rich character, with some firm tannins and a sold texture. Weight and concentration balance the juicy acidity and black fruits. Drink the wine from 2020.
title: Chateau de Belleverne 2017 Les Seignaux  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: This mineral-driven wine from 80-year-old vines shows the granite soils of the vineyard. The resulting structure and density sustain the ripe fruits, fine tannins and acidity. The wine should be aged further, so drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Anita 2017 Tres Vieille Vigne Les Caves  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: A 2.5-acre parcel has produced a ripe, generously textured and wood-aged wine. The spice and warm tannins are balanced by juicy black-currant flavors to give a wine that will age for a few more months. Drink from late 2019.
title: Domaine Richard Rottiers 2017  Brouilly

description: Floral, perfumed and structured, this is a wine for aging. It has tannins, concentrated black-plum flavors and acidity. The wine has the potential for richness but needs time. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Lathuiliere Gravallon 2017 Grand Pre  (Fleurie)

description: A ripe, soft wine with rich berry fruits, this is smooth, velvet textured and already delicious. Concentration comes from generous fruits with a splash of acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Chateau de Belleverne 2017 La Madone  (Saint-Amour)

description: This is a solid, structured wine with firm tannins as well ripe fruit. Its concentration and minerality from the granite soil are the secret to the wine's aging potential. Give this rich wine, full of black fruits and acidity, until 2020.
title: Vignobles Bulliat 2017  Moulin-A -Vent

description: From one of the top vineyard sites in Moulin-A -Vent, this wine is richly structured, firm with tannins while also juicy with cherry flavors. It is young, full of vivacious fruit and needs some time. Drink from 2020.
title: Patrick Tranchand 2017 Roche Gres  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: A powerful and dense wine, this is concentrated and dark. Black fruits and a solid structure give richness and power, with good acidity to balance the structure. The wine is a blend of four different parcels. Drink from 2020.
designation: Xavier et Nicolas Barbet Vieilles Vignes
title: Jean Loron 2017 Xavier et Nicolas Barbet Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: The Saint-Cyr family has produced a perfumed wine with ripe berry fruits, generous tannins and acidity. The nine months in wood have given richness and balance, while the low sulfur brings out the fruitiness. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Saint-Cyr 2017 Les Journets  (Chenas)

description: Low sulfur and wood aging both contribute to the deliciously structured fruitiness of this wine. With its juicy black-cherry flavors, touches of minerality and some tannins, it is a wine that will age. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Saint-Cyr 2017 Les Blemonts  (Chenas)

description: Corinne and Vincent Flache used partial oak aging for this rich, structured and fruity wine. It is certainly young, bold with red-berry flavors and generous tannins that need to soften. Drink from 2021.
title: Flache Sornay 2017  Morgon

description: A small-production wine from one of the top vineyard sites in Morgon, this is structured and firm, with a strong tannic element over the rich berry fruits. All this richness balances with a strong line of acidity. Age this wine for some time longer and don't drink before 2020.
title: Domaine Pral 2017 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

description: All the perfumed character and structure to be expected in a wine from this appellation are exhibited in this full, dense wine. Its juicy character is still developing, but it is doing so in partnership with fresh berry flavors. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaines Chermette 2017 Poncie  (Fleurie)

description: As befits old vines from the Collonge family's top Beaujolais cru, this wine has great weight and impressive concentration. Juicy acidity, rich tannins and blackberry flavors all lead to a complete wine that needs time to mature. Wait until 2020 before drinking.
title: Domaine de Colonat 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: From an estate owned by Jacques Charlet, this wine has ripe tannins and rich black-currant and cherry fruits. A firm core supports the fruit, giving an initial dry character to this wine. It will develop well and should be drunk from 2020.
title: Jean Loron 2017 La Victorine  (Saint-Amour)

description: Matured in stainless steel tanks only, this wine is perfumed and fresh, with attractive acidity and plenty of red fruits. It has a structure and a dry core alongside a fresh, crisp aftertaste. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2017 Belles Grives  (Morgon)

description: From a two-acre parcel in one of the Morgon cru vineyards, this young wine still shows a touch of yeastiness. However it also has ripe berry fruits and touches of wood aging that add pepper and some spice. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Saint-Cyr 2017 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

description: This intense, concentrated young wine demands plenty of aging. Red-berry flavors are there along with a powerful tannic structure. Still firm and dry even though with potential fruitiness, the wine should be held until 2020.
title: Jean Loron 2017 Chateau de Bellevue  (Fleurie)

description: Packed with red fruit, this rich wine is firmly structured. The dry core gives impressive richness to the tannins and to the pure fruit flavors. Its juicy character is beginning to come through, suggesting good potential. Drink this wine from 2021.
title: Domaine Lathuiliere Gravallon 2017 Corcelette  (Morgon)

description: Named after the captains who used to control Saint-Amour, this wine has structure and layers of spice as well as some rich berry fruits. Its tannins are still young, still right up front, showing the wine's aging potential. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2017 Les Capitans  (Saint-Amour)

description: This perfumed wine offers both richness and dense tannins. Its acidity and black fruits hold great promise, with freshness as well as ripeness. It will be ready from 2020.
title: Domaine de Roche-Guillon 2017  Fleurie

description: While the fruit of this wine is perfumed, the structure is firm and dry. That gives considerable aging potential to this rich wine with its blackberry flavors and considerable acidity. The wine will take its time, and should be ready from 2020.
title: Patrick Tranchand 2017 Poncie  (Fleurie)

description: Produced from organically grown grapes and bottled without additional sulfur, this wine is part of a trend in Beaujolais. Its tannic structure and pure red-cherry flavors are already impressive, giving the wine aging potential and richness. Enjoy this wine from 2020.
title: Vignobles Bulliat 2017 Nature  (Morgon)

description: The old vines that gave this wine endow it with great structure and concentration, what the seventh generation of Collognes call the signature of the terroir. Firm and solid, it has weight as well as black fruits, rich tannins supporting the juicy acidity and fruitiness.
title: Domaine de Colonat 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Regnie)

description: Ripe, fruity while also structured, this wine is concentrated. It comes from a sloping five-acre parcel, giving tannins, red fruits and good acidity all wrapped in an ageworthy parcel. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2017 Les Mouilles  (Julienas)

description: Firm and structured, this wine is rich in tannins while also having plenty of fresh, juicy fruit. The wine's dry core is dominant at this stage, but just wait until that fruit begins to shine. The dense texture and the wine's ripeness will let it age for several years. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2017 Corcelette  (Morgon)

description: A dense wine made from 50-year-old vines, this is rich and dense. It has a smoky character with some bitterness at this young stage. Both elements will disappear into the rich fruit as the wine matures. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine de Bel-Air 2017 Les Burdelines  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: This wine is full of fruit and tannins. Although still young, it has plenty of freshness and fruit potential to go with the ripe, perfumed tannins. Drink the wine from 2020.
title: Domaine de Bel-Air 2017 Granits Roses  (Fleurie)

description: From a vineyard known as Les Mouilles, this wine is firmly structured while also rich. Its tannins and touches of licorice are balanced by the black fruits that are developing. It has a good future with its tannins, acidity and dark fruit. Drink from 2020.
title: Jean Loron 2017 Domaine de la Vieille Eglise  (Julienas)

description: Red cherry and red berry fruits are balanced by the ripe tannins in this structured wine. It has good potential, with plenty of tight acidity and spicy tones. Drink from 2020.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Flower Label  (Julienas)

description: This wine is tight with tannins as well as juicy acidity. The young fruits are still developing through the dense texture and need more time to balance with the structure. Then this should be an attractive, ripe wine. Drink from late 2019.
title: Domaine de Grands Fers 2017 Gamay Noir 1890  (Fleurie)

description: This Beaune negociant has produced a richly structured wine from one of Morgon's best vineyards. It is ripe, fleshy with black-cherry fruits and the firm texture that will allow this rich wine to age. Drink from 2020.
title: Albert Bichot 2017 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

description: This wine comes from Fleurie's most famous vineyard, which descends the hill from the La Madone chapel. Rich and concentrated, it has structure that balances well with the juicy black fruits. However it needs to age further, so wait until 2020.
title: Albert Bichot 2017 La Madone  (Fleurie)

description: Named after the dovecote in the family's vineyards, this wine has structure and the aging ability typical of this appellation. Tannins and dark fruits come together in a rich wine with juicy acidity and layers of black-cherry flavors.
title: Vignobles Bulliat 2017 Cuvee du Colombier  (Morgon)

description: Named after the small workers' cabin in the vineyard, this wine has rich fruit, generous tannins and layers of spice and acidity. The wine is all berry flavors with a fresh lift. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine du Gry-Sablon 2017 La Petite Cabane  (Julienas)

description: This solid, rich wine offers firm tannins as well as generous berry and black-cherry fruits. A touch of spice and layers of acidity support the ripe fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Domaine des Maisons Neuves 2017 Selection Vieilles Vignes  (Brouilly)

description: Showing the softer side of Fleurie, this wine is deliciously full of red fruits. Its young structure gives the wine a core of tannin that supports the ebullient fruits. Red cherries and acidity balance well in this wine that will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Vignobles Bulliat 2017  Fleurie

description: The granite soil of this famous vineyard gives this wine its dense minerality and firm tannins. Paired with this solid element, the wine offers rich berry flavors and a fresher acidity. It should age well and will not be ready before 2021.
title: Pardon et Fils 2017 Cote du Py  (Morgon)

description: The Grand Cras is one of the recognized vineyard areas of Morgon, producing, as here, concentrated wines. This is dense, firm and still young, with potential from the rich black fruits. A wine to age, it will be best from 2020.
title: Jean-Michel Dupre 2017 Grands Cras  (Morgon)

description: Produced, like all this producer's wines, from organically grown grapes, this is an aromatic wine. Wood aging has given the wine its richness and full, generous structure. Spice, black fruits and acidity are all coming together. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Richard Rottiers 2017  Moulin-A -Vent

description: Partly aged in wood, this ripe wine is smoothly textured and rich. With tannins as well as red fruits and spice, the wine is already balanced although its bright fruitiness need to calm down a little. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Colonat 2017 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

description: Partially aged in old wood, this wine with its ripe fruit and smooth tannins is full of rich, perfumed flavors. The dry edge just adds to the attractive ripeness of the wine. Drink now.
title: Domaine les Capreoles 2017 L'Amourgandise Terroir de Lantignie  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Spice along with rich fruit give this wine a juicy, ripe character. Layers of gentle tannins add structure to the black-cherry and plum flavors. It is well balanced, generous and ready to drink.
title: Domaine Lathuiliere Gravallon 2017 Les Extremes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Old vines planted on granite on the Darroze estate give this richly structured and dense wine. It has a layers of red-berry fruits, tannins and a youthful mineral texture. All these elements will come together over the next few months, so drink this wine after 2020.
title: Domaine des Quatre Vents 2017  Fleurie

description: Deep pink in the glass, this full-bodied, perfumed rose offers vibrant red-plum and sour-cherry aromas with an elegant mineral undertone. Its red fruit flavors are still refreshingly tart and concentrated, making it a lovely pairing with fish or fowl.
title: Lavau 2017  Tavel

description: This wine has structure and rich fruits, full of tannins as well as well as blackberry flavors. Still young and with plenty of time ahead of it, this wine from a 15-acre parcel within the Darroze estate will be ready from 2020.
title: Clos des Quatre Vents 2017  Fleurie

description: A crisp style of Morgon with tannins and a dense texture, this wine is ripe and powerful. The cherry flavors have considerable acidity and need to soften.
title: Maison Remy Passot et Fils 2017  Morgon

description: The volcanic soil of Mont Brouilly has given a mineral edge to this structured wine from a seven-acre vineyard. Juicy berry flavors are still developing alongside the dry edge of tannins. It will become a spicy, fresh wine from 2020.
title: Domaine du Riaz 2017  Cote de Brouilly

description: A long maceration of the grapes before fermentation has given this wine a solid structure and intensity. Its richness comes both from the ripe red fruits and the tannins. Acidity promises plenty of freshness as the wine ages.
title: Domaine de Colette 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Regnie)

description: Lightly structured, this wine has ripe fruit that is also fresh and crisp. With the tannins and acidity, the wine has the ability to age, introducing extra richness as it does so. Drink from late 2019.
title: Agnes Pegaz 2017 Plaisirs de Pegase  (Brouilly)

description: This structured wine is still full of young tannins, with a dense, dry core that needs to soften. Around that center, the wine offers black fruits, ripe tannins and plenty of balancing acidity.
title: Florent Descombe 2017 Cuvee M  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Structured, full of dark tannins and with a strong Py mineral streak, this wine from nine acres of old vines is still young and needs time. It has weight along with fresh red-cherry flavors that contrast with the structure. Let it age and drink from 2020.
title: Domaine de Javerniere 2017 Cote du Py  (Morgon)

description: Structured, spicy and with layers of rich fruits, this is a wine has tannins and concentration. The black fruits are cut with acidity and a dry edge that will soften over the next few months. Drink now.
title: Domaine Bertrand 2017 Vuril  (Brouilly)

description: This fourth-generation-run estate has produced a rich, tannic wine. At this stage black fruits and a firm structure demand aging. The wine is likely to balance well over the next year and be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Mont Chavy 2017  Morgon

description: The black volcanic rock of this vineyard is a strong element in its firm, upright texture. Dark and full of tannins, the fruit is still in the background. However there is fresh acidity and hints of the red-cherry flavors that will develop. Wait to drink until 2020.
title: Domaine de Roche Noire 2017  Moulin-A -Vent

description: Made without added sulfur, this ripe wine offers black fruits and soft tannins. The fruit is pure, juicy and clean, with attractive acidity as well as a fresh aftertaste. Drink the wine now.
title: Domaine de Grands Fers 2017 Gamay Originel 1890  (Fleurie)

description: This wine is rich with young tannins that promise excellent aging. Ripe red-berry fruits have a touch of spice as well as a lightly herbal edge. It is developing well as its silky texture begins to show. Drink from 2020.
title: Chateau de Julienas 2017 Cuvee Tradition  (Julienas)

description: Playing on the name of Saint-Amour (named after a Roman soldier), this wine celebrates Gamay. Its juicy red-cherry flavors are bright while allowing space for tannins and aging potential.
title: Patrick Tranchand 2017 Coeur de Gamay  (Saint-Amour)

description: From soil that has some sand as well as granite, this wine has both structure and ripe black fruits. Tannins are prominent at this early stage and need to soften into the fruitiness of this ripe wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Pardon et Fils 2017 Domaine Pardon Cuvee Tim  (Regnie)

description: This is an elegant wine, with acidity and red fruits already in harmony. An edge of tannins gives the wine structure and aging potential.
title: Christophe Savoye 2017 Cuvee Loic  (Chiroubles)

description: A blend of equal proportions of Grenache Blanc and Clairette, this full-bodied yet vibrant white offers crisp apricot and tangerine flavors offset by bites of lemon zest and crushed minerals. Enjoy this thirst-quenching wine now through 2021.
title: Chateau Maucoil 2017 White (Cotes du Rhone Villages)

description: Pale and dusky pink in hue, this bright, zesty wine suggests crisp raspberry and cassis flavors accented with earth and bramble. Full bodied yet invigorating, it's a refreshing wine that's still drinking well almost a year after bottling.
title: Alain Jaume et Fils 2017 Reserve Grand Veneur Rose (Cotes du Rhone)

description: Parcels on the red-iron slopes of the dramatic 1,100-foot Cote du Py are the backbone of this rich and structured wine. Powerful tannins give the wine density and aging potential. It has a way to go, with rich black fruits and acidity that still need to soften. Drink from 2020.
title: Jean-Ernest Descombes 2017 Cote du Py  (Morgon)

description: The schist soil of this estate has left its mark on this wine in its mineral texture. The wine is tight and firmly structured, with bold tannins that need to soften. Drink from 2020.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2017 Domaine des Versauds  (Morgon)

description: From the famous Cote du Py vineyard, this wine has considerable structure. Its black fruits and rich tannins are typical of this granite terroir. The wine also has juicy red fruits that are developing and will come to dominate from 2019.
title: Florent Descombe 2017 Cuvee M Cote du Py  (Morgon)

description: This structured wine has big tannins as well as generous black fruits. Acidity and a cool edge to the structure show the elevation of this appellation and will allow the wine to mature slowly. Great fruitiness adds to the promise. Drink from 2020.
title: Fabien Collonge 2017 L'Aurore des Cotes  (Chiroubles)

description: Partially aged in wood, this smoothly textured, dense wine is packed with black fruits, bright acidity and spice. The fresh edge contrasts with the dry tannins that will soften as the wine develops. Give this wine until 2020 before drinking.
title: Domaine des Rosiers 2017  Moulin-A -Vent

description: Ripe red fruits and soft tannins characterize this rich wine. With berry flavors, intense acidity and developing richness, it will turn into a full, generous wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine des Maisons Neuves 2017 L'Ecluse  (Cote de Brouilly)

description: Rich yellow fruits bring out the ripeness and emphasize the opulent nature of this wine. There's enough acidity to balance all this generosity and the wine could develop for a few more months. So best drink from summer 2019.
title: Domaine des Nugues 2017  Beaujolais-Villages Blanc

description: This rich, opulent wine is full of black fruits, ripe tannins and good acidity. It has plenty of spice and a toughness that comes from its youth. The wine needs to soften, so drink from mid 2019.
title: Domaine des Maisons Neuves 2017 Les Bois-Combes  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Hillside vineyards facing southwest are the source of this structured wine. Ripe tannins parallel the bright red-berry flavors that shine from the wine. It is already ready to drink.
title: Maison Remy Passot et Fils 2017  Chiroubles

description: This wine has structure, with tannins as well as concentrated fruits. A backdrop of juicy black-cherry flavors is likely to come to the front of the wine and add texture and acidity.
title: Domaine Chavy les Charmes 2017  Morgon

description: This wine is firmly structured and still young. Red-cherry flavors partner with the tannins, giving a fruity edge to a solid, dense wine. It needs time to develop its full potential, so drink from 2020.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Flower Label  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Both fresh and rich, this wine is crisp with acidity and lively with red-cherry flavors. The bright aftertaste lifts the ripe fruit and soft texture. Drink now.
title: Domaine Andre Collonge 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

description: A well-structured wine, this already shows rich berry fruits that shine richly. The wine has weight, with rounded fruit lifted with acidity. Gentle tannins complete this attractive wine. Drink now.
title: Colin Bourisset 2017 Henri et Colin Bourisset  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This wine is tannic and firm, still obviously young for a wine from this Beaujolais cru. Its structure will soften into the juicy cherry fruits and crisp acidity. Drink this wine from late 2019.
title: Chateau de Pougelon 2017  Julienas

description: Typical of the appellation, this wine has intense layers of acidity at this young age. These need to soften allowing the red-cherry flavors and firm edge of tannin to develop. Drink this wine from late 2019.
title: Chateau de Pizay 2017  Regnie

description: A perfumed wine with generous tannins as well as ripe berry flavors, this is bursting with young fruitiness. It needs some time to calm down and relax, so wait until late 2019.
title: Chateau de la Chaize 2017 Rien de Trop  (Brouilly)

description: Named after the parcel of vines that produced the grapes, this wine is packed with tannins and crisp red-fruit flavors. Its structure and fruit are already in balance, finishing with a crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2020.
title: Laurent Gauthier 2017 Chatenay Vieilles Vignes  (Chiroubles)

description: A young wine replete with tannins, this is also fruity while well structured. It shows power as well as concentration, with a generous red-cherry aftertaste.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2017 Collection  (Morgon)

description: With grapes from a number of vineyards, this wine has structure while pushing the red-cherry flavors right to the front. It is an attractive juicy wine with a fresh edge of acidity and great fruitiness at the end.
title: Jean Loron 2017 Au Beau Moulin  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Still firm with tannins and with an austere edge, this wine is dry and young. Its fruit is still to come, with just a hint of blackberries in the background. Drink from 2020.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2017 Chateau de la Chaponne  (Morgon)

description: Soft and ripely fruity, this rich wine has juicy red fruits and plenty of acidity. Red-berry flavors and good acidity give the wine an already delicious, attractive character. Drink the wine from 2019.
title: Domaine de Colonat 2017 Les Charmes Tradition  (Morgon)

description: Ripe, lightly structured and fruity, this wine is bright with acidity as well as tannins. Black-currant freshness gives a lift to the structure and to the final acidity. Drink now.
designation: Le Bois de Chat Vieilles Vignes
title: Chateau de Belleverne 2017 Le Bois de Chat Vieilles Vignes  (Julienas)

description: Ripe yellow apple and nectarine flavors have a touch of white-blossom perfume in this spry, medium-bodied white. It's not a complex wine but fresh and quaffable. The finish is brisk and clean. Enjoy now - 2020.
title: Alain Jaume et Fils 2017 Reserve Grand Veneur White (Cotes du Rhone)

description: This wine is lightly structured, with plenty of juicy acidity as well as red-cherry flavors. Coming from a single estate, the wine is full, generous and ripe. Drink from late 2019.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2017 Domaine des Nazins  (Brouilly)

description: Granite subsoil gives a firm edge and minerality to this wine. Its blackberry fruits are still developing, balancing with the tannins and acidity. It should be ready to drink from late 2019.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2017 Chateau de la Perriere  (Brouilly)

description: A ripe, attractively perfumed wine, this is rich in red fruits and texture. Freshness is balanced by the undertow of ripe fruit to give a wine with a juicy aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine Joncy 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Soft fruit gently laced with acidity is behind this fresh wine. Its acidity has a crisp edge that lifts the white stone-fruit flavors that have gathered further richness from lees stirring. Drink this wine now.
title: Domaine du Granit 2017  Beaujolais-Villages Blanc

description: Grown on the slopes of the highest of cru appellations, this wine is structured, with tannins balanced by berry fruits. It has the typical cool feel of the appellation so the wine's freshness and acidity need time to fill out. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine des Pontheux 2017  Chiroubles

description: This warm, ripe wine has attractive yellow-fruit flavors and a rich texture. The smooth, creamy character is enhanced by touches of toast and honey. Drink this wine now.
title: Gilles Gelin 2017  Beaujolais Blanc

description: From vines up to 85 years old, this rich wine has generous tannins as well juicy red fruits. It is ready to drink despite its structure, full bodied and fruity at the same time.
title: Domaines Chermette 2017 Origine Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

description: Ripe red fruits dominate this broad wine. Rose-petal aromas are followed through with perfumed tannins that back up that fruit. Aged for eight months before bottling, the wine should be ready from late 2019.
title: Domaine de Bel-Air 2017 Briante  (Brouilly)

description: This purple-colored wine is full of fruit, with a lightly tannic texture. It is full, with black-currant and cherry flavors and light acidity. The wine is textured and another few months will allow it to open. Drink now.
title: Chateau des Loges 2017 Selection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This fortified castle, one of the oldest in the region, is situated just north of the Brouilly vineyards. This wine, rich in fruit and light in tannins, is well balanced, ripe and generous. Layers of black fruits are gently cut by acidity and a structure that is just right. Drink now.
title: Chateau de la Terriere 2017  Brouilly

description: This full, ripe wine has plenty of strawberry flavors as well as acidity. The tannins are surprisingly light for this appellation, while the acidity is still intense. Wait to drink until late 2019.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Flower Label  (Saint-Amour)

description: Produced from the first juice to come from the press after the hand-picked grapes are at the winery, this limited-production wine is full of ripe berry fruits and soft tannins. Its acidity and lively character are all part of a wine that could age for a few months. Drink from summer 2019.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Coeur de Presse  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Ripe fruit and soft tannins are dominant in this wine made from old vines. It has concentration, touches of spice and bright red-cherry flavors. Drink now.
title: Domaines Chermette 2017 Coeur de Vendanges Vignes Centenaires  (Beaujolais)

description: Five generations have run this family estate that's planted with old vines. This wine is juicy and fruity, with hints of bananas as well as some firm tannins. It will soften to give a fruity wine, so wait until late 2019.
title: Domaine du Pourpre 2017  Moulin-A -Vent

description: A jammy, banana and red-fruit-flavored wine, this is soft and fresh. It has a crisp edge to the fruitiness and only the lightest of tannins. Drink the wine now.
title: Domaine des Maisons Neuves 2017  Chiroubles

description: This upfront, fruity wine has bold blackberry flavors touched with spice and finished with acidity. Berry flavors and fresh acidity come together with a rounded and light texture. It is generous, silky and lightly tannic. Drink now.
title: Vignerons des Pierres Dorees 2017 La Rose Pourpre Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)

description: With its light structure and good balance between cherry flavors and acidity, this is an attractive wine. It is all about fresh, crisp fruit, with just the right amount of richness. Drink now.
title: Louis Jadot 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Easy, forward plum and cherry flavors abound in this ripe, juicy red. A Grenache-dominant blend, it's an approachable sip for enjoyment young. Soft, fine tannins and a touch of black pepper mark the finish.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2017 Saint-Vincent Red (Cotes du Rhone)

description: Rich and smoothly textured, this is a generous wine with ripe tannins and juicy black-cherry fruitiness. It has enough structure to give the wine a balanced shape, ready to drink now.
title: Florent Descombe 2017 Chateau de Pougelon  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Fresh and crisp, this is a fruity wine. Apple and citrus flavors give a bright character. Drink this lively wine now.
title: Domaine Bertrand 2017  Beaujolais Blanc

description: Juicy fruit and firm tannins give this wine ripeness and structure. The red-berry flavors are still young and ebullient and need to calm down along with the dry core of the wine. Drink from late 2019.
title: Domaine Baron de l'Ecluse 2017 L'Ecluse  (Cote de Brouilly)

description: Soft and fruity, this wine has attractive red-cherry flavors and a line of crisp acidity. A touch of spice give this round wine its final lift. Drink now.
title: Chateau de Pougelon 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This full, ripe wine has layers of tannins as well as fresh red-cherry flavors. Coming from this appellation, it has a structure that needs to soften before drinking. Wait until late 2019.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Flower Label  (Morgon)

description: This smooth, creamy wine has ripe yellow and citrus fruits already well integrated together. The wine has also shows weight and enough acidity. The estate is in conversion to organic. Drink from late 2019.
title: Domaine Joncy 2017  Beaujolais-Villages Blanc

description: Plenty of juicy fruit in this structured single-estate wine balances with the tannins. The intense acidneeds time to soften. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine de Javerniere 2017  Morgon

description: This wine comes from a 12-acre vineyard planted in the heart of the Beaujolais Villages appellation. It has some concentration as well as juicy red fruits, backed up by tannins that need to soften for a few months. Drink from summer 2019.
title: Chateau des Vierres 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This softly textured, bright wine is all about juicy, perfumed fruit and acidity. For the appellation and the 3.5-acre vineyard of La Madone it less structured than usual, although the fruitiness is attractive. Drink from summer 2019.
title: La Madone 2017 Clos des Quatre Vents  (Fleurie)

description: This is an attractive, perfumed wine, fresh with red-cherry flavors and acidity. It is softly textured, light on the tannins although full of young fruitiness. Drink from summer 2019.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Flower Label  (Fleurie)

description: As Beaujolais comes back in favor, the Chasselay family used its sense of humor with this label. This organic wine sums up the attractive red fruits of a simple wine from the region. Drink now.
