title: Domaine Chasselay 2017 Beaujolais Is Not Dead  (Beaujolais)

description: This simplest style of Beaujolais is soft and with red-cherry fruits. Acidity and a crisp aftertaste give the wine a bright, lifted character. Drink now.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Flower Label  (Beaujolais)

description: From the south of Beaujolais, this tropical-fruit-flavored wine is gentle and with a rich texture. Acidity keeps it fresh, balancing the ripe, warm fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Vignerons des Pierres Dorees 2017 Rostre de Belemite  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: From a single organic parcel, this wine has bright red fruits and a ripe character. Its soft texture and acidity balance well with the delicious fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Chasselay 2017 La Platiere  (Beaujolais)

description: Coming from the southern Beaujolais region where buildings have almost gold-colored stones, the pierres dorees, this wine is gently textured with lemon and green apple. Acidity and a fresh aftertaste make this wine ready to drink now.
title: Domaine Pral 2017 Les Pays des Pierres Dorees  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: Gamay makes an attractive rose and this lightly pink-colored wine is no exception. It is crisp with red-currant flavor, a touch of caramel and plenty of acidity. Drink the wine now.
title: Boutinot 2017 Joli Beaurose Rose (Beaujolais Rose)

description: Firm and tightly structured, this wine shows tannins as much as fruit. The dry core is very obvious with its dark character while the fruitiness seems to be missing.
title: Louis Tete 2017  Brouilly

description: Soft red cherries and touches of bananas give this gentle wine richness. It has a warm feel to it, open and packed with fruitiness. This should be drunk now.
title: Pardon et Fils 2017 Cuvee P  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Ripe and soft, this negociant wine is made for easy drinking when young. Plenty of attractive blackberry fruits are cut with just the right amount of fresh acidity. Drink now.
title: Florent Descombe 2017 Cuvee B  (Beaujolais)

description: Soft but warm yellow and white stone-fruit flavors give this wine a rich feel. It is open and smooth, with just a tang of acidity. Drink the wine now.
title: Domaine Saint-Cyr 2017 La Galoche  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: This lightly perfumed, fresh and fruity wine has some fine, gentle tannins as well as black-cherry flavors and acidity. Bright and exuberant at this stage, it could benefit from calming down. Drink from late 2019.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2017 Flower Label  (Brouilly)

description: This crisp, fresh wine offers raspberry and red-currant flavors. It has a young, fragrant character shot through with acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Roche-Guillon 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

description: This 16th-century estate close to Mont Brouilly has produced an open, fruity wine with attractive acidity. Red-berry flavors are right up front, making a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Chateau de Pizay 2017 Chateau de Saint Lager  (Brouilly)

description: This soft wine is full of juicy red-berry flavors. Easy to drink with fresh acidity at the end, the wine is ready now. Longtime producers in Beaujolais, the Tete family makes a range of cru wines.
title: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2017 La Roche  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This wine has intense fruitiness. With ripe tannins and juicy red-berry flavors, it is open and ready to drink.
title: Chateau de Belleverne 2017 Les Gays  (Chenas)

description: Bright, tangy and with good acidity, this Semillon-dominant wine is refreshing and lightly structured. It has a crisp texture as well as a tangy aftertaste that needs to soften a little. Drink this organic wine from mid-2019.
title: Chateau du Seuil 2017  Graves

description: The current generation of the Bossuet-Hubert family went all out with certified biodynamic vines, indigenous yeasts and low sulfur. Crisp and lemon flavored, this vegan wine has attractive acidity and a zesty texture. It is full of mango and kiwi flavors. Drink this ripe, attractive wine now.
title: Chateau Peybonhomme-les-Tours 2017  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Soft and fruity, with cinnamon flavors, this four-grape blend from a seven-acre parcel is smooth and rounded. It has hints of toast, a ripe structure and plenty of herbal, tangy acidity at the end. Drink from mid-2019.
title: Chateau de Beau-Site 2017  Graves

description: Ripe tropical flavors dominate this rich Nicolas Thienpont wine, a full and fruity Sauvignon Blanc/Sauvignon Gris blend. Sure to develop impressively, it will be better from 2019. It's available in limited quantities only due to spring frost.
title: Chateau Puygueraud 2017  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This rich wine from Jean-Michel Baudet is packed with juicy green plum and yellow fruits. It has weight and a spicy edge that fills it out and enhances the ripe fruits. The wine is developing well, full of Sauvignon Blanc and Semillon fruit that will broaden out over the next few months. Drink from 2019.
title: Chateau Monconseil-Gazin 2017 Blanc Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is Sauvignon Blanc with a tropical twist. As well as acidity, it brings out pineapple ripeness as well as kiwi and rich lime flavors. Ripe and fruity, the wine will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Chateau Maison Neuve 2017 Sauvignon  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This crisp wine from some of the highest vineyards in the Graves is tangy, fruity and almost ready to drink. Bright acidity and a touch of minerality don't detract from the fruitiness of this delicious wine. Drink from mid 2019.
title: Chateau Ducasse 2017  Graves

description: This spicy, wood-aged wine offers flavors of nutmeg and warm white fruits. Its freshness is still developing, with plenty of time for the richness to come through. It will be best from 2020.
title: Chateau de Castres 2017  Graves

description: A light touch of wood aging has given this wine ripe, perfumed flavors and rich tannins. A generous wine, it's full of fruit, spice and concentration. Produced from old vines, this dense wine is ready to drink from 2019.
title: Chateau de Belleverne 2016 Cuvee Mandrin  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: From a 12-acre parcel, this wine is ripe, with layers of wood, spice and black fruits. Opulent and generous, it has great potential. The concentration and richness indicate a wine to age for a few more years. Drink from 2021.
title: Albert Bichot 2016 Domaine de Rochegres  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: The volcanic soil of this impressive vineyard gives powerful wines, like this. It is about tannins as much as fruit, but this will change. Wood aging has already done much to smooth the up-front structure and the fruit is developing well. But wait until 2021 for the wine to be at its best.
title: Domaine des Souchons 2016 Cote du Py  (Morgon)

description: This wood-aged wine offers complex tannins and perfumed fruit. Ripe cherries and spice go with juicy blackberry flavors to produce a wine that will age further. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Labruyere 2016 Le Clos du Moulin-A -Vent  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: This family estate, which has grown grapes since 1619, is set in the relatively high-altitude village of Chiroubles. Perfumed and ripe, this wine has some firm tannins as well as flavors of mint and spice, all balanced by acidity. The wine will develop over the next few months, so drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Joncy 2016  Chiroubles

description: The wood aging of this wine is apparent in the toasty aromas. On the palate though, the rich fruits come right to the fore. The wine has concentration, density and bold black cherry and plum flavors. It needs to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau des Jacques 2016 Clos de Rochegres  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Big and rich, this generous wine has spice, juicy black fruits and fine tannins. It has developed well with a full, rich character. Coming from a single parcel, the wine shows a great sense of terroir. The estate is under the same ownership as Domaine Jacques Prieur in Meursault on the Cote de Beaune. Drink the wine now.
title: Domaine Labruyere 2016 Le Carquelin  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Grown on crumbly granite, this wine shows its mineral side as well as rich fruit. Structured with firm tannins, the wine has a perfumed character that lifts the fruit's richness and melds into the final acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Chateau des Jean-Loron 2016 Les Gandelins  (Chenas)

description: Still young although with fruit and tannins that have come into balance, this is a full, partially oak-aged wine. The tannins are still there and this concentrated wine needs to age further. Drink from 2020.
title: Flache Sornay 2016  Morgon

description: From one of the top vineyard sites in Morgon, this wine has powerful, concentrated fruits and structure. Its dark tannins are big and dense, matching the blackberry flavors and acidity. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2020.
title: Domaine des Souchons 2016 Grands Cras  (Morgon)

description: Under the same ownership as Domaine Jacques Prieur in Meursault on the Cote de Beaune, this estate has produced a rich wine, generously textured and full of black fruits. It has weight and concentration as well as ripe berry flavors.
title: Domaine Labruyere 2016 Champ de Cour  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: A rich wine with great tannins and attractive perfumes, this is structured and packed with both fruit and acidity. Still young, its fruitiness will soften into something more serious and concentrated.
title: Domaine des Fontaines 2016  Moulin-A -Vent

description: This rich wine is full of dark fruits, rich tannins and a juicy aftertaste. Its tannins and concentration will definitely allow this wine that is both fruity and structured to age. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Joncy 2016  Cote de Brouilly

description: The latest release from this estate has had two years wood aging, giving it richness, spice and layers of wood to balance the ripe black fruits. It is a young wine, with acidity, ripeness and an excellent future. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Fond Moiroux 2016  Moulin-A -Vent

description: This wine has power, rich tannins and perfumed black-cherry fruits. Its concentration and dark structure are impressive and sure to age well. The density of wine goes with the ripe fruit cut with acidity. Drink this ageworthy wine from 2021.
title: Domaine Lathuiliere Gravallon 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Morgon)

description: An impressively structured wine for this appellation, this is rich and dense. Black fruits and perfumed acidity are supported by a firm backbone that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Romain Jambon 2016 Les Eronnes  (Brouilly)

description: This ripe wine is full of black fruits and generous, integrated tannins. It is rich, solid with warm blackberry fruits and crisp with acidity. The wine is ready, so it can be enjoyed for its fruitiness now, but it will also age and can be drunk until 2023.
title: Domaine de Briante 2016  Brouilly

description: Produced from old vines, this wine is dense and well structured. Tannins march with the black fruits and dense dry core to give richness and fullness. Drink this wine from late 2019.
title: Domaine Romain Jambon 2016 Les Vieux Ceps  (Brouilly)

description: Powered by its tannins, this structured wine is still developing. It has ripe fruit as well as spice from wood aging. The richness is impressive and will give a generous wine from 2020.
title: Chateau de Pizay 2016 Les Sybarites  (Morgon)

description: This richly concentrated wine comes from a small parcel of 40-year-old vines. Its structure is matched by the ripe black fruits and intense acidity. Like any good wine from this appellation, it needs to age further.
title: Domaine Pral 2016  Moulin-A -Vent

description: Old vines and barrel aging give this wine a perfumed character. The top cuvee from this estate, it is rich and ageworthy. Ripe black fruits convey fragrance and spice. The wine needs to age further, so drink from 2020.
title: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2016 Reserve Louis Leyre-Loup  (Fleurie)

description: Ripe cherry and red-berry flavors burst from the glass with this deliciously fruity wine. It has a soft texture and richness cut with acidity. This is a wine to savor from 2019.
title: Chateau de Poncie 2016 Le Pre Roi  (Fleurie)

description: This subtly perfumed wine has the smoothness that comes with wood aging. It is ripe with black-fruit flavors and generous tannins. Drink from 2019.
title: Chateau de Belleverne 2016 Cuvee Mandrin  (Chenas)

description: From 70-year-old vines, this limited-production wine comes from an estate that has been in the hands of the same family since 1619. Rich tannins and black-cherry fruits are lifted and given extra dimension by the wine's fresh edge. This bold, ripe wine will repay another year, so drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Joncy 2016  Morgon

description: A blend of a selection of grapes from across the estate, this wine is open, rich and ready to drink. Generous and juicy, the wine balances tannins, good acidity and great fruitiness.
title: Domaine Labruyere 2016 Coeur de Terroirs  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Named after the cherry tree in the vineyard, this wine is firm and solidly structured. It offers rich blackberry flavors and concentration. Produced from organically grown grapes, it has a good lift, ripeness and a still-young structure. Wait to drink until 2020.
title: Domaine Franck Besson 2016 Le Griottier  (Julienas)

description: This ripe, soft and jammy wine is immediately enjoyable. It has generous berry fruits, black plums and spice from the wood aging. Richness and a warm feel are lifted at the end by acidity. Drink the wine now.
title: Domaine Bertrand 2016 Pisse-Vieille  (Brouilly)

description: This perfumed wine is full of black fruits, with a firm core of tannins that will allow it to age. Its pure fruit flavors are enhanced by the structure, giving a tense character that will calm down. Drink from late 2019.
title: Domaine Joncy 2016  Regnie

description: This ripe, full wine has tannins and rich berry flavors. Dense texture and concentration partner with acidity and a fresher aftertaste.
title: Louis Tete 2016  Morgon

description: Ripe and structured, this rich wine offers fine tannins and forward berry fruits. The generous fruitiness and acidity balance a dry edge that gives the wine shape. Drink now.
title: Chateau des Loges 2016 Selection  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Though he'd rather be a musical genius, Jean-Franсois Reaud did wonders with this estate, in the family since 1904. Dense and full of tannins, it also offers ripe fruits. Its structure and density match the intensity of the fruit, meaning the wine has a great future. With a dense aftertaste, the wine will age, so drink from 2022.
title: Vignobles Gabriel and Co. 2016 Chateau Le Grand Moulin  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A structured wine from Denis Dubourdieu Domaines, this offers black fruits that are developing well. Rich, smoky, full of tannins and berry flavors, the wine is fleshy and well endowed. Drink from 2022.
title: Clos Floridene 2016  Graves

description: This perfume wine is rich in blackberry flavors. Its tannins are already well defined and in balance with the ripe fruitiness. This full, smoky wine has a great future. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau de Beau-Site 2016  Graves

description: Balanced and structured, this rich organic wine is generous and packed with black fruits. Concentration and layers of wood are all part of Jean-Franсois Reaud's fruity wine that will age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Les Aubiers 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: New wood and spice flavors show strongly in this structured wine from 50-year-old vines. It has plenty of spice and ripe blackberry fruits along with a firm aftertaste. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Moutin 2016  Graves

description: This wine from fifth-generation vigneron Jean-Michel Baudet is full of perfumed new wood and also plenty of ripe, black fruits, suggesting excellent potential. With structure and rich fruits, it is going to develop into a complex wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Ricaud 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine from Jean-Franсois Baudet is rich with fine tannins and ripe black fruits. Its structure and concentration are generous, while with 12 months in oak, the smoky black-currant fruit still gives freshness. The wine is now well integrated and will be ready from 2021.
title: Chateau Monconseil-Gazin 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine offers fine fruit, attractive acidity and touches of spice and dryness from the wood aging. It all hangs together, giving a wine that has a promising future as the tannins soften and the fruit asserts itself. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Venus 2016  Graves

description: This Jean-Franсois Reaud property offers a Merlot-dominant juicy, ripe wine that's packed with black-currant flavors. Acidity and firm tannins back up the fruitiness to give a wine with plenty of freshness and a crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Haut Sociondo 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Dark and dense, this wine has a serious amount of tannins. The fruit shows slowly but will come through over the next two or three years. Then, this will be a rich, concentrated wine with a bold structure and ripe fruit. Wait to drink this Palatin Guibert family wine until 2023.
title: Chateau Roquevieille 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Bold, ripe and full of generous flavors, this Guignard brothers' wine is already showing its great potential. Rich black fruits are full of promise, with supporting acidity and a backdrop of tannins. Drink this full wine from 2022.
title: Chateau d'Uza 2016  Graves

description: Spicy, smoky and with ripe 95% Merlot, this wine has potential. Its structure is still important while allowing room for the fruitiness and acidity that are developing. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau du Cros 2016 Les Coteaux de Lou  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Big tannins come equally from ripe black fruits and from limestone rock in the Vignobles Gabriel vineyards. This wine has a good future but needs time. Drink Patricia Aroldi's powerful, dense biodynamic wine from 2022.
title: Chateau Rochers Bellevue 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Dark, dense and bold, this organic wine has the potential for richness as well as structure. The blackberry fruits are readying to come forward as the tannins soften. The wine should be ready from 2022.
title: Chateau l'Avocat 2016  Graves

description: Ripe, rich and juicy, this is a full, warm and rounded wine. Fine tannins are layered with plenty of acidity and berry flavors. Spice comes through to fill out this ripe wine. Drink from 2021.
title: Les Vignerons d'Alliance Bourg 2016 Grand Bourgeau  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This dense Denis Lafon wine is packed with tannins and also with juicy, ripe Merlot fruit, offering the potential for aging. Black-currant flavors are laced through the firm structure and the serious tannins. It has a good future after 12 months in wood, some of it new. The wine's structure is still firm and the wine will gradually open out. Drink from 2020.
title: Chateau Gardut Haut Cluzeau 2016 Cuvee Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Sean and Nicola Allison's full-bodied, ripe, organic wine with fine tannins and dark black fruits will develop well. It is a big wine, packed with tannins and fruit. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau du Seuil 2016  Graves

description: Aged in tank, this ripe, fruity wine is packed with red-berry flavors. Ripe tannins support the fruitiness and acidity. It's an attractive wine that will develop relatively quickly. Drink from 2020.
title: Chateau Bellerives Dubois 2016 Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Jean-Michel Bergeron's wine is developing well, showing ripe fruits, wood flavors and some tannins. It offers red-berry flavors, spice and a core of dryness that will allow it to age further. Drink this wine from Vignobles Gabriel from 2021.
title: Vignobles Gabriel and Co. 2016 Chateau Haut La Valette  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This juicy, smoky wine from a chateau that's an historic monument has good potential. Its richness is balanced by the acidity and the firm tannins that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Vieux Chateau Gaubert 2016  Graves

description: This smoky, ripe wine from the seventh generation of Medevilles is full of red fruits and balanced tannins. It conveys a juicy character from the open fruitiness and acidity. Drink this attractive wine from 2021.
title: Chateau Puy Boyrein 2016  Graves

description: This comes from a single vineyard facing southeast across the Saone Valley. Ripe tannins and great concentration are balanced by opulent, spicy fruit and wonderful richness. The wine is just approaching maturity and will benefit from further aging. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau du Moulin-A -Vent 2015 La Rochelle  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Beautifully wood aged, this perfumed wine is rich and elegant. It comes from a single vineyard on the estate, offering a fine line in tannins as well as great black fruits. The wine has weight along with presence and style. Drink from 2020.
title: Chateau du Moulin-A -Vent 2015 Les Verillats  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: From a parcel within one of the top vineyards in Moulin-A -Vent, this wine has weight and spiciness from the wood aging. Its tannins, still young, give both structure and emphasize the richness of the fruit. It provides a fine example of the aging ability of great Beaujolais and will probably not be ready until 2020.
title: Chateau du Moulin-A -Vent 2015 Champ de Cour  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Aged for two years in old barrels, this wine has rich tannins as well as blackberry flavors. With a firm structure still developing, it is still a young wine, packed with fruit and with crisp acidity at the end.
title: Domaine Fond Moiroux 2015  Moulin-A -Vent

description: The nose is subtle on this elegant Syrah but the palate opens gradually to introduce layer upon layer of silky, sun-kissed blackberry and plum flavors. It's ripe but restrained, muted by a granitic mineral tone and crisp red-currant acidity. The long finish lingers on fine, framing tannins. Ready now it should improve through 2025, hold further.
title: E. Guigal 2015  Crozes-Hermitage

description: From 60- to 80-year-old vines, this is a concentrated wine. It is rich with fruits that are moving into a more mature phase, while still preserving structure and tannins. This powerful wine needs a few more months, so drink from late 2019.
title: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2015 Les Burdelines  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Aged for six months in large barrels, this elegantly structured wine offers perfumed ripe fruits and rich tannins. Juicy black fruits and acidity are well balanced by the structure of the wine that is now well integrated. Drink now.
title: Domaine du Mont Verrier 2015  Fleurie

description: An excellent value for such an elegant wine, this medium-bodied Syrah offers pert blackberry flavor edged by layers of crushed stone and earth. It's pristine in fruit yet lingers with mineral intensity and fine, slightly sandpapered tannins.
title: Arnoux & Fils 2015 Chapelle-St-Arnoux  (Crozes-Hermitage)

description: This smooth wine from a ripe vintage is now mature. With a perfumed character as well as generous black fruits, it is open and rounded, with a crisp edge of acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Domaine du Clos des Garands 2015 Les Garants Vieilles Vignes  (Fleurie)

description: While this wine is initially juicy, its structure shows later, coming from behind to give tannins and weight to the black-fruit flavors. It is now fully balanced, rich and fruity.
title: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2015  Fleurie

description: Plump blackberry and bramble on the nose introduce a pristine black-fruited palate in this medium-bodied Syrah. It's an elegant but easy-drinking example of Crozes-Hermitage at a very reasonable price. Enjoy now - 2025.
title: Michel Picard 2015 Remy Ferbras  (Crozes-Hermitage)

description: A touch of wood aging has lifted this rich wine and added spice and acidity to the berry flavors. A single-parcel wine, it is full of fruit and final freshness.
title: Domaine Bertrand 2015 Les Petits Bois  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Made from 70% Syrah and 30% Grenache, this rich, meaty wine juxtaposes rich black-cherry and plum flavors against layers of charcuterie, coffee grinds and bramble. It's plump and mouthcoating, enveloped in fine, easy tannins offset by welcome briskness on the finish. Enjoy now - 2021.
title: Tortoise Creek 2015 Le Charmel Red (Costieres de Nimes)

description: This rich wine is cut with acidity. It is structured although now ready to drink. Ripe, juicy and tannic, it has layers of spice, licorice and a bright aftertaste.
title: Domaine du Clos des Garands 2015 Tradition  (Fleurie)

description: From vines on the slopes of Mont Brouilly, this wine has some texture while at three years old it is ready to drink. Juicy cherry flavors predominate, tempered by acidity and a touch of tannin. Drink now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Cote de Brouilly)

description: From vines owned by the Aubert family in Castillon, this blend of 85% Cabernet Sauvignon and 15% Merlot is ripe and full of black-currant fruits. Firm tannins allied to the toastiness from wood aging leave a mix of spice, a dry core and rich flavors. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Hyot 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: An unusual blend for the Medoc of Merlot and Cabernet Franc, this wine comes from a Rothschild vineyard next door to its Chateau Clarke. The wine is balanced, richly perfumed and spicy with swathes of black-currant fruit and ripe tannins. Developing slowly, the wine needs some time. Drink from 2023.
title: Chateau Malmaison 2015  Moulis-en-Medoc

description: A blend of ripe, unctuous Semillon with some crisper Sauvignon Blanc has given a honeyed, candied-fruit-flavored wine. It is really rich while still having the essential acidity. Drink the wine now, but it will be better from 2020.
title: Chateau Kalian 2015  Monbazillac

description: Dried garrigue, smoky granite and bramble lend an earthen tone to ripe but restrained black plum and cassis in this medium-bodied Syrah. It's still a bit closed and angular. Drink 2020 - 2030.
title: Maison Denuziere 2014 Les Hauts Lieux  (Cote Rotie)

description: Still with its tannins in place, this wine also has fresh, perfumed fruits. The two are coming into balance to reveal a wine packed with berry fruitiness and red-cherry acidity. Drink the wine now.
title: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2014 Reserve Louis Leyre-Loup  (Fleurie)

description: This wine tastes mature. Its fruit has changed into secondary flavors with undergrowth and mushrooms coming through the dryness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Fond Moiroux 2013  Moulin-A -Vent

description: Beautifully structured, with black fruits still showing through the tannins, this intense, fresh wine is approaching maturity. Its pure line of fruit, now tempered by the hint of secondary flavors, means this wine is ready to drink.
title: Domaine Fond Moiroux 2011  Moulin-A -Vent

description: From a 22-acre estate, this richly structured wine shows some mature tarry flavors as well as delicious black fruits that have integrated with time. This special cuvee is now ready to drink.
title: Domaine Fond Moiroux 2011 Gros Vosges  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Partly oak aged, this wine has great richness and dense tannins. Coming from one of the top sites in Morgon, it benefits from the blue granite that brings out the minerality of the wine. Solid and concentrated, it will age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Guenael Jambon 2017 Cote de Py Reserve  (Morgon)

description: Coming from the far north of Beaujolais, this wine has the typical structure and solid tannins. They mask the promise of the black-cherry fruits that will soon burst through. Then it will be a perfumed, ripe wine with great structure and potential. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine du Breuil 2017  Saint-Amour

description: This single-parcel wine, aged for seven months before bottling, is still young. Red fruits and ripe tannins are integrating with the fresher acidity to promise a wine that will have density as well as attractive juiciness. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine des Chers 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: This 69-acre estate has four separate parcels, including one in the famed La Madonne vineyard. The wine is packed with tannins and with aromatic fruit, richly structured and with a good future. Drink this balanced wine from 2020.
title: Jean Loron 2017 Chateau de Fleurie  (Fleurie)

description: This juicy, perfumed wine also has rich tannins, spice from wood aging and great acidity. It is a ripe wine, generous with black fruits and the structured potential to age.
title: Domaine Chasselay 2017 Chardignon  (Cote de Brouilly)

description: Firm tannins and a solid structure befit a wine from this northern of the Beaujolais crus. Its weight shows the potential of the black fruits. Offering structure and acidity, this wine will age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Pardon et Fils 2017 Les Mouilles  (Julienas)

description: The granite soil shows strongly in this terroir-driven wine. Lees aging also gives extra intensity to the concentrated black-cherry fruits. Acidity and a fresher aftertaste complete the wine, balancing crunchiness with richness. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine de Colette 2017 Le Mont  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Named after the parcel of vines from which it comes, this dense, concentrated wine packs tannins, acidity and black fruit. Wood aging has given this wine a ripe, smooth texture that balances well with the tannins. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine les Capreoles 2017 Sous la Croix  (Regnie)

description: Selected from several parcels of old vines, this wine is rich in tannins and red-berry flavors. Minerality and structure are prominent at this young stage. With time, they will bring weight and concentration to this ageworthy wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine des Chers 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Julienas)

description: This brother-and-sister team has produced a rich, complex wine, packing tannins and ripe berry fruits into an already delicious package. The wine has a juicy blackberry character, structured while never losing sight of the fruitiness.
title: Claire & Fabien Chasselay 2017 L'Heronde  (Cote de Brouilly)

description: This rich wine offers a dense black-fruit flavor that sits on firm tannins. The juicy acidity and fruitiness are still up front and need to calm down in order to give this wine its ripe character. Drink from 2020.
title: Chateau de Saint-Amour 2017  Saint-Amour

description: Named after the vineyard, this wood-aged wine is rich and impressive. Great white fruits, ripe acidity and touches of toast are cut with acidity.
title: Domaine Chasselay 2017 Eparcieux  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: A rich and structured wine, this has powerful red-cherry flavors as well as a firm substrate of tannins. These two rich elements will allow this dense wine to age. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine des Chers 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Saint-Amour)

description: Fresh tangerine, lemon and white peach abound from nose to finish in this unusually zesty blend of six traditional Rhone grape varieties. It's a bit puckering on the palate but the citrus flavors are refreshing. The finish is moderately long. Enjoy now - 2021.
title: RhoneA 2017 Fontimple White (Vacqueyras)

description: This is a fresh, pretty wine made from a blend of Clairette, Grenache Blanc and Roussanne. The nose offers inviting whiffs of orange blossom and grapefruit. Aged partially in French oak, it's silky in texture and has a rounded acidity and richness of body that's pleasing. Enjoy now - 2022.
title: Domaine la Fourmone 2017 Le Fleurantine White (Vacqueyras)

description: Sixty-year-old vines provide an impressive legacy, giving this wine richness and a juicy black-fruit character. It has tannins, not overpowering but enough to power the wine to a rich future. Drink from late 2019.
title: Domaines Chermette 2017 Pierreux  (Brouilly)

description: The most northerly of the Beaujolais cru villages has produced a richly structured wine, firm with tannins as well as bright red-berry fruits. It has density cut with intense acidity that will soften over the next few months.
title: Domaines Chermette 2017 Les Champs-Grilles  (Saint-Amour)

description: Aged in neutral cement tanks, this wine is all about rich black fruits and tannins. It is ripe and dense, with layers of spice, black cherries and acidity. The wine will develop much further, so drink from 2021.
title: Domaine de Colette 2017 Charme  (Morgon)

description: Attractively perfumed, this wine is also richly structured. It is young, with a good future ahead of it. Rich black-cherry flavors are lifted by acidity and firmly structured with dark tannins. It is worth waiting for and will be best drunk from 2020.
title: Domaine Baron de l'Ecluse 2017 Les Garances  (Cote de Brouilly)

description: Fresh red fruits and soft tannins give this wine an easy, attractive character. There is some backbone to balance the ripe berry flavors and acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Lafayette 2017  Brouilly

description: Bottled without sulfites, this juicy wine with hints of overripe cherries is also structured. The clean, rich red-cherry and red-berry flavors are cut with intense acidity. Drink the wine from 2021.
title: Domaine Guenael Jambon 2017 Cote de Py Nature  (Morgon)

description: A blend of several parcels of vines, this wine is named after the pink granite that forms the subsoil of much of the appellation. Its structure and firm tannins indicate the aging ability of this still-young wine. As it matures, the ripe fruits will develop well. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2017 Terres Roses  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: This wine is initially austere, with more acidity than fruit. Red-berry flavors reveal themselves slowly through the tannins and the touch of spice from wood aging. The wine should be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Domaine les Capreoles 2017 Chamodere  (Regnie)

description: Richly structured, packed with tannins as well as fruit, this is a complex wine for this appellation. Enticing red fruits entwine with the dry tannins, while being lifted with acidity.
title: Domaine de Colette 2017 Coteaux de Colette  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: A touch of sweet beetroot flavor lends earthiness to otherwise forward, plummy blackberry and cherry flavors in this wine. Moderately full bodied, it's framed by fine, easy tannins. Enjoy this juicy, brightly concentrated wine now through 2021.
title: Leon Perdigal 2017 Red (Cotes du Rhone)

description: This soft, fruity wine is packed with red-cherry flavors and easy acidity. There is a light dusting of tannin, although this wine is really all about fruit.
title: Louis Dailly Fondateur 2017  Saint-Amour

description: This fruity wine has an edge of minerality that contrasts with the ripe, white stone fruits. The wine has richness as well as acidity, with a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2017  Beaujolais Blanc

description: Delicate yellow-apple and pear notes have a waxy tinge in this dry, full-bodied white. It's rich and mouthfilling in texture, with a moderate concentration of apple and tangerine flavors. Soft and rounded in acidity, it gains structure from a pleasant bite of bitterness on the finish. Enjoy now - 2022.
title: Arnoux & Fils 2017 Vieux Clocher White (Vacqueyras)

description: Lightly structured and rich, this wine offers touches of spice as well as blackberry fruits. Its tannins will allow it to age, although it is already delicious. Drink now.
title: Domaine du Mont Verrier 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

description: The vines in question are 70-years-old, giving this wine its ripe concentration. It has plenty of structure as well as a ripe perfume that adds complexity. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Baron de l'Ecluse 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Cote de Brouilly)

description: This simple, red-cherry-flavored wine has attractive freshness along with the touch of spice. Drink immediately.
title: Le Pere la Grolle 2017 100% Bouchons 100% Machons  (Beaujolais)

description: This fresh wine offers plenty of acidity as well as open red fruits. It shows some richness although the emphasis is on brightness and a crisp aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Chateau de la Terriere 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: This wine has both tannins and ripe black fruits, With its richness, structure and acidity, the wine is still developing. Drink from late 2019 when the tannins will have softened.
title: Mommessin 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais-Villages)

description: Pale in color but rich in taste, this is a softly textured, ripe wine. Red fruits and plenty of acidity provide the fresher side of the wine's full character. Drink now.
title: Domaines Chermette 2017 Griotttes Rose (Beaujolais Rose)

description: This wine comes from the southern part of Beaujolais in the area known as Pierres Dorees, or golden stones, from the color of the houses. It is a bright wine with attractive black fruits and plenty of acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine Duperray 2017 Grains de Gamay  (Beaujolais)

description: Notes of pear and green banana are crisp and demure on the nose of this dry, medium-bodied blend of Clairette and Bourboulenc. The palate is a bit savory, offering more earth and mineral than fresh fruit but its mineral freshness is pleasant. Drink now.
title: Domaine de la Verde 2017 Odyssey White (Vacqueyras)

description: Spice aromas lead to a wine that shows touches of new French-oak aging that adds to the richness of the ripe green plums and acidity. A lightly structured wine from hillside vines bordering the Gironde Estuary, it will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Chateau Haut Grelot 2017 Selection  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Spicy and fruity, this lightly toasty wine also has a tangy character that shows structure. The wine's texture suggests it needs to age, so drink from 2020.
title: Chateau Moutin 2017  Graves

description: This crisp wine offers tangy acidity and a bright texture. Its fruitiness is still developing, highlighting the apple and citrus flavors. Wait to drink this wine until mid 2019.
title: Chateau Simon 2017  Graves

description: A grassy blend of Semillon with a touch of Sauvignon Blanc, this is an intense wine. Its concentrated white and citrus fruits are still young and up front. As they settle down, the wine will be fruity and attractive. Drink from 2019.
title: Chateau Kalian 2017 White (Bergerac Sec)

description: Perfumed notes of violet and wild thyme introduce the penetrating black-cherry and plum flavors of this wine. It's bristling and vibrant, darkened by shades of bramble and garrigue. Concentrated and held upright by fine, firm tannins, it's already lovely but should improve through 2035 and hold further.
title: Delas Freres 2016 Seigneur De Maugiron  (Cote Rotie)

description: This single-vineyard wine is dense and firmly structured. Bold tannins and rich black fruits are developing well although remain very young. The structure and dense texture show the potential of the appellation. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Chateau des Jacques 2016 Clos du Grand Carquelin  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: In this full and rich wine, great tannins ride under the black fruits. The wine has structure as well as the fruit of the vintage, suggesting good potential for aging. Drink this well-structured wine from 2020.
title: Chateau Bonnet 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Julienas)

description: Grown in the Le Chateau single vineyard, this wine is structured and firm, with dense tannins and bold black fruits. It also has juicy acidity and black-currant fruitiness that are showing well against the structure. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Robert Perroud 2016 La Fournaise du Perou  (Cote de Brouilly)

description: This small parcel, under two acres, is still planted with low-yielding, century-old vines. Its density and richness are impressive. This is enhanced by the wood aging that adds spice as well as hints of toast to the ripe black fruits. With this concentration, the wine needs time and shouldn't be drunk before 2020.
title: Domaines Laurent Perrachon & Fils 2016 Les Vignes Centenaires  (Julienas)

description: Hints of toast and pressed yellow apple on the nose gain concentration on the palate of this full-bodied blend of Grenache Blanc, Marsanne and Roussanne. It's a ripe, rich white with sunny apple flavors accented by touches of spice and cashew. Salty mineral notes lend freshness to a long, elegant finish. Enjoy now - 2022.
title: Domaine Fontaine du Clos 2016 Castillon White (Vacqueyras)

description: Wafts of vanilla, spice and toast accent ripe but slightly muted yellow peach and tangerine flavors in this oak-aged wine. Made predominantly from Clairette and smaller proportions of Roussanne and Viogner, it's full bodied and richly styled. It appeals to lovers of lavishly oaked wines but maintains balance and elegance. Enjoy now - 2023.
title: Le Clos des Cazaux 2016 Vieilles Vignes White (Vacqueyras)

description: Wood aging has given spice to this rich, structured wine. Tannins and generous black fruits show through the still-young structure. This powerful wine, from one of the top vineyards in Morgon, will age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Laurent Gauthier 2016 Vieilles Vignes Cote du Py  (Morgon)

description: Fifty-year-old vines create the basis of this ripe, concentrated wine. Big tannins and juicy berry flavors are lifted by freshness at the end. This rich wine will age. Drink from 2020.
title: Chateau Bonnet 2016 Cote de Besset  (Saint-Amour)

description: Blossomy yet elegantly restrained, this Grenache-Blanc-dominant blend offers white peach and apricot flavors shaded by salt and mineral tones. It's a soft, easy-drinking wine with a refreshing finish. Enjoy now through 2020 for its youthful appeal.
title: Chateau Lestours Clocher 2016 Les Penitents White (Vacqueyras)

description: Fine tannins support the rich black fruits of this wine. Solid and dense, it's full of dark berries, ripe tannins and good potential. Drink this full, firm wine from 2020.
title: Chateau Bonnet 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Chenas)

description: A rich and ripe wine that is both perfumed and structured, this shows a good balance between fruit and tannins. Aged partly in wood, the wine has a touch of spice along with the black fruits and finishing acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Chateau des Jacques 2016  Moulin-A -Vent

description: This richly structured wine has firm tannins as well as great swathes of juicy black fruits. Its richness is balanced by the acidity and the dry core that will allow the wine to age.
designation: Charlotte et Pierre-Yves Perrachon Vieilles Vignes
title: Chateau Bonnet 2016 Charlotte et Pierre-Yves Perrachon Vieilles Vignes  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Faint hints of granite and dried thyme lend some complexity to this plush, smoothly edged red. Blackberry-preserve and mulberry flavors are rich and spicy, falling softly on the palate with yielding acidity and ripe, easy tannins. Enjoy this full-bodied, luscious sip now through 2022.
title: Domaine de Chateaumar 2016 Cuvee Vincent Selection Syrah (Cotes du Rhone)

description: Inviting black-cherry and plum flavors are nuanced by layers of bramble, garrigue and forest floor in this impeccably balanced wine. Black-fruit characteristics are ripe and pristine, finishing on fine-grained tannins and a peppering of sweet anise. It's a fantastic value to enjoy now through 2021.
title: Famille Perrin 2016 Red (Cotes du Rhone Villages)

description: Grown on a mix of granite and chalk soils, this perfumed wine with ripe yellow fruits has richness as well as a mineral texture. Fruitiness makes the wine immediately attractive. Drink now.
title: Domaines Chermette 2016 Collonge  (Beaujolais Blanc)

description: Hints of honey and fresh hay accent yellow-apple and pear flavors in this plump, full-bodied white. A blend of Roussanne, Grenache Blanc and Clairette, it's a softly textured wine with a lingering cashew finish. Enjoy now - 2021.
title: Domaine la Monardiere 2016 Galejade White (Vacqueyras)

description: Delicate spice tones accent broad yellow apple and lemon flavors in this soft, silky blend of Grenache Blanc, Roussanne, Clairette and Viognier. Integrated but fresh acidity accentuates its warm, rounded feel. Enjoy now - 2020.
title: Domaine de Galuval 2016 L'Olivier White (Cairanne)

description: Spicy and with a great balance between the tannins and red fruits, this wine shows both weight and plenty of freshness. Its structure promises aging while its hand-picked fruit is already attractive. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau La Caussade 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Still very dry and closed up, this hand-picked wine holds promise in its weight. Dark tannins dominate, masking hints of black fruits and rich berries. The wine, produced by Denis Dubourdieu Domaines, needs time, so wait until 2022.
title: Chateau Haura 2016  Graves

description: This wine from Sophie Holzberg has fine tannins, rich fruit and excellent potential. Its solid structure and concentration indicate the richness and density of the vintage. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Franc-Cardinal 2016  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This special reserve from Belcier has both structure and attractive black fruits. Its tannins and concentration suggest aging potential. The blend of 59% Merlot, 30% Malbec and 11% Cabernet Franc in all-new oak propose a solid future. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau de Belcier 2016 Le Pin de Belcier  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The balance between tannins and dark black fruits has given an elegant wine, dominated by the black-currant flavors of Cabernet Sauvignon. This wine needs to age further, so drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Anthonic 2016  Moulis-en-Medoc

description: Layers of wood in this old-vines wine from Christophe Lavau are balanced by ripe black-plum and berry fruits. Concentrated and dense, this 90% Merlot has a rich texture. Drink this ripe wine from 2022.
title: Lavau 2016 Chateau Terrasson Cuvee Prevenche  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Dense with tannins, this wine has power and concentration. The tannins are generously paired with rich fruits and acidity. These elements all point to a wine that needs time to mature and release its full power. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Les Bertrands 2016 Diamant Rouge  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Firm tannins and a dark, dense character make this wine from the Armand family, for the moment, all about structure. However, it has fruit weight and the hints of black currants will become stronger. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau La Rame 2016 La Charmille  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This perfumed wine offers rich tannins, layers of new-wood aging and plenty of spice. The black-currant fruits also show ripe potential. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Moutin 2016 Grande Cuvee  (Graves)

description: Rich, smoky and with ripe fruits, this is a powerful wine from vines bordering the Garonne river. Its tannins, swathes of blackberry and black-plum flavors and concentration all point to the need for aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau de Marsan 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine revels in its generous fruit and velvet tannins. It is juicy with black fruits and acidity. The structure has a dry core, but the wine's richness and ripe flavors are very much in charge. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Hourtin-Ducasse 2016  Haut-Medoc

description: This smoky, ripe and structured Gonfrier wine shows good potential, offering fine tannins and rich black fruits. Its structure, concentration and balance already show a wine that will have an excellent future. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Tanesse 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Rich and spicy, this offers ripe black-currant fruits. toast and plenty of crisp acidity. The wine is full in the mouth and has a good future. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Perron 2016  Graves

description: Structured, firm and with the potential of ripe fruits, this wine from Sainte-Foy's first vintage as a Cotes de Bordeaux is ready for aging. Aged in amphorae, it has weight, concentration and dark tannins. The black fruits from biodynamic vines are still waiting to come through what will be a rich wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Chateau Pre La Lande 2016 Terra Cotta  (Sainte-Foy Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This ripe wine offers new-wood mint and spice flavors as well as rich tannins. They are balanced by generous blackberry fruits and juicy acidity to give a full-bodied wine that will age well over the medium term. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Les Bertrands 2016 Nectar des Bertrands  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Winemaker Pierre Lanain and the Stephane Derenoncourt consultants blended a perfumed wine with rich tannins, weight and concentration. Warm and generous, it has ripe black fruits, juicy acidity and layers of spice and wood-aging flavors. Drink from 2022
title: Chateau des Fougeres 2016 Clos Montesquieu  (Graves)

description: Named after the owner's father, this richly structured wine has both berry fruits and ripe tannins. Firm where it needs to be, it is also generous in its blackberry flavors and acidity. The wine delivers a juicy aftertaste. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Berthenon 2016 Cuvee Henri  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Minty aromas suggest new wood and plenty of spice. The wood aging has given the wine a strongly toasty character that dominates the fruit. Allow time for the black-currant flavors to come through and balance the burnt toastiness. Drink from 2022 when it will be a balanced wine.
title: Chateau Berthenon 2016 Cuvee Chloe  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: At this stage, the wine just hints at a structured, firm future. Showing the power of the vintage and a dense texture, the black fruits should develop into a powerful wine. It needs to age, so wait until 2022.
title: Chateau de Birot 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: While this wine is dry, it already shows the potential balance from ripe black-currant flavors, generous acidity and fruit tannins. It will develop well, if slowly, and should be ready from 2022.
title: Chateau des Places 2016 Grand Vin  (Graves)

description: Guided by consultant Michel Rolland, this property has delivered a structured wine full of tannins. It also has piles of black fruits from its organic vineyard. Black currants, spice from wood aging and a core of dryness all point up the aging potential. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Suau 2016 Cadillac  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This Lesgourgues family wine has a structure that is right up front at this stage. Behind, though, are plenty of black fruits, warm tannins and acidity. It already shows signs of being a balanced wine and will be ready from 2022.
title: Chateau Haut Selve 2016  Graves

description: Dense, rich and still young , this wine has excellent potential. Firmly structured and full of blackberry fruits, it comes from the small village of By in the northern Medoc. It likely will ready from 2021.
title: Chateau Cailloux de By 2016  Medoc

description: Vignobles Ardoin's Merlot-dominated wine is well structured and full of fruits. The tannins and blackberry flavors are full bodied and integrated, giving richness and a fine future. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Cap Saint-Martin 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe and smoky, this concentrated wine offers fine tannins and rich acidity. It has density and layers of black fruits, including 5% Petit Verdot, and a rich potential. Let the wine mature and drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Baracan 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: With the same winemaking team as Chateau Latour-Martillac, this Kressmann family-owned property has produced a ripe, wood-aged wine that has solid tannins at this stage. Smoky wood and black-plum fruits are still developing. The wine has potential and should be ready from 2020.
title: Chateau Langlet 2016  Graves

description: This wine is dry, firm and has some dark concentration. It needs time for the tannins to balance with the rich blackberry fruits. Firm but with good potential, the wine from the Chombart family will be ready from 2021.
title: Chateau Lamothe de Haux 2016 Premiere Cuvee  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Argentine Alejandro Bulgheroni bought Suau in 2017 but it has been under Michel Rolland's direction, and organic, since 2014. This vintage shows layers of delicious blackberry fruits and dark, smoky tannins. Its weight, spice and density show well against the fruitiness. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Suau 2016 L'Artolie  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Perfumed with mint and wood flavors, this rich wine has tannins that show strongly against the red-fruit flavors. This suggests a wine that needs to age, so wait until 2020.
title: Chateau Pre La Lande 2016 Diane  (Sainte-Foy Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Ripe black fruits and rich tannins show the potential of this wine. It has power, layers of berry flavors and acidity, and a core of dryness. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Haut Dina 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Bold, ripe and rich, this is a concentrated wine. Its dark tannins have a smoky edge from the wood aging. It needs time. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Lacaussade Saint-Martin 2016 Trois Moulins  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Fresh, fruity and with crisp acidity, this wine is already approachable. It is bright with black-currant flavors that lift tannins that are giving a dry core. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Mayne Guyon 2016 Chateau Mayne Mazerolles  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Lavender and violet perfume extends from nose to finish in this aromatic Syrah. Black-plum and cherry flavors are juicy yet spry, balanced by crisp acidity and tangs of crushed granite. Ripe, fine tannins accentuate its supple style. Lovely already it should gain complexity well through 2030 and hold further.
title: Remi Niero 2015 Eminence  (Cote Rotie)

description: Aged in wood, stainless steel and cement tanks, this wine brings out spice as well as clean, perfumed fruit. It has weight and structure as befits a wine from this appellation and a tense tannic character that will allow it to age. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine du Granit 2015 Tradition  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: This Brouilly estate also has vines in the more northerly cru of Moulin-A -Vent. The rich and perfumed wine is in the warm, concentrated style of winemaker Lauren Frapin. It has weight, with dense black-cherry flavors along with mint and spice. Drink this full-bodied wine now and until 2023.
title: Domaine de Briante 2015  Moulin-A -Vent

description: Intensely ripe black-cherry and mulberry aromas are muted by shades of forest floor, porcini and dried violet in this full-bodied wine. The black fruit flavors are lavishly fruity but balanced by complexities of earth, leather and charcuterie. This inviting but stately wine should drink well through 2025.
title: Louis Bernard 2015  Gigondas

description: From a parcel of old vines, this wine is particularly rich and concentrated. It is full of tannins as well as black fruits with a rich texture. Firm, with hints of wood and spice, boosted by the firm tannins, this is a wine to age. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine de Briante 2015 Baronne  (Brouilly)

description: This wine is beautifully balanced, with rich tannins and great concentration. Ripe black fruits dominate the structure, giving it density that is enhanced by the wood aging. The aftertaste is balanced, juicy and ready to drink.
title: Chateau du Moulin-A -Vent 2015  Moulin-A -Vent

description: This 113-acre estate, now owned by the Henriot family of Champagne, has produced an intense and rich wine. Its acidity and dense black fruits are impressive and concentrated. The wine is ready to drink, although it will age further, certainly until 2024.
title: Chateau de Poncie 2015 Le Pre Roi  (Fleurie)

description: Touched by wood, and with plenty of spice as well as black-cherry flavors, this is a rich wine. Coming from this fine vintage, it has density and weight as well as layers of attractive, juicy fruit. Drink this wine now.
title: Domaine de Briante 2015  Brouilly

description: This vineyard is on the slope just below the famous windmill of Moulin-A -Vent. Bringing out both tannins and rich black plum and cherry fruits, the wood aging gives it a smooth texture as well as a touch of spice. This now-mature wine is ready to drink.
title: Colin Bourisset 2015 Domaine Bourisset  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: The vineyard for this wine is at the foot of the slope that leads up to the photogenic windmill of Moulin-A -Vent. It is a perfumed wine, full of blackberries and black cherries. Juicy and rich, the wine is reaching its maturity, so drink from early 2019.
title: Chateau de la Terriere 2015 Climat Le Moulin  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: This estate has belonged to the Edmond de Rothschild family since 1973. From one of the top performing properties in Listrac, this wine is well proportioned, rich and dense. It has weight but its main thrust is elegance, with stylish black-currant fruit, acidity and a dry core from the wood aging. The wine will age well and should not be drunk before 2023.
title: Chateau Clarke 2015  Listrac-Medoc

description: While this wine shows lots of wood flavors at this stage, it will soften. The wine also has ripe berry fruits, rich tannins and good acidity. Once these integrate, this will be a rich wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Les Vignerons de Tutiac 2015 L'Un dans l'Autre  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Owned by the Boissenot family, consultants to four of the five Bordeaux first growths, this estate produces classic Bordeaux. There's nothing flashy, but the wine offers rich tannins and layers of ripe black-currant fruit. It is ready to drink from 2020.
title: Chateau les Vimieres 2015  Haut-Medoc

description: This well-balanced, ripe wine is firmly full of tannins and rich with black fruits. Its concentration and acidity are layered with licorice and toast flavors, all suggesting the need for aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Hyot 2015 Reserve  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: With 90% Merlot, this Denis Lafon wine is ripe and jammy. It has a good structure, showing the wood aging strongly. Touches of licorice contrast with the big black-fruit flavors and dense texture. Drink the wine from 2020.
title: Chateau Gardut Haut Cluzeau 2015 La Revelation  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This well-balanced blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot offers black-currant flavors. Its tannins and firm, dry core promise aging. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau les Hauts de Gadet 2015  Haut-Medoc

description: This smooth, rich wine is well balanced, with a solid core of tannins supporting ripe blackberry fruits. The wine is still young, the tannins firm. But the balance is there and the wine will develop well. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Franc-Cardinal 2015  Francs Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This is an immediately attractive, ready-to-drink wine. Its soft tannins and bright fruit are already open. With berry flavors, ripe acidity and a generous, rich aftertaste, it is balanced, with great fruitiness at the end.
title: Chateau Crusquet de Lagarcie 2015  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A soft style of wine, this benefits from the ripe vintage. Its red fruits are rich and warm, with a hint of tannic structure and crisp acidity. It is not a wine for long-term aging, but will be very ready from 2020.
title: Chateau la Tuilerie 2015  Graves

description: This wine has great fruit and generous tannins that are now moving out of the initial dry stage and opening up. The wine is now ready to drink, full of juicy black fruit with a rounded texture. Drink now.
title: Chateau Renard Mondesir 2014  Fronsac

description: Now fully mature, this attractively perfumed wine is full of jammy berry fruits, mint and spice from wood aging. The wine is a blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, full in the mouth without being heavy. It is delicious to drink now.
title: Chateau Crusquet de Lagarcie 2012  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The granite soils of this great vineyard give intense minerality and structure to this wine. Black fruits shine through, built up by bright acidity and structured tannins. This will develop into a rich wine, concentrated while always having a fresh edge.
title: Mommessin 2017 Cote du Py  (Morgon)

description: A rich and tannic wine with a solid, dry core, this needs to be aged. Its concentration comes also from the ripe black fruits and acidity that are developing. All the elements give the wine impressive potential. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine de Roche-Guillon 2017  Moulin-A -Vent

description: One of the Duboeuf wines that is bottled at the estate, this is rich, spicy and full of ripe tannins. A dense black-fruit flavor suggests power which is accompanied by juicy acidity. Age this wine and drink from 2020.
title: Chateau des Capitans 2017 Estate Bottled  (Julienas)

description: An 11-acre vineyard in the northernmost of the Beaujolais cru villages is the source of this rich wine. It has structure, concentration, generous tannins and a fresh edge of acidity. The wine will benefit from some aging, so drink from 2019.
title: Clos de la Brosse 2017  Saint-Amour

description: This chateau with 13th-century origins is a magnificent estate now belonging to the Boisset family. The wine's ripe cherry flavors and density are matched by the generous tannins that lie behind the fruit. It is already smoothly textured and ready to drink.
title: Chateau de Pierreux 2017 Reserve du Chateau  (Brouilly)

description: A two-acre parcel forms the basis of this well-structured wine. Both fresh and rich, it has perfumed tannins as well as ripe black fruits and acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine les Capreoles 2017 L'Hydrophobe  (Brouilly)

description: This major Beaujolais negociant has produced a good example of the most northerly of the cru villages. Its structure and dense texture partner with ripe black fruits and solid, juicy berry flavors. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Mommessin 2017  Saint-Amour

description: While the wine has all the bright red fruits you would expect from this appellation, it also has a firmly tannic edge that will allow it to age. It is ripe with fruitiness and acidity to match.
title: Vins Descombe 2017 Florent Descombe  (Saint-Amour)

description: The Grillet family's organically grown wine shows delicious, pure flavors of jammy blackberries cut with acidity. It comes from old vines in one of Morgon's cru vineyards, giving both concentration and a mineral structure. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2017 Grands Cras  (Morgon)

description: A delicate layer of honeycomb lends waxiness to bright tones of tangerine and yellow apple in this full-bodied but crisply balanced wine. Broad and richly textured, it's edged by mineral tones. The finish is slightly warming. Enjoy now - 2020.
title: Ferraton Pere et Fils 2017 Samorens White (Cotes du Rhone)

description: Young vines are the backbone of this fruity, organically grown wine that offers red cherry and spice from wood aging. The wine is ripe, packed with fruitiness and smoky tannins. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2017 Les Charmes  (Morgon)

description: This well-structured wine offers tannins and sophisticated black-cherry fruits. Weight backs up the richness and mineral texture. Named after the stones in the soil, the wine is ready to drink while remaining firm.
title: Pardon et Fils 2017 Les Pierres  (Saint-Amour)

description: Intensely ripe blackberry and plum flavors are pristine and lip smacking in this fruit-forward yet elegant wine. Soft and plummy on the palate, it has a hint of granite minerality. Ripe, feathery tannins accentuate its rounded appeal. Enjoy now - 2021.
title: M. Chapoutier 2017 Belleruche Red (Cotes du Rhone)

description: Facing southeast, this vineyard is rich in sandstone and granite, giving weight and minerality to this wine. Black fruits show strongly, backed by acidity and tannins. All these elements suggest a wine that will age. Drink from 2020.
title: Jean Loron 2017 Domaine des Billards  (Saint-Amour)

description: Crushed stone and bright yellow apples introduce this full-bodied white blend. It's an elegant wine with a broad, satiny palate brightened by sunny tangerine acidity. A delicate bite of tea tannins marks the finish. Enjoy now - 2022.
title: M. Chapoutier 2017 Belleruche White (Cotes du Rhone)

description: Fresh yellow-apple and lemon-rind flavors are accented by touches of sweet spice and dried herbs in this softly textured, dry white blend. It's a moderately full-bodied, moderately concentrated wine with a rounded, plush palate. Enjoy now - 2021.
title: Domaine de la Brunely 2017 White (Vacqueyras)

description: This soft, fruity wine shows a touch of tannins as well as generous black fruits. It has acidity in a light structure along with plenty of brightness. Drink now.
title: Bouchard Aine & Fils 2017  Beaujolais-Villages

description: Glimmers of toast and sweet spice are integrated from nose to finish in this lavish white wine. Fermented and aged in new oak barrels, it's an opulent but elegantly balanced wine juxtaposing ripe yellow apple and pear flavors against layers of cream and honey. Soft acidity accentuates its plump, hedonistic style. Enjoyable now - 2026.
title: Domaine Brusset 2016 L'Esprit de Papet White (Cairanne)

description: This structured wine has layers of black fruits, rich tannins and spice. Wood aging and time in bottle have softened the ripe fruit and acidity to produce a dense, velvet-textured wine that has an open and a juicy finish. Drink now.
title: Chateau de Pierreux 2016 Grande Reserve  (Brouilly)

description: Finesse and delicacy prevail over power in this ripe yet freshly balanced wine. It's plummy and silken, with a lavishly floral flair, and framed by fine, firm tannins that linger on the finish. Approachable now it should hold well through 2028.
title: NewRhone Millesimes 2016 Romain Duvernay Red (Rasteau)

description: Whiffs of dried plum and violet perfume this fragrant blend of Grenache and Syrah. Succulent black-cherry and plum flavors are plush and forward but the midpalate offers freshness and tension, too. The wine is approachable already but should improve through 2028.
title: Lavau 2016 Red (Rasteau)

description: While ripe and concentrated, this full-bodied Grenache-dominant blend offers welcome restraint and freshness. Black-cherry and blackberry flavors are zesty and slightly puckering, softened by hints of anise and violet. Framed by fine, firm tannins, the wine should drink well from 2019 - 2026.
title: Domaine du Trapadis 2016 Les Cras Red (Rasteau)

description: Fruit from vines more than 50 years old have given this wine richness and density. Spice from wood aging and the acidity add a lift of freshness and extra complexity. This will be a fine wine as it ages. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2016 Reserve Louis Leyre-Loup  (Morgon)

description: Morgon's most famous vineyard is on a long, steep slope. It has produced this perfumed, ripe wine. The tannins are fully integrated into the fruit giving richness and leaving plenty of room for acidity. This wine could age further and will be better from 2021.
title: Chateau des Jacques 2016 Cote du Py  (Morgon)

description: Equal parts fruit and savory, this full-bodied red offers loads of pristinely ripe cherry and berry flavors offset by hints of soy sauce, earth and graphite. It's a silky, supple sip balanced by fresh mineral tones and ripe, integrated tannins. Ready now it should improve through 2026.
title: Remy Ferbras 2016 Terre de Mistral Red (Chateauneuf-du-Pape)

description: This well-priced Grenache-blend is buoyantly perfumed, offering loads of ripe black-cherry and blackberry notes shaded with thyme, wild mint and juniper. It's a rich and spicy sip with a long, juicy finish. Enjoy now - 2024.
title: Brotte 2016 Creation Grosset Red (Cairanne)

description: This flagship estate, owned by Beaune negociant Louis Jadot, has produced a wine with great intensity and structure. Partly wood aged, the blend of three vineyards is rich although with a strong streak of freshness and acidity. That, along with the tannins, suggests it could age. It will be better from late 2019.
title: Chateau des Jacques 2016  Morgon

description: Intensely ripe black-cherry flavor is shaded by hints of barnyard, bramble and garrigue in this well-priced wine. It's lush and open knit in fruit character but complex too. The long finish ends on fine-grained, velvety tannins. Enjoy now - 2022.
title: Louis Bernard 2016 Louis Red (Cotes du Rhone Villages)

description: Pristine, plummy black plum and cherry perfume this supple, silky red. Black-fruit flavors are bold in concentration but muted by hints of earth, dried herb and moss. It's an elegant, plush wine balanced by fresh acidity and fine, velvety tannins.
title: Pierre Henri Morel 2016 Signargues Red (Cotes du Rhone Villages)

description: Forward, fruity black-cherry and mulberry flavors are softly bundled in this comforting blend of Grenache and Syrah. It's a plush, moderately concentrated wine with fine, firm tannins. The open-knit style is approachable now but should hold well through 2023.
title: Domaine de Verquiere 2016 Red (Rasteau)

description: Elegant yet easy drinking, this spectacular value wine offers sumptuous black-cherry and plum flavors accented by earth, licorice and coffee notes. It's a concentrated, luscious wine with a warmly spiced finish and soft, feathery tannins. Enjoy now - 2021.
title: Les Dauphins 2016 Made with Organic Grapes Red (Cotes du Rhone Villages)

description: This wine's golden hue and slightly muted notes of yellow apple and quince already suggest a bit of maturation. Vinified without oak influence, it has a mineral transparency that's appealing even without primary fruit. It's a full-bodied, fleshy wine but pertly balanced. Enjoy now - 2020.
title: Chateau des Roques 2016 Cuvee Blanche White (Vacqueyras)

description: Notes of smoke and dark earth subside with aeration to reveal ripe, forward tones of blackberry and plum in this wine. Full bodied and silken, it's an easy-going, approachable red with soft tannins.
title: Domaine de l'Espigouette 2016 Latour Bel Air Red (Cotes du Rhone)

description: Initially quite closed and earthen, this wine has brighter whiffs of tangerine and honey that peek through with time and aeration. Made predominantly from Clairette and Roussanne along with smaller proportions of Bourboulenc and Viognier, it's a plump, juicy wine with pleasing flavors of lemon and yellow apple. Hints of sweet spice and cashew linger on the finish. Enjoy now - 2021.
title: Domaine de Montvac 2016 Melodine White (Vacqueyras)

description: Initially quite smoky and earthy on the nose, this full-bodied blend of 75% Clairette and 25% Grenache Blanc needs time and aeration to allow prettier notes of yellow apple and fresh quince to peek through. It's a rounded wine, with soft acidity and a salty minerality on the finish. Drink now - 2021.
title: Domaine de la Tourade 2016 Eva White (Vacqueyras)

description: From vines on the slopes of its castle, a witness to the 1453 end of the Hundred Years' War, this solid, concentrated wine has everything in the right place. It has the power of the vintage, showing firm tannins, rich black fruits and acidity. The wine will develop slowly and surely and should be ready from 2023.
title: Chateau Castegens 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This property belonged to the Le Rey family since the 1600s. The last descendant sold in 2016, making this the first vintage of new owners Peter Kwok, Philippe Lambrecht and Jean-Christophe Meyrou. This wine is already balanced, full of rich black-currant fruits and generous, structured tannins. The dry core of the wine will take time to soften, so wait until 2022.
title: Chateau le Rey 2016 Les Rocheuses  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The fifth-generation Filliatreaus are working the estate's Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon well. Bold tannins are balanced by rich blackberry flavors in this wine. The combination gives it a fine future, rich, concentrated and dense. Acidity at the end adds the necessary lift. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Beaumont Les Pierrieres 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The Carreau cousins, Nicolas and Sebastien, continue to make waves with this 2015 acquisition of the chateau. This balanced and structured wine spent six months in old oak barrels. Its blackberry fruits are ably assisted by the generous tannins and dry core. This rich wine will age well, ready to drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Le Cap 2016 Cuvee Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Harvested under the direction of the Dubourdieu sons, this smoky wine is ripe, full of rich juicy fruit as well as firm tannins. A layer of strong black fruits is balanced by acidity. This rich, deliciously fruity wine has a fine future. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Reynon 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe, dense and perfumed, this wine offers rich blackberry fruits and generous tannins. It is a structured wine, firm but with swathes of fruit. The estate has been owned by the Carreau family since 1832. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau L'Escadre 2016 Grande Reserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Big tannins don't hide the fruitiness of this ripe Merlot-dominated wine. It has concentration, a dark core of powerful tannins that bring out black-coffee accents. At the same time, rich blackberry flavors are right up there. Drink the Dominique Bessineau wine from 2022.
title: Chateau Cote Montpezat 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: While this wine has plenty of tannins, solid, dark fruits shine through the structure. Consultant Stephane Derenoncourt has created a powerful wine, with juicy black-currant fruits and a ripe, solid aftertaste. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Magdeleine Bouhou 2016 Grand Vin  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This firm and structured Merlot-based wine conveys a light touch of wood from older barrels. It is rich with tannins and fruit. The dry core surrounded by ripe blackberry fruits promises a rich future. Drink this well-structured wine from 2022.
title: Chateau les Petits Arnauds 2016 Cuvee Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This bold, ripe wine is full of delicious black fruits. It has plenty of tannins as well, but it is the fruit that shines, ripe, generous and with good acidity. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Chateau La Carelle 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This spicy wine is packed with black fruits and hints of wild thyme and mint, with swathes of juicy acidity and firm tannins. In a typical blend for Aix-en-Provence, it holds Cabernet Sauvignon as well as the more usual Grenache and Mourvedre. The wine is worth aging, so drink from 2020.
title: Chateau Calissanne 2016 Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This dark, structured wine with firm tannins has the potential for richness. That comes from the blackberry flavors that are coming through the dry structure. The fruit hints at juiciness as well as acidity. Drink this ageworthy wine from 2022.
title: Chateau Magdeleine Bouhou 2016 Boha  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a densely textured wine, packed with dark tannins as well as black fruits. It is concentrated, boasting the structure of the vintage. Blackberries vie with the firm structure, with both suggesting plenty of potential. Drink this Carreau wine from 2022.
title: Chateau la Croix Saint-Pierre 2016 Grande Reserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Spicy and structured, this wine has layers of firm tannins as well as plenty of ripe blackberry fruits. Oak aged for 12 months, it is already balanced, packed with fruitiness with the firm core giving a fine backup. Drink from 2020.
title: Chateau Haut Grelot 2016 Coteaux de Metheze  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A concentrated wine from the Pitray family, who fought in the American Revolution, this has bold tannins and the potential for rich fruit. A powerful wine, it shows plenty of spice as well as ripe black-currant flavors and acidity. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau de Pitray 2016 Premier Vin  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Part of the von Neipperg holdings, this ripe, perfumed wine is rich with tannins and and spice. Black fruits and acidity balance all this firmness to give a wine with delicious potential. Drink this generous Merlot-Cabernet Franc wine from 2021.
title: Chateau d'Aiguilhe 2016 Seigneurs d'Aiguilhe  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Ripe and balanced, this rich, structured, mostly Merlot wine offers fine tannins and layers of berry fruits. Concentrated and dense, the wine will develop well, with plenty of fruitiness as well as a firm structure. Drink this Vignobles Bayle Carreau wine from 2022.
title: Chateau Pardaillan 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Ripe and juicy, this fruity wine from an estate with a vibrant history from the 1700s has warmth and rich tannins. Merlot-dominated blackberry and black-plum fruits are allied to a tight structure that promises a fine future. This will age well, so drink from 2022.
title: Chateau de Belcier 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Richly balanced, this ripe, black-fruit -lavored wine has a good future. Its dark texture and generous tannins promise much, backed up by fresher acidity. Drink this Carreau wine from 2022.
title: Chateau Clairac 2016 Grande Reserve  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This rich, generous wine from a small vineyard has great black fruits as well as ripe tannins. While young, it has power and density to enhance the warm berry flavors. These will bulk up further to give a powerful wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Bonnange 2016 Le Clos de Bonnange  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This wine has ripe black fruits to go with its rich tannins. Planted to 90% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, the 22-acre vineyard has produced a wine with solid textures and juicy acidity that point up the weight of the fruit. Drink this generous, spicy wine from 2022.
title: Chateau Bonnange 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Layers of ripe fruits, rich and packed with red-berry flavors, give this wine concentration and an already delicious fruitiness. It is produced by Thierry Valette, whose family is prominent in Saint-Emilion. The fruit needs perhaps to calm down and fully integrate, so wait until 2021.
title: Clos Puy Arnaud 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux
