description: The second wine of Chateau de Belcier, this is a rich, juicy wine with great black fruits. It is already attractive, although the tannins promise aging potential. Its ripe structure and final acidity suggest it should age over the medium term, ready to drink from 2021.
title: Chateau de Belcier 2016 B de Belcier  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Wood aromas from aging for 12 months in barrels dominate this wine and the wood shows strongly on the palate. However, the berry flavors and acidity are also well placed to integrate with the wood and tannic structure. so the wine should age well. Drink this Vignobles Bayle Carreau wine from 2022.
title: Chateau Barbe 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Dark-chocolate flavors are happily balanced by ripe black fruits that give this wine weight. It has a good long-term future, with plenty of wood aging playing with the rich fruitiness. The wine is produced by Bordeaux-born Jean Lissague. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Grand Secret 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This wine named for a Santiago de Compostela pilgrim route is ripe and spicy. Its solid, dry core is balanced by the black fruit and concentration. With time, the wine will lighten up to showcase the rich fruits and good supporting structure. Wait until the wine matures, in 2022.
title: Chateau Cote Montpezat 2016 Compostelle  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: The black fruits of this wine are embedded in the dark, dense tannins and concentrated structure. With its weight and firm backdrop, the wine has aging potential. It started its maturing process in the Chombart family's unusual troglodytic cellars. Drink this rich wine from 2022.
title: Chateau Lamothe de Haux 2016 Valentine  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Firm tannins don't mask the berry fruits and acidity in this wine. It has a juicy, forward character backed by tannins.Touches of wood aging from the 12 months in barrel give a dry core. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Cone-Taillasson Sabourin 2016  Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The Dartier sister-and-brother team created a wine of rich fruit and minty aromas balanced by new wood and black fruit flavors. Harvested late in the season, as was typical for the vintage, it's a ripe wine that's fruity and juicy, yet structured and firm. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Cailleteau Bergeron 2016 Prestige  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Soft and fruity, this mainly Merlot wine is approachable already. Black-currant flavors and generous tannins work well together to give a juicy wine, full of acidity. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Clairac 2016 Cuvee Tradition  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This concentrated wine is firm with tannins and rich with black fruits and juicy acidity. The wine has great potential, but needs time. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Jouvente 2016 La Source de Jouvente  (Graves)

description: This richly perfumed wine is ripe with both tannins and concentrated blackberry fruits. From a 24-acre estate, it has weight, density and a good future. Drink this structured, juicy wine from 2021.
title: Chateau Le Cap 2016 Cuvee Excellence  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Diverse soils in this part of the Cadillac slope give a rich wine with fine tannins and bold ripe fruit. It is concentrated and packed with smoky wood and berry flavors. The wine shows excellent potential for the tannins and acidity to come together. Drink from 2021.
designation: Grand Vin de Chateau de Ricaud
title: Chateau de Ricaud 2016 Grand Vin de Chateau de Ricaud  (Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: From property in the Fauchey family since the 1880s, this wine is firm, tight with tannins at this stage. Hints of black fruits promise future balance. With a dense core, the wine will develop over the long term. Drink from 2020.
title: Chateau Paret 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This Gonfrier Freres wine is structured and firm, packed with tannins but with the fruit weight to balance. Black fruits and attractive acidity are the hallmarks of this rich wine. Let it age and drink from 2021.
title: Chateau de Lestiac 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Rich, structured and fruity, this second wine of Belcier is dense. Black fruits and acidity balance with the firm tannins and dry core. Drink this already balanced wine from 2021.
title: Chateau de Belcier 2016 Chateau de Monrecueil  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Black fruits give this wine a good shape and richness. Backed by dark licorice and coffee flavors from 12 months in new French oak, the wine offers both structure and ripe spice. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau la Baronnerie 2016 Grand Vin  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Alain Tourenne's wine has plenty of organic red fruits cut with acidity. Its structure is still developing but promises firm support for the fruitiness. The wine needs time to come together, so drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Beynat 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This rich wine is aged in old barrels for more than two years. Spice, mint and ripe perfumed black fruits come together in a wine that has weight, density and is just now becoming ready to drink.
title: Domaine Bertrand 2015 Infini  (Moulin-A -Vent)

description: Smoky tones of charcuterie and dried garrigue meld into ripe, luscious black plum and cassis here. A rich, densely concentrated Syrah, it's keenly balanced by crisp acidity and firm mineral tones. The finish is endless and unctuous, cushioned by sweet spice and silky, supple tannins. Gorgeous already it will only improve through 2027 and hold further.
title: Delas Freres 2015 La Landonne  (Cote Rotie)

description: Plump blackberry and cherry flavors are tinged with dried lavender and thyme in this rich, intensely fruity Grenache-Syrah blend. A whisper of sweet spice lends opulence to the palate but fresh acidity and ripe, gripping tannins anchor the finish. It's ready now but should improve through 2025.
title: Domaine de Verquiere 2015 Cuvee 1928 Grenache-Syrah (Rasteau)

description: A rich wine from this ripe year, this has concentration from the 45-year-old vines and spice from the wood aging. It is packed with black fruits. The wine, with its fresh final fruitiness, will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Domaine de Leyre-Loup 2015 Reserve Louis Leyre-Loup  (Fleurie)

description: From a fine Beaujolais vintage, this organically grown wine is perfumed and still structured with its dark tannins. The density and richness are still developing, giving the wine its concentrated potential.
title: Domaine de la Bonne Tonne 2015 Cote du Py  (Morgon)

description: Black-plum and berry flavors are intensely ripe in this full-bodied Saint-Joseph. It's a concentrated, almost ruddy, wine freshened by tangy blackberry acidity and hints of granite and spice that linger on the finish. Tannins are fine-grained and integrated.
title: Delas Freres 2015 Les Challeys  (Saint-Joseph)

description: This ripe, still-young wine is full of tannins as well as rich Merlot fruit. Blackberries, black plums and some ripe tannins are all part of this dense wine. It needs to age until at least 2021 so be patient.
title: Chateau Renard Mondesir 2015  Fronsac

description: This generous wine is ripe with seductive black fruits and rich tannins. The Merlot gives this wine its juicy, jammy character absorbing the tannins like a sponge. It comes from red clay soil (Terres Rouges) that brings extra richness to this full-bodied wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Tour du Moulin 2015 Les Terres Rouges  (Fronsac)

description: This wine comes from a family-owned 19-acre property on the slopes of the Fronsac hill. The wine is still young and full of tannins. But it also offers classic stalky fruit, juicy acidity and plenty of black-currant flavors. Drink this wine with aging potential from 2022.
title: Chateau Belugue 2015  Fronsac

description: A ripe black-currant-flavored wine, this is smooth and dense. Maturing well with acidity and smoky wood flavors right up front, the wine is juicy, rich and will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Chateau de Monbadon 2015  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Made entierly from Merlot, this wine is smoothly textured, with tannins cushioned by the ample black fruits. With its blackberry flavors and dense texture, the wine will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Chateau Renard 2015  Fronsac

description: Intensely ripe black-cherry and cassis notes are shaded by dried mint, licorice and spice in this richly concentrated blend of 50% Syrah, 25% Carignan and 25% Mourvedre. A polished sip, it's framed by fine, feathery tannins and a long finish. The wine should improve through 2021 and hold a few years further.
title: Chateau d'Or et de Gueules 2014 Trassegum Red (Costieres de Nimes)

description: Earth and spice juxtapose delicate black-cherry flavor in this elegantly evolving wine. Tasted five years after bottling, it's already showing prominent notes of sandalwood and forest floor along with umami-rich notes of leather. Moderately full bodied and freshly balanced, it's a stately wine finishing on ripe, feathery tannins. Lovely now it should hold till 2023.
title: Domaine la Milliere 2013 Vieilles Vignes Red (Chateauneuf-du-Pape)

description: A blend of Syrah, Mourvedre and Cabernet Sauvignon, this single-vineyard, wood-aged wine is massive and impressive. Its weight comes both from the solid tannins and the juicy black-plum fruits. Rich and only just now mature, this is a powerful wine. Drink now, but, better, hold until 2020.
title: Chateau Calissanne 2013 Clos Victoire Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

description: This Prestige is deeper in concentration and more firmly composed than the producer's basic Rasteau bottling. Black-cherry and plum flavors are ripe and penetrating but pristine, almost crunchy. The tannins are firm and quite stalwart on the finish. This elegantly composed wine drinks well now but should improve through 2028.
title: Domaine la Soumade 2016 Cuvee Prestige Red (Rasteau)

description: This is a softer, more rounded wine than the producer's other Rasteau bottlings this vintage. Black-plum and cherry flavors are fleshy and ripe, muted by subtle earth tones and ripe, yielding tannins. Enjoy this approachable wine now - 2026.
title: Domaine la Soumade 2016 Cuvee Confiance Red (Rasteau)

description: While the nose of this Grenache-Syrah blend is more mineral than fruity, bright black-cherry and plum flavors are crisp on the palate. It's a full-bodied, supple wine framed by bold but chalky tannins. Ready now, it should improve through 2028.
title: Domaine Wilfried 2016 La Terre des Promesses Red (Rasteau)

description: The 37-acre vineyard, one of the cru's largest, is on the hill of Saint-Amour, close to the village church. It has produced a juicy wine, full of strawberry flavors and ripe acidity. Perfumed and textured, this wine is developing, but needs some time. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine de la Pirolette 2017  Saint-Amour

description: While Grenache is dominant, this robust, full-bodied rose is a blend of five traditional Rhone grapes. It's a complex wine boasting a core of concentrated raspberry and red-cherry flavors layered with sage, bramble and smoked meat. It's an excellent year-round accompaniment to light meals well through 2020.
title: Domaine de la Mordoree 2017 La Reine Des Bois  (Tavel)

description: Deep pink with an attractively dusky hue, this invigorating but sturdy rose can be enjoyed year round. Ripe but fresh red-cherry and raspberry flavors are nuanced by hints of bramble, dried garrigue and earth. This refreshing yet penetrating wine should drink well through 2020.
title: Domaine de la Mordoree 2017 La Dame Rousse  (Tavel)

description: The 22-acre vineyard belonging to the Duc family has given this rich, structured wine. While it has plenty of juicy acidity, the tannins are most marked at this young stage. The wine is dark, powerful, full of spice and pepper.
title: Domaine des Duc 2017  Saint-Amour

description: This full-bodied wine balances the richness of Grenache Blanc with the freshness of Clairette. Yellow-apple and apricot flavors are ripe but restrained, accented by hints of spice and vanilla from vinification in French oak. It's a rich, rounded sip with a slightly warming finish. Enjoy now - 2022.
title: Le Clos de Caveau 2017 Louis d'Or White (Vacqueyras)

description: Forward, fresh black-cherry and blueberry flavors abound in this plump, easy-drinking blend of Grenache, Syrah and Mourvedre. Full bodied and fleshy, it's an unabashedly ripe wine but maintains a touch of mineral restraint. Enjoy now - 2021.
title: Cave de Rasteau 2017 Ortas Tradition Red (Rasteau)

description: Vinified entirely in stainless steel, this full-bodied but fresh wine offers cutting apricot and lemon flavors. A blend of four traditional Rhone white grapes, it's a silky wine balanced by a crisp fruit character. Enjoy now through 2022.
title: Chateau des Roques 2017 Cuvee Blanche White (Vacqueyras)

description: Savory notes of dried thyme and sage accent crisp blackberry in this elegant Grenache-Syrah blend. It's freshly composed on the mid palate with very firm but chalky, grippy tannins on the finish. It should improve through 2026.
title: Domaine des Escaravailles 2016 La Ponce Red (Rasteau)

description: While the nose of this full-bodied blend of Grenache, Mourvedre, Syrah and Carignan is plush and plummy, the palate conveys surprising tension and verve. It's intensely ripe and concentrated but simultaneously crisp and finessed, boasting a bold mineral backbone. Tannins are fine yet persistent.
title: Ogier 2016 Helianthe Red (Rasteau)

description: Plush layers of preserved plum and cherry are speckled by darker tones of licorice, granite and dried earth in this plump, enveloping red. Full bodied and rippling like silk, it's a powerful yet open-knit wine with a soft, cocoa-powder finish. Enjoy now - 2023.
title: Domaine de la Mordoree 2016 La Dame Rousse Red (Lirac)

description: Dark spice, bramble and sun-dried garrigue juxtapose plush black cherry and plum in this rich, intensely fruity red. A blend of 80% Syrah and 20% Grenache, it's a dark, sultry sip that's deeply fruity yet earthen and savory too. The finish offers plush, easy tannins and a hint of leather.
title: Les Vignerons du Castelas 2016 Oak Barrel Selection Red (Cotes du Rhone Brezeme)

description: Anise and pepper spice this unctuous, silky blend of Grenache, Syrah, Mourvedre and Carignan. It's full bodied and thirst-quenchingly juicy, maintaining pert acidity on the midpalate. The finish lingers on soft, yielding tannins. Approachable now it should hold through 2024.
title: Brotte 2016 Domaine Grosset Red (Cairanne)

description: This shows elegant rusticity, with whiffs of leather, wet earth and smoke accenting intensely primary blackberry and plum flavors. A richly composed wine with a kick of angularity on the midpalate, it has fine-grained but grippy tannins marking the finish. Enjoy now - 2026.
title: Domaine Wilfried 2016 Red (Cairanne)

description: Whiffs of dried Mediterranean herbs and crushed earth lend nuance to this freshly concentrated Grenache-dominant blend. Its plum and black currant flavors are crisp and angular on the palate, edged by fine-grained but gripping tannins. Enjoy now - 2024.
title: Domaine la Soumade 2016 Red (Rasteau)

description: Restrained but ripe black-cherry and mulberry flavors have an intensely mineral, elegantly earthen quality in this full-bodied red. A blend of Grenache, Mourvedre, Syrah and Carignan, it's ripe and concentrated but not at all jammy. The midpalate is plump but briskly balanced and framed by firm, fine-grained tannins. Enjoy now - 2023.
title: Ogier 2016 Heritages Red (Rasteau)

description: Intensely ripe blackberry and cherry flavors are slightly muted in this plush, juicy blend of Grenache, Syrah and Mourvedre. It's a rounded but pertly balanced wine, with a fine-grained grip of tannins on the finish. Enjoy now - 2022.
title: Pierre Amadieu 2016 Les Hautes Rives Red (Cairanne)

description: Ripe blackberry and black-cherry flavors are peppered with sweet spice, licorice and cacao in this wine. Rounded and voluminous, it's lavished with prominent oak tones and soft, silky tannins. Enjoy this approachable wine now through 2024.
title: Lavau 2016 Domaine les Evigneaux Red (Rasteau)

description: Crisp black cherries are accented by anise and balsamic notes in this full-bodied blend of 90% Grenache and 10% Carignan. The black-fruit flavors are ripe but restrained, maintaining freshness on the midpalate. The finish is dampened by bold, dense tannins. It's ready now but should improve through 2026.
title: Domaine Wilfried 2016 Septentrion Red (Rasteau)

description: Forward and plush, this full-bodied red offers ripe, primary flavors of summer plum and preserved cherry nuanced by subtle hints of bramble, dried mushroom and earth. It's a juicy, easy-drinking wine that's freshly balanced and framed by fine, lingering tannins. Enjoy now - 2022.
title: Chateau de Segries 2016 Cuvee Reservee Red (Lirac)

description: A blend of 60% Grenache and 40% Syrah, this intensely primary, fruity wine bursts with a ripe black-cherry flavor. Not deeply concentrated, it's a juicy, lavish wine that's shaded by tones of licorice and sweet vanilla. Fresh acidic balance and soft, easy tannins cushion the finish.
title: Bieler Pere et Fils 2016 La Jassine Grenache-Syrah (Cotes du Rhone Villages)

description: Primary, juicy blackberry and black-cherry flavors dominate in this cheery, easy-drinking blend of 70% Grenache and 30% Syrah. It's a plush, brawny wine with concentrated but straightforward black-fruit flavors and a touch of warmth that lingers on the finish.
title: Domaine Guy Mousset 2016 Les Garrigues Red (Cotes du Rhone Villages)

description: Ripe and rich, with some firm tannins, this wood-aged wine has a good future. It offers plenty of black fruits backed by the structure and with a solid, juicy fruitiness at the end. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Brisson 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Bold tannins and ripe fruit are the hallmarks of this rich wine from the Nicolas Thienpont range. A solid structure backs up the ripe black-currant flavors. The wine will certainly age well, so wait until 2021.
title: Les Charmes Godard 2016 Chateau La Prade  (Francs Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This ripe, juicy wine offers balanced smoky wood-aging flavors. Pure black-currant flavors shine in this blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec from one of several Bruno Laporte properties. Drink this wine that has the power and the fruit intensity of the vintage from 2021.
title: Chateau de Clotte 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: This rich wine has spice, black fruits and plenty of tannins. Its density and weight are coming together well with the fruit and acidity. Drink the wine from 2022.
title: Les Charmes Godard 2016 Chateau Alcee  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Poised between tannins and dark fruit, with 20 months in oak, this ripe wine has touches of dark chocolate as well as layers of spice and wood aging. All that will change as the rich wine develops. Concentrated and dense, it needs aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Bel-Air 2016  Cadillac Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The rich black fruits in this wine from property in the Monteil family since the 15th century are full of promise. Dark tannins, spice and licorice balance the fruitiness, suggesting aging potential. Drink from 2021.
title: Chateau Brehat 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Structured and firm, this wine has weight and dense tannins. Black- coffee flavors hint at extraction although the ripe berry fruits act as a balance and contrast. This wine will take a while to develop, so wait until 2022.
title: Chateau Segonzac 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This smoky wine is packed with spicy wood-aging flavors. The fruit weight and the ripe blackberry flavors are beginning to develop and will balance out this full, rich wine. Drink this Jean-Franсois Meynard wine from 2022.
title: Chateau La Bourree 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: A richly textured wine full of black fruit and ripe tannins, this has power and a dense structure. It balances black-plum flavors laced with acidity with pepper and a juicy aftertaste. Drink this full-bodied wine from 2020.
title: Chateau le Peyrat 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: Structured and firm, this wine has excellent potential. Black fruits, solid tannins and plenty of acidity come through, underlining spice and a dark core. Drink from 2021.
title: Vignobles Arbo 2016 Chateau Godard Bellevue  (Francs Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Ripe, juicy blackberry and mulberry flavors are muted by darker shades of dried garrigue, bramble and earth in this bold but balanced Syrah. It's black-fruit flavors are luscious and youthful still, vibrantly edged with acidity and briskly textured tannins. Enjoyable now it should improve through 2035 and hold further.
title: Delas Freres 2015 Seigneur de Maugiron  (Cote Rotie)

description: Fleshy plums and supple, baby-soft tannins encapsulate this wine's luscious, rounded character. Black fruit flavors are a touch preserved on the palate, but accented by hints of dried sage, thyme and dark chocolate. Granite tones lend freshness and minerality to a lingering finish. Drink now - 2025.
title: Famille Perrin 2015 La Gille  (Gigondas)

description: Luscious describes this rich, palate-clinging Grenache. Black cherry and mulberry flavors are lavishly ripe but pristine, accented by sweet spice and chocolate. It's full bodied and unctuous yet freshly composed, fringed with fine, feathery tannins. Enjoy this forward but elegant wine now through 2025.
title: Arnoux & Fils 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Gigondas)

description: Elegant shards of granite and crushed mineral lend freshness to plump, juicy mulberry and plum in this wine. A deeply fruity, full-bodied blend of 80% Grenache and 20% Syrah, its plushness is framed by soft, easy tannins and a lingering cling of black fruit. It's an approachable yet satisfying wine neatly balancing fruit and earth, to enjoy now through 2023.
title: Pierre Amadieu 2015 Romane Machotte  (Gigondas)

description: Although this wine is initially smoky and earthen, aeration opens layers of ripe black plum, anise and pepper. It's a fleshy, supple wine that's seductive in texture. Soft, ripe tannins cushion the finish. Ready now it should hold through 2023.
title: Domaine de l'Espigouette 2015 Pas du Meunier Grenache-Mourvedre (Rasteau)

description: Fermented and aged in oak, this wine has solid tannins and rich black fruits. The wine is still very young, dry to the core but also with plenty of fruit potential as well as dark-coffee flavors. Drink from 2021.
designation: Arion by Chateau Moulin de Clotte
title: Chateau Moulin de Clotte 2015 Arion by Chateau Moulin de Clotte  (Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Unctuous and open knit yet surprisingly nuanced, this luscious blend of 95% Syrah and 5% Mourvedre offers loads of fleshy black-cherry and plum flavors offset by cinnamon, cocoa, dried mint and thyme. It's densely concentrated yet briskly balanced, finishing elegantly on a bite of fine-grained tannins.
title: Chateau de Nages 2014 JT Red (Costieres de Nimes)

description: Tasted five years after bottling, this wine still shows a core of dried strawberry and cherry flavor, but it's shaded by umami tones of balsamic, leather and mushroom. It's intoxicatingly rich on the palate but balanced freshly, edged by delicate tea tannins. This complex wine shows its savory side elegantly. It drinks well now but should hold till 2024.
title: Domaine du Pegau 2013 Cuvee Laurence Red (Chateauneuf-du-Pape)

description: Five years after bottling, this wine still offers loads of fresh, punchy blackberry and plum flavors. It's a bold, penetrating wine nuanced by hints of granite and wet earth. The fresh finish lingers on fine, integrated tannins. Lovely now it should improve further through 2022 and hold a few years longer.
title: Chateau du Trignon 2013 Grenache-Mourvedre (Rasteau)

description: Five years after bottling, this plump yet elegantly balanced wine continues to offer primary black-cherry and raspberry flavors with a textural cling. It's a pristinely fruity wine with supple, soft tannins that should improve through 2023 and hold further.
title: Clos Saint Michel 2013 Grand Vin Red (Chateauneuf-du-Pape)

description: Primary, intensely fleshy blackberry and plum flavors are shaded with milk chocolate and sweet spice in this unabashedly fruity, forward red. It's plush and easy on the palate, enveloped by the softest of tannins and finishing with a luscious cling. Enjoy now - 2020.
title: Mas Carlot 2013 Les Enfants Terribles Red (Costieres de Nimes)

description: Sunny raspberry and preserved strawberry are juicy and a touch candied in this blend of equal parts Grenache and Syrah. Full bodied in style, it's a bright, primary wine balanced by fresh acidity and ripe, finely edged tannins. Approachable now it should hold well through 2023.
title: Domaine des Coteaux des Travers 2016 Les Traves Grenache-Syrah (Rasteau)

description: Made entirely from Grenache, the Fleur de Confiance offers luscious mulberry and black-currant flavors muted by notes of crushed stone and dried herb. It's bold and silky yet held upright by ripe, persistent tannins. This decadent yet freshly composed wine should improve through 2026.
title: Domaine la Soumade 2016 Cuvee Fleur de Confiance Grenache (Rasteau)

description: Made from a blend of 75% white and 25% black Muscat a  petits grains, this light-footed vin doux naturel presents inviting whiffs of raspberry and caramel. Apricot, berry and white-blossom notes on the palate are concentrated and a touch candied in character. There's a tinge of alcoholic warmth throughout but this is a charmingly sweet and fruity tipple. Enjoy now - 2022.
title: Domaine des Bernardins 2017  Muscat de Beaumes de Venise

description: Crisp, sun-kissed cherry and wild-strawberry notes introduce this floral, perfumed wine. Made from predominantly old vines, it's intensely concentrated and forward in fruit yet shaded by hints of violet, lavender and bramble. This full-bodied, unctuous wine with fine, gripping tannins should improve through 2030 and hold further.
title: Alain Jaume et Fils 2016 Domaine Grand Veneur Vieilles Vignes Red (Chateauneuf-du-Pape)

description: Elegance and purity abound in this fragrant dessert wine. Aromas of white blossom, apricot and tangerine skin are charming and inviting. Flavors of honeysuckle and hibiscus nectar are concentrated and sweet, glazed with honey and a lingering glycerol cling. It's a fresh and sprightly sip with integrated alcohol and a long floral finish. Enjoy now - 2022.
title: Domaine de la Pigeade 2016  Muscat de Beaumes de Venise

description: Accents of toast, spice and nut lend nuance to intensely ripe black cherry and preserved strawberry in this opulent wine. It's boldly fruity yet savory, shaded by umami tones of balsamic vinegar, soy sauce and earth. This full-bodied, complex wine is ready now but could improve through 2026 and hold further.
title: Alain Jaume et Fils 2016 Domaine Grand Veneur Le Miocene Red (Chateauneuf-du-Pape)

description: Violet, lavender and black olive perfume this plump, full-bodied blend of Grenache, Mouvedre and Cinsault. On the palate, black-plum and cherry flavors are richly concentrated yet firmly structured with tight, fine-tipped tannins. This bold yet elegant wine should improve through 2026 and hold further.
title: Notre Dame des Pallieres 2016 Les Ribes Red (Rasteau)

description: Fleshy plum and black-cherry flavors are juxtaposed by dark shades of anise, crushed granite and sage in this bold, richly textured wine. Polished and penetrating, the wine is lifted by tangs of crushed mineral on the midpalate. It drinks beautifully now but should continue to improve through 2026.
title: Alain Jaume et Fils 2016 Domaine Du Clos de Sixte Red (Lirac)

description: Ripe black cherry and raspberry are accented by sweet spice and whiffs of banana bread in this Grenache-dominant red. Fine, feathery tannins mark the finish. Full bodied and opulent, it's already approachable but has enough concentration to improve through 2026 and hold further.
title: Pierre Henri Morel 2016 Red (Chateauneuf-du-Pape)

description: Violet and licorice candy lend spice and perfume to this plump, penetrating blend of Grenache, Syrah and Mourvedre. It's loaded with sun-kissed cherry flavor but shaded by umami notes of mushroom and leather too. Luscious but sleek, this polished wine is marked by fine, feathery tannins. Ready now it should improve through 2026.
title: Domaine de la Mordoree 2016 La Reine Des Bois Red (Lirac)

description: Pretty violet and pristine blackberry aromas are touched by crushed earth in this plush, fruit-forward blend of Grenache, Syrah and Carignan. It's primary and pure in fruit character but deeply concentrated. Fresh acidity and ripe, chalky tannins mark the finish. Enjoy now - 2024.
title: Domaine des Coteaux des Travers 2016 Mondona Red (Rasteau)

description: Layers of crushed stone augment crisp, cutting black plum and cherry in this blend of Grenache, Syrah and Carignan. It's ripe and concentrated, with firm but chalky, mouthfilling tannins. It drinks well already but should improve through 2028.
title: Domaine Wilfried 2016 Red (Rasteau)

description: Intense aromas of black-cherry candy and preserved plum are accented by anise, pepper and dried violet in this bold, aromatic wine. A blend of 80% Grenache and 20% Mourvedre, its black-cherry palate is luxuriously plump but freshly balanced, nuanced by veins of dried herb and potpourri florals. Enjoy this forward, pretty wine with fine, lingering tannins now through 2023.
title: Halos de Jupiter 2016  Gigondas

description: Fleshy, slightly ruddy flavors of preserved blackberry and plum are plump and easy on the palate of this full-bodied, warming red. It's a touch jammy but freshened by sunny acidity. A firm grip of acidity lends structure on the finish. Enjoy now - 2022.
title: La Ferme de Gaby 2016 Red (Cairanne)

description: Fleshy, primary black-plum and black-cherry flavors are tinged by burnt caramel and violet candy in this plump, silky wine. Full bodied and voluptuously textured, it finishes on soft, feathery tannins, with a whisper of smoke that lends elegance. Enjoy now - 2023.
title: Alain Jaume et Fils 2016 Domaine Grand Veneur Les Champauvins Red (Cotes du Rhone)

description: Juicy and easy drinking, this voluptuous red offers plump black-cherry and plum flavors accented by anise and cinnamon. Approachably ripe and primary in style, it's anchored by a pleasant bite of tannins and lingering warmth on the finish. Enjoy now - 2022.
title: Domaine Coudoulis 2016 Red (Lirac)

description: Licorice and cinnamon lend a spicy tone to preserved blackberries and plums in this fleshy, full-bodied blend of 80% Grenache and 20% Syrah. Smooth and unctuous, it has rounded acidity and soft, easy tannins. Enjoy this juicy, hedonistic sip now through 2021.
title: Halos de Jupiter 2016 Grenache-Syrah (Cotes du Rhone)

description: Mint aromas signal the wood aging of this ripe wine. It is named after Franсois Carreau, credited with being the first in Bordeaux to graft rootstock onto vines to protect against phylloxera. The wine is full, poised between big tannins and equally important dark fruits. This impressive wine will age well, but will not be ready before 2022.
title: Chateau L'Escadre 2016 Major  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: From a tiny organic vineyard, this dense wine is packed with tannins while still having plenty of fruit weight. Its black-plum flavors are already delicious, backed up by the impressive structure and concentrated texture. Drink from 2022.
title: Clos Louie 2016  Castillon Cotes de Bordeaux

description: The heavy bottle tells you this is meant to be a statement wine. It comes from the vineyard's best parcels, which have produced a richly endowed wine, dark and concentrated, powered by the tannins. It needs to age and will not be ready before 2022.
title: Chateau Bourdieu 2016 Absolu  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: This is a jammy wine, produced in a clay amphora. It is full of the extra-ripe fruit typical of the vintage. However the wine works because the tannins are not excessive, giving space to the red-berry flavors and just enough acidity. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Chateau Bellevue 2016 Amphorae  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: A balsamic lift and hint of dried plum suggest some maturity in this otherwise ripe, fruit-forward wine. A Grenache-dominant blend augmented by Syrah and Mourvedre, its black-cherry and berry flavors are full bodied and juicy on the palate. The finish is marked by bold, mouth-dampening tannins. It's ready now but should hold through 2022.
title: Domaine Fond Croze 2015 Red (Rasteau)

description: Plush blackberry and mulberry flavors are intensely primary in this approachable yet nuanced wine. Deeply fruity and forward, it's shaded by anise, dark chocolate, bramble and herb. Luscious and velvety on the palate, the wine finishes on warming notes of smoked meat and fine, persistent tannins.
title: Michel Gassier 2015 Nostre Pais Red (Costieres de Nimes)

description: Fermented in cement tanks and then aged in amphoras, this wine is pure black fruit. Its rich Merlot is dense and the wine is still young, but it has good potential. Dark, firm and with great black-plum flavors, the wine is worth aging. Drink from 2022.
title: Chateau Mercier 2015 Chateau Bellevue Amphorae  (Blaye Cotes de Bordeaux)

description: Intensely ripe blackberry and strawberry flavors are muted by layers of savory, earthen complexities in this wine. Tasted five years after bottling, it's still concentrated in fruit yet suggests prominent notes of beet root, leather and smoked meat. A rich, complex wine, it finishes long on fine, integrated tannins. Enjoy now - 2024.
title: La Celestiere 2013 Tradition Red (Chateauneuf-du-Pape)

description: A slight bricking on the hue and savory notes of barley, earth and dried herbs suggest maturity in this late-release wine tasted six years after bottling. Black-cherry and raspberry flavors are still concentrated but elegantly muted by earth tones. It's a stately wine, with a silky, mouthwatering palate. Although it drinks well now, it should hold till 2022.
title: La Celestiere 2012 La Croze Grenache (Chateauneuf-du-Pape)

description: Intensely ripe, forward black-plum and mulberry flavors maintain a pristine, invigorating demeanor in this luscious Grenache-dominant blend. Freshly composed on the midpalate it lingers on firm but integrated tannins. Ready now it should improve through 2026.
title: Domaine Fond Croze 2016 Vieilles Vignes Red (Rasteau)

description: Ripe black-cherry and plum notes are shaded by licorice and cacao in this lavishly styled Grenache. It's a forward, richly concentrated wine with bold tones of vanilla and anise. Robust and mouthfilling, it offers a chalky but densely gripping finish.
title: Domaine Fond Croze 2016 Le Haut Plateau Grenache (Rasteau)

description: Ripe but pristine black-cherry aromas are lifted by whiffs of rose petal, crushed stone and licorice in this forward but nuanced red. Bold proportions of Mourvedre lend an elegant herbal edge to Grenache's plummy character. The long finish is edged by lingering, grippy tannins. Lovely now, it should improve through 2026 and hold further.
title: Domaine des Coteaux des Travers 2016 Terra Rosea Grenache-Mourvedre (Cairanne)

description: Ripe, pristine blackberry and cherry flavors are touched with sweet spice in this easy-drinking Grenache-dominant blend. It's a lush, silky wine yet delicate in texture. The fresh finish is marked by chalky, persistent tannins. Enjoy now - 2022.
title: Domaine Fond Croze 2016 Red (Cairanne)

description: This is a ripe, intensely fragrant vin doux naturel chock full of apricot and floral exuberance. Tasted after seven years in the bottle, it's still bold and concentrated in fruit, but with flavors gearing towards candied apricot and fig rather than primary fruit. Still, it's an unctuous, appealing wine that's integrated in alcohol and long on the finish. Enjoy now.
title: Chateau du Trignon 2011  Muscat de Beaumes de Venise

description: Intense floral perfume and ripe muscat notes are lifted by a whiff of alcohol in this vin doux naturel. A decade after bottling, it's luscious but shows maturation notes with apricot and honeysuckle flavors a bit candied rather than fresh. Plush on the palate, it lingers with some heat on the finish. Enjoy now.
title: Domaine de Coyeux 2009  Muscat de Beaumes de Venise

description: Intensely ripe, fleshy black-plum and black-cherry flavors burst from this heaving, full-bodied red. Unabashedly fruit forward, it's a rich, densely concentrated wine with soft acidity and ripe, welcoming tannins. Enjoy this bold, big red now through 2021.
title: Cave de Rasteau 2016 Ortas Tradition Red (Rasteau)

description: Subdued aromas of bramble and crushed mineral, lime and lemon suggest restraint on the nose of this Auslese. Yet the palate here is surprisingly forward, flooding the senses with streaks of sweet, sun-ripened peach, pineapple and melon flavors. It's a lavishly fruity yet pertly balanced wine, lingering on staccato notes of lime and honey. Delicious already but should improve well through 2030.
designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Auslese Old Vines
title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2017 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Auslese Old Vines Riesling (Mosel)

description: High-toned aromas of lemon and lime zest introduce this laser-edged, penetrating wine. It's light as a feather yet lip-smacking and sweet, offering loads of pristine, ripe honeydew, grapefruit and tangerine flavors. Electric acidity shines a spotlight through a long, dazzling finish. Enjoy now - 2030.
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2017 Bernkasteler Badstube Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Lavish yellow peach and quince aromas are calibrated by streaks of smoke and earthy mineral in this forward, complex wine. It's nuanced yet open and inviting, offering loads of ripe, sunny stone fruit flavors anchored by lime and lemon acidity. It's honeyed and spry with a clean, invigorating finish. Enjoy now through 2027.
title: Dr. Hermann 2017 Erdener Herzlei Spatlese Alte Reben Riesling (Mosel)

description: Savory, earthen undertones of crushed slate and salt lend counterpoints to pristine grapefruit, melon and peach in this restrained yet fruity Auslese. It's equal parts sweet and tart, filling the palate with alternating layers of nectar and lime. An invigorating wine that should open and meld well through 2030.
designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Auslese
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2017 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Laser light yet bold in fruit concentration, this penetrating Auslese offers juicy pineapple, tangerine and stone fruit flavors edged with slate, earth and dried herbs. Bracing acidity and sweet honey tones go toe-to-toe through an endless finish. Gorgeous already but should improve through 2030.
title: Prinz Salm 2017 Scharlachberg Bingen Auslese Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Perfumed notes of blossom and lemon zest introduce this zesty, featherlight dessert Riesling. Concentrated honey, tangerine and pineapple flavors seem to dart and dance on the palate, accentuated by high-toned acidity and an enticing whiff of sweat. A stunning wine that's likely to develop complexity well through 2030.
title: Prinz Salm 2017 Binger Scharlachberg Beerenauslese Grosse Lage Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Pristine, sun-kissed white peach and grapefruit flavors are jolted by lightening strikes of lemon and lime in this irresistibly lip-smacking wine. It's intensely juicy and concentrated yet breathless and weightless on the palate. A gorgeous wine already that should improve through 2027.
title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Muller-Burggraef) 2017 Berncasteler Doctor Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Dusty notes of earth and dried herb mingle into fresh lemon and lime on the nose of this sprightly Kabinett. Fresh pear and pineapple flavors are crisply concentrated, accented by a hint of candlewax. A sweet-tart, light-footed wine that should improve through 2025 and hold further.
title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Muller-Burggraef) 2017 Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Pink grapefruit and honeydew melon flavors are bold and primary in this easygoing value Auslese. It's light footed and fresh on the palate but concentrated in sweetness. Reverberating acidity and a touch of waxy complexity lengthens the finish. Enjoy now - 2023.
title: Weingut Georg Albrecht Schneider 2017 Niersteiner Hipping Auslese Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Ethereally light in texture, this intriguing Auslese calibrates pristine tangerine and peach flavors against savory notes of pollen and earth. It's spry and spine-tingling, with a long, floral finish. It drinks well now, but should meld and improve from 2021 - 2030.
title: Schloss Vollrads 2016 Auslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: While the nose is demure here, offering faint whiffs of lemon and honey, there's an avalanche of fruit and flavor to be found on the palate. Luscious yellow peach and tangerine flavors are concentrated yet spine-tingling, calibrated by shards of zesty lime and a steely tang of minerality. A deeply penetrating wine that's gorgeous now but likely to improve through 2030.
title: Peter Nicolay 2017 Graacher Himmelreich Spatlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Intoxicating aromas of honey, pineapple and yellow peach introduce this intensely ripe, rich Spatlese. Semisweet and light as a feather, it offers loads of punchy stone fruit and yellow apple flavors accented with caramel and brisk lemon acidity. Enjoy now - 2030.
title: Schloss Saarstein 2017 Spatlese Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)

description: Savory, herbaceous notes on the nose contrast with intense honey, tangerine and peach on the palate of this dainty Spatlese. It's breathlessly light in body yet silky and luscious in mouthfeel. Medium-sweet in style, its finish calibrates racy lemon-lime acidity against a salty caramel finish. Enjoy now - 2023.
title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2017 Bernkasteler Badstube Spatlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Aromatic notes of freshly cut violets and crushed slate lend elegance to this sprightly, semisweet Spatlese. It's a delicately textured yet deeply concentrated wine with a juicy, peachy finish offset by piercing lemon-lime acidity. Enjoy now - 2035.
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2017 Graacher Himmelreich Spatlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: The nose here is quite subtle, offering hints of lemon, lime and crushed mineral. Sunny yellow cherry and pink grapefruit flavors on the palate, however, are buoyant, peppered by hits of slate, steel and acidity. A zesty yet elegant, exuberant Spatlese with a delicately sweet finish.
designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spatlese
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2017 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spatlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Aromas of tangerine, quince and candlewax perfume this intensely fruity medium-sweet Riesling. It's a zesty, light-footed wine yet densely concentrated, with summer-sweet nectarine and pineapple flavors. The finish is long, highlighted by lime acidity and lingering notes of slate and smoke.
title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Muller-Burggraef) 2017 Brauneberger Juffer-Sonnenuhr Spatlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Spicy notes of saffron, pollen and slate accent zesty pineapple and tangerine in this light-bodied but complex Spatlese. Flavors of honey and peach nectar are sunny and sweet but offset by darker tones of dust, earth and salt. It's a thrilling, racy wine finishing with an elegant murmur of astringency.
title: Weingut Karp-Schreiber 2017 Brauneberger Juffer-Sonnenuhr Spatlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: A savory, earthen nose full of green herb and dusty pollen contrasts gorgeous yellow peach, honeydew and grapefruit flavors on the palate here. It's a juicy, intensely concentrated Kabinett balanced by hits of lime acidity and a tangy, spicy finish. A sprightly off-dry wine to enjoy now through 2023.
title: Dr. Hermann 2017 Urziger Wurzgarten Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: This is a lip-smacking, honeyed Kabinett. It's gloriously juicy, offering loads of zesty tangerine and white grapefruit flavors, but balanced keenly with bracing lemon-lime acidity and a touch of dried earth. An elegant, invigorating wine to enjoy now through 2023.
title: Dr. Hermann 2017 Piesporter Goldtropfchen Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Broad yellow apple and nectarine notes juxtapose earthier, smokier tones in this stately, slightly savory Spatlese. Semisweet in style, it's a racy, light-footed Riesling with pert tangerine flavors accented by lingering honey, candlewax and pollen. Enjoy now - 2025.
designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spatlese Old Vines
title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2017 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Spatlese Old Vines Riesling (Mosel)

description: Pronounced notes of spice, baked slate and saffron lend a savory complexity to bright yellow apple and grapefruit here. The palate is equal parts primary fruit and savory earth, catapulted by intense lemon-lime acidity. Intriguing now but should meld and open through 2027.
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2017 Bernkasteler Badstube Spatlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Layers and layers of honey and hibiscus nectar envelop ripe tropical melon, pineapple and peach in this pristine, fruity Kabinett. It's straightforward and sunny but balanced with a clean, steely finish. A light-bodied, zesty sip to enjoy now through 2023.
title: Dr. Hermann 2017 Erdener Treppchen Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Savory earth and spicy pollen notes are offset by luscious tangerine, honey and cantaloupe in this approachable, lip-smacking Riesling. It's off dry yet vibrantly brisk in acidity. The finish is succulent but a touch sugary. Enjoy now - 2022.
title: Peter Nicolay 2017 Urziger Goldwingert Spatlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Exuberant and aromatic, this spry, light-footed Spatlese offers a heady introduction of orange blossom, pineapple and yellow cherry perfume. It's juicy and concentrated with sweet-tart peach and guava flavors adorned by a filigreed veil of sweetness. Lovely already but should intensify through 2035.
title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Muller-Burggraef) 2016 Berncasteler Doctor Spatlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Slate and dried herb juxtapose tropical pineapple, guava and berry in this medium-sweet Kabinett. It's lusciously fruity on the palate yet cutting and spry. The finish extends elegantly, marked by lingering notes of dusty mineral and dry earth. Enjoy now - 2025.
title: Meierer 2016 Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Exuberantly perfumed, this tropical, sun-kissed Auslese wafts from the glass with notes of pineapple, guava and mango. It's featherlight on the palate but chock-full of sweet, pristine pomelo and grapefruit flavors. A vibrant, thirst-quenching wine that's irresistible already but should deepen well through 2030.
title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Mullne/er-Burggraef) 2017 Berncasteler Lay Auslese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Pristine minerality and crisp-tart apricot, nectarine and tangerine flavors collide in this spine-tingling semisweet Riesling. It's a crystalline, light-footed wine that persists through a long, luminous finish. Enjoy now through 2023.
title: Bastgen 2016 Kestener Paulinsberg Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Inviting aromas of lime, lemon, stone and slate introduce this intensely juicy, primary wine full of sunny tangerine, white grapefruit and pineapple flavors. Off-dry in style, it's approachable and easy-drinking with a honeyed, sweet disposition but zesty in balance, too. Enjoy now through 2022.
title: Von Buhl 2015 Armand Kabinett Riesling (Pfalz)

description: Concentrated aromas of lemon, tangerine and caramel are accented by crushed earth on the nose of this gorgeous Spatlese. It's a sprightly, light-bodied wine with luscious, concentrated peach and apricot flavors. A powerful, laser-edged sip that lingers on an endlessly spine-tingling finish. Delicious already yet bound to improve through 2027.
title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Muller-Burggraef) 2017 Bernkasteler Graben Spatlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Ethereal yet deeply penetrating, this light-footed wine offers layers and layers of yellow peach, apricot and tangerine intensity. It's luminous and ripe yet racy and lip-smacking, finishing on smoky notes of slate and crushed mineral. A powerful, electric Kabinett to enjoy now through 2028.
title: St. Urbans-Hof 2017 Nik Weis Wiltinger Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Notes of zesty lemon and lime waft from the nose of this vibrant Kabinett. It's a spine-tingling, juicy quaffer loaded with cutting white grapefruit and crystalline mineral tones. The finish is long, marked by a lacy veil of sweetness and a hint of musky floral perfume. Enjoy now - 2022.
title: Weingut Karp-Schreiber 2017 Brauneberger Juffer Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Steely and thrilling, this racy Kabinett offers layers of sweet-tart white-peach, pear and pineapple flavors off set by penetrating lime acidity. It's lavishly honeyed but squarely balanced, finishing on cool, reverberating strikes of steel and slate. Delicious already but should improve through 2027.
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2017 Graacher Himmelreich Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Sunny yet spine-tingling, this featherlight Kabinett offers sweet-tart grapefruit and peach flavors marked by hints of honey and slate. It's a deeply fruity wine yet intensely mineral, too, finishing on a salty margarita-like ring. Enjoy now through 2027.
title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2017 Wehlener Sonnenuhr Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: This is a fragrant, light-footed wine offering loads of pristine white blossom, white peach and melon notes amid a stony, mineral backdrop. It's juicy and approachably fruity yet vivaciously piercing on the palate. Enjoy now - 2023.
title: Dr. Nagler 2017 Rudesheimer Berg Schlossberg Auslese Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Dusty mineral notes accent pristine lemon on the nose of this light-footed but powerful Riesling. It's a sprightly, punchy Kabinett, pulsating with concentrated white grapefruit and lime flavors yet anchored by tones of steel and slate. The finish is long, accentuated by citrusy acidity. Enjoy now - 2027.
title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2017 Graacher Himmelreich Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Equal parts fruit and mineral, this charming semidry Riesling offers layers of juicy white grapefruit and yellow peach flavors juxtaposed by bracing hits of slate and earth. It's an approachably sweet-and-tart yet revitalizing wine to enjoy now through 2021.
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2017 Riesling (Mosel)

description: Whiffs of crushed stone and lime pith are demure on the nose, but the palate here is forward and fruity, offering loads of fresh tangerine, honeydew and grapefruit. It's a light-bodied, zippy wine with a honeyed, easy sweetness. Enjoy now - 2022.
title: Dr. Hermann 2017 Dr. H Riesling (Mosel)

description: Notes of guava, pineapple and orange blossom lend a tropical tone to this juicy medium-sweet Riesling. Plump white peach and apricot flavors are intensely primary in fruit character but balanced by crisper tones of green apple and lime. An easy, open-knit wine to enjoy now through 2021.
title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2017 Noble House Riesling (Mosel)

description: Cutting lemon, lime and tangerine notes abound in this approachably juicy but mineral wine. Off-dry and light bodied in style, its piercing citrus flavors are invigorating and honeyed. Enjoy now - 2023.
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2017 Bernkasteler Badstube Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Cherry blossoms and river rocks collide in this gorgeously perfumed, light-footed dry wine. Pink grapefruit and lime flavors are concentrated and crisp, marked by hints of fresh mint and pollen. An easy-drinking but finessed wine to enjoy now through 2023.
title: Paul Anheuser 2017 Kreuznacher Hinkelstein Kabinett Trocken Riesling (Nahe)

description: This is a lip-smacking, impeccably balanced wine offering concentrated white peach and tangerine flavors calibrated by a spine-tingling acidic backbone. Just off-dry in style, it's charmingly forward and fruity but edged by cool tangs of steel and mineral that linger on the finish. Enjoy now - 2023.
title: Fritz Allendorf 2017 Kabinett Riesling (Rheingau)

description: There's a crystalline minerality that permeates through lip-smacking pink grapefruit and peach flavors that abound in this vibrant Kabinett. It's an unabashedly fruity, forward wine, yet balanced by zesty lime acidity and a steely tang. Enjoy now through 2022 for its youthful exuberance.
title: Peter Nicolay 2017 Bernkasteler Badstube Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Light as a feather yet juicy in concentration, this spry off-dry wine offers layers of honey, caramel, lemon and tangerine flavors. It's fruity and forward but accented by hints of blossom, saffron and crushed earth. A delightfully quaffable yet substantive wine to enjoy now through 2025.
title: Peter Nicolay 2017 Riesling (Mosel)

description: Deeply earthen aromas of dried herb and crushed stone juxtapose fresh yellow apple and white grapefruit here. The medium-sweet palate offers loads of sweet-tart tangerine and lemon flavors accented by hints of honey and pollen. It drinks quite tightly still but should open and ease through 2024.
title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2017 Bernkasteler Badstube Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: High-toned aromas of lime and lemon are accented by hints of crushed earth and white flower perfume here. It's a fruity, forward wine offering loads of juicy pink grapefruit and tangerine flavors. Primary fruit flavors and delicate, lingering sweetness make it a crowd-pleaser to enjoy now through 2021.
title: St. Urbans-Hof 2017 Nik Weis Urban Riesling (Mosel)

description: Whiffs of crushed mineral, earth and pollen lend savory nuances to fresh white grapefruit, peach and tangerine in this off-dry Riesling. It's a juicy, easy-going wine with brisk concentration and a zesty finish. Enjoy now - 2021.
title: The Seeker 2017 Riesling (Mosel)

description: Luscious honey, citrus and tropical fruit notes are layered in smoke and petrol in this vibrant dessert Riesling. It's deft and light footed but penetrates with sweet, fruity flavor. Spine-tingling acidity and a long, honeyed finish lend flair.
title: Weingut Binz 2015 Nackenheimer Engelsberg Beerenauslese Estate Bottled Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Initial aromas of forest floor and bramble dissipate to reveal fruitier tones of lemon and peach on this spry, light-footed Kabinett. Stone fruit and pineapple flavors are plump and concentrated but nuanced by savory notes of saffron and barley, too. It's a juicy, spine-tingling wine with a delicate honey finish to enjoy now through 2024.
designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Kabinett
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2017 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)

description: Dark shades of earth, candle wax and pollen lend nuance to fresh, primary white grapefruit, peach and apricot in this forward but nuanced Kabinett. Delicately off dry in style, it's a penetrating, juicy wine offset by racy acidity. Enjoy now - 2024.
designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Kabinett Old Vines
title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2017 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Kabinett Old Vines Riesling (Mosel)

description: Layers of crushed slate, bramble and earth lend savory nuance to juicy lemon and white peach flavors in this invigorating off-dry Riesling. It's a piercing, mouthwatering wine, highlighted by streaks of lime and lemon acidity. Drink now through 2024.
designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Old Vines Offdry
title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2017 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Old Vines Offdry Riesling (Mosel)

description: Sun-kissed raspberry, apricot and tangerine perfume this bold, intensely juicy Kabinett. It's an irresistibly guzzle-worthy wine offering loads of sweet-tart yellow peach and nectarine flavors. Zesty acidity and a steely finish lend balance.
title: Dr. Nagler 2017 Rudesheimer Berg Roseneck Kabinett Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Delicate pollen and earth tones juxtapose sunny pineapple, yellow apple and peach in this featherlight Riesling. It's just a shade off-dry but finishes invigoratingly dry and brisk. An elegant but approachable wine to enjoy now through 2022.
title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Muller-Burggraef) 2017 Dr. Thanisch Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)

description: Slate and crushed earth tones permeate from start to finish in this racy, intensely mineral Riesling. Just a shade off dry on the palate, it offers concentrated tangerine and lemon-skin flavors offset by a steely tang. This vibrant wine should open and improve through 2022.
title: St. Urbans-Hof 2017 Nik Weis From Old Vines Riesling (Mosel)

description: Brambly, earthen notes on the nose are offset by brighter tones of lemon, honey and grapefruit on the palate of this off-dry Riesling. It's a spry, cutting wine with zesty acidity and just a hint of caramelized sugar on the finish. Enjoy now through 2021.
title: Weingut Karp-Schreiber 2017 My Karp Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)

description: While initial aromas of crushed slate, dried herb and lime zest seem rather savory, the palate of this juicy, easy-drinking Riesling suggests sunnier notes of tangerine, lemon and yellow cherry. It's juicy and off-dry in style, with crisp, invigorating acidity. A light-bodied sip to enjoy now through 2022.
title: Lucashof 2016 Bischofsgarten Kabinett Riesling (Pfalz)

description: Ebullient pink grapefruit and tangerine notes extend from start to finish in this fruit-forward Riesling. Off dry in style, it's delicately sweet yet refreshingly balanced in acidity. It is not a complex wine but a satisfying crowd-pleaser.
title: Bex 2016 Riesling (Nahe)

description: Vibrant notes of lemon, lime and orange blossom perfume this fresh, approachable wine. It's off-dry in style, offering loads of thirst-quenching tangerine and apricot flavors but with a zesty, light-footed ease. Enjoy now - 2021.
title: S.A. Prum 2017 Essence Riesling (Mosel)

description: Crystalline minerality and delicate earth tones accentuate crisp nectarine and yellow peach in this semidry, concentrated Riesling. It's stony and sleek yet luxuriously fruity. The finish is marked by zesty acidity a high-toned tang of steel. Enjoy now - 2026.
title: Dr. Leimbrock 2016 Graacher Himmelreich Spatlese Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)

description: Crisp nectarine and yellow-peach aromas are edged by hints of earth and crushed slate in this juicy, medium-sweet wine. White grapefruit and peach flavors are approachably fruity, catapulted by streaks of high-toned acidity and delicate mineral tones. Enjoy now - 2021.
title: Blue Fish 2016 Sweet Riesling (Pfalz)

description: White floral perfume, crushed minerals and lime form the core of this restrained but elegant dry wine. It's lean and quite linear on the palate, extending through a long, steely finish. A filigreed, light-bodied sip to enjoy now through 2027.
designation: Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Old Vines Dry
title: Dr. Pauly Bergweiler 2017 Bernkasteler alte Badstube am Doctorberg Old Vines Dry Riesling (Mosel)

description: Fresh white grapefruit and stony mineral tones collide in this dry but richly textured Riesling. It's medium bodied and brisk in acidity yet voluminous and thirst-quenching on the palate. An elegant, deeply satisfying wine likely to appeal broadly.
title: Pfluger 2017 Buntsandstein Riesling (Pfalz)

description: Hints of spice and honeycomb lend a slightly savory tone to pressed apple and pear in this off-dry Riesling. It's light footed and honeyed but tart and citrusy, too, finishing with racy hits of lemon and tart-apple skin. Drink now - 2023.
title: Carl Ehrhard 2017 Rudesheim Kabinett Feinherb Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Dusty slate and mineral notes abound from nose to finish in this light-footed dry Riesling. It's not deeply complex but offers loads of refreshing lemon and quince flavors amplified by a juicy tangerine crush on the midpalate. Enjoy now through 2022.
title: S.A. Prum 2017 Luminance Dry Riesling (Mosel)

description: Pretty white peach and apricot aromas perfume this fruity dry Riesling. It's ethereal and light in texture with a zippy mouthfeel, accentuated by brisk acidity and delicate red apple, quince and honey flavors. An easy-drinking, approachable wine to enjoy now through 2020.
title: Dr. Heyden 2017 Oppenheimer Estate Bottled Dry-Style Kabinett Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Faint whiffs of lemon and white blossom appear on the nose here, but floral and citrus notes abound on the palate of this slightly off-dry wine. White grapefruit and lime flavors are juicy yet elegant, edged by hints of crushed mineral and a touch of beer hops. A fresh, light-bodied Riesling to enjoy now through 2023.
title: Peter Nicolay 2017 Erdener Treppchen Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)

description: While light and zesty in style, there's a deep mineral intensity from nose to finish in this dry, savory Riesling. Crisp apple flavor on the palate is dusted in exotic spice and shards of dark mineral that linger long through the finish. Drinks well already but should improve through 2028 and hold further.
title: Okonomierat Rebholz 2016 Brirkweiler Trocken Riesling (Pfalz)

description: Smoke and slate mingle into luscious peach and pineapple in this lithe yet concentrated dry Riesling. Piercing lemon-lime acidity and honed strokes of steel build a feeling of tension on the palate with each sip. Gorgeous already but likely to intensify in complexity through 2030.
title: Dr. H. Thanisch (Erben Muller-Burggraef) 2016 Graacher Himmelreich Trocken GG Riesling (Mosel)

description: Delicate lemon, lime and orange blossom aromas intensify on the palate of this fresh, fruity Riesling. Just a shade off dry, its tropical pineapple and melon flavors balance neatly against brisk acidity and a steely mineral finish. Enjoy now - 2022.
title: Hansen-Lauer 2016 Bernkasteler Badstube Riesling (Mosel)

description: Whiffs of zesty pineapple and chamomile contrast pronounced layers of crushed stone and dusty mineral here. The dry palate is zesty and spry but intensified by crisp lemon and lime flavors. The finish is marked by savory tones of earth and dried herb. Enjoy now through 2021.
title: Weingut Liebfrauenstift 2016 Dry Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Pronounced aromas of caramelized honey and zesty lemon and tangerine skins perfume this unusual late-release feinherb. It's an elegant wine that shows glimmers of maturity via slightly muted notes of apple and pear along with spicy hints of saffron and dried citrus peel. Creamy in texture with a long, lingering finish, it wraps up with a perception of dryness.
title: Carl Ehrhard 2014 Rudesheim Berg Roseneck Feinherb Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Hints of orange blossom and red apple perfume this juicy, primary wine. Flavors of zesty lemon, apple and pear are briskly concentrated, offset by crisp acidity and a clean finish. Enjoy now - 2021.
title: Fitz-Ritter 2017 Durkheim Riesling (Pfalz)

description: Perfumed and pristine, this dry, pertly balanced Riesling offers layers of lime and grapefruit flavors cut by shards of slate and steel. Its refreshingly tonic style is quaffable but elegant. Enjoy now - 2021.
title: Weingut Binz 2017 Nackenheimer Kabinett Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Squeaky fresh grapefruit and lemon flavors abound in this dry, light-bodied Riesling. It's zesty and easy drinking with hints of spice and crushed stone lending interest to the midpalate. Enjoy now through 2021.
title: Weingut Binz 2017 Nackenheimer Estate Bottled Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Brisk tangerine and pineapple aromas are cutting and fresh on the nose of this zesty, light-bodied Riesling. While dry and mineral in focus, it offers refreshing lemon and lime flavors accented by a hint of bramble. Enjoy now through 2022.
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2017 Dry Riesling (Mosel)

description: Harvested at high sugar levels yet fermented dry, this medium-bodied but rich, cream-textured wine offers intensely concentrated apple and pear flavors balanced against crisp acidity. Darker tones of crushed mineral, pollen and spice lend a savory, spicy intensity to the midpalate. An intriguing wine that should improve through 2026.
title: Weingut Georg Albrecht Schneider 2016 Niersteiner Hipping Berg Trocken Spatlese Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Lime zest and lemongrass notes mingle into warmer notes of spice and earth in this savory, electric wine. Medium bodied and dry in style, it's marked by piercing, palate-jolting hits of lemon and lime. A racy wine that should open and ease from now through 2022.
title: Wechsler 2017 Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Sun-kissed, punchy pineapple and peach notes perfume this irreverently fun, fruity sip. It's totally dry on the palate but intensely peachy, its peach-gummy fruitiness offset neatly by fresh green herb and crystalline mineral tones. The finish is brisk and clean, lengthened by squirts of lemon-lime acidity. Enjoy now through 2022 for its exuberant, youthful style.
title: Wechsler 2017 Trocken Scheurebe (Rheinhessen)

description: Appropriately named, there's a dense core of slate and crushed mineral tones pulsating from within this dry, medium-bodied Riesling. Grapefruit and lime flavors are invigoratingly tart yet mouthwatering, finishing with lingering strikes of slate and stone. Enjoy now through 2022.
title: Dr. Heidemanns-Bergweiler 2017 Dry Mineral Riesling (Mosel)

description: Subdued but quite elegant, this dry, medium-bodied Riesling offers delicate shades of lemon, lime and white blossom. Easygoing and approachable, it's tart, tangy refreshment with a hint of steely minerality. Enjoy now through 2022.
title: Dr. Hermann 2017 Trocken Riesling (Mosel)

description: Whiffs of smoke and crushed mineral accent tart tangerine and pineapple in this sprightly dry Riesling. Juicy lemon and lime flavors are enriched by a sheen of honey on the midpalate, but the finish is dry and zesty. Enjoy now through 2022.
title: Peter Nicolay 2017 Dry Riesling (Mosel)

description: Brisk aromas of tangerine and quince gain ripeness and concentration on the palate of this dry but honeyed Silvaner. It's an easy-drinking, juicy wine with ample yellow-peach flavor and just a hint of mineral complexity. Enjoy now through 2022.
title: Michael Frohlich 2017 Escherndorfer Silvaner (Franken)

description: There's just a hint of honeydew melon on the nose of this demure, dry Riesling. It's a crisp, medium-bodied wine with fresh, red-apple flavor and a touch of spring blossom on the finish. Easy drinking yet elegant, it should show well through 2020.
title: Blue Fish 2017 Riesling (Pfalz)

description: Minerality defines this dry, medium-bodied Riesling. It's demure on the nose, offering savory tones of earth and crushed stone. The palate offers vibrant lime and lemon but with a stern backbone of slate and steel. A refreshing yet restrained wine that should open and ease through 2021.
title: Von Buhl 2016 Riesling (Pfalz)

description: There's a salty, intensely stony tone to this spot-on, bone-dry Riesling. It's medium bodied yet expansive on the palate, offering easygoing flavors of fresh apple and lemon but marked by an umami richness. Elegant already but should open through 2021.
title: Von Buhl 2016 Bone Dry Riesling (Pfalz)

description: This bright, medium-bodied Spatburgunder shares the same crisp-tart blackberry and cherry flavors and piquant hints of herb and bacon offered by the producer's single-vineyard bottling. By comparison, however, it's a plummier, softer wine, edged by soft, feathery tannins. An easy-drinking yet elegant wine to enjoy now through 2023.
title: Fritz Allendorf 2016 Trocken Spatburgunder (Rheingau)

description: Light bodied and spry, yet voluminous and creamy in mouthfeel, this intriguing dry Riesling suggests hints of succulent white peach and grapefruit layered in honey and yogurt. Accents of spice and pollen lend warmth to the midpalate. It drinks beautifully now but should improve through 2027.
title: Bischofliche Weinguter Trier 2015 Trittenheimer Apotheke Reserve Riesling (Mosel)

description: Fragrant notes of yellow cherry, blossom and pink grapefruit waft from this lavish, perfumed Riesling. Dry in style and silky on the palate, it offers concentrated citrus flavors edged by hints of bitter lime pith and a deep mineral undertone. The finish is long and luscious. Lovely already but should intensify through 2032.
title: Fitz-Ritter 2017 Ungsteiner Herrenberg Trocken GG Riesling (Pfalz)

description: Fragrant yellow peach and melon notes are accented by earthy whiffs of crushed mineral and slate in this full bodied, luscious Riesling. Ripe yellow peach and apple flavors are rich and penetrating, offset by brisk acidity and a sleek, stony finish. A hedonistic wine to enjoy now through 2030.
title: Bastgen 2017 Bernkastel-Cueser Weisenstein Spatlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Intensely citrusy from start to finish, this dry but mouthwatering, full-bodied wine offers loads of pink grapefruit and blossomy appeal. Lemony acidity and delicately astringent notes of lime pith lend vibe and structure. It's a refreshing, elegant wine to enjoy now through 2021.
title: Weingut Georg Albrecht Schneider 2017 Vom Rotlegender Neirsteiner Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Juicy yellow peach and pineapple flavors are fresh and fruity in this vibrant dry-style Silvaner. Full bodied and silky, it's a richly textured wine balanced with zesty lime acidity and hints of bitter citrus pith. An elegant wine to enjoy now through 2023.
title: Michael Frohlich 2017 Escherndorfer Lump Erste Lage Silvaner (Franken)

description: While this dry Riesling's floral and stone fruit perfume is lovely, the showcase here is texture and mouthfeel. It's a complex, concentrated wine loaded with pristine yellow apple and grapefruit flavors layered in silky streaks of candlewax, silk and honey. Full bodied and rippling on the palate, it finishes with hints of bitter lime pith and pollen. Gorgeous now but likely to improve through 2035.
title: Wachtstetter 2016 Glaukos Trocken GG Riesling (Wurttemberg)

description: Crisp black cherry and blackberry flavors are muted by layers of dried herb and charcuterie on the nose of this elegant Spatburgunder. It's a brisk, restrained red wine with crisply concentrated black fruit flavors and savory accents of earth and chestnut. The finish is moderately long, ending on fine-grained yet persistent tannins. Enjoy now through 2025.
title: Fritz Allendorf 2016 Assmannshauser Spatburgunder (Rheingau)

description: Ripe red cherry and tart cranberry notes are accented by toast, caramel and crushed mineral in this plush, full-bodied Pinot Noir. Bottled unfiltered, it's rich and velvety on the palate but balanced neatly by crisp acidity and a cushion of feathery tannins. Enjoy now through 2023.
title: Dr. Heyden 2016 Oppenheimer Unfiltered Pinot Noir (Rheinhessen)

description: Cutting lime, lemon and grapefruit flavors are layered with wax and stony mineral in this dry, full-bodied Riesling. It's not a deeply concentrated wine, but it's refreshing and silky. An approachable wine with wide appeal to enjoy now through 2021.
title: Weingut Georg Albrecht Schneider 2016 Vom Kalk Neirsteiner Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)

description: Aromas of ripe blackberries are marked by granite and balsamic vinegar here. Medium bodied and briskly concentrated, this zesty Spatburgunder offers crisp blackberry and currant flavors accented by hints of earth and violet candy. The finish is moderately long, edged by soft, feathery tannins. Enjoy now through 2023.
title: Dr. Nagler 2016 Estate Bottled Trocken Spatburgunder (Rheingau)

description: Fragrant yellow cherry, raspberry and orange blossom notes abound on the nose of this luscious, lavish dry Riesling. It's full bodied and plump yet pertly balanced by spine-tingling grapefruit acidity and a fringe of bitter lime pith. It's enjoyable now for its youthful perfume but likely to gain complexity through 2030 and hold further.
title: Fritz Allendorf 2015 Jesuitengarten Trocken GG Riesling (Rheingau)

description: Whispers of earth, smoke and dried herb envelop fresher tones of yellow apple, grapefruit and peach in this intriguingly complex wine. It's full bodied and richly textured but balanced by bristling tones of lime and lemon. A sleek but powerful wine to enjoy now through 2035.
title: Schnaitmann 2015 Gotzenberg GG Riesling (Wurttemberg)

description: This is a bold, heady wine that penetrates the palate with rich flavors of yellow peach and nectarine. It's voluminous and dense, yet anchored by piercing streaks of lemon-lime acidity and bitter pith notes that lend tension to the finish. It's a complex, muscular dry Riesling to enjoy now through 2035.
title: Schloss Vollrads 2016 Schlossberg Trocken GG Riesling (Rheingau)

description: This is a perfumed Pinot Noir, offering a sumptuous red-cherry aroma that's backed by crystalline notes of granite and crushed earth. It's fresh and fruity on the palate, suggesting ripe but pristine raspberry and cherry flavors, with savory tones of dried sage and wild thyme. Full bodied and plush, it's an approachable people-pleaser yet stately and persistent, too. Enjoy now - 2025.
title: August Kesseler 2015 The Daily August Pinot Noir (Rheingau)

description: Honeysuckle, green-apple and white-almond aromas follow over to the lightly foaming palate along with pear, crushed herb and a hint of ginger. A soft mousse provides the backdrop.
title: Nino Franco 2017 Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: Aromas of white spring flower and orchard fruit form the nose on this elegant sparkler. Mirroring the aromas, the silky palate doles out ripe pear, juicy golden apple and crushed herb alongside crisp acidity. A foaming mousse lends finesse.
title: Nino Franco 2016 Brut Nodi  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco)

description: Fragrant and polished, this elegant sparkler opens with enticing aromas of white spring flower and orchard fruit. On the juicy palate, a silky mousse caresses ripe apple, Bartlett pear and wild herb. It closes on a fennel note.
designation: Vigneto della Riva di San Floriano
title: Nino Franco 2017 Vigneto della Riva di San Floriano  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: A blend of Sardinia's native grapes Monica, Carignano and Cannonau, this fragrant rosato boasts enticing scents of wild berry, Mediterranean brush and chopped herb. Bright and tangy, the light-bodied savory palate offers strawberry, Marasca cherry, white pepper and a hint of blood orange alongside a saline note.
title: Pala 2017 Chiaro di Stelle Red (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: This has aromas suggesting Mediterranean brush, mature black-skinned fruit and scorched earth. The easygoing palate shows dried black cherry, baking spice and a hint of star anise framed in rounded tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Mustilli 2016 Aglianico (Sannio)

description: Fresh and refined, this elegant sparkler opens with enticing, delicate scents of white stone fruit, spring flower and crushed alpine herb. The dry savory palate delivers Bartlett pear, crunchy apple, lemon zest and ginger set against a foaming mousse. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors. Delicious!
title: Nino Franco 2013 Grave di Stecca Brut Glera (Vino Spumante)

description: Ripe wild berry, spiced plum and Mediterranean brush aromas lead the nose. The juicy palate offers Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry and a hint of orange zest alongside pliant tannins.
title: Tenute Casoli 2016 Kataro Aglianico (Irpinia)

description: Dark-berry, pressed violet and tilled earth aromas come together on this. The easygoing enjoyable palate offers ripe blackberry and a hint of clove alongside mellow tannins.
title: Di Meo 2015 Isso Aglianico (Campania)

description: Made with organically farmed Piedirosso, this has aromas of tilled earth, red berry and cooking spice. The juicy palate offers ripe raspberry, clove and a touch of hazelnut on the finish.
title: Cantina del Vesuvio 2015 Rosso Piedirosso (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

description: Made with 80% Aglianico and 20% Piedirosso, this opens with aromas of ripe black fruit, scorched earth and vanilla. The straightforward palate offers mature black plum, cocoa and a balsamic note alongside firm tannins.
title: Nugnes 2012 Caleno Riserva Red (Falerno del Massico)

description: Tobacco, star anise and blue-flower aromas lead the way along with whiffs of scorched earth and leather. The evolved, rather lean-bodied palate offers dried cherry, prune and ground pepper alongside grainy tannins that leave a somewhat drying finish. Give the tannins a few more years to unclench then drink sooner rather than later.
title: Miru 2009  Ghemme

description: A blend of Rondinella Bianca, Gold Traminer, Kerner and Incrocio Manzoni, this fragrant, savory white opens with aromas of lime zest, yellow stone fruit and aromatic herb. The succulent, delicious palate doles out honeydew melon, creamy peach and apricot alongside tangy citrus. A saline note marks the close.
title: Zyme 2017 From Black to White White (Veneto)

description: This opens with aromas of mature black-skinned berry and Mediterranean brush while the round easygoing palate offers juicy morello cherry, black raspberry and a hint of baking spice. Supple tannins offer lithe support. Drink soon.
title: Cecchi 2017 La Mora  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Delicately understated but still enticing aromas of ripe apple, beeswax, Mediterranean scrub and a whiff of the seaside mingle together on this medium-bodied white. Reflecting the nose, the smooth fresh palate offers juicy white peach, ripe pear and citrus alongside a hint of saline. A white almond note lingers on the close.
title: Nuraghe Crabioni 2017 Tresmontes  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

description: Aromas of yellow peach and tropical fruit lead the nose. Reflecting the aromas, the tangy, elegant palate offers apricot, citrus and pineapple along with a hint of saline.
title: Argiolas 2017 Meri  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

description: Aromas of spring field flower, yellow stone fruit and lemon rind waft out of the glass. The tangy savory palate doles out juicy yellow peach, saline, tangerine rind and a hint of bitter almond.
title: Pala 2017 I Fiori  (Nuragus di Cagliari)
