description: Truffle, ripe blackberry and scorched earth aromas lift out of the glass. The aromas carry over to the medium-bodied easygoing palate along with mature black cherry, clove and Mediterranean brush. Lithe tannins provide soft support. Drink soon.
title: Mora & Memo 2017 Ica  (Monica di Sardegna)

description: Delicate scents evoking wild berry and blue flower waft out of the glass. It's simple but well made, offering red cherry, prune and a hint of clove alongside soft pliant tannins. Drink now.
title: Poggio Salvi 2016 I Butteri  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: This blend of Aglianico and Piedirosso opens with aromas of violet, red berry and underbrush. The juicy palate delivers red cherry, crushed raspberry and clove alongside fresh acidity and velvety tannins.
title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2016 Red (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, blue flower and a whiff of moist earth emerge from the glass. The easygoing palate offers blackberry jam and licorice alongside round tannins. Drink soon.
title: Manimurci 2016 4 Contrade Aglianico (Irpinia)

description: Blue-flower, tilled soil and dark-berry aromas lead the nose. The straightforward palate delivers ripe blackberry, black pepper and mocha alongside velvety tannins.
title: Donnachiara 2016 Aglianico (Campania)

description: This easygoing red offers a potpourri of red-berry, baking-spice and blue-flower aromas. The savory straightforward palate offers dried Marasca cherry, cranberry and ground clove alongside relaxed tannins. Drink sooner rather than later to enjoy the fruit flavors.
title: Fattoria di Magliano 2015 Heba  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals subtle aromas of berry, blue flower and a whiff resin. The simple easygoing palate offers juicy black cherry and a hint of spice alongside soft tannins. Drink soon.
title: Barbanera 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Aromas of toast, underbrush, roasted coffee bean and a whiff of camphor lead the nose. It's taut and rather light bodied, showing sour cherry, cranberry, espresso and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins and bright acidity.
title: Ceretto 2015 Bernadot  (Barbaresco)

description: Aromas of dark fruit, mocha and vanilla lead the nose. The firm palate offers raspberry jam, licorice and black pepper alongside close-grained tannins that grip the finish.
title: Montevetrano 2015 Core Aglianico (Campania)

description: Made with 85% Nebbiolo and 15% Uva Rara, this polished red opens with aromas of exotic spice, rose petal and wild berry. Reflecting the nose, the bright linear palate doles out crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry and ground pepper alongside fine-grained but pliant tannins.
title: Podere ai Valloni 2015 Gratus Red (Colline Novaresi)

description: Aromas of dark-skinned fruit, baking spice and a hint of violet lead the nose. The straightforward palate offers blackberry jam and star anise alongside smooth tannins.
title: Tenuta Fontana 2015 Civico 28 Aglianico (Sannio)

description: This opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, underbrush and cooking spice. The medium-bodied savory palate offers black-cherry jam, white pepper and a clove note alongside lithe tannins and fresh acidity.
title: Agricola Bellaria 2015 Sir V Aglianico (Irpinia)

description: This blend of Pallagrello Nero and Casavecchia has aromas of red berry, vanilla and baking spice. The juicy palate offers raspberry jam, star anise and white pepper alongside polished tannins.
title: Vestini Campagnano 2015 Kaianero Red (Terre del Volturno)

description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, tilled soil and smoke emerge from the glass. The juicy palate delivers black plum, black cherry jam, clove and white pepper alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity.
title: La Sibilla 2014 Vigna Madre Piedirosso (Campi Flegrei)

description: Aromas of woodland berry, dark spice and tilled soil lead the nose. The bright palate offers Marasca cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside firm tannins and fresh acidity.
title: Guastaferro 2013 Memini Aglianico (Irpinia)

description: Aromas of ground pepper and ripe black-skinned berry follow over to the smooth juicy palate along with raspberry compote. Polished tannins provide the elegant framework. Drink through 2021.
title: Pietro Cassina 2011 Vespolina (Coste della Sesia)

description: Subtle aromas suggesting dark spice, wild berry and Alpine herb waft out of the glass. The palate is smooth and bright, offering dried cherry, star anise and a hint of espresso alongside buffed, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2021.
title: Pietro Cassina 2011 Ciuet Nebbiolo (Coste della Sesia)

description: This opens with subtle aromas of underbrush, dark culinary spice, pressed rose, a whiff of tar and mature berry. The smooth if rather evolved palate shows dried cherry, licorice, mint and a hint of iron alongside polished tannins. Drink soon to capture the fruit sensations.
title: Tenute Sella 2010 I Porfidi  (Bramaterra)

description: Aromas of leather, dark spice and a whiff of barnyard follow over to the lean palate along with game and a hint of prune. It's rustic and evolved, with dusty drying tannins.
title: Il Chiosso 2009  Ghemme

description: Earthy and savory, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, pressed violet, baking spice and a whiff of sunbaked earth. The aromas follow over to the easygoing generous palate along with ripe plum and clove. Enjoy through 2022.
title: Salcheto 2017 Obvius Sangiovese (Toscana)

description: Aromas of wild berry, blue flower, roasted coffee bean and coconut lead the nose. On the palate, dusty tannins offset dried black cherry, star anise and espresso. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit.
title: Fattoria Le Pupille 2017  Morellino di Scansano

description: Fruity aromas of ripe woodland berry and red plum mingle with scents of blue flower. Round and juicy, the savory supple palate offers succulent Marasca cherry, raspberry compote and baking spice alongside lithe tannins. It doesn't have any complexity, but it is delicious. Drink through 2019 to capture the succulent fruit.
title: Grillesino 2017 Battiferro  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Red-plum, wild-berry, eucalyptus and Mediterranean scrub aromas lead the nose. The easygoing palate offers crushed raspberry, black cherry and ground pepper set against supple tannins.
title: Morisfarms 2017  Morellino di Scansano

description: Aromas of wild berry and fragrant blue flower lead the nose. It's juicy and easygoing, offering ripe black cherry and hints of baking spice alongside soft tannins. Drink through 2020.
title: Fattoria San Felo 2017  Morellino di Scansano

description: Tilled soil, baking-spice and blackberry aromas take center stage on this young red along with a whiff of charcuterie. The easy-drinking medium-bodied palate offers Marasca cherry, clove and a hint of white pepper alongside soft pliant tannins. Drink through 2019.
title: Provveditore 2017 Irio  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Red berry, violet and a whiff of baking spice shape the nose. The straightforward palate offers ripe Marasca cherry, clove and ground pepper alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.
title: Poggio al Lupo 2017  Morellino di Scansano

description: Yellow peach, Mediterranean brush and a whiff sea breeze virtually leap out of the glass. Tangy and savory, the bright, medium-bodied palate doles out juicy apricot, pineapple and a hint of wild fennel. A tangy saline note marks the close.
title: Vigne Surrau 2017 Branu  (Vermentino di Gallura)

description: A fifty-fifty blend of Carignano and Monica, this savory red opens with aromas of Mediterranean scrub, wild berry and a whiff of sea breeze. The smooth juicy palate doles out raspberry compote, ripe black cherry and star anise alongside lithe tannins. Drink through 2019.
title: Pala 2017 Rosso Silenzio Red (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: Aromas of white spring flower, tropical fruit, Mediterranean brush and sea breeze almost jump out of the glass. The juicy palate shows more restraint but reflects the nose, doling out pineapple, grapefruit and a tangy saline note alongside tangy acidity. It closes on a bitter-almond note.
title: Mora & Memo 2017 Tino  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

description: Spring flower, yellow-peach and exotic fruit aromas lead the nose. Bright and savory, the juicy palate doles out apricot, honeydew melon, banana and a hint of saline.
title: Pedres 2017 Thilibas  (Vermentino di Gallura)

description: Aromas of white wildflower and yellow stone fruit mingle with a whiff of Mediterranean scrub. The juicy medium-bodied palate offers ripe apricot, yellow peach and citrus alongside a saline note. A hint of bitter almond marks the close.
title: Pala 2017 I Fiori  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

description: Aromas of white spring flower, white orchard fruit and citrus lead the nose. The juicy rounded palate offers peach, apricot and honeydew melon alongside a tangy hint of saline.
title: Mora & Memo 2017 Tino Sur Lie Vermentino (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: Spring flower and tropical-fruit aromas follow over to the bright savory palate along with yellow peach and apricot. It closes on a tangy saline note.
title: Mesa 2017 Giunco  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

description: Subtle aromas evoking Mediterranean brush, exotic fruit and a whiff of thyme lead the way. On the light-bodied palate, bright acidity lifts pineapple, lemon rind and a hint of grapefruit, while a note of bitter almond marks the close.
title: Sella & Mosca 2017 La Cala  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

description: Wild red-berry, myrtle and garrigue aromas demonstrate this wine's Sardinian origin. The medium-bodied palate offers ripe raspberry, juicy cranberry and dark culinary spice alongside polished tannins.
title: Argiolas 2017 Cardanera  (Carignano del Sulcis)

description: Made with Sangiovese and 5% Canaiolo Nero, this has enticing aromas of wild berry, fragrant purple flower, exotic spice and a whiff of new leather. It's bright and smooth, offering juicy wild cherry, ripe strawberry and baking spice while taut fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity lend balance. Drink 2020 - 2028.
title: Valdipiatta 2016  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: A pure expression of Sangiovese, this has aromas of ripe red berry, violet, star anise and a whiff of crushed herb. Tight and focused, the youthfully austere vibrant palate evokes Marasca cherry, pomegranate, licorice and ground clove while firm fine-grained tannins provide a polished backbone. Fresh acidity lends balance. Drink 2021 - 2031.
title: Valdipiatta 2016 Vigna d'Alfiero  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Scorched earth, eucalyptus, wild berry and a whiff of blue flower emerge from the glass. The straightforward palate evokes ripe morello cherry, baking spice and star anise framed in lithe tannins.
title: Val di Toro 2016 Reviresco  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Aromas of wild berry, blue flower, roasted coffee bean and coconut lead the nose. On the palate, dusty tannins offset dried black cherry, star anise and espresso. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit.
title: Fattoria San Felo 2016 Lampo  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Red-berry, forest-floor and Mediterranean brush aromas lift out of the glass. The juicy enjoyable palate doles out succulent Marasca cherry, raspberry and star anise alongside supple tannins. Enjoy through 2019.
title: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2016 Santa Maria  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Underbrush, ripe plum and toasted aromas lead the way. The simple fleeting palate offers suggestions of dried cherry and a hint of baking spice alongside dusty fleeting tannins and lively acidity.
title: Mocali 2016  Morellino di Scansano

description: Wild-berry, grilled herb and clove aromas lead the way. Bright and juicy, the simple palate offers ripe morello cherry, clove and star anise alongside dusty rather fleeting tannins.
title: Vignaioli del Morellino di Scansano 2016 Roggiano  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Aromas of dark berry, violet and cooking spice emerge from the glass. The vibrant palate offers crushed blackberry, licorice and clove alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2022.
title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2016 Rubrato Aglianico (Irpinia)

description: Dark berry, Mediterranean scrub and tangerine zest aromas carry over the juicy palate along with sour cherry and star anise. Fresh acidity adds backup while firm tannins provide the framework. Drink 2019 - 2024.
title: Villa Raiano 2016 Aglianico (Campania)

description: This wine opens with alluring aromas of violet, dark berry, nutmeg and thyme. The vibrant palate offers black cherry, licorice and clove alongside fine-grained tannins.
title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2016 Dal Re Aglianico (Irpinia)

description: Wild berry, violet, clove and aromatic herb aromas lead the way on this fragrant red. It's polished and delicious, doling out juicy raspberry, Marasca cherry and star anise alongside lithe tannins and bright acidity. It's made to be drunk young so enjoy soon to capture the succulent fruit.
title: Antoniolo 2016 Juvenia Nebbiolo (Coste della Sesia)

description: Polished and savory, this has fruity aromas of red and black-skinned berry that mix with a whiff of baking spice. The soft round palate doles out juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry and a hint of clove framed in lithe, velvety tannins.
title: Saracco 2016 Pinot Nero (Piemonte)

description: Opening with aromas of wild red berry, tilled earth and blue flower, this fresh, young Nebbiolo demonstrates the grape's more easygoing side. It's bright and silky, with juicy red-cherry, raspberry and star anise flavors accompanied by lithe tannins and tangy acidity. Drink through 2020.
title: Travaglini 2016 Nebbiolo (Coste della Sesia)

description: Made with Aglianico and Piedirosso, this has aromas of cedar, pine resin and dark berry. The firm palate offers ripe black plum, clove and a bitter-almond finish alongside close-grained tannins.
title: Marisa Cuomo 2016 Rosso Furore Red (Costa d'Amalfi)

description: Aromas of wild berry, dark spice, leather and a whiff of farmyard lead the nose. The easygoing if slightly rustic palate reflects the nose, evoking raspberry, game and clove alongside pliant, rather fleeting tannins.
title: Vigneti Zanatta 2016 Salana  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

description: Made with organically cultivated Sangiovese, this fragrant elegant red opens with enticing scents of underbrush, sunbaked earth, wild berry, violet, crushed mint and a balsamic whiff of camphor. Smooth and savory, the linear palate has surprising vibrancy for such a hot vintage, delivering juicy Marasca cherry, strawberry compote, star anise and white pepper. Elegant fine-grained tannins lend polished support while a coffee note lingers on the close. Drink through 2025.
title: Salcheto 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Wild-berry, new leather, truffle and clove aromas take center stage. Smooth and savory, the linear palate shows dried Marasca cherry, mature plum and licorice set against taut refined tannins. Drink through 2025.
title: Ambrogio e Giovanni Folonari 2015 Torcalvano  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Forest floor, mature plum, menthol and exotic spice aromas lift out of the glass. On the smooth, savory palate, fine-grained tannins wrap around dried cherry, prune and star anise. Drink through 2021.
title: Allegrini 2015 Palazzo della Torre Red (Veronese)

description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, baking spice, tilled soil, eucalyptus and a whiff of black olive fill the glass. The palate is linear, lean and elegant, offering dried morello cherry, raspberry, crushed herb and star anise alongside a gamy note. Taut close-grained tannins leave a firm finish. Drink 2020 - 2027.
title: Villa S. Anna 2015 Poldo  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: The nose is initially shy but a few swirls of the glass release subdued aromas of ripe blackberry, scorched earth and a whiff of oak-driven spice. Reflecting the hot vintage, the palate is rather evolved, offering dried cherry, prune, powdered sage and ground pepper alongside dusty tannins that leave a drying finish.
title: Morisfarms 2015 Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: This opens with aromas evoking stewed plum, leather, baking spice and a whiff of game. The linear, rather lean palate offers dried cherry, clove, thyme and truffle alongside dusty close-grained tannins.
title: Carpineto 2015 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: A blend of 85% Sangiovese and 15% Merlot, this has aromas of French oak, underbrush and spiced plum. The lean palate is rather austere, offering dried cherry, prune, licorice and a note of rusty iron set against taut close-grained tannins. Give the tannins a few years to unwind then drink to capture the remaining fruit flavors.
title: Triacca 2015 Santavenere Poderuccio  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: This has rather subdued aromas of leather, mocha, wild berry and a whiff of baking spice. The palate is on the lean side, offering dried cherry and star anise alongside lithe tannins. A coffee-bean note marks the close. Drink through 2022.
title: Tenute del Cerro 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Wild-berry, tobacco, clove and truffle aromas mingle with a whiff of oak. Lean and linear, the palate offers dried cherry, orange zest, toast, oak-driven spice and roasted coffee bean alongside close-grained tannins.
title: De' Ricci Cantine Storiche 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Toasted oak, underbrush, stewed plum and scorched earth aromas form the nose. Reflecting the nose, the lean linear palate offers prune, clove and roasted coffee bean alongside close-grained tannins that leave a drying finish.
title: Le Bertille 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Aromas of mature black-skinned fruit, clove and crushed herb waft out of the glass. The palate is lean and assertive, offering roasted coffee bean, star anise and a green note of powdered sage alongside just a hint of raw sour cherry. Grainy tannins leave an astringent finish.
title: Tenuta Santavenere 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Scorched underbrush, new leather, steeped prune and exotic spice aromas come to the forefront. Buffed and lean, the taut light-bodied palate offers dried cherry, clove, powdered sage and a hint of espresso alongside dusty but not very persistent tannins that still leave a drying finish.
title: Fattoria Svetoni 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Red-berry, underbrush, leather and eucalyptus aromas waft out of the glass. On the lean palate, fine-grained tannins accompany sour cherry, pomegranate, powdered sage and roasted coffee bean. It closes on an astringent note.
title: Grillesino 2015 Battiferro Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Aromas of scorched soil, grilled herb, celery and wild berry lead the way. The straightforward palate offers dried cherry, pomegranate and roasted coffee bean alongside pliant tannins. Drink sooner rather than later to enjoy the remaining fruit.
title: Doga delle Clavule 2015  Morellino di Scansano

description: Wild-berry, underbrush, menthol and used leather aromas lead the nose. Showing the heat of the vintage, the palate is rather evolved, suggesting dried cherry, prune, clove and a hint of game alongside soft, rather fleeting tannins. It closes on a note of roasted coffee bean. Drink sooner rather than later.
title: Villa S. Anna 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Red-berry, underbrush and light baking-spice aromas guide the nose. The straightforward, rather lean palate shows dried cherry, clove and a hint of crushed sage alongside dusty tannins that leave a somewhat astringent finish.
title: Fassati 2015 Pasiteo  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: This has aromas of stewed prune, spearmint and a whiff of scorched earth. The lively if rather rustic, simple palate offers raisin and licorice alongside dusty tannins.
title: Castellani 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Scorched earth, leather, underbrush and a balsamic note of camphor slowly take shape on this. The palate is lean-bodied and focused, offering sour cherry, cranberry and a hint of baking spice alongside fine-grained tannins and surprisingly bright acidity given the hot vintage. Give it time to fully come around. Drink 2023 - 2030.
title: Prunotto 2015 Bric Turot  (Barbaresco)

description: Aromas of exotic spice, menthol, blue flower and a whiff of woodland berry come together on the fragrant, elegantly structured wine. The tight focused palate delivers juicy red cherry, pomegranate, licorice, clove and a hint of espresso alongside firm close-grained tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance. Drink 2023 - 2033.
title: Oddero 2015 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

description: Invigorating aromas of red berry, wild mint, camphor and a whiff of rose lead the nose on this radiant red. Focused and elegant, the savory palate doles out juicy red cherry, strawberry compote, orange zest and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. It's ethereal and ready to enjoy now, but will also offer several years of drinking pleasure. Drink now - 2025.
title: Prunotto 2015  Barbaresco

description: Woodland berry, iris, violet, game and a whiff of tilled earth form the nose. The taut light-bodied palate offers juicy red cherry, star anise and a hint of rusted iron alongside tight polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2020 - 2025.
title: Fontanafredda 2015  Barbaresco

description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, leather and tilled soil. The juicy palate offers blackberry, clove and black pepper alongside polished tannins.
title: Fattoria La Rivolta 2015  Aglianico del Taburno

description: Made entirely with native grape Piedirosso, this opens with aromas of red berry, cooking spice and a whiff of smoke. The savory palate delivers red plum, clove and white pepper alongside pliant tannins.
title: Cantina del Taburno 2015 Piedirosso (Beneventano)

description: Aromas of French oak, cassis and coconut lead the nose. The palate is rather lean in terms of fruit richness, offering suggestions of raw sour cherry, pomegranate, powdered sage and oak-driven spice alongside bracing acidity.
title: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2014 Pietraregia dell'Ammiraglia Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Perfumed berry, menthol, pipe tobacco and blue flower are some of the aromas you'll find on this fragrant red. It's ethereal and racy, offering cranberry, sour cherry and baking spice set against an acidic backbone and taut fine-grained tannins. Give it a few more years to fully come together. Drink 2022 - 2029.
title: La Spinona 2014 Bricco Faset  (Barbaresco)

description: A fifty-fifty blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cannonau, this has earthy aromas of leather, tobacco, game, overripe black-skinned fruit and a funky but not unpleasant whiff of barnyard. The aromas carry over to the smooth juicy palate along with notes of clove and a hint of roasted coffee bean.
title: Sella & Mosca 2014 Tanca Farra Red (Alghero)

description: Aromas of mature dark-skinned berry, toast, culinary spice and a whiff of leather shape the nose. On the soft enveloping palate, supple tannins accompany fleshy morello cherry, clove and a hint of espresso. Drink through 2021.
title: Roccapesta 2013 Castelia  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Black-skinned fruit, grilled herb, mocha and toasted oak aromas shape the nose. The polished linear palate offers mature plum, red cherry, roasted coffee bean and clove alongside close-grained tannins that grip the close. Give the tannins a few years to unwind then drink.
title: Le Bertille 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Aromas of ripe plum, dark culinary spice and a whiff of French oak lead the nose. The medium-bodied palate delivers dried black cherry, mature blackberry and licorice alongside dusty tannins.
title: Fattoria Mantellassi 2013 Le Sentinelle Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Aromas of rose petal, baking spice, tilled soil, red berry and new leather shape the nose. It's taut, tense and loaded with finesse, evoking juicy red berry, licorice, blood orange and clove framed in bright acidity and fine-grained tannins. An iron note marks the close. Drink 2021 - 2033.
title: Ioppa 2013 Balsina  (Ghemme)

description: This opens with aromas of wild rose, perfumed berry, exotic spice, leather and a whiff of vanilla. It's taut and medium bodied, offering sour cherry, pomegranate, star anise and mint framed in tight fine-grained tannins that leave a firm, slightly drying finish. Drink 2021 - 2031.
title: Antoniolo 2013 La Castelle  (Gattinara)

description: Aromas of rose petal, woodland berry, camphor and wild herb lift out of the glass. Vibrant and focused, the linear elegant palate delivers crushed strawberry, red cherry, white pepper and star anise set against taut refined tannins. Bright acidity lends balance and tension. It's still youthfully tense and needs a few more years to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2020 - 2033.
title: Antoniolo 2013  Gattinara

description: Licorice, clove, new leather and tobacco aromas mingle with rose, chopped herb and woodland berry. Structured and savory, the vibrant, precise palate shows juicy Marasca cherry, cranberry, star anise and menthol alongside youthfully assertive but elegant tannins. An iron note lingers on the close. Drink 2023 - 2038.
title: Antoniolo 2013 San Francesco  (Gattinara)

description: Underbrush, leather, dark spice and menthol aromas shape the nose on this radiant red along with forest berry. The vibrant chiseled palate mirrors the nose, evoking wild strawberry, Marasca cherry, licorice and chopped mint. Firm polished tannins and bright acidity lend balance and tension. It's a stunning wine, loaded with class and finesse. Drink 2023 - 2038.
title: Antoniolo 2013 Osso San Grato  (Gattinara)

description: Made with 80% Aglianico and 20% Piedirosso, this opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, tobacco, and cooking spice. The savory palate offers blackberry jam, cocoa and cinnamon alongside fine-grained tannins.
title: Galardi 2013 Terra di Lavoro Red (Campania)

description: Chopped herb, red-berry and blue-flower aromas lift out of the glass along with a funky whiff of farmyard. The lean-bodied linear palate offers sour cherry, pomegranate, clove and a hint of iron alongside racy acidity and pliant tannins.
title: Anzivino 2013  Gattinara

description: Made entirely with Nebbiolo, this offers aromas of underbrush, new leather, scorched earth and camphor. On the firm, linear palate, taut fine-grained tannins support dried Marasca cherry, star anise, white pepper and tobacco. It's balanced, with fresh acidity. Drink 2020 - 2032.
title: Centovigne 2012 Castellengo Nebbiolo (Coste della Sesia)

description: This taut structured red has aromas of woodland berry, baking spice, forest floor and crushed stone. The medium-bodied, focused palate delivers juicy red cherry, strawberry, white pepper and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. A mineral note of crushed oyster shell lingers on the close. Drink 2020 - 2030.
title: Ca' Nova 2010  Ghemme

description: Aromas of menthol, exotic spice, new leather and pressed rose take center stage. The firm linear palate is rather austere, offering dried red berry, orange rind, sandalwood and licorice alongside close-grained tightly knit tannins that lead to a drying finish. Give the tannins a few more years to unwind then drink.
title: Ca' Nova 2009 San Quirico Red (Colline Novaresi)

description: This opens with aromas of dark-skinned fruit, wild berry and a whiff of baking spice. The ripe savory palate reflects the nose, doling out fleshy Marasca cherry, black berry and ground pepper set against dusty, rather drying tannins. Drink soon.
title: Erik Banti 2017 Spineto  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Woodland berry and grilled herb aromas lift out of the glass. Soft and juicy, the palate doles out succulent morello cherry and clove wrapped up in rounded tannins. Drink through 2020.
title: Bruni 2017 Marteto  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Round and fruity, this easygoing red, made with organically farmed grapes, opens with aromas suggesting ripe black-skinned berry, tilled earth and culinary spice. The dense soft palate doles out black-cherry jam, clove and a hint of star anise. Supple tannins lend light support. Drink through 2019 to capture the succulent fruit.
title: La Selva 2017  Morellino di Scansano

description: Aromas of wild red berry, star anise and wild herb follow over to the easygoing palate along with dried cherry and a hint of clove. Supple tannins offer light support. Drink soon.
title: Rocca delle Macie 2017 Campo Maccione  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Easygoing and savory, this juicy red doles out ripe Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry and cinnamon flavors. Soft round tannins lend light support. Drink now.
title: Vignaioli del Morellino di Scansano 2017 Vigna Benefizio  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of scorched earth, underbrush, leather and wild berry. On the palate, dusty drying tannins accompany dried black cherry, powdered aromatic herb and ground clove. Drink soon.
title: Poggio Maestrino e Spiaggiole 2017 Spiaggiole  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Soft and easy drinking, this opens with aromas of dark berry and white pepper. The round palate offers juicy Marasca cherry and clove alongside pliant tannins. Drink now.
title: Santa Lucia 2017 A Luciano  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Enticing scents of honeysuckle, apricot and tropical fruit almost leap out of the glass. The juicy rounded palate doles out pineapple, yellow peach and lemon drop while a hint of saline energizes the finish. It's incredibly delicious.
title: Vigne Surrau 2017 Superiore Sciala  (Vermentino di Gallura)

description: Aromas of apricot, white spring flower, exotic fruit and Mediterranean brush shape the nose on this delicious white. Rounded, full-bodied and enveloping, the smooth, elegant palate offers juicy yellow peach, pineapple and pink grapefruit alongside a tangy saline note that gives it a savory close.
title: Mesa 2017 Opale  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

description: Tropical-fruit, Mediterranean-scrub, flint and white-almond aromas take center stage on this juicy white. The round structured palate doles out succulent Bartlett pear, pineapple and lemon drop. A tangy saline note lifts the finish.
title: Siddura 2017 Spera  (Vermentino di Gallura)

description: This opens with dark berry and Mediterranean brush aromas. The juicy easygoing palate offers black cherry and star anise alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.
title: D'Aione 2017 Aglianico (Campania)

description: This smooth red opens with aromas evoking ripe dark-skinned berry, Mediterranean scrub and dark culinary spice. The medium-bodied palate offers mature blackberry and star anise alongside lithe tannins. Drink through 2020.
title: Cantina Mesa 2017 Buio  (Carignano del Sulcis)

description: This rounded red opens with subtle aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, scorched earth and a whiff of grilled herb. The straightforward palate reflects the nose, offering black cherry, white pepper and a hint of clove alongside light loose tannins before a rather dusty close.
title: Pala 2017 I Fiori  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

description: Vinous aromas of wild berry practically jump out of the glass. Smooth and juicy, the polished, straightforward palate doles out succulent blackberry, Marasca cherry and a hint of clove alongside soft, round tannins. Drink now.
title: Pala 2017 I Fiori  (Monica di Sardegna)

description: Fragrant and refined, this elegant red offers enticing scents of woodland berry, pressed rose, violet and culinary spice. The polished focused palate delivers ripe Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and clove set against precise fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020 - 2030.
title: Trerose 2016 Vigna Santa Caterina  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Made predominantly with Sangiovese, this opens with fruity aromas of black-skinned berry, mature plum and a whiff of baking spice. The dense rounded palate doles out black cherry, raspberry jam and a hint of clove alongside soft pliant tannins. Drink through 2022.
title: Roccapesta 2016 Roccapesta  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Aromas of ripe woodland berry, eucalyptus, violet and Mediterranean scrub lead the way. The tight linear palate offers mature Marasca cherry, dried sage and star anise framed in dusty, rather astringent tannins that leave a drying finish.
title: Poggio Maestrino e Spiaggiole 2016 Poggio Maestrino Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Smooth and easygoing, this opens with aromas of charred earth, toasted nut, grilled herb and pressed violet. The polished easy-drinking palate evokes fleshy red cherry and baking spice set against supple tannins. Drink soon.
title: Roccapesta 2016 Ribeo  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: This opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, violet and a whiff of exotic spice. On the easygoing palate, you'll find dried black cherry, toast and oak-driven spice alongside polished tannins.
title: Fattoria Mantellassi 2016 San Giuseppe  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, French oak and exotic spice lead the nose. Reflecting the aromas, the palate offers dried cherry, cassis, ground pepper and oak-driven spice alongside firm, close-grained tannins that clench the somewhat astringent finish.
title: Podere 414 2016  Morellino di Scansano

description: A blend of 85% Sangiovese and 15% Syrah, this has aromas suggesting wild berry, charred earth and used leather. The firm palate offers morello cherry, ground pepper and a hint of smoke alongside dusty tannins that leave a drying finish.
title: Castello Romitorio 2016 Tenuta Ghiaccio Forte  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: This opens with aromas evoking camphor, grilled herb, ripe berry and a whiff of cellar floor. The taut palate offers star anise, eucalyptus and dried cherry alongside taut dusty tannins that leave a firm drying finish.
title: Villa Poggio Salvi 2016 Vaio  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: This has aromas of toasted oak, mocha and a whiff of smoke. The firm palate is rather lean in terms of fruit richness, offering dried cherry, toast and oak-driven spice alongside assertive tannins that leave a drying finish. You'll also notice a green note of powdered sage on the close.
title: Provveditore 2016  Morellino di Scansano

description: Scorched earth, truffle, sea-breeze and overripe berry aromas lead the nose along with whiffs of barnyard. Reflecting the nose, the soft palate offers fleshy black cherry and gamy notes alongside hints of baking spice. Rounded but rather dusty tannins provide easygoing support. It's definitely earthy, with a rustic charm.
title: Terre di Talamo 2016 Tempo  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Beeswax, orchard fruit and a whiff suggesting kerosene lead the nose. There's a lot happening on the palate, which offers ripe pear, apple, citrus zest, vanilla and a hint of toasted almond. It's well structured and fresh, with an energizing mineral finish.
title: Siddura 2016 Maia  (Vermentino di Gallura)

description: This opens with subtle aromas of exotic fruit, apricot and a whiff of citrus that carry over to the tangy palate along with a candied note. Bitter almond and a hint of saline mark the close.
title: Vigneti Zanatta 2016 Le Saline  (Vermentino di Gallura)

description: Perfumed berry, tilled earth, pressed rose, new leather, cake spice and a balsamic note are just some of the aromas you'll find on this fragrant, delicious red. It's linear, structured and loaded with finesse, delivering ripe Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and tobacco. Taut refined tannins and fresh acidity provide an age-worthy framework. Drink 2022 - 2035.
title: Salcheto 2015 Vecchie Viti del Salco  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Balsamic aromas of eucalyptus mingle with spiced plum, new leather and underbrush. On the rounded, enveloping palate, notes of star anise, clove and roasted coffee bean accent dried cherry marinated in spirits while fine-grained tannins provide the framework.
title: Il Conventino 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Mature plum and baking-spice aromas mingle with fragrant purple flowers, new leather and a whiff of tilled soil. On the earthy savory palate, taut fine-grained tannins underscore fleshy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice, dried aromatic herb and a hint of game. Drink 2020 - 2027.
title: Romeo 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: A blend of 90% Corvina Veronese and 10% Oseleta, this alluring red opens with aromas of wild berry, tobacco and a whiff of coffee bean. It's elegant and full bodied, offering ripe plum, black cherry, star anise and ground pepper alongside taut fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.
title: Allegrini 2015 La Grola Red (Veronese)

description: Initially rather shy, this eventually offers aromas of mature black-skinned fruit, pipe tobacco and a whiff of new leather. The enveloping palate evokes dried cherry, prune, clove and a note of star anise alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2023.
title: Boscarelli 2015 Il Nocio  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Here's a soulful blend of Sangiovese mixed with 10% Canaiolo and Mammolo that offers aromas of underbrush, used leather, sunbaked earth, prune and a whiff of mocha. Reflecting the nose, the earthy palate evokes dried cherry, prune, truffle, cake spice and tobacco. The buffed fine-grained tannins creep up on you, leaving a rather dusty drying finish.
title: Casale Daviddi 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Aromas of exotic spice, crushed herb, menthol and rose petal form the nose. The palate is lean, linear but elegant, offering dried cherry, sage and orange zest while licorice and espresso notes provide backup. Taut fine-grained tannins lend firm support. Drink 2022 - 2028.
title: Bindella 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: This offers aromas of ripe black plum, blue flower and exotic spice. The round juicy palate shows mature black cherry, prune and baking spice alongside supple fine-grained tannins. It's already accessible so drink over the next few years to enjoy the fruit flavors.
title: Gattavecchi 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Subtle aromas of ripe forest berry, scorched earth, exotic spice and a balsamic whiff of camphor lead the nose. The linear palate offers dried black cherry, ground pepper and a hint of grilled herb alongside fine-grained tannins.
title: Boscarelli 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Leather, graphite, crushed herb and spiced plum aromas lead the nose. The aromas follow over to the palate along with dried cherry, oak and star anise while polished tannins lend support. Drink through 2025.
title: Lunadoro 2015 Pagliareto  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Pressed rose, new leather, botanical herb and plum-cake aromas shape the nose. The austere medium-bodied palate is on the lean side, offering dried cherry, prune, licorice and a hint of espresso set against close-grained tannins that grip the finish.
title: Poggio alla Sala 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Plum-cake, French oak, rose and leather aromas lift out of the glass. The oak aroma carries over to the palate, along with dried cherry, licorice and espresso. It's rather austere, with tight close-grained tannins that grip the finish.
title: De' Ricci Cantine Storiche 2015 Soraldo  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Earthy aromas of scorched soil, underbrush, leather, spiced prune and a whiff of toasted nut follow over to the firm palate along with dried cherry and a hint of powdered sage. Dusty tannins leave a drying finish.
title: Gattavecchi 2015 Riserva dei Padri Serviti  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: French oak, mature plum, roasted coffee-bean and coconut aromas form the nose. The aromas carry over to the firm austere palate along with prune, vanilla and a hint of mocha. Tightly knit, close-grained tannins leave a drying finish. Give the tannins another few years to unwind then drink to capture the remaining fruit.
title: Poggio alla Sala 2015 Parceto  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals subdued aromas of cassis, wild herb and oak-driven spice. Polished and straightforward, the medium-bodied palate is on the lean side, suggesting dried morello cherry, ground pepper, crushed sage and a hint of coffee bean alongside fine-grained tannins that leave a drying finish.
title: Ventisei 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Aromas recalling scorched forest floor, toast, leather and grilled herb form the nose. On the medium-bodied palate, polished pliant tannins accompany Marasca cherry, roasted coffee bean and a hint of tobacco. Drink through 2025.
title: Fassati 2015 Gersemi  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: French oak, prune, new leather and dark culinary-spice aromas set the tone. It's taut, linear and focused, offering dried cherry, star anise, tobacco and espresso set against a backbone of firm close-grained tannins that grip the finish.
title: Poggio alla Sala 2015 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Underbrush, pressed iris and baked plum aromas come together on this. It's round and soft, offering flavors of prune, dried cherry and hints of coffee and clove while round pliant tannins give light support. Drink soon.
title: Santa Lucia 2015 Tore del Moro Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Aromas of French oak, dried thyme and a whiff of cellar floor emerge in the glass. The palate is lean and linear, offering incense, star anise, prune and roasted coffee bean, plus grainy tannins that leave a drying finish.
title: Talosa 2015 Alboreto  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Woodland berry, blue flower, sunbaked soil and a whiff of dark spice shape the nose. Structured and extremely elegant, the focused, impeccable palate doles out juicy red cherry, strawberry, baking spice and star anise set against taut polished tannins that provide seamless support. It's well balanced, with fresh acidity. It's already tempting but hold for even more complexity. Drink 2022 - 2032.
title: Gaja 2015  Barbaresco

description: This opens with aromas of truffle, cellar floor and a whiff of wild berry. It's rather rustic, offering raw sour cherry, powdered sage, a hint of clove and a gamy note alongside dusty drying tannins that leave a rough finish.
title: Fanetti - Tenuta S. Agnese 2015 Tenuta S. Agnese  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: This opens with a potpourri of red berry, rose, menthol and exotic spice aromas. Juicy and elegantly structured, the smooth palate doles out juicy Marasca cherry, ripe strawberry, white pepper and star anise. Taut but polished tannins provide the framework. Drink 2021 - 2030.
title: Musso 2015 Rio Sordo  (Barbaresco)

description: Classic Nebbiolo aromas of wild berry, new leather, dark culinary spice and a whiff of tilled earth pave the way. The polished medium-bodied palate delivers dried black cherry, cranberry, licorice and chopped fennel alongside taut fine-grained tannins. A salty mineral note lingers on the finish. It cries out for food. Drink 2021 - 2027.
title: Adriano Marco & Vittorio 2015 Basarin  (Barbaresco)

description: This opens with enticing scents of fragrant blue flower, chopped mint, woodland berry and a whiff of exotic spice. Linear and elegantly structured, the vibrant, focused palate delivers crushed raspberry, juicy red cherry, licorice and baking spice. Taut fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity provide seamless support and balance. Drink 2023 - 2035.
title: Ceretto 2015 Asili  (Barbaresco)

description: Violet, pipe tobacco, woodland berry and sandalwood aromas form an enticing bouquet. It's linear and radiant, delivering cranberry, red cherry, cake spice, star anise and chopped herb. Firm, fine-grained tannins provide the framework. Drink 2023 - 2030.
title: Sottimano 2015 Basarin  (Barbaresco)

description: This has classic Nebbiolo aromas of dark-skinned berry, fragrant blue flower, baking spice, new leather and menthol. The firm focused palate delivers dried black cherry, cranberry, licorice and white pepper set against a backbone of youthfully austere fine-grained tannins. Give it a few more years to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2025 - 2035.
title: Sottimano 2015 Fausoni  (Barbaresco)

description: Rose, violet, ripe berry, truffle, menthol and exotic spice aromas form and enticing fragrance. The delicious structured palate doles out succulent black cherry, wild raspberry, licorice and cinnamon while tightly knit fine-grained tannins provide the backbone. Fresh acidity gives it balance and tension. Drink 2021 - 2030.
title: Fontanafredda 2015 Coste Rubin  (Barbaresco)

description: Fragrant blue flower, dark spice, perfumed berry and cedar are just some of the aromas you'll find on this elegant red. The structured savory palate delivers crushed raspberry, black cherry, blood orange, white pepper and licorice framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2023 - 2035.
title: Michele Chiarlo 2015 Asili  (Barbaresco)

description: Delicate tantalizing scents of woodland berry, rose petal, iris and exotic spice mingle with new leather and a balsamic whiff of cedar. The palate is ethereal, delivering cranberry, red cherry, star anise, brown pepper and crushed herb alongside tight fine-grained tannins. It's still youthfully austere and needs time to come around and develop even more complexity. Drink 2025 - 2035.
title: Cascina delle Rose 2015 Tre Stelle  (Barbaresco)

description: Fragrant and focused, this offers tantalizing aromas of rose, violet, woodland berry and Asian incense. Firm and linear, the chiseled palate evokes red cherry, cranberry, star anise and a hint of white pepper set against tightly wound fine-grained tannins. It's still young and austere but balanced, with vibrant acidity. Give it ample time to fully develop. Drink 2023 - 2038.
title: Sottimano 2015 Curra   (Barbaresco)

description: The nose is initially shy but slowly reveals wild berry, exotic incense, aromatic herb and a whiff of toast. The firm palate is more expressive and is all about elegance, delivering crushed red cherry, raspberry compote, cinnamon and star anise while taut, fine-grained tannins provide support. It's extremely young but already tempting so hold for even more complexity and to let the tannins unwind. Drink 2023 - 2035.
title: Sottimano 2015 Cotta   (Barbaresco)

description: This offers aromas of exotic spice, fragrant blue flower, dark-skinned fruit and menthol. On the savory palate, taut fine-grained tannins support mature black cherry, blood orange, licorice, vanilla and hint of game while fresh acidity lends tension. Drink 2023 - 2030.
title: Michele Chiarlo 2015 Faset  (Barbaresco)

description: Beautiful aromas of fragrant blue flower, rose, perfumed berry and dark spice form the nose. Juicy and elegantly structured, the savory focused palate doles out ripe Marasca cherry, black raspberry, licorice and a hint of tobacco. Taut polished tannins provide the framework while fresh acidity lends balance. Drink 2022 - 2035.
title: Rizzi 2015 Pajore  (Barbaresco)

description: Wild berry, camphor, star anise and forest floor aromas lead the way. Smooth and elegant, the taut polished palate doles out dried cherry, blood orange, licorice and tobacco while fine-grained tannins provide the framework. Drink 2021 - 2030.
title: Cascina Luisin 2015 Rabaja   (Barbaresco)

description: Intense and alluring aromas of iris, violet and strawberry take center stage. It's juicy and elegant, doling out Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, baking spice and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021 - 2027.
title: Marchesi di Barolo 2015 Tradizione  (Barolo)

description: Menthol, dark-skinned berry, violet and dark culinary spice are just some of the aromas you'll find on this elegantly structured red. The savory polished palate delivers juicy black cherry, licorice, tobacco and a hint of espresso set against fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021 - 2027.
title: Marchesi di Barolo 2015 Serragrilli  (Barbaresco)

description: Wild berry, fragrant blue flower, cake spice and a whiff of camphor pave the way. Linear, structured and elegant, the palate delivers juicy red cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and a hint of tobacco. It's still young but already well balanced, with fresh acidity and youthfully austere but refined tannins. Drink 2023 - 2030.
title: Figli Luigi Oddero 2015 Rambone  (Barbaresco)

description: Iris, woodland berry and a whiff of new leather are just some of the intense, enticing aromas that you'll find on this elegant red. Smooth and structured, the focused palate offers red cherry, cranberry, licorice and a note of white pepper framed in taut tannins.
title: Adriano Marco & Vittorio 2015 Sanadaive  (Barbaresco)

description: This opens with earthy aromas of forest floor, woodland berry, blue flower and a whiff of game. Reflecting the nose, the taut chewy palate offers juicy black cherry, truffle and dark culinary spice alongside firm fine-grained tannins. Drink 2023 - 2030.
title: Michele Chiarlo 2015 Reyna  (Barbaresco)

description: Enticing aromas of violet, red berry and clove lead the nose while the vibrant palate offers raspberry jam, star anise and black pepper. Fine-grained tannins support the savory flavors.
title: Antonio Caggiano 2015 Campi Taurasini Salae Domini Aglianico (Irpinia)

description: Crushed herb, camphor, new leather and woodland berry aromas lead the nose. The linear vibrant palate shows sour cherry, cranberry and star anise in youthfully assertive close-grained tannins that leave a rather drying finish.
title: Bersano 2015 Mantico  (Barbaresco)

description: Pressed rose, wild berry, new leather and camphor aromas slowly appear on this polished, structured red. The taut palate delivers black cherry, crushed raspberry and star anise set against tightly knit, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021 - 2030.
title: Cascina Luisin 2015 Paolin  (Barbaresco)

description: Aromas of exotic spice, crushed mint and iris lead the nose. It's firmly structured, delivering dried cherry, cranberry, licorice and espresso alongside tight fine-grained tannins. You'll also find a note of powdered sage on the firm close. It's still youthfully austere and needs time to unwind. Drink 2023 - 2035.
title: Cascina Luisin 2015 Asili  (Barbaresco)

description: Exotic spice, coconut, dark-skinned berry and camphor aromas come together in the glass. It's still young and primary, offering black cherry, plum, vanilla and licorice alongside tight-knit fine-grained tannins. Drink after 2025.
title: Musso 2015 Pora  (Barbaresco)

description: This opens with aromas of ripe dark fruit, eucalyptus and leather. The juicy palate delivers black cherry jam, clove and black pepper. It's well balanced, with fresh acidity and fine-grained tannins.
title: Terre Stregate 2015 Manent Aglianico (Sannio)

description: Made with organically farmed grapes, fermented in amphora and aged in both French and Slavonian oak barrels, this opens with aromas of French oak, coconut, exotic spice and plum. Smooth and chewy, the full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and roasted coffee bean alongside rather close-grained tannins that leave a drying finish.
title: Olianas 2015 Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

description: This fragrant red offers enticing scents of eucalyptus, mature black-skinned berry, Mediterranean brush and carob. On the full-bodied, chewy palate, velvety tannins wrap around blackberry, prune and licorice. You'll also notice the warmth of evident alcohol before the dusty drying finish.
title: Ferruccio Deiana 2015 Sileno Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

description: Wild berry, baking spice and blue-flower aromas come together on this linear red. The rather lean-bodied palate evokes sour cherry, blood orange and espresso alongside taut, close-grained tannins.
title: Ceretto 2015  Barbaresco

description: Blue- flower, red woodland berry, wild herb and dark culinary-spice aromas lead the nose. The solid palate delivers ripe black cherry, star anise and clove hint of carob alongside tightly knit close-grained tannins. Drink 2021 - 2027.
title: Pertinace 2015 Marcarini  (Barbaresco)

description: Subdued aromas of dark berry, espresso and tobacco lead the nose. The solid palate offers dried black cherry, roasted coffee bean and cooking spice alongside close-grained tannins.
title: Cantina del Taburno 2015 Delius  (Aglianico del Taburno)

description: This 100% Pallagrello Nero opens with aromas of ripe black fruit, cooking spice and underbrush. The firm palate offers roasted coffee bean, vanilla and black plum alongside close-grained tannins.
title: Vestini Campagnano 2015 Pallagrello Nero (Terre del Volturno)

description: Aromas of toasted oak, baked plum and vanilla lead the nose. The assertive palate offers black cherry jam, cake spice and espresso alongside grainy, rather astringent tannins.
title: Cantina del Taburno 2015 Blue Apis  (Aglianico del Taburno)

description: Aromas reminiscent of underbrush, tilled earth, red berry and crushed herb lead the way. The straightforward palate suggests dried cherry and fennel alongside solid but not extremely persistent tannins. It has a tight, mouth drying finish.
title: Pertinace 2015  Barbaresco

description: This opens with earthy aromas of scorched soil, leather, game and a whiff of barnyard. The aromas carry over to the juicy palate along with fleshy black cherry and clove while rounded tannins offer gentle support before it closes on a drying note. It has a rustic charm but is full of personality.
title: Pala 2015 Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

description: Made with 90% Aglianico, 5% Sangiovese and 5% Merlot, this opens with aromas of dark-skinned fruit, underbrush and cooking spice. The straightforward palate delivers ripe black plum and clove alongside solid tannins.
title: Cantina del Taburno 2015 Fidelis  (Aglianico del Taburno)

description: Enticing scents of baking spice, pressed violet and wild berry take center stage on this fragrant elegant red. The smooth savory palate doles out juicy black cherry, ripe blackberry and licorice alongside polished fine-grained tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Drink through 2026.
title: Boscarelli 2014 Sotto Casa Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Aromas of oak, spiced plum, forest floor, rose and a whiff of new leather appear in the glass. The elegant polished palate offers tart cherry, pomegranate, star anise and espresso accompanied by lithe tannins. It's already accessible but will also offer several years of enjoyment. Drink through 2024.
title: Lunadoro 2014 Quercione Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Packaged in an exceedingly heavy bottle, this has delicate aromas evoking prune, exotic spice and moist soil. The linear palate is rather lean and ethereal, offering dried cherry, licorice and espresso. Close-grained tannins leave a somewhat drying finish.
title: Tenute del Cerro 2014 Antica Chiusina  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Menthol, woodland berry, blue flower and a whiff of ground pepper lead the nose. Vibrant and linear, the savory elegant palate has good intensity, offering juicy red cherry, pomegranate, star anise and a hint of tobacco. Taut fine-grained tannins and bright acidity provide structure and balance. Drink 2021 - 2029.
title: Cantina del Pino 2014  Barbaresco

description: Dark spice, red fruit, tobacco and menthol aromas lead the way. Firmly structured and linear, the elegant palate delivers pomegranate, cranberry, licorice and a hint of espresso set against bright acidity and tightly wound fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022 - 2034.
title: Cantina del Pino 2014 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

description: This boasts an intense fragrance composed of graphite, pressed rose, star anise, new leather, crushed herb and dark spice aromas. The enveloping palate doles out juicy cherry, cranberry, licorice and white pepper framed in tight fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2022 - 2032.
title: Cantina del Pino 2014 Albesani  (Barbaresco)

description: Aromas of underbrush, dark berry, new leather and a whiff of camphor waft out of the glass. The tense chiseled palate evokes Marasca cherry, raspberry, star anise and a hint of cinnamon alongside polished fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2022 - 2032.
title: Gaja 2014 Conteisa  (Barolo)

description: Toast, pressed rose, dark spice and wild berry aromas form the nose. Polished and structured, the elegant palate delivers raspberry compote, sour cherry, licorice and a hint of tobacco framed in taut fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021 - 2029.
title: Pio Cesare 2014  Barbaresco

description: Racy and focused, this has aromas of exotic spice, coconut and star anise. The aromas carry over to the elegantly structured linear palate along with sour cherry and cranberry set against fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity.
title: Cantina del Pino 2014 Ovello  (Barbaresco)

description: Aromas of tobacco, leather and ripe dark fruit lead the nose. The firm palate offers prune, clove and coconut alongside a backbone of assertive close-grained tannins that grip the finish.
title: Quintodecimo 2014 Terra d'Eclano Aglianico (Irpinia)

description: This earthy red opens with aromas of leather, tilled soil, ripe black-skinned fruit and a whiff of barnyard. The aromas carry over to the juicy palate along with mature Marasca cherry, crushed black olive and dark spice. It has a rustic charm but it's also smooth and savory.
title: Pala 2014 Essentija Bovale (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: Aromas of ripe dark berry, cedar and white pepper emerge from the glass on this 50-50 blend of Aglianico and Piedirosso. The dense palate delivers blackberry jam, toasted oak and roasted coffee bean.
title: Marisa Cuomo 2014 Rosso Furore Riserva Red (Costa d'Amalfi)

description: Made with 70% Piedirosso and 30% Aglianico, this has aromas of red berry, cedar and black pepper. The palate shows raspberry jam, toasted oak and roasted coffee bean alongside bracing tannins.
title: Marisa Cuomo 2014 Rosso Ravello Riserva Red (Costa d'Amalfi)

description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, roasted coffee bean and vanilla. The dense palate offers prune, clove and espresso alongside close-grained tannins.
title: Trabucco 2014 Rapicano Aglianico (Falerno del Massico)

description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals aromas of dark-skinned fruit and cake spice. The buffed, smooth palate offers dried cherry and star anise while soft tannins offer light support. Drink soon.
title: Mandrolisai 2014 Kent'Annos  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

description: This has subtle aromas suggesting green bell pepper and cassis. On the dense, medium-bodied palate, close-grained tannins offset dried Marasca cherry, grilled pepper and clove before a rather dusty finish.
title: Cecchi 2013 La Mora Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: A blend of Sangiovese, Canaiolo and Mammolo, this offers aromas suggesting spiced plum, leather, grilled herb and a whiff of toasted oak. The accessible linear palate presents dried cherry, oak-driven spice and spearmint alongside close-grained if somewhat fleeting tannins that leave a drying finish.
title: Cantina del Giusto 2013 San Claudio II Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Filled with rustic charm, this has earthy aromas of truffle, leather, a whiff of wet fur and a note of spiced plum. Reflecting the nose, the ripe chewy palate offers black cherry, prune extract, ground clove and a funky hint of game alongside dusty tannins.
title: Casale Daviddi 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Aromas evoking stewed prune and nail polish follow over to the palate along with game, black olive and a hint of barnyard. It's evolved, with dusty fleeting tannins a slightly astringent but fleeting finish.
title: Casale Daviddi 2013 Camaione  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: This opens with aromas of stewed prune, carob, leather and a whiff of truffle. The firm palate is already evolved, offering dried cherry, powdered thyme, toast and roasted coffee bean alongside grainy tannins that leave a drying, dusty finish.
title: Lombardo 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Menthol, rose, wild berry, aromatic herb and new leather aromas form the nose on this fragrant red. Juicy and linear, the palate doles out black raspberry, cherry compote, licorice and baking spice. It's structured and balanced, with taut polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021 - 2033.
title: Adriano Marco & Vittorio 2013 Basarin  (Barbaresco)

description: Enticing mature dark berry, tobacco, forest floor and leather lead the nose. The concentrated, generous palate delivers blackberry jam, clove, star anise and ground pepper alongside polished, silky tannins. Drink 2020 - 2030.
title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2013 Serpico Aglianico (Irpinia)

description: Dark-skinned berry, menthol, new leather and a whiff of pipe tobacco lead the nose. Elegantly structured, the tight linear palate offers crushed raspberry, red cherry and star anise framed in firm fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. It's still youthfully austere and will be even better in a few more years. Drink 2021 - 2033.
title: Antica Casa Vinicola Scarpa 2013 Tettineive  (Barbaresco)

description: Fragrant blue flower, aromatic herb and a whiff of camphor come together in the glass. The focused, elegant palate delivers juicy red cherry, cranberry, white pepper and star anise alongside polished tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2021 - 2033.
title: Ioppa 2013 Santa Fe  (Ghemme)

description: Aromas of dark berry, blue flower and a whiff of charred earth lead the nose. The easygoing palate offers Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry and Mediterranean herb alongside pliant tannins.
title: Fontanavecchia 2013  Aglianico del Taburno

description: Dark berry, espresso and cooking-spice aromas emerge from the glass. The savory ripe palate offers raspberry jam, raisin and vanilla alongside polished tannins.
title: Montesole 2013 Sairus Aglianico (Irpinia)

description: Aromas of chocolate, truffle, toast and culinary spice form the nose along with a whiff of leather. The firm polished palate evokes black cherry extract, prune, licorice and orange slice alongside fine-grained tannins that envelope the finish.
title: Romeo 2012 Lipitiresco  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Exotic incense, sunbaked earth, new leather, eucalyptus and dried herb are just some of the aromas to discover on this fragrant red. The aromas carry through to the fresh polished palate along with dried black cherry, cinnamon, tobacco and an iron note. Refined tannins provide seamless support and finesse. Drink through 2031.
title: Anzivino 2011 Riserva  (Gattinara)

description: Baking-spice, violet, wild berry and grilled herb aromas form the nose. The polished linear palate evokes dried cherry, blood orange, licorice and vanilla alongside dusty tannins that leave a rather drying finish.
title: Ca' Nova 2009 Riserva  (Ghemme)

description: Ripe black-skinned fruit, eucalyptus and Mediterranean scrub aromas shape the nose. The rounded straightforward palate doles out fleshy Marasca cherry and licorice accompanied by dusty tannins. Drink through 2019.
title: Fattoria Mantellassi 2017 Mentore  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Smooth and full-bodied, this delicious white boasts enticing scents of spring wild flower, exotic fruit and Mediterranean scrub. On the tangy, enveloping palate, a saline-like mineral note and fresh acidity brightens juicy pineapple, candied lemon drop, mature apricot, fennel and aromatic herb. Delicious.
title: Argiolas 2017 Is Argiolas  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

description: Smooth, fragrant and utterly delicious, this opens with heady aromas of vineyard dust, blue flower and wild berry. The savory juicy palate doles out succulent Marasca cherry, blackberry, baking spice, star anise and Mediterranean herb alongside lithe polished tannins. It's not complex, but it's silky and chock-full of flavor.
title: Mora & Memo 2017 Nau  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

description: Pronounced aromas of Spanish broom, exotic fruit, lemon rind and Mediterranean brush take center stage on this savory white. The round full-bodied palate doles out grapefruit, pineapple, apricot, wild herb and ginger. It closes on a note of star anise. This is a big white so rather than pouring as an aperitif, pair it with substantial fish recipes, rice-based dishes or white meat.
title: Argiolas 2017 Isellis  (Nasco di Cagliari)

description: Fragrant spring flower, tropical fruit and a whiff of Mediterranean-scrub aromas lead the way. The savory succulent palate offers pineapple, lemon rind and apple alongside an almond note. Tangy acidity lifts the finish while a saline note marks the close.
title: Ferruccio Deiana 2017 Arvali  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

description: Aromas of banana, tropical fruit, white spring flower and a whiff of vineyard dust lead the nose. On the full-bodied savory palate, you'll find ripe cantaloupe, juicy pineapple and Mediterranean scrub, while a bitter-almond note wraps up the finish.
title: Pala 2017 Stellato Nature Vermentino (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: Tropical fruit, banana and yellow stone-fruit aromas lead over to the enveloping full-bodied palate along with ripe apricot and nectarine. Notes of saline and bitter almond lend depth to the finish. This cries out for food and would work better with savory first courses and lighter second courses as opposed to serving as an aperitif.
title: Pala 2017 Stellato  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

description: Made with rare native grape Cagnulari, this Sardinian red has aromas of wild black-skinned berry, Mediterranean scrub and dark culinary spice. The lively easygoing palate offers ripe blackberry, spiced blueberry, tangy blood orange and a hint of clove alongside pliant tannins.
title: Santa Maria La Palma 2017 Cagnulari (Alghero)

description: Delicate aromas of truffle, wild berry, violet and espresso lead the nose. The elegant palate delivers ripe morello cherry, raspberry compote and star anise framed in lithe tannins.
title: Erik Banti 2016 Ciabatta  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Enticing scents of underbrush, wild berry, rose, iris and a whiff of tilled soil all come together on this fragrant red, made with organically farmed grapes. Full bodied and rather lively, the palate offers ripe black cherry, raspberry jam and baking spice. Lithe, easygoing tannins provide light support while bright acidity gives it a tangy close. Drink through 2020.
title: Erik Banti 2016 Spineto  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Aromas of baked plum, roasted coffee bean, grilled herb and French oak lead the way. Reflecting the nose, the palate offers prune, dried cherry, grilled sage and espresso alongside close-grained but rather fleeting tannins that leave a drying finish.
title: Santa Lucia 2016 Tore del Moro  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Stewed prune, withered violet and culinary-spice aromas follow over to the firm palate along with dried cherry, a green note of powdered sage and evident alcohol. Solid, dusty tannins leave a drying astringent finish.
title: Conte Ferdinando Guicciardini 2016 Massi di Mandorlaia  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: A blend of 75% Bovale and 25% Carignano, this opens with aromas of Mediterranean scrub, wild berry and dark baking spice. Full bodied and savory, the smooth chewy palate doles out juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry jam, vanilla and a hint of mocha alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2020.
title: Olianas 2016 Perdixi Red (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: Aromas of red berry, Marasca cherry and ground pepper follow over to the juicy easygoing palate. Smooth tannins lend gentle support.
title: Mesa 2016 Primo Scuro  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

description: A blend of Vermentino and Nasco, this unusual, full-bodied white has aromas of mature yellow stone fruit, orange rind and yellow wild flower. Round and enveloping, it glides across the palate, offering dried apricot, grapefruit and a note of candied-tangerine drop.
title: Ferruccio Deiana 2016 Pluminus White (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: Made with 50% Vermentino, 30% Chardonnay and 20% Malvasia, this big white has a shy nose that eventually shows aromas suggesting beeswax and tropical fruit. The aromas carry over to the soft full-bodied palate along with ripe peach, vanilla and a candied note.
title: Pala 2016 Entemari White (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: A blend of 85% Monica, 10% Carignano and 5% Bovale, this full-bodied red has aromas of ripe red berry, sunbaked earth and dark cooking spice. The structured palate delivers mature morello cherry, clove and a hint of espresso alongside taut, fine-grained tannins.
title: Argiolas 2016 Superiore Iselis  (Monica di Sardegna)

description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this offers enticing aromas of exotic spice, ripe black-skinned fruit, tilled soil, French oak and a whiff of leather. The full-bodied palate boasts structure, elegance and tension, delivering juicy wild cherry, raspberry, star anise and espresso set against firm fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022 - 2030.
title: Boscarelli 2015 Costa Grande  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Alluring aromas of black-skinned berry, forest floor, oak and exotic spice shape the nose. On the elegantly structured, focused palate, polished fine-grained tannins support dried black cherry, raspberry compote, clove and cinnamon while a hint of espresso lingers on the close. It's already tempting, but give it a few more years to develop even more complexity. Drink 2021 - 2030.
title: Avignonesi 2015 Progetto di Sopra  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Crushed mint, toasted oak, camphor, wild-berry and dark-spice aromas meld together in the glass. The rounded full-bodied palate doles out layers of fleshy black cherry, ripe plum, oak-driven spice and espresso alongside polished well-integrated tannins. It closes on a star anise note. Drink through 2025.
title: Canneto 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Aromas of rose, iris, wild berry, truffle and a whiff of game all take shape on this earthy refined red. Smooth and savory, the succulent palate delivers crushed raspberry, fleshy Marasca cherry and baking spice framed in elegant, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.
title: Fattoria Le Pupille 2015 Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Aromas of forest floor, roasted coffee bean, new leather and camphor meld with violet and wild berry. Soft and full bodied, the palate provides cherry marinated in spirits, prune, espresso and licorice alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2022.
title: Icario 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Forest floor, ripe black plum, baking spice and a balsamic note form the nose. The brooding palate offers dried cherry, prune, sandalwood and licorice framed in firm fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022 - 2027.
title: Cantina del Giusto 2015 San Claudio II  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Plum, cassis, mocha, underbrush and Asian spice aromas mingle with a whiff of eucalyptus. The taut full-bodied palate shows dried cherry, black currant, star anise, clove and espresso framed in tightly wound, grainy tannins. Drink 2021 - 2028.
title: Nottola 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Aromas of scorched earth, ripe plum, new leather and baking spice fill the glass. The full-bodied accessible palate offers dried black cherry, prune and licorice set against polished tannins. Drink through 2022.
title: Val delle Rose 2015 Poggio al Leone Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: A blend of 85% Sangiovese and 15% Merlot, this has aromas of baked plum, leather and a balsamic whiff of eucalyptus. Soft, juicy and full bodied, the palate offers black cherry, prune and licorice alongside velvety tannins. It's already hit its ideal drinking window so enjoy sooner rather than later.
title: La Selva 2015 Colli dell'Uccellina Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: This opens with aromas evoking baked plum, exotic spice, new leather and coconut. The taut palate offers French oak, prune, dried cherry, espresso and licorice framed in tight close-grained tannins that give it a firm drying finish.
title: Talosa 2015 Filai Lunghi  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Truffle, forest floor, grilled herb and a whiff of mature plum lead the nose. The solid juicy palate presents dried Marasca cherry, ripe cranberry and hints of baking spice framed in rounded fine-grained tannins that leave a drying close.
title: Val di Toro 2015 Reviresco Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: This opens with aromas of steeped prune, truffle and a whiff of graphite. Reflecting the nose, the firm lean palate offers dried cherry, espresso and licorice. You'll also notice the heat of evident alcohol. It's already evolved so drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit.
title: Conte Ferdinando Guicciardini 2015 Massi di Mandorlaia Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: This has subdued aromas evoking mature black-skinned fruit, dark spice and a whiff of camphor. Tight and restrained, the firm palate offers dried cherry, espresso and powdered sage set against assertive close-grained tannins that clench the finish. Give the tannins another year or two then drink to capture the remaining fruit.
title: Viticcio 2015  Morellino di Scansano

description: This offers aromas of pressed violet, berry and a whiff of dark spice. Mirroring the nose, the straightforward palate evokes dried black cherry, star anise and powdered sage alongside dusty grainy tannins that leave a drying finish.
title: Vignaioli del Morellino di Scansano 2015 Sicomoro Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: This opens with aromas of French oak, coconut and spiced plum. It's full bodied but lean, offering prune, oak-driven spice, thyme and espresso but it's shy on fruit richness. Grainy tannins leave an astringent finish.
title: Lombardo 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Dark-skinned berry, pipe tobacco, a hint of menthol and a whiff of blue flower slowly take shape in the glass. Full bodied, with the firm's hallmark finesse, the smooth savory palate boasts succulent morello cherry, raspberry compote, star anise, clove and crushed mint. It has great length and is impeccably balanced, with fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Gorgeous. Drink 2022 - 2035.
title: Gaja 2015 Sori San Lorenzo  (Barbaresco)

description: Rose, violet, red-berry and baking-spice aromas mingle with a whiff of menthol on this compelling gorgeous red. The vibrant full-bodied palate is all about flair and finesse, delivering crushed raspberry, Marasca cherry, licorice and a hint of tobacco framed in taut fine-grained tannins. Young and intense, it will be ideal after a few more years of aging but will continue to develop for decades. Drink 2023 - 2040.
title: Gaja 2015 Costa Russi  (Barbaresco)

description: This opens with aromas of French oak, pressed violet, resin and a whiff of leather. The lean firm palate shows oak-driven spice and a green note of powdered sage but it lacks fruit. Grainy assertive tannins clench the astringent finish.
title: Lombardo 2015 Poggio Saragio  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Celery, minestrone soup and scorched earth aromas mingle with whiffs of used leather. The palate offers dried black cherry, ground pepper and game alongside dusty fleeting tannins that leave an abrupt, drying close.
title: Vignaioli del Morellino di Scansano 2015 Roggiano Riserva  (Morellino di Scansano)

description: Aromas of dark spice, menthol and ripe black-skinned fruit lead the nose. The firm powerful palate is still young and austere, offering morello cherry, cranberry and tobacco set against tightly knit close-grained tannins. Drink 2023 - 2032.
title: Barale Fratelli 2015 Serraboella  (Barbaresco)

description: Rose petal, dark spice and camphor aromas slowly take shape in the glass along with a whiff of tar. Juicy and delicious, the smooth full-bodied palate has a weightless elegance, delivering succulent Marasca cherry, ripe raspberry, licorice and tobacco while fine-grained tannins provide support. Drink 2021 - 2027.
title: Produttori del Barbaresco 2015  Barbaresco

description: This delicious, polished red shows more body and structure than most wines made with Cannonau. It opens with inviting aromas of wild red berry, Mediterranean brush and ground pepper that follow over to the savory juicy palate along with clove and a savory hint of saline. Smooth tannins provide lithe support.
title: Vigne Surrau 2015 Sincaru Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

description: Wild berry, fragrant blue flower, tilled soil and ground spice aromas propel out of the glass. Structured but understated and elegant, the focused palate delivers mature cherry, star anise and a tobacco note alongside taut, refined tannins. Drink 2021 - 2027.
title: Rizzi 2015 Rizzi  (Barbaresco)

description: Rose, woodland berry, chopped herb and a whiff of smoke lead the nose. Reflecting the aromas, the smooth full-bodied palate delivers crushed morello cherry, orange zest, star anise and a hint of game while fine-grained tannins lend polished support. Drink 2023 - 2030.
title: Nada Giuseppe 2015 Casot  (Barbaresco)

description: Wild berry, cedar, menthol and crushed herb aromas take center stage in this full-bodied red. It's savory and enveloping, with firm polished tannins that support succulent flavors of black cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and tobacco. Drink 2022 - 2030.
title: Demarie 2015  Barbaresco

description: Exotic spice, crushed violet, wild berry and camphor aromas set the tone on this savory red. It's both elegant and firmly structured, offering ripe Marasca cherry, black raspberry and licorice framed in close-grained tannins. Drink 2022 - 2030.
title: Castello di Neive 2015  Barbaresco

description: This fragrant red has classic varietal aromas of red berry, cake spice, new leather and a whiff of rose. The firmly structured, youthfully austere palate offers sour cherry, crushed strawberry and star anise. Tight knit fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity give it balance and an age-worthy structure. Drink after 2025.
title: Castello di Verduno 2015  Barbaresco

description: Aromas of iris, rose red berry and baking spice lead the way. On the full-bodied but seemingly weightless palate, firm close-grained tannins support dried morello cherry, licorice and clove alongside a savory, almost salty note. Drink 2020 - 2030.
title: Albino Rocca 2015 Ronchi  (Barbaresco)

description: This stunning, structured red has lovely floral and spice aromas of iris, violet and cinnamon that take center stage while red berry and menthol float in the background. Full bodied and extremely elegant, the tight polished palate delivers ripe morello cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and nutmeg framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2023 - 2035.
title: Albino Rocca 2015 Cotta   (Barbaresco)
