description: Forest floor, woodland berry, crushed herb and dark culinary-spice aromas set the tone. The tight focused palate offers crushed strawberry, red cherry, licorice and a hint of exotic spice while firm fine-grained tannins provide the backbone. Drink 2025 - 2035.
title: Albino Rocca 2015 Angelo  (Barbaresco)

description: Compelling aromas of fragrant blue flower, red berry, crushed herb, new leather and tilled earth shape the nose. On the savory, full-bodied palate, taut, fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity frame flavors of ripe Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and tobacco. It's young but already boasts a fantastic combination of elegance and structure. Drink 2022 - 2030.
title: Elvio Cogno 2015 Bordini  (Barbaresco)

description: This fragrant and structured red opens with alluring scents of crushed rose, baking spice, wild berry and a whiff of menthol. Full bodied and elegant, the focused palate delivers succulent red cherry, crushed strawberry, orange zest, licorice and white pepper framed in taut refined tannins. Fresh acidity lends tension and keeps it balanced. Give it time to fully develop. Drink 2023 - 2035.
title: Cascina delle Rose 2015 Rio Sordo  (Barbaresco)

description: Intense aromas of rose, woodland berry, dark spice and an earthy whiff of new leather are some of the aromas you'll find on this fragrant full-bodied red. Boasting ripe fruit and energy, the polished, structured palate doles out juicy red cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and white pepper. Firm refined tannins and fresh acidity provide an age-worthy structure. Drink 2022 - 2035.
title: Rizzi 2015 Nervo  (Barbaresco)

description: Wild berry, scorched earth, star anise, crushed herb and a whiff of toasted hazelnut pave the way on this poised full-bodied red. The structured palate boasts remarkable elegance, evoking juicy Marasca cherry, black raspberry, licorice and graphite alongside fine-grained tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it well balanced and imparts youthful tension. Drink 2022 - 2035.
title: Gaja 2015 Sori Tildin  (Barbaresco)

description: This fragrant red has classic varietal aromas of wild rose, red berry, dark spice and a whiff of camphor. It's full bodied and polished, delivering juicy red cherry, strawberry compote, star anise and white pepper alongside taut refined tannins. It's still young, with great tension so give it time to develop even more complexity. Drink 2023 - 2030.
title: Ugo Lequio 2015 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

description: This opens with aromas of ripe berry, crushed herb, scorched soil and dark culinary spice. Mirroring the nose, the firm full-bodied palate evokes juicy Marasca cherry, black raspberry, star anise and clove. Taut, tightly knit and noble tannins provide the framework. Give it time to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2023 - 2035.
title: Giuseppe Cortese 2015 Rabaja   (Barbaresco)

description: Enticingly fragrant, this radiant red has lovely aromas of woodland berry, violet, new leather, aromatic herb and a whiff of pipe tobacco. Firmly structured, the vibrant focused palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, crushed strawberry, licorice and clove framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2023 - 2035.
title: Sottimano 2015 Pajore  (Barbaresco)

description: Enticing aromas of star anise, blue flower, wild berry, menthol and a whiff of new leather all come together on this gorgeous elegantly structured red. The full-bodied creamy palate doles out ripe Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, baking spice, licorice and tobacco framed in fine-grained tannins that offer seamless support. It's balanced, with fresh acidity. Drink 2022 - 2035.
title: Albino Rocca 2015 Ovello Vigna Loreto  (Barbaresco)

description: Rose, underbrush, tilled earth and leather aromas mingle with balsamic whiffs of eucalyptus. The savory full-bodied palate is also earthy, offering ripe black cherry, raspberry, tobacco and a hint of game set against rather lively acidity and fine-grained tannins. Drink after 2023.
title: Albino Rocca 2015 Montersino  (Barbaresco)

description: Fragrant blue flower, wild berry and crushed herb mingle with exotic spice aromas. Firmly structured and tense, the full-bodied palate evokes red cherry, cranberry, star anise and blood orange set against youthfully assertive, close-grained tannins. Drink 2025 - 2035.
title: Castello di Neive 2015 Albesani Santo Stefano  (Barbaresco)

description: Intense, alluring aromas of red berry, Mediterranean brush, eucalyptus and dark culinary spice virtually leap from the glass. It's smooth and full bodied, offering Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and a hint of saline alongside polished, enveloping tannins.
title: Argiolas 2015 Is Solinas Riserva  (Carignano del Sulcis)

description: You'll find aromas of wild red berry, dark spice, leather and a light whiff of game in this juicy red. The savory, supple palate doles out crushed raspberry, ripe strawberry, baking spice and just hint of salted game alongside lithe tannins. Drink through 2023.
title: Sella & Mosca 2015 Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

description: Heady aromas of Mediterranean brush, wild red berry and exotic spice mingle together on this full-bodied red. It's structured and polished, offering black cherry, blackberry, star anise and espresso alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.
title: Mesa 2015 Buio Buio Riserva  (Carignano del Sulcis)

description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Carignano and Cannonau, this opens with aromas of cassis, French oak and exotic spice. The aromas follow on to the round polished palate alongside black cherry and star anise. Soft pliant tannins provide seamless support. Drink through 2020.
title: Vigne Surrau 2015 Barriu Red (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: Grilled herb, forest floor, dark spice and menthol aromas come together on this. Oak-driven spice powers the austere tightly knit palate, while dried cherry, orange zest and powdered sage stay in the background. Extremely firm close-grained tannins clench the finish.
title: La Spinetta 2015 Starderi  (Barbaresco)

description: Blue-flower, clove, licorice and wild berry aromas mingle with a whiff of menthol. Linear and full bodied, the palate offers dried black cherry, cranberry, star anise and tobacco framed in taut close-grained tannins that leave a firm, drying finish. Drink 2021 - 2027.
title: Bel Colle 2015 Pajore  (Barbaresco)

description: Aromas of French oak, blue flower, camphor and dark spice lead the nose. On the palate, close-grained tannins provide the backbone for dried cherry, orange rind, grilled herb, game and clove. It has a firm, extremely drying finish. Give the tannins a few years to unwind then drink sooner rather than later.
title: Orlando Abrigo 2015 Montersino  (Barbaresco)

description: Scorched earth, underbrush, leather, Mediterranean scrub and mature black-skinned berry aromas lead the nose. The full-bodied palate offers dried Marasca cherry, prune, clove and a hint of espresso set against fine-grained tannins.
title: Siddura 2015 Fola  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

description: Made with Cannonau, Carignano and Bovale, this earthy red offers aromas of scorched soil, leather, underbrush, French oak and ripe black-skinned fruit. Mirroring the nose, the full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, blueberry, vanilla, prune and oak-driven spice accompanied by fine-grained tannins.
title: Pala 2015 S'arai Red (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, Mediterranean brush and dark spice lead the nose. The dense palate offers blackberry jam, black pepper and a touch of cocoa alongside polished tannins.
title: Tempa di Zoe 2015 Zero Supercampano Aglianico (Irpinia)

description: This Sardinian red offers aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, myrtle, new leather and scorched earth. The firm palate evokes dried black cherry, coconut, grilled sage, roasted coffee bean and clove alongside close-grained tannins that leave a drying finish.
title: Argiolas 2015 Korem Bovale (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: Charred earth, grilled herb, espresso and French oak aromas mingle with whiffs of violet and menthol. The tight austere palate offers dried cherry, star anise, blood orange and roasted coffee bean alongside astringent tannins that leave an extremely firm, mouth drying finish.
title: La Spinetta 2015 Valeirano  (Barbaresco)

description: Dark baking spice, forest floor, camphor and dark berry aromas lead the nose. On the full-bodied palate, you'll find dried black cherry, clove and tobacco alongside the warmth of evident alcohol. Grainy tannins give it a somewhat drying finish. Give the tannins a few years to unwind then drink.
title: Francone 2015 I Patiarchi  (Barbaresco)

description: This opens with subdued aromas suggesting scorched earth, camphor, pressed rose and an unusual whiff of chopped celery. The aromas follow over to the extremely firm, austere palate along with a notes of dried cherry, ground clove and toast. It's lean in terms of fruit richness and has assertive, grainy tannins that dry out the finish.
title: La Spinetta 2015 Vigneto Bordini  (Barbaresco)

description: Aromas of tilled soil, coconut, French oak and mature plum shape the nose. It's taut, linear and lean, evoking dried cherry, prune, licorice and crushed thyme alongside a roasted coffee-bean note. Drying grainy tannins grip the assertive finish.
title: Fattoria della Talosa 2014 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Aromas suggesting stewed prune, wild herb, French oak and a whiff of baking spice lead the nose. The palate is on the lean side, offering suggestions of dried cherry, roasted coffee bean and a hint of clove alongside grainy tannins that leave a drying finish.
title: Fattoria Del Cerro 2014  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: This opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, cedar and cooking spice. The easygoing palate offers dried black cherry, tobacco and white pepper alongside round tannins.
title: Luigi Righetti 2014  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: A blend of 85% Cannonau, 5% Carignano, 5% Bovale and 5% Malvasia Nera, this full-bodied red offers aromas of black-skinned fruit, French oak, Mediterranean herb and exotic spice. The structured palate delivers mature blackberry, spiced blueberry, orange peel, espresso and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2019 - 2029.
title: Argiolas 2014 Turriga Red (Isola dei Nuraghi)

description: Crushed mint, wild berry and pressed rose aromas mingle with a whiff of pipe tobacco. On the juicy, savory palate, lithe, polished tannins and bright acidity seamlessly support succulent Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, orange zest, star anise and baking spice. Delicious and already almost accessible, it also offers good mid-term aging potential.
title: Cigliuti 2014 Vie Erte  (Barbaresco)

description: Mature black-skinned fruit, baking spice, leather, violet and an earthy whiff of game take center stage. The firm savory palate mirrors the nose, doling out ripe Marasca cherry, strawberry compote, licorice and the same gamy note as the nose. A backbone of bright acidity and youthfully assertive fine-grained tannins provides the framework. Drink 2022 - 2034.
title: Piero Busso 2014 Gallina  (Barbaresco)

description: Aromas of rose, violet and red berry mingle with scents of dark culinary spice. The juicy savory palate delivers succulent Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, cake spice and licorice. It has great tension and elegance thanks to fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2022 - 2029.
title: Cigliuti 2014 Serraboella  (Barbaresco)

description: New leather, exotic spice, camphor and fragrant blue-flower aromas mingle with an earthy whiff of underbrush. On the savory palate, taut tightly knit fine-grained tannins and bright acidity provide the backbone for juicy red cherry, cranberry, licorice and cinnamon. It's still young and primary so give it a few more years to fully develop. Drink 2022 - 2034.
title: Piero Busso 2014 San Stunet  (Barbaresco)

description: Classic Nebbiolo aromas of woodland berry, rose petal, iris, pipe tobacco and an earthy whiff of new leather make for a compelling fragrance. The polished structured palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and baking spice set against firm fine-grained tannins. Bright acidity gives it balance and tension. Drink 2022 - 2032.
title: Piero Busso 2014 Albesani Vigna Borgese  (Barbaresco)

description: Mouthwatering aromas of ripe wild berry, dark baking spice, Mediterranean scrub and a whiff of sea breeze shape the nose on this inviting red. Smooth and full bodied, the juicy palate doles out raspberry compote, ripe strawberry, clove and ground pepper alongside polished fine-grained tannins.
title: Argiolas 2014 Senes Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

description: Aromas of wild herb, Mediterranean scrub, prune and leather slowly take shape in the glass. The round full-bodied palate offers black cherry marinated in spirits, licorice and a hint of game alongside velvety tannins. It closes on a saline note. Drink through 2022.
title: Vigneti Zanatta 2014 Tarara  Riserva  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

description: Pipe-tobacco, blue-flower and menthol aromas escape the glass along with an earthy hint of cured meats. It's linearly structured and racy, offering crushed raspberry, strawberry compote and licorice along with an earthy hint of game on the salty finish. Fine-grained tannins provide support.
title: Socre 2014 Roncaglie  (Barbaresco)

description: This opens with aromas of wild red berry, Mediterranean brush and a hint of baking spice. The soft straightforward palate offers juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry and a hint of white pepper alongside round smooth tannins. Drink over the next few years.
title: F.lli Puddu 2014 Nepente di Oliena Carros Classico  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

description: A blend of Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon aged in barriques, this opens with aromas of underbrush, toasted oak, wild berry and a whiff of eucalyptus. The full-bodied palate offers espresso, toast, cassis, clove and powdered age alongside grainy tannins that leave a firm, drying finish.
title: Siddura 2014 Tiros Red (Colli del Limbara)

description: Aromas of burned rubber, menthol, crushed herb and a whiff of tilled earth follow over to the palate along with dried cherry and oak-driven spice. Close-grained but rather fleeting tannins leave a drying finish.
title: Sella & Mosca 2014 Terre Rare  (Carignano del Sulcis)

description: Baked plum, exotic spice, leather and a whiff of French oak mingle with a suggestion of fragrant blue flower. The firm elegant palate delivers Marasca cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and baking spice before a coffee finish. Taut fine-grained tannins provide structure while fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Drink 2021 - 2033.
title: Trerose 2013 Simposio  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Mocha, coconut, French oak and spiced plum aromas pave the way. The polished palate offers toast, espresso, prune, sage and licorice while fine-grained tannins provide the taut framework.
title: Bindella 2013 Vallocaia Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Full-bodied and focused, this gorgeous wine opens with enticing scents of dark-skinned berry, pipe tobacco, truffle, new leather and a whiff of camphor. Savory and structured, the palate presents succulent red cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and baking spice accompanied by firm fine-grained tannins. It's well balanced, with fresh acidity. Drink 2021 - 2033.
title: Rizzi 2013 Boito Riserva  (Barbaresco)

description: Aromas of French oak, underbrush, dried herb and a whiff of woodland berry lead the nose. The taut linear palate is still youthfully austere, offering sour cherry, cranberry and star anise alongside tightly knit, close-grained tannins that leave a firm dry finish. Give this plenty of time to come around. Drink 2023 - 2033.
title: Castello di Neive 2013 Albesani Santo Stefano Riserva  (Barbaresco)

description: Underbrush, pressed rose-petal, grilled porcini and red-berry aromas take shape in the glass. The taut tense palate delivers dried cherry, licorice, clove and tobacco set against clenching, close-grained tannins that dry out the finish. Give it time to fully unwind and develop. Drink 2021 - 2033.
title: Orlando Abrigo 2013 Rongalio Riserva  (Barbaresco)

description: Prune, exotic spice and Mediterranean-scrub aromas lift out of the glass. The rounded palate is rather evolved, evoking dried cherry, blueberry and clove alongside dusty tannins that leave a drying close.
title: Gabbas 2013 Arbore  (Cannonau di Sardegna)

description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, dark spice, coconut and a whiff of French oak shape the nose. The polished, straightforward palate offers dried cherry, licorice and a hint of espresso alongside fine-grained tannins.
title: Francone 2013 Riserva  (Barbaresco)

description: Underbrush, tobacco-leaf, sunbaked soil and baked plum aromas form the nose. The rounded full-bodied palate offers prune, mature black cherry and licorice alongside supple fine-grained tannins. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the brooding fruit.
title: Montemercurio 2012 Messaggero  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Underbrush, baked plum, new leather, botanical herb and a whiff of camphor slowly appear on this. The dense palate offers prune, mocha and licorice alongside an espresso note. Close-grained tannins give it structure and grip the finish. Drink 2020 - 2027.
title: Icario 2012 Vitaroccia Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: This opens with aromas of scorched earth, leather, forest floor and exotic spice. Reflecting the heat of the scorching vintage, the robust evolved palate presents dried cherry, prune marinated in spirits and licorice alongside the heat of evident alcohol while dusty tannins leave a drying finish. Drink sooner rather than later.
title: Montemercurio 2011 Damo  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Aromas of stewed prune, underbrush and charred earth lead the nose. The palate is rather evolved, offering dried cherry, clove and grilled herb alongside solid, drying tannins. Drink sooner rather than later.
title: Pier 2011 Rio Sordo  (Barbaresco)

description: This opens with aromas of cassis and Mediterranean brush. The dense palate offers blackberry jam, vanilla and cedar alongside firm, rather astringent tannins and the heat of evident alcohol.
title: Tempa di Zoe 2017 Diciotto Red (Campania)

description: Combining structure and finesse, this offers aromas of spiced plum, underbrush, French oak and pipe tobacco. It's full bodied and smooth but also has tension, evoking mature black cherry, prune, mocha, licorice and clove framed in firm close-grained tannins. It closes on a coffee-bean note. Drink 2023 - 2030.
title: Poliziano 2015 La Caggiole  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: Dark berry, violet and underbrush aromas lead the nose. The savory balanced palate offers blackberry jam, white pepper and star anise alongside velvety tannins.
title: Acinum 2015  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: Inviting aromas of baked plum, exotic spice, blue flower and a balsamic whiff of menthol all take shape in the glass. It's full bodied but accessible, delivering spiced prune, fruitcake, mocha and star anise. Polished tannins provide finesse. Drink through 2023.
title: Corte Giara 2015  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: Mature dark-skinned berry, baking-spice and scorched earth aromas lead the nose. The forward palate offers prune, white pepper and clove alongside tightly knit tannins.
title: Farina 2015  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Spiced plum, star anise, menthol and sunbaked forest-floor aromas lead the nose. It's big and chewy, with dried cherry, prune extract, licorice and tobacco set against fine-grained tannins. You'll also detect the warmth of evident alcohol on the finish. Drink sooner rather than later.
title: Le Berne 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

description: Ripe dark-fruit, clove and tobacco aromas lead the nose. The structured palate delivers prune, black pepper and espresso alongside tightly wound tannins.
title: Giuseppe Campagnola 2015 Vigneti Vallata di Marano  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this opens with aromas of spiced plum, underbrush, violet and pipe tobacco. The earthy accessible palate delivers steeped prune, star anise and a hint of game alongside smooth tannins.
title: Villalta 2015 I Comunali  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Blackberry, mature plum and clove aromas take shape in the glass. The soft straightforward palate evokes prune, star anise and a hint of black pepper alongside pliant, rather fleeting tannins.
title: Villalta 2015 XIX  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Subdued aromas evoking tobacco, prune and baking spice slowly emerge from the glass. The straightforward palate offers stewed prune, star anise and a black-pepper note alongside grainy tannins.
title: Villa Canestrari 2015  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: Aromas of tilled soil, baking spice and raisin lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the straightforward palate together with prune and a confectionery note while grainy tannins give it a firm finish.
title: Montresor 2015  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: This opens with aromas of raisin, dark spice and sage. The aromas carry over to the one-dimensional palate along with grainy tannins that leave a sharp finish.
title: Tinazzi 2015 Collezione di Famiglia  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: This opens with aromas of grilled sage, cooking spice and a whiff of black-skinned fruit. The straightforward palate offers prune, mocha and clove alongside round tannins.
title: Tenuta Valleselle 2015 Aureum Acinum  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Packaged in an extremely heavy bottle, this has a shy nose that eventually reveals subdued aromas of leafy underbrush, prune and oak. The forward one-dimensional palate offers mocha, raisin and a drop of vanilla alongside evolved tannins.
title: Ca' de' Rocchi 2015 La Bastia  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Ripe dark-skinned berry, fragrant blue flower, camphor and exotic spice aromas leap out of the glass. The palate is full bodied but also shows restraint, offering dried black cherry, truffle and licorice alongside taut close-grained tannins. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol on the close. Drink 2021 - 2027.
title: Socre 2015  Barbaresco

description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, underbrush and pipe tobacco lead the nose. The full-bodied palate delivers dried black cherry, raspberry jam and licorice alongside polished tannins.
title: Sartori 2014 Estate Collection  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Ripe dark-fruit, toasted oak and cooking-spice aromas emerge from the glass. The dense palate delivers prune, black pepper and cinnamon alongside firm tannins.
title: Cesari 2014  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: Ripe dark-fruit, tilled soil and exotic spice aromas come together in the glass. The firm palate offers licorice, dried black cherry and tobacco alongside polished tannins.
title: Corte Moschina 2014  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: Aromas of violet, exotic spice and ripe dark berry lead the nose. The enveloping palate delivers dried black cherry, nutmeg and white pepper alongside fine-grained velvety tannins.
title: Ca' Rugate 2014 Punta Tolotti  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: This opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, toasted wood and cocoa. The solid palate offers prune, vanilla and espresso alongside firm tannins.
title: Bellora 2014  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Earthy aromas of game, tilled soil and prune lead the nose. The one-dimensional palate offers roasted coffee bean, coconut and raisin alongside assertive tannins.
title: Castelforte 2014  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: Enticing scents of spiced plum, pipe tobacco, crushed mint, new leather and a whiff of smoke come to the forefront. The full-bodied, velvety palate boasts dried cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and a graphite note. Fine-grained tannins provide the firm but elegant framework while fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Drink through 2025.
title: Speri 2013 Vigneto Monte Sant'Urbano  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Aromas of French oak, coconut, exotic spice and mature black-skinned fruit shape the nose along with a whiff of menthol. The enveloping palate shows flair and finesse, offering dried black cherry, prune steeped in spirits, cinnamon and licorice set against firm fine-grained tannins. An espresso note lingers on the close.
title: Dei 2013 Bossona Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

description: This opens with aromas of black-skinned fruit, underbrush, tobacco and culinary spice. The full-bodied velvety palate doles out prune, soaked cherry, star anise and mocha wrapped up in polished tannins. It boasts enough fresh acidity to lift the rich flavors. Drink now through 2025.
title: Masi 2013 Costasera  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Enticing aromas of violet, dark berry, leather and a balsamic note lead the nose. The juicy palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and black pepper alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink now - 2027.
title: Novaia 2013 Corte Vaona  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Enticing aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and cedar come together on this. The chewy palate delivers blackberry jam, mocha and star anise alongside firm tannins.
title: Santi 2013 Santico  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, tobacco and toasted oak emerge from the glass. The chewy palate delivers prune, mocha and licorice alongside assertive tannins.
title: Bolla 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: This opens with aromas of ripe dark berry, underbrush and toasted oak. The chewy palate delivers raisin, mocha and licorice alongside close-grained tannins.
title: Vogadori 2013 Forlago  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Aromas of baking spice, mocha and raisin lead the nose. The chewy palate delivers prune, licorice and white pepper alongside rounded tannins.
title: Tezza 2013 Corte Majoli  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Black plum, cocoa and tobacco aromas lead the nose. The chewy palate offers raisin, roasted coffee bean and star anise alongside tightly packed tannins.
title: Degani 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: This opens with aromas of ripe dark berry, mushroom and tilled soil. The firm palate offers raisin, toasted oak and espresso accompanied by close-grained tannins.
title: Roncolato 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: This opens with aromas suggesting ripe black plum, forest floor and leather. The robust palate delivers prune, white pepper and nutmeg alongside chewy tannins.
title: Aldegheri 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Intense aromas of violet, black-skinned berry, leather with a whiff of cake spice lead the nose on this full-bodied wine. The luscious balanced palate offers blackberry, mature plum, licorice, clove and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2020 - 2029.
title: Nicolis 2012  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Mocha, baking-spice and mature dark-berry aromas come together on this big red. The brawny palate delivers raisin, espresso and clove alongside close-grained tannins.
title: Tezza 2011 Brolo delle Giare Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Valpantena)

description: Aromas of ripe dark fruit, cocoa and cedar emerge from the glass. The densely knit palate delivers blackberry jam, mocha and licorice alongside velvety tannins and evident alcohol.
title: Fontanavecchia 2011 Grave Mora Riserva  (Aglianico del Taburno)

description: This opens with quintessential Amarone aromas of baked plum, dark spice, underbrush, leather and pipe tobacco. The full-bodied palate offers dried cherry, prune, toasted hazelnut, star anise and clove set against fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2024.
title: Bertani 2009  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: This opens with aromas of ripe dark berry, underbrush, incense and baking spice. The juicy palate delivers black cherry, chopped mint, tobacco and a hint of clove alongside polished, fine-grained tannins.
title: Bertani 2015  Amarone della Valpolicella Valpantena

description: Violet, mature dark-fruit and cooking-spice aromas lead the nose. The dense concentrated palate offers raisin, raspberry jam, cinnamon and cocoa alongside smooth, velvety tannins.
title: Castellani Michele & Figli 2015 Colle Cristi  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Ripe dark fruit, baking spice and cedar lead the nose. The dense palate offers raisin, vanilla and star anise alongside firm tannins.
title: Castellani Michele & Figli 2015 Cinque Stelle  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: This has subdued aromas evoking Asian spice, prune, underbrush and a whiff of toast. The rather evolved, monolithic palate offers raisin steeped in spirits, black pepper and licorice alongside dusty rather fleeting tannins.
title: Provolo 2015 Tenuta Ca' Nova  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Exotic spice, mature black-skinned fruit, espresso and French oak are just some of the aromas you'll find on this delicious, full-bodied red. Boasting an enviable combination of concentrated flavors and elegance, it delivers flavors of ripe black cherry, prune steeped in spirits, vanilla bean and licorice framed by enveloping fine-grained tannins. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors while a coffee note lingers on the finish. Drink through 2026.
title: Allegrini 2014  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Violet, black-plum, underbrush and leather aromas lead the nose. The structured palate delivers blackberry jam, pipe tobacco and licorice alongside polished tannins.
title: Le Salette 2014  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Dried violet, cooking-spice and leather aromas emerge from the glass. The brawny palate offers black-cherry jam, star anise and chewing tobacco alongside velvety tannins.
title: Fattori 2014 Col de la Bastia  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Enticing aromas of cassis, exotic spice, dark berry and baking spice form the nose. The concentrated savory palate delivers black cherry jam, ripe black plum, star anise and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins.
title: Le Salette 2014 La Marega  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: This opens with aromas suggesting raisin, forest floor, tobacco leaf and raisin. On the straightforward palate, smooth tannins support prune, black plum and baking spice.
title: Adalia 2014 Ruvalin  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Aromas of moist underbrush, tobacco leaf, prune and clove slowly take shape on this. The soft approachable palate offers dried cherry, prune, brown pepper and a confectionery note alongside rounded tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2022.
title: Zonin 2014  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: Aromas of ripe dark berry, cooking spice and underbrush lead the nose. The dense palate offers blackberry jam, clove and mocha alongside assertive tannins.
title: San Cassiano 2014  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: Inviting aromas of dark-skinned berry, pipe tobacco, cassis and cedar lead the way on this smooth, full-bodied, savory red. The concentrated balanced palate doles out ripe black currant, raspberry jam, nutmeg and pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2029.
title: Monte del Fra  2013 Lena di Mezzo  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: This opens with aromas evoking black-skinned fruit, tilled soil and cooking spice. The savory concentrated palate offers mature black plum, tobacco and licorice alongside velvety tannins.
title: Albino Armani 2013 Cuslanus Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Aromas of ripe dark berry, tobacco and a whiff of mocha emerge from the glass. The concentrated palate delivers dried black cherry, licorice and pepper alongside tightly knit tannins.
title: San Cassiano 2013 Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Plum-cake, exotic spice and ripe black-plum aromas emerge from the glass. The brawny palate offers prune, clove and vanilla alongside assertive tannins.
title: Montresor 2013 Capitel della Crosara  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: The shy nose eventually reveals suggestions of dried dark-skinned fruit, underbrush and a toasted hazelnut note. The big, one-dimensional palate is already evolved, offering notes of raisin, clove and a note of powdered sage alongside soft but not very persistent tannins.
title: Aldegheri 2013 Sant'Ambrogio  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: This opens with aromas of scorched earth, cooking spice and a hint of ripe dark-skinned fruit. The robust straightforward palate offers raisin, vanilla and clove alongside solid tannins.
title: S. Giorgio 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: This opens with aromas of prune, vanilla and espresso. The brawny palate offers raisin, clove and toasted oak alongside assertive astringent tannins that leave the drying finish.
title: Giuseppe Campagnola 2013 Caterin Zardini Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: This opens with aromas of ripe berry, underbrush, cedar and pipe tobacco. The concentrated balanced palate offers blackberry jam, baked plum, star anise and clove alongside fine-grained tannins.
title: Cesari 2012 Il Bosco  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Cocoa, baked plum, toast, culinary spice and leather aromas shape the nose. Full bodied and elegant, the smooth, dense palate doles out fleshy black cherry, blackberry jam, licorice and clove while velvety tannins provide structure. It closes on an espresso note. Drink through 2027.
title: Masi 2012 Costasera Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: This full-bodied red opens with aromas of underbrush, steeped prune, French oak, ground culinary spice and a whiff of graphite. The bold palate delivers dried cherry marinated in spirits, raisin, licorice and tobacco while firm, velvety tannins provide support. Drink through 2024.
title: Monte del Fra  2012 Lena di Mezzo Scarnocchio Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this opens with aromas of violet, dark-skinned berry and new leather. The concentrated, balanced palate delivers blackberry jam, baked plum, licorice and ground black pepper. Solid but velvety tannins provide the backbone.
title: Corte Sant'Alda 2012 Valmezzane  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Made with organically farmed dried grapes, this boasts inviting aromas of ripe dark-skinned berry, tilled soil, new leather and baking spice. Concentrated yet elegant, the palate delivers ripe black plum, blackberry jam, clove and black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. A licorice note wraps up the long finish. Drink 2020 - 2030.
title: Corte Sant'Alda 2012 Mithas  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: This opens with aromas of ripe plum, violet, cinnamon and new leather. The savory palate offers blackberry extract, white pepper and mocha alongside enveloping polished tannins.
title: San Rustico 2012  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Scorched earth, prune, Asian spice, toasted nut and leather aromas make their way to the forefront. The brawny palate offers raisin, cherry marinated in spirits, licorice and tobacco set against fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2024.
title: Masi 2012 Serego Alighieri Vaio Armaron  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: This opens with aromas of ripe dark berry, coconut and underbrush. The bracing palate displays raisin, roasted coffee bean and tobacco alongside grainy tannins that grip the finish.
title: Monteci 2012  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: Baked plum, pressed violet, smoke and nutmeg aromas pave the way on this bold red. The palate combines muscle and finesse, offering prune, black cherry extract, cake spice and tobacco framed in firm velvety tannins. The warmth of alcohol and a dollop of vanilla linger on the close. Drink now through 2026.
title: Zyme 2011  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Aromas of mature black-skinned berry, forest floor and a balsamic note emerge from the glass. The smooth ripe palate delivers prune, star anise and white pepper alongside velvety tannins.
title: I Saltari 2011  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: Aromas of dried black-skinned berry, black pepper and underbrush emerge from the glass. The concentrated palate offers black-currant jam, steeped prune, licorice and baking spice alongside fine-grained tannins.
title: Sartori 2011 Corte Bra   (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Aromas of toasted oak, coconut, black-skinned fruit and exotic spice lead the nose. The firm palate offers black-currant jam, espresso, licorice and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins.
title: Damoli 2011 Checo  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Aromas of raisin, leafy underbrush and leather emerge from the glass. The dense palate delivers prune, licorice and vanilla alongside big chewy tannins.
title: Tommasi 2011 Ca' Florian Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Aromas of mature dark berry, mocha and baking spice come to the forefront. The syrupy palate offers prune, star anise and a hint of cocoa alongside tightly packed tannins.
title: Villa Canestrari 2011 Plenum Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Subdued aromas suggesting scorched earth, used leather and steeped prune emerge from the glass. The evolved palate delivers raisin, star anise, powdered sage and tobacco alongside close-grained but fleeting tannins.
title: Provolo 2011  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: Aromas of cedar, crushed violet and black pepper lead the way. The polished palate delivers dried black cherry, raisin, nutmeg and vanilla alongside velvety tannins.
title: Garbole 2010 Hatteso Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Aromas of black plum, tilled soil and cedar lead the nose. The dense palate delivers blackberry jam, black pepper, cocoa and star anise alongside chewy tannins and the warmth of evident alcohol.
title: Fontanavecchia 2010 Riserva  (Aglianico del Taburno)

description: Smoke, leather, scorched earth, mature plum and baking-spice aromas mingle together. The brooding robust palate evokes morello cherry marinated in spirits, prune, licorice and clove alongside a network of taut close-grained tannins. A note of roasted coffee bean marks the close. Drink through 2024.
title: Cesari 2009 Bosan Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Scorched earth, mocha and ripe black-plum aromas form the nose. The forward palate offers prune, espresso and star anise alongside close-grained tannins.
title: Garbole 2009 Hatteso Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Ripe dark-berry, underbrush and cooking-spice aromas lead the way. The concentrated, rich palate delivers raisin, star anise and tobacco alongside firm, refined tannins.
title: Le Ragose 2008  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Moist underbrush, grilled celery, smoke, steeped prune and tobacco aromas slowly take shape on this smooth full-bodied red. The soft concentrated palate is already accessible, offering baked plum, black-cherry extract, vanilla and the heat of evident alcohol alongside velvety tannins.
title: Tommasi 2008 De Buris Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Aromas of mature dark-skinned berry, cooking spice and cedar lead the nose. The concentrated palate offers blackberry jam, clove and licorice alongside polished tannins.
title: Le Ragose 2008 Marta Galli  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Tilled soil, baking-spice and ripe dark-skinned fruit aromas emerge from the glass. The linear palate offers raisin, licorice and clove alongside chewy tannins.
title: Garbole 2008 Hatteso Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Dried black-cherry, exotic spice and sweet pipe-tobacco aromas lead the nose on this mature wine. The smooth forward palate offers raisin, prune, cinnamon and star anise alongside buffed tannins.
title: Villa Spinosa 1998 Guglielmi di Jago 20 Years  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: This brawny red opens with aromas of mature dark-skinned berry, new leather and cedar. The full-bodied palate delivers plum jam, vanilla and nutmeg alongside velvety tannins.
title: Luciano Arduini 2015  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: This opens with ripe black-plum, underbrush and toasted oak aromas. The palate delivers prune, roasted coffee bean and cocoa alongside chewy tannins.
title: I Campi 2015 I Campi Lunghi  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Aromas of toasted oak, cooking spice and prune lead the nose. The warm, dense palate offers dried black cherry, mocha and clove alongside close-grained tannins.
title: Luciano Arduini 2015 Simison  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Aromas of toasted oak, coconut and ripe dark fruit lead the nose. The dense palate offers prune, licorice and espresso alongside close-grained tannins.
title: Corte Adami 2015  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: Aromas of steeped prune, leafy underbrush and toasted oak lead the nose. The dense one-dimensional palate offers raisin, coffee bean and espresso alongside tightly packed tannins that leave a drying finish.
title: Bonfanti 2015 Gran Lombardo  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Tobacco, underbrush and ripe dark-berry aromas lead the nose. The savory structured palate offers raisin, clove and black pepper set against fine-grained tannins.
title: Antolini 2014 Moropio  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: This opens with aromas of tilled soil, cooking spice and ripe dark fruit. The dense palate delivers raisin, clove and tobacco alongside polished tannins.
title: Tedeschi 2014  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Aromas of tilled earth, Asian spice and mature black-skinned fruit come together on this hearty red. Mirroring the nose, the robust palate evokes dried cherry marinated in spirits, ground pepper and a dollop of vanilla.
title: Ca  d'Or 2014 Nerofusco  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: This opens with aromas of black plum, baking spice and tobacco. The syrupy palate offers prune extract, vanilla and star anise set against chewy tannins.
title: Monte Tondo 2014  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: This opens with aromas of dark cherry, cocoa and cedar. The concentrated palate delivers black currant jam, pepper and cinnamon alongside fine-grained tannins.
title: Tedeschi 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: This opens with aromas of raisin, leather and scorched earth. The brawny palate delivers dried black cherry, black pepper and tobacco alongside firm ripe tannins.
title: Monte Santoccio 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Aromas of black-skinned fruit, leather and baking spices take center stage. The hearty full-bodied palate offers raisin, white pepper and clove alongside velvety tannins.
title: Vigneti di Ettore 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Aromas of plum cake, vanilla and baking spice lift out of the glass. The dense palate delivers prune, clove and white pepper alongside rounded tannins.
title: Dal Cero 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: This has aromas of mature black-skinned fruit, leather and underbrush. The bolddense palate shows blackberry jam, licorice, clove and black pepper alongside polished tannins.
title: La Dama 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Aromas of toasted oak, dark cooking spice and mature black-skinned fruit emerge from the glass. The linear palate offers coconut, roasted coffee bean and raisin alongside grainy tannins.
title: Gamba 2013 Campedel  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Aromas of ripe dark fruit, mocha and toasted oak lead the way. The dense chewy palate delivers raisin, licorice and cocoa alongside close-grained tannins.
title: Spada 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: This opens with aromas of ripe dark-skinned fruit, mocha and cooking spice. The forward palate offers blackberry jam, tobacco and star anise alongside firm tannins.
title: Bolla 2012 Rethico  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Ripe dark-berry, underbrush and baking-spice aromas form the nose. The hearty palate offers raisin, dill, clove and black pepper alongside velvety tannins.
title: Manara 2012 Corte Manara  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: This has aromas evoking cocoa, underbrush and mature black plum. The firm palate delivers prune, espresso and star anise alongside tightly wound tannins.
title: Farina 2012 Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: This opens with aromas of exotic spice, mature dark-skinned fruit and cocoa. The brawny palate offers raisin, blackberry jam and tobacco alongside tightly knit tannins.
title: Vogadori 2012 Proemio  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Aromas of mature black-skinned fruit, tilled soil and baking spice lead the nose. The solid palate offers prune, dried cherry, walnut and a confectionery note alongside buffed tannins.
title: San Michele 2012  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: This opens with ripe black-skinned fruit, vanilla and mocha aromas. The grainy palate delivers prune, espresso and clove alongside assertive tannins.
title: Manara 2012 Postera  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Enticing scents of cocoa, blackberry preserve, new leather and baking spice fill the glass. The full-bodied palate combines velvety finesse and power, delivering spiced plum, raisin, clove and tobacco set against polished fine-grained atannins. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors while a licorice note lingers on the close. Drink 2021 - 2031.
title: Masi 2011 Campolongo di Torbe  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Aromas of baked plum, blue flower, underbrush and a balsamic note lead the nose. The concentrated, savory palate offers blackberry jam, dried black cherry, star anise and cinnamon alongside fine-grained, velvety tannins.
title: San Rustico 2011 Gaso  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: This opens with aromas of violet, black-skinned berry, underbrush and a whiff of exotic spice. The firmly structured concentrated palate doles out dried black cherry, raspberry jam, clove and black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2029.
title: Novaia 2011 Le Balze Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Ripe dark-berry, underbrush and baking-spice aromas lead the nose. The concentrated palate delivers blackberry jam, licorice and tobacco alongside polished chewy tannins.
title: Fattori 2011  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: Underbrush, tobacco leaf, toasted oak and leather aromas lead the way. It's tight and concentrated, offering cassis, kirsch, prune, clove and licorice alongside firm, close-grained tannins that grip the close. It closes on a hazelnut note. Drink 2023 - 2031.
title: Masi 2011 Mazzano  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Underbrush, sunbaked earth, crushed herb and ground spice aromas lead the nose. The brawny, concentrated palate offers raisin, cherry marinated in spirits and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Roasted coffee bean marks the close.
title: Guerrieri Rizzardi 2011 Calcarole  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: This opens with aromas suggesting tilled soil, leather and mature black-skinned fruit. The concentrated palate delivers blackberry jam, cocoa, licorice and white pepper alongside chewy tannins.
title: Villa Erbice 2011 Tremenel  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Underbrush, cedar and black-plum aromas take center stage on this bold red. The firm palate offers prune, mocha, black pepper and licorice alongside bracing tannins.
title: Farina 2011 Montefante Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this has aromas of iris, spiced plum and a whiff of mocha. The structured palate offers blackberry jam, espresso and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins.
title: Fidora 2011 Monte Tabor  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: This opens with aromas of ripe dark-skinned fruit, tilled soil and baking spice. The chewy concentrated palate offers prune, dried cherry, star anise and tobacco alongside polished tannins.
title: Secondo Marco 2011  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: This opens with aromas of baked plum, exotic spice, scorched earth and a whiff of nail polish. Smooth and dense, the chewy palate doles out blackberry extract, cherry marinated in spirits and clove alongside fine-grained tannins.
title: Guerrieri Rizzardi 2011 Villa Rizzardi  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Toasted oak, espresso and black-cherry aromas lead the nose. The dense palate offers vanilla, roasted coffee bean and blackberry jam alongside bracing tannins.
title: Corte Moschina 2011 Vigneto Cav  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Made with organically farmed dried grapes, this opens with aromas of stewed prune, baking spice and vanilla. The big savory palate doles out black-currant jam, licorice, nutmeg and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins.
title: Tenuta Vignega 2010 Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: This opens with aromas evoking raisin, underbrush and dried tobacco leaf. The chewy palate delivers dried sour cherry, prune and licorice alongside firm tannins.
title: Villa Spinosa 2010 Albasini  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Steeped prune, tilled soil and vanilla aromas come together on this. The concentrated chewy palate delivers raisin, tobacco, clove and star anise alongside round tannins. It's ready now so drink through 2023.
title: Nicolis 2009 Ambrosan  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Aromas of scorched earth, ripe black-skinned fruit and cooking spice lead the way. The robust monolithic palate offers blackberry jam, prune, tobacco and a hint of mocha alongside rounded tannins.
title: Trabucchi d'Illasi 2009  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: Aromas of underbrush, leather, and spiced plum lead the nose. The big chewy palate doles out dried black cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside firm polished tannins.
title: Villa Spinosa 2007 Guglielmi di Jago 10 Years  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Baked plum, spice, vanilla and pressed violet aromas mingle with a whiff of cassis. Dense and concentrated, the palate combines power and an almost weightless character, doling out blackberry jam, black cherry, coconut and a confectionery note alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2026.
title: Zyme 2006 La Mattonara Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Aromas of resin, nail polish remover and steeped prune lead the nose. The evolved, densely concentrated palate offers glimpses of raisin and licorice alongside buffed tannins.
title: Provolo 2003 Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: This has aromas reminiscent of prune, blue flower, cooking spice and a whiff of resin. The syrupy palate evokes raisin, baking spice and a confectionery note alongside pliant, not very persistent tannins. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol on the close.
title: Giusti 2014  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Ripe blackberry, baked plum, forest-floor and pipe-tobacco aromas are front and center. The plush full-bodied palate delivers dried cherry, prune soaked in spirits, licorice and clove framed in velvety tannins. Even though the heat of alcohol is noticeable on the close, it's well integrated with the rich fruit flavors.
title: Zenato 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: Underbrush, prune, leather, French oak and mocha aromas slowly shape the nose. The bold palate doles out steeped plum, dried black cherry, vanilla and a confectionery note alongside fine-grained tannins. It closes on the warmth of alcohol.
title: Ottella 2013 Ripa della Volta  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: This opens with earthy aromas of underbrush, dark berry and tobacco leaf. The concentrated palate delivers raisin, vanilla and pepper alongside solid fine-grained tannins.
title: Massimago 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: Aromas of scorched earth, toasted hazelnut and ripe dark fruit emerge from the glass. The firm palate delivers dried black cherry, mocha and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins.
title: Costa Arente 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella

description: Iris, spiced plum and raisin aromas come together on this. The dense palate offers blackberry jam, licorice and mocha alongside firm tannins.
title: Le Marognole 2013 Campo Rocco  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Resin, leather and mature black-skinned fruit aromas come together in the glass. The powerful palate delivers licorice, blackberry jam, steeped prune and tobacco alongside firm, fine-grained tannins.
title: Brigaldara 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

description: This opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, graphite and cedar. The concentrated palate delivers blackberry jam, baked plum, black pepper and clove alongside brooding tannins.
title: Brigaldara 2012 Case Vecie  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Baked plum, fruitcake, underbrush and new leather are just some of the aromas you'll find on this generous red. On the concentrated palate, velvety tannins envelop fleshy Marasca cherry steeped in spirits, blackberry extract, baking spice and a confectionery note. A hint of tobacco lingers on the close.
title: Zenato 2012 Sergio Zenato Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Aromas of black pepper, ripe black plum and cedar emerge from the glass. The dense palate delivers blackberry jam, mocha and star anise alongside big, chewy tannins.
title: Tezza 2012  Amarone della Valpolicella Valpantena

description: This opens with ripe black-fruit, toasted oak and cooking-spice aromas. The brawny palate offers prune, roasted coffee bean and vanilla packed in assertive tannins.
title: Zanoni 2012 Zovo  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Aromas evoking fruitcake, red-plum preserve, exotic spice and French oak take center stage. The full-bodied, generous palate also boasts finesse and focus, delivering cherry marinated in spirits, prune, crushed alpine herb, ground pepper and clove. Fine-grained, velvety tannins provide the backbone while fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors. Drink 2021 - 2031.
title: Allegrini 2011 Fieramonte Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Aromas of toasted oak, mature black-skinned fruit, nutmeg and mocha lead the nose. The dense brooding palate offers prune steeped in spirits, espresso and vanilla alongside close-grained tannins.
title: Brigaldara 2011 Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Mature dark-skinned berry, cocoa and culinary-spice aromas lead the nose. The densely concentrated palate delivers blackberry jam, star anise and black pepper alongside firm, polished tannins.
title: Bolla 2011 Le Origini Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Aromas of ripe dark berry, tilled soil and ground black pepper shape the nose. The dense palate delivers toasted notes, espresso, prune and vanilla alongside close-grained tannins.
title: Gamba 2011 Campedel Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: This opens with aromas of ripe black plum, leafy underbrush and a whiff of baking spice. The dense palate delivers raisin, ground pepper and clove alongside tightly knit tannins and the heat of evident alcohol.
title: Villa Canestrari 2011 1888 Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Aromas of black fruit, underbrush and vanilla emerge from the glass. The dense palate delivers blackberry jam, clove and licorice while polished tannins lend support. You'll also notice the heat of alcohol on the finish.
title: Corte Aleardi 2009 Bure Alto  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Aromas of ripe black fruit, underbrush and vanilla emerge from the glass. The dense palate delivers blackberry jam, clove and licorice while polished tannins lend support. You'll also notice the heat of alcohol on the finish.
title: Corte Aleardi 2008 Bure Alto Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Toasted oak, steeped prune, coffee and coconut emerge from the glass. The dense palate delivers espresso, vanilla and dried black cherry alongside assertive tannins that leave a drying finish.
title: Trabucchi d'Illasi 2008 Cent'Anni Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Inviting aromas of tilled soil, underbrush and ripe dark-skinned berry lead the nose. The full-bodied concentrated palate delivers prune, raspberry compote, star anise and black pepper alongside big fine-grained tannins.
title: Tedeschi 2012 Capitel Monte Olmi Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Aromas of underbrush, prune, minestrone soup and grilled bell pepper lead the nose while whiffs of French oak, leather and coconut stay in the background. The densely concentrated, tightly knit palate offers raisin, blackberry extract, clove, licorice and dried sage while assertive grainy tannins leave an astringent mouth-drying finish.
title: Dal Forno Romano 2012 Monte Lodoletta  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Made from organically farmed grapes, this offers enticing aromas of cassis, dark-skinned berry and exotic spice. The bold palate doles out ripe black plum, raspberry jam, black pepper and nutmeg alongside fine-grained tannins. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol but it's supported by the fruit richness.
title: Valentina Cubi 2011 Morar  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: This opens with aromas of ripe dark-skinned fruit, new leather and a balsamic note. The concentrated palate offers black-currant jam, licorice, clove and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins.
title: Valentina Cubi 2011 Morar  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Enticing aromas of scorched earth, cooking spice and mature dark-skinned berry emerge from the glass. The dense full-bodied palate offers steeped prune, licorice and black pepper alongside firm polished tannins.
title: Tedeschi 2011 Capitel Monte Olmi Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

description: Made with organically farmed dried grapes, this robust, structured wine opens with aromas of ripe dark-skinned berry, baking spice and leather. The big brawny palate offers raisin, blackberry jam and star anise alongside chewy tannins.
title: Gino Fasoli 2012 Alteo  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

description: Made in a sweet style with only 8.5% alcohol, pair this delicately-textured wine as you might a Mosel spatlese, with sweet-spicy dishes. Green apple and citrus notes provide crisp balance to the residual sugar.
title: Forrest 2010 The Doctors' Riesling (Marlborough)

description: Neudorf seems to do almost everything well, and the winery's efforts with Riesling off the Moutere clays are no exception. It's made in a light- to medium-bodied style, off dry, with crisp notes of lime, green apple and wet stone that linger on the mouthwatering finish.
title: Neudorf 2010 Moutere Riesling (Nelson)

description: Medium-sweet on the IRF scale, this light- to medium-bodied Riesling displays classic scents of petrichor, green apple and lime. Shows decent length and hints of petrol on the finish.
title: Carrick 2010 Riesling (Central Otago)

description: This wine's ripeness and power are similar to many Rheingau Rieslings. Honey, apple, peach, spice and petrol all combine easily into a slightly broad, off-dry style.
title: Lake Chalice 2009 Falcon Vineyard Riesling (Marlborough)

description: Ripe and fragrant, with hints of peaches and cinnamon on the nose, followed by bold, fruit-driven flavors and more than a touch of sweetness.
title: Giesen 2010 Riesling (Marlborough)

description: Light to medium in body, with simple off-dry apple and citrus flavors and a hint of peppery spice on the finish. Drink now.
title: eco.love 2009 Riesling (South Island)

description: On the riper end of the spectrum, heady aromas of peach, pineapple, ripe grapefruit and a touch of honey and herb are at the fore. Light bodied with a slightly chalky texture and crisp - but not searing - acidity. There's a touch of fruit sweetness here, but overall it's a dry and refreshing drop.
title: Greyrock 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: So pale in color it could be mistaken for water, this perfumed wine smells like bananas, ripe peaches and flowers. The palate is clunky and disjointed, with sweet-and-sour flavors that linger on the finish.
title: Cook Strait 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: There are ripe apple, pear and honey aromas here, but they're somewhat masked, seemingly by sulfur. The palate feels equally trodden upon and watery in texture, with some decent acidity, but fruit weight and residual sugar make the wine feel flat and rather two-dimensional.
title: Fern Ridge 2017 Pinot Gris (Hawke's Bay)

description: The Hawke's Bay region isn't known for its Pinot Gris, but this is a solid example at a very reasonable price. It's citrusy and very nearly dry, giving an overall impression that's a bit lean. Probably best with seafood dishes. Drink now.
title: Sileni 2011 Cellar Selection Pinot Gris (Hawke's Bay)

description: Classified as medium dry on the IRF scale, this is a medium-bodied Riesling without much texture, yet classic apple and citrus aromas and flavors. A sensation of wet stone creeps in on the finish.
title: Forrest 2010 Riesling (Marlborough)

description: A medium-bodied, off-dry style, with scents of baked apples and vegetable oil followed by flavors of apple and peach accented by peppery cinnamon-tinged spice. It's slightly creamy in texture, with a long, mouthcoating finish. Drink now.
title: Jawbone 2009 Reserve Selection Classic Riesling (Marlborough)

description: Peach, pineapple, guava, tomato leaf and dried herb aromas lead the way for a crisp, zesty palate that shows a little fruit weight and a juicy, citrusy finish. It's not overly complicated, but a balanced example of this style.
title: Waxing Moon 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A simple, straightforward sipper showing bright lemon, peach, ginger and floral notes. The palate is light bodied and fruity, seemingly with a touch of residual sugar to balance the acidity. A refreshing, uncomplicated porch pounder.
title: Oyster Bay 2018 Pinot Gris (Hawke's Bay)

description: This wine starts off with aromas of bell pepper and nettle that are followed closely by lemon, grapefruit and flowers. The palate is a little mean and green, with enamel-stripping acidity and heaps of crisp vegetal and citrus flavors. But there's also a mouthwatering lemony finish, which hints at wet stone minerality.
title: Yealands 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This small, family-run producer makes a solid, salt-tinged Sauvignon Blanc from the estate vineyards close to the sea in the cooler Awatere Valley subregion of Marlborough. This wine is a relatively quiet mix of lemon zest, apple peel, sea spray and jalapeno, accompanied by prickly, mouthwatering acidity, a chalky texture and a citrusy finish.
title: Glover Family 2017 Zephyr Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This strawberry-hued Pinot is light on its feet, showing subtle notes of ripe red cherry, strawberry, red currant, florals and touches of vanilla and dried herb. It's light bodied with mouthwatering acidity, clean, bright fruit and a savory, leafy spine.
title: Villa Maria 2017 Private Bin Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This wine starts a touch reductive but quickly blows off in the glass, revealing subtle notes of grapefruit, peach, pineapple, snow pea and bell peppers. Crisp acidity and an almost chalky texture add lift and character beside the fruit weight. The citrus and veg notes continue to work together to create a balanced, zippy drop.
title: Taonga 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: An appealing nose bursting with ripe lemon, pineapple, peach and florals leads to a palate that veers close to the medium-bodied neighborhood. There's bright, tingly, mouthwatering acidity and a long, citrus finish.
title: Hay Maker 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Starting reductive and oniony, this wine takes its time to open, eventually revealing notes of dried herbs, nettles and green beans, with grapefruit and pineapple tones in the background. There's more fruit on the palate, which wraps around enamel-stripping acidity that's resolved by a soft texture on the finish.
title: Vavasour 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

description: This wine offers slightly honeyed tropical and citrus fruits on the nose. The palate adds in biting acidity, a light texture and some heavy fruit.
title: Oyster Bay 2017 Pinot Gris (Hawke's Bay)

description: This wine starts pretty and lifted, full of bright fruits, florals and holiday spices - think blueberry, strawberry, rose, clove and cracked pepper. The palate gets a little more serious, thanks to a tight grip of leathery tannins and lifted acidity that hold together bundles of juicy fruit.
title: Matua 2016 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Right now this wine is reductive, earthy and closed in on itself. Hiding deep within are plush red berry aromas, florals, pepper and baking spices, but, as wines do sometimes, it seems to be going through a shy phase. Try another year in the bottle. Drink now - 2025.
title: Giesen 2016 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a soft, ripely fruited Sauvignon Blanc, embued with hints of passion fruit and lime. It's plump and medium bodied, round on the palate, then tart and lingering on the finish. Drink now.
title: Smythe & Renfield 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This Hawkes Bay producer has turned out a plump, medium-bodied Sauvignon Blanc sourced from Marlborough. Notes of orange and lime sherbet enliven the nose, while tropical fruit comes through on the palate. Clean and refreshing on the finish.
title: Sileni 2011 Cellar Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A lightweight wine seemingly made for poolside sipping, with herbal-grassy tones accenting citrus notes. It's clean on the finish and as refreshing as a cool breeze.
title: Zeal 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Citrus and crushed stone notes start this wine off, followed by lemon sorbet on the palate. It's lightweight, a real summertime refresher, with a short, clean finish.
title: Overstone 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Light in weight, delicate in style, this is just barely off dry. Crisp apple fruit carries hints of riper stone fruit (nectarine?) but is underlain by a distinctly stony note. The lingering finish ably balances tart and sweet.
title: Seifried 2011 Riesling (Nelson)

description: Millton's 2010 Chenin Blanc starts off with a fruit bowl of aromas ranging from apricot to melon. It's a full-bodied, richly textured expression of Chenin Blanc, yet one that retains a certain vibrancy to its ripe flavors of pineapple and stone fruit. Despite being dry, a honeyed note lingers on the long finish.
title: Millton 2010 Te Arai Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Gisborne)

description: This full-bodied, off-dry wine represents a pretty good value in the current market. The flavors hint at peach, melon and citrus but finish clean and refreshing despite evident sweetness.
title: Seifried 2010 Pinot Gris (Nelson)

description: Ballerina pink in hue, this dry, light- to medium-bodied pink sipper is a tasty combo of fruit and spice: strawberries and cream flanked by white pepper and dried herbs. The palate is slippery textured and a little creamy. The supple fruit is lifted by crunchy acidity and an herbal finish.
title: Jules Taylor 2018 OTQ Single Vineyard Pinot Noir Rose (Marlborough)

description: This single-vineyard wine shows all of the cool climate, maritime influence of the Awatere Valley, a subregion of Marlborough. It's an aromatic and balanced mix of green bell pepper, tomato leaf, grapefruit and lemon zest. The whole package is backed by crisp, crunchy acidity, a slippery texture and a long, lemony finish.
title: Yealands 2018 Estate Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

description: In a difficult and complicated vintage, this succeeds in showcasing Marlborough Sauvignon in the light so many have come to recognize and enjoy. Heady, exotic aromas like passion fruit, grapefruit rind, guava and tomato leaf lead into a palate that is light but with some texture to balance zingy acidity. Finishes on an herbal, leafy note.
title: Toi Toi 2018 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This is a highly aromatic wine. Concentrated pineapple and guava aromas rush out of the glass, followed by some snow pea and green bell pepper characters. The palate is equally fruity, and a little residual sugar and fruit weight balance the racy acidity.
title: Fault Line 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Ripe red berry and slightly leafy, stalky aromas lead to a crisp, lightweight palate that's fruity but dry, finishing on a tangy red fruit note. A simple, easy-drinking drop.
title: Toi Toi 2018 Sara Rose (Marlborough)

description: Starting on the quiet, muted side, this eventually opens after some swirling in glass, revealing notes of snow pea, tomato leaf, jalapeno and tropical fruit. The acidity is tingly but feels a touch underripe, and there's some residual sugar seemingly to try to counteract this, which it achieves to some degree, closing on a ripe fruity tone.
title: The Crossings 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Awatere Valley)

description: This wine starts off somewhat reductively and with the variety's typical honeyed tropical and passion fruit aromas. The palate feels a touch disjointed, with searing acidity cutting through a touch of residual sugar and fruit weight.
title: Fire Road 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This wine starts out with aromas of onions and cabbage. This blows off a bit with time in the glass, revealing notes of guava, grapefruit, grass and bell pepper. The palate offers a slippery texture, with biting acidity that gives a sharp edge to this wine.
title: Te Pa 2018 Koha Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Like this producer's other wines, this starts reductively with an oniony aroma that struggles to blow off. Citrus and tropical fruit and snow pea characters lie underneath but are pretty well hidden. The palate improves a bit, with a slippery texture and prickly, if slightly underripe, acidity, although the fruit still feels a little lost.
title: Te Pa 2018 Pa Road Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This is an easy-going, lightweight sipper with pineapple rind, stone fruit and snow pea aromas. On the palate, mouthwatering, prickly acidity balances tropical fruit, making it easy to take another sip.
title: Sea Pearl 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This ticks all the Kiwi Sauvignon Blanc boxes, with upfront aromas of passion fruit, guava, bell pepper and tomato leaf. The palate is lightweight, with crispy, crunchy acidity and a slightly slippery texture. It finishes on an herbal note. Drink now.
title: Toi Toi 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This is a bright, aromatic wine, with generous amounts of tropical fruit, ripe lemon, nettle, honey and a little oyster shell. The palate is light, crisp and slippery textured with a lemony finish.
title: Misty Cove 2017 Reef Ridge Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A closed nose opens up to reveal aromas of citrus, tropical fruit, snow pea and tomato leaf, and, because it's seen some time in barrel, a touch of toasty oak. The medium-bodied palate is all at once grainy and creamy in feel, yet with searing acidity coming in on the midpalate. There's nice fruit weight and a long lemony finish.
title: Giesen 2017 The Brothers Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This charges out of the gate with heady aromas of lychee, pineapple and mango. There are hints of nettle and tomato leaf, but this is a fruit-led, crisp and chalky-textured wine.
title: Baron Edmond de Rothschild 2017 Rimapere Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Confected strawberry and watermelon aromas combine with green veg and yeasty notes that are an odd combo. On the palate, the fruit goes the other way, feeling underripe rather than candied and falling a little flat. Overall, this wine seems a bit overworked and unbalanced.
title: Matua 2017 Elegant & Dry Pinot Noir Rose (Marlborough)

description: This is on the lighter end of the Pinot spectrum. There's quite a bit of cinnamon and stalky characters here, but notes of strawberry and rhubarb are bright as well. Violet and white pepper notes add to the mix. The stalkiness continues on the palate, which is wispy and delicate, showing less in the way of oak and more in the way of crisp fruit and dried leaves.
title: Baron Edmond de Rothschild 2016 Rimapere Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a likable, easygoing Pinot that's fruity but not syrupy. It leads with a bowl of berries - strawberries, raspberries and cranberries - and is quickly followed by notes of baking spice, cracked pepper and violet. It's medium bodied but on the lighter end, with lifted acidity and smooth, stalky tannins. Drink now.
title: Catalina Sounds 2016 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a light, wispy wine that is, for the moment, a little lost in itself. It shows a lot of promise, however. The color is of dried rose petals, and there are quiet notes of tart red berries, florals, black olives and peppercorns, with a meaty undertone. The palate is delicate, but the fruit is on the thin, bitter side. Give this another year or two in the bottle and it might find its way again.
title: Allan Scott 2016 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Pale gold in color, this wine starts with notes of Band-Aid and menthol. Most of it blows off relatively quickly, however, and to the fore come notes of honeyed apple and pear. The palate is medium to full bodied and creamy, thanks to partial lees stirring. It does border on flabby and weighty, but it's just barely redeemed by a line of acidity. The finish is short and fruity.
title: Monowai 2016 Pinot Gris (Hawke's Bay)

description: This is a relatively simple Pinot showing cherry and other ripe red berry aromas along with some soft floral and sweet spice notes. The palate is less generous, however. While ripe fruit is there, it falls a bit flat and sour, not helped but seemingly underripe acidity, blocky oak and drying, grippy tannins.
title: Toi Toi 2016 Clutha Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: This shows a ripe, fairly heavy nose of melon, butterscotch and honey, with a touch of toasty oak and a smoky, mineral streak. The oak becomes more apparent on the palate, particularly on the finish, which is a little short and bitter. But this medium-bodied Chard also tastes of bright lemony fruit and honey, and has enough acidity and structure to age well through 2025.
title: Cloudy Bay 2015 Chardonnay (Marlborough)

description: This starts quite reductive, with notes of onions and old flower stalks. After quite a bit of time in the glass, this blows off, transforming into more appealing honeyed nut and yeasty apple aromas. The medium-bodied palate is on the watery and sour side. But there are crisp apple flavors, too, a nice line of acidity amid a grainy texture and a slightly salty, seashell finish.
title: Spy Valley 2015 Chardonnay (Marlborough)

description: Saint Clair's flagship Sauvignon, the 2011 Wairau Reserve features layers of tropical fruit aromas and a slightly sweaty pungency-just enough to lift and accentuate the fruit. Flavors are a lively mix of ripe tropical and stone fruit, with nettles and other green herbaceous notes. The wine is medium to full bodied and richly textured on the palate while remaining zesty and refreshing.
title: Saint Clair 2011 Wairau Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Framingham is one of New Zealand's Riesling pioneers, but this shows the winery is serious about Sauvignon Blanc as well. There's a smoky, struck-flint character on the nose, then layers of citrusy fruit on the palate. It's medium bodied, with a long, grapefruity finish.
title: Framingham 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: From a block in the lower part of the Wairau Valley, this is a pungently herbal expression of Sauvignon Blanc. Yet there's plenty of body and textural richness to offset and even complement the green tomato and tobacco notes, and a suggestion of briny minerality on the long finish.
title: Saint Clair 2011 Pioneer Block 18 Snap Block Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Intensely passion fruity from start to finish, with accents of fresh herbs just adding a bit of complexity. This is a medium-bodied, creamy-textured Sauvignon Blanc that displays an admirable blend of ripe tropical fruit and just a hint of green.
title: Saint Clair 2011 Pioneer Block 1 Foundation Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Saint Clair produces some 86,000 cases of this solid Sauvignon Blanc. If it's not quite as rich, concentrated or flamboyant as its Pioneer Block bottlings, it still delivers authentic Marlborough Sauvignon character. Pineapple and tomato leaf notes are well balanced, while the wine is medium bodied and slightly creamy in the mouth.
title: Saint Clair 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Pungent scents of crushed tomato or nettle leaves enliven this lightweight wine. It's citrusy and pleasantly leafy on the palate, with a finish that turns slightly chalky.
title: Oyster Bay 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Ripe and round in style, this large-production (almost 100,000 cases) Sauvignon Blanc may lack a bit of length, but otherwise offers a lush mouthful of stone and tropical fruit accented by modestly grassy notes.
title: Saint Clair 2011 Vicar's Choice Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Impressive for its bold tropical fruit flavors and subtle texture, this is a nicely proportioned Sauvignon Blanc that manages to combine richness with enough refreshing citrus to achieve balance. Drink now.
title: Jawbone 2010 Reserve Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This is the rare Riesling that has seen some oak influence. Yet it's not obtrusive at all, and just adds hints of honey, vanilla and toast to the wine's already complex flavors, encompassing lilac blossoms, fresh greens, peach and tangerine. It's on the full-bodied side of the Riesling spectrum, with just a pinch of residual sugar and a pleasant cremainess on the midpalate.
title: Greywacke 2010 Riesling (Marlborough)
