description: This is full-bodied, offering subtle cashew and melon shadings alongside bold pineapple fruit. The oak stands a little apart on the palate, imparting a touch of dryness to the bright fruit. Drink now.
title: Omaka Springs 2009 Falveys Vineyard Chardonnay (Marlborough)

description: A light-bodied, delicate style of Pinot Noir, with pretty cherry fruit and plenty of forest and earth complexity. Silky on the finish, with hints of tea leaf. Probably best over the next year or two.
title: Ara 2009 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is slightly bigger and earthier than Ara's other 2009 Pinot Noir, with notes more of beet than cherry, and hints of dried herbs and mushrooms. It's a sturdy wine that could stand up to braised meats.
title: Ara 2009 Pathway Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: A silky, easy-drinking Pinot Noir, but one that retains Martinborough's savory profile, featuring hints of dark earth and mushrooms alongside black cherries. Drink now.
title: Margrain 2008 River's Edge Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: Made from biodynamically grown fruit, this cranberry-hued wine is light and silky textured, weaving savory, fine-grained tannins and focused acidity with stony minerality, juicy cran-raspberry fruit, cinnamon and stalks. Between the cracks lie violet, pepper and warm earth.
title: Clos Henri 2017 Petit Clos Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This vintage shows plump plum and cherry aromas, laced with licorice, damp earth, dried herb, flower and cola. The textured palate sees supple fruit running along an earthy, herbal spine, held together by fine-grained, savory tannins. The oak rears its head particularly on the finish, but overall this is a balanced and finessed wine. Drink now after a short time in a decanter or through 2024.
title: Jules Taylor 2017 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is an ultrareductive, thin wine that only partially blows off with some vigorous swirling in the glass. Underneath the reductive notes lurk fresh red berry, floral and dried herb aromas. The palate is light to medium bodied and comes with sinewy, grippy tannins. But the acidity feels a little underripe, and the fruit a touch sour.
title: Te Pa 2017 Pa Road Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a light, pretty and enjoyable wine that exemplifies the changing tide toward more delicate Marlborough Pinot styles. It combines fresh cran-raspberry fruit notes with floral tones, cracked pepper, tar, and an earthy, stalky core. Light bodied, with crunchy, tangy fruit and a soft, satiny line of savory tannins, this would be great slightly chilled on an early spring day.
title: Glover Family 2016 Zephyr Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a light-bodied, fairly oaky expression of Pinot showing cranberry, raspberry, dried herb and flower, licorice and cola oak spice. The palate is tightly wound with savory olivey, oaky tannins, laser sharp acidity and tart red fruit. Drink now and for the next few years.
title: Komaru 2016 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: A straightforward, perfumed Pinot offering up ripe, almost candied aromas of strawberries and blueberries along with grape jelly, florals, black pepper and oak spice. The palate is on the rounder, fuller end of the spectrum, with plump fruit and oak spice flavors and earthy tannins. Finishes short and a little flat.
title: Innocent Bystander 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: This is a solidly medium-bodied wine that offers up plush rhubarb and strawberry aromas with red licorice, dried herb and a touch of wood spice. There's plenty of fruit weight on the palate but also a good lick of acidity that keeps things lifted, accompanied by soft, dusty tannins and a tangy red berry finish.
title: Fire Road 2016 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a dense, oaky wine that at first is pretty closed on the nose. After some vigorous swirling it ekes out aromas of red currant, plum, tar and savory oak spice. It's full bodied with slightly biting acidity and grippy, grainy tannins. Closes with bitter oak and tart red fruit.
title: Mud House 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: This starts out quite stinky and reductive, with associated barnyard, sweat and onion aromas dominating. Underneath are ripe, dense cherry and strawberry aromas, sweet spices and florals. The palate is on the heavy, flat side, with more ripe fruit and plenty of oak that seems to be aiding in weighing the whole thing down.
title: Brancott 2016 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This dense wine starts out quite closed, with a distinctly earthy, barnyard funk. After time in the glass, it starts to blow off, uncovering red berry fruit, florals and peppery spice. Things improve on the palate, which delivers a clean line of acidity, drying, grainy tannins and a good lick of oak. An herbal, cranberry note marks the finish.
title: Marisco Vineyards 2016 The Ned Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Reductive at first, with notes of onion and menthol at the fore, this blows off with time in the glass. In its place are tones of yeasty apple, oat, ginger and buttery brioche. The palate is medium bodied but has an unexpected lightness and delicacy to it. It's slippery textured but with a long line of focused acidity. The toasty oak creeps in on the finish.
title: Villa Maria 2015 Single Vineyard Taylors Pass Chardonnay (Marlborough)

description: This bottling is a bit green and herbal while remaining plump and ripe in the mouth. The aromas are intense and vibrant, redolent of gooseberries and crushed tomato leaves, while the flavors are a beguiling mix of ripe tropical fruit, with an herbal edge that lingers on the finish.
title: Saint Clair 2011 Pioneer Block 3 43 Degrees Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Complex on the nose and richly textured in the mouth, this wine delivers it all. Hints of struck flint and wild onion accent grapefruit aromas, while the flavors range easily from pink grapefruit and red currant to delicate herb shadings. It's full without being too full, with a potent yet refreshing finish that seemingly lingers forever.
title: Dog Point 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Former Cloudy Bay winemaker Kevin Judd's new label displays a vibrant pungency to its leafy aromas, then opens up on the palate to add gooseberry and grapefruit notes. It's refreshingly medium bodied, with a slightly creamy texture and a long finish filled with pink grapefruit.
title: Greywacke 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This Marlborough classic remains on form, artfully blending pineapple and crushed tomato leaf notes. If it's a bit leaner than some examples from the region, it's also more elegant and refined; less explosive and flamboyant, but tighter and more focused.
title: Cloudy Bay 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This is a full-bodied, soft and round style of Pinot Gris that's almost completely dry. Understated pear and melon aromas combine with hints of fern fronds to create an enchanting bouquet, while the flavors are more straightforward and fruity. Drink now.
title: Jules Taylor 2011 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

description: Since this wine weighs in at 14% abv and still retains more than 17 g/L of residual sugar, the fruit was clearly very ripe. That ripeness is reflected in the flavors as well, which feature nectarine and honey accented by hints of white pepper. It's full bodied and lush, with a long finish that mingles the sensations of sweet and spicy. Drink now.
title: Forrest 2010 Tatty Bogler Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

description: This is a lush, creamy-textured wine, redolent of roasted cashews and grilled pineapple. It's toward the full-bodied side of the spectrum for New Zealand Chardonnay, but retains ample complexity in its interplay of nuts and citrus, with a hint of peach on the long finish. Drink now.
title: Esk Valley 2010 Chardonnay (Hawke's Bay)

description: This is only light to medium in body, but it has a tactile, peach-skin element that gives it extra interest on the palate and pleasant flinty notes alongside modest citrus fruit. Drink now.
title: Starborough 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: It's nice to see this historic winery finally being represented in the United States. This offers scents of toasted grain, smoke, citrus and just a hint of butter before it hits the palate with ample weight and a slightly creamy texture. A bit woody and smoky, but nice in that style. Drink now.
title: Mission Estate 2010 Chardonnay (Hawke's Bay)

description: This offers quality that's almost the equal of Seifried's primary label Pinot Gris for a couple dollars less. Melon rind, pineapple and cinnamon notes are pervasive. This is plump and expansive on the palate, yet remains focused through the soft, elegant finish.
title: Seifried 2010 Old Coach Road Pinot Gris (Nelson)

description: This medium-bodied wine is bright and refreshing, filled with tart citrus flavors. Hints of fresh-cut grass, passion fruit and pineapple keep it interesting. Drink now.
title: Lil Rippa 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: Starts well, with pineapple and gooseberry aromas, but it doesn't seem that intense or concentrated on the palate. This is a medium-bodied, slightly creamy-textured wine that's easy to drink.
title: Konrad 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: A simple, medium-bodied Chardonnay that emphasizes the variety's fruity characteristics. Apple, pineapple and citrus pick up a hint of peppery or clove-like spice on the finish.
title: Stratum 2010 Chardonnay (Marlborough)

description: Dry and medium bodied, this features ample apple and citrus notes, accented by hints of chalk dust and spice. Drink it over the next six months.
title: Lake Chalice 2010 Eyrie Vineyard Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

description: This wine's pineapple fruit carries a faintly lactic note along with it, although it doesn't show much in the way of an enriched texture. Drink now.
title: Sileni 2010 Cellar Selection Chardonnay (Hawke's Bay)

description: Broad and off dry, this is bulky for Riesling, with weighty notes of honey and stone fruit. There's a pleasant whiff of mossy stones and a hint of petrol, but also a hint of bitterness on the finish.
title: Mud House 2010 The Mound Vineyard Riesling (Waipara)

description: Over the past several vintages, Villa's tannin management in its Reserve Cab-Merlot has evolved to make the wines more approachable young. This blend of 75% Cabernet and 25% Merlot is fleshy and supple without being soft, with leafy cassis fruit framed by hints of vanilla and charred oak. Drink now-2023.
title: Villa Maria 2009 Gimblett Gravels Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Hawke's Bay)

description: A top-notch offering, this combines ample weight and richness with an impression of focus and purity. It's smoky and subtly toasty on the nose, seamlessly marrying those notes with apple, peach and citrus flavors. Long, lingering and very fine on the finish. Drink now-2017.
title: Neudorf 2009 Moutere Chardonnay (Nelson)

description: Already mature, this shows hints of bricking at the rim, plus complex aromas of decaying leaf litter, herbal-briary touches and delicate strawberry shadings. Finishes long and silky. Delicious; drink now.
title: Croney Estates 2009 Two Ton Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: Reasonably priced for a Hawke's Bay blend of this quality, this medium- to full-bodied wine offers scents of cassis and dried herbs and a crisp, mouthwatering finish. The fruit is bright and focused, which sould give it at least 5-7 years of longevity.
title: Te Awa 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Hawke's Bay)

description: A nicely balanced, slightly herbal version of Martinborough Pinot Noir, with pretty berry and herb shadings and a bit of mushroomy savoriness. Turns tart on the finish.
title: Te Kairanga 2009 Estate Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: At only $12 per bottle, this is a solid value. The aromas are slightly dusty, like dried rose petal, while the flavors suggest mixed berries and dry earth, with a hint of black tea on the finish. Tannins are silky. Drink now.
title: Stoneburn 2009 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: A solid effort for the price, marrying hints of pencil-like oak with bright pineapple and lemon drop flavors. There's ample weight and texture without going over the top, and a moderately long finish. Drink up.
title: Fernz 2009 Chardonnay (Marlborough)

description: This is a crisp, solidy structured Marlborough Pinot (a region known more for soft and accessible Pinots), which gives it a leg up on much of the competition. Plum and cherry fruit dominates, with shadings of mocha, root beer and tea leaves adding touches of complexity. Drink now-2018.
title: Saint Clair 2009 Pioneer Block 4 Sawcut Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Sourced from the Waihopai Valley subregion, this is a round, soft Pinot Noir. It emphasizes fruit, but the black cherry notes are undeniably attractive and nicely balanced, framed by silky tannins. Easy to like and easy to drink, now-2014.
title: Marisco Vineyards 2009 The Ned Benmorven Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Shows a slightly evolved color for a wine this young, with hints of brick already creeping in at the rim, but it also delivers elegant sous bois aromas, bright cherry and cranberry fruit and notes of scorched wood and leather that turn more mocha-like on the finish. Drink now.
title: Wairau River 2009 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a tart, lean, somewhat ungenerous Pinot Noir, but one that still manages to deliver an attractive, creative tension between its earthy, composty aromas and bright cranberry fruit.
title: Dashwood 2009 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: A supple, medium-bodied Pinot Noir with a pronounced acidic edge. Cranberry is the starring fruit here, framed by coffee-like oak. Crisp and a bit astringent on the finish.
title: Mt. Difficulty 2009 Roaring Meg Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: A pleasing, ready-to-drink Pinot Noir, Margrain's 2008 Home Block is a modest step up in concentration and length from its River's Edge bottling, but displays similar notes of dark cherries and berries and a mushroomy edge.
title: Margrain 2008 Home Block Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: This tart, medium-bodied Pinot Noir features sour cherry and cranberry fruit blended with hints of minty herbs and fresh compost. Drink now.
title: Lil Rippa 2008 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Reflecting the difficulties of the vintage, this is a slightly edgy, coarsely textured wine, with sweet, oaky notes framing cherries and roasted beets. Try it with something slightly rustic, like beef stew.
title: Spy Valley 2008 Satellite Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Ready to drink, this Pinot is already losing color and going brick at the rim, its modest red berry fruit falling away to reveal notes of brown sugar, vanilla and even a touch of wintergreen. Supple in texture, with mouthwatering acids on the finish.
title: Ara 2008 Composite Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Pale in color, with modest aromas and flavors of tart strawberries and brown sugar. There's not much texture or weight to this effort, but it's fine for casual drinking over the summer.
title: Tablelands 2009 Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: From a difficult vintage, this is an impressively youthful wine, loaded with bold cherry fruit that's vibrant, fresh and clean, with shadings of coffee-tinged oak on the silky finish. For drinking now and over the next few years.
title: Villa Maria 2008 Reserve Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a medium-bodied Pinot with plenty of lifted raspberry and strawberry fruit, thanks to 20% whole bunch fermentation, along with aromas of flower, clove, herbal tonic and an oak-derived spice. On the palate, tart red currant flavors and crisp acidity are tempered by grainy, woody tannins. The oak becomes more apparent on the finish, which is a little clunky.
title: Te Pa 2017 Koha Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Cherries and raspberries are backed by distinctive notes of meat and mushroom, dried herb and wood spice on this medium-bodied wine. The fruit is plush and weighty on the palate, and the tannins are a little woody and blocky, but in general, those who like a richer style of Pinot will be happy plonking this affordable bottle on the table.
title: The Crossings 2016 Pinot Noir (Awatere Valley)

description: This is a medium- to full-bodied Pinot with fairly prominent oak influence. Aromas are rich and heady, wafting ripe red berries, Christmas spices, vanilla and Dr. Pepper. It's all bordering on soapy and a touch synthetic. The palate is also rich, and the spicy oak more apparent and a little bitter on the finish. The fruit, however, is juicy and plush without being syrupy, and tannins are relatively soft and earthy. Drink now and for the next few years.
title: Invivo 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Like the previous vintage, this is a full-bodied Chard charging out of the gate with toasted nut and smoke aromas, threaded through with soft pineapple and stone fruit and vanillin oak. The palate is more restrained while still being rich. It's creamy in texture, with yet more nutty, smoky, ripe fruit and wood spice flavors balanced by crunchy acidity. Drink now - 2027.
title: Greywacke 2015 Chardonnay (Marlborough)

description: Loaded with fruit-apricot, pineapple and passion fruit-this is an attractive, medium-bodied Pinot Gris with just a hint of sweetness. Enjoy it over the next year.
title: Mt. Difficulty 2011 Roaring Meg Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

description: A lovely example of dry Marlborough Pinot Gris, with plenty of weight and a round, creamy texture that sets it apart. Pear and melon notes on the nose and palate blend with hints of honey, clove and plenty of indefinable spice. It's ready to drink now, but should hold for 2-3 years.
title: Huia 2010 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

description: A full-bodied, lushly textured wine with aromas and flavors that hint at peach or nectarine, honey and vanilla. This is just slightly off dry (8 g/L residual sugar), but that sweetness is balanced with a bit of tartness and a dash of white pepper on the finish. Drink now.
title: Greywacke 2010 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

description: This medium-bodied Pinot Gris is nearly dry in style, with crisp acids that give it a somewhat angular feel. Melon and citrus notes finish with a slightly bitter hint of orange pith. Drink now.
title: Maude 2010 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

description: A medium-bodied Chardonnay with a focus on fruit. Honeydew and citrus flavors take the lead, then finish crisp and clean.
title: Villa Maria 2010 Private Bin Unoaked Chardonnay (Hawke's Bay)

description: This is a full-bodied, firmly tannic blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot that's built for the cellar. It boasts copious amounts of vanilla and cedar, but there's plenty of cassis fruit to support it, and that fruit comes through strongly on the intense, long finish. Drink 2015-2025.
title: Sacred Hill 2009 Helmsman Red (Hawke's Bay)

description: Less weighty than some of the other top-rated Hawke's Bay Syrahs, Homage relies on complexity rather than raw power. Its sour plum fruit is perfectly balanced by black olive and roasted meat, hints of bacon and espresso, while the tannins are fine and silky, the acids bright. Drink now-2025.
title: Trinity Hill 2009 Homage Syrah (Hawke's Bay)

description: This Villa Maria Chardonnay starts off with toasted custardy richness on the nose, hints of vanilla and relatively restrained fruit, then reveals its intensity on the palate, where flavors of vanilla, pineapple, citrus and smoke swirl together. Despite the richness, it's tightly structured, with a long, textured yet bright finish. Drink now-2018.
title: Villa Maria 2009 Taylors Pass Vineyard Chardonnay (Marlborough)

description: This blend of five Bordeaux varieties is a solid value, offering intense and pure cassis fruit that's subtly framed by coffee, chocolate and the faintest hint of dried herbs. The overall feel is sturdy, with firm tannins. Drink 2015-2025.
title: Trinity Hill 2009 The Gimblett Red (Hawke's Bay)

description: This wine's elevated percentage of Merlot (63%) no doubt accounts for its forward, supple character. Cassis and black cherry notes pick up hints of tobacco, all framed by soft tones of vanilla and cedar. Drink now-2018.
title: Alluviale 2009 Gimblett Road Red Wine Red (Hawke's Bay)

description: A dark, savory style of Pinot Noir, with intense aromas and flavors of cedar, coffee and cola that turn a bit dry and astringent on the finish. It's fairly big in the mouth, yet not particularly rich or textured. Drink it over the next few years.
title: Lake Chalice 2009 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is plump and round without being heavy, a slightly chunky Pinot featuring modest plum fruit. Savory accents of roasted meat and coffee add interest. At its suggested retail price of $15, it represents excellent value.
title: Hunter's 2009 Jane Hunter Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This seems to be hurrying along its aging curve, showing a burnished gold color. It's smoky and intense, with citrusy fruit that's more like grapefruit than anything else, plus plenty of weight and bright acidity. Drink up.
title: Man O' War 2009 Valhalla Chardonnay (Waiheke Island)

description: This lightweight Pinot Noir features high-toned red-fruit aromas and flavors. Strawberry and red cherry notes dominate, but there are hints of coffee and nail polish as well. Drink now.
title: Mana 2009 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Pretty ripe stuff, marked by hints of stewed berries and chocolate. It's medium to full in body, with soft tannins, yet the acids remain crisp, turning tart almost to the point of being citrusy on the finish.
title: Stoneleigh 2009 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a fairly big, muscular Pinot Noir, with beefy black-cherry fruit and oaky overtones of brown sugar. Give it a year or more to smooth out, because the long, intense finish filled with berry fruit shows tremendous promise. Drink 2013-2020.
title: Carrick 2009 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Basically a second label of Seresin, this is a medium-bodied, crisp Pinot Noir with bright cherry-berry fruit, a slightly briary, peppery quality and hints of button mushroom. It should drink well for the next few years.
title: Momo 2009 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This Pinot Noir from the Bannockburn subregion is a bit chunky and extracted without going too far, marrying ripe black cherry fruit with hints of cinnamon and coffee. It lacks the finesse of Carrick's pricier bottling, but offers a rich mouthful of Pinot at an attractive price.
title: Carrick 2009 Unravelled Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: The Nautilus wines have been getting better and better, and this dark-toned Pinot is no exception. It shows excellent complexity-black cherry and dark earth notes alongside hints of cured meat and sassafras-as well as a round mouthfeel that never turns jammy. It's firm enough to hold 2-3 years, if you prefer.
title: Nautilus 2009 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Always one of the most approachable Pinot bottlings from Felton Road, the Bannockburn is a medium-bodied wine in 2009, redolent of earth, smoke and mushrooms. Silky tannins on the finish frame flavors of ripe cherries, dark earth and a hint of espresso. Drink now-2016.
title: Felton Road 2009 Bannockburn Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Although CB made its reputation on Sauvignon Blanc, the Pinot Noir is finally achieving a similar level of quality. Dark cherry fruit is couched in notes of sandalwood, cinnamon and clove, framed by tannins that are silky without being excessively soft. Drink now-2016.
title: Cloudy Bay 2009 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: The husband-and-wife team of Mike and Claire Allen have turned out 2,000 cases of this terrific value, which delivers authentic Pinot Noir complexity at an attractive price. Bold black cherry fruit carries subtle herb, twig and vanilla shadings with aplomb, while the texture turns velvety on the lengthy finish. Drink now-2017.
title: Huia 2009 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Kennedy Point is located on Waiheke Island, so this is contract grown and made for the label in the Marlborough region but the results in 2009 are very good. It delivers campfire-like notes, plus black cherry fruit and hints of brown sugar, mocha and cinnamon. Drink this supple wine over the next year or so.
title: Kennedy Point 2009 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Slightly herbal in style, with hints of tomato leaf accenting black cherry fruit. This is a crisp, fresh-even tangy-red that perhaps needs a few months to settle down and smooth out. Try it later this year; it should cellar well through 2018.
title: Villa Maria 2009 Cellar Selection Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This wine shows a fair bit of oak influence; notes reminiscent of brown sugar and mocha mingle with savory, root-vegetable-like fruit. The tannins are supple, the wine reasonably balanced in terms of alcohol and acids. Drink now.
title: Nobilo 2009 Icon Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: From a challenging vintage, this wine matches the intensity of barrel-fermentation and aging with potent grapefruit notes. The mouthfeel is creamy and lush, while the flavors of oak spice and citrus linger easily on the finish. Fully mature; drink up.
title: Dog Point 2008 Section 94 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)

description: This is nicely nuanced and silky in style, boasting delicate scents of mushrooms and tea backed by flavors of cranberries, leather and dried leaves. Long and elegant on the finish. Drink now.
title: Jawbone 2008 Reserve Selection Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: The 2008 vintage wasn't an easy one in Marlborough, but Ivan Sutherland and James Healy (both formerly of Cloudy Bay) have turned in an excellent effort. Even after almost four years, the wine remains dark and vibrant in color, with bold black cherry fruit accented by hints of plum and coffee. Tannins are soft and acids crisp, making it a wine to enjoy over the next few years.
title: Dog Point 2008 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Full bodied, creamy in texture and long on the finish, the 2009 Le Sol is the complete package. Blackberry fruit is accented by cracked pepper and vanilla, but closer examination reveals hints of black olive and coffee as well. The tannins are exquisitely silky on the finish, where the fruit comes to the fore. Drink now-2020.
title: Craggy Range 2009 Le Sol Syrah (Hawke's Bay)

description: Faintly herbal or green bean notes seem to fade a bit with airing, giving way to cassis fruit and oak-derived elements of vanilla and brown sugar. This is full bodied and richly textured, with a long, velvety finish. Drink now-2020.
title: Newton Forrest Estate 2009 Cornerstone Red (Hawke's Bay)

description: This pretty Pinot is less concentrated than those in Palliser's The Great... series, but the fruit speaks louder nonetheless. Bright cherry fruit retains Martinborough's savory, earthy edge while finishing crisp, with a hint of tea leaf. Drink now.
title: Palliser Estate 2008 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: A chunky, muscular example of Pinot Noir, with dark fruit and lashings of oak. Coffee, vanilla and bacon notes blend with black cherries. It's firmly tannic on the finish right now, so try it in 2013.
title: Palliser Estate 2009 The Great Marco Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: Craggy Range's Pinot Noir is typically an intense, concentrated wine, and the current release is no exception. Dark cherry fruit is nicely framed by vanillin oak, the tannins are creamy smooth and the acids provide tangy relief on the finish. Drink now-2018.
title: Craggy Range 2009 Te Muna Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: From a single vineyard at the top of the Brancott Valley, this is a harmonious, silky-texured Pinot, with typical black cherry and sous bois notes and hints of charred beef and cedar. Finishes long, crisp and vibrant. Drink now-2016.
title: Jules Taylor 2009 The Wrekin Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Sourced from a high-altitude vineyard near the top of the Awatere Valley, this wine shows some of the leafiness characteristic of the region. The fruit is more roasted root vegetable than tree fruit, with a potent savory and fairly muscular character.
title: Jules Taylor 2009 Ballochdale Estate Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a solid, well made Pinot Noir, just one that shows more oak than fruit at this stage of its evolution. Vanilla and coffee flavors overshadow pleasant cherry and herb notes in this medium-bodied, slightly chewy wine.
title: Palliser Estate 2008 The Great Walter Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: Made from Alfrocheiro, this crisp wine is textured, with a steely edge. By contrast the lively mousse and citrus freshness give an attractive lift. As its name suggests, it is dry and is more of a food wine than an aperitif.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2013 Ravasqueira Grande Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Alentejano)

description: Ripe and fruity, this wine shows a good balance between crisp red fruits and a richer underlay from the wood aging and concentrated Touriga Nacional. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Manuel Carvalho Martins 2017 Golpe Single Vineyard Rose (Douro)

description: Fermentation in wood has given spice and delicious richness to this lemon-flavored wine. A mineral texture adds complexity to this ripe wine that finishes with refreshing acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Monte Branco 2017 Alento Reserva Branco White (Alentejano)

description: Delicious and refreshing, this wine balances acidity and bright green and white fruits. A tangy edge goes with the lively texture and zesty aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Paсos 2017 Casa de Paсos Loureiro-Arinto White (Vinho Verde)

description: The granite soil lends a mineral edge to this otherwise ripe, perfumed wine. With lychee and apricot flavors, the wine is ripe and ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Paсos 2017 Casa de Paсos Fernuo Pires (Minho)

description: This wine comes from 100-year-old vines, giving both concentration and intense white-fruit flavors. It is strongly textured, bringing together minerality and some wood-aging flavors. These, along with fruit and acidity, suggest aging. Drink from 2020.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2017 Conceito Branco White (Douro)

description: Fresh while also creamy, this wine is full of ripe apple fruits cut with lemon zest. It is a young wine with rich potential and a strong texture. Let the forward fruitiness calm down and drink from 2019.
title: Quinta de Paсos 2017 Casa do Capituo-Mor Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: A blend of four grapes, this wine is ripe, creamy and immediately attractive. It has a fresh feel as well as richness, with white-fruit and apricot flavors melding well together. Drink this wine now.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2017 Superior White (Alentejano)

description: Lightly herbal, this crisp, cool wine is also rich with pear and melon flavors. The acidity and mineral edge give it an extra attractiveness. The wine is still a little young, so wait until mid-2019.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2017 Alvarinho (Tejo)

description: Rounded, smooth and ripe, this attractively balanced wine is rich with spiced apples and crisp with tight grapefruit flavors and minerality. The wine comes from a Coutada, a protected nature reserve. It is fruity, structured and ready to drink.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2017 Vinha da Coutada Velha White (Alentejano)

description: Named after a Coutada, a nature reserve, this wine is soft and rounded, rich with spice and ripe white stone fruits. Acidity and a mineral texture give the wine a lift and framework. Drink now.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2017 Coutada Velha Signature White (Alentejano)

description: This ripe wine is just nicely ready to drink. It is full bodied and rich with concentrated green-fruit flavors, good acidity and a smooth final texture. From the northern Vinho Verde region, it is ready to drink now.
title: Quinta de Paсos 2016 Casa do Capituo-Mor Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)

description: With eight months in wood, this is a rich, creamy wine with a touch of spice. A rich blend of four Douro white grapes, it offers apricot and pineapple flavors as well as tight acidity. Drink the wine now.
title: Santos & Seixo 2016 Santos da Casa Reserva White (Douro)

description: A classic blend of Duo grapes including Alfrocheiro and Jaen, this wine has touches of spice from wood aging as well as rich tannins and dense blackberry flavors. Its directness and ripeness give the wine structure and great fruitiness. Drink from 2019.
title: Boas Quintas 2016 Fonte do Ouro Reserva Red (Duo)

description: Rich and full bodied, this wine is made from wood-aged Antuo Vaz, ripe and full of generous fruit and spice. Produced from old vines, the wine has concentration that contrasts with the good acidity. Drink now.
title: Ribafreixo 2016 Pato Frio Grande Escolha Antuo Vaz (Alentejo)

description: The small amount of Syrah in an otherwise typical Douro blend gives this wine both its perfumed character and also its classification as a regional wine. The wine is firm, structured with plenty of minerality amid all the black fruits. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2016 R de Romaneira Red (Duriense)

description: Richly structured and with fine tannins, this spicy wine is also full of black fruits. Its balance is just right, with concentration and a dense texture lifted by the final acidity. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2017 Dona Vitoria Coleсuo Privada Red (Alentejano)

description: This ripe, bold wine is full of dark fruits and ripe tannins. Its structure is firm within the juicy blackberry flavors and acidity. This powerful wine is ready for aging and should not be drunk before mid-2019.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2017 Coutada Velha Signature Red (Alentejano)

description: Spicy and herbal, this wine comes from a field blend of obviously old varietals. Flavors of thyme, rosemary and lemon juice give it a fresh, textured character. It is a wine to savor in a few months, so drink from summer 2019.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2017 Contraste Branco White (Douro)

description: Close to the slopes of the Serra de Montejunto hills, this vineyard has produced a warm, ripe wine. Rich apple and melon flavors are integrated with a mineral edge and attractive tangy acidity, with a crisp, textured aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2017 Quinta de Pancas Branco White (Lisboa)

description: Crisp and fruity, this young wine needs some taming. Its bright fruits are right up front, packed with citrus and tangy acidity. The intensity will soften over the next few months and the wine will be best from mid-2019.
title: Mouchuo 2017 Dom Rafael White (Alentejo)

description: This rich, full-bodied wine has been wood aged, giving it a smooth, concentrated texture and ripe tannins. The structure of the wine and its black-fruit-dominated character point to aging potential. Drink from 2019.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2017 Superior Red (Alentejano)

description: This wood-aged Touriga Nacional offers great weight and richness from the layers of black-plum and berry fruits. A mineral edge comes from the granite soil. It has definite aging potential. Drink from 2022.
title: Boas Quintas 2016 Fonte do Ouro Reserva Especial Touriga Nacional (Duo)

description: This generous wine offers flavors of licorice and black fruit. It comes from a blend of Touriga Nacional and Aragonez grown on the Quinta do Gradil estate. Rich and full of fruit, the wine should age another few months. Drink from mid-2019.
designation: Castelo do Sulco Seleсuo dos Enologos Reserva
title: Parras Vinhos 2016 Castelo do Sulco Seleсuo dos Enologos Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This powerfully structured, young wine is dense and shot through with tannins as well as dark black fruits. It has weight and considerable potential as its tannins begin to soften. Drink this intense wine from 2020.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2016 Contraste Red (Douro)

description: Attractive soft fruit and touches of tannins give this wine an instant appeal. The black-currant freshness is balanced by a core of dryness and lifted by acidity. This wine is ready to drink.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2016 Duas Quintas Red (Douro)

description: This generous wine is ripe with black fruits, with a backdrop of rich tannins. The wine also has a fresher side, appropriate for a bottling from a region close to the Atlantic. Balance is a watchword here and also potential. Drink the wine from 2020.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2016 Quinta de Pancas Red (Lisboa)

description: Partial aging in Portuguese and French oak barrels has given this wine a smooth texture. It has a light touch of tannins but the fruit and hints of toast are the main characteristics. The berry fruits are softening well and the wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Reserva do Monte Red (Lisboa)

description: This ripe, spicy blend of Tinta Roriz, Touriga Nacional and Syrah is full, warm and richly structured. It comes from vines at the Quinta do Gradil estate, oak aged and packed with open tannins. Drink now..
title: Parras Vinhos 2016 Ruelas Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: Smoothly textured and with dense black fruits, this is an open wine. The tannins are generous, backing up juicy black-plum flavors and the rich structure. The wine is balanced and deliciously ready to drink.
title: Parras Vinhos 2016 Mula Velha Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This estate wine from this family property in the heart of the Lisboa region is structured with refined tannins and swathes of ripe black fruits. Fermented in open lagars and then aged for 18 months in wood, it has spice, a dense structure and the ability to age further. Drink from 2020.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2015 Red (Lisboa)

description: This rich, wood-aged wine also has a crisp edge from the bright fruit. Structured and mineral-rich with acidity and yellow fruits, it has weight as well as a fresher side from its high-altitude old vines. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Quinta do Cardo Vinha Lamedo Siria (Beira Interior)

description: A full, rich wine packed with tannins and layers of black fruits, this is dense and structured. Juicy black-currant and berry flavors are bolstered by tannins and by intense acidity. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Portas da Herdade Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Lightly wood aged, this wine has spice, ripe berry fruits and plenty of juicy acidity. Its fresh side contrasts with the rich, perfumed character of the Syrah and Touriga Nacional used in the blend. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2017 Lobo e Falcuo Red (Tejo)

description: A field blend from 90-year-old vines in the Douro Superior, this wine has weight and richness along with style and concentration. The black fruits are cut with juicy acidity, ripe tannins and hints of oak aging. Wait on this wine and drink from 2022.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2016 Conceito Red (Douro)

description: From selected grapes, this wine is richly structured and dense. It has a good balance between acidity and the ripe black fruits. Tannins and the solid structure are just coming together with the fruit. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2016 Lobo e Falcuo Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: A selection of the best fruit goes into this concentrated wine. The Cabernet Sauvignon and Touriga Nacional impart tannins along with ripe black-currant and berry fruits. This ripe, wood-aged wine should age and will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2015 Quinta de Pancas Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This juicy red-berry-flavored wine is ripe and structured. It has a solid feel with its firm tannins and opulent fruitiness. This is developing into a full-bodied wine, the licorice and black-chocolate flavors emphasizing the wine's intensity. Drink from 2019.
title: Monte Branco 2015 Alento Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Well structured and rich, this wine has layers of dark fruits, ripe tannins and good acidity. A blend of three grapes, it is dominated by Aragonez, with Alicante Bouschet giving the rich, dark color. Drink now.
title: Ribafreixo 2015 Pato Frio Red Edition Red (Alentejano)

description: A soft, fruity, lightly textured wine from the Mouchuo estate, this is made to be drunk young. It has some structure although the main success of the wine lies in its poised black fruits and acidity. Drink this ripe wine now.
title: Mouchuo 2015 Dom Rafael Red (Alentejo)

description: Fermented in traditional open-top granite tanks and aged for three years in large wood barrels, this wine celebrates Alicante Bouschet. It has power, dense tannins and a powerfully rich texture. These contrast well with the solid black fruits and the impressive poise and elegance. It is not quite ready to drink, so wait until mid-2019.
title: Mouchuo 2013 Red (Alentejo)

description: This wine is rich, layered with wood, spice and intense white fruits. Dense and powerful, at times it overwhelms with its ripeness. However, the crisp acidity that shoots through redeems and lifts the wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2017 Duas Quintas Reserva Branco White (Douro)

description: This is a dark-colored wine, richly endowed with juicy black fruits and a firm layer of tannins. It has weight and generous structure from the opulent fruitiness and balanced acidity. Drink from 2019.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2017 Valcatrina Red (Lisboa)

description: This powerful wine offers great fruits, solid tannins and concentration. It comes from a single parcel of vines that imparts richness, structure and balanced, juicy acidity. Drink from 2021.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2015 Vinha Mue Red (Lisboa)

description: Celebrating the family's Swiss roots (CH is the abbreviation for Switzerland), this wine comes from the estate's oldest vines. It is richly endowed with mint and spice flavors, serious tannins and layers of black fruits. This wine is still aging and will be ready from 2020.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2015 CH by Chocapalha Red (Lisboa)

description: This is the second wine from this historic estate. It has much of the richness and dense, dusty tannins of the first wine while also having more direct black-fruit flavors. The rich character of this powerful wine is just reaching maturity and the wine is ready to drink.
title: Mouchuo 2014 Ponte das Canas Red (Alentejo)

description: Hugely dense and with firm tannins, this concentrated wine shows great structure as well as great fruits. Its powerful licorice and black-chocolate flavors contrast with the opulent black-plum fruits. The wine can be drunk now, but will be even better from 2020.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Herdade da Farizoa Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: This spicy, rich wine has all the warmth of southern Portugal, boasting black fruits and layers of juicy acidity. Mature while still structured, the wine is powerful and densely textured. Drink this ripe wine now.
title: Santos & Seixo 2012 Santos da Casa Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This structured wine is built for aging. Firmly tannic and with swathes of rich black fruit, the wine is concentrated. Coming from one of the pioneers of the Douro wine revolution, the wine sums up the richness and minerality of the region. Drink from 2020.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2016 Duas Quintas Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This powerful, wood-aged wine is hugely dense and generally massive. Bold black, heavily extracted fruits are enmeshed in complex tannins and layers of spice and toast. There is no question about the richness of the wine and its aging potential. Drink from 2020.
title: Perescuma 2015 No. 1 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: While Tinta Negra is the workhorse grape of Madeira, it can also produce fine wines that age. This example with its richness and sweetness accompanied by acidity is now smooth. Aging in old whisky barrels may have added the extra spirit that dominates the wine at the end. Drink now.
title: Henriques & Henriques 1997 Fine Rich Madeira Single Harvest Tinta Negra Mole (Madeira)

description: It's exciting to see Rita Marques, winemaker of her family's winery, launching a Vintage Port. She has found 90-year-old vines and has produced a well-balanced wine, rich with raisins, dark plums and a powerful structure. It is on the sweet spectrum of Vintage Ports, opulent and set for long-term aging. Drink from 2027.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2016 Vintage  (Port)

description: An extra amount of bottle aging has given this rich wine a rounded character. Black fruits, raisins and sultanas mingle with tannins that give shape to the richness of the Port. It could be aged further, but there is no need.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2013 RP LBV Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: This balanced, sophisticated Port offers richness and acidity as well as dried fruits and some firm tannins. It is bottled unfiltered, meaning this wine can age.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2013 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Made in a manner typical of many top Ports, this wine was partially fermented in open-top lagars before the addition of alcohol. It has power, offering sweet raisins and stewed plums along with the cut of spirit. This wine could be aged, but it is so delicious now.
title: Mouchuo 2012 Sobremesa Dessert Tonel Aged Alicante Bouschet (Alentejo)

description: Sweet but not overdone, with attractive aromas of lychee, peach and rose water. Medium weight, with a fruity but somewhat thin finish. Drink now.
title: Two Oceans 2011 Moscato (Western Cape)

description: Soft floral hints add depth to the otherwise straightforward ripe peach and white gummy bear aromas. There's a good balance in the mouth, with a nice acidic lift and slightly bitter edge to cut the sweetness on the finish and close with the faintest hint of astringency.
title: Jam Jar 2011 Moscato (Western Cape)

description: This easy and straightforward white boasts pleasant notes of fresh apple and lemon-lime citrus throughout. The palate is lush but braced with medium acidity that lingers into the close. Enjoy it now.
title: Paul Cluver 2009 Riesling (Elgin)

description: A distinct note of honeycomb marries harmoniously with the pear and hard nectarine aromas. A nice creaminess fills the mouth, with green apple and citrus flavors, which finish on an appropriately toasty yet mouthwatering note. This already shows nice development; drink now.
title: Graham Beck 2003 Cuvee Clive Sparkling (Western Cape)

description: Solid and straightforward, this refreshing and vibrant Sauv Blanc is light and approachable, with aromas and flavors of lemon, sweet grass and pineapple core throughout. A crowd-pleasing selection for entertaining.
title: Morgenhof 2010 Fantail Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: Toast and fresh hay aromas immediately waft from the glass, with supporting notes of red apple and spiced orange peel. Round and full in the mouth, it has good mousse and a soft honeyed accent that carries through onto the finish.
designation: Philip Jonker The Ring Blanc de Blancs Brut
title: Weltevrede 2008 Philip Jonker The Ring Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Robertson)

description: A bit muted and easy-drinking with soft notes of tart green apple and lemon peel throughout. It's brisk and prickly on the tongue with a fleeting finish; drink up.
title: Bon Cap 2011 The Ruins Sauvignon Blanc (Robertson)

description: This light and approachable wine boasts easy notes of green apple, melon rind and a touch of hay. The mouth shows more citrus dominance, with a brisk lemon-lime character staying through the finish. Drink now.
title: Two Oceans 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: A nice flinty accent graces the ripe peach and sweet citrus aromas, while flavors of honeydew are lifted by a good acidic streak in the mouth. Refreshing and balanced with a mouthwatering close; drink now.
title: Thelema 2009 Riesling (Stellenbosch)

description: Green plum, apple and lemon-rind aromas and flavors are at the center of this dry sparkler. It's clean and refreshing, with medium carbonation and a brisk, mouthwatering finish. Drink now.
title: Graham Beck 2005 Brut Zero Sparkling (Western Cape)

description: Fresh fynbos, Asian pear, ginger root, green melon and fig tones form the nose of this lovely wine, with pretty honeysuckle, orange blossom and beeswax accents all dancing in the background. The medium-weight palate boasts some opulence and roundness in the ripe, sweet citrus, melon and fig tones, but it's masterfully balanced by superbly bright and laser-focused acidity. Balanced and harmonious, with a long finish, this is delicious now, but shows some serious long-term potential. Drink now - 2028.
title: Beaumont 2017 Hope Marguerite Chenin Blanc (Bot River)

description: This is such a bright and fun wine, with vibrant red-fruit aromas of strawberry, raspberry and spiced plum. There's a pleasantly noticeable yet well-integrated spicy seam throughout, expressed in waves of cola spice, white pepper and fresh-tilled soil. There's a slight prickle to the palate, with a supreme juiciness that carries through to the mouthwatering finish. Medium-light in weight, well balanced and oh-so-easy to enjoy, drink this now - 2020.
designation: Flotsam and Jetsam Stalwart Dry Farmed Old Bushvines
title: Alheit 2017 Flotsam and Jetsam Stalwart Dry Farmed Old Bushvines Cinsault (Western Cape)

description: Earthy aromas of forest floor and rooibos tea are front and center on the nose of this pretty Pinot. Notes of crunchy red berry, pomegranate and red cherry pit are hit with a dusting of cocoa. Silky in feel and texture, it's medium in weight and well balanced, with lively acidity and just-ripe red fruits that flood the palate and finish with a mouthwatering zest.
title: B Vintners 2016 Black Bream Pinot Noir (Walker Bay)

description: Light aromas of lime, green fig, apple and freshly dried straw form the bouquet of this dainty wine. The palate is clean and light in feel, with some solid apple and lemon cream flavors coupled with ample acidity to keep it all fresh and lifted. Direct and clean, a touch of baking spice unfolds on the finish.
title: B Vintners 2016 Fire Heath Chardonnay (Walker Bay)

description: Apple and citrus aromas mingle on the nose, with hints of steely minerality and just-dried grass. The medium-weight mouthfeel boasts flavors of underripe stone fruit and lemon zest, shifting to riper orange and pear flavors as the finish evolves.
title: Bon Cap 2011 The Ruins Chardonnay-Viognier (Eilandia)

description: Ripe notes of pineapple and firm guava are framed by bracing acidity that lends a slight prickle to the palate. Flavors of sweet grass and Key lime develop and carry onto the clean finish. Drink now.
title: Buitenverwachting 2011 Beyond Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

description: This is quite grassy and herbaceous, with an almost perfumy quality to the bouquet. Fruity flavors of pineapple, mango and tangerine help to flesh out the medium-weight palate, ending clean and lifted. Drink now.
title: Stellenbosch Hills 2011 Polkadraai Chenin Blanc-Sauvignon Blanc (Polkadraai Hills)

description: There's a great freshness to this Chenin, with upfront, juicy notes of clementine, Granny Smith apples and green melon rinds. The light and refreshing palate transitions into a bright, mouthwatering finish, with accents of pineapple-flavored acidity.
title: Beaumont 2011 Chenin Blanc (Walker Bay)

description: This is light, bright and easy, with clean notes of Granny Smith apple, pear, and a hint of fresh grass. The tart palate is sharp but refreshing, with a medium-length, mouthwatering finish.
title: Six Hats 2011 Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Dainty floral aromatics mingle with the fresh scents of white peach and melon rind. Medium weight, this has good zip on the palate that carries through to the finish. Lively lime and green plum flavors abound.
title: Wildekrans 2011 Chenin Blanc (Bot River)

description: Cuvee V, MAN's homage to the wines of Vouvray, is an attractive and semisweet-style Chenin Blanc that offers rich aromas of peach, lightly baked apple and tropical fruit. A slight prickle from the bright acidity dances on the palate and keeps the wine from feeling too sweet or heavy. Drink now.
title: MAN Vintners 2011 Cuvee V Chenin Blanc (Coastal Region)

description: Opens light and easy, with scents of green apple flesh, lemon rind and soft herb. A tart, nervy streak overwhelms the mouth, with flavors of white currant and citrus pith.
title: De Meye 2011 Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: A refreshing and approachable wine, with forward notes of green plum, plantain, Granny Smith apple and lime on the nose and palate. There's a slight roundness to the midpalate, but a vibrant twang lifts the finish.
title: Van Loveren 2011 Chenin No. 5 Chenin Blanc (Robertson)

description: A soft but pretty wine, with notes of yellow florals, orange supremes, sweet grass and a touch of peony. It's balanced and lifted with a good acidic cut to the palate, leading through to a mouthwatering finish laced with white strawberry flavors.
title: Robertson Winery 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Robertson)

description: Vibrant and lively with forward notes of fresh red berries and pink florals along with a touch of watermelon rind and soft sandalwood. Juicy and clean in the mouth with a crisp, mouthwatering finish. Drink now.
title: Mulderbosch 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon Rose (Coastal Region)

description: Accents of flint and charred apple skin mingle with the orange rind and pear flesh notes on the nose and mouth. Round and flabby on the palate, with a short but clean finish.
title: Robertson Winery 2011 Chenin Blanc (Robertson)

description: A soft and easy selection, this Chenin provides a round but balanced palate brimming with refreshing notes of melon, citrus pith and green apple. A hint of toast is revealed after swallow; drink up now.
title: Ernst Gouws & Co. 2011 Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: A hint of honeysuckle and orange blossom graces the red apple and juicy melon fruit flavors. Tangy and a touch astringent in the mouth with a finish of bitter citrus pith.
title: Rooiberg 2011 Chenin Blanc (Robertson)

description: Made from 70% Chardonnay and 30% Pinot Noir, this is clean yet nuanced, with subtle suggestions of strawberry hull and freshly picked herbs to the white peach and Key lime core. Medium weight, with a mouthwatering finish; drink now.
title: Haute Cabriere 2010 Chardonnay-Pinot Noir White (Franschhoek)

description: This is so intense and fruit forward, the aromas are almost like those of Fruit Roll-Ups. Notes of strawberry, raspberry and peach abound on the nose and palate, with good acidic lift that just balances all of that fruity sweetness.
title: Saronsberg 2010 Provenance Shiraz Rose (Tulbagh)

description: A distinct green streak shines throughout this wine, with aromas of green bean and plantain and flavors of grass and pepper. Light weight but a bit round in the mouth, with a medium-length finish.
title: Helderberg Wijnmakerij 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: A pale salmon color, this rose shows ripe notes of cocoa-dusted cherry and strawberry alongside sweet citrus oil. Creamy and full in the mouth, it's a richer rose that can stand up to heartier fare.
title: Morgenhof 2010 Fantail Pinotage Rose (Stellenbosch)

description: A grapefruit pith note dominates the finish, taking away from the more traditional refreshing lift that one might expect from Sauv Blanc. But the rest is gorgeous and inviting, with notes of white peach, hard gooseberry and white cranberry throughout.
title: Mulderbosch 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: A stunning and inviting dessert wine that exhibits the superb balance that Chenin Blanc can lend to the style. Honeyed peach and apricot notes abound, with spicy accents of ginger, clove-spiked orange and toast. The mouth is lush and slightly viscous, but the racy acidity provides good cut. This ends with a long, spice-driven finish. Delicious now, but it should age for another five years.
title: Ken Forrester 2009 T Noble Late Harvest Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: This wine starts off with an enticing honeycomb and baked apple aroma, followed by secondary accents of baking spice and orange zest. The fully textured mouth is loaded with dried peach and apricot flavors, followed by a nice citrus zip that adds spring to the long finish.
title: Rudera 2008 Noble Late Harvest Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: Delicate accents of green apple flesh, juicy orange and peach pit fill out the nose and mouth of this attractive sparkler. The slightly aggressive carbonation keeps the palate fresh and mouthwatering, and a hint of baking spice graces the brisk finish.
title: Graham Beck 2007 Brut Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Robertson)

description: This beautiful Semillon-dominant blend that shows great finesse, depth and power. Rich and opulent in every way, notes of baked red apple, lemon verbena, honey-drizzled peach and sweet orange oil flood the nose and mouth, while additional flavors of hazelnut cream, fig bread and soft sweet spice carry into the long finish. Round, but with enough acidic lift to keep it from being flabby. Drink now-2015.
title: Bizoe 2010 Henrietta Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: This is a pretty, clean, bright and well-balanced Chardonnay. It leads with scents of fresh red apple, crunchy melon rind, lemon balm and a touch of beeswax. Medium in weight, the ripe fruit flavors and soft toasty elements are enlivened by great minerality and a vibrant acidic cut that carries through to the mouthwatering finish. Faint touches of toasted almond and pressed yellow flower appear on the finish.
title: De Wetshof 2017 Lesca Chardonnay (Robertson)

description: There's a beautiful floral lift to the nose of this wine, as fresh-pressed white flowers and orange blossom are coupled with apple flesh, crumbled chalk and a touch of sweet herbs. The medium-weight palate is round and satisfying, a little soft on the midpalate, but then the acidity pops up and the texture builds to reveal a nice balance and overall bright mouthfeel. Soft tannins and flavors of orange and lime pith round out the feel, with a subtle yet lingering richness and toasty accent to the close.
title: Hamilton Russell 2017 Chardonnay

description: This wine is red sunshine in a glass. So bright and lively, it boasts enticing scents of fresh red plum, cherry and strawberry that are coupled with glimmers of baking spice and rooibos tea which add pleasant depth and interest in the background. There's a slight lift to the palate, which is light and juicy. Well made, direct, unfussy in approach and high in pure, unadulterated drinking pleasure.
title: The Blacksmith 2017 Barebones Cinsault (Paarl)

description: There are pretty praline and fresh straw accents to the nose of this wine, with a core of fresh orange rind, yellow apple, lime, beeswax and a touch of honeydew. The medium-weight palate offers similar flavors as the nose suggests, but with great acidity to keep it all fresh and in balance. Subtle toasty accents unfold on the close, but are short lived thanks to the vibrant acidity that picks it all right back up.
title: De Wetshof 2017 Bon Vallon Chardonnay (Robertson)

description: This is bright and tropical in nature, with a lovely top note of pineapple and fresh peach. It's vibrant and fruit-forward on the nose, with just a touch of fresh straw in the back. The palate is light and easy, with a touch of sweetness to the ripe fruit flavors but plenty of acidity to keep it fresh and enliven the finish.
title: Chamonix 2017 Unoaked Chardonnay (Franschhoek)

description: This is a stunning wine, with superb complexity and great balance between the ripe fruit characteristics and the lightly toasty, sweet spice elements. Notes of yellow melon, sweet orange, honeysuckle and almond paste are rich and satisfying, but by no means fat or overdone. It's medium in weight, with bright acidity and a pronounced minerality that lends focus and definition. The finish is fresh and vibrant, starting with crisp citrus flavors that evolve into a spiced orange-tea tone before landing on a succulent tone of cedar-grilled apple.
title: Ataraxia 2016 Chardonnay (Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge)

description: Pleasant earthy hints of fresh-tilled soil and spice bark ride atop the core of ripe red plum, cherry and currant on the nose of this wine. Floral hints of violets, carnation and rooibos add an interesting depth and complexity to the direct fruit core. The medium-weight palate boasts soft, fine tannins and bright acidity, resulting in a texture like crushed satin. Well balanced and defined, and supremely easy to like and drink.
title: Natte Valleij 2016 Cinsault (Coastal Region)

description: There's a nice brightness to the nose of this wine. It leads with enticing scents of snappy red currant, cherry and rhubarb, with lovely orange-oil and herbal tea overlays. The palate is light and cheery in feel, with medium acidity and fine tannins that offer a subtle structure while the finish is fresh and clean.
title: Boschendal 2016 Appellation Series Pinot Noir (Elgin)

description: There's not a ton of aromatic intensity here, with some delicate hints of white melon rind, fresh thyme, mint and lemon pith in the bouquet. It's lightweight and easy to enjoy, with good acidity and touches of sweet orange and pineapple flavors on the back of the palate. Drink now.
title: Downes Family 2016 Sanctuary Peak Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

description: A blend of 80% Sauvignon and 20% Chardonnay, this is clean and pleasant right off the bat. Soft melon and pithy citrus tones are coupled with herbal hints of mache and watercress, as well as a hint of feline essence. Green grass, lime leaf and plum abound on the fresh and zippy palate, with solid acidity and a brisk, mouthwatering finish.
title: Ashbourne 2016 Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay (Walker Bay)

description: Lovely top notes of carnation, tilled earth, mentholated herbs, sweet oak and forest floor grace the brambly berry core of this wine. There's a lot to take in, with nuances of orange oil and sweet cured meat in the background. The medium-weight palate boasts a brightness and lightness to the midpalate, with fine yet structuring tannins and lingering notes of red cherry and plum skin. It's well balanced, earthy and lovely to drink now, though it will mature well through 2028.
title: Ataraxia 2015 Pinot Noir (Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge)

description: Subtle aromas of grilled apple, peach pit and ripe yellow melon set the stage on the nose of this wine, with a touch of dried hay in the back. The medium-weight palate is smooth in feel, with just a subtle textural grip of citrus pith and ample acidity to lift the ripe fruit flavors. It's well-balanced and integrated, with lingering hints of sweet spice and toast.
title: Chamonix 2015 Chardonnay (Franschhoek)

description: This is forward and fresh, with notes of green apple, gooseberry and lemon-lime on the nose and palate. Zippy and mouthwatering, it has faint suggestions of lime zest and fresh-cut grass on the back.
title: MAN Vintners 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Green plum and tart gooseberry aromas and flavors lead the way of this lively selection. Linear and direct on the palate, it has refreshing notes of lime rind, sweet grass and a touch of white flower. Clean and balanced; drink now.
title: Indaba 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)

description: This wine shows character and layers of flavor in its straightforward yet elegant approach. A mineral thread stitches together the ripe fruit notes of white melon, yellow apple, pear and Key lime. Medium weight, with a bit of a nervy feel right now, give this another year to really shine.
title: Raats Family 2011 Original Unwooded Chenin Blanc (Coastal Region)

description: A great value wine that's ready to drink now. This vibrant and aromatic selection boasts scents of orange blossom, white peach and fresh honeydew. The palate is fresh and lively with a crisp and mouthwatering finish.
title: Spier 2011 Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: Good intensity of fruit aromas and flavors are matched with a light, easy mouthfeel and clean finish. Aromas of guava, mango, yellow peach and sweet pineapple flood the nose and palate. Drink now.
title: Van Loveren 2011 Five's Reserve Chenin Blanc (Robertson)

description: This wine shows good balance between the lively acidity and ripe notes of red apple flesh, pear and orange oil. The round mouthfeel of ripe fruit flavors are lifted on the finish by a tangy, green plum and lime zest accent. Drink now.
title: Winery of Good Hope 2011 Bush Vine Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: An off-dry Chenin, with lush notes of peach, red apple and sweet lime. There are soft hints of sweet grass and spice that unfold on the bouquet and on the finish. Vibrant acidity keeps the flavors fresh and leaves a lingering tingling sensation. An easy choice for drinking now.
title: Landskroon 2011 Bush Camp The Sundowner Chenin Blanc (Paarl)

description: An interesting blend of 80% Chenin Blanc and 20% Pinotage, this white is fresh and fruity, with an enticing mixture of citrusy flowers and small red berries. There's a touch of earthiness on the palate, with a nice smoothness its medium weight. So crisp and alive now; drink up.
title: Beyerskloof 2011 Chenin Blanc-Pinotage White (Coastal Region)

description: Pretty aromas of yellow florals, wood-grilled red apple and walnut skin lead the bouquet of this wine, while continued rich flavors of red apple flesh and Key lime pie unfold in the round and softly fat mouth.
title: Releaf 2011 Made With Organically Grown Grapes Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Green plum, tart gooseberry and lime rind aromas are accented with a touch of feline essence on the nose. Flavors of guava and banana unfold in the riper mouth, but the wine closes clean and zippy. Drink now.
title: Ernst Gouws & Co. 2011 Sauvignon Blanc (Coastal Region)

description: There's a toasty streak that adds depth to the apple and melon fruit core of this wine. Soft tropical fruit accents appear in the mouth, with a brioche-flavored finish sealing the deal.
title: Mullineux 2011 Kloof Street Chenin Blanc (Swartland)

description: Fresh and inviting notes of pineapple and tropical fruit are balanced by orange oil citrus and medium acidity in the mouth. The palate is round with a nice weight and a medium-length finish.
title: Indaba 2011 Chardonnay (Western Cape)

description: Rich fruit aromas of yellow apple flesh, mealy pear and banana lead the bouquet, with a hint of grapefruit pith in the background. The palate is tangier and more lifted than the nose suggests, with bright flavors of green plum and citrus juice.
title: Cape View 2010 Combination Sauvignon Blanc-Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: This is a stunning and cellar-worthy Chenin that exhibits superb balance and layers of flavor. At first it's nutty and toasty on the nose, with notes of grilled red apple, orange rind and honeydew providing a solid fruit core. Threads of mineral and a soft fynbos character weave through the palate. Peach pit and sweet spice flavors grace the long, evolving finish.
title: Beaumont 2010 Hope Marguerite Chenin Blanc (Bot River)

description: Flavorful and harmonious, seductive notes of soft toast and walnut shell add dimension to the honeydew, red apple and orange zest notes. Medium weight, with good acidity and a lasting finish, this is balanced and approachable now, with all of the elements working together.
title: Land of Hope 2010 Reserve Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: There's a natural essence to this wine, exhibiting the best qualities of the grape as well as a sense of terroir. Soft herbal and mineral accent the clean, fruity core. Green pear, melon rind and a hint of peach pit unfold on the palate and follow through to the long, slightly spiced finish. Perfectly drinkable now, but will cellar nicely for another 3-5 years.
title: Reyneke 2010 Organic Grapes Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: Open and seductive, this has upfront notes of oak backed by moderate red apple, pear and faint herb accents. Medium weight, with a flinty streak, the palate is bright and mouthwatering, closing on a toasty, orange rind flavor.
title: Radford Dale 2010 Renaissance Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: For ten bucks, this is an attractive and crowd-pleasing Chenin that boasts forward notes of baked apple, melon, sweet orange and a hint of savory herb. The balanced acidity ensures that the ripe flavors don't feel too heavy on the close.
title: Stonewalker 2010 Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Apple skin, orange rind and clove spice lead on the bouquet, while opulent flavors of popcorn and baked apple fill the medium-weight palate. Despite the rich notes throughout, there's a nice freshness, with a clean, softly spiced finish. Drink now.
title: Dornier 2010 The Pirate of Cocoa Hill Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)

description: A forward and fruity wine, with red apple flesh, melon and tropical fruit aromas and flavors that are laced with just a hint of oak. The medium-weight mouth is juicy and clean, and the finish brisk and refreshing.
title: False Bay 2010 Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

description: The bouquet opens with peppy aromas of sweet clementine juice, white peach and a soft saline accent. The palate is fresh and crisp, with the green melon and lime zest flavors taking center stage and lingering well into the finish. Drink now.
title: Six Hats 2010 Chenin Blanc (Western Cape)

description: Named for the winemaker's youngest daughter, this ripe and sweet selection boasts intense oak-driven aromas of butter and creamy vanilla that mingle well with the honeydew, pear and peach notes. Thankfully, there's good cut to the round mouthfeel, as zesty orange-flavored acidity keeps the finish fresh and long. Drink now-2014.
title: Vins d'Orrance 2010 Cuvee Anays Chardonnay (Western Cape)

description: Hamilton Russell just knows how to do Chard right, striking superb balance and finesse in a wine that's drinkable now but can age for another five-plus years. Baked apple, barely-ripe honeydew, lemon custard and a touch of beeswax dance in the bouquet and transition seamlessly into the softly-toasted palate. A beautiful seam of acidity threads it all together and lifts the lengthy finish.
title: Hamilton Russell 2010 Chardonnay (Hemel en Aarde)

description: Hay, green plum and gooseberry lead off on the nose, while ripe hints of passion fruit and pineapple acidity flood the mouth. Lifted, with good cut and freshness, and a mouthwatering close. Delicious now, but should hold together nicely for another couple of years.
title: Southern Right 2010 Sauvignon Blanc (Walker Bay)

description: With 12 months spent in French oak, this wine offers rounded notes of boysenberry and cassis framed by hints of purple florals and sweet spice. There's a lively lift to the fruit in the mouth, driving the palate to a clean and juicy finish. Drink now.
title: Rooiberg 2010 Roodewyn Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Robertson)

description: White melon rind and key lime citrus abound in the bouquet of this intricate white blend made from 40% Rhine Riesling, 33% Viognier, 13% Sauvignon Blanc, 11% Chenin Blanc and 3% Chardonnay. The mouth is ripe and full of tropical fruit flavors, with sweet but zippy pineapple acidity lingering after swallow.
title: Bouchard Finlayson 2010 Blanc de Mer White (Western Cape)

description: Named after five stone pine trees that stand over the vineyards, this small-production Chard is lush and toasty, offering great weight and richness followed by a long, nutty finish. Notes of red apple skin and peach are accented by hints of white clover and honeysuckle that unfold with time in the glass. Brisk lime-flavored acidity lifts the mouth and provides freshness to the palate.
title: Rustenberg 2009 Five Soldiers Chardonnay (Stellenbosch)

description: Flashy notes of wood-grilled apple, brioche and apricot fill the nose. The mouth is round and the palate spicy, as flavors of ginger and cedar dominate the stone fruit.
title: Radford Dale 2009 Viognier (Stellenbosch)

description: Hints of flint and softly charred cedar grace the ripe peach and pear fruit core of this balanced Chard. The mouth is round and lush, with a good cut to keep things clean and lifted on the wood-spice-infused finish. Should pair nicely with wood-plank grilled salmon.
title: Radford Dale 2009 Chardonnay (Stellenbosch)

description: A clean and attractive Chard with no malo, this is a perfect choice for folks looking for that magical balance between ripe fruit and toast. Red apple flesh, peach pit, orange oil and toasted egg bread all abound on the nose and mouth, with a long and mouthwatering finish that evolves from ripe fruit flavors to soft oaky spice.
title: Mulderbosch 2009 Chardonnay (Stellenbosch)

description: Approachable now with an enticing mocha streak throughout that's lifted by the bright red cherry and raspberry fruit flavors. Low tannins and medium acidity make this an easy-pleaser for fans of the grape.
title: Paul Cluver 2009 Pinot Noir (Elgin)

description: Rich, honeyed notes flesh out the apple and orange rind aromas, while flavors of honeydew, apple core and a soft nuttiness unfold in the mouth. Round and forward with a medium-length finish.
title: Hartenberg 2009 Weisser Riesling (Stellenbosch)

description: Green plum, gooseberry, lime pith and fresh sweet grass all unfold on the nose of this varietally correct wine. Lightweight, fresh and vibrant, it boasts lime-like acidity and pleasantly tart, not mouthpuckering, green melon and plum flavors. Superfresh and vibrant, this is well balanced and easy to like.
title: Paul Cluver 2018 Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

description: Pronounced aromas of mentholated herbs and fynbos dance on the nose of this excellent wine, with supporting tones of forest floor, tilled soil, red currant and cherry. Medium in weight and plush in feel, it offers framing tannins that lend a solid grip to the palate and finish, while a kiss of warming spice graces the close. Well balanced and structured, it's attractive now, but will mature well through 2029.
title: Hamilton Russell 2017 Pinot Noir

description: Brambly berry, black plum and cherry abound on the nose of this attractive wine. Touches of cinnamon stick, violet and milk chocolate add interest. The medium-weight palate is fresh and vibrant in ripe fruit tones, with velvety tannins and ample acidity. It's well balanced and harmonious, while the lasting finish evolves from fruit flesh to soil then tree bark and finally soft sweet spice.
title: Robertson Winery 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Robertson)

description: This is ripe and fruit-forward upfront, with abundant aromas of brambly berry and cherry that are partnered with delicate scents of violet and baking spice. The texture is smooth as silk, with medium acidity and fine tannins that are soft yet lend ample structure to the palate. It's pristine and laser focused, with great purity and a fresh red-berry flavor that endures on the finish.
title: Lievland 2017 Bushvine Pinotage (Paarl)

description: A new brand to watch, this stunning Pinot opens with initial scents of forest floor and orange-spiked cranberry, red currant and rhubarb. The palate is smooth and satiny, with fine tannins, bright acidity and ripe, fresh red-fruit characters that all meld together masterfully. Subtle accents of cocoa, cedar and baking spice linger on the close atop a note of cherry hard candy.
title: Tesselaarsdal 2017 Pinot Noir (Hemel-en-Aarde Ridge)

description: Scents of honeycomb, beeswax and yellow melon abound on the nose of this wine, with some light sweet spice, baked apple and yellow flower accents. It's medium in weight, with ample acidity to lift the ripe orange, apple and pineapple core flavors and a slight prickle to the palate.
title: Lievland 2017 Old Vines Chenin Blanc (Paarl)

description: Aromas of fresh sweet grass, green melon rind, lime peel, underripe mango and fig form the nose of this fresh and tart wine. It's lightweight and easy to drink, with subtle fruit flavors and medium acidity. It's not an overly complex pour, but it's tasty enough, with a touch of earthy, herbal bitterness on the end.
title: Thelema 2017 Sutherland Sauvignon Blanc (Elgin)

description: A medium-intense nose of lightly toasted apple, orange rind, fresh yellow melon and a touch of sweet spice sets the stage for this beautiful Chard, with secondary hints of fresh straw and pressed yellow flower. The medium-weight palate shows great balance and cut, with bright acidity and precise citrus and green fig flavors that carry through to the evolving finish. It all ends with a delicate kiss of peach-pit nuttiness.
title: Paul Cluver 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Elgin)

description: The bouquet of this interesting, supertextural wine leads with notes of white peach and peach pit, yellow melon and grilled apple. Supporting tones of ginger root, fresh hay and savory fresh herbs add depth from the background. Ripe yet pithy melon and orange flavors carry through to the close and lend a lasting textural impression to the palate. Ample acidity supports the package, just picking up the density of the flavors and textural weight. A lightly toasty, nutty almond and melon flavor resides on the close.
title: Boschkloof 2016 Patatsfontein Enkel Wingerd Steen Chenin Blanc (Montagu)

description: This is quite bold, oaky and rich, with loads of buttery tones, caramel corn, baked apple and creamed melon on the nose. The palate is similarly superrich and buttery, with ample toast and bright acidity to keep the weighty richness in check. It's mouthfilling and plump in feel, but again, lifted by pleasant acidity and a lingering spiced-orange flavor on the close.
title: Boschendal 2016 Appellation Series Chardonnay (Elgin)

description: There's a floral, spicy lift to the nose of this wine, with aromas of ginger-peach tea, honeysuckle, spiced pear and nectarine that fill the bouquet. The medium-weight palate shows a bit of heft on the midpalate, with waves of peach, nectarine, rose and honeysuckle flavors. There's just enough acidity to lift the sweet-flavor impressions, while the finish is all floral.
title: Noble Hill 2016 Viognier (Simonsberg-Paarl)

description: This is warm and lush upfront, with notes of chocolate-covered cherry and sweet spice that are surprisingly coupled with an assertive stemmy characteristic. The palate has a slightly vicsous feel, with astringent tannins and a sharp bitterness that dominates the finish.
title: Chamonix 2016 Feldspar Pinot Noir (Franschhoek)

description: This is quite pretty and complex smelling, with a lot to take in. The bouquet offers a range of medium-intense aromas, with scents of frankincense, whole baking spice, rose-hip tea and a sweet cured-meat accent that harmonizes seamlessly with the fresh, snappy red-fruit core. The medium-weight palate is smooth and silky in feel, with fine yet structuring tannins and medium-plus acidity.
