description: Pure and intense up front, with dry, nutty core aromas and not too much blatant oxidation. Fresh and kicking in the mouth, but still fairly smooth, with nutty, toasty flavors and a hint of baked apple. Nutty, creamy and not too acidic or scouring on the finish.
title: Alvear 2006 Fino en Rama Pedro Ximenez (Montilla-Moriles)

description: A huge wine that's tannic as nails but so aromatic and flavor packed. Toasted oak, mint, cola, maple, marzipan work the potent nose, while the saturated palate thumps along with massive black-fruit flavors and coffee, fudge and light herb accents. This is one of the most powerful wines from Spain or anywhere. Drink or hold.
title: Marques de Grinon 2005 Emeritus Red (Dominio de Valdepusa)

description: Beautiful aromas of forest floor, dusty berry and smoked meats lead to a huge, tannic but tolerable mouthful of toasty blackberry, cassis, chocolate and additional darkness. It's toasty and really long on the finish; almost syrupy but not quite. A tannic effort, like all Grinon wines.
title: Marques de Grinon 2005 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Syrah (Dominio de Valdepusa)

description: Oaky and superconcentrated, with shoe polish and other dark aromas forming a cap on the bouquet. Airing reveals a rugged, fully oaked and tannic wine, with baked berry, baking spice, raisin, syrup and chocolate flavors all wrapped up in a chewy, chunky frame. Sweet, rich and saturated stuff. Drink now or hold through 2017.
title: Alidis 2005 VS (Ribera del Duero)

description: Gritty on the nose, this has baked bean, mushroom, roasted plum and earth aromas. It feels blocky and tannic, with some cushion to the palate. Oaky tasting, with prune, vanilla and buttery notes that settle on baked fruit and chocolate. It comes on forceful and heavy and is arguably a little overripe.
title: Resalte 2005 Reserva (Ribera del Duero)

description: Concentrated and sweet, with aromas of raisin and cassis that lead onto an intense, syrupy palate, with salty berry, brown sugar and fudge flavors. This is deep as a country well, with a ton of flavor. But truth be told, it's tannic as can be, with a crushing mouthfeel that makes food mandatory.
title: Marques de Grinon 2005 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Dominio de Valdepusa)

description: Charcoal, cola and menthol aromas sit on top of blueberry and mint. The mouth is so tannic and powerful that it's tough to swallow. Incredibly ripe, this has a short finish that's toasty tasting and not complex in the least.
title: Marques de Grinon 2005 Single Vineyard Estate Bottled Petit Verdot (Dominio de Valdepusa)

description: This smells of baked black fruit, coconut, vanilla and char, with a palate that's ultrasaturated and almost cloying. The compact flavors are of concentrated blackberry liqueur and cassis, which narrow to berry and oak notes on the finish.
title: Atalaya 2010 Alaya Garnacha (Almansa)

description: The Gil family understands how to make fully loaded reds that are balanced and highly enjoyable. Look for a saturated, rich nose with brandied plum, blackberry pastry and toasty oak notes. The palate is both lush and racy, with dark berry and chocolate flavors. It finishes huge and masculine, almost like fudge. Drink now-2015.
title: Bodegas Ateca 2009 Atteca Armas Old Vines Garnacha (Calatayud)

description: Dense, cool and masculine on the nose, this has aromas of prune, cola, tobacco, cheese and leather. It feels silky and soft, showing maximum ripeness and excellent balance. It tastes of ripe berry, stewed plum, spice and tobacco. Complex and classy on the finish; drink now-2017.
title: El Nido 2009 Red (Jumilla)

description: Opaque to the eye, this has a bouquet that's tightly sealed with aromas of oak, tobacco and cola, and a baked, minty note. Saturated but not syrupy, this has roasted, savory flavors of clove, nutmeg, hickory and baked blackberry. It remains roasted, deep and delicious on the finish. This is entirely modern, full bodied and excellent as a whole.
title: El Nido 2009 Clio Red (Jumilla)

description: Fondillon represents the pinnacle of red Spanish dessert wines, and the 1999 vintage just might make your jaw drop. Subtle but expansive on the nose, with a blend of baked dark-fruit and cinnamon aromas, it is liquid heaven in the mouth, with excellent balance and flavors of roasted plums, black cherry, nutmeg and chocolate. This is pure, structured and outstanding from start to finish. Drink now or hold in a proper cellar for another 10 or 20 years. 100 cases made.
title: Bodegas Gutierrez de la Vega 1999 Casta Diva Fondillon Sweet Monastrell (Alicante)

description: A rank well above most PX sweeties, with lush but fresh aromas of raisin and spice that are distinctly not syrupy or heavy. Feels thick, but there's enough acidity to cut through the wine's weight. Flavors of caramel and chocolate are ideal, and the finish is smooth, not heavy, and has bounce in its step. A beautiful PX any way you cut it.
title: Alvear NV Solera 1927 Pedro Ximenez (Montilla-Moriles)

description: Midnight purple in color, this has legs as thick as an elephant's. It smells like boysenberry jam, spice and bacon, then feels like motor oil on the palate, with flavors of black fruit, chocolate and boysenberry syrup. It lacks complexity, but it hits hard with concentration, power and sweetness.
title: Bodegas Bleda 2011 Amatus Dulce Monastrell (Jumilla)

description: Light brown and slightly translucent in color. Aromas lean toward raisin and prune, but there's orange zest and molasses on the bouquet as well. Bores straight ahead on the palate, with sweet flavors of burnt brown sugar, caramel and prune. Satisfying and balanced even if it's not overly complex.
title: Alvear 2008 de Anada Pedro Ximenez (Montilla-Moriles)

description: This starts out with mustard and horseradish aromas, but with the chance to breath, it reveals a dark berry scent. The palate feels tannic and sticky, with flavors of cooked plum, hard spice and brown sugar. It's grabby, fiery and full of flavor on the finish, with a slightly abrasive feel.
title: Costers del Priorat 2007 Dolc de l'Obac Red (Priorat)

description: There's no question about the variety, with its outrageously bright notes of lychee, flower, orange peel and spice. Spritzy, medium-sweet fruit flavors follow, with plentiful Mandarin orange notes throughout. Have it as an aperitif.
title: Vino 2016 Moscato (Washington)

description: This stunning sweet Riesling is sourced from the winery's Josef Vineyard. A concentrated nose of dried apricot, mango and honey carries a delicate sheen of polished wood. This is incredibly luscious and concentrated on the palate, persistent in juicy stone fruit and tropical flavors that are honed by laser-focused acidity. It's a powerful offering that lingers for days on the tongue and is sure to develop well with time in the bottle. Drink now - 2028.
designation: Single Select Estate Bottled and Grown
title: Hermann J. Wiemer 2016 Single Select Estate Bottled and Grown Riesling (Seneca Lake)

description: Aromas of fresh thyme, honeycomb wax and citrus blossom meld with a stony core of quince and slate in this single-vineyard Riesling sourced from the east side of Seneca Lake. A smooth, well-concentrated palate delivers flavors of green melon, apple and white cherry, while an electric current of acidity keeping this feeling persistent yet balanced. Drink now - 2022.
title: Bellwether 2016 Sawmill Creek Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: A strong clover-honey aroma greets the nose and carries straight through the palate. This is luscious and well-concentrated, displaying juicy peach and citrus flavors that are drizzled with gobs of honey. Latent acidity balances this sweet wine out come the finish.
title: O-Neh-Da 2016 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: This single-vineyard wine offers a well-formed nose of honey-drizzled peach and white flowers. The semisweet palate is creamy in feel, loaded with swirls of ripe peach and fleshy yellow apple that are balanced by drawing acidity.
title: Hermann J. Wiemer 2016 Josef Vineyard Estate Bottled & Grown Riesling (Seneca Lake)

description: Defined aromas of grapefruit and crisp apple start off this semidry Riesling. A solid concentration of stone fruit and apple flavors marks the palate, with a frame of bright acidity to keep the balance.
title: Bellangelo 2016 Morris Vineyard Riesling (Seneca Lake)

description: Pristine aromas of ripe peach and pineapple are accented by a dusting of lime zest and jasmine on the nose of this semisweet Riesling. The succulent palate displays a dazzling array of juicy stone- and orchard-fruit flavors that are brightened by shots of tangerine and passion fruit, all honed by an explosion of acidity.
title: Hosmer 2017 Patrician Verona Riesling (Cayuga Lake)

description: Pollen dusted herbs and lime start off this delicate Riesling. The palate is slick in feel, displaying flavors of green melon rind, slate and lime juice, while a strong current of acidity keeps it alive and kicking. Pair with a meal to counteract all that zest.
title: Bellwether 2016 S Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: The aromas seem subdued for the variety, with notes of flower and peach. Medium-sweet stone fruit flavors follow.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2017 Harvest Select Sweet Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A bright nose of apple and pear aromas melds with an edging of tangerine and grapefruit in this off-dry wine. The palate is delicate and soft, displaying a plump orchard-fruit flavor backed by orange acidity. A peach-fuzz texture lingers on the finish.
title: Keuka Spring 2017 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Well-formed aromas of honeydew melon and white blossom meet a tangy, steel element on the nose. Light in profile, the dry palate offers a juicy melon flavor drizzled in a squeeze of lime. A slick of wet slate lingers on the finish.
title: Barnstormer 2017 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Long Island Riesling is few and far between, however this example is relatively solid. It is taut and liner in feel, with delicate flavors of wet limestone, lime zest and white blossoms. The concentration is light, yet it's zesty and refreshing.
title: Paumanok 2017 Riesling (North Fork of Long Island)

description: A delicate nose of gardenia, jasmine, quince and slate give this semisweet Riesling a graceful start. The palate offers explosive acidity that carries flavors of juicy white cherry, green melon and candied lemon zest.
title: Hosmer 2016 Patrician Verona Riesling (Cayuga Lake)

description: A mineral-laden nose of wet rock and crushed slate mingles with broader tones of white blossoms and yellow apple. This is off-dry in style and delicately textured on the palate, displaying a juicy orchard-fruit profile that's peppered with notes of jasmine and tonic water.
title: Keuka Spring 2017 Humphrey's Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: This unusual sparkling wine made from Verdejo grapes goes for a doughy complexity that starts with an earthy, yeasty aroma and follows through with flavors like freshly baked bread and mineral water. It's on the light side in terms of fruit character, and is light to medium bodied.
title: Riaza 2017 Sparkling Verdejo (Clarksburg)

description: Done in the traditional Champagne method, this unusual sparkling wine, based on Cabernet Franc, brings sharply-focused apple fruit front and center. Though still quite young, it's a crisp and refreshing wine that will set up well with a variety of the usual appetizers for good bubbly.
title: Quady North 2016 Brut Rose of Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

description: Slate and stone mark this delicately earthy wine, with strikes of green apple and pear in the background. The off-dry palate shows a pleasing roundness, with flavors of green melon and yellow apple giving a juicy feel. Bright acidity keeps this buoyant and lively, while a slightly savory note marks the close.
title: Red Tail Ridge 2016 RTR Estate Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Slate and smoke mask a core of peach juice and crushed tangerine on the nose of this semidry Riesling. The palate is a well-blended mix of ripe stone fruit, sugar-dusted blossoms and sour green apple, with a pillowy, marshmallow finish.
title: Bellangelo 2016 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Flower, lime leaf, slate, peach and citrus aromas are out front. Sleek, off-dry, leaning sweeter fruit flavors follow. There's a sense of balance that heightens the appeal. It's a whole lot of wine for the money.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2017 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: These 33-year-old vines have been ripened to spatlese sweetness and left hanging in the balance between sweet and tart. The peach and papaya fruit flavors come with ample acidity, finishing with the flavor of sweet lemon tea.
title: Brooks 2016 Bois Joli Vineyard Riesling (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Honey-drizzled apple and white blossoms start off this semisweet wine. It's ripe on the palate, with luscious flavors peach and melon that end on a caramel tone.
title: Damiani 2016 Semi-Sweet Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Keeler is doing some interesting experimentation with fermentation methods, and here they deliver a stunning amphora-fermented, off-dry Riesling. The wine offers a fine mix of apricot, peach and nectarine tones that display a sweet and sour tension. It finishes with a lick of butterscotch.
title: Keeler 2017 Terracotta Amphorae Riesling (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: A stony, citrus-laden nose offers glimpses of earthy white tea and stone fruit in this dry-style wine made from seedless (or virgin) Riesling grapes. There's power on the palate, with a firm grip of slate, yellow apple skin and peach flavors that lead to a lingering limestone finish.
title: The Grapes of Roth 2017 Virgin Berry Dry Riesling (Long Island)

description: This wine is intriguing in an earthy oolong note that's backed by ripe apricot and peach. It's well concentrated on the palate in these flavors, with a defined layer of acidity keeping it persistent and lengthy.
title: The Grapes of Roth 2017 Dry Riesling (Long Island)

description: A fresh, focused nose of grapefruit peel, peach and quince starts off this dry-style Riesling. It's taut on the palate, with an astringent grip of peach and apricot skins that is shot through with bright citrus acidity.
title: Fox Run 2016 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: This is a fun, pop-top wine, orange-pink in color, a blend of Pinot Noir and Chenin Blanc. An inviting, floral-candied note of watermelon Jolly Rancher leads to interesting flavors of hazelnut and lemon, with plenty of acidity to buoy the light body.
title: Karah Estate 2018 Tendance Passante Sparkling (California)

description: Aromas of wet limestone, citrus zest and quince are tight and focused on the nose of this dry-style Riesling. Flavors of tart green-plum and lime are persistent on the palate, softened by some textural roundness and extended by a lingering marshmallow finish.
title: Bellangelo 2016 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Made entirely from Pinot Noir, this has an impressive mousse that's light on its feet with bright acidity and plenty of crispness on the palate. Strawberry, cherry and tangerine mingle along a thread of elegance and balance.
title: Grand Napa 2013 Blanc de Noir Sparkling (Carneros)

description: This delicious semidry Riesling offers an exuberant nose of ripe apple, white blossoms and crushed slate. There's a pleasing roundness to the palate, with a textured, fuzzy feel that carries flavors of crisp apple and lemon underscored by juicy, sweet peach. Laser-focused acidity keeps it all in check, making this a well-balanced offering.
title: Damiani 2016 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Dry and crisp, this surprising wine made from Zinfandel grapes has a sophisticated and complex lees-aged character that gives a toasty note to the aroma, and light earthy oaky ginger and cherry flavors on the palate. While medium bodied, it is well concentrated and interesting to taste.
title: Fiddletown Cellars 2017 Sparkling Rose (Amador County)

description: Aromas of freshly squeezed lime and white peach lead to tart, mouthwatering, just a hair off-dry fruit flavors. The sense of acidity and balance is lovely.
title: Charles & Charles 2017 Art Den Hoed Riesling (Yakima Valley)

description: The grape were put through whole-cluster carbonic maceration in concrete, then aged in both neutral oak and stainless steel, yielding a wine with bold cranberry fruit with a vein of iron. The tannins are polished but stiffen the finish, with a thread of graphite. It's still quite young, quite tart and bursting with flavor.
title: Evening Land 2017 Seven Springs Gamay Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This young release wine is light in color with an orange rim, offering notes of fresh tobacco, herb, orange peel and green pepper. Quite smoky fruit flavors follow. There are good things going on, but the smoke influence has a big impact.
title: Savage Grace 2017 Two Blondes Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

description: This dry-style Riesling is named after the wife of Willy Frank, second generation owner of the estate. An expressive nose of lime, white blossoms and slate gives it an intense, focused start. The palate is persistent in acidity and well-textured, displaying flavors of lime and white cherry that end on a lingering powdered-stone finish.
title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2017 Margrit Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Wet stone, crushed rocks and a touch of funky grass aromas show on the nose of this bottling, the first for young vintner Gina Hildebrand. The palate is all about minerality, reminiscent of wet sidewalks on a rainy day, along with touches of lime skin, grapefruit pith and ash.
title: Lady of the Sunshine 2017 Coquelicot Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Waxy and mineral, this delightful white has a bright high-acid freshness and a texture of stone. Lemon, quince and apricot factor into the flavor profile with an exotic complexity and undeniable drinkability.
title: Anaba 2017 Snow Vineyard Picpoul Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

description: In the midst of a major transformation to new varieties, a biodynamic vineyard and innovative fermentations, Troon scores with this rich, toasty, barrel-fermented white wine. A ripe mix of fruits brings poached pear and banana to the front, with a lick of vanilla custard as the wine trails off. Delicious already, so drink up.
title: Troon 2017 Vermentino (Applegate Valley)

description: Spiced apple and pear aromas mix with lemon and ginger on the nose. The palate is dry in style, with a juicy orchard-fruit flavor that's peppered with white blossoms and lemongrass. A honed bed of acidity frames it all, with spiced apricot marking the close.
title: Millbrook 2017 Proprietor's Special Reserve Dry Riesling (Hudson River Region)

description: Diffused aromas of tangerine and grapefruit peels abound in this single-vineyard Riesling sourced from a shale-laden vineyard on the western side of Seneca Lake. The palate is broad and juicy, yet dry, displaying flavors of fleshy yellow apple and white blossoms, with shots of orange acidity.
title: Bellangelo 2017 Kashong Glen Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: White peach, banana, lemon wedge and tropical fruits show on the nose of this bottling of a grape rarely seen in California. There is a flash of sweetness at the tip of the sip, followed by tingly acidity and pome-fruit flavors.
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2017 Sylvaner (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is a limited selection from the estate's original vines planted in the mid-1970s. Tart berry and citrus flesh and zest introduce a balanced, almost ethereal wine, with notes of wet stone and green tea. It's a testament to the exceptional care paid to these biodynamic vines, and the intent of the winemaker to emphasize delicacy over power.
title: Winderlea 2016 Winderlea Legacy Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This cuvee, from estate-grown fruit, undergoes 100% whole-cluster fermentation using natural yeast, and spends 17 months in 20% new French oak. In this vintage, it is not quite optimally ripe, showing dill, astringent tannins, and tart berry flavors. The barrel influence, at least for now, is immaterial.
title: Winderlea 2016 Winderlea Imprint Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This dry-style Riesling is all about texture. Pollen-dusted green melon and apple start off the nose, giving way to more creamy melon on the palate. This has a soft, silken feel that's balanced by a delicate framing of acidity. With its broad mouthfeel and savory finish, this is sure to be a welcome addition to the dinner table.
title: Trestle Thirty One 2016 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: From a 1984 planting, this is listed as medium dry but shows noticeable sweet, somewhat sugary fruit flavors. The mix of sugar, acid and biting skin flavors is a bit jagged at this point, and the finish shuts down abruptly. Give it another year or two in the bottle and it should pull those well-made components together.
title: Brooks 2016 Yamhill Vineyard Riesling (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: Rich and full of flavor, this wine offers fruit, spice and some attractive aged complexity in equal measures. It has an earthy toasty gingery aroma, mellow cherry and raspberry flavors and a mouth-filling mousse.
title: Goldeneye 2015 Brut Rose (Anderson Valley)

description: This is made from a majority of Pinot Noir alongside Chardonnay and Pinot Gris. Aged three-and-a-half years in bottle, it's complex and approachable in equal measure. Cherry, peach and a twist of lime round out the lush palate, with integrated acidity underlining its freshness.
title: Domaine Carneros 2014 Brut Cuvee Sparkling (Carneros)

description: This is a relatively small-production sparkling blend of 51% Pinot Noir and 49% Chardonnay, aged more than three years in bottle. Creamy and lush on the palate, it contrasts that richness with focused acidity and crisp flavors of ginger and lemon.
title: Domaine Carneros 2013 Estate Brut Sparkling (Carneros)

description: A well-formed nose of apricot and white blossoms carries to the juicy yet dry palate. Ripe stone fruit mixes with shots of astringent grapefruit pith, while bright acidity helps extend a powdered mineral finish.
title: Hosmer 2017 Dry Riesling (Cayuga Lake)

description: A stony nose of limestone and freshly zested citrus leads to a juicy palate of green melon and apple flavors. This dry Riesling offers well-concentrated orchard-fruit and citrus flavors that are held in check by a persistent line of acidity.
title: Anthony Road 2016 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Soft aromas of pollen-dusted apple and peach meet a sheen of spring ramps on the nose. This semisweet offering is light in feel, with flavors of juicy melon and tart yellow apple that are backed by wet stone and citrus.
title: Anthony Road 2017 Semi-Sweet Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Aromas of chamomile, cut lime and white flower lead to lightly spritzy, off-dry fruit flavors. It's straight down the fairway.
title: Barnard Griffin 2017 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A blossomy nose of lemongrass and gardenia starts off this dry-style Riesling. Notes of stone, citrus and tart peach give the palate a peppy feel, with a delicate astringent grip and a fine framing of acidity offering structure. Shots of wet stone and peach linger on the finish.
title: Benmarl 2016 Reserve Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: This is a light tart delicate wine, with hints of raspberry and lemon. It's a clean, rather simple wine that slips away quickly.
title: Et Fille 2014 Deux Vert Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: This single-vineyard Riesling from the eastern shore of Seneca Lake is intensely focused on the nose, displaying defined aromas of lime zest, white flowers and crushed limestone. It's bright and zesty on the dry, light-bodied palate, with shots of tart green plum and powdered minerals. There's a delicate astringency come the midpalate which culminates on a peach-fuzz sensation on the finish.
title: Wagner 2017 Caywood East Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Refreshing aromas of lime, crushed stone, white peach and green apple skin carry to the light-bodied palate, where a brisk tonic tone keeps things pristine and crisp. This dry-style Riesling is well balanced by tangy acidity and a pleasantly astringent green-plum-skin finish.
title: Wagner 2017 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Clean and tight on the nose, this bottling offers lemon juice, chalk, wet river stone and sharp, grassy aromas. There is great acidity and strong tension to the palate that grabs the tongue and won't let go, weaving through flavors of lemon-lime and Anjou pear.
title: CrЕ« 2017 Albarino (Edna Valley)

description: The aromas pop, with notes of rubbed lime leaf, citrus, white peach and cut green apple. Sleek, bone-dry, Nestea Lemon Iced Tea flavors follow, with the finish sailing. This is always one of the best wine values on the shelf, and this vintage does not disappoint.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2017 Dry Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Vineyard-designated offerings of this variety are an extreme rarity in the state. Citrus, green apple, herb and wilted flower aromas predominate. The palate is light in style, with a textured feel.
title: Vino 2017 Evergreen Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Ancient Lakes)

description: This bottling by Ian Brand always packs bang for the buck, but he really nailed it in the 2017 vintage. Clean and delicate aromas of Asian pear, lemon rind and edgy chalk lead into a racy, crisp and tightly wound palate. Flavors of grapefruit, nectarine, blanched almond and sea salt are delicious.
title: Le P'tit Paysan 2017 Jacks Hill Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Boushey Vineyard makes up the 70% majority of this wine, with the rest coming from Red Willow. Barrel fermented with native yeast, the aromas are light on first pour, with notes of lemon verbena, lemon oil and herb. The flavors are tart, racy and acid driven, with a long, drawn out finish. It's elegant and subtle, with pleasing complexities to be had. Give it some additional time in bottle to see it at its best.
title: Avennia 2017 Oliane Sauvignon Blanc (Yakima Valley)

description: Quiet aromas of lemon and lime rinds hover over a core of fresh herbs and white cherry in this barrel-fermented Riesling. The palate offers creamy apple and tangerine peel flavors, peppered with a zesty limestone note and shot through with electric acidity. It's savory and lingering on the finish.
title: Fox Run 2017 Silvan Riesling (Seneca Lake)

description: Defined aromas of apple, white blossoms, lime and stone shine in this off-dry Riesling. The well-textured palate is succulent in feel, with a snappy orchard-fruit flavor that's backed by a waxy lemon note.
title: Wagner 2017 Select Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Aromas of fuzzy peach and powdered slate start off this bright, sunny semidry Riesling. The palate brings ripe red apple and dusty minerals to the fore, enlivened by a flowing river of acidity. Ending on a talc-dusted green apple tone, this is a well-balanced, well-priced offering.
title: Wagner 2017 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Named after Konstantin Frank's wife, this single-vineyard Riesling offers fresh tones of apple, apricot, lime peel and crushed stone on the nose. It's broad and juicy on the palate, displaying loads of crisp tree-fruit flavors that are balanced by delicate astringency. The finish is brisk, refreshing and dry.
title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2017 Eugenia Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Boisterous aromas of peach, mango and melon carry to the medium-bodied palate. This semidry Riesling offers a solid concentration of creamy tropical-fruit flavors that are well-honed by pineapple and citrus acidity. This is straightforward in its appeal, yet the energy and balance keeps you coming back for more.
title: Chateau Lafayette Reneau 2017 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Refreshing and crisp, this light-bodied, elegant wine offers very clean appley aromas and good lean Bosc pear and mineral flavors backed by appetizing acidity.
title: Imagery 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)

description: Fresh aromas of apple and quince show a delicate grip on the nose, leading to a textured palate that's peppered with tonic water. The acidity is drawing yet well-honed, giving a wine that's refreshing, crisp and begging to be served alongside food.
title: Lamoreaux Landing 2017 Yellow Dog Vineyard Estate Bottled Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Though not as rich as its first (2015) vintage, this forward and fruity wine is ripe enough, with plenty of citrus-tinged acidity, along with freshly cut apple. It's crisp and steely, with a little Viognier blended back in to add a welcome bit of texture.
title: Quady North 2016 Eevee's Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Applegate Valley)

description: Ripe aromas of Anjou pear and apple are leveled by clean lines of white rock minerality and wet river stones on the nose of this block-designated bottling. Tangy pear and lime flavors are fresh and zesty, with more wet rock touches in the background.
designation: Mount Eden Clone Block 11 Bien Nacido Vineyard
title: Scar of the Sea 2016 Mount Eden Clone Block 11 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: One among numerous limited-production Rieslings from Brooks, this young wine puts a strong emphasis on phenolic skin flavors rather than just-squeezed fruit. Lemon, grapefruit zest and brewed tea show the most.
title: Brooks 2016 Meyer Vineyard Riesling (Dundee Hills)

description: Relatively light in the glass, this true Mourvedre bottling shows black raspberry and a strong rocky minerality on the nose. The palate is crisp with more bright raspberry flavors, but is made complex thanks to earthy herbal tones.
title: Tablas Creek 2016 Mourvedre (Adelaida District)

description: Aromas of green pear and yellow apple ride over a core of lime rind on the nose of this off-dry Riesling. The palate is brisk yet well-textured, offering a creamy green melon flavor that's balanced by crunchy green pear and lime.
title: Hickory Hollow 2016 Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: The aromatics from these biodynamically grown grapes are compelling, though in the mouth the flavors fall a bit short of completely ripened fruit. Apple skin, citrus pith and a touch of grapefruit are on display. Despite 14 months on the lees, the mouthfeel flattens out through the finish. Best consumed now through 2020.
title: Keeler 2016 Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: A delicate nose of yellow apple, stone fruit and a dusting of pollen starts off this dry-style Riesling. The palate is crisp and chalky in texture, displaying a fleshy orchard-fruit flavor that's struck against a lime peel backdrop.
title: Hickory Hollow 2016 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Three-quarters Cabernet Sauvignon with the rest Syrah, this wine comes in at an alcohol level (12.5%) unheard of for a red wine in the state in modern times. The aromas are brooding, with notes of sea salt, herb, tobacco, barrel spice and earth. The flavors are light and elegant, not entirely holding together throughout but still providing a lot of interest.
title: K Vintners 2015 Roma River Rock Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: This mostly Pinot Noir-based sparkling wine contains 5% Pinot Meunier. It was given three years en tirage, resulting in a creamy mouthfeel and moderate acidity. It stays fresh and light in the glass, combining flavors of green apple, hazelnut and a squeeze of lemon.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2014 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Russian River Valley)

description: Herb Quady's proprietary blend of cofermented Viognier, Roussanne and Marsanne is finished with a splash of Grenache Blanc and Vermentino. An aromatic delight, it sends up beguiling scents of orange blossom, lemon rind and apricot fruit. It's deep, ripe and rich, bursting with fresh fruit flavors that are buoyed with tangy acidity.
title: Quady North 2017 Pistoleta White (Rogue Valley)

description: This exceptionally lively, all stainless Pinot Gris has more natural fruit complexity than most unoaked Chardonnays, at half the price. Lime, apple and white peach fruit, along with compelling minerality, make this surefire for seafood, simple poultry and mild cheeses.
title: Underwood 2017 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

description: A well-honed mix of ripe peach and tangerine mix with underscores of white blossoms and slate. The palate is broadly concentrated in ripe fruit flavors of tart kumquat and passion fruit that are struck against a taut, astringent sensation. Persistent bursts of acidity keep this both succulent and tense, making the palate beg for more.
title: Empire Estate 2017 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Very fresh and very vibrant, this light-bodied and well-balanced wine is aromatic, crisp and refreshing. It promises green apples, garden herbs and citrus in the aroma and delivers juicy tangy apple and grapefruit on the palate.
title: Pennyroyal Farm 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)

description: Complementing its Whole Grape Ferment Rieslings, this barrel-fermented (on the skins) wine was aged a half-year in neutral wood. It offers scents of cinnamon spice and lean apple fruit. The racy minerality completes the picture and sets it stylistically apart from the winery's other Vermentino.
title: Troon 2017 Whole Grape Ferment Vermentino (Applegate Valley)

description: This is a ripe, forward dry Riesling that offers mango, apple and stone fruit on the nose. The palate is equally fruit-laden, yet well-balanced by honed acidity and delicate astringency. A light lemon curd tone lingers on the finish.
title: Red Tail Ridge 2017 Dry RTR Estate Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: The aromas pop, with notes of orange peel, apple, tropical fruit and peach. Plentiful stone fruit and kiwi flavors follow. It delivers a lot of appeal.
title: Barnard Griffin 2017 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Stunning aromatics combine spicy citrus, tangy tropical and spun sugar notes. In the mouth, the wine (though bone dry) still manages to convey a sense of fruit sugar. It's tart, racy and complex, with the structure to age for 15 years or longer, but delicious already. The vines date back to the early 1970s.
title: Harper Voit 2016 Maresh Vineyard Old Vine Riesling (Dundee Hills)

description: Gritty in texture and supremely complex, this estate red is powerful in concentration and acidity. Floral rose and earth ride along its midpalate of forest floor, black tea and tangy pomegranate, finishing with an emphasis on the persistent Asian spice.
title: Hirsch 2016 West Ridge Estate Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: Ripe yellow apple and peach resound on the nose, with underscores of lemon and white blossoms. The medium-bodied palate is fleshy and round, broadened out by plenty of ripe fruit flavors yet balanced by well-honed, orange-laden acidity.
title: Red Tail Ridge 2016 Dry RTR Estate Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: This is one of the few orange wines coming out of the state at present. The aromas enchant, with notes of lychee, rose petal, orange rind and spice. Bone-dry flavors follow, showing a touch of bitterness on the finish.
title: Savage Grace 2017 Oak Ridge Vineyard Orange Gewurztraminer (Columbia Gorge (WA))

description: This wine begins with ripe bubblegum, peach, pear-syrup and Stargazer lily aromas, although those start to fade into more mineral tones as it sits open. The sip is quite tight, with lemony acidity and a chalky frame constraining the peachy flavors.
title: Margerum 2017 Margerum Estate Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)

description: Ripe tones of nectarine, peach and waxy honeycomb form on the nose. There's some textural roundness on the palate, bolstered by flavors of peach skin and chewy dried apricot. Despite these ripe fruit flavors, the finish is dry, ending on a delicate astringent sensation.
title: Sheldrake Point 2017 Estate Bottled Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Pleasantly fruity, with standard apple and pear flavors, this has not achieved the ripeness of past vintages, and it thins out quickly in the finish. That said, it would be fine with unfussy preparations of seafood and poultry.
title: Rock Point 2017 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

description: Bright fruit flavors blend apple and pear with spicy highlights. A hint of lemon rind adorns the finish. All in all, it's a tasty, well-made and totally enjoyable bottle.
title: Cubanisimo Vineyards 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: A fine example of the variety, this wine is crisply defined and brimming with a mix of grapefruit, melon and kiwi flavors. It is fruit driven for sure, but detailed and textural, with lingering fruit tones that wrap smoothly into a clean finish.
title: Apolloni 2017 Estate Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

description: A full, even fleshy wine, which puts a bit of barrel toast (15% was aged in wood) around plump pear fruit. It's well ripened and ready to drink while young and fresh.
title: Apolloni 2017 L Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: This rich and fruity wine is irresistible in its flavors of apple, orange, tangerine and apricot. It's juicy and plump, fresh and full bodied, with a touch of toast from 30% new French oak fermentation.
title: Archery Summit 2016 Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Tasty, toasty and refined, this mixes tree fruits and tropical fruit highlights with lush seams of caramel and maple syrup. It was fermented in 45% new French oak and put through full malolactic. Enjoy this delightful wine now through the mid-2020s.
title: Archery Summit 2016 Summit Vineyard Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

description: Sanguine in red currant although accented a light seasoning of black pepper and clove, this wine is on the lighter side of ripeness and imparts a delicacy that appeals, but leaves the fruit subdued.
title: Domenica Amato 2016 Cherry Camp Syrah (Sonoma Coast)

description: A pleasant easy-drinking wine, it's lightly fruited with tart red berries. A hint of chocolate adorns the finish. Though fresh and clean, it verges on the generic.
title: Et Fille 2015 Gabriella Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Too bad California doesn't make more Semillons like this. While technically light-bodied, this wine tastes nutty and feels smooth, bringing a lot of richness to the palate along with buttery earthy almond-like flavors. It has a touch of astringency and acidity to counterpoint its weight and support the complex and evolved character of the flavors.
title: Bee Hunter 2015 Semillon (Yorkville Highlands)

description: Ripe and tangy at once on the nose, this bottling shows berry and overextracted cherry on the nose. Roasted tomato, cherry and licorice spice show on the sip.
title: Rockin' R Winery 2013 Barbara Anne Barbera (Paso Robles)

description: This is a pleasantly distinctive version of the grape, fermented and aged in stainless steel, yet with lovely apple and tangerine fruit and a wash of almond paste. The relatively low alcohol and suggestions of honey may mean that some grape sugar remains, and if that's the case, it works quite nicely.
title: Amity 2017 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)

description: The winery continues its interesting experiment with this wine, in a blend in which almost half was aged in clay amphora, 40% in neutral oak, and 18% in stainless steel. It's an unusual mix - textured, softened up a bit, with a mix of lime, grapefruit and Meyer lemon fruit. The time in clay brings those drying flavors into sharp focus.
title: Winderlea 2017 Meredith Mitchell Vineyard Pinot Blanc (McMinnville)

description: This unoaked wine is positively charged with crisp apple and grapefruit flavors, has tangy acidity and medium body. Refreshment is in the forefront from the apple-skin aromas to citrus flavors to a mouthwatering finish.
title: Portalupi 2017 Graziano Vineyard Arneis (Mendocino)

description: Once again, this is the lightest of the winery's single-vineyard cuvees, though the overall balance compensates for any perceived lack of optimal ripeness. All own-rooted Wadenswil fruit, this offers flavors of wild strawberry, pine forest and flowers. It's delicate, balanced and expressive, without quite reaching the power of the other 2016s from this producer.
title: Big Table Farm 2016 Cattrall Brothers Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This is a tiny production field blend of 90% Petite Sirah and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon. It surprises and delights in aromas of floral lavender sachet and white pepper, the red fruit is high-toned and tangy, with buoyant acidity and freshness shining from start to finish.
title: Sheldon 2016 The Red Hat Red (Napa Valley)

description: Fresh Meyer lemon peel and lime are drizzled atop pear brioche, nut cream and oak on the nose of this expressive, fresh bottling from an Ojai-based winery. It's tightly wound on the palate with fresh honeysuckle and light white peach flavors, finishing with a chalky grip.
title: Topa Mountain Winery 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling shows pressed rose petals, dewy thyme, wet forest floor, wild tarragon and a touch of funk on the nose. The palate's light pomegranate flavors gain complexity from earthy elements of moss, damp mint and turned loam. It's an intriguing, refreshing sip.
title: Leitmotif 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is an acid-driven, sharply focused white, tense and fresh with exotic waves of green apple and Meyer lemon. The oak is subdued and secondary to the briny, stony taste of the forest and sea.
title: Hirsch 2016 Hirsch Estate Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: From a vineyard in Aptos just 4.5 miles from the ocean, this bottling begins with a bright fruity nose of alpine strawberry, red currants, dried thyme and lavender. The palate is fascinatingly floral, with rose petal, hibiscus and dried purple-flower flavors, wrapped around elegant cherry tones.
title: Lioco 2016 Saveria Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Housed in a classic green-glass bottle, this appellation blend offers aromas of lime blossom, sharp citrus rind, burnt almond and chalk. The palate is very racy and sharp with mouthwateringly sour citrus and wound-up pome fruit flavors.
title: Scar of the Sea 2016 Seven Leagues Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Winemaker/owner Cabell Coursey ages this white entirely in terra-cotta amphorae, and the result is robustly perfumed in apple blossom, with a hint of citrus. Light in texture and balanced power, it finishes in a lovely mix of lemon verbena and pear.
title: Works and Days 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Tightly woven aromas of chalky mandarin zest and faint nectarine show on the fresh nose of this bottling by Rick Longoria. There is bright lemony flavor and crushed chalk minerality on the palate, and the acid just won't quit, even days after opening the bottle.
title: Longoria 2017 Clover Creek Vineyard Albarino (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Aromas of pink grapefruit, tropical fruit and herb lead to broad feeling, ever so slight spritzy fruit flavors. A tart, lingering finish caps it off.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Grassy and herbal, this white is made in an austere style, with little to no perceptible oak. Light and bright, it has a vegetal element offset well by a linger of lemon.
title: Delaney Blue Vineyards 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

description: Production of this value Pinot has almost tripled in the past few years, but for the price the quality remains quite high. Principally sourced from the Umpqua Valley AVA, it's a spicy wine with flavors of cranberry, blood orange and underbrush.
title: Underwood 2017 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: The simple diluted cherry fruit cannot overcome the earthy bitter tannins. The best option here is aggressive aeration to help smooth them over.
title: Kings Ridge 2017 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A fruity, plummy aroma and fresh cherry flavors make this medium-bodied wine straightforward and easy to appreciate. It's rather light and lean but pleasant to sip.
title: Heron 2017 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Pinot Gris from the southern region of state can attain a luscious fruitiness not found further north. This excellent wine offers a concentrated Bosc pear flavor that's dappled with cinnamon spice. Any dish featuring pears would be an ideal match.
title: Earth Song 2017 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Southern Oregon)

description: Wet cement, almond cream, nectarine and tuberose aromas show on the nose of this blend of 44% Viognier, 24% Marsanne, 20% Grenache Blanc and 12% Roussanne. There is a strong acidity to the sip, which is crisp and clean with sliced pear and a hint of guava flavors.
title: Tablas Creek 2017 Cotes de Tablas Blanc White (Adelaida District)

description: A perfectly composed blend of 30% Riesling, 20% Pinot Blanc, 25% Muscat, 10% Gewurztraminer and 15% Pinot Gris, this nicely integrates the various aromatic, spicy and fruity components from the different grapes. Tart apple, orange, lemon and grapefruit flavors come in equal proportion, with a refreshing minerality underscoring the fruit.
title: Brooks 2017 Amycas White (Willamette Valley)

description: Rounded aromas of lemon cream and banana meet with a touch of chalk and a crushed rock minerality on the nose of this blend of 44% Grenache Blanc, 29% Viognier, 12% Marsanne, 12% Roussanne and 3% Clairette Blanche. There is a compelling tension to the palate, giving structure to the tropical guava and lime-spray flavors.
title: Tablas Creek 2017 Patelin de Tablas Blanc White (Paso Robles)

description: Unoaked and showing flavors of green apple flesh and peel. There's a pleasing sharpness to the mouthfeel. Flavors penetrate and linger, suggesting a match to any and all white fish in a butter sauce.
title: A to Z 2017 Chardonnay (Oregon)

description: Tasted blind this could pass for Pinot Blanc, a near neighbor in France. It's a fresh, crisp white wine with a solid minerality under a mix of celery, lime and melon.
title: Bjornson 2017 Viola Auxerrois (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Solid and expressive, this vintage of Big Fire offers big fruit. Plush pear, apple and peach flavors are underscored by a hint of lime. It's a wine to drink young and slightly chilled.
title: R. Stuart & Co. 2017 Big Fire Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a medium-weight wine that balances subtle floral and orange-zest characters against suggestions of vanilla and butter that build on the palate and add richness on the finish.
title: Oak Grove 2017 Family Reserve Viognier (California)

description: Made by Pacific Rim (now owned by Banfi), this is a serviceable white wine. It's varietally true, displaying tones of crisp apple and pear that finish balanced and clean.
title: Rainstorm 2017 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

description: Just ripe enough, this simple, straightforward example of a fruit-driven Chardonnay shows a clean apple flavor and an interesting hint of banana. Drink over the next couple of years.
title: Del Rio 2017 Chardonnay (Rogue Valley)

description: An easy-drinking wine in a lightly fruity style, this pushes no boundaries, but delivers clean flavors of apple and peach. Taste carefully and you may detect a streak of lemon custard sneaking through the finish.
title: Cedar + Salmon 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: This is sharp and spicy, with a streak of wintergreen and licorice somewhat muting the wild-berry fruit. Fermented entirely with whole clusters and native yeast, this is a strongly flavored wine, with tart berry and cherry fruit. Aging four months in 100% new French oak brings up baking spices such as cinnamon, allspice and ginger through the finish.
title: Evening Land 2016 Seven Springs Estate Anden Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Black fruits are underscored with hints of seashells, leading into a sharp, focused wine with the structure to cellar well. Light suggestions of blood and mushrooms add complexity, and it should benefit from another year or two in bottle. Drink from 2020 - 2030.
title: Owen Roe 2016 Durant Vineyards Clonmacnois Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Summum is the reserve-level Chardonnay from this Chardonnay specialist. This is a chewy, textural wine, deeply fruited with nectarine, blood orange, Meyer lemon, candied lemon peel and grapefruit. The lush citrus flavors are supported with seams of butterscotch, toast and coconut.
title: Evening Land 2016 Seven Springs Estate Summum Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: A glass of this young wine is like a hike up a mountain trail, starting with brambly, wild berries, and leading through underbrush and Mediterranean herbs. It thins out gracefully into suggestions of upland grasses, underscored with a layer of basalt.
title: Nicolas-Jay 2016 Nysa Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: A single puncheon produced this rich ripe cuvee. It's loaded with brambly berry and cherry fruit, rounded out with sweet spices. Finishing highlights suggest anise and a dollop of caramel latte. The time in barrel has placed it in a prime drinking window already, so don't wait.
title: Chateau Bianca 2016 Wetzel Estate Puncheon Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The winery's biggest production Pinot Noir is a gem, with grip, tension and power. Black fruits etched with iron ore and graphite, along with a touch of black olive, make this smooth and supple wine a joy to explore. The tannins are ripe and very lightly earthy. It's delicious the instant you pull the cork, so don't wait.
title: Owen Roe 2016 The Kilmore Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: Bishop Creek is the estate vineyard, planted in the late 1980s with own-rooted vines. The wine is dark and muscular, with brambly black-cherry fruit. Streaks of earth and iron add further density, and there's a slight hint of leather in the nose. Already displaying good initial depth and power, this should be consumed 2024 - 2026.
title: Nicolas-Jay 2016 Bishop Creek Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: Decanting is strongly recommended, as this old-vine, biodynamically farmed wine is shut tight when first opened. Primary fruit flavors of strawberry and cherry gather weight with airing, and the wonderful purity of the wine begins to shine. The lengthy finish is detailed by herb, berry and citrus - subtle, well-integrated flavors that suggest a long life ahead. Drink now through the late 2020s.
title: Winderlea 2016 Winderlea Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Pineapple jumps out, a wash of intense fruit flavor, supported by juicy, fresh acidity. The fruit piles on blood orange, Meyer lemon, grapefruit and more. All this lush ripeness is buoyed and balanced by the acidity, and the tangy flavors are never bitter or sour. The length and intensity are especially impressive, finishing with a nice lick of coconut.
title: Evening Land 2016 Seven Springs Estate La Source Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: A broad swatch of strawberry fruit coats the palate, then comes into focus with peppery highlights. Aged 11 months in French oak, this shows more fruit than toast, and is already drinking nicely.
title: Amity 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Aromas of peppery spice, sliced green pepper and jalapeno lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors that bring a sense of purity and balance. It's a pleasing if a bit green example of the variety. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best, pairing with roasted chicken sprinkled with sage.
title: Seven Hills 2016 Carmenere (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: This is a straightforward example of the variety that will appeal to many. It shows broad, simple flavors of apple and pear, but concludes with a bitter sting on the finish.
title: Kings Ridge 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: A strong, sweet, candied lollipop flavor dominates here. The cheery cherry flavors have the sort of appeal that broadly popular, inexpensive California Pinots display, but as a single-vineyard Oregon selection this falls wide of the mark.
title: Erath 2016 Willakia Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Juicy, dusty and mineral-driven, this wine is balanced and fresh on the palate - a study in contrasts between savory and the succulence of plum, dark cherry and just a touch of vanilla. Lush and fleshy, it retains plenty of acidity throughout.
title: Brick & Mortar 2016 Cougar Rock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

description: Grown at about 2,200 feet above the Salinas Valley with views of the Monterey Bay, this bottling, which saw 88% whole-cluster fermentation, shows crushed hibiscus, spicy cinnamon, anise and red plum on the pungent nose. Crisp pomegranate and raspberry flavors meet with sumac and aromatic mints on the palate.
title: Big Basin 2016 Coastview Vineyard Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: Lush and oaky despite its light-bodied delicacy of restrained ripeness, this wine has floral undertones that present as mineral and earth. It has a balanced bite of green apple and lemon curd and tons of structure that should support it over time.
title: Brick & Mortar 2016 Manchester Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino Ridge)

description: From a high-elevation vineyard above Petaluma, this wine has a great depth of floral and mineral aromatics that invite one in immediately. Meyer lemon, crisp green apple and wet stone accentuate its acid-driven nature that's broadly quenching and complex.
title: Brick & Mortar 2016 Fault Line Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: From vines planted in 1973, this excellent bottling is superfresh with aromas of raspberry as well as loads of dark rock minerality, from crushed slate and wet clay to smashed soapstone. That earthy minerality shows on the sip as well, alongside sagebrush, thyme, peppercorns and intense boysenberry flavors.
title: Scar of the Sea 2016 Block Q Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This wine is tannic and tightly wound in its youth, exotic and feral with its grasp of earthy forest and dried herb. Blue fruit pokes through, trying to make its way against a wall of structure and grippy balance. Enjoy 2023 - 2026.
title: Brick & Mortar 2016 Manchester Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)

description: Two different Muscat clones are blended, and the wine is finished completely dry. The aromas are classic for the variety - rosewater, orange peel and citrus blossom. Flavors of orange, apricot and peach rule the palate, with a hint of brioche through the lengthy finish. Have fun pairing this with a variety of spicy noodle dishes.
title: Treos 2016 Dry Muscat (Willamette Valley)

description: Loads of white-flower, guava-peel and orange-blossom aromas show on the nose of this blend of 75% Roussanne, 18% Grenache Blanc and 7% Picpoul Blanc. Light pear, peach and guava flavors make for a very mellow expression of Roussanne that will age for years but is drinking great now. Drink until 2030.
title: Tablas Creek 2016 Esprit Blanc De Tablas White (Adelaida District)

description: Aromas of strawberry, cherry and underbrush lead to an exquisitely balanced, drawn-out palate, full of juicy, flavorful fruit that brings a sense of delicacy. The tannins give a light squeeze. It's as good an example as I've had of the variety from this appellation.
title: Savage Grace 2016 Underwood Mountain Vineyards Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (WA))

description: A reduced oaky entry leads to edgy citrus-driven acidity and a high-strung, stony briny mineral character that beguiles. Green apple, quince and Meyer lemon offer subtle fruit elements that rise up to the overall earthiness.
title: Brick & Mortar 2016 Cougar Rock Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: From a block planted in 1987, this bottling offers an extremely fresh, bright and snappy black raspberry aroma, with deeper tones of tar, char and coffee in the background. The palate is all about grippy tannins, roasted berries and white pepper spice. Drink now - 2035.
title: Bien Nacido Estate 2015 The XO Reserve Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Part of the historic winery's new reserve line, this intense wine delivers a roasted pork aroma against black cherry, dried rose petals and charred wood. There is a compelling sharpness of cranberry, pomegranate and raspberry flavors on the palate, with hints of green peppercorn, moss and tea leaves.
title: Bien Nacido Estate 2015 The Captain Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: The oldest Pinot Noir vines in the Willamette Valley may be tasted here, in a carefully crafted, elegant wine built to age. Dig deep and let the flavors find you. It's subtle and expressive, with stacked layers of wild berries, citrus, hay, iron and coffee. If history is any indication, this wine will age gracefully for another 20 years.
title: The Eyrie Vineyards 2015 Original Vines Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Well structured, with bracingly tangy raspberry fruit, this was aged over a year in one-quarter new French oak. The flavors show a strong streak of chocolate before firm tannins kick in and set up a polished finish. The forward flavors suggest consuming this by the early 2020s.
title: King Estate 2015 Domaine Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This Willamette valley wine was produced by a Washington winery way out on the Olympic Peninsula. It touches on wild berry and apple flavors, but just barely. The fruit is so thin that the wine shows little or no varietal character.
title: Long Road 2015 Roncali Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: All of the fruit for this wine comes from Antoine Creek Vineyard, north of the Lake Chelan appellation. Aromas of lemon balm, white peach and honeysuckle are followed by generous but still sleekly styled fruit flavors that show beautiful depth, balance and tension. Lemony acidity heightens the interest. The winery's best offering of this variety to date.
title: Gramercy 2017 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Pure varietal, this is as perfectly-ripened as Viognier can ever be. Rich, smooth flavors of melon and tangerine with zesty notes of Meyer lemon push the fruit forward, with underlying minerality keeping the lengthy finish fresh and invigorating. Drink now and over the next two or three years.
title: Quady North 2017 Steelhead Run Vineyard Viognier (Applegate Valley)

description: Aromas of wet slate, kiwi, pineapple and herb are out front. Broad feeling tropical fruit flavors follow and carry through the kiwi-filled finish, with mouthwatering acidity backing it up. There's a lot to like.
title: Mercer 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Some tasters may prefer the Classique to the Reserve, because it's a bit fruitier and more open at first taste. Both are leesy and textural, this one with mineral-drenched flavors of melon and apple. It was fermented and aged in neutral puncheons and stainless steel.
title: Lange 2017 Classique Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: Aromas of hay and lawn clippings meet with wet river stone on the nose of this fresh and vibrant bottling. It's zippy on the palate, with flavors of lemon, lime and grapefruit rind.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)

description: This tangy, tasty wine will appeal greatly to those who favor highly acidic, lemony whites. The lip-licking acidity conjures up a citrus mix of grapefruit, lemon and orange. It was fermented in stainless and picked at low pH to emphasize the juicy acidity.
title: Five Fourteen Vineyards 2017 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: Initially closed on the nose, after a few swirls in the glass this wine reveals aromas of thyme, citrus and crushed stone. The light-bodied palate offers flavors of ripe yellow apple and tangerine, with a soft peach note lingering on the finish.
title: Heron Hill 2017 Ingle Vineyard Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: This wine has a beautiful floral entry of rose and lavender, building slowly on the palate in delicate layers of complexity. The lengthy broadway of fruit is defined in cassis and crunchy pomegranate, the finish a mix of white pepper and black tea.
title: Friedeman 2016 Terra de Promissio Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This 44-year-old vineyard was picked early, keeping finished alcohol well below last year's bottling. Clean Bing cherry fruit with a lovely seam of mocha washing over and through the palate makes this especially inviting for near-term drinking.
title: Lavinea 2016 Tualatin Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine is 100% varietal, with a dash of fruit coming from Stone Tree Vineyard on the Wahluke Slope. The aromas are high toned, with notes of baking spice, anise and cherry. Compact, lighter styled fruit flavors follow. It needs time to stretch its legs to show its best.
title: Kerloo 2016 Exclusive Release Red Willow Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

description: All of the fruit for this wine comes from Block 50, the sprawl block at this vineyard. The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of violet, black pepper, smoked meat and plum. Lightly spritzy, tacky-feeling fruit flavors follow, with dry tannins and a cough drop note on the finish.
title: Kerloo 2016 Les Collines Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: This is a bright, complex and succulent single-vineyard designate that is also textured and beguilingly delicate. Cherry, blueberry and plum flavors wrap around Asian five spice and savory cardamom elements that season the light lovely body.
title: La Follette 2016 Sun Chase Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This lovely, well-made white is spicy, grippy and textured, with robust underlying richness. Light in style, the mouthfeel is balanced in juicy, lingering acidity and quiet flavors of green apple and lime.
title: Coursey Graves 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Delicate layers of raspberry and strawberry define this coastal wine, which is deliciously layered and lightly complex. Pomegranate and blood orange flavors give it an additional lift of freshness and focus within its restrained style.
title: Red Car 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a well-made version of the rare variety - oily and floral with a gritty underbelly of texture. Apple, rose water and lemon provide an exotic framework of balanced acidity and crispness.
title: Red Car 2015 Vivio Vineyard Roussanne (Bennett Valley)

description: This has a carbonic freshness and high-strung acidity. The fruit is nuanced, fresh and powerful in strawberry and orange.
title: Red Car 2015 Zephyr Farms Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Crushed sandstone and flinty mineral aromas meet with a slightly reductive nose on this bottling. The palate is very tightly wound with grassy lime-skin flavors.
title: Black Ridge 2014 Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Ian Brand's flagship bottling just keeps getting better, yet stays reasonably priced. Light in the glass, this blend of 65% Grenache, 26% Syrah, 7% Mourvedre and 2% Counoise offers lovely aromas of strawberry, red plum, white pepper, wild tomato and forest floor. It's taut in texture on the sip, holding cranberry and strawberry flavors in check, as dried sagebrush carries through the finish.
title: Le P'tit Paysan 2016 Le P'tit Pape Red (Central Coast)

description: Herb, pineapple, pink grapefruit, licorice and clove aromas are at the fore. Taut fig and tropical fruit flavors follow, with tart acidity keeping the interest high.
title: Seven Hills 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This wine is still quite young, which makes it very energetic if not yet fully evolved. Aromas of crushed hibiscus, elderberry and smoked meat lead into a palate of plum, berry, game and dried sage. It's both rich and zesty at once.
title: Barden 2017 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Pinot Gris has been a Lange highlight since the winery was founded in 1987. For the first time, a portion of this vintage was aged in concrete egg. It takes some time to open up, then does so with a burst of a lemon drop flavor. It's a tart and juicy style, with excellent pull through to a long, minerally finish.
title: Lange 2017 Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: This lovely wine impresses on all counts. Affordable, beautifully proportioned and expressing well-defined, nicely layered flavors, it puts many far more expensive Chardonnays to shame. Elegant apple, pear, white peach and pineapple flavors intertwine, set up in a soft, lightly buttery frame.
title: Cardwell Hill 2017 Estate Bottled The Bard Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: The aromas leap out of the glass, displaying notes of slightly wilted white flower, ginger, mandarin orange zest and spice. This is a hair off-dry, with plenty to like.
title: Rocky Pond 2017 Clos CheValle Vineyard Gewurztraminer (Lake Chelan)

description: Not as ripe or concentrated as in 2015, this is a tight, rather tannic wine that will require ample aeration or further bottle age. Astringent tea flavors overtake light black-cherry fruit, and 40% whole cluster fermentation emphasizes the earthy, herbal components.
title: Archery Summit 2016 Archer's Edge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: An homage to the vineyards that helped to pioneer the Willamette Valley, this is not a big wine, but nicely layered and interesting. Cranberry, pomegranate and raspberry fruit are buoyed with zesty acids that suggest blood orange. This is a wine that is still hiding the influence of the new French oak in which it spent 10 months. The impression in general is that all of Winderlea's 2016s will benefit from another year or two of bottle age.
title: Winderlea 2016 Dundee Hills Vineyards Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This remains a sharp, angled wine with somewhat unintegrated components. Melon flavors and a pat of butter are in the mix, and some raw, unresolved wood flavors also, perhaps from time in 228-liter French oak. The potential is there. Decant aggressively or wait another year or two before opening.
title: Alchemist 2016 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: The nose of this estate bottling is quite showy, offering Bing cherry, pungent rose buds and a hint of vanilla. It's fairly light on the palate but with pleasing red-plum and cranberry flavors that are easy to quaff.
title: Sculpterra 2016 Estate Merlot (Paso Robles)

description: This is the winery's entry-level Pinot Noir, and it's a screaming deal. Aromas of black raspberry, hibiscus and purple flowers make for an elegant and pretty nose that's both high toned and approachable. Alpine strawberry and rose-petal flavors ride a crushed rock minerality and taut texture of fine tannins and bright acidity.
title: Scar of the Sea 2016 Seven Leagues Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Deep aromas of baked black currant, grilled beef and wild sagebrush make for a very compelling nose on this cool-climate expression of Syrah. Roasted meat and blackberry-paste flavors combine with rosemary, black pepper and pickling herbs on the palate, which is delicious and savory.
title: Odonata 2016 Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This offers acid-driven, crunchy red fruit that intertwines with rose petal and orange zest. Tightly wound tannins support an earthy core of forest, tobacco and tea, which complement the subtle fruit. It is light bodied and delicately ripe.
title: Gary Farrell 2016 Fort Ross Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: Clean and bright aromas of sharp lemon, crushed chalk and lightly toasted almond are very reminiscent of Alex Gambal's bottlings from Burgundy on the nose of this promising collaboration project with Peter Work of Ampelos Cellars. There is phenomenal tension to the palate, with tightly woven citrus, chalk and seared nectarine flavors.
title: Gambal + Work 2016 Bentrock Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Paying homage to how the Romans would have fermented their Falanghina in a ceramic vessel, this skin-contact wine is slightly orange and cloudy in the glass, offering aromas of wet stone, orange rind and crushed nuts. Tangy tangerine rind, lemon and apple flavors meet with a touch of rust on the palate.
title: Wrath 2016 Ex Dolio Falanghina (Monterey)

description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling from atop the Santa Cruz Mountains offers cherry, pomegranate and strawberry aromas on the nose with a pinch of nutmeg. The palate combines ripe cherry with sarsaparilla spice.
title: Big Basin 2016 Old Corral Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Done in a ripe, rich and toasty style, this is quite tasty in a mainstream sort of way. It's full bodied and ready for immediate enjoyment. What's missing is the precision of place that could elevate it still further.
title: Elton 2016 Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This is among winemaker Cathy Corison's finest offerings, made from decades-old vines planted on St. George rootstock. Cassis, red currant and floral elements make for an inviting entry of aromatics that is followed by substantial structure and classic herbal undertones. A pillowy body of balanced elegance is met by an earthy, leathery finish of complex beauty.
title: Corison 2015 Kronos Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

description: Sourced from the highest point in the Bieze vineyard, this crisp, beautifully defined wine bursts forth with ripe autumnal apple fruit, pear, highlights of graham cracker crust and a finishing hint of toasted coconut.
title: Harper Voit 2015 Elevage Pinot Blanc (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Sea-shell scents abound in this wine, accenting light fruit flavors of cranberry and raspberry. Natural acidity provides balance throughout, and the pretty finish lingers gracefully, leaving with a dash of sweet spice.
title: Anne Amie 2015 Anne Amie Estate Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: Tangy oranges and tangerines accent sculpted acidity in this textured, gritty white from the always impressive vineyard site. With just a touch of reduction, it has understated elegance and a light-bodied style.
title: Red Car 2015 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Tartly acidic raspberries carry a hint of gun metal. It's young and still a bit astringent, with an interesting finish that unwinds with suggestions of green herbs, black olive and coffee.
title: Merriman 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: A tart herbal wine, this grips the palate with flavors of wild berry, iron filings and black licorice. All estate fruit, it aged 12 months in 20% new French oak.
title: Merriman 2015 Cummins Road Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: This is from an old-vines Wente clone, planted in 1977. You'll notice the texture first, layers of well-proportioned citrus, lemon zest, wet stone and hints of barrel toast. The length and detail are superb, and though drinking well already, this is a wine that will reward cellaring. Drink now through the 2020s.
title: Bethel Heights 2015 The High Wire Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This proprietary white blends 95% Viognier with 5% Sauvignon Blanc. Together they're exotic in sea salt, wet stone and high-toned floral aromatics of jasmine. The palate is succulent and restrained, a study in white peach, green apple and lemon zest.
title: Conclusion 2017 The Storyteller White (Sonoma County)

description: Though quite astringent, this opens with moderately ripe, firm purple-fruit flavors. The stem and leaf flavors follow, and the tannins are a bit rough. Best to pair this with such fatty foods as burgers and pizza.
title: Grochau 2017 Commuter Cuvee Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is the first time that Doug Margerum has parsed out a single-vineyard expression from his Sta. Rita Hills blend for this label, and it's easy to see why. On the nose, sagebrush and blackberry converge with gamy meats, while the extremely zippy palate offers black-raspberry, lavender, white-pepper and duck-fat flavors.
title: Barden 2017 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Sourced from eight-year-old vines, this tangy young wine is bursting with tart grapefruit and pineapple fruit. It's leesy and refreshing, with underlying minerality and bountiful acidity.
title: Carlton Cellars 2017 Pinot Blanc (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: In an outstanding portfolio of crisp, textural 2017 white wines, this is perhaps the most approachable. It's balanced and fresh, though not quite as bitingly tart as the winery's Pinot Blanc, or as crisply defined as the Auxerrois. Nonetheless a fine bottle, with ripe apple and pear fruit in a compact style.
title: Carlton Cellars 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: High-toned acidity supports bright fresh flavors of peach, apricot and green apple in this well-made lightly bodied white. Floral aromas of jasmine and apple blossom complement the fruit.
title: Quivira 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

description: It would behoove this talented producer of Alsatian-style white wines to adopt the universal Riesling scale on the back label, in order to emphasize the crisp, food-friendly style here. Though not bone dry - there's a light hint of residual sugar - it's dry enough to work well with many foods. Lemon tea, orange rind and pink grapefruit flavors abound, backed by clean, cutting acidity.
title: Foris 2017 Riesling (Rogue Valley)

description: This is a phenomenal start for the small-batch side project by Stephen Searle, whose main job is running Jaffurs Winery. Intense aromas of Bing cherry jelly, crushed rocks and dried sage show on the nose, while the palate combines wild berry and minty flavors with a strong chalky grip, proving both luxurious and refreshing.
title: Leitmotif 2016 Duvarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Scott Paul's Azana is an elegant concise wine, with well-defined raspberry and cherry fruit. The supporting acids are in good balance, and there's a clean minerality with a hint of sea shell. The finish trails out with suggestions of lemon rind and grapefruit.
title: Scott Paul 2016 Azana Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This remains astringent, with opening flavors of black tea and black olive, ahead of rather delicate red-berry fruit. It opens slowly with ample breathing, unwinding a bit and broadening the fruit. Give this another year in the bottle and drink from 2020 on.
title: Scott Paul 2016 Ribbon Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: This very focused, medium-bodied wine is substantive and delicious. It starts with a quite fruity aroma full of black cherries and sour cherries, then on the palate it shows vivid, cherry-like flavors, nicely balanced by nervy acidity and moderate tannins and weaving in hints of black tea and rhubarb.
title: MacPhail 2016 Wightman House Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Smoke, peach rinds, sour lemon and struck matchstick show on the nose of this blend of 37% Roussanne, 36% Viognier, 22% Marsanne and 5% Picpoul Blanc. A very zesty mouthfeel is full of zippy acidity, delivering smoked lemon and dried peach flavors.
title: Lion Ranch 2016 Lion's Share White (Santa Clara Valley)

description: The vines date back to the 1970s, but in this vintage the fruit seems less than optimally ripened. Thin strawberry flavors along with dried grassy herbal components are there, but after that it thins out and fades.
title: Ruby 2016 Estate Blend Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Bradley Brown goes 100% whole cluster for this single-vineyard expression with stunning results. Aromas of sagebrush, pine needles, damp thyme and wet soil meet with tart raspberry on the distinctive nose. The palate's tangy red fruit is lifted by tea leaves, wild green sage and zesty acidity that vibrates the tongue.
title: Big Basin 2016 Lester Family Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Pungent amounts of cinnamon, raspberry, wet thyme and dill show on the brilliant nose of this cool-climate, 100% whole cluster bottling by Bradley Brown. It's tart and tightly wound on the palate like a ready-to-pluck instrument, combining fresh and bright red-fruit flavors with forest-floor spice.
title: Big Basin 2016 Alfaro Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Dried red flowers and sagebrush combine for an elegant aromatic entry to this bottling by two business partners who have worked in Santa Barbara's restaurant scene for many years. Tarragon and intriguing peppercorn flavors decorate the tangy cranberry palate, which is lightly bodied but very well structured.
title: Point & Line 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This reserve bottling aims for richness, offering aromas of rounded apple, pear, smoked nuts and crushed chalk. The palate wraps a smoky touch around the dried grass and yellow-pear flavors.
title: Grassini 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: This is an elegant wine, seemingly light but offering wonderful details as it unfolds across and through the palate. Cherry tomato, golden raspberry and yellow-plum flavors combine, with hints and highlights of sandalwood, mocha and Asian spices. Don't quit on this wine and it won't quit on you.
title: Anne Amie 2015 Twelve Oaks Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Tempranillo is a strength in this region, but this rustic tannic woody wine does not reflect that. Suggestions of black-cherry fruit are buried in woody flavors of charred burnt coffee, leading into a short bitter finish.
title: Schmidt 2015 Tempranillo (Applegate Valley)

description: Black-raspberry, forest floor, wet tobacco and peppercorn aromas show on the layered and minty nose of this bottling. The fresh palate is taut and tart with bright red fruits that benefit from complex touches of thyme, bay leaf and green peppercorn.
title: Jaffurs 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Boysenberry sorbet, cocoa and sweet dried herbs show on the nose of this complex and layered Cab from the warm reaches of Carmel Valley. The structure is tannic, chalky and firm, though the mouthfeel is lighter than expected, offering flavors of tobacco, berry and light vanilla on the finish.
title: Joullian 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Carmel Valley)

description: Sour and tart berries smell like balsamic vinegar on the nose. The palate is also very sour with almost painful acidity.
title: Rockin' R Winery 2012 Everything in Its Right Place Red (Paso Robles)

description: Crafted from a mix of barrels that were originally part of the winery's single-vineyard program, this lightly gamy wine shows tangy cranberry and pie cherries, along with a whiff of the tack room. Dried herbs dot the finish, leading into tannins that resolve into dried tea-leaf flavors.
title: Sineann 2017 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
