description: Subdued aromas of peach and herb are followed by spritzy, full-bodied stone fruit flavors. The variety's intensity and joy seem to be missing
title: Tamarack Cellars 2017 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: An enveloping nose of apple, pineapple, tangerine and jasmine mixes with an earthy base note. The medium-bodied palate is textural and waxy in feel, with hi-def flavors of apple skin, white blossoms and orange that are graced by a tangy wet-slate note.
title: Empire Estate 2017 Dry Reserve Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Rounded aromas of ripe melon and nearly tropical fruit show on the nose of this single-varietal expression, but it's the edgy chalky aromas that are most compelling. That grippy minerality peaks on the palate, grabbing attention with citrus and more melon flavors before settling into a smooth finish.
title: Tablas Creek 2017 Grenache Blanc (Adelaida District)

description: Here is a very fine example of Oregon Pinot Gris. It pushes fresh apple and pear fruit right down the heart of the palate. It's full bodied and balanced, drinking at its youthful best already.
title: Cardwell Hill 2017 Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: Thirst quenching in lemon, anise and wet stone, this is a steely, focused white that will appeal to fans of the unoaked style. It finishes on a lingering baked-bread tone.
designation: Teresa's Unoaked Estate Grown Estate Bottled
title: Balletto 2017 Teresa's Unoaked Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Aromatic and deeply imbued with scents of black fruits, iron and barrel toast, the careful handing of this exceptional fruit yields a wine with power and finesse. The potent primary fruit flavors are set upon a sturdy age-worthy base of stiff acids and ripe tannins. Drink this during the decade of the 2020s.
title: Winderlea 2016 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: The grape of Beaujolais should do quite well in Oregon, but has not really caught on. This striking example from Ehren Jordan may help to change that. It was fermented with native yeast, carbonic maceration and 100% whole cluster fruit, yielding a bright spicy wine loaded with cranberry and purple-plum flavors. The riveting acidity keeps it lively across the palate, and it should drink nicely over the next two or three years.
title: Failla 2016 Bjornson Vineyard Gamay Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: The most affordable Pinot Noir in Moffett's lineup, this blends fruit from three of the winery's single-vineyard selections, and sees 25% new French oak. Plum and cherry fruit, lightly dappled with Italian herbs, shows just a bare hint of cherry tomato. It's a quite tasty wine already, and should drink nicely into the early 2020s.
title: Moffett 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This blend of Grenache Blanc and Viognier does justice to both varieties, showing characteristics of honeysuckle, wet stone and lemon peel in a light, crisp package of elegant ripeness. Peach and apple round out the fresh flavors.
title: Noble Tree 2016 Noble Blanc White (Chalk Hill)

description: Cot is an alternate name for Malbec - a southern Oregon strength. This tasty wine mixes plum and wild-berry fruit with smoky toast from 18 months in barrel. It's drinking well and should go another three or four years.
title: Troon 2016 Estate Cuvee Cot (Applegate Valley)

description: This is the brand new project from Alex Gambal and Peter Work of Ampelos Cellars in the Sta. Rita Hills, where Gambal is hoping to replicate his Burgundian style. This wine's rounded aromas of white peach, sea salt caramel and nectarine syrup lead into an energetic palate that's sharply citrus at first before the chalky minerality takes hold.
title: Gambal + Work 2016 Francesca Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: For the first time since 2011, Cowhorn offers a Grenache (55%) and Syrah (40%) blend. A small amount of Tempranillo is included. Loaded with baking spices and mixed blue fruits, this tasty wine finishes with a seam of dark chocolate and espresso.
title: Cowhorn 2015 Moonraker Grenache-Syrah (Applegate Valley)

description: Lightly built with a persistent succulence, this wine shines in up-front acidity and delicately woven flavors of strawberry, cherry and orange. The tannins are tight and quiet.
title: Red Car 2015 Heaven and Earth Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Sourced from the Griffin Creek vineyard, this wine seems to have been built upon rather thin fruit flavors. Dilute, generic hints of red berry, along with herbal tomato leaf, are all but buried in a wash of vanilla. No information was provided, but often it's overuse of oak chips that bring on such flavors. Drink up.
title: Panache Cellars 2015 Sangiovese (Rogue Valley)

description: Ripe blueberry and blackberry fruit, with ample acidity, anchors this reserve. With just a hint of the natural funky character that the better Syrahs express, this high-acid example will need time and attention, as in several hours of decanting prior to drinking.
title: Cowhorn 2014 Reserve Syrah (Applegate Valley)

description: Among Cowhorn's several different Syrahs, this winemaker selection fits squarely in the center in terms of concentration and power. Dense fig and coffee-liqueur flavors combine, with chocolate-covered cherries filling in the finish. The tannins remain a bit astringent, even though this wine was released at almost four years of age.
title: Cowhorn 2014 Sentience Syrah (Applegate Valley)

description: Give this one a bit of extra attention, and let it unfold its complex mix of fig, chocolate, and charred coffee beans. At first, it may seem that the astringent tannins override all else, but with air the wine opens up gracefully. It's stylistically in tune with the better Syrahs from Canada's Okanagan valley.
title: Cowhorn 2014 8 Syrah (Applegate Valley)

description: Golden-apple, lemon-extract and toasted marshmallow aromas immediately reveal that this is a California Chardonnay, but one held in balance. The palate is clean and crisp with lemon and Asian pear flesh flavors, woven by a firm grip and strong acidity.
title: Martellotto 2017 Melodeon Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: Lime peel, green pear, lemongrass and wet river stone combine for an inviting and complex nose. There is strong chalky tension to the palate, where a flavor of Key lime pie is wrapped in bright acid.
title: J. Wilkes 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: One of the first of the 2017s to be released, this elegant, sophisticated wine dramatically out-performs its price point. The luminous color, pretty floral aromatics and subtle integration of fruit all suggest a wine that could easily bear a reserve label. Raspberry and cherry fruit, sweet spices, polished tannins and supple acidity pull it together nicely, even at such a young age.
title: Broadley 2017 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is the first vintage of this wine, and it was made in minuscule amounts. It opens awash in fresh strawberry, white pepper, citrus and flowers, aromatically inviting and fruity. A touch of grit and oak provides backbone amidst a textured, balanced palate of great beauty.
title: Sheldon 2017 Luc's Vineyard Grenache (Fountaingrove District)

description: Aromas of baked red cherry, rose and fennel lead into a palate loaded with strawberry, sagebrush, thyme and loamy soil. The mouthfeel is full yet cut by strong acidity.
title: J. Lohr 2017 Falcon's Perch Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: Baking spice aromas and ripe, juicy fruit flavors make this full-bodied wine easy to appreciate. It follows on the palate with toasty oak nuances and satisfying notes of red and black cherries. A good structure of fruit, acidity and moderate tannins keeps it well balanced.
title: Three Thieves 2017 Pinot Noir (California)

description: A solid example of an emerging Oregon style, this is a classy mix of fruit and barrel, melon and toast. The fruit rambles into the edges of a tropical profile, with suggestions of banana and papaya. There's a slight impression of cream on the palate.
title: King Estate 2017 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: Fruit for this wine comes from a vineyard at 1,300 feet of elevation - high for the state. All aged in neutral French oak, the wine has aromas that bring notes of ripe peach, apricot and flower. Full-bodied, well-structured stone fruit and creamsicle flavors follow. There's much to enjoy.
title: K Vintners 2017 Art Den Hoed Viognier (Yakima Valley)

description: This is a complex, impressive white with a creamy lush entry that evolves on the palate to offer crisp fleshy elements of white peach and lime. The midpalate is balanced in richness, leading the way to a bold herbal grassy finish.
title: Capture 2017 Tradition Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

description: Aged entirely in stainless steel, this pretty, appropriately named white is floral and herbal, tasting strongly of grapefruit pith and lemon peel. The flavors lead to accompanying textures of light-bodied weight and refreshment.
title: Flint & Steel 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: This is a well-made wine that's generous in aromas and flavors. It is a little taut and appetizing in texture and balanced by good acidity. Cinnamon and red-cherry aromas are followed by snappy cherry and raspberry flavors. The wine is medium bodied and lightly tannic.
title: Freelander 2017 District One Pinot Noir (California)

description: Right on the heels of the 2016 comes this early release from 2017. It's almost a twin - smooth, ripe and remarkable for the price. Flavorful berry and plum fruit with well-massaged notes of vanilla, tobacco and Bourbon combine to make this a most enjoyable everyday wine. That it's true Willamette Valley Pinot Noir is even better.
title: Castle Rock 2017 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a fruit-forward and balanced white, crisp and fleshy in bold layers of pear and apple. The acidity is nicely integrated.
title: Precision Wine 2017 Fly By Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: This is a lighter style of Pinot Noir, with earthy aromas of juniper, cola and pine needles on the nose. There are a lot of green aspects to the palate as well, such as menthol, which give nuance to the tart cranberry fruit.
title: Martellotto 2017 Le Bon Temps Roule Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Light and bright in well-defined flavors of white peach and apricot, this is a fulsome, balanced white, quiet and subtle in flavor with crisp, focused acidity.
title: Decoy 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

description: This soft-textured wine combines light citrus aromas and heavier poached pear and vanilla flavors. It tastes fat and full, low in acidity and a touch sweet.
title: The Seeker 2017 Chardonnay (California)

description: This is a nutty, somewhat reduced white, steely and light in ripeness. The flavors lean into Meyer lemon mousse and anise.
title: Sean Minor 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This wine is very fruity, tastes sugary and thick and has low acidity for a soft mouthfeel. It's simple and uncomplicated.
title: Geyser Peak 2017 Chardonnay (California)

description: This lightly sweet and syrupy wine smells like waffles and tastes like blueberries. It is medium bodied, soft in texture and very low in tannin.
title: Leaping Horse 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: A smoky, earthy character dominates this medium-bodied wine, while low-intensity blackberry flavors and a tangy texture provide a foundation.
title: Grayson 2017 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This is a decent commercial wine that's medium bodied, lightly tart at first and plenty fruity. It turns richer, almost sweet, on the palate as vanilla and butter notes come forward.
title: Josh Cellars 2017 Chardonnay (California)

description: The flavors start out thin and weedy, with beetroot and earth, and continue into a tannic and astringent finish. The fruit is hard to find. Give this a good decanting or better yet, aerate it aggressively.
title: Chemistry 2017 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Finding zesty white wines in Paso Robles is a noble quest, and this bottling works well. Broad aromas of pear, grass clippings and pomelo skins lead into a tangy palate of lime peels, lemongrass and kaffir lime leaf. Then it rounds out into green-apple flesh, all framed by a chalky edge.
title: Robert Hall 2017 Cavern Select Vermentino (Paso Robles)

description: Vibrant and firm in texture but intense in flavor, this wine has a pale-salmon color, subtle aromas of white flowers and white raspberries followed by tangy, almost chewy raspberry and white-peach flavors. It practically vibrates with tantalizing acidity and has a clean, snappy finish.
title: Pennyroyal Farm 2017 Rose of Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This is an aromatic, bone-dry wine that shows off the grape's floral side. It smells of jasmine, rose and lychee, tastes crisp and refreshing and finishes with an appetizing nip of astringency.
title: Bonterra 2017 Dry Muscat (Lake County)

description: This 20th anniversary release is a zippy, sassy fruit bomb of a wine. Apple cider, a squirt of grapefruit, and plenty of juicy acidity push the flavors forward and keep the mouthfeel fresh and lively. Drink now - 2020.
title: Carabella 2017 Estate Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Sourced from a 1979 planting, this crisp, steely wine seems to have been made entirely in stainless steel, to good effect. Stylish apple fruit is highlighted with hints of chervil and parsley, and a twist of lemon peel finishes it off.
title: Brooks 2017 Brooks Estate Vineyard Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: A spicy nose with an herbal edge carries a faint impression of petrol, as a Riesling might show. In the mouth the flavors fill in and round out, with sweet pear, white peach, and more of that Germanic hint of petrol. An interesting wine, though done in a style that's atypical for Pinot Gris.
title: Spindrift Cellars 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: Farmed by Dai Crisp (Temperance Hill), this is a soft, lightly oxidized take on Pinot Gris. Round and smooth, with fresh flavors of pear flesh and skin, it carries a hint of cinnamon into the finish.
title: Brooks 2017 Logsdon Ridge Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: This warm, spicy wine has a good combination of ripe red and black-fruit and generous dashes of baking spices. It is full in body, tastes ripe and has a firm but smooth texture.
title: Castle Rock 2017 Cuvee Pinot Noir (California)

description: Production of this workhorse Pinot Gris tops 66,000 cases, but the quality remains consistently good and the price looks more and more like a bargain as comparable wines creep upward in cost. Precisely layered flavors of apple, pear and white melon comprise the palate, with a gentle touch of spice.
title: A to Z 2017 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

description: This is a meaty white, layered in dried herb and white peach. The texture is youthful and still evolving.
title: Quivira 2017 Fig Tree Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Clean aromas of Asian pear rind, lime and chalk make for a very tightly woven nose on this bottling. Apple and pear-juice flavors dominate the broad palate.
title: Lucas & Lewellen 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This old-vine Coury clone cuvee is making its last appearance in Big Table Farm's lineup, for reasons undisclosed. It's a fine finale - a lush and inviting mix of ripe blackberry and black-cherry fruit, sweet spice and a touch of chocolate-covered orange rind. The tannins keep it smooth and supple on through an extended finish.
title: Big Table Farm 2016 Wirtz Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine is beautifully fruity in tones of cranberry, strawberry and raspberry, with perfumed wafts of rose and lavender on the nose. It's light in body, driven by bright acidity that keeps it fresh and inviting. A silky display of Asian spice rings on the finish.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2016 Fox Den Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: Lovely aromatics introduce bright, fresh and forward raspberry and tart cherry fruit. It's supple and well proportioned, with lingering threads of coffee, iron and graphite adding texture and detail. This should continue to drink quite well over the next six to eight years.
title: Lavinea 2016 Lazy River Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: Great ripeness comes with great balance in this fruity, expressive and firm-textured wine. It is full in body but not flabby due to sinewy tannins and persistent acidity. Aromas and flavors run from cinnamon to black cherry to rhubarb, as hints of nutmeg and vanilla show a deft touch of oak. Best from 2022.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Weir Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)

description: Young and a bit chewy, this brings a nicely-layered mix of orange peel, almond paste, black cherry, sassafras and cola, all in good proportion. Those well-integrated components are further highlighted with a streak of iron ore and graphite. The complexity is already impressive, and seems sure to improve with age. Drink now through 2030.
title: Nicolas-Jay 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Just a single Chardonnay was made in 2016, and it's a gem. Done in a racy crystalline mineral-driven style, it saw just 20% new French oak, which, as it turns out, was plenty. Honeycrisp apple, tangerine and lemon-rind flavors are lightly framed with pretty barrel toast.
title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: From a field selection planted to old Hyde and Wente clones, this white has soft rounded corners of caramel oak and vanilla bean. The complex, balanced richness is defined in tropical fruit accented by a brightness of tangerine and white peach.
title: Fort Ross Vineyard 2016 Fort Ross Vineyard Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: Low in oak and high in acidity, this is an earthy herbal white that's stony and salty, capturing full-on the spirit of the ocean. Light and lemony, it has complexity and elegance in spades.
title: Saxon Brown 2016 Etre Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This aromatic wine mixes hints of thimbleberries with a light whiff of compost. The flavors follow in line, with wild raspberry fruit and a bit of mocha. It's firmly anchored in svelte ripe tannins, and just a touch of chocolate. As with virtually all Eyrie Pinots, this should age nicely for a decade at least. Drink now to 2030.
title: The Eyrie Vineyards 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a tremendous value for the quality, a full embrace of creme brulee and baked pear that's grainy in texture and bright in acidity. Minimal oak allows for a succulent experience on the balanced palate, finishing in a burst of lemon zest and key lime.
title: La Crema 2016 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Svelte and smoky, this is a sexy bottle of Pinot Noir. The fruit is supple and seamless, with plums, marionberries, figs and chocolate. Aged for one year in 25% new French oak, it's firm and rippled with touches of olive and mushroom. This exceptional value is simply a riot of flavor.
title: Evening Land 2016 Seven Springs Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Always one of the winery's best, this new vintage doesn't hold back on some unusual accent flavors - caraway, cherry pit, dried herb and stem. But there's also ample tart pie cherries, clean earth and even a finishing lick of grapefruit. Note the new label design.
title: Sokol Blosser 2016 Orchard Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Lovely aromatics introduce a wine balanced between tart pomegranate fruit and suggestions of dried leaves and herbs. Baking spices from the aging in one-quarter new oak add interest to the finish. This is a wine that dives down deep into the palate and lasts through a long finish.
title: Sokol Blosser 2016 Big Tree Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Firm, tight, this is focused with green apple, melon, butter and toast. It opens up into a broad midpalate, maintaining that focus through a lingering finish with a delicious butter-cookie flavor.
title: Evening Land 2016 Seven Springs Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Plump and buttery, this medium-bodied wine pours on the vanilla, butter and baking spice flavors, with a rich, layered texture that's soothing on the palate. Made from biodynamic grapes, it is well concentrated but not too heavy.
title: Bonterra 2016 The Roost Blue Heron Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino County)

description: In this vintage this selection is a big full-bodied wine, with cherry fruit accented with scents and flavors of cut tobacco, clove and cola. The grapes are the so-called Martini clone, harking back to an older California-influenced style of bold fruity Pinot Noir.
title: Sokol Blosser 2016 Twelve Row Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This is floral in jasmine and steely on the midpalate - a beautiful white wine that's balanced and elegant in approach. With a good grip of tannin and oak, it shines in sharp flavors of green apple, Meyer lemon and creme brulee., while the richness is seasoned in nutmeg.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2016 Rued Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The winery's Taproot cuvee sees extra time in a higher percentage of new oak, 15 months in one-third of the barrels. A dark seam of espresso, graphite and smoke infuses the firm core of black-cherry fruit. It's a fairly potent yet well-balanced wine that should be enjoyed over the next five years.
title: Brigadoon 2016 Taproot Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Tightly packed with tart berry fruit, highlighted with sharp tangy acidity, there's some bite to this young wine which should profit from further bottle age. Black cherry and blood orange, along with hints of pepper and mushroom, display the range and depth of flavor here. Drink from 2022 on.
title: Lavinea 2016 Nysa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: The name references sedimentary soils, a companion to the volcanically inclined Fire Pinot. A burst of strawberry and blackberry introduces a flavorful wine with a broad streak of cola. The leesy texture and underlying minerality add interest to the finish, which leaves a touch of lemon skin lingering on the palate.
title: Chapter 24 2016 The Flood Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: An historic vineyard, originally planted in 1970, provided these grapes. This is lightly spicy, with a flavorful mix of blood orange, rhubarb, strawberry and a hint of butter. It spent 10 months in one-quarter new French oak.
title: Winderlea 2016 Maresh Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Fruit for this wine comes from Red Willow (52%) and Upland vineyards, with a dash of 5% Viognier capping it off. The aromas are arresting, with notes of green olive, stem, parsley, smoked meat, black pepper and fresh herb out front. The palate is sleek but compelling, along with plentiful smoked meat flavors and an extended finish.
title: Kerloo 2016 Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This wine has been renamed, but remains a reserve-level coferment of 62% Tannat and 38% Malbec. It's concentrated and fruit-powered, packed with blueberry and blackberry goodness. A vein of chocolate and some palate-sharpening acidity contribute further detail and depth. Drink now through the late 2020s.
title: Troon 2016 Estate Cuvee Pyrenees Red (Applegate Valley)

description: The vineyard's biodynamic farming adds interesting earthy, peat moss highlights to the rich core of black-cherry fruit. There are gentle hints of lime water and cola as the wine moves gracefully into a medium-bodied finish.
title: Nicolas-Jay 2016 Momtazi Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: Bright aromas of lemon skin and grapefruit pith are enveloped in strong chalky scents on the nose of this wine. There is tremendous tension to the palate, where fresh flavors of golden apple meet with honey, butter and toast that lead to a chalky finish.
title: Niner 2016 JR Reserve Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: The fruit here seems carved in rock - perhaps the volcanic soils speaking through the grapes. The cranberry, raspberry and tart cherry flavors remain firm and tangy. Then, in the glass and on the palate, the wine softens up a bit as it rolls into a smooth lightly chocolatey finish.
title: Alexana 2016 Crawford Beck Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Brambly berry fruit with old-vine texture and detail might fool you into thinking you've stumbled upon a fairly light Lodi Zinfandel. There's a light streak of cola and gently citrusy acids. Enjoy it for its subtleties.
title: Ruby 2016 Steve's Reserve Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Destemmed whole berries were fermented in 35% new French oak. The wine is not too oaky, but firm with ripe tannins and tangy berry and pomegranate fruit. There are notes of dark chocolate and underlying minerality.
title: Maison L'Envoye 2016 The Attache Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Rick Longoria has been making age-worthy Pinot Noir since the 1980s, and this bottling fits right into that legacy. Aromas of black plum, damp forest floor and pine wood lead into a structurally sound, very dry palate of boysenberry, tarragon, dill and smoke. Drink now - 2036.
title: Longoria 2016 Lovely Rita Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Already showing a trace of bricking around the rim, this seems to have been smoothed out during its 22 months in barrel. The core flavors of plum and cherry are accented by baking spices. The wine finishes with a bit of sharpness. Enjoy through 2020.
title: Earth Song 2016 Pinot Noir (Southern Oregon)

description: Sealed with a screwcap, this wine will need aggressive aeration as it initially opens with some rubbery scents. It's a tight wine which grudgingly yields flavors of black cherry and red licorice. A seam of espresso animates the finish.
title: Cave Spring 2016 Cabernet Franc (Niagara Escarpment)

description: The name references volcanic soils, though it's more of a marketing distinction than one that shows up in the wine. Blueberry and blackberry fruit comes with a whiff of leather, and the wine doesn't seem to be completely knit together as it finishes. Give it another year or two in bottle.
title: Chapter 24 2016 The Fire Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Firm and tightly threaded with stem and skin flavors, this opens slowly to reveal just-ripe black fruits and dark seams of chocolate and espresso. It was aged 10 months in 30% new oak, and would best be cellared another year or two, or decanted several hours before drinking.
title: Dion 2016 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This biodynamic estate-grown three-clone blend spent two years in mostly neutral French oak. Black-cherry, cola and a burst of black-coffee flavors evolve into a lightly toasty wine with stiff chewy tannins. This should continue to improve throughout the first half of the 2020s.
title: Keeler 2016 Majestic White Oaks Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This estate-grown brightly fruity wine frames its raspberry and cherry fruit with a light (16%) dose of new French oak. The tannins are particularly well managed, firm and ripe, and finishing with a touch of roasted coffee.
title: Brigadoon 2016 Lylee Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine is a blend of 70% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Sangiovese. Aromas of green herb, raspberry and plum lead to fleshy, pure, black currant and raspberry flavors. There's a pleasing sense of directness to it.
title: Vino 2016 Red (Washington)

description: Like a stiff shot of cranberry-raspberry juice, this young wine remains tart and tightly focused throughout the palate. It's stylish and fresh, with plenty of youthful energy. Give it another year or two to round out the flavors.
title: Ruby 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A surefire palate pleaser, this is toasty and forward, saturating the palate with creamy latte flavors of mocha and vanilla. The black-cherry fruit is there but definitely in the background, and the finish brings notes of roasted peanuts.
title: Apolloni 2016 L Cuvee Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Medium to full bodied, broad and rich in mouthfeel, this wine doesn't taste exactly like its name, but shows plenty of other fruits like ripe cherry and berry aromas, pleasant, mouth-coating cherry and strawberry flavors and a rather soft texture.
title: Plummy 2016 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Though showing a bit more concentration than most of the winery's 2016s, this still lacks the flesh hoped for in a reserve-level wine. It's subtle and herbal, well structured with red fruits and sappy acids. Drink now through the early 2020s.
title: Ruby 2016 Winemaker's Reserve Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Tight and tannic, this sits on the wild, herbal side of the line. Tart berry and pomegranate fruit is followed with tannins that still bear a touch of green character. The finish brings green-tea and bitter coffee notes. But overall, it's a sturdy wine that should handle heartier meat dishes.
title: Maison L'Envoye 2016 Two Messengers Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Sourced from 1985 plantings on the Oregon side of the Columbia river, this is a light version of Cabernet, with gentle flavors of berry, underbrush and dried herbs. It's balanced and shows some interesting complexity, but should be consumed over the next four or five years.
title: Merriman 2016 South River Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: This is a good, well-balanced and modestly fruity wine that shows low-key blackberry and cherry flavors, medium body and a light, dry mouthfeel. It's a good standard pour at a great price.
title: Dark Horse 2016 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Front loaded with flavors of cherry cola, this reserve seems to float along in a foamy sort of way - not literally foamy, but foamy in the sense that the flavors are almost weightless. Drink over the next couple of years.
title: Eugene Wine Cellars 2016 Reserve b2 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Compared with Erath's inexpensive, mass-produced Oregon Pinot, this limited-production cuvee seems sweet, as if dusted with powdered sugar. It's made in a forward, fruity style, and offers no challenges, but that grapey sweetness may hamper its food-matching possibilities.
title: Erath 2016 Leland Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a solid example of mass-produced Oregon Pinot, with purple-berry fruits, tartaric acid and modest tannins. Nothing wrong with it at this price, but it borders on generic.
title: Erath 2016 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: There's a touch of fizz to the glass of this twist-top bottling, which indicates a freshness that shows in the snappy berry aromas on the nose. The palate offers herbal touches of tobacco against tangy dark-red fruits. The body is somewhat thin but the overall experience is pleasurable.
title: Castle Rock 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This is a funky, earthy wine that's sizable in tannin weight and robust oak. The fruit struggles to exist within this context, offering a mix of baked strawberry and cherry.
title: Kenwood 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: This is a fruity, soft-textured and rounded wine that has raspberry and cherry-extract flavors, very low tannin content and a syrupy, almost-sweet character.
title: Ironstone 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

description: Black currant, tire rubber, green herb and mesquite aromas are followed by fruit flavors that paint around the edges, missing in the middle. The variety seems hard to find.
title: Castle Rock 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is a light watery wine with diluted raspberry fruit and little else. Some suggestions of bouillon come out in the quick finish. There's not much here.
title: Winter's Hill 2016 Watershed Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This is a relatively light, smooth and honest version of a typically tannic varietal. It offers vivid black-cherry and blackberry flavors, no assertive oakiness, a slightly gripping mouthfeel and medium body.
title: emBRAZEN 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Aromas of dried cranberry, hibiscus, rooibos tea, mace and grated ginger combine on the nose of this appellation blend. Intense flavors of elderflower and violet make for an elegantly vibrant palate, which is framed by intense black-raspberry fruit.
title: Sanford 2016 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The historic vineyard shows well in this impressive wine, which opens in an earthy mix of black peppercorn and black tea. Soft and seductive on the palate, it lingers in citrus-laden acidity that lifts up flavors of cranberry, strawberry and nutmeg.
title: Gary Farrell 2016 Rochioli Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Rounded aromas of Meyer lemon cream and crushed hazelnuts are deliciously inviting on the nose of this bottling from the winery's historic vineyard series. White peach, walnut, smoke and tangy grapefruit converge on the dynamic palate.
title: Au Bon Climat 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Allan Hancock College's vineyard is in the city of Santa Maria, and much closer to the coast than most of the Santa Maria Valley appellation. That gives this Syrah extreme cool-climate character, from tar, peppercorn, roasted lamb and black-currant paste on the nose to a tense palate loaded with cracked pepper, rosemary and game. Fresh acidity provides a juicy quality too.
title: Allan Hancock 2016 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Intense and concentrated aromas of black raspberry and alpine strawberry prove dark and rich but not overripe. The palate is framed by warm oak flavors that bind the rich strawberry and plum elements, which are offset by an orange-rind tang.
title: Odonata 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This wine was barrel fermented in 20% new French oak. It's racy, inviting and aromatic, with sharp flavors of lemon, gooseberry, lime and cantaloupe. Tart and stylish, it's built for aging, though immediately enjoyable. Drink now - 2028.
title: Lavinea 2016 Lazy River Vineyard Chardonnay (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: This is a powerfully perfumed red, inviting in lavender and rose petal, with a lasting impression of cardamom spice. It feels dense and rich within a context of balanced acidity and stemmy earthiness that lingers long on the finish.
title: Small Vines 2016 MK Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is an intriguing and excitingly exotic red, delicately layered and balanced in freshness. It opens in crisp blueberry and orange-zest characteristics seasoned in baking spice and cardamom, finishing with as much elegance as it begins.
title: Flowers 2016 Sea View Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Strawberry sorbet, light licorice and dried earth show on the nose of this bottling, which is quite mellow at first but becomes incredibly enjoyable with time. Fresh and accessible red-fruit flavors combine with hints of tobacco and tea leaf on the palate, which is delicate but with juicy depth.
title: Kathryn Kennedy 2016 Small Lot Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: A matchstick aroma leads to a package of great flavor and texture in this white from a historic producer. Flavors of apple, lemon and peach accentuate the creamy mouthfeel, with a honed balance of acidity, tannins and oak.
title: Heitz 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Consistent with past releases of the winery's reserve, this uses the estate's oldest Dijon vines and is barrel fermented and aged for almost a year in 20% new French oak. It's firm and spicy, with flavors of yellow plum, white peach and phenolic highlights of peach skin and grapefruit zest. The time in barrel does not add significant flavors of toast, but has helped to smooth out the mouthfeel. Drink now through 2025.
title: Stoller 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

description: Made for a Rhode Island wine bar of the same name, run by Leonard and Sherri Mello, this cross-country collaboration is quite fresh and spicy on the nose, showing aromas of strawberry, dried rose petals and a dusting of thyme and sage. It's bright and taut on the palate, with pomegranate and raspberry flavors, as well as touches of white pepper and curry.
title: Tavolo 2016 Lindsay's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Smashed berries, charred meat and peppercorn-crusted game show on the nose of this expression of a single vineyard that's dry farmed at 2,100 feet in the mountains. It's very dry on the sip, with flavors of elderberry, crushed pepper and garden herbs.
title: Scar of the Sea 2016 Casa Vineyard Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is winemaker Jim Clendenen's take on the region's most important vineyard. It is light in the glass yet with savory aromas of chalk, butter, hazelnut and sandalwood. Rounded flavors of lemon, honeydew and orange cream lead into a caramelized finish.
title: Au Bon Climat 2016 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A blend of two worlds (62% of the fruit from Sonoma County and 38% from Monterey), this is an approachable red wine, with a juicy entry of savory forest floor, black tea and black cherry. It finishes in a tartness of acidity akin to rhubarb.
title: La Follette 2016 Los Primeros Pinot Noir (Sonoma County-Monterey County)

description: An exotic earthy character dominates this dark-colored, full-bodied and firmly tannic wine, giving it a rustic feral appeal that gets progressively more enjoyable on the palate and finish. Blackberry and blueberry flavors underneath add to its appeal. Best after 2023.
title: Terra d'Oro 2016 Petite Sirah (Amador County)

description: Smoked hazelnut and rich oak aromas are cut by whiffs of lemon rind, citrus spray, chalk and Asian pear on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate offers both sharp citrus and rounded apple flavors.
title: Sanford 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This wine shows light aromas of plum and cinnamon before rich and mouthfilling plum and strawberry flavors coat the palate. It is medium to full in body, is not overly oaky and has good concentration and light tannins to keep it feeling snappy on the finish.
title: Tailor Made 2016 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Dried sage, bay leaf and thyme play against red cherry, raspberry and white pepper on the nose of this affordably priced twist-top bottling from the Talleys. Crushed carnations and tart cranberry flavors meet with orange rind on the palate.
title: Bishop's Peak 2016 Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Bright blueberry, plum and cherry aromas open this affordable red, which is soft and supple in approachability. Clove and a touch of mocha round out the light-bodied experience.
title: Ca' Momi 2016 Heartcraft Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Intense cranberry aromas meet with smoked pork roast, crushed slate and pinches of sage, thyme and white pepper on the nose of this luxury-level bottling. The palate is florally flush in touches of rose and tarragon, set against snappy red-plum fruit and racy acidity.
title: Bien Nacido Estate 2015 LXXIII Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Forward and fruit-driven, the flavors here touch on strawberry, cherry and tangy tangerine. It's a juicy ripe delicious bottle, balanced and ready for near-term drinking. Enjoy this excellent wine from now on into the early 2020s, when it should be at its best.
title: Broadley 2015 Marcile Lorraine Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: All of the fruit for this wine comes from Stoneridge Vineyard on the Royal Slope and was harvested at a scant 1.2 tons per acre, then barrel aged in puncheons on lees for 26 months. The aromas pop, with notes of green olive, brown stem, licorice, fresh herb, flower, tobacco and cherry. The palate is silky smooth and detailed, with plentiful black fruit flavors on the finish. Firm tannins back it all up. It needs some time to fully come together. Best after 2022.
title: K Vintners 2015 Royal City Stoneridge Vineyard Syrah (Washington)

description: As light in color as a Pinot Noir, this nonetheless delivers potent flavors of red and blue plum. There's an almost foxy character to the flavor, and a luscious finish loaded with sweet tobacco and baking spices.
title: Cowhorn 2015 Grenache 53 Grenache (Applegate Valley)

description: A pretty wine with sappy fruit flavors, this included 40% whole clusters in the fermentation, and 30% new French oak barrels in the elevage. Concentrated raspberry preserves anchor the fruit, with interesting seams of buttermilk and a touch of toasted cracker.
title: Broadley 2015 Claudia's Choice Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This enticing blend includes grapes from all of the estate vineyards, in a smooth, supple and well-integrated wine. The blueberry and sweet cherry fruit carries a touch of spice. The round, almost soft midpalate penetrates and lingers in a lush finish.
title: Cristom 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Smelling this wine, there is no question it comes from the Rocks District. A blend of 70% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Syrah, aromas of green and black olive, moist earth, ash and mineral are followed by soft, velvety, elegantly styled fruit flavors. It's a very pretty wine, with peat and smoke notes on the finish.
title: K Vintners 2015 Ovide Jack's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up three-quarters of this wine, with the balance Syrah. The aromas offer notes of green olive, mortared green herb, stem, fresh tobacco and spice, leaning hard into the savory. Juicy, ripe but still elegant fruit flavors follow. Chalky, dry feeling tannins back it all up.
title: K Vintners 2015 King Coal Stoneridge Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Washington)

description: This wine opens in floral and spicy aromas before unleashing a succulent midpalate that's as substantial in red and blue fruit as it is tannin. A lengthy streak of earthy forest floor complements the concentrated fruit.
title: De Loach 2015 Les Parcelles Cachees Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Tangy and high in acidity, this is a fresh and funky wine, earthy in dried herb, black tea and rhubarb. The style is light and bright.
title: Kenwood 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine seems to teeter on the edge of ripeness, with aromas of green pepper, mint and fresh chopped herb out in front of cherry. The compact, somewhat lighter-styled, blackberry flavors need some time to spread out.
title: Substance 2015 Vineyard Collection Cs Powerline Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Fruit for this wine comes from the Rocks District. The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of black olive, raspberry, smoke, licorice, high-toned savory herb, cherry, crushed chalk and spice. Soft, light, savory fruit flavors follow with a cranberry-filled finish.
title: Substance 2015 Vineyard Collection Jack's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: There is very little Syrah grown in the Willamette Valley, at least in part because the grape shows itself more expressively in other parts of Oregon, notably the Rogue Valley and the Rocks District. This is a pleasant red, with hints of varietal flavors of coffee grounds and light red fruits, but don't look for the power of the state's best Syrahs.
title: Eugene Wine Cellars 2015 b2 Syrah (Willamette Valley)

description: There is little to differentiate this winemaker's selection from the Watershed bottling at half the price. Tart thin strawberry fruit and a mouthfeel that seems to still have some trapped CO2 are all that there is. Two bottles tasted with similar results.
title: Winter's Hill 2015 Cuvee du Vigneron Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Steely and measured in ripeness, this wine is acid driven and crisp in style - a layered expression of green apple and lemon.
title: Red Car 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Green-olive and marshmallow flavors mesh in a fleshy, fruity mix of yin-yang flavor in this lightly ripe white.
title: Aviary 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Rusty and gamy aromas of blood meet with light cranberry and charred wood on the nose of this bottling by Jim Clendenen and team. The body is light yet carries immense waves of flavors, including sarsaparilla, pomegranate and smoke.
title: Au Bon Climat 2015 La Bauge Au-dessus Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: From Jim Clendenen's historic vineyard collection of wines, this bottling (from the vineyard that surrounds his winery) is light in the glass with aromas of red cherry, bay leaf, juniper and vanilla. The herbal attack is powerful on the palate, where oregano, sage and chamomile lift up the cranberry and pomegranate fruit.
title: Au Bon Climat 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Very light in the glass, this elegant bottling by Jim Clendenen shows spicy aromas of mace, crushed sage and eucalyptus, set against tangy cranberry and hibiscus aromas. It's a sprightly wine on the palate, with thyme, bay leaf and rusty cranberry flavors. Drink now through 2035.
title: Au Bon Climat 2015 Knox Alexander Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Concentrated aromas of mulberry, exotic red cherry, crushed rose petals, crushed slate, tarragon and sandalwood make for a stunning entry to this always epic bottling by Jim Clendenen. Clean flavors of raspberry and red currant are lifted by dried herbs and tea spice on the palate, which is drinking great but will also age for eons. Drink now - 2035.
title: Au Bon Climat 2015 Isabelle Pinot Noir (California)

description: Rich aromas of sandalwood, cinnamon, brioche French toast, vanilla and nutmeg make for a lush and attention-grabbing entry to this bottling. There is great cohesion of those spices on the plate alongside a bright lemony streak that cuts through the white peach and Marcona almond flavors.
title: Au Bon Climat 2015 Nuits-Blanches au Bouge Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Snappy black-raspberry and green-peppercorn aromas meet with black-plum paste and purple flowers on the nose of this bottling. It's a lively wine, fresh, floral and medium bodied on the palate, where thyme, rosemary and fennel flavors decorate the dark fruit.
title: Jaffurs 2015 Kimsey Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Sharp pomegranate aromas and concentrated strawberry tones meet with star anise, clove and crushed rocks on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. It's taut on the palate with tightly woven raspberry and a touch of thyme, proving rather light and easy.
title: Au Bon Climat 2015 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This is a finely made wine, blended with 10% Merlot and smaller bits of Petit Verdot and Malbec. It offers silky tannins and lovely notes of dried herb, sage, black cherry and blackberry. The finish is dusted in cocoa powder.
title: Franciscan 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This tasty, tawny wine is made from barrel-fermented, free-run juice. Aging in oak for 16 months both smooths out and softens its flavors, resulting in a broad, expressive palate with flavors of baked apple cobbler, with notes of vanilla and buttered toast. It's in a fine drinking window and should be consumed in the next couple of years.
title: Anne Amie 2015 Prisme Blanc Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Clean and bright Bing cherry aromas meet with red flowers on the intense nose of this bottling from high above the Salinas Valley. The palate combines rooibos tea with hibiscus flavors, but the compelling aspect is the grippy texture on an otherwise light frame.
title: Scar of the Sea 2015 Clone 113 Westside 3 Block Brosseau Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)

description: Intense waves of black currant, elderberry, lavender and tar show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard high above the eastern flanks of the Salinas Valley. The palate is framed by solid tannins and acid, offering very ripe black-currant flavors that are ready to drink now.
title: Big Basin 2015 Coastview Vineyard Terraces Syrah (Monterey County)

description: This estate-grown wine is made with whole-cluster fermentation, intended to be slower and cooler in order to produce less bitter tannin. It succeeds though does offer a stemmy carbonic expression that tastes of fresh strawberry and ash, the earthiness intense and persistent.
title: Marimar Estate 2015 Metodo Antiguo Dona Margarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: A blend of 72% Pinot Noir and 28% Chardonnay, this is a stunning vintage of the perennially impressive sparkler. Nutty and earthy, it sings in strawberry, wet stone and rose petal. The palate offers a lively mousse and persistent acidity, making it vibrant and easy to enjoy.
title: Iron Horse 2014 Wedding Cuvee Estate Bottled Sparkling (Green Valley)

description: Soft ripe flavors emphasize baking spices rather than fruit. This is appealing and ready to drink, though more of the lovely Pommard clone and less of the sweet spice would add complexity and balance. The label indicates the generic Oregon AVA, but the fruit was estate-grown in the recently expanded southwestern portion of the Willamette Valley.
title: Pfeiffer 2014 Blue Dot Reserve Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: A blend of Jim Clendenen's vineyards at Rancho La Cuna and Le Bon Climat, this extra-bottle-aged beauty is a showstopper, starting with aromas of roast pork in a cranberry-mulberry sauce, hickory smoke, star anise, curry and crushed slate. Intense but not biting acid pops right away on the sip, delivering deep sour-cherry, licorice and chai-spice flavors.
title: Clendenen Family 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: This blend of two-thirds Syrah and one-third Cabernet Sauvignon is earthy, smoky and black peppery in a very good way, as it reveals funky nuances from the potent aromas through flavors that are also ripe and full of black-fruit notes, to the lingering spicy finish. There aren't many pure Syrahs from the Foothills as good as this blend.
title: Terre Rouge 2014 Garrigue Red (Sierra Foothills)

description: Dusty blackberries and roasted fennel aromas show on the nose of this blend of 50% Dolcetto, 29% Refosco and 21% Nebbiolo that nods toward the owners' Italian heritage. The grapes do well in the cool Regan Vineyards, pairing a lighter weight mouthfeel with grippy tannins, wrapped in slightly tart red fruit and baking spice. Drink now - 2034.
title: Bargetto 2014 La Vita Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Candied black cherry makes for a very expressive, almost sweet nose on this bottling. The palate blossoms with purple flowers of lilac and jasmine, yet it is somewhat thin in body.
title: Black Ridge 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Roundly fruity, with solid flavors of strawberry pie, this wine is close to fully mature and should be consumed soon. Though the label indicates the generic Oregon AVA, the fruit was estate-grown in the recently expanded southwestern portion of the Willamette Valley.
title: Pfeiffer 2013 Blue Line Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Strawberry jam comes out in a wine that has moved into mature secondary fruit flavors. The tannins are peppery and carry a touch of bitter espresso. This should be consumed by the end of this decade.
title: Pfeiffer 2012 Epic Blue Dot Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This vineyard was right in the heart of the wildfire zone during the summer of 2017, and the winery notes that this wine has a campfire aroma, which indeed it does. It's not the same as barrel toast, yet when paired with the bright berry fruit, it works in similar fashion. Not for everyone, but it's a slam dunk match for barbecue.
title: Sineann 2017 Phelps Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: Firmly tannic, this leans toward a more herbal, earthy side of Pinot Noir. Its red fruits have a pleasing touch of barrel spice, and it's priced for everyday enjoyment, or it would make a fine by-the-glass restaurant pour.
title: Carlton Cellars 2017 Seven Devils Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Lovely ripe flavors of pear and white peach carry a hint of mint. The wine gathers itself into a focused core, buoyed with natural acidity and finishing with a lick of spice.
title: Sineann 2017 Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: Oily and oaky, this white is light bodied and viscous, featuring layered flavors of green apple, lemon and wet stone.
title: Domenica Amato 2017 Ceja Farms Grenache Blanc (Sonoma Coast)

description: This medium- to full-bodied wine offers ripe fruit flavors and has a bold, moderately tannic texture that fills the mouth. To its credit, the wine shows some restraint in the firm acidity and almost tangy finish, so it keeps one coming back for another sip. Drink through 2026.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Burt Williams' Morning Dew Ranch Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Smoky, toasty oak plays a stellar background role to this wine's succulence of black cherry, raspberry and blood orange. Acid-driven on the palate, it presents plenty of secondary characteristics that lean into savory tones of black tea and cardamom.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Williams Selyem Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: All of Lavinea's wines are deftly detailed, but none more than this. Citrus, rosemary, wet rock and well-ripened tannins add complexity to the core of blueberry and brandied cherry fruit. Beautifully balanced and long, it's coming together nicely and should continue to improve over the next half decade or more.
title: Lavinea 2016 Temperance Hill Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Pretty cherry and blackberry fruit highlights this palate-pleasing wine. Three-fifths was whole-cluster fermented, and 30% saw new French oak. Light flavors of Mediterranean herbs and milk chocolate add interest.
title: Archery Summit 2016 Renegade Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Forward and bright flavors emphasize cranberry and black cherry, along with earth and stem and skin flavors from the whole-cluster fermentation. Native (wild) yeasts were also used. A bit more bottle age may elevate the score.
title: Archery Summit 2016 Whole Cluster Cuvee Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: At first this seems quite soft and smooth - an easy-drinking style with toasty flavors of red fruits. The finish brings out the tannins, still a bit rough and showing a touch of bitterness, but with good length and texture. The best drinking window may start around 2020.
title: Keeler 2016 Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Lemon peels and apple rinds meet with steely, almost ashy aromas on the nose of this bottling. There is a good sizzle at first to the palate, which moves into apple-blossom, sour lime and toasted nuts flavors.
title: Sola 2016 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Tangy berry and sassafras flavors combine in a lightweight effort which does not demonstrate the depth and power of most comparably priced Dundee Hills Pinots. It's all Pommard clone, with a finishing hint of mushroom.
title: Winter's Hill 2016 Block 10 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: The name references a type of soil. There's tangy raspberry fruit, along with flavors of wet straw rather than green herb. It seems to lack a bit of stuffing, and quickly fades out.
title: Ruby 2016 Laurelwood Blend Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This is a juicy, spicy and well-developed appellation wine - a testament to good winemaking and fruit. Cardamom, dark cherry, pomegranate and tannin combine well and find contrast and complement within a balanced light-bodied style.
title: La Follette 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a refined, well-built wine, with tightly wound, concisely focused fruit flavors of fresh apple. Layers of butter, butter brickle and toasted hazelnut wrap around the fruit, and the balancing acidity brings a hint of lemon zest.
title: Flaneur 2016 Cuvee Constantin Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: Exotic and floral, this has a substantial midpalate of powerful concentration, exhibited as big flavors of apple, pear and lemon. Lightly ripe, it has texture and nuance that are impressively lengthy and delicious.
title: La Follette 2016 Sangiacomo Green Acres Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Fresh and deep, this offers ripe fruit flavors of apple, Asian pear and white melon. It was fermented in barrel with native yeast and 20% new oak. The structure, as with all Lavinea wines, is perfectly balanced for optimal tension and texture.
title: Lavinea 2016 Elton Chardonnay (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Great balance and freshness make this medium-bodied wine very appealing. It has lively acidity, just-ripe citrus and green-apple flavors and a mouthfeel that's both full and a bit tangy at the same time. It comes from the family that founded Navarro.
title: Pennyroyal Farm 2016 Hammer Olsen Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: Intense aromas of rich cherry, clove and smashed plum show on the nose of this bottling from a steep hilltop vineyard. The palate is very full and lavish with dark plum and strong baking-spice flavors.
title: Point & Line 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is estate-grown wine, crisp and sharply tense in acidity, the flavors marked by a distinction of green apple, pear and pineapple. The oak is measured and unobtrusive.
title: Etude 2016 Grace Benoist Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: The aromas pop, with notes of olive, smoke, spice, dark fruit and tire rubber. The palate is seamless and well balanced. It provides a lot of appeal.
title: Gordon Estate 2015 Estate Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is a tight stiff wine, with scents and streaks of licorice, rubber and espresso. It was aged in one-quarter new oak for two years, which seems to have further roughed up the tannins. It's astringent and dark, and not built for aging.
title: Maragas 2015 Tempranillo (Applegate Valley)

description: Estate-grown, firm and compact, this leans toward barely ripened flavors of cherry tomato and thin black cherry. There's a touch of buttery barrel, along with a gentle earthy character.
title: Del Rio 2015 Malbec (Rogue Valley)

description: This wine is lighthearted and approachable yet structured, with earthy elements of turned earth and dried herb. The palate is grippy in tannin and dark in blackberry and chocolate flavors.
title: Louis M. Martini 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)

description: From a selection of vineyards in Oak Knoll, Yountville and St. Helena, this crisp white is floral and lemony, with moderate weight and breadth. It's made in a steely, straightforward style with an intensity that lingers on the finish.
title: Amici 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Blended with nearly 18% Sauvignon Musque, this is fermented in both stainless steel and oak. Dried herb, lemon peel and peach shine along a thread of stony minerality and texture, the body balanced and impressively robust.
title: Oberon 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: A good sense of concentration and balance in this medium-bodied wine give it an appetizing appeal. Fresh apple and pear aromas are lightly shaded with baking spices, and the flavors follow with plenty of fruit, good acidity and a light tang on the finish.
title: FEL 2017 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)

description: This white is disjointed, a bit dull on the palate with dizzying flavors of green apple and olive.
title: Reynoso 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)

description: Melon, yellow apple and spice aromas are out front. Ripe peach flavors follow, with a browned apple note on the finish. It's a straightforward, enjoyable offering of the variety.
title: Gordon Estate 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The aromatics have a burnt rubbery character, suggesting that this wine, bottled under screwcap, needs aggressive decanting and aeration. Even so, it remains tight and unyielding for hours, barely hinting at lightly plummy fruit.
title: Rock Point 2017 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: A candidate for the best Albarino in the country, year after year, this rich and stylish wine offers up thick, tangy flavors of gooseberry, green apple and melon. The acids are touched with lime, and the overall power and freshness are exceptional.
title: Treos 2017 Albarino (Willamette Valley)

description: Bright, fresh and balanced, this is a fruity white with bold flavors of baked peach and apricot. A nutty undertone adds a touch of richness and texture.
title: Benessere 2017 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

description: The 40-year-old Maresh vineyard vines contribute flavors of ripe berry, cherry and other red fruits with both depth and power. Tannins remain a bit astringent, with 40% whole cluster fermentation perhaps a factor. Aging for 16 months in 30% new oak adds a finishing touch of chocolate. The concentration and depth of this wine should reward medium to long term cellaring. Drink now to 2030.
title: Scott Paul 2016 Maresh Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Beautifully plump aromas of black plum, violet, rose and baked fennel show on the nose of this bottling. Soft and full on the palate, it offers plenty of fruit surrounding the earthy core, with flavors of wild cherry, cherry pit, Alpine strawberry, loam and herb.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Vista Verde Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Benito County)

description: This is an Eastside Road hillside site that contributes balanced weight and smooth, seductive texture to this wine. With flavors of red cherry and raspberry, it has texture and complexity, with touches of Asian spice and black tea.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Calegari Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is the second vintage for this new label under the Willamette Valley Vineyards umbrella, and last year's single Pinot Noir is now split into a pair. This one is built upon 30+-year-old Pommard vines, ungrafted as the name implies. It's a sexy detailed seductive wine that offers immediate pleasure and medium-term ageability. Flavors of plum cake and black-cherry turnover abound; no need to wait on this one.
title: Elton 2016 Self-Rooted Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: A deep color, gorgeous fruit aromas and mouthfilling richness make this full-bodied wine memorable. The aromas show everything from strawberry syrup to sour cherries to cinnamon, while the flavors are fully ripe without seeming fat or sweet.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Ferrington Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Hannah is a block selection from the upper portion of the Tualatin estate vineyard. It's sleek and restrained, less ripe than the 2015, but exhibiting balanced flavors of brambly berry. The tannins are astringent, with the trailing flavor of Earl Grey tea.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2016 Hannah Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine offers a richness of caramelized oak and toffee that takes on an intensity in the midpalate. It settles into a more balanced presentation of apple, pear and melon with a lushness on the finish.
title: Longboard 2016 Rochioli Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Full on the nose with ripe red fruits, this blend offers sweet wood and snapped sagebrush aromas as well. The palate shows tangy boysenberry and herbal flavors, framed by very tight drying tannins.
title: Castoro Cellars 2016 Pasofusion Reserve Red (Paso Robles)

description: Sharply focused flavors bring cranberry and cherry fruit front and center. There's a stiffening frame of black licorice, suggesting some time in new wood. The wine seems to sit on the palate without any further development, and then just stops. A bit more bottle age is recommended; drink after 2020.
title: Northwest Ridge 2016 8 Barrel Whole Cluster Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The fruit seems thinner than usual in this vintage, and the impact of herbal components more evident. Some 40% was whole-cluster fermented, bringing in flavors of earth and stem, along with suggestions of ripe raspberries. The wine will benefit from another year in bottle, which may help to lengthen the finish.
title: Scott Paul 2016 La Paulee Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A light vintage across the board for the winery's Pinots, this all-Pommard cuvee surrounds dilute raspberry fruit with stem and skin flavors of green herb, tomato leaf and bark.
title: Winter's Hill 2016 Block 10 Whole Cluster Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Though the label simply indicates Oregon fruit, the winery confirms that it's 100% Willamette Valley. Tight and tannic, this brings earthy characteristics front and center, and the black fruits have a thinness to them. The tannins are chewy, with a touch of dark chocolate.
title: Carabella 2016 Plowbuster Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Brawny, juicy and lushly layered, this wine impresses in its full-bodied concentration of strawberry jam and biscuit flavors, with soft, approachable tannins. Black tea and a twist of clove give it an understated warmth and spicy persistence.
title: Gary Farrell 2016 Hallberg Vineyard-Dijon Clones Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Lime skins, grapefruit, ash, lily, chives and dairy aromas make for a unique and dynamic entry to the nose of this bottling from a vineyard high in the mountains near Chalone. There's a grainy tightness to the palate, where Meyer lemon pith, almond oil and herbal elements battle for attention.
title: Big Basin 2016 Coastview Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey County)

description: Tar, forest floor and muddy earth aromas meet with wild berries on the nose of this blend of 52% Syrah and 48% Cabernet Sauvignon. Strong herb and mint flavors arise on the palate, giving complexity to the black-plum and cedar backdrop.
title: Pianetta 2016 Bilancio Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey)

description: The grapes for this wine come 83% from Sonoma County, the remainder mostly from Monterey, with just 2% from Mendocino. It's made in a quenching style of succulent acidity and nuanced flavors of fig, quince and Meyer lemon, the backbone nicely rich in graham cracker.
title: La Follette 2016 Los Primeros Chardonnay (Sonoma County-Monterey County)

description: Lightly spiced and earthy, with a touch of tree bark and forest floor, this wine shines in tangy raspberry and strawberry flavors, with a backbone of sage and black tea. Light bodied and balanced, it has a persistence of acidity.
title: La Follette 2016 Heintz Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A firm texture and big, earthy black-fruit flavors give this full-bodied wine plenty of presence. It tastes of blackberry, cranberry and dark chocolate while it feels tannic and grippy on the palate. Merlot and Petite Sirah are the two main components in the blend.
title: Bonterra 2016 Equinox Made with Organic Grapes Red (California)

description: This barrel-fermented (one-sixth new), single-clone, estate-grown wine has pleasant but light flavors of fresh apple. The concentration of the previous vintage is missing, but the balance is fine, with hints of buttery toast in the finish.
title: Carabella 2016 Dijon 76 Estate Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Fresh and almost effervescent on the nose with lilacs and cracked rainbow peppercorns, this bottling also offers aromas of ripe alpine strawberry. That zesty red-fruit component shines on the palate as well alongside white pepper, dried purple flower and a hint of elderflower flavors.
title: Topa Mountain Winery 2015 John Sebastiano Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Vanilla aromas are out front, followed by green wood notes, flowers and cherries, with the palate showing more of the same. The variety seems hard to find, with the wood stealing the show.
title: Gordon Estate 2015 Estate Petit Verdot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Aromas of hay, herb, licorice and citrus twist lead to dried-out-seeming fruit flavors that fall flat. The variety seems impossible to find.
title: Cathedral Ridge 2015 Syrah (Columbia Valley (OR))

description: Rustic aromas of pomegranate, sagebrush, forest floor and charred wood show on the nose of this appellation blend. Pine tree and eucalyptus aromas decorate the soft strawberry and red-plum flavors of the lightly bodied palate.
title: Kynsi 2015 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: This is an acid-driven, light-bodied wine that offers elements of black tea and forest floor. Amidst the savory tones are tasty flavors of cranberry, brambly cherry and orange zest.
title: Ron Rubin 2015 Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: Light aromas of pomegranate and cherry meet with licorice on the nose of this bottling. Cola-spice and strawberry-juice flavors make for a pleasant fruit-punch-like sipping experience.
title: Europa Village 2015 Bolero Cellars Garnacha (Temecula Valley)

description: This outstanding value showcases the fruit from a vineyard adjacent to Jadot's Resonance vineyard. It's an under-the-radar site beautifully expressed here by winemaker Peter Rosback. Densely packed with strawberry and cherry fruit, it's textural, deep and long, wrapping up in a tight citrus-framed finish. Drink now and over the next decade.
title: Sineann 2017 Yates Conwill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: The wine's aromas are arresting in notes of lemon pith, herb, stone fruit, fig, spice, mineral and citrus. Full-bodied, layered and exquisitely balanced fruit flavors follow with a zing of electric, lemony acidity stitching it all together. The fig- and tropical fruit-filled finish seems near endless. It's showing beautifully now, but should only get better with some time in the cellar. Best 2020 - 2025.
title: DeLille 2017 Chaleur Blanc White (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This blend of 50% Viognier and 50% Grenache Blanc offers edgy and sharp aromas of lime pith and lemon skin but also rounded touches of white peach and singed guava. There is a linear line of energy to the palate, which is tight and bright although a touch sour, with cooked lemon flavors.
title: Leitmotif 2017 Cuvee Amiliana White (Santa Barbara County)

description: Blended with 12% Semillon, this white is steel and floral, with a lemony core that's more balanced and elegant than fruit forward. Wet stone and jasmine accent it well.
title: Markham 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: This is a grassy, herbal and refreshing white, from vines that date back decades in some cases. Lemongrass, lime and Meyer lemon flavors dominate the palate, accentuating a tart, acid-driven proposition of ample texture.
title: Kunde 2017 Magnolia Lane Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

description: Smashed cranberry, dried herbs and meat, and a touch of rubbery funk show on the nose of this bottling, which combines fruit from Monterey, San Luis Obispo and Santa Barbara counties. Cranberry, dried cherry and flower petals decorate the palate.
title: Parker Station 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey-San Luis Obispo-Santa Barbara)

description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Weinbau and Otis vineyards. The aromas offer notes of corn on the cob, kiwi and canned pineapple. The palate falls flat.
title: Bayernmoor 2017 Chardonnay (Wahluke Slope)

description: Tones of creamy citrus and vanilla wafer dominate the palate of this layered, complex white. Additional flavors of green apple and tangerine emphasize the underlying acidity that's both juicy and crisp.
title: Whitehall Lane 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)

description: This is a fruity white that is balanced by buoyant acidity. Fermented mostly in stainless steel, it offers defined flavors of lemon, melon and lime.
title: Cannonball 2017 Eleven Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Very delicate on the nose, this appellation blend offers aromas of Asian pear, lychee and spring flowers. It's tightly wound yet expressive on the palate with honeysuckle and nectarine flavors.
title: La Honda Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Though still rare, Auxerrois seems to have found a good home in Oregon, as this young wine clearly demonstrates. Crisp apple, juicy nectarine, pink grapefruit and Meyer lemon components come together seamlessly, bound with snappy, refreshing, mineral-driven acidity.
title: Carlton Cellars 2017 Auxerrois (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: The aromas of this wine are light, with notes of herb, grass, citrus and lemon balm. The palate is more giving, with sleek but textured lemony flavors.
title: Woodward Canyon 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Fermented in 75% stainless and 25% neutral oak, this clean, simple wine mixes flavors of apple and pear. There are light hints of vanilla and water cracker. It's a pleasant wine at a modest price.
title: David Hill 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a structured and remarkable wine, bursting in tension and complexity. High toned, it dances lightly on the palate in bolts of tangerine, Meyer lemon and green apple, with a jasmine note providing a pleasing complement.
designation: Year of the Monkey Single Vineyard
title: Donum 2016 Year of the Monkey Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This vintage of Jessica is a rock star of a wine, a full display of winemaking craftsmanship at its best. Black-cherry, black-tea, tobacco and coffee flavors are seamlessly combined in a rich supple utterly captivating wine that will be hard to leave in your cellar for very long. It's 100% Wadenswil clone, and was 50% whole-cluster fermented.
title: Broadley 2016 Jessica Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Candied Bing cherry, lavender, rose petal and tea leaf are extremely approachable and delicious smelling on the nose of this bottling. There is firm tension to the palate, where dark berry and plum flavors are lifted by juniper, allspice and a pinch of lavender.
title: Talley 2016 Stone Corral Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Full throttle fruit, wide open with big flavors of black cherry, this red easily carries the barrel highlights (41% new French oak) and herbal components from 40% whole-cluster fermentation. Streaks of coffee, dark chocolate and wet bark roll through polished tannins. This seems bound to improve over the next decade and longer.
title: Archery Summit 2016 Arcus Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: A lot of Oregon vintners are eager to get on Shea's customer list, and this bottle is as good an example as any why that's the case. A striking mix of cranberry, strawberry, raspberry and marionberry flavors, it also sports a firm seam of stem and earth. The tannins are smooth and polished, with the pleasantly drying mouthfeel of tea.
title: Broadley 2016 Shea Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: In this new vintage the Summit selection has quickly smoothed out thanks to a year in 50% new French oak. Cherries and chocolate, almond paste and yes, peanut butter flavors, are all in play. It's a supple sexy wine that may be opened and enjoyed immediately.
title: Archery Summit 2016 Summit Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Deep, dense and dark aromatics spotlight blackberry and black cherry. It's a smooth well-integrated wine with a thick veneer of fruit, smoke and earth. The tannins are substantial, polished to a fine lustre, and carry a streak of graphite.
title: Bethel Heights 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Intense aromas of Sauvignon Blanc dominate this bottling, including sharp lawn cuttings, lemongrass, argan oil and even cut garden hose, yet there's a slight hint of peach as well. The dynamic experience continues on the sip, which is both lush in mouthfeel yet very grassy and herbal in flavor with green pepper, basil and lime leaf.
title: Dragonette 2016 Grassini Family Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: A smooth, supple, yet muscular wine, this brings blackberry and black-cherry fruit, a vein of cola and a dusting of chocolate powder. It's already drinking quite nicely, with well-integrated fruit and barrel flavors, while a nice lemony acidity underscores the finish.
title: Lavinea 2016 Elton Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: High-toned and floral, this blend of several Eastside Road vineyards is soft and approachable. Moderately structured, it allows the delicate layers of dried herb, cola and dark cherry to shine, lifted by lemony acidity.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Eastside Road Neighbors Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Blackberry paste, licorice, lavender dust and roasted meat aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the warm reaches of southern Monterey County. Stewed black-fruit flavors meet with hints of wild thyme and white pepper on the palate, which is framed by stiff tannins.
title: Pianetta 2016 Syrah (Monterey)

description: Intense and ripe aromas of boysenberry jam, violets and dark earth show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Powerful, juicy flavors of blackberry and cracked pepper appear on the palate, which is elegantly wrapped in a clay-like minerality and bolstered by strong acid.
title: Talley 2016 Rosemary's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Stiff and a bit steely at first, this mixes briary berry-fruit flavors with balanced tannins that add a suggestion of tea leaves to the finish. As with all of Morgan Broadley's Pinots, it's well balanced, seamlessly smooth, and quite readily drinkable.
title: Broadley 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is wine well worth stockpiling, such a good deal it is for the price. Hearty creamy ripeness is balanced and complemented by bold robust stone fruit, baked apple and a lingering thread of stony mineral.
title: Olema 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)

description: Oaky and a touch reduced, this wine offers a grip of texture and rich, round concentration. Baked apple and pear flavors are seasoned in tones of vanilla and butterscotch.
title: Kunde 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)

description: The winery's reserve-level Pinot spends 18 months in 50% new French oak. The fruit leans toward black cherry, with a slightly roasted quality. The aging in new barrels adds a warm smooth mocha flavor, and the acidity closes with a touch of citrus.
title: Carabella 2016 Inchinnan Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Intense aromas of candied boysenberry, black raspberry and a brisk purple flower and rose-petal florailty show on the nose of this blend of 69% Grenache, 23% Mourvedre and 8% Syrah. The palate is redolent with tea-leaf and cherry-cola flavors that tighten focus as the chalky tannins steadily emerge.
