title: Foxen 2016 Cuvee Jeanne Marie Williamson-Dore Vineyard Red (Los Olivos District)

description: Candied boysenberry and jammy red-plum aromas show on the nose of this blend of 70% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Syrah. The palate is very drinkable and fresh with bright and snappy black raspberry flavors, a twinge of herbs and a decent tannic edge.
title: Cloak & Dagger 2016 The Assassin Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Paso Robles)

description: Young and still wrapped up tight, this clonal blend shows tart fruit flavors of marionberry and sour plum. Aging in one-third new French oak for 16 months adds a hint of coffee, and the terroir-based flavors of the region contribute a hint of iron. Drink after 2020.
title: Carabella 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Earthy, somewhat rustic aromas of dried herbs and black cherry make for nicely layered nose. The palate offers gravelly, earthy, loamy flavors that complement the roasted strawberry core.
title: Pianetta 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey)

description: All Pommard clone, this is a pleasant wine, with crunchy blackberry fruit, a whiff of mint, and tannins that finish with a taste of green tea. Overall, it's light and insubstantial, but drinking perfectly well now and over the next couple of years.
title: Winter's Hill 2016 Block 9 Pommard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This blends 84% Pinot Blanc and 16% Riesling into a waxy, viscous and floral expression of green apple, peach and jasmine. High in acidity, it offers a touch of weight within a light-bodied ripeness.
title: Eponymous 2016 Proprietary White (Carneros)

description: Very light in color in the glass, this single-vineyard expression shows light chalky aromas on the nose alongside lemon peel and candied honeysuckle. Green-apple-flesh flavors pop on the palate with bright citrus flashes.
title: CrЕ« 2016 Paraiso Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Red-cherry and baking-spice aromas make for a likable and easy nose on this bottling. The palate offers richer but tart Montmorency cherry flavors along with hints of thyme and dried garden herbs.
title: CrЕ« 2016 Vineyard Montage Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Despite the home printer label and punny name, this is a decent effort with substantial, honest, true-to-variety flavors. It's tight and spicy, with cranberry fruit and tannins that leave an impression of pekoe tea. There's no sign of the "amendments" some wineries use to beef up cheap Pinot Noir - just clean, straightforward juice.
title: Drum Roll 2016 Pinot Renoir Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: A jasmine aroma lifts from the glass as white peach lingers in the background. Sourced from the well-known Bacigalupi Vineyard, the palate is well textured and sizzling in lemon zest acidity.
title: Gary Farrell 2016 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Earthy notions of tree bark and forest floor mark this lovely wine, a light bright expression of the variety that's focused and tense in acidity. Baked orange and plum flavors add to the mix, contributing to the spicy, lengthy palate of flavor and understated intensity.
title: La Follette 2016 Sangiacomo Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a beautifully made wine, crispy in mineral elements and lovely layers of fig, Meyer lemon, tangerine and pear. Medium bodied, it holds its fruit and acidity well, with gritty layers of texture from start to finish.
title: Peter Paul Wines 2016 Live Free or Die Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a robustly structured, energetic wine, robust in oak and spicy components. Leather and game give it an edginess of rough-hewn intensity, as white pepper contrasts well against flavors of strawberry and orange.
title: La Follette 2016 Hawk's Roost Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This full-bodied wine matches buttery, toasty overtones with plenty of juicy ripe pear and apple flavors. Aged on the lees for 10 months, the texture is smooth and layered, and there's a good hint of acidity to balance the wine's richness.
title: Gen5 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Rich aromas of plum and incense show on the herbaceous nose of this blend. It's taut in texture on the palate, where flavors of pine needle and dark red fruits ride a decent wave of acidity.
title: La Honda Winery 2016 Exponent Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This wine is very fruity and also well-structured, offering generous raspberry and blackberry flavors backed by moderate tannins and good acidity. It's well balanced and appetizing to taste.
title: Charles B. Mitchell 2016 Estate Primitivo (El Dorado)

description: This wine has high-toned fruit and underlying brightness, melding the two complementary sides within a context of integrated oak and thick tannin. Citrus, rhubarb and pomegranate provide a tartness of lingering fruit dipped in light Asian spice. This is the producer's first vintage.
title: Zeka 2015 Pinot Noir (Bennett Valley)

description: Select blocks of Dijon 115 and 777 are blended here, yielding a full-flavored broadly accessible wine, with a generous cherry and chocolate foundation. When first opened it's smooth and supple, though retasted on the second day it was cracking up, so it's best consumed now and over the next couple of years.
title: Cardwell Hill 2015 Dijon Blocks Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Aging quickly and drinking well, this follows the winery's usual course with up-front flavors emphasizing baking spices and strawberry pastry. There's even a suggestion of mocha coffee cake. The wine was aged a year in new French oak barrels.
title: Pfeiffer 2015 Robin's Romance Blue Dot Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Dark in the glass, and dark in flavors, this shows more charred wood and burnt coffee than fruit. It resembles a rough and tumble Zinfandel more than the named grape.
title: Schmidt 2015 Pinot Noir (Applegate Valley)

description: Mortared savory herb, cherry and spice aromas are at the fore. Broad cranberry flavors follow, with a light grassy note on the finish. It comes off as green for the variety. Drink now.
title: Gordon Estate 2015 Estate Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Brambly berries quickly fall into a roughly tannic, tongue-thrashing wine with stemmy, charred wood and coffee grounds the major flavors.
title: Schmidt 2015 Syrah (Applegate Valley)

description: The Claret designation indicates a Bordeaux-style blend. Here (as with the previous vintage), the mix is 60% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% each Cab Franc and Malbec. There's a hint of burnt rubber that turns the finish astringent and bitter. Aggressive aeration may mute that a bit.
title: Del Rio 2015 Claret (Rogue Valley)

description: The nose is tightly wound yet showing hints of roasted plum, root beer and sandalwood on this blend of 50% Mourvedre, 33% Grenache and 17% Syrah. There sip is wrapped in tannic tension and offers flavors of pine wood, nutmeg and black plum.
title: Jaffurs 2015 High Tide Red (Santa Barbara County)

description: Leathery, sinewy tobacco adorns firm tannin in this structured, layered and integrated wine, made from a tiny acre block of the producer's hillside property. Elegant in style, it's lovely and light, a perfect companion for the table.
title: Calluna 2015 The Colonel's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Chalk Hill)

description: Tightly woven aromas of cranberry, soft leather and gravelly minerality show on the nose of this bottling from the vineyard that surrounds this winery. There's good grip to the palate, where flavors of turned soil, sagebrush and tart cherry make for an intriguingly rustic sip.
title: Kynsi 2015 Stone Corral Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Juicy in style, this blend of 45% Petit Verdot, 25% Merlot, 23% Malbec and 7% Cabernet Franc offers aromas of fresh-pressed blackberry and a hint of caramel. Charred oak, red-cherry and cranberry flavors arise on the palate alongside dried sage.
title: Bishop's Peak 2015 Elevation Red (Paso Robles)

description: Very shy aromas of black raspberry show on the nose of this bottling. Tart black-plum and elderberry flavors meet with dried herbs on the palate, but the overall expression is very mellow and reserved.
title: Wolff 2015 Syrah (Edna Valley)

description: Candied cherries, hibiscus, sumac and light clove aromas show on the nose of this bottling from Southern California. Dried strawberry flavors meet with mint and garden herbs on the aromatic palate.
title: Europa Village 2014 Vienza Private Reserve Sangiovese (Temecula)

description: Extracted aromas of blackberries are both tangy and ripe on the nose of this bottling. There is a balsamic edge to the palate, where tart red fruits dominate.
title: Rockin' R Winery 2013 Brown Eyed Girl Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

description: Light in the glass, this clonal expression from a fantastic vineyard offers aromas of sour cherry and dried thyme on the nose. It's light and acid-driven on the palate, where mouthwatering flavors of sage and strawberry lead into a tense finish.
title: CrЕ« 2017 Clone 113 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This light-hued bottling offers candied strawberry, fresh berry, wild thyme and sage on the nose. There's a slightly green, almost cannabis element to the palate, which gives intriguing depth to the bright red fruit.
title: CrЕ« 2017 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This is a successful, small-production white that's bright, textured and memorable in swathes of well-heeled grapefruit and Meyer lemon. A grassy undertone of pea shoots plays well against the crisp fruit.
title: Concannon 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)

description: This medium-bodied wine is subtle on the nose, but opens up on the palate to rich fruit and spice flavors that coat the tongue. It is balanced toward the soft side, but with underling acidity to balance the richness.
title: Matchbook 2017 Estate Bottled Old Head Chardonnay (Dunnigan Hills)

description: Ripe apple, nectarine and lime-peel aromas make for a very accessible nose on this bottling. There is compelling tension to the palate, where bright citrusy and yellow-apple flavors get a white pepper lift and ride on fresh acidity. It's a great white wine for many occasions.
title: J. Wilkes 2017 Pinot Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)

description: An earthy aroma blows off and this medium-bodied wine reveals appealing fresh apple and light spice flavors, buttery accents and good balance.
title: Toad Hollow 2017 Francine's Selection Unoaked Chardonnay (Mendocino)

description: Ripe strawberry, red-plum skins, carnation and turned earth make for an engaging nose on this bottling. The palate is taut but also a tad sour, with dried berry and more plum-skin flavors. It is still quite young, so the tartness may broaden and mellow with time.
title: J. Wilkes 2017 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Some white Pinot Noirs have rich fruit flavors that hint at cherry, but here the color and overall lightness seem closer to a Pinot Noir rose. The peach and cherry fruit is delicate, and gets no boost from aging in stainless steel.
title: Amity 2017 White Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Ripe cranberry sorbet, orange peel and a pinch of tarragon show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a bit tangy with strawberry-balsamic flavors and a pinch of herbs.
title: Olelo 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Sharp acidity girds a steely, austere expression of the variety, stony in lemon peel, grapefruit and jasmine.
title: Houdini 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Underripe berries, red-plum skins and wood spice show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tart and framed by squeaky tannins.
title: Olelo 2017 Merlot (Paso Robles)

description: Rounded cherry aromas are lifted by light licorice spice and sweet herbs on the nose of this clonal study. The lightweight mouthfeel is tense with pinpoint tannins, offering flavors of black raspberry, orange rind and spicy fruit punch.
title: Bargetto 2017 Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is such a lovely white wine, priced attractively, which delivers a heady entry of honey and caramelized oak. Juicy acidity lifts bold flavors of lemon meringue, green apple and tangerine, finishing with a balanced weight and intrigue of nutmeg.
title: RouteStock 2017 Route 121 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Young winemaker Gretchen Voelcker got her hands on some rare fruit for this bottling, which shows edgy aromas of crushed rock, flint, smoked apple and citrus peel on the nose. There is an immensely chalky tension to the palate, where yellow-apple and grapefruit-rind flavors wrestle for attention.
title: Luna Hart 2017 Fiddlestix Vineyard Gruner Veltliner (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Intense boysenberry aromas meet with slate, soil and a hint of char on the nose of this expression of the historic clone. It's still very young and shy on the palate, yet the elegant black-raspberry and dried herb flavors emerge with patience and air.
title: Bargetto 2017 Mount Eden Clone Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: There's a strong kick of hickory to the nose of this bottling by a winery founded in 1933, with subtle black-cherry fruit slow to emerge. The palate offers a tight structure that evolves with time, proving light in body and tense with mellow rosewater flavors.
title: Bargetto 2017 Regan Vineyards Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Floral in musque-like aromatics, this is a well-integrated and fruity white, crisply showing its stainless-steel fermentation. Apple, lime and peach play well with each other to offer bold, memorable flavors.
title: Girard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Aromas of candied lemon rind, lime leaf, Granny Smith apple and crushed granite show on the nose of this bottling by the Gallo family. The palate is smooth in feel, with flavors of apple skin, grapefruit and squeezed lime.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2017 Winemaker Series Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)

description: Robust on the palate, this wine opens in floral aromatics of jasmine and apple blossom. It follows flavorfully in Meyer lemon zest, tangerine and pineapple, combining firm structure with rounded approachability.
title: Folie a  Deux 2017 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: High toned and perfumed, this wine has ample texture and structure. Rose, lavender and blood orange effuse from the glass, before powerful waves of strawberry compote and rhubarb shoot through hoops of savory minerality.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Allen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is the second vintage for this new label under the Willamette Valley Vineyards umbrella, and last year's single Pinot Noir is now split into a pair. The Florine is a 2000 planting at the highest elevation, and shows impressive depth and detail. Brambly blackberry fruit is highlighted with peppery spice, and the wine's finish brings still darker streaks of chocolate and coffee grounds. Good already, this should continue to improve over the next half decade.
title: Elton 2016 Florine Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Wild sagebrush herbs and forest wood meet with juicy cranberries and pencil shavings on the nose of this blend of 44% Cabernet Franc, 43% Merlot and 13% Petit Verdot. It's both juicy and tart with berry flavors on the well-structured palate, but the compelling complexity comes from dill, marjoram, licorice and tarragon spices.
title: Cloak & Dagger 2016 Deep State Red (Paso Robles)

description: This tight tannic multi-clone blend is currently in a compact youthful phase. Tart cranberry and raspberry fruit expresses the young vineyard perfectly, buoyed with ample acidity. The tannins are polished and compact. Drink this after 2020.
title: Sylvanus 2016 Sylvanus Estate The Cipher Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: A ripe supple wine, more approachable at this time than its excellent companion "The Cipher". Plum and cherry fruit carries a slightly salty note. Aging in one-quarter new French oak adds a whiff of chocolate and the finishing acidity brings a lick of citrus.
title: Sylvanus 2016 Sylvanus Estate Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: Intriguing things happen on dry-farmed, old vine vineyards, and this bottling shows a wide-ranging nose of aromas, from boysenberry and sour violets to smoke, roasted game and singed rosemary. The palate offers sour berry and cedar flavors, proving rather tight at this stage of life.
designation: Tinaquaic Vineyard Old Vines Dry Farmed
title: Foxen 2016 Tinaquaic Vineyard Old Vines Dry Farmed Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This appellation blend of Rita's Crown and Huber vineyards offers the classic California Chardonnay experience but with expert balance. Aromas of white peach, blanched almonds and crisp lime peel lead into a oak-kissed palate, where Gravenstein apple and yellow-pear richness are deftly cut by lemon wedge sizzle and a chalky taut frame.
title: Ken Brown 2016 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This ripe blend of 72% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Sangiovese and 3% Petite Sirah starts with rich black cherry, sweet cedar and candied raspberry on the nose. There are grippy tannins on the sip and decent acidity, delivering flavors of exotic red cherry and mace.
title: Pianetta 2016 Tuscan Nights Red (Central Coast)

description: Not quite as ripe nor as smooth as the 2015, this mixes tangy raspberries with sharp acidity. There's a hint of green to the tannins, and a backdrop of underbrush against the clean well-defined fruit.
title: Alchemist 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This ripe and expressive wine exudes an earthy, black-fig aroma, then rich and concentrated black-cherry and dried date flavors are accented by spicy, wet earth and oak notes and a mouthfeel shaped by velvety tannins.
title: Vigilance 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)

description: Nicely detailed, this is a pleasing mix of citrus, berry and barrel flavors, that gently spread across the midpalate. It lacks the hoped-for concentration as it fades into a lightly herbal finish.
title: Chehalem 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: This is an amazing price point for a wine of quality and great vineyard sourcing. Steely high-toned acidity girds a midpalate that's low in oak and subdued in crisp apple fruit, with just a touch of tannin on the finish.
title: Amici 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Raspberry, struck match, whole green pepper and spice aromas are paired with lighter-styled fruit flavors. It seems washed out and green.
title: SR 262 2016 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Cedar box and mesquite aromas are at the fore, with the cherry notes seeming subdued and dried out. Ripe, jammy, sweet fruit flavors follow. It doesn't all work.
title: Cosentino 2016 Cigar Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Quite dried out-seeming aromas of raspberry, vanilla and cherry are followed by ripe fruit flavors that also seem desiccated. The concentration comes off as quite light.
title: Mercer 2016 Edge of Heaven Blend Red (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: The aromas are quite green, with notes of green pepper, dried tobacco and fresh green herb along with orange peel. Light, tangy fruit flavors follow, with plentiful orange peel notes throughout.
title: Mercer 2016 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This affordable red is soft and round, offering full flavors of dark chocolate, vanilla and plum. The backbone is built on a foundation of fresh acidity and dried herb.
title: Decoy 2016 Merlot (Sonoma County)

description: Tannic from start to finish, the wine pushes flavors of beetroot, earth, stem and herb front and center. The slightly bitter tannins dominate and keep the fruit flavors well in the background.
title: Rain Dance 2016 Nicholas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Concentrated black cherry and dark-hued rose petals meet with French toast and bacon aromas on the inviting and rich nose of this bottling by the Duckhorn family of wines. The palate is approachable with mulberry and alpine-strawberry flavors, dusted with pepper and strong violet character.
title: Migration 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: The fruit in this ripe, rich wine is farmed by the Casteel family (Bethel Heights). The lemon, peach and apricot flavors bounce with youthful vitality, and the overall balance is spot on. The tea-flavored tannins are lightly dusty, and the overall texture and persistence are first class.
title: Brooks 2016 Hope Well Vineyard Riesling (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: From a vineyard in the heart of the Sta. Rita Hills, this bottling shows vanilla and star anise on the nose along with black plum fruit. The palate is very cohesive and well integrated, offering alpine strawberry, boysenberry and rounded lilac flavors.
title: Migration 2016 Drum Canyon Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Sizzling acidity greets the palate immediately in this medium-bodied white that makes a good first impression and supports it with well-defined flavors of lemon, lime and green apple. The finish teases further in white peach.
title: Ektimo Vineyards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: Walnut and toasted oak aromas meet with poached and roasted apples on the nose. Flavors of sliced yellow pear and honeysuckle sit atop a rocky mineral note on the palate.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2016 Winemaker Series Heritage Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: Now designated as part of the single-vineyard series, this rich wine is packed with ripe flavors of peach, apricot and honeysuckle. There's a streak of vanilla cream which adds to the lush mouthfeel. This will appeal to those who love a buttery, decadent style, with enough acidity to keep it lively.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2016 Tualatin Estate Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: The nose of this bottling is very twiggy with aromas of dried herbs, dark cocoa, peppercorn and elderberry. Damp wood and sage sticks show on the palate alongside very dark and dry berry flavors.
title: La Honda Winery 2016 Salinian Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Elegant purple fruits meet with violet and lavender on the nose of this blend, which is led by Syrah, Tannat, Tempranillo and Grenache, with little bits of Viognier and Petite Sirah. Firm tannins uphold the medium-bodied palate, where tart berry and more purple-flower flavors arise.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2016 Red (Central Coast)

description: Intensely textured and concentrated in fruit, this is marked by a depth of mango and pineapple with generous oak imparting toffee and caramel. It finds its balance midpalate with supportive acidity that lasts throughout a long finish.
title: La Follette 2016 Lorenzo Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Robust tannin and oak wraparound a full expression of red cherry and vanilla in this soft, approachable blend.
title: Decoy 2016 Red (Sonoma County)

description: The aromas offer notes of baking spice, plum and blue fruit. Plump feeling but quite light. Grainy-feeling black currant and plum flavors follow. The concentration seems very light.
title: Mercer 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Among the highlights from an exceptional set of 2015 Pinots from Cardwell Hill is this barrel selection of Pommard and Dijon 777 clones. Bright flavors of raspberry and cherry are buttressed with ample acid and just a light touch of chocolate.
title: Cardwell Hill 2015 Monet Blocks Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: From ungrafted vines planted in 1983, this light and elegant wine is a complex mix of citrus rind and tangy raspberry fruit, and is still a bit tightly wound. The sharpness of the primary fruit flavors suggests that further aging is not only possible, but advised. Drink from 2020.
title: Cardwell Hill 2015 Old Vines Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This densely packed, superripe wine is a winner for folks who love an all-out fruit and oak combination. From aromas like cloves, black cherries and lilac it goes to jammy rich berry flavors and a plush mouth-filling texture, followed by a lingering, baking-spice finish.
title: Goldeneye 2015 Confluence Vineyard Hillside Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: The Pommard clone is often a winemaker favorite for its open and broadly fruity appeal. Here the core flavors of black cherry and cola are further amplified with barrel-introduced highlights of baking spices, gingerbread, coffee and cocoa.
title: Cardwell Hill 2015 Pommard Block Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Tangy black-plum aromas meet with savory meats, lilac and burnt brown sugar on the nose of this reserve bottling. It's soft and chalky on the full and ripe palate with a thick layer of blackberry foam as well as a hint of lighter flowers toward the finish.
title: Topa Mountain Winery 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Reserve Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Aromatic and quite pretty, this four clone blend spent 21 months in French oak barrels. It's restrained for a reserve (and less expensive than most) but does not skimp on flavor. Citrus highlights frame strawberry and blueberry fruit, with just a hint of barrel.
title: Cardwell Hill 2015 Estate Bottled Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Deep fruity aromas of blackberry and black-plum jam meet with wood spice, roasted meat and sarsaparilla on the nose of this single-vineyard expression, which is still young and may grow more interesting with patience. The tannins rise up right away on the palate, offered roasted wood and berry flavors with a coffee, tea and tobacco finish.
title: Clos LaChance 2015 Whitestone Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

description: Here is a well-made estate-grown Willamette Valley Pinot Noir at a price usually reserved for wines with the all-encompassing "Oregon" appellation. Clean raspberry and black-cherry fruit is in place, along with seams of cola and root beer. This is a great choice for everyday enjoyment.
title: Cardwell Hill 2015 Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Well structured and filled with straightforward fruit flavors, this full-bodied wine is nicely dry, concentrated and appealing without overt oak influence. Ripe cherry and blackberry notes fill the aroma while equally vivid fruit flavors coat the palate.
title: Gen5 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

description: Candied boysenberry, white pepper and thyme-crusted roast aromas show on the nose of this bottling from a seminal vineyard in the Los Alamos area. Tightly woven on the palate, the wine is very expressive and floral, with flavors of violet, elderflower and black-plum skins.
title: Jaffurs 2015 Thompson Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Roasted game, turned earth and sagebrush aromas meet with rustic cherry on the nose of this bottling. There's an amazing array of flavors on the palate, from blistered tomato and pinched thyme to marjoram, tangy red plum skins and peppery spices.
title: Kynsi 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Intense and tarry in style, this bottling starts with deep aromas of boysenberry. There is a compelling density and intensity to the sip, where dark berries meet with damp tarragon flavors.
title: Figge 2015 Foster's Vineyard Sangiovese (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Inviting aromas of Bing cherries, star anise, mace, tobacco and wood spice show on the nose of this blend. There's a strong herbal kick on the earthy palate, where turned loam and red-cherry flavors arise.
title: Sola 2015 Meritage (Paso Robles)

description: This is a value-driven blend that delivers plenty of quality flavor for the price, including an explosion of juicy dark cherry, cassis and rich round nicely integrated oak and tannin. It's enjoyable now and sure to please a crowd.
title: Decoy 2015 Red (Sonoma County)

description: Crushed slate, oregano and blackberry-syrup aromas show on the nose of this blend. Ripe cherries and strawberries provide an approachable, nearly sweet core to the palate, which benefits from a pinch of herbs.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2015 Winemaker Series Meritage (Paso Robles)

description: This bottling, aged in 100% American oak, offers earthy aromas of forest floor, concentrated cassis and a balsamic berry sauce on the nose. Chunky sticky tannins deliver flavors of dark chocolate and dried berries, which turn tangy toward the finish.
title: Fernwood 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Blackberry, black cherry, vanilla and baking spice converge for a very hedonistic and delicious aromatic entry to this bottling from an old vineyard near Gilroy. Roasted red-fruit flavors show on the sip along with star anise and cherry-wood smoke.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2014 Besson Vineyard Syrah (Santa Clara Valley)

description: This dessert wine is quite sweet, with candied flavors of peach, apricot and papaya. It shows a decent balance between concentrated fruit tones and bright acidity.
title: Apolloni 2014 Dolce Vino Viognier (Oregon)

description: Guava and bubblegum aromas are very clean and cut by a steely edge on the nose. The palate tightens up considerably, offering tense lemon skin and chalky tones against rounded white-peach and guava flavors.
title: CrЕ« 2017 French Camp Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

description: This is a unique blend of principally 32% Syrah, 20% Grenache, 16% Cinsault and 11% Counoise, along with pinches of Petite Sirah and Alicante Bouschet. Primary huckleberry, raspberry gummy, black pepper and herb aromas are followed by elegant, graceful fruit flavors. The concentration seems light at times, but what is there delights, with a lovely sense of balance. Give it some additional time in the bottle to see it at its best.
title: Cairdeas 2017 Diffraction Red (Washington)

description: Ripe and ready aromas of black cherry, wood spice and clove are intense on this blend of 40% Malbec, 35% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Cabernet Franc. The palate is rounded with ripe dark-fruit and baking-spice flavors, framed by mouth-coating soft tannins.
title: Martellotto 2017 Rosso di Sera Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: Coffee grinds, wet soils and dark fruits show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is slightly sour with berry and forest-floor moss flavors.
title: Martellotto 2017 My Way Malbec (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: Tightly wound and bursting with botanical highlights, there is a ginlike flavor to this pure varietal expression. Power and precision abound, and the long, phenolic finish, bone dry and detailed, defines this as a wine worth exploring and experimenting with as far as companion foods.
title: Brooks 2017 Deux Vert Vineyard Viognier (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: Doug Margerum is capturing the freshness of Rhone varieties like few others in California, as evidenced in this twist-top blend of 44% Grenache, 37% Syrah, 11% Mourvedre, 4% Counoise and 4% Cinsaut. Aromas of zesty rosewater, raspberry and a hint of smoke lead into a palate that's zippy with joyous flavors of red fruit, sumac and white pepper.
title: Margerum 2017 M5 Red (Santa Barbara County)

description: A watermelon aroma meets a sharp lime edge on the nose of this zesty wine. It's tightly woven on the palate, where a chalky mouthfeel and citrus-driven flavors make a good pairing.
title: Villa San Juliette 2017 Small Lot Selection Reserve Rose (Paso Robles)

description: This wine offers a deft mix of rose petal, baby powder and lychee aromas. There's plenty of spice, and, as it's bone dry, it matches well with peppery noodle dishes.
title: Foris 2017 Dry Gewurztraminer (Rogue Valley)

description: This attractive medium- to full-bodied wine lays out tasty pear and vanilla aromas and adds a touch of butter wrapped in a soft low-acidity texture. It was aged in neutral barrels on the lees for nine months so it goes easy on the oakiness.
title: Maset 2017 Estate Chardonnay (Eagle Peak)

description: Sourced from from Quintessence Vineyard, this wine offers aromas of toast, fig, lemon balm and herb. These tones echo on the full-bodied palate but dip a little in concentration.
title: Henry Earl 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Red Mountain)

description: As with all of the Foris white wines, refreshing minerality and an overall sense of immaculate fruit preservation are foremost. The supporting minerality emphasizes focused flavors of cucumber and jicama through a refreshing finish.
title: Foris 2017 Pinot Gris (Southern Oregon)

description: Clean honeydew, lime balm and peach-orange aromas meet with vanilla and white-rock aromas on the nose of this bottling. There is a flash of sweetness to the palate, where ripe apple and pear flavors combine with lemon syrup.
title: Ferguson Crest 2017 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)

description: Fresh, crisp flavors tilt toward green produce - daikon radish, celery and yellow apple. There's a dash of white pepper and a finishing hint of brioche.
title: Foris 2017 Pinot Blanc (Rogue Valley)

description: Once again this cuvee opens with lush aromatics of ripe raspberries and sandalwood incense. There are hints of fresh herbs also, and the flavors, still young and tight, show good balance and detail. Put this away another couple of years and drink throughout the 2020s.
title: Archery Summit 2016 Red Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Delicate at first on the nose, this bottling from a vineyard that's northwest of the Sta. Rita Hills offers honeysuckle, light pineapple, candied orange rind and a hint of pecan on the nose. The palate is rounded with yellow-melon, orange-cream and walnut flavors, proving unique and complex.
title: Dragonette 2016 Duvarita Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)

description: This wine is a blend of 37% Grenache, 28% Mourvedre, 16% Syrah, 11% Counoise and 10% Cinsault, coming from one of the state's top Rhone variety sites. High-toned, thoroughly enchanting aromas of raspberry gummy, huckleberry, fresh ground black pepper, smoked meat and rose hips are followed by initially elegantly styled fruit flavors that bring a sense of freshness, broadening over time. Smoked meat and white pepper notes linger on the long finish. It brings all of the freshness and elegance of the vintage. Give it time to open up and it delivers, with a long life in front of it.
title: Cairdeas 2016 Caislen an Papa Boushey Vineyard Red (Yakima Valley)

description: This is only the third time an O'Brien reserve has been produced in the past decade (2008, 2012 and now 2016). It's all Pommard fruit, given time in 40% new French oak. Concentrated puree of raspberry, ripe black cherry and sweet baking spices compound. The finish brings toasted coconut, cola and mocha-cream highlights. Drink this now and through the early 2020s.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2016 O'Brien Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Charred meat, smoked boysenberries, crushed gravel and charcoal make for a savory nose on this bottling by Greg Martellotto, whose Italian family has made wine for generations. Dried herbs, tangy cranberries and roasted meats show on the palate, which offers a hefty weight and should age well.
title: Martellotto 2016 La Bomba Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: Blended with 25% Alicante Bouschet - the first use of this variety I am aware of in the state - the aromas boast notes of smoked meat, dried flower, herb, black pepper and sea salt, leaning hard into the savory. The palate is sleek and pure in style, with a lingering, smoked meat and white pepper-filled finish.
title: Cairdeas 2016 Cinsault (Yakima Valley)

description: A supple smoothly integrated wine, this bursts forth with red berries, blue plums and a hint of maraschino cherries. Some time in barrel brings up light notes of milk chocolate. It's quite tasty and ready for immediate enjoyment.
title: R. Stuart & Co. 2016 Daffodil Hill Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This old-vine Pommard clone wine, from a site previously known as the Ana vineyard, brings ripe cherry and zesty raspberry fruit, with a finishing lick of green tomato. It's juicy, clean and fresh, and the influence of 30% new French oak remains subdued.
title: Winderlea 2016 Weber Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: A ripe juicy wine, this brings a lively mix of citrus fruits lightly accented with French oak (nine months, 25% new). It's a good effort, but not as deeply flavored as the previous vintage.
title: Winderlea 2016 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Frenchman Hills, Moxee and Roza Hills vineyards. Aged in 32% new French oak puncheons. Lemon balm, wet rock, candlewax and spice aromas lead to sleek but textured nectarine flavors that pique the interest. A lingering finish caps it off.
title: Sixto 2016 Uncovered Chardonnay (Washington)

description: This wine is just under three quarters Syrah, with the balance Mourvedre and Grenache. Cherry candy, black pepper and spice aromas lead to soft, supple fruit and peppery flavors. It doesn't quite have the intensity to stand up on its own but should shine at the dinner table. Pair it with lamb chops with a cherry glaze.
title: Cairdeas 2016 Tri Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Tannat can be aggressively tannic, but here it's been softened and smoothed, delivering a tasty red wine with concentrated berry and chocolate flavors. If you're a fan of medium-weight Zinfandels, this would make a most interesting alternative.
title: Troon 2016 Tannat (Applegate Valley)

description: Dried black plums, purple flowers, toasted wood and a touch of funk show on the nose of this blend of 68% Malbec, 19% Cabernet Franc and 13% Petit Verdot. There's a strong, almost skunky herbal kick to the palate, which gives depth to the tart berry and black-plum-skin flavors.
title: Cloak & Dagger 2016 Espionage Red (Paso Robles)

description: This blend of Sangiovese, Malbec and Cabernet Franc from San Diego County is a bit light in the glass and shows aromas of candied red cherry as well as leather and Old World-like funk. The palate is a tad sour.
title: Chuparosa 2016 North Block Red (Ramona Valley)

description: Very fresh on the nose, this twist-top bottling from the East Bay shows tart black-raspberry and dried violet aromas. It's both bright and very slate-driven on the palate, where boysenberry and black-plum-skin flavors meet with white pepper and lavender. It's very expressive.
title: Bonny Doon 2016 Old Telegram Mataro (Contra Costa County)

description: Lavender aromatics accent a delicately built body that develops intensity as it opens. Asian spice, white pepper and toasted oak burnish on the palate before settling into a soft rounded finish of dark cherry.
title: Works and Days 2016 Hill Justice Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: This blend of three properties from up and down the Central Coast (64% Rancho Solo, 24% Alta Loma and 12% Shokrian vineyards) is a bit gamy at first, but the red fruit and flower aromas emerge from the reductive veil with time. The palate offers flavors of roasted pork in a red-plum sauce, with a touch of oak.
title: Bonny Doon 2016 Grenache (Monterey County)

description: Oak spiciness lights up the bouquet and flavors of this full-bodied firmly tannic wine. It's not as heavy in alcohol as some, but is very rich in flavors of black plums and blackberries, black pepper and light oak char, and has a good, grippy texture.
title: Criss Cross 2016 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)

description: Dark red-cherry, boysenberry and rosebud aromas make for a deep and expressive style of Grenache on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong herbal touch to the palate, where thyme, sagebrush and cinnamon meet with snappy black-raspberry flavors.
title: Figge 2016 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Brawny broad shouldered notions of earthy strawberry, rose petal and Asian baking spice define this medium-bodied wine from an estate-farmed block. It has plenty of tannic power.
title: Dutton Estate 2016 Jewell Block Vineyard Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A barrel-fermented white, this features an unexpectedly steely entry of bright integrated acidity that keeps it fresh and focused. It evolves to offer layers of texture and bold clear flavors of green apple and Meyer lemon.
title: Alpha Omega 2015 Drew Vineyard Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

description: The sole Domaine Serene vineyard outside of the Dundee Hills, this sits in a most trendy location, surrounded by rising star wineries. Smooth, supple and delicious immediately upon opening, it's a showcase mix of blue fruits, satiny chocolate, oolong tea and a tantalizing whiff of smoke.
title: Domaine Serene 2015 Jerusalem Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Black currant, charred berries and a hint of diesel show on the nose of this dark and intense bottling from Ballard Canyon. The dark-fruit flavors continue on the sip, but are lifted by rosemary, bay leaf and chalky tannins.
title: Jaffurs 2015 Larner Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Earthy in ash, dusty rock and forest, this coastal wine is succulent and tightly wound. It offers density on the palate, with succulent flavors  of strawberry and rhubarb laced with cola.
title: Works and Days 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This full-bodied and thick-textured wine wraps spicy smoky beefy flavors around a good core of blackberries and black cherries. The spicy oak character dominates but it's attractive and adds to the wine's boldness.
title: Odisea 2015 Lewis Vineyard The Temp Tempranillo (Clements Hills)

description: This single-block expression is extremely earthy on the nose with aromas of loamy soil, wet gravel, sumac, cinnamon and wild berries. It's light in the glass, with rounded flavors of raspberry, cherry and underripe strawberry as well as a clay-like minerality. A chalky mouthfeel leads into a clean and taut finish.
title: Sanford 2014 Founders' Vines Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Cassis and caramelized strawberry aromas show on the fairly extracted nose of this bottling of a red-pulped grape that's rarely seen at all in California, much less all by itself. The palate is flush with soft red fruit and sprinkled with chai spice.
title: Villa San Juliette 2014 Alicante Bouschet (Paso Robles)

description: This is a quirky wine that's drinkable but past its prime already. It has stewed fruit flavors, pronounced oak accents and a baked, aged taste on the finish.
title: Brotherhood 2014 Honker Pinot Noir (California)

description: A rugged blend of 50% Zinfandel, 35% Tempranillo and 15% Petite Sirah, this bottling by the Greenough family shows concentrated aromas of black plum and black currant alongside tobacco and leather on the nose. It's thick and ripe on the palate, but balanced enough, offering powerful black-fruit flavors wit pinches of sage and incense.
title: Saucelito Canyon 2015 Muchacho Red (San Luis Obispo County)

description: This is a barrel-fermented white that impresses from start to finish, with 4% Semillon added to the mix. A sublime white-peach flavor is layered and well-integrated within a stony texture. Offering length and breadth, this is defined by an exotic spice note that lingers.
title: Aperture 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Bennett Valley)

description: Cranberry, Bing cherry and sagebrush aromas make for a delicate nose in this small-lot bottling. There is a compelling crispness to the palate, where pomegranate and rose petal flavors align.
title: CrЕ« 2017 Wine Club Reserve Sarmento Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This blends a majority of Viognier with 27% Chardonnay and 5% each of Roussanne and Marsanne. Inviting floral aromas of apple blossom are followed by textured tangy flavors of grapefruit, green apple and apricot in an integrated, complex package of vibrant elegance.
title: Paraduxx 2017 Proprietary White (Napa Valley)

description: This is a concentrated and layered concrete-fermented white. Apple, pear and mango figure into the flavor profile, with a dusting of nutmeg and clove tones.
title: Jax 2017 Y3 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Blending 85% Sauvignon Blanc with 15% Semillon, this white offers a robust body weight and grip joined by length and breadth. Fig, lemon peel and quince provide fleshy fruit flavors complemented by wet stone and lingering texture.
title: Blackbird Vineyards 2017 Dissonance Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Napa Valley)

description: A perennially popular and well-made wine, this vintage is no exception, shining in concentrated, layers of rich, bold flavor. A sweetness of peach and vanilla complement a more exotic element of rose petal and black licorice.
title: Merry Edwards 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: Broad peach and ripe melon aromas lead into pear flesh, banana chip and brioche on the dynamic nose of this bottling. There is a toasty flavor to the sip, with apple butter on pastry tones riding a chalky tension. It is a very lively wine though quite ripe.
title: CrЕ« 2017 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Fresh aromas of yellow pear, sharp lime and a hint of crushed white rocks show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with lime flavors reminiscent of a margarita, along with toasted oak.
title: Olelo 2017 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Orange with a slightly bricked color. Melon and herb aromas are out front. The palate is broad, with fat feeling fruit flavors that need more acidity to stand them up. It comes off as quite warm.
title: Noviello 2017 Rose of Syrah (Lake Chelan)

description: This top-tier Sauvignon Blanc is crisp, clear, clean and tangy, with just enough grass and gooseberry characters that are balanced by grapefruit. This should drink well over the next five years, into the mid-2020s.
title: Andrew Rich 2017 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)

description: Very lively aromas of lemongrass, kaffir lime, rainy cement and a hint of greenish orange show on the nose of this block-designated bottling. The texture is very crunchy and grippy with lime skins, springtime herbs and a touch of passion fruit. It is fresh yet complex.
title: Grassini 2017 Block 14 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: This wine is equal parts fruit from Celilo and the winery's Estate vineyard. Seeing a kiss of 20% new oak from Burgundy barrels, the aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of spice, lemon curd, pear, mineral and apple. Sleek, seamless flavors backed by bright, lemony acidity follow. The finish sails into the distance. The balance is exquisite. This one is all about delicacy and restraint but it brings both in abundance. Best from 2020 - 2025.
title: Woodward Canyon 2017 Chardonnay (Washington)

description: Made in small amounts, this white worth seeking. It's crunchy in green apple and quince, with a complementary cradling of caramel oak. The rich body weight is buoyed by bright acidity.
title: Chenoweth 2017 Bootlegger's Hill Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: Light aromas of honeydew and honey show on the restrained nose of this bottling. The palate is all about a tight texture, with springtime flavors of white flowers and lime pith showing through.
title: Castoro Cellars 2017 Dos Vinas Vineyard Reserve Viognier (Paso Robles)

description: Bright, crunchy red fruit effuses ripeness in this lushly layered wine. Black tea, forest and cedar pierce through, making for a complementary experience that intrigues with complexity.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Foss Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This white has an expert level of intensity and concentration, and plenty of length within its balanced frame. Flavors of lemon meringue, brioche and apricot are complemented by wet stone.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2016 Dutton Ranch Walker Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: Exceptional fruit from an exceptional vineyard sparks this broadly delicious Pinot Noir. Berries, citrus and lemon-tea flavors combine, with light but impactful skin and stem highlights from 50% whole cluster fermentation. The wine spent 11 months in 15% new French oak, and was bottled unfined and unfiltered.
title: Failla 2016 Seven Springs Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Intriguing scents of slightly dusty, brambly berries, along with a delicate hint of leather, lead into a burst of cherry fruit holding down the flavor core. The fruit from the Pommard clone expresses, in a restrained fashion, the AVA's typical earthy component. Sappy acids support the lingering, detailed finish. Drink 2022 to 2033.
title: Failla 2016 Eola Springs Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: The slow rise of Gamay Noir on the Central Coast shows immense promise for lovers of mineral inflected, lighter styles of wine. This bottling offers wet slate and gravel on the nose along with sagebrush and light berries. The palate's tart cranberry fruit takes a backseat to wet rocks, tobacco leaf and mossy forest floor.
title: Martian Ranch 2016 Absolute Magnitude Gamay Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Crystallized boysenberry and lilac aromas are boosted by black peppercorn on the clean nose. There is chalky grip and bright acidity on the full-bodied palate, where jasmine and violet flavors lead into a candied grape tone.
title: Foxen 2016 Williamson-Dore Vineyard Syrah (Los Olivos District)

description: Yummy (O.K., not a technical term) is the first word that comes to mind upon tasting this inviting wine. Tangy berry fruit enlivened with sappy acidity drives it on through a generous midpalate. Just a dash of pepper comes up on the finish. It spent 18 months in barrel, 38% new.
title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2016 Dijon Clones Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: This vineyard selection is 100% Dijon 115 clone, 30% whole-cluster fermented. Spicy fresh flavors of berry, pomegranate and citrus peel show subtle hints of sea-shell minerality. This wine needs fairly aggressive aeration, or cellar it for another couple of years.
title: Failla 2016 Chehalem Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Previously this blend was labeled Spectrum, but in the current vintage it's the Willamette Valley AVA and with pricing that makes it easy to find among the winery's somewhat confusing labeling. It's a fine value, mixing purple fruits such as blueberry jam, with spice-box highlights, barrel toast and coffee grounds.
title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A spicy white-pepper note opens this wine. Root beer, black cherry and firm tannins combine for a beefy midpalate of freshness and power.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Coastlands Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Add Ehren Jordan to the growing number of California winemakers who have begun making Oregon wines. Apart from his proven talent with the grape, he brings consumer-friendly pricing to top-tier wines, starting with this dusty, tightly wound gem. Native yeast, 30% whole cluster, 15% new French oak and a deft hand yield a lively mix of pomegranate, raspberry and cherry fruit with a dark thread of coffee.
title: Failla 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A fine-tuned complex wine that rewards your full attention, this offers pretty fruit flavors of golden raspberries and a touch of lemon chiffon. It's smooth, elegant and lingering, with the promise of further development. Drink now through the late 2020s.
title: Alexana 2016 Fennwood Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: A lush and textured wine, this suggests strawberry compote and cherry pie in the nose, with ripe fruit flavors to follow. Threaded with sandalwood and graphite streaks, its balanced ripe tannins carry a finishing flicker of mocha.
title: Owen Roe 2016 Sojourner Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: The natural austerity of wines from this AVA is on display here, with mineral-backed bare-boned red-fruit flavors seemingly set in a stark landscape, at least at first taste. But what is gained is precision: a knife-edge cut throughline tapers into a biodynamic finish with delicate details of compost and barrel toast.
title: Winderlea 2016 Meredith Mitchell Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: This wine gets a special label but no vineyard designation in 2016. The flavors are a melange of cranberry, strawberry and cherry, but the early impression is that they remain a bit diffuse. The wine has a pleasing texture, and solid flavors, but misses the complexity of its companion 2016 Owen Roe Pinots.
title: Owen Roe 2016 Clandeboye Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: There's a compelling dairy component to the nose of this bottling, but more toward yogurt rather than butter, and then the aromas evolve into white peach and crushed nuts. A salty edge leads the palate, where lemon zest, roasted apple and oak smoke ride a racy acid-driven sip.
title: Fernwood 2016 Vanumanutagi Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Another in a series of single-vineyard offerings from Ehren Jordan, this shows earthy richness and brambly strawberry and raspberry fruit. It's pretty and complex, with the sort of elegant density that promises further development over the next decade or longer.
title: Failla 2016 Bjornson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Potent flavors of marionberry pie topped with cherry-vanilla ice cream somehow work well here. They are firmly backed with proportionate acids and tannins, and the vineyard's biodynamic grapes bring extra texture, along with hints of clean earth, tobacco and nutmeg.
title: Portlandia 2016 Momtazi Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: This appears to be the first time a reserve has been issued, and it's been given almost double the new French oak compared to the regular release. Other than that, there's perceptibly more concentration, but overall not a lot to differentiate the two bottlings.
title: Knudsen 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: A light and lovely mix of red fruits, this also shows a streak of chicken stock, dried straw and moderate acids. It spent 16 months in 20% new French oak.
title: Knudsen 2016 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Floral aromas of violet and cherry blossom drop into rich black-cherry and cocoa tones on the nose of this widely available bottling. The palate is juicy in black cherry and blackberry flavors, with accents of oak and cracked pepper, all framed by a chalky texture.
title: Ancient Peaks 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Margarita Ranch)

description: Pommard and Wadenswil are the clones, and the wine spent 17 months in 40% new French oak, trimmed down from the previous vintage. It's a rich ripe mix of berries and plums, with ample toast, chocolate and caramel woven through the full-bodied finish.
title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2016 Heritage Clones Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: Self-rooted vines planted in 1983 are the foundation of this wine, yielding an aromatic note of orange zest around core tones of brambly berries and Bing cherries. Barrel aging adds a touch of chocolate, and the tannins have tea-like astringency.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2016 Bernau Block Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The aromas enchant, with notes of fresh herb, flower, blackberry and cherry, showing a lovely sense of purity and delineation. Far from a big bruiser, the palate brings a compelling sense of elegance and restraint, with cranberry flavors and firm tannins backing it up.
title: Owen Roe 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

description: Merlot makes up just over half of this wine, with the rest 37% Cabernet Franc along with dashes of 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Malbec. Dried and fresh herb aromas are at the fore, with cherry and spice notes in the background. There's a lovely sense of elegance to the palate. This one is all about restraint, equal parts intrigue and delivery.
title: Owen Roe 2016 Red (Yakima Valley)

description: This is an intensely minty, earthy and clove-spiced wine, soft and velvety in texture. It shows a rounded body that feels ripe and rich, making this a real crowd-pleaser of a pour.
title: The Calling 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A light, bright and pretty wine, this offers delicate flavors of raspberries, backed with bright acidity. There's good push through the midpalate into a gentle finish with a hint of chicken stock.
title: Spindrift Cellars 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Cherry, baking spice and green pepper aromas lead to ripe, juicy, compact cranberry and cherry flavors. It piques the interest, though doesn't entirely come together.
title: Owen Roe 2016 Rosa Mystica Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

description: Plum, dried herb and red apple aromas are out front, with plenty of graphite and spice accents following. The flavors are juicy and fresh, with a tart cranberry finish and grainy tannins.
designation: The Pearl Block Union Gap Vineyard
title: Owen Roe 2016 The Pearl Block Union Gap Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

description: Light aromas of dried herb, cherry, pencil lead, spice, rubber and vanilla are followed by somewhat lighter-styled but still fresh, well-balanced fruit flavors. It brings a sense of sophistication and elegance.
title: Tamarack Cellars 2016 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This proprietary blend is dominant in Merlot and Cabernet Franc, its tannins burly and cradled in sizable helpings of toasted oak. Juicy red fruit is seasoned in dried herb, clove and pencil shavings.
title: Blackbird Vineyards 2016 Arise Red (Napa Valley)

description: A tannic hard-edged wine, this shows some potential for future power, perhaps as the vines continue to mature. The black-cherry fruit is accompanied by bitter stem and tannin flavors, along with notes of earth and espresso.
title: Rain Dance 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Perhaps the biggest labeling trick on government minders in awhile (get it?), this stylishly packaged bottling offers aromas of smashed strawberries, cherry Jolly Ranchers and mint chocolate chip. The palate is quite sweet with boysenberry pie flavors, and will probably excel in the broad market.
title: If You See Kay 2016 Red (Paso Robles)

description: This full-bodied wine has an aroma like new leather and balsam that leads to warm maple, brown sugar and stewed plum flavors. It's tasty and enjoyable in an offbeat way.
title: Grady Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Lodi)

description: The aromas offer notes of fresh herb, cigar box, barrel spice and dark cherry, seeming subdued out of the gate. Plentiful, somewhat lighter-styled cherry flavors follow. Grainy, slightly dry tannins provide support. It's in an awkward place right now.
title: Owen Roe 2016 Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

description: The aromas seem hyper ripe, especially for this producer and site, with notes of cassis, blackberry and spice. Ripe fruit flavors follow, with dry-seeming tannins providing support. It's an odd mix.
title: Owen Roe 2016 DuBrul Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

description: Aromas of raspberry jam and spice are followed by plump, juicy red fruit flavors. It delivers appeal.
title: Mercer 2016 Merlot (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: This white is so good, sumptuous in pear, peach and honey flavors dipped in anise. Lush and creamy, the texture is particularly memorable and beautiful. It has fully integrated the richer elements of fruit with supportive acidity and lingering twists of nutmeg and ginger.
title: Lynmar 2016 Old Vines Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Stone fruit, nutmeg and mineral notes open this lovely wine, which dazzles in high-toned acidity and a persistence of mineral and stony texture. The oak is nuanced and integrated, offering a hint of toasted nut and vanilla within a lasting cradling of baked apple and pear.
title: Lynmar 2016 Sweeney Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Briny sea salt and lemon open this wine in a bright, acid-driven way - a statement that follows through in an integrated meaty substance. A lingering flavor of just-ripe white peach adds to the complexity and delicious succulence.
title: La Follette 2016 Sun Chase Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: A round Bing cherry aroma combines with vanilla and nutmeg on the ripe, accessible nose. It's delicious on the palate, with broad red-fruit flavors, a tight structure and just enough astringency to keep it in balance.
title: Zaca Mesa 2016 Homage Collection Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This wine is raucous and raw-boned, exuding a powerful black-pepper aroma and a mouthcoating palate of beef, pepper, singed rosemary and blackberry. Owing some of its wild character to the use of 50% whole-cluster fermentation, the wine is medium to full in body, quite tannic and bone dry. It's not for the faint of heart, but the adventurous will love it.
title: Halcon 2016 Tierra Petite Sirah (Yorkville Highlands)

description: This outstanding wine compares well to cool-climate Syrahs, especially its aromas of French oak, new leather and turned earth. It has a deep, dark color, complex aromas, intense blackberry and coffee-bean flavors and a full but not overbearing body. The firm tannins provide good grip without drying. Best after 2021.
title: Boatique 2016 Petite Sirah (Red Hills)

description: Ripeness is paramount in this full-bodied, dark-fruit-forward wine crafted by Winemaker Kirk Venge. It smells and tastes soaked in late-picked grape and berry flavors, has a broad, almost thick texture and full mouthfeel. The oak influence is not obvious, but adds complexity and grip to the midpalate and finish.
title: Jax 2016 Y3 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

description: This is an intensely built, dense red that is sultry and full bodied yet totally in balance. Tangy dark cherry, pomegranate and black tea are accented by rose petal and orange zest, finishing on a lush expanse of vanilla.
title: Gary Farrell 2016 Toboni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a soft, delicate and lightly styled red from the appellation, earthy and quietly rich in caramelized oak and baked cherry. It has a nice balance of nutmeg and cola on the finish.
title: MacRostie 2016 Wildcat Mountain Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Smoky and reduced, this is a dense, tannic and boldly flavored wine, its flavors a mix of black tea, baked orange and red currant. Baking spice notes pierce the finish.
title: MacRostie 2016 Rodgers Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Black cherry, cocoa and turned loam aromas show on the nose. Bright berry and cherry flavors meet with tobacco and ancho chile dust on the palate.
title: Firestone 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: From a small vineyard in the East Bay, this bottling offers snappy black-raspberry, rose-petal and peppercorn aromas on a light but expressive nose. There is a herbal tinge on the palate, with thyme and sagebrush flavors, as well as more berry. The structure and acidity are in balance.
title: Perfusion 2016 Pinot Noir (San Francisco Bay)

description: Spicy and acid-driven, with a lushness that develops on the back of the palate, this is a highly aromatic white, floral in jasmine and honeysuckle. The fruit is crisply lemon and green apple, with a touch of white peach.
title: Cuvaison 2016 ATS Estate Grown Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: Snappy blackberry and boysenberry aromas combine with lilac, herbs and olive on a very inviting nose in this second-label bottling by the Talley family. It's a fully flavored experience on the sip, with black plum, savory charred meat and dried herbs, showing great complexity for under $25.
title: Bishop's Peak 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: A tangy plum aroma meets turned soil on the rustic and rugged nose of this appellation blend by the historic winery, now owned by Duckhorn. The turned earth component shows on the palate as well, with additional flavors of thyme, dried sage, plum and baked sour cherry.
title: Calera 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Creamy, round and lush in strong flavors of vanilla, baked apple and pear, this white is powerfully tannic and grippy as it finishes.
title: Volunteer 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Tightly wound fruit flavors strike a sharp raspberry note, with a zesty highlight of orange peel emphasizing the bright acidity. The concentration and length are admirable, suggesting that this wine will age very well over the next decade. Drink through 2030.
title: Domaine Serene 2015 Winery Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Fresh on the palate and floral on the nose in a bouquet of rose, lavender and crushed herb, this perennially beautiful, delicate wine benefits from the addition of 7% Cabernet Franc and 3% Petit Verdot, also from the organically farmed estate. Pencil shavings, coffee and a touch of tobacco add to its savory, earthy nature, contributing to its overall structure and elegance. Enjoy best from 2025 through 2030 if you're able to wait.
title: Spottswoode 2015 Family Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

description: This is a classic version of the variety, the grapes grown at the Four Brothers Vineyard (winemaker Mike Sullivan is among the brothers). Smoky tar, oak and tannin grip a softly layered, structured mingling of lavender, white pepper, strawberry and leather.
title: Benovia 2015 Grenache (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Made from 50% Malbec blended with 36% Cabernet Sauvignon and 14% Merlot, this red is broad in tannin and spicy oak, with plenty of structure and concentration. The fruit leans into bold flavors of strawberry and blueberry, the finish bright and lengthy.
title: Paraduxx 2015 Cork Tree Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)

description: Made in an earthy, austere style, this wine is intensely savory and spicy, with high-pitched acidity at its core. The fruit follows suit, a melange of cranberry, pomegranate and blood orange, finishing in a balance of black tea and pepper.
title: Saxon Brown 2015 Sangiacomo Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Smoked wood, light red currant and a stronger cassis element begins to emerge on the nose of this blend of 68% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 6% Charbono and 6% Carignane. There is a clean line of elderberry fruit with hints of white pepper and cedar on the lighter-bodied palate.
title: CrЕ« 2015 Monarch Red (Paso Robles)

description: A 100% varietal wine, this impresses mightily in its offering of blueberry-cobbler flavor and graham cracker. Dark chocolate and white pepper contrast easily within bright polished tannins and a lingering finish of leather and graphite.
title: Stags' Leap Winery 2015 Malbec (Napa Valley)

description: Floral in a heady mix of cherry blossom and lavender, this light-styled red is sanguine in red currant and cassis. Firm tannins provide support without distraction, the oak equally integrated and subtle. Robust and ripe on the midpalate, the wine has a graceful finish.
title: Ackerman 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)

description: This bottling relies heavily on dry-farmed bush vines planted in 1880, and their unique impact is on full display. Tightly wound blackberry aromas combine with tobacco leaf, loamy soil and dried meat on the nose. Elderflower and elderberry flavors show on the sip, which is firm with chalky tannins, bright with acid and elegantly layered. Drink now - 2025.
title: Saucelito Canyon 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Pure focused fruit aromas make this wine instantly appealing and it only gets better on the palate where hints of black tea and sour cherry meet a gorgeous and just-ripe black-cherry core. Vibrant acidity and light tannins give the wine a good nervy mouthfeel while the medium body contains layers of fruits and spices that continue flowing on the finish.
title: Pennyroyal Farm 2015 Jean Sheep Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: An intense mix of rosemary, lavender, asphalt and elderberry jam makes for an attention-grabbing entry into this bottling from the Los Alamos Valley. The savory palate is reminiscent of beef roasted in an herb-laced plum sauce, with cracked black pepper and grated coffee beans atop.
title: Margerum 2015 Black Oak Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Layered in crunchy apple and cinnamon, with an underlying richness of pie dough, this is a well-integrated and highly likable white. Oak does its job quietly and with purpose, as a mineral component of crushed rock provides an exotic edge to the finish.
title: The Calling 2015 Sullivan Vineyard Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made in an austere style, this has a backbone of tannin and power that builds on the midpalate, with the oak prominent and supportive. Meyer lemon and tangerine flavors are seasoned in touches of nutmeg and ginger, making for a balanced experience of fruit and spice.
designation: Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled
title: Balletto 2015 Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Golden honey and apple are met by a richness of coconut in this well-integrated, substantive wine. A balance of oak adds weight and breadth around a medium-bodied ripeness and lasting bit of ginger.
title: Theorize 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Rose petal and white pepper season the entry aromatics of this well-made wine, that's robust in weight and expansive tannin. Exotic fruit tones like rhubarb and pomegranate wrap around savory elements of black tea and forest floor.
title: Saxon Brown 2014 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Half Merlot, the other half an equal split between the Cabernet Sauvignon and Franc, this is heavily scented with vanilla and cut tobacco. The fruit is pretty and open, with flavors of tart cherry. This is the current vintage, and should be consumed now.
title: Grizzly Peak 2014 Rogue Rouge Red (Rogue Valley)

description: Macerated cherry aromas meet with dried sage and freshly dug earth on the nose of this bottling. Aromatic herbs and dried mint flavors meet with a red-fruit backbone on the intriguing palate.
title: Black Ridge 2014 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This wine has the grip and good acidity of a Sangiovese along with ample red- and black-cherry flavors that fill out the palate very well. It has a medium-dark color, light salt and pepper aromas that accent the cherries, and then a satisfying richness on the palate that is well supported by fine-grained tannins.
title: Via Romano 2014 Tuscan Style Papa Romano Red (Sierra Foothills)

description: Tart cranberry and pomegranate flavors present as juicy on the palate, the spiciness tenacious and accented in citrus. The energy and freshness is complemented well by a soft velvety texture.
title: Sedition 2014 Chenoweth Vineyards Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: This full-bodied wine features plummy raisiny aromas and fresh grapey flavors on a smooth, almost soft texture. It's easy to sip and enjoy on its own due to low tannins.
title: Vino Noceto 2014 OGP Original Grandpere Zinfandel (Amador County)

description: This full-bodied wine is heavy-handed with the oak, showing bold wood char and smoke aromas followed by smoky, black-peppery flavors that dominate the blackberry and cherry notes underneath. Firm tannins give a good tight mouthfeel.
title: Lewis Grace 2014 Estate Tempranillo (El Dorado)

description: The winery considers this a reserve, as it was aged in 45% new oak for five full years - not to good effect. It's oaky and totally dried out, with rough rustic tannins. The blend is 55% Merlot and 45% Cabernet Sauvignon.
title: Maragas 2012 M Red Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon (Applegate Valley)

description: Tart, tangy and inviting, this medium-bodied wine shows deft layers of succulent fruit over a smooth texture. Flavors of lemongrass, anise and Meyer lemon are carried by a flowing river of acidity.
title: Jax 2017 Dutton Ranch 7 Barrels Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: With lasting tension and a good build-up of fresh acidity, this is a well-made white that offers fruity notes of white peach and apple. It has enough creaminess to be pleasurable on the palate, but ultimately is well built and balanced.
title: Heritance 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: This is essentially a reserve selection from Yates Conwill fruit, and it's a rich classy wine, beginning to show its age already, perhaps because it is bottled exclusively in half bottles. Spice and citrus, freshly picked berries, and overall a dense juicy character make it appealing already, though aging another few years is also a good option.
title: Sineann 2017 TFL Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Dark gold in color, this wine is showy in oak, with a nutty core of richness and full-bodied flavor. It offers a wealth of green apple, lemon and lime on the lengthy palate.
title: Anderson Conn Valley 2017 Sarah's Cuvee White (Napa Valley)

description: Bright and ripe berry aromas kick of the nose on this bottling, which then offers a hint of crushed clove. The palate is very full and framed by chalky tannins, loaded with ripe berry, baking-spice and dried tarragon flavors.
title: Clos LaChance 2017 Erwin Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Hints of butterscotch and caramel in the aroma of this full-bodied wine are followed by baked apple and brown-sugar flavors and a rich soft texture. It has an appealing creaminess both in the flavors and the mouthfeel.
title: Jeremy Wine Co 2017 Shinn Vineyard Chardonnay (Lodi)

description: Floral and herbal, this has high-toned acidity and a grassy element that's earthy and within the wine's style. Stony texture adds complexity to the stone fruit and lemon.
title: Jamieson Ranch 2017 Silver Spur Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Thick, robust and full bodied, this white is intensely flavored in sweet peach, with a gritty texture that lingers in steely acidity.
title: Gratus 2017 Estate Grown White (Napa Valley)

description: This is from an estate-grown block at 300-feet in elevation. It is an intense take on the variety that's crisp and refreshing in flinty petrol, lemon and melon.
title: Kunde 2017 Block 4SB20 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)

description: This medium-bodied wine is very fruity in flavor and soft and easy in texture. It has low acidity, very little noticeable tannin and a rather thick, syrupy mouthfeel.
title: Samuel Charles 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

description: Beautifully floral and inviting, this wine has a nice weight to it and a balanced approach to ripeness and acidity. Peach, lemon and wet stone carry through a midpalate of silky smoothness and peppery finish. This is an impressive version of the variety.
title: Anaba 2017 Landa Vineyard Viognier (Sonoma Valley)

description: Candied honeydew, lime cream, white peach and chalk show on the inviting nose of this organically grown Falanghina, an uncommon grape for California. There's a sizzle of fresh acid on the palate, which is full of balanced flavors of peach and guava.
title: Castoro Cellars 2017 Whale Rock Vineyard Falanghina (Paso Robles)

description: This is a hearty, acid-driven white, with a white peach flavor and a lush, creamy palate. Hints of jasmine and apple blossom meld with a touch of lemon zest on the lingering finish.
title: Kenzo Estate 2017 Asatsuyu Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: A 100% whole-cluster bottling from Glenrose Vineyard, this whimsically labeled wine combines dark black currant and blackberry on the nose with saddle leather and earthy aromas. The palate is very earthy as well, with stewed black-plum and turned loam flavors.
title: Saint K 2017 Dial Tone Mourvedre (Adelaida District)

description: This wine has light aromas of figs and crushed stone, followed by a creamy mouthfeel and subtle flavors of almond and white pepper. A couple of years in the cellar will bring out more complexity. Best after 2020.
title: Lava Cap 2017 Viognier (El Dorado)

description: Clean aromas of pomelo and lychee meet with peach and dried sour pear on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Tangy citrus and grapefruit flavors ride an energetic mouthfeel, with a long-lasting acid that takes a sour stretch into the finish.
title: Jaffurs 2017 Bien Nacido Vineyard Viognier (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A touch of seeming-sweetness from generous oak treatment spices up the aromas and flavors of this ripe and generous-tasting wine. It has lots of plums and cherries in addition to a mapley baking-spice component.
title: Sean Minor 2017 4B Pinot Noir (California)

description: Though this winery's single-vineyard expressions are awesome, this appellation blend is also a strong choice. Intense aromas of tart pomegranate, cinnamon, sumac and turned soil lead into a smooth, fresh and high-toned palate of rhubarb and French toast flavors.
title: Dragonette 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This bottling by industry veterans John and Helen Falcone always packs in Paso Robles' lushness without breaking the bank. Creamy aromas of black-cherry chiffon, lush roses and violets and vanilla-speckled French toast lead into a ripe palate of black cherry, cassis, mocha and caramel. Soft but structural tannins and a proper acidity hold it together.
title: Falcone 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: From a site the heart of the appellation, and a block-designate at that, this is an exuberant and intensely flavored wine, with tones of black cherry, smoke and forest floor. It builds power as it sits in the glass, finishing on a lush, seductive texture.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Rochioli Riverblock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The reserve is two-thirds Pommard and one-third heirloom clone, fermented with native yeast and aged 18 months in 75% new oak. Deeply richly fruity, it's a ripe bowl of blackberries in a bottle, with a lush finish loaded with mocha and toast. Irrepressibly delicious, yet built to age nicely over the next decade or so.
title: Cramoisi 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: From a great vineyard sourced by this producer for some time, this wine impresses in its sublime texture and integrated oak, the fruit profile of Gravenstein apple and pear is fleshy and lush. Bright acidity keeps the palate fresh and ready for more.
title: Patz & Hall 2016 Kent Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Trent Moffett moved his California winery to Oregon in 2014, to focus principally on Pinot Noir. Working with consulting winemaker Drew Voit, he's off to a great start.
