Sourced from the Terrarossa vineyard, this bright and sappy wine offers luscious flavors of raspberry compote and pie cherries. Full, forward and delightfully fruity, it fills in the ample finish with flavors of roasted coffee and barrel toast, from aging in 40% new French oak.
title: Moffett 2016 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Drawing upon young vines planted in 2012, this all-Dijon clone wine shows amazing length and strength. Mixed berry-fruit flavors are rich and juicy, while the overall balance is supple and refreshing. There's a burst of spice as it trails in a finish elevated with flavors of blood orange.
title: Cramoisi 2016 Sofia's Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This is a small-production offering from a small producer. It opens in a beautifully floral display of rose and sage, following through with a substantial weight and breadth of cassis and black cherry. The oak is rich and rewarding while allowing the wine to remain balanced and elegant.
title: Coursey Graves 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Light, plush and dancing in dark cherry and strawberry tones, this estate wine is soft and pillowy on the palate. A tangy citrus undertone rides along a backdrop of black tea, nutmeg and turned earth.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Lewis MacGregor Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Very dark in the glass, this bottling shows tightly wound blackberry fruit, pepper and dark chocolate on the nose. It's a very rich expression of Cabernet Franc, with lush dark fruit, although there is cracked pepper and a hint of herbs on the taut palate that adhere to the variety's roots.
title: Daou 2016 Cabernet Franc (Adelaida District)

description: This is a lovely, earthy vineyard-designate, brimming in thick, viscous and youthful layers of black tea and cardamom. Structured tannins support a core of velvety baked strawberry and cola.
title: Patz & Hall 2016 Burnside Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Trent Moffett moved his California winery to Oregon in 2014, to focus principally on Pinot Noir. Working with consulting winemaker Drew Voit, he has released four single-vineyard examples from 2016, each nicely balanced and displaying a sophisticated hand at the helm. Coffee, cherry and toast combine here, in a polished effort using fruit from the Monk's Gate vineyard. Given 10 months in 30% new French oak, it's young and sassy and delicious already.
title: Moffett 2016 Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: Sourced from the Bieze vineyard, which is next to the outstanding Seven Springs site, this all-Pommard selection brings mulberry and strawberry fruit into focus, right on the edge of jammy. It was fermented with 40% whole clusters, and aged in 50% new French oak, adding a kiss of dark chocolate to the finish.
title: Moffett 2016 Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This is a floral, concentrated white wine. The entry of lush creme brulee and fig flavors are met by persistent honeysuckle and toasted oak tones.
title: Hess Collection 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: An elegantly structured medium-bodied white, this shows crisp green-apple and steel flavors, with subtle oak tones. Elements of Meyer lemon and melon add context and complementary flavor to a lengthy, succulent finish.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Drake Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Dark-golden color gives way to a rich, rounded exploration of baked apple, nutmeg and toasted oak in this well-made vineyard-designate. The creamier, concentrated tones are given a lift of freshness from persistent acidity.
title: B Cellars 2016 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This blends grapes from the Gap's Crown and Wildcat Mountain vineyards, aging the whole in a small percentage of new French oak for 11 months. Heady in spice and baked dark cherry, it offers moderate body structure and ripeness with a touch of orange peel and toasted oak.
title: On Point 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a very Sauvignon Blanc-like take on Chardonnay, starting with aromas of lemongrass, lime leaf, lemon balm and a steely edge. The palate is tense with melon and pear-rind flavors as well as more grassy tones.
title: Dragonette 2016 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is a big-boned generously spiced vineyard-designate with sizable tannin weight and textured grit. Toasted oak supports dark cherry, mint and pomegranate flavors that are well-integrated and lengthy.
title: Patz & Hall 2016 Moses-Hall Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Re-established in Oregon after a long-contemplated move from California, Trent Moffett is now focused on Pinot Noir and Chardonnay. Tart lemon and grapefruit lift this high-acid style, that's snappy and clean, though a bit austere despite a year in 30% French oak.
title: Moffett 2016 Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

description: This bottling, which also includes 9% Carmenere, 4% Petit Verdot and 3% Cabernet Franc, hews toward an older California style of Cab, with dried oregano and cedar overriding black-plum and blackberry aromas on the nose. The palate is also very herbal and rather light, with tight tannins framing flavors of oregano, peppercorn and blackberry.
title: Niner 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Smoky in oak, this soft, round and medium-bodied red is a mix of blackberry and black cherry, with tart acidity lurking in the background. Smooth integrated tannins support without distraction.
title: K Squared Cellars 2016 Merlot (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine is a blend of equal parts of these two varieties. The aromas seem lightly volatile, along with notes of green herb and cherry. Quite light fruit flavors follow.
title: Cathedral Ridge 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Columbia Valley (OR))

description: This wine is a blend of 53% Mourvedre, 35% Grenache and 12% Malbec. The aromas bring notes of white pepper, cut red apple, Band-Aid and ash, with the volatiles amped up. Lighter-styled cranberry flavors follow that trail toward the finish. It doesn't all work.
title: Cathedral Ridge 2016 The Daughter Red (Columbia Valley (OR))

description: Lighter aromas of dried herb, licorice, vanilla and cherry are out front. Light, tangy fruit flavors follow, with the tannins showing a bit of grit.
title: GFW 2016 Vinocluster Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The aromas are light and hard to tease out. Smooth fruit flavors follow, with the concentration not all there. The variety seems hard to find.
title: GFW 2016 Vinocluster Merlot (Rattlesnake Hills)

description: This is a tannic, minty wine full of earthy strawberry flavor and a medium-bodied approach to ripeness. The oak is well-integrated and supportive.
title: Spicy Vines 2016 Peter's Delight Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The history of this remote property is fascinating, and more will come to love its story thanks to excellent wines such as this. Aromas of black cherry, loamy soils and tarragon lead into a palate redolent with sagebrush, marjoram and minty forest floor flavors. Wild strawberry and red currant touches provide fruity depth.
title: Eden Rift 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Cienega Valley)

description: This is a heck of a deal for the quality: an appellation wine with juicy intensity and a rich layering of red and blue fruit. With plenty of tannic power beneath its integrated texture are secondary notes of forest, clove and black tea that complement the fruit beautifully.
title: Patz & Hall 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Lush and brightly layered in exotic citrus, this features crunchy pomegranate and cherry tones as well. The fruitiness is marked by acidity and balanced ripeness. It has a lasting impact of spice and cola.
title: Sojourn 2016 Wohler Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A distinctly minty note informs this Dijon clone Chardonnay, along with light melon and apple fruit. It's firm through the midpalate, moving into a lingering, detailed finish. A touch of butter suggests some malolactic fermentation, but the remaining acidity is sufficient to keep it all in balance.
title: David Hill 2016 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: Sweet peach and apricot flavors are given a touch of richness from a jolt of vanilla. Medium bodied and fleshy, it finishes bright and fresh.
title: Herencia 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Up-front oak gives way to a brightness of Meyer lemon in this ultimately medium-bodied structured white. Briny salty mineral elements pique a lusher midpalate of pineapple, fig and nutmeg, contrasting well to offer memorable complexity.
title: Cuvaison 2016 Kite Tail Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Baked strawberry and mulberry aromas are lifted by gingersnap elements on the nose of this bottling. Concentrated red-plum and licorice flavors show on the very extracted palate, which gains a slight tartness from the acidity.
title: Wrath 2016 Boekenoogen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This appellation wine is brawny in brambly red and black cherry, tight full-bodied robustness and ripeness. Toasted oak imparts a warmth and seasoning of vanilla cola.
title: Sojourn 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Aromatically, vanilla oak supports a medium-bodied ripeness of baked pineapple and lemon curd - viscous richness that works in the context of its balanced acidity.
title: Belden Barns 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Equal parts Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon aged for 20 months in new American oak. The aromas are lighter styled, with notes of dark fruit and abundant barrel spice. Ripe, rich black fruit flavors that pack a big punch follow. It seems a bit one note, but what's there is quite nice.
title: Liberty Lake 2016 Heritage Reserve Red Wine Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: Thick, rich and robust in peach, apricot and stone, this is made in a big viscous style with present ripeness.
title: Andretti 2016 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

description: One of the winery's "soil designates", this wine tastes as if it were sourced from Ribbon Ridge, though there is no indication other than the broad Willamette Valley AVA. Complex layers of berry, cherry, cola, brown sugar and coffee liqueur are integrated beautifully. The wine sails through a perfectly balanced finish, with lingering highlights of all of the above, and a splash of citrus trailing behind.
title: Andrew Rich 2015 Marine Sedimentary Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: From a hillside site between Oak Knoll and Coombsville, this is a sanguine, elegant red densely layered and plush in soft oak. Red currant, clove, cedar and cherry make appearances within savory complements of leather and tobacco.
title: Flora Springs 2015 Out of Sight Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Aromas of toasted marshmallow, nuts and ripe apple meet with a steely, racy seam on the nose of this bottling. There's an orange-rind edge to the bright palate, providing freshness to balance the richer cashew and almond flavors.
title: Center of Effort 2015 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)

description: You might wish for more information (and more legible labels) on Andrew Rich's excellent Pinots, but it's not here at the moment. The wine must speak for itself, and it does so quite well, with dense textured seams of black cherry, Kahlua and granite. A steely astringent finish suggests further aging. Optimal drinking should be the decade of the 2020s.
title: Andrew Rich 2015 Volcanic Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This comes from a site in Pope Valley on the eastern edge of the appellation, where the grapes are grown at 1,200-feet in elevation. Red currant, clove and turned earth top a layer of grippy reduction and sizable oak, with secondary elements of tar and leather.
title: Flora Springs 2015 Wild Boar Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: A 100% varietal wine from a three-acre block on the producer's estate, this is an herbal, woody and earthy red wine. Generous helpings of oak and concentration grasp bold flavors of black cherry, currant as well as richer hits of dark chocolate and coffee.
title: Flora Springs 2015 Rennie Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

description: Among a host of the winery's Pinots that are not easily differentiated, the Magnus may be the ripest by a thin margin. Blackberry, black cherry and cola flavors mix nicely, with a touch of sweet barrel spices adding to the pleasure.
title: Bjornson 2015 Magnus Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Thick red- and black-cherry fruit punctures more savory earthy elements of dried herb and currant in this tart tangy wine. A strong core of tannin supports the ripeness with violet aromatics leading the way.
title: Toybox Wine Cellars 2015 Cadden Family Vineyard Malbec (Napa Valley)

description: Black plum, leather, tobacco and a hint of jasmine show on the nose of this bottling of a still rather uncommon grape for the region. There is also a jasmine touch to the palate, where intriguing purple-flower flavors meet with ripe blueberries and licorice spice.
title: Seven Angels 2015 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)

description: Presumably a single-vineyard (unnamed) selection, this is a supple wine with a lush core of purple berry fruits. Beyond that it offers some astringent tannins, and a touch of the earthiness characteristic of the AVA.
title: Andrew Rich 2015 Eola Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Though it bears a reserve designation, this is a light simple wine, with black currant and a dash of espresso. Some barrel time has lent a seam of baking chocolate to the finishing tannins.
title: Bjornson 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Named to honor the winery's permit number, this barrel selection blends clones to show a mix of tart red fruits, backed with acids that taste of grapefruit. It finishes with earthy tannins, a reflection of the AVAs characteristic terroir.
title: Bjornson 2015 #21003 Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Here the fruit is so lightly ripened that salmonberries come to mind - a wild, thinly ripened Northwest variety. Clean earth underlies the thin fruit, turning the tannins slightly bitter.
title: Bjornson 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This wine is a blend of 54% Cinsault and 46% Counoise. It's quite light in color with an orange tinge at the rim. The aromas seem closed up at present, while the palate offers faint, slightly tangy fruit flavors. The flavors seem quite dilute.
title: Maryhill 2015 Indira Elephant Mountain Vineyards Red (Rattlesnake Hills)

description: Perfumed oak is smoky and a tad rough around the edges, the wine offering a fruity and lush midpalate that takes on a harsh green component as it finishes soft and simple.
title: Precision Wine 2015 Spotlight Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Very light in the glass, this wine from a vineyard off of Santa Rosa Road offers aromas of muddled cherry and crushed thyme in a rustic, herbaceous style. The palate is refreshing and layered with oregano, marjoram and peppercorn, set against a raspberry backdrop.
title: Ken Brown 2015 Rancho La Vina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Floral aromas and concentrated black-cherry flavors mark this medium- to full-bodied wine as something distinctive. It smells of enticing rose petal and light lilac, tastes vivid and fruity but not overripe. Firm tannins and lively acidity lift the texture and while the good concentration leads to a lingering finish.
title: Pennyroyal Farm 2015 Monty In Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This atypical blend of Pinot Noir and Grenache is always a fun release for this winery, and the pairing works very well. Aromas of bay leaf, thyme, red currant and rosewater lead into a palate loaded with star anise, mace and dried red-cherry flavors. The structure is light but the floral freshness is lovely.
title: Kynsi 2015 Nocturnum Red (Edna Valley)

description: This might be the best value in the appellation: a beautifully structured wine that's brimming in blackberry and plum flavors with a medium-bodied elegant approach. Soft velvety texture gives it additional appeal as it finishes in baking spice and clove.
title: Experience 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Seared lemon rinds, toasted almonds and broad apple aromas arise on the nose of this bottling. It's smooth and waxy on the palate with creme brulee and Marcona almond flavors.
title: Black Ridge 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Crushed rocks, black currant, caramel and toasty oak make for a bright, minerally entry to this blend of 38% Cabernet Sauvignon, 38% Syrah and 24% Petite Sirah. Sour black-plum flavors meet with lilac on the palate.
title: Sculpterra 2015 Statuesque Red (Paso Robles)

description: This wine is exotic and extroverted thanks to the aroma of wood char and singed rosemary, the bold black-fruit, the roasted coffee and the cocoa nib flavors. It's not overly full in body, and has good acidity and firm tannins for structure, which helps power the bold flavors on the palate and finish.
title: Shannon 2015 Home Ranch Reserve Tempranillo (Lake County)

description: This wine is delicious in terms of late-harvested fruit flavors like boysenberry jam and raspberry syrup. It has full body, mild tannins and a mouthcoating texture.
title: Binz 2015 Fox Creek Vineyard Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

description: Cinnamon and clove season sanguine elements of smoked meat and blue fruit in this broadly structured, well-made wine. Big in flavor, it finishes in a length of toasty oak.
title: Corley 2014 Yewell Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

description: This wine has a classic herbal element of sage, sous-bois and mint, tucked within soft layers of integrated tannin and oak. Medium bodied, it shines in rich blue fruit and a lasting note of clove.
title: Corley 2014 Tietjen Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: Rich aromas of black cherry, candied violets and charred cigar box show on the nose of this blend of Petit Verdot, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. The mouthfeel is quite full and rich, and the flavors trend toward caramelized berry fruits and balsamic tones, framed by squeaky tannins.
title: Lorenzi Estate 2014 French Twist Red (Temecula Valley)

description: High-toned acidity lifts a delicate offering of cinnamon, plum and blueberry in this soft, round and approachable red.
title: Kalaris 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Mild-mannered fruit is dominated by substantial tannin weight and concentration, with savory elements of clove and black tea playing around the edges.
title: Jigar 2014 Graham Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: Always impressive, this is a fleshy, boldly structured white wine, offering a tremendous palate of exotic flavor. Lemon rind, wet stone, peach and a grittiness of background oak mingle effortlessly within a moderate richness of balanced complexity.
title: Lail 2017 Blueprint Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: This is made from 60% Sauvignon Blanc, 35% Chardonnay and 5% Viognier, some of the wine stainless-steel fermented, some barrel or concrete-egg fermented. Together, they offer a lively hit of bright grapefruit, apricot and Meyer lemon squeeze. The texture is velvety smooth with a twist of grip.
title: B Cellars 2017 Blend 23 White (Napa County-Sonoma County)

description: This wine is exuberant in juicy tones of Meyer lemon, peach and wet stone. The medium-bodied palate has a fleshy mouthfeel that will appeal to a wide array of wine lovers.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

description: A hint of flowers in the aroma of this rich and full-bodied wine gives way to ripe fig, pear and honey flavors on the palate. It's so ripe that it verges on sweetness, and has an opulent, viscous texture that helps the honeyed character cling to the sides of the mouth for a lingering finish.
title: Wood Family Vineyards 2017 Para Mas Amigas Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)

description: Broad aromas of fruit punch, pomegranate, sumac, mace and rust show on the nose of this fairly priced bottling from the Miller family of Bien Nacido Vineyard. It's bright, snappy and tangy with red-plum skin, strawberry and raspberry flavors on the palate, plus herbs and pepper spice.
title: Ballard Lane 2017 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: A paean to the classic signature of the AVA, this mixes blue and black fruits into a fully ripened slice of berry-pie goodness. Along with that exceptional fruit are hints and highlights of earth, herb and olive. The full-bodied flavors are finished with a light suggestion of cedar plank.
title: Big Table Farm 2016 Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: A ripe cherry aroma pops from the glass, with a light accent of milk chocolate in the background. The fruit is so rich and appealing that it takes a moment or two for the extra nuances to filter through - cinnamon, cedar and even a whiff of musk. These details contribute to a most expressive wine that shows power and aging potential.
title: Big Table Farm 2016 Sunnyside Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Made entirely from old Wente clone vines, this structured wine offers a steely core of lemon, green apple and honey. There's balanced acidity on the palate, with floral accents of apple and orange blossoms.
designation: Year of the Monkey Single Vineyard
title: Donum 2016 Year of the Monkey Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Well balanced and complex, this smoothly integrates strawberry and cherry fruit with highlights of lemon and orange. The aromatics conjure up orange pekoe tea, and a gentle hint of fresh herb annotates the finish.
title: Alexana 2016 Zena Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: From a dry-farmed coastal site, this is a grippy, concentrated wine full of powerful tannins. Dried herb, tea, blood orange and pomegranate combine for a force of flavor as the wine broods and develops.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Precious Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Winemaker Tony Rynders consistently makes this top-tier cuvee a toasty treat. Pleasing berry and cherry fruits open generously, with soft tannins and lush barrel flavors of caramel and butter brickle.
title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2016 Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: Deep blackberry aromas meet with new leather and elegant rose-petal scents on the nose of this blend from one of the warmer regions in Santa Barbara. Rich and ripe flavors of candied cherries and berries are wrapped in a woody caramel-laced coating.
title: Martellotto 2016 Il Capoccia Riserva Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: The sense and supposition is that these are young vines, with clean, bright fruit flavors that favor tangy cranberry and raspberry. At first whiff, the sense of vanilla is a bit overwhelming, but as the wine breathes open that subsides: young vines, young wine. Aggressive aeration is highly recommended.
title: Harper Voit 2016 Filament Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Caramelized apple and creme brulee flavors make for a heady richness in this wine. It finds its balance on the midpalate, where concentrated, silky waves of flavor move to a settling mineral intensity on the finish.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Strata Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Chewy and tannic, this young wine is dense and a bit stiff. Black fruits, espresso and cacao combine to accent the dark flavors. It spent 18 months in half new French oak, and should continue to develop nicely over the next few years.
title: Dion 2016 Winemaker's Reserve Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This white offers tremendous value, being bright, floral and fruity with a touch of restraint. Integrated ripeness and oak are etched in apple, pear and nutmeg, with just enough acidity to keep a level of freshness through the finish.
title: Stags' Leap Winery 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: This is a new offering from the producer - a lush expression that offers bold flavors and texture. With complementary oak, it offers rich layers of creme brulee, caramel and apple, all dusted in nutmeg.
title: Hess Collection 2016 Panthera Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Dark gold in color, this wine takes on a heady bouquet of honey, graham cracker, vanilla and creme brulee. Hearty, full bodied and fleshy, its fruit-forward character is defined by flavors of pineapple and mango.
title: Landmark 2016 Damaris Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Bright, spicy and fragrantly fruity, this coats the palate with lush flavors of raspberry puree. Firm polished tannins extend the finish gracefully. Still in its infancy, the primary and focused fruit flavors are delicious now, but the real pleasure here should come with additional bottle age.
title: Harper Voit 2016 Terrarossa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: A brilliant garnet hue, this intensely aromatic, lush and sexy wine mixes black-cherry fruit with scents and seams of sandalwood and cedar. Though still a bit stiffly tannic, it should benefit from additional bottle age, as a second day taste shows. The best drinking window will open during the 2020s.
title: Harper Voit 2016 Strandline Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Now labeled Old Vines, this outperforms the reserve from the same vineyard, with lovely density and texture. Black fruits come wrapped in barrel flavors of espresso and char. The tannins are granular but polished, and the wine lingers gracefully through a satisfying finish.
title: Chehalem 2016 Ridgecrest Vineyards Old Vines Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: This medium-bodied white has soft rounded corners of structure and flavor, a mix of tangy lemon and crunchy Gravenstein apple. The oak is helpful and well incorporated.
title: Kokomo 2016 Mukaida Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Aromas of butter, lees and spice are followed by full-bodied, creamy fruit flavors, finishing warm. The heat holds it back.
title: Noviello 2016 French Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)

description: This wine is aged in neutral oak, allowing plenty of room for the fruit and spice to breathe. Complex, bright and structured, it imparts lovely tones of dried herb, ginger, wet stone and lemon zest. The palate is medium bodied and subtle, finishing elegant and full of grace.
title: Lynmar 2016 La Sereinite Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This Cabernet Sauvignon-based blend brings overt aromas of wood spice, green herb, tire rubber, vanilla and green pepper, followed by lighter-styled fruit flavors. The tannins come off as quite grippy, not seeming to have fully ripened.
title: GFW 2016 Vinocluster Rattledeaux Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Rusty cherries, sagebrush and a touch of game make for a rich but rustic entry to this clonal study by Sabrine Rodems. Smoke, red cherry and star anise make for a spicy and zesty sip, lifted by buoyant acidity.
title: Wrath 2016 Pommard 4/777 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Briny lemon and tangerine lift a creamy lush personality buoyant in complementary and well-integrated acidity. This wine offers a wealth of succulence and complexity, trafficking in bold flavors and structure.
title: MacRostie 2016 The Key Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Medium bodied and gritty on the palate, this has a richness of creme brulee, the fruit a mix of quince and stone fruit. The acidity is emphasized in lingering layers of lime salt that remain vibrant on the finish.
title: Lynmar 2016 Old Wente Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The 25% new French oak shows in luxurious ways on this bottling, with aromas of butterscotch, scorched hazelnuts, pecans and a backdrop of seashell minerality on the nose. Warm nutty flavors consume the palate, yet there's a grapefruit-rind edge as well.
title: Eden Rift 2016 Terraces Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)

description: Bright and joyous Bing cherry aromas meet with nutmeg and gingerbread on the extremely accessible nose of this bottling. It's really juicy and lovable on the palate, where playful cherry and strawberry flavors are framed by slate-driven minerality, tense tannins and strong acidity.
title: Pianetta 2016 Sangiovese (Paso Robles Estrella District)

description: This is one of the lightest-tasting and most charming examples of a notoriously blunt and tannic varietal. Cherries and violets accent the aromas, bright black-cherry flavors brighten the palate and a moderately tannic texture gives a snap to the mouthfeel.
title: Berryessa Gap 2016 Petite Sirah (Yolo County)

description: Mint, lavender and rose-petal aromas make for an exotic floral entry as substantial tannins and body weight build strength on the palate. Well made, the wine is robust in dark-cherry fruit and a lasting note of toasted oak.
title: Fulcrum 2016 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: A beefy, savory aspect gives this concentrated and full-bodied wine some nice complexity. Its richly layered tannins coat the mouth while deep and persistent blueberry and blackberry flavors taste compelling and delicious. Best after 2023.
title: Rowdy Bush 2016 Petite Sirah (Lodi)

description: This is an intensely earthy, soft and stemmy red, savory and exotic in black tea, cardamom and citrus undertones. On top, expect dark cherry compote and wisps of pomegranate within a medium-bodied ripeness of style.
title: Bruliam 2016 Torrey Hill Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Light aromas of cedar and spice are followed by supple black fruit flavors and grainy tannins. It comes off as quite ripe.
title: Liberty Lake 2016 Scooteney Flats Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Red Mountain)

description: This wine is a blend of 45% Grenache, 36% Syrah and 19% Mourvedre. Aromas of freshly squeezed Mandarin orange, raspberry, black pepper and plum lead to light, juicy, fresh fruit flavors on the palate, with the tannins bringing a slightly scraping feel. Mouthwatering acidity and a light smoky note linger in the background. It brings a pleasing sense of delicacy.
title: Rocky Pond 2016 Stratastone Double D Vineyard Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A fresh cherry aroma is wrapped in loads of intriguing spice on the nose of this bottling, including clove, mint and cocoa. A chalky texture of grainy tannins frames the palate, where plum, blackberry, dried ginger and more baking-spice flavors ride a persistent acidity.
title: Dusty Nabor 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Strikingly fresh and delicious raspberry and cherry fruit absolutely rocks this young wine. It's bright and immaculately clean, with comparable juicy flavors to certain classic Dry Creek Zins. Forward and fruit-driven, with a tart tangy tail, this is an under-the-radar gem.
title: Holmes Gap 2015 Pioneer Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Quality is growing by leaps and bounds at Carlton Cellars, and the grapes from the estate's Russell-Grooters vineyard are the centerpiece here. A lovely Pinot-perfect pale-rose color, this aromatic and sexy wine offers crisp red fruits, notes of cola, spice and brown sugar, and a lightly dusty feel to the tannins.
title: Carlton Cellars 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: Crafted from just a barrel each selected from the winery's three vineyard designates, this rich and full-bodied wine deftly frames its blueberry, plum and cherry fruit in flavors of caramel and toast. It's exactly the sort of young and delicious wine that seems to refill your glass all by itself.
title: Moffett 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Smoked meat, tobacco and tea make for a robust, edgy experience in this block-designate from the famous site, the wine savory, thick and exotic in nature. Red-currant and cherry notes brighten its mood.
title: Saxon Brown 2015 Durell Vineyard Hayfield Block Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Ripe and candied strawberry aromas meet with nutmeg on the delicious nose of this bottling. There is a strong acidic tang to the palate, where macerated strawberry flavors feel quite fresh and young. It goes down easy.
title: McClean 2015 Simone Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

description: Candied black-raspberry aromas meet with elegant mace and star anise spice on the nose of this bottling. There's a backbone of black-plum jelly and purple flowers to the sip, which is layered throughout in Christmas spices.
title: Seven Angels 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)

description: This grower bottling was made by the talented Drew Voit. Broad flavors of strawberries and pie cherries abound, with a slightly biting finish. The color already hints at a sunset shade, suggesting that this is ready to drink and at or near its best. All Pommard grapes, it was aged in 40% new French oak.
title: Holmes Gap 2015 Sage Hen Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Raspberry jam carries the fruit, with better balance than the winery's other 2015 reds, which seem bitter and tannic in comparison. Here there's enough fruit to compensate for some initial roughness. The wine will reward aggressive aeration.
title: Schmidt 2015 Malbec (Applegate Valley)

description: Generic flavors disguise any varietal fruit character with overwrought, rough, charred tannins.
title: Schmidt 2015 Merlot (Applegate Valley)

description: The mocha, dried herb, tire rubber, hay and cherry aromas are brooding. The flavors are lighter styled, painting around the edges. The fruit doesn't seem to have fully ripened.
title: Adega Northwest 2015 Two Blondes Vineyard Block 8 Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

description: Syrah makes up 40% of this wine, with the balance equal parts Grenache and Mourvedre. The aromas don't seem entirely settled, with notes of jelly bean and herb along with dried fruit. Sleek fruit flavors follow.
designation: Grower's Cuvee Miguel Rodriguez Weinbau Vineyard
title: Adega Northwest 2015 Grower's Cuvee Miguel Rodriguez Weinbau Vineyard G-S-M (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Very pure and deep black-cherry flavors highlight this inky-colored and full-bodied wine. It's packed with layers of very ripe cherry, plum and blackberry and wrapped in thick velvety tannins for a full mouthfeel.
title: Jigar 2015 Tollini Vineyard Syrah (Redwood Valley)

description: Somewhat shy on the nose, this bottling offers berry, dried herb and wet slate aromas. The palate is very dry and tightly woven with chalky tannins that only allow berry, roast beef and charcoal flavors to barely arise. It will likely become more expressive with time.
title: Donati Family Vineyard 2015 Family Reserve Malbec (Paicines)

description: This reserve blend of 55% Grenache, 25% Syrah, 16% Mourvedre and 4% Cinsaut takes a good amount of patience to open, but is quite compelling when it does. Candied cherry and hibiscus aromas meet with rusty sanguine aromas on the nose, while the palate combines red fruit with raw meat and feral flavors. A baking-spice warmth evolves with time.
title: Bonny Doon 2013 Le Cigare Volant Reserve Red (Central Coast)

description: Generous aromas of raspberry, blueberry, hard candy, herb and spice give way to compact, initially lightly spritzy, tightly wound plum flavors that bring an appealing sense of purity and freshness. The sense of balance only adds to the enjoyment. It would benefit from a bit of additional time in the bottle or some time in a decanter to open up, but it delivers.
title: Cairdeas 2017 Concrete Lawrence Vineyards Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Packaged in one of the more impressive labels on the market, this very young wine is quite ready now, starting with fresh aromas of blackberry sauce, crushed slate and dried herbs. Chalky tannins frame the sip, where ripe red-fruit flavors lead into herbs, smoked meat and cocoa.
title: McClean 2017 Clemence Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This full-bodied but light-in-concentration wine has very lean fruit flavors and a dominant spicy, oaky, vanillin tone in both the aromas and the flavors.
title: Theopolis 2017 Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)

description: Pleasing aromas of melon, spice and peach lead to medium-bodied stone fruit flavors. Tart acidity backs it up. The alcohol pokes through at times.
title: Maryhill 2017 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Broad aromas of poached pear, clotted cream, cashew and a hint of toasted brioche show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is clean although very light in flavor, offering green-pear and key lime pie touches.
title: Clos La Chance 2017 Murphy's Choice Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is a utilitarian, light-bodied wine. It has earthy, lightly spicy aromas followed by flavors like red cherry with a touch of raspberry vinegar.
title: Lucky Rock Wine Co. 2017 County Cuvee Pinot Noir (California)

description: The Calera clone is rare in Oregon; here it's in the mix with the more common Pommard. This young, tight wine brings bright, primary cranberry and raspberry fruit flavors, set upon a firm spine of balanced acids and polished tannins. Notes of iron, licorice and coffee grounds come up in the finish, and overall this has the structure for a decade of life at least. Drink 2022 to the early 2030s.
title: Harper Voit 2016 Bieze Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This has gorgeous aromas of ginger and crushed rock, a stony mineral component that's irresistible and memorable. Balanced in richness, it sings in baked pear and honeysuckle, finding a touch of restraint within a medium-bodied frame of welcome decadence.
title: Black Kite 2016 Gap's Crown Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Bright citrus aromas meet with clay-like minerality and richer nutty aromas on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from atop the Sta. Rita Hills. The palate combines edgy tang with richness, pairing lemon cream with white peach, citrus peel with custard, making for a fascinating sip that will please many.
title: Dragonette 2016 Rita's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A robust entry of crisp acidity and lively pineapple fruit impresses immediately in this vineyard-designate that's well made and memorable. Rounded integrated oak gives it a pleasurable texture and length that's both complex and inviting.
title: Friedeman 2016 UV Lancel Creek Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Freshly smashed violets combine with hints of tar, black pepper and elderberry on the nose of this bottling. There is strong acid on the palate delivering flavors of pepper, roasted meat and tangy dark fruits, proving quite fresh and still a tad young.
title: Foxen 2016 Tinaquaic Vineyard Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Grenache makes up just under three-quarters of this wine, followed by 21% Mourvedre and 5% Syrah. The aromas intrigue, with notes of raspberry, stem, tobacco, orange peel, flower and white pepper. Light, lithe cherry and raspberry flavors follow, with plentiful smoked meat accents throughout. It's all about elegance.
title: Kerloo 2016 Majestic Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This combines grapes from several single-vineyard sites, including Terra de Promissio and Campbell Ranch. It excels in its opening notes of rose petal and lavender, with an underbelly of turned earth. Bold black fruit presents as sizably rich on the palate, a richness that turns velvety smooth and indelible.
title: Friedeman 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a thick, intense and boldly concentrated wine, balanced in its richness by supportive acidity. Gravenstein apple flavors are nearly baked in flavor, with bolts of nutmeg and cinnamon adding intrigue and complexity.
title: Patz & Hall 2016 Zio Tony Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Ripe blackberry and black-cherry aromas meet with tar on the rich nose of this bottling. The palate begins with a tangy grip that leads into elderflower and elderberry flavors, along with lavender on the finish.
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Flood Family Vineyards Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Rob Stuart's most affordable Pinot opens with toasty, chocolatey aromas that lead into pretty fruit flavors of berry and cherry. It's balanced throughout, medium bodied, and quite pleasurable.
title: R. Stuart & Co. 2016 Vignette Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Excellent fruit brings rich blackberry and black-cherry flavors front and center. There's a swath of cola and lighter notes of brown sugar and cut tobacco. It's full bodied and finishes with plenty of punch, especially for a wine in this price range.
title: Panache Cellars 2016 One Heart Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: There is a strong herbal and peppercorn start to the nose of this wine, followed by leather and black fruit. The blend of 40% Syrah, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Petit Verdot and 20% Grenache shows gamy Old World flavors on the palate of dried leather, dried meat, black plum and graphite minerality.
title: Ferguson Crest 2016 Fergalicious Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Earthy aromas of red cherry and wild strawberry also show a gunmetal streak on the nose of this bottling. It's full and soft on the palate, with red-cherry and turned loam flavors that are quite extracted.
title: Reata 2016 Pedregal Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Benito County)

description: Salty, briny and beautifully spicy, this wine offers full-bodied richness that's completely in balance and remarkably memorable on the palate. Everything is well integrated, from the entry to the long, lingering finish.
title: Lynmar 2016 Monastery Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Creamy stone-fruit and lemon-curd flavors provide an elegant richness to this coastal white. It is a bold, layered example of the variety that is well balanced by honed acidity.
title: Lynmar 2016 Susanna's Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This blend of 44% Grenache, 36% Syrah, 12% Mourvedre, 5% Counoise and 3% Cinsaut marinates together in 2,000-liter French foudres, a process that delivers elegant aromas of black plum, star anise, gingerbread, peppercorn and wet slate. Those same flavors dominate the palate, where a compelling tannic tension and lingering acidity complete a beautiful picture.
title: Margerum 2016 M5 Reserve Red (Santa Barbara County)

description: This Grenache is elegant and light, starting with aromas of rose hips, hibiscus extract and rooibos tea. The palate is energized, tense and quite quaffable, with plummy fruit-punch flavors that are lifted by star anise and other baking spices.
title: Margerum 2016 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

description: Bright aromas of candied blackberry meet with dewy herbs on the nose of this multiple vineyard blend by Doug Margerum. The palate combines black-currant juice with licorice, cracked black pepper and fresh acidity.
title: Margerum 2016 Uber Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Tightly wound on the nose, this clonal combo offers citrusy aromas of grapefruit rind and sharp apple flesh on the nose. The palate is wrapped in a chalky, tight texture, revealing flavors of Anjou pear and Pink Lady apple.
title: Wrath 2016 3 Clone Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Roasted aromas of coffee, charred black currant and pepper show on the rather lavish nose of this bottling. It's rich in style on the palate, where hearty dark-fruit flavors couple with an espresso note and are framed by solid acidity.
designation: Whale Rock Vineyard Reserve Estate Grown
title: Castoro Cellars 2016 Whale Rock Vineyard Reserve Estate Grown Syrah (Paso Robles)

description: Relatively light in the glass, this bottling offers red berry, tart strawberry, tea leaf and exotic floral touches on the nose. The red-plum flavors are hit by star anise, red licorice and red apple on the palate, proving to be a well rounded sip.
title: Roblar 2016 Estate Mourvedre (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Dried herbs, dark red cherry, crushed slate and smashed twigs show on the nose of this bottling from the southern Paso Robles region. The herbaceous character is deftly integrated into the palate's black-cherry fruits, all framed by tight tannins.
title: Ancient Peaks 2016 Merlot (Santa Margarita Ranch)

description: Roasted pork, nutmeg, vanilla and mulberry aromas show on the nose of this blend of 64% Grenache, 27% Syrah and 9% Petite Sirah, part of Napa winemaker Josh Phelps' new venture. It's smooth on the palate with loads of star anise and gingerbread flavors that play against a roasted red- and black-plum backdrop.
title: Grounded Wine Co. 2016 Public Radio Red (Paso Robles)

description: AВ soft velvety middle of muddled dark cherry, strawberry and black tea combines fruit and earth well in this medium-bodied estate wine. A touch of reduction persists from the beginning.
title: Dutton Estate 2016 Manzana Vineyard Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The aromas lack a sense of clarity, with notes of boysenberry and blue fruit lurking in the background. The palate is lighter styled but well proportioned, tapering toward the finish. The flavors are very pretty, but the aromas don't seem to sync up at present.
title: Structure 2016 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Bay leaf, tarragon, black-plum sauce and Asian spices show on the sharp nose of this bottling. There's a rich streak of boysenberry to the palate as well as juniper and pine needle touches. Still needs time to evolve.
title: Wrath 2016 Tondre Grapefield Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Strong aromas of Anjou pear, honeysuckle and almond make for an aromatic entry to the nose of this bottling, which halts malolactic fermentation halfway through to preserve freshness. The palate is indeed fresh, with flavors of apple and white flowers.
title: Wrath 2016 Fermata Chardonnay (Monterey)

description: Dark raspberry, packed lilacs, crushed lavender and a hint of game make for a powerful yet elegant nose. The palate is framed by strong, silty and grippy tannins, with zippy acidity that delivers flavors of black raspberry, pepper spice and roasted boar.
title: Center of Effort 2015 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Dark gold in color, this is a meaty, substantial white, tremendously flavorful in tropical and stone-fruit notes and an intensity of savory spice.
title: Saxon Brown 2015 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Though the listed alcohol tops 14%, this comes across as a delicate wine, with aromatics of rose petals and lemon zest leading to light strawberry fruit. As it breathes open it gathers strength, and the finish shows extra concentration with highlights of tea leaves and dried Mediterranean herbs.
title: Brooks 2015 Rose-Weber Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This wine is effusively aromatic in violet and wild raspberry, following through on the palate with similar flavors. Compact in medium-bodied ripeness and tannin, it finishes with secondary characteristics of black pepper and leather.
title: Lobo 2015 Wulff Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)

description: Sweet cherry fruit grabs hold of your palate from the get-go and hangs on delightfully, adding accents of cut tobacco and chocolate. This instantly appealing Pinot should be enjoyed now through the early 2020s.
title: Brooks 2015 Toluca Lane Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Aromas of plum, green herb, licorice, cigar box and baking spice lead to somewhat disjointed-seeming fruit flavors, with a firm lick of dry tannins on the outer edges. It doesn't all come together at present.
title: Tamarack Cellars 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Reduced to the point of inscrutable, other than scents of rubber tire, this wine stayed stubbornly closed even after many hours. What flavors were there appeared dull and sour, with weedy fruit.
title: Maragas 2015 Terrebonne Malbec (Oregon)

description: Aromas of overripe cherry, herb and fruit leather lead to dried-out-seeming fruit flavors backed by gritty tannins. It all seems quite desiccated, with the heat of the vintage showing.
title: Adega Northwest 2015 Two Blondes Vineyard Block 7 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)

description: This blends grapes from three tremendous sites: Chenoweth Ranch, Treehouse and Bootlegger's Hill, all sites farmed by Charlie Chenoweth himself. It melds and marries aspects of fruit and spice effortlessly around a tightly packed bit of power and ongoing freshness, with a perspective of Asian spice and black cherry.
title: Chenoweth 2015 Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: Lavish aromas of dried raspberry, black sage, hibiscus and boysenberry make for a generous entry to this bottling from a vineyard in the heart of the Sta. Rita Hills. The palate shows more herbal touches, including thyme, marjoram and tea leaves, giving depth to the boysenberry and white-pepper flavors.
title: Ken Brown 2015 Rita's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Perfectly baked apple aromas meet with crisp white flowers and fresh kumquat on the nose of this bottling by a winery based in Malibu. Bright lemon and honeysuckle flavors make for a mouthwatering palate, rounded by savory touches of sandalwood and framed with tense structure.
title: Dolin 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This bottling, using grapes grown at 1,400-feet in elevation and made with 31% whole cluster, shows candied blackberry, cola and fennel-frond aromas on the nose. It's tightly woven on the palate, where pinpoint tannins and bright acid deliver elderberry paste and white-sage flavors.
title: Big Basin 2015 Rattlesnake Rock Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Made of 90% Cabernet Sauvignon, with the balance Merlot. Cherry, graphite, raspberry and herb aromas lead to even-keeled dark fruit flavors that break up a bit in the middle before pulling back together. The tannins come off as a bit gruff out of the gate but soften with significant time open. Give it some time or a very long decant. Best after 2022, and it has the stuffing to go well beyond that.
title: Cadence 2015 Camerata Cara Mia Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)

description: This wine is a blend of 46% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Cabernet Franc and 19% Merlot. The aromas are locked up at present, with notes of herb, flower, mineral and black fruit. The palate is incredibly tightly wound, full of dark fruit flavors and firm tannins. It needs time in the cellar to come together. Best after 2022.
title: Cadence 2015 Tapteil Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)

description: Boysenberry and slate are lifted by baking spice on the nose of this bottling, which is being released later than the 2016 vintage. Tart plum-skin and floral flavors play on the palate, which is not as dense as usual but is still a strong wine.
title: Patz & Hall 2015 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Roasted red and black cherries meet with hickory and nutmeg on the rich nose of this bottling, which is given color and depth thank to 10% Petite Sirah. A chalky mouthfeel carries flavors of rich red cherry, framed by tense tannins and decent acidity.
title: Sculpterra 2015 Grenache (Paso Robles)

description: This is a blend of 56% Merlot and 44% Cabernet Franc. The aromas are a bit reticent out of the gate, with notes of herb, flower and dark fruit. The palate features big, burly tannins that come off as a bit dry and wound up at present.
title: Cadence 2015 Bel Canto Cara Mia Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)

description: Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon each make up a third of this blend, with the balance equal parts Merlot and Petit Verdot. The aromas offer notes of high-toned cherry, graphite, flower and spice. The tannins bring a bit of grip and dryness, needing some time to soften.
title: Cadence 2015 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)

description: Concentrated and fruity, this full-flavored wine shows bright berry aromas, deep and ripe blackberry flavors and a texture that has a good little bite of tannin.
title: Cinnabar 2015 Mercury Rising Red (California)

description: Blackberry and raspberry flavors fight for attention against the tarry asphalt-laced nose of this bottling, which also shows off sage and anise aromas. Roasted wood and thyme flavors arise on the palate against elderberry and black-plum flavors.
title: Left Bend 2015 Gali Vineyard Syrah (Santa Cruz County)

description: Black currant, lilac and dried herbs combine for a delicious aromatic entry to this bottling. There is a hearty richness to the palate, with flavors of smoked blackberries framed by firm but forgiving tannins.
title: Black Ridge 2014 San Andreas Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Aromas of framboise, with lavender, potpourri and sage sticks, show on the nose of this bottling from one of the steepest vineyards in the region. Earthy flavors of sagebrush and minty tarragon meet with boysenberry and elderberry fruits, and an aromatic lift goes deep into the finish.
title: Ken Brown 2014 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The cedar, sandalwood and pine-forest aromas work well on the Sangiovese in this bottling, which also shows red cherry on the nose. There is good tannic tightness to the palate, where red-fruit flavors meet with sawdust and vanilla on the finish.
title: Martin Ranch 2014 Therese Vineyards Dos Ninas Vineyard Sangiovese (Santa Clara Valley)

description: Concentrated aromas of black currant, blackberry syrup, licorice and dried herbs show on the nose of this blend of Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. There is a zip to the sip and a flash of minerality, but the extracted and thick dark-fruit flavors and searing acidity dominate the experience.
title: Figge 2014 Vaquero Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: From the Riboli family's new vineyard named after the patriarch, this bottling offers tuberose and tropical aromas of mango and papaya cream on the nose, but with a chalky edge. The palate is clean and crisp in flavors of lemon curd and apple mousse.
title: San Simeon 2017 Stefano Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)

description: Blended with 15% Semillon, this white is bright in lemon, stone and anise, yet full-bodied in weight and breadth. It has a grip on the palate that emphasizes its ultimate power and concentration of fruit.
title: Robert Mondavi 2017 Fume Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: Grassy, herbal and strongly full bodied, this white is textured and tannic, with an ongoing grittiness of wet stone. The fruit is a mix of peach and pineapple.
title: Frei Brothers 2017 Sonoma Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: Rounded aromas of yellow apple and lemon wedge show on the nose of this bottling by the country music star. It's very zippy on the palate, carrying flavors of honeydew, ripe pear and peach, that are seeming a touch sweet.
title: Z. Alexander Brown 2017 Uncaged Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Aromas of almond skin and spice lead to sweet, citrus-filled, full-bodied fruit flavors. It shows quite a bit of alcoholic warmth.
title: Maryhill 2017 Proprietor's Reserve Tudor Hills Vineyard Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Exotic in fig and guava flavors, this is a ripe full-bodied white that's fleshy and concentrated in richness.
title: Saddleback 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Oakville)

description: Warm, spice and vanilla aromas and flavors wrap around the ripe fruit and brown-sugar flavors in this obviously oaky and full-bodied wine. It has a rich texture and almost-sweet balance.
title: Z. Alexander Brown 2017 Uncaged Pinot Noir (Monterey County-Napa County-Sonoma County)

description: Aromas of fig and spice carry the nose of this lush white. The palate brings a lovely sense of texture, with notes of honeycomb, fig and tropical fruit. A warm finish caps it off. Like most examples of this variety, it needs time in the bottle to be fully appreciated, but it has all the stuffing. Best after 2019.
title: L'Ecole No. 41 2017 Semillon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The balance here is tilted slightly toward Semillon (54%). The nose offers notes of fig, lemon balm, spun cotton and citrus. Well-balanced, richly textured flavors follow, with tropical and citrus tones on the lingering finish. It needs some time to flesh out, but the stuffing is all there.
title: L'Ecole No. 41 2017 Estate Luminesce Seven Hills Vineyard Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Cream, spice and roasted squash aromas draw you into the glass. The palate is graceful and elegant, with impeccable balance to the stone fruit and pumpkin flavors throughout, along with a pretty sense of texture. A lingering finish caps it off. It walks the tightrope perfectly.
title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2017 Mimi Chardonnay (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: Fresh, focused and herbal, this robustly ripe white has strong flavors of apricot, green apple and pineapple. The fruit is sourced from the family's Shop Block Vineyard, planted to the Mosque clone, as well as from the Mrs. George Vineyard near its Home Ranch. It develops fleshy elements of tropical splendor as it opens in the glass.
title: Dutton Estate 2017 Kylie's Cuvee Dutton Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Semillon is a savory feast of mineral, herb and consomme flavors on a firm structure of good acidity and medium to full body. It's hearty, mouthfilling, a bit boisterous and quite satisfying to sip.
title: Concannon 2017 Reserve Assemblage Blanc White (Livermore Valley)

description: A dance between tangy acidity and a creamy texture plays out wonderfully in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It offers fresh citrus aromas and generous apple and honeydew melon flavors while the mouthfeel is broad and smooth.
title: Binz 2017 White Grenache (Fiddletown)

description: Aromas of lees, squash, custard, nut, candy corn and spice lead to full-bodied fruit flavors. There's a lovely sense of texture that piques the interest.
title: L'Ecole No. 41 2017 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: The aromas are generous, with notes of melon, white flower, pear and peach. The apricot and peach flavors are full bodied, sweet, ripe and nectarous with a warm finish. It delivers a lot of appeal, though the apparent residual sugar runs a bit high.
title: Maryhill 2017 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Black-cherry, vanilla and cola-syrup aromas show on the nose of this widely available wine. That richness dries up a bit on the sip thanks to upright, slightly sticky tannins, allowing flavors of strawberry and tart black-plum skin to shine through.
title: Austerity 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Aged 10 months in neutral American oak, this wine has a thick gritty texture and a sweetness of peach, green apple and honey. The structure and acidity are moderate; the ripeness full bodied and intense.
title: Mengler Family Wines 2017 Hoot Owl Creek Vineyard Viognier (Alexander Valley)

description: Warm aromas of cherry and chalk start off this pink wine from Happy Canyon. It's easy on the palate with light red-fruit flavors and a soft quaffable texture.
title: Grassini 2017 Afiora Rose (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: This captures the magic of this tiny AVA. It's an elegant tumble of berry fruit, sedimentary minerals and light seams of cola, coffee and clean earth. The balance and complexity, along with site-specific density, are superb.
title: Harper Voit 2016 Bramble Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: Inky in the glass, this rich and structured bottling offers a plump black-currant aroma, along with pinches of pepper and tightly woven oak. The palate lands softly and then the tannins rise up, offering savory flavors of charred beef, dark chocolate and black cherry. Drink 2020 - 2036.
title: Daou 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: A blend of Syrah, Grenache and Mourvedre aged in concrete and neutral oak, this bottling offers concentrated aromas of black plum, strawberry paste, wild thyme and black pepper. That pepper carries deep in the palate, spicing up the black plum, tangy berry and caramelized pork flavors. It finishes on a lingering violet note.
title: Zaca Mesa 2016 Inceptive Estate Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: A lush mix of pie cherry and briary blackberry fruit, this moves into more rarified territory with well-placed hints of thistle and stem. The finish brings a dash of sea-salt chocolate along with polished tannins.
title: R. Stuart & Co. 2016 Hirschy Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: This white opens with a bright honeysuckle note on the nose, leading to a palate of moderate structure and grip. Lightly textured and demure, it finish is memorable in flavors of apple and nutmeg.
title: De Loach 2016 Ritchie Vineyard Middle Reach Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This estate-grown wine is made in small amounts and is bursting with complexity. Tightly structured, it's peppery, intense and tannic, with concentrated fruit flavors of pomegranate and cassis. A lingering note of black tea marks the finish. Enjoy from 2021 - 2026.
title: MacPhail 2016 Mardikian Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This bottling exhibits the richness that's made Paso Robles famous, yet at a price point that's great for frequent indulgence. Inky in the glass, the bottling's lush nose offers concentrated black cherry, caramel, cocoa and coffee. It's soft and smooth on the palate, where the black-cherry compote flavors are lifted by star anise and clove.
title: Vina Robles 2016 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Opaque in the glass, this bottling from a district in east Paso Robles shows espresso, tar, roast beef and pepper on the complex nose. There's an herbal quality to the sip as well as a violet note, set against elderberry fruit and held up by loads of acid and tannin.
title: Pianetta 2016 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles Estrella District)

description: This is Cabernet Franc done in a fresh and zesty style, starting with aromas of raspberry, cranberry, dewy herbs and green peppercorns. The palate is loaded with cracked pepper, juniper and mossy herbs, yet the ripe red apples and dried berry flavors complete the refreshing picture. Serve a bit chilled.
title: Luna Hart 2016 Cabernet Franc (Los Olivos District)

description: A delicious, compounding mix of strawberry, raspberry and Bing cherry fruit, this smooths its way through a luscious midpalate, with barrel-inflected flavors of mocha, milk chocolate and almond paste. It's soft and subtle, with forward flavors that suggest drinking it sooner rather than later.
title: Harper Voit 2016 Antiquum Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine has wonderful ripeness without sweetness, a tangy mouthfeel and great structure. It shows bright cherry and apple-skin aromas, fresh and crisp cherry, cranberry and rhubarb flavors and medium to full body.
title: Black Kite 2016 Redwoods' Edge Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: What's most notable for such a big production wine is that it was sourced entirely from two estate vineyards rather than assembled from purchased fruit. Supple flavors of berry, plum and baked cherry spread broadly across the palate, with highlights of cocoa and tobacco. The finish is smooth as silk.
title: La Crema 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This coastal-influenced wine is rich in tones of vanilla and pear. It's thick, complex and full bodied, yet appropriately balanced, with a lingering note of savory nutmeg.
title: De Loach 2016 Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)

description: Fresh and lively on the nose, this bottling by Molly Bohlman offers aromas of baked boysenberry, savory caramelized pork and purple flowers. Grippy and chalky tannins are fairly rigid on the palate, offering flavors of dark cherry, plum and thyme. Drink 2020 - 2031.
title: Niner 2016 JR Reserve Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: According to winery notes, these grapes got significantly riper in 2016 than the previous vintage - to good effect. The wine is focused and intense, with juicy berry, blood orange and tangy acidity highlighting the fruit. Tannins are firm and lightly earthy, as per this AVA's signature, with a touch of coffee and graphite from aging in 27% new French oak.
title: Winderlea 2016 Crawford Beck Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This is a new wine from the producer's Westside Road property. Soft and approachable, it has crisp, steely acidity that carries flavors of wet stone and lemon peel. It takes on a broader sense of lushness as it opens on the midpalate, presenting bold flavors of peach and apricot.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Williams Selyem Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine squeezes lots of bright fruit flavors into a tight frame of good acidity and moderate tannins. It's medium to full in body, has an appetizing dry texture and stops short of full ripeness.
title: Black Kite 2016 Stony Terrace Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Very ripe blackberry and black-plum aromas are lifted by compacted violets on the nose of this bottling by the Fess Parker family. It lands on the palate with full flavors of blackberry reduction sauce, charred meat and pepper spice, with acidity that rolls into the finish.
title: Epiphany 2016 Hampton Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: This wine is full of unmistakable varietal character, bursting with black-cherry and pine-forest aromas, filling the palate with a ripe-tart tension between black and red fruits, and staying nimble and balanced in terms of texture.
title: Aquinas 2016 Pinot Noir (North Coast)

description: This is a throwback to a more savory style of Cabernet Sauvignon that was once the norm in California. Aromas of crushed oregano, peppercorn and pencil shavings lead into a palate that is full in rocky minerality and dried herbs, but there's also dark cranberry fruit to round it out.
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Flood Family Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)

description: From an estate vineyard this combines 60% Merlot and 40% Cabernet Sauvignon. Together, they offer a broad, succulent experience of strawberry and cassis that's bright and full bodied, with an underlying density that finishes dipped in leather and black pepper.
title: Coursey Graves 2016 Bennett Mountain Estate Red (Bennett Valley)

description: This is a well-made, full-bodied white that delivers honeyed flavors of salted pretzel and toasted oak. The bolder richer elements are complemented by bright bursts of orange blossom, grapefruit and lemon pith.
title: Buena Vista 2016 Jovita's Selection Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Clean aromas of toast, oak, butter and nectarine cream make for a strong showing of a Paso Robles Chardonnay. There is great grip to the palate right away, with flavors of lime and apple skin leading into a toasted oak finish.
title: Robert Hall 2016 Cavern Select Chardonnay (Paso Robles)

description: Softened with the addition of 25% Merlot, this wine offers a combination of power with grace. Touches of tar, petrol and rocky mineral start this off on the nose. It's shows robust and tightly grained tannins on the palate, with a bold shock of blue fruit and cinnamon.
title: Chimney Rock 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: This edition of Rob Stuart's Autograph is spicy with a ginger-cookie character, anchored in brambly berry and black-cherry fruit. It's open and tasty, with a soft, easy finish.
title: R. Stuart & Co. 2016 Autograph Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Dark and tangy blackberry and black-plum-fruit aromas meet with a touch of charred meat on the nose of this bottling. The palate is well structured, carrying flavors of elderberry, violet and roasted cocoa on the edges.
title: Outward 2016 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This is a well-made value-driven red, tasting of blueberry cobbler, cinnamon and nutmeg, with a lingering touch of meat and smoke. Brawny and full bodied it benefits from bright underlying acidity.
title: Houdini 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: This young wine intrigues with texture and depth, adding detail to the brisk raspberry fruit. There's an herbal note throughout, and it lacks the richness of the previous vintage. An extra year or two of bottle age is recommended.
title: Winderlea 2016 Murto Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Northridge (54%) and Clifton Hill vineyards. The aromas offer notes of wet gravel, dried and fresh stem, orange rind, blackberry and dark plum. Sweet, somewhat linear raspberry and darker fruit flavors follow that bring a sense of purity and intent, with slightly tacky-seeming tannins backing it all up.
title: K Vintners 2016 Milbrandt Syrah (Wahluke Slope)

description: Cherry, crushed slate, wet soil, brick and dried leather make for a compelling nose in this enjoyable blend of 56% Sangiovese, 26% Syrah and 18% Cabernet Sauvignon. There is a tang of red berry fruit on the palate as well as integrated sandalwood spice.
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Tre Vini Flood Family Vineyards Red (Santa Barbara County)

description: A top-tier blend from several vineyards, this playful Pinot is full bodied and well built. It's robustly rich, ripe and firm in tannic structure. The oak supports flavors of juicy wild strawberry and raspberry as well as a persistent earthy note, while the finish offers lingering hints of vanilla and cola.
title: MacPhail 2016 The Flyer Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Tart red fruits and tangy herbs make for a familiar and varietally correct lead into this bottling, which also shows a funky Old World touch as well. The red fruit and dried herbs also pop on the palate, yet so does that sour funk.
title: Chuparosa 2016 Cabernet Franc (Ramona Valley)

description: With a steely core of apple, pear and lemon, this wine takes on a considerable concentration of richness midpalate, with subtle oak playing a supporting role. The texture is creamy and voluptuously lush.
title: Char Char 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Made from 65% Syrah, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Merlot, this tastes of caramel toffee and red cherry, and is sizable in weight and ripeness. The structure is moderate and the wine softly approachable.
title: Lobo 2016 Howl Wulff Vineyards Custom Red (Napa Valley)

description: The grapes for this wine come from the Rodgers Creek Vineyard in the new appellation. This is a hearty barrel-fermented white that's lush and luxurious, moderate in oak with big flavors of marshmallow, peach and vanilla.
title: Silverpoint Cellars 2016 Chardonnay (Petaluma Gap)

description: Chalky bulky tannins round out a bold big-flavored hit of smoky oak and green herb in this red, blended with 10% Cabernet Sauvignon and 6% Petite Sirah.
title: Educated Guess 2016 Educated Guess Merlot (Napa County)

description: This extremely smoky oaky wine is full bodied but not too tannic and has a touch of sweetness in the flavors. Charred wood and maple-syrup aromas lead to maraschino cherry flavors and more smoky oaky accents on the palate.
title: Ironstone 2016 Cabernet Franc (Lodi)

description: This has a dull nose and disjointed acidity, offering leathery brawn and a strong waft of lavender without complexity.
title: Kalaris 2016 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

description: This is an exceptionally well-made wine at the price point: floral and appealing in quiet waves of citrus, baked pear and nutmeg. Integrated oak gives it power and strength within an edge of mineral-laden acidity.
title: La Crema 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Both concentrated and luxurious, this wine is a classic that offers a broad range of enticing aromas, plenty of delicious fruit in the middle and a lingering finish. Clove, cedar and cassis fill the aromas, while ripe blueberry and black cherry flood the palate. A great balance of a velvety texture and soft tannins holds it all together.
title: Lava Cap 2016 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (El Dorado)

description: This wine is complex, concentrated and deep, like an old-vine wine should be. It shows whiffs of dried earth, sage and black pepper in the aroma and hearty flavors that range from savory herbs to potent blackberry and clove. It is full bodied, dry, firmly tannic and has a long lingering finish.
title: Fiddletown Cellars 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)

description: This is a richly built wine, with flavors of juicy black cherry and baking spice. Citrus-driven acidity offers length to the full-bodied palate.
title: MacRostie 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: From vines planted in 1974, this vine-designate is spicy, savory and rocky in mineral content, with a broadly lush palate that's succulent in texture. Immensely pleasurable and appealing, it has an exuberance of fruit and spice.
title: Lynmar 2016 Old Vines Quail Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Exotic cherry aromas mix with mace and other rum-barrel spices on the nose of this blend of 46% Mourvedre, 31% Syrah, 18% Grenache and 5% Counoise. There's a burst of red cherry and tart strawberry on the palate, which then settles into a smooth suave texture.
title: Tablas Creek 2016 Esprit de Tablas Red (Adelaida District)

description: Smooth aromas of mace, strawberry and red plum paste show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is a bit angular in texture, with sharp acidity and a raspberry sorbet flavor. A flash of vanilla unfolds on the finish.
title: Scheid 2016 Doctor's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Creamy and lushly full bodied, this wine is complemented by a gritty texture of mineral and crushed rock, the whole integrated and well structured. Bold ripe flavors of pear are met by baking spice and toasted oak that linger with abandon on the finish.
title: Entrepreneur 2016 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Juicy in blue and black fruit, this is a thick, tangy and savory wine. Clove, forest floor and black tea play supporting roles on the palate. It's rich and will satisfy fans of a richer style of Pinot.
title: Davis Bynum 2016 Jane's VIneyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Fruit for this wine is 43% Destiny Ridge, 30% Wallula, 14% Red Willow and 13% Stillwater Creek vineyards. Aromas of blueberry, herb and flower are followed by ripe but still in check blue and black fruit flavors that coat the palate but show a sense of elegance. Herbal notes persist on the finish. It brings a lot of appeal.
title: Structure 2016 Bauhaus Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Smoky oak and caramel enriched the expansive palate of this intense, ripe and powerful red that's black in brooding fruit and root beer. Well made in a big style, it finishes in mocha chocolate.
title: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Apple Lane Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: In this lovely and complex white from estate fruit, winemaker Elizabeth Vianna blends 79% Sauvignon Blanc with 21% Sauvignon Gris to offer an intense, ripe and thick-bodied wine that's lush and layered. The fruit is a mix of green apple and quince.
title: Chimney Rock 2016 Elevage Blanc Estate Grown White (Napa Valley)

description: This twist-top blend of various vineyards is an affordable and excellent way to get a taste of what this historic winery is up to. Aromas of black raspberry, turned loam and savory dried meats lead into a tense palate that bursts with berry and is layered with black rock minerality.
title: Saucelito Canyon 2016 Backroads Zinfandel (San Luis Obispo)

description: A bright raspberry aroma meets accents of hibiscus tea, turned soil and wet rock on the nose. The palate brings broad flavors of sour cherry and thyme that are enhanced by peppery spice and a grippy texture.
title: Metz Road 2016 Riverview Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: This is well made and big in style: a full-bodied, soft and round white offering an intensity of baked pineapple and mango. The spice component complements the bolder fruit and substantial oak, finishing in spicy nutmeg.
title: Frank Family 2016 Beckstoffer Carneros Lake Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: This is a broad-shouldered, richly unctuous white despite its un-oaked approach. Spicy ginger, ripe mango and pear are aligned with a lasting taste of caramel.
title: Pellet Estate 2016 Sun Chase Vineyard Un-Oaked Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: The fresh, snappy fruit flavors in this medium-bodied wine are almost irrestible. It shows the charming, light and quaffable aspects of the grape that make it a good lunch wine or pre-dinner glass.
title: The Federalist 2016 Zinfandel (Lodi)

description: The aromas are light, with notes of red fruit, berry, fresh herb and whiffs of smoked meat. The palate shows an appealing sense of restraint, texture and balance that carries through the smoked meat finish. One wants a bit more aromatically, but the elegance of the palate delivers.
title: Structure 2016 Red Willow Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)

description: A thick, layered and richly woven red from a well-farmed site, this speaks loudly to the vintage and the appellation, imparting lovely flavors of black cherry, black tea and cola. Fleshy and beguiling, it lingers in vanilla.
title: Migration 2016 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine shows good concentration in color, flavor and texture. It is deep and dark, with ripe, jammy tones of blackberry and black cherry. Significant baking-spice elements add complexity, while fine-grained tannins add a thick texture.
title: Educated Guess 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)

description: Tea, forest floor and rose petal combine forcefully on the nose of this wine, before a torrent of thick, underlying cranberry and cassis take over. The savory complements the fruit well, finishing in a twist of burnt orange peel.
title: Iris 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a thick, rich and unctuously varietal wine, smoky in oak and beautifully wrapped layers of grilled meat and game. A thicket of lavender and licorice gives it complexity and more to ponder.
title: Coursey Graves 2016 West Slope Syrah (Bennett Valley)

description: A rich and concentrated varietal wine, this is tannic and edgy, with robust layers of rhubarb, cherry cola and dark chocolate. Its oak imprint is strong and seasoned in vanilla.
title: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Bateman Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Aromas of red and black raspberry, cigar box, mandarin orange, dried herb, flower, white pepper and gummy bear are followed by light, soft, red fruit flavors. It has a pretty, elegant styling, with a lingering finish.
title: Palencia 2016 Grenache (Yakima Valley)

description: Grenache makes up 60% of this wine, followed by Mourvedre and Syrah.
