Perfumed tangerine peel, flower, white pepper, ash, green herb and raspberry aromas are followed by soft, supple, elegant red fruit flavors, laced with peppery accents. What's there is pretty, but the concentration seems light, especially in the middle.
title: Palencia 2016 Casa Amarilla G-S-M (Yakima Valley)

description: This kitchen sink blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and more offers aromas of boysenberry, alpine strawberry and peppercorn on the fresh nose. The earthy palate combines violet and black cherry with a pinch of pepper.
title: Zaca Mesa 2016 Toyon Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Very rich and ripe, this lip-smacking wine has abundant grapey jammy blackberry-like aromas and flavors, and a broad, mouthfilling texture. It's well-backed by moderate tannins to balance out all that fruit.
title: Collier Creek 2016 Big Rooster Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

description: Gobs of fruit flavor and a rich, rounded texture make this wine fun to taste and easy to enjoy. It practically oozes blackberry and black cherry flavors, and is supported by mild tannins and a velvety mouthfeel.
title: Sobon Estate 2016 Rocky Top Zinfandel (Amador County)

description: Full bodied and firm textured, this wine offers plenty of fruit flavor, light oak shadings from the use of 30% new oak barrels and a good grippy mouthfeel.
title: Oak Farm 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)

description: Green pepper, green herb, jalapeno and black cherry aromas are followed by sleek, fresh, well-balanced fruit flavors. One wants a bit more concentration but what's there is pleasing, accented by tart, lively acidity.
title: Brook & Bull 2016 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This wine has a good range of fruit, spice and wood flavors along with appealing balance and a smooth, lightly tannic texture. Hints of cedar, black cherry and raspberry light up the palate.
title: Urgency 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Spicy clove and black pepper adorn a burly build of subdued black fruit in this reserve-level wine. The finish is soft and moderate.
title: Rutherford Ranch 2016 Reserve Malbec (Napa Valley)

description: Tart, tangy acidity is persistent through this wine's full-bodied character of robust dark-red fruit, black tea and dried herb. It offers richness and ripeness.
title: Peter Paul Wines 2016 Gravenstein Highway Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This wine is big, bold and densely textured. Ripe blackberry and violet aromas lead to rich saturated fruit flavors, very little oakiness and a very full mouthfeel boosted by layered tannins.
title: Berryessa Gap 2016 Durif (Yolo County)

description: Black cherry, wet loam, damp cedar and a pinch of cocoa show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very tense with tannins and searing acid, though intense boysenberry flavors do peek through.
title: Bargetto 2016 Regan Vineyards Reserve Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This spicy oaky wine is not quite sweet, but is packed full of strawberry jam, maple syrup and Maraschino cherry flavors that give it an exuberant, fruity personality. It has good fruit acidity and light tannins to add some textural counterpoint to the jamminess.
title: Precision Wine 2016 Navigator Zinfandel (Lodi)

description: Intensely expressive fruit flavors carry this full-boded wine from first whiff through lingering finish. Bright black-cherry tones meet violets in the aroma, while black cherry, blackberry and rhubarb fill out the palate. The flavors are unusually pure and well delineated and the balance is spot-on, as moderate tannins and good fruit acidity bolster the mouthfeel.
title: Goldeneye 2015 Confluence Vineyard Lower Bench Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Bright and snappy violet aromas lead into black peppers and charred blackberry on the elegant nose of this bottling, created from the winery's best-barrels released each vintage. The palate is taut and grippy with firm tannins and perfectly primed acid, which will carry the dried herb and pepper flavors into the deep future. Drink 2020 - 2030.
title: Jaffurs 2015 Upslope Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is a blend of fruit from the Mark Bradford, Grace and Cote Sud vineyards. Designed as a snapshot of the estate's overall terroir, it succeeds admirably, resulting in a smooth, forward and inviting wine which is ready for near-term consumption. Lovely red berry and cherry fruit is highlighted by nuanced threads of tea and tobacco. The wine spent 18 months in half new French oak barrels.
title: Domaine Serene 2015 Aspect Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This wine is pretty, floral and compact in red fruit, the texture soft and billowy on the palate. Rich and full bodied, it has additional complexity from small amounts of Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Integrated beautifully, it shows balance and power in equal measure.
title: Alpha Omega 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This blends 71% Cabernet Sauvignon with 13% Cabernet Franc, 11% Petit Verdot and 5% Merlot. Together, they present a reduced grip of tar, black cherry, blackberry and substantial power within a graceful frame of supportive acidity and integrated oak. Let this one lie; enjoy best 2025 - 2030.
title: Alpha Omega 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)

description: This lovely vineyard-designate is expertly put together, showing honeyed concentration and evolved flavors of baked apple and apricot. Floral in honeysuckle and apple blossom, it has substantive layers of bold texture and body, with a steely undertow of fresh acidity.
title: Alpha Omega 2015 Toyon Vineyard Chardonnay (Los Carneros)

description: This is sourced from the oldest vineyard on the estate, a high-elevation site now reaching optimum maturity. The flavors are a deep, densely textured mix of black fruits, cocoa powder and baking spices. It's a stunning bottle, delicious now and a choice cellar candidate through 2030.
title: Domaine Serene 2015 Mark Bradford Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This vintage of the perennial knockout is exceptional - a concentrated blend of 90% Cabernet Sauvignon, 7% Petit Verdot, 2% Cabernet Franc and 1% Malbec. Pencil shavings, red currant and red plum are complemented by hints of crushed rock and cocoa, with persistent acidity maintaining balance. Like so many of its forebears, this is a wine well worth cellaring; enjoy 2025 - 2035.
title: Joseph Phelps 2015 Insignia Estate Grown Red (Napa Valley)

description: A reserve-level wine sourced from the estate's Russell-Grooters vineyard, this new vintage vaults into the top ranks of high-end value wines from Oregon. It stands apart with expanded, deeper flavors than the excellent regular bottling from the same vineyard. Black fruits are layered around rich barrel flavors of Bourbon, Kahlua and molasses.
title: Carlton Cellars 2015 Roads End Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)

description: This is a well-structured, subtly flavored wine that should improve and become even more complex with a few years aging. It has bold black-cherry aromas, enticing black-fruit flavors that are more tangy than rich, and mild oak spices wending through from aroma to finish. Best after 2023.
title: La Crema 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Soothing and elegant aromas of blackberry meet with cedar, dill and oregano on the nose of this blend of 51% Cabernet Sauvignon from Santa Cruz County and 48% Syrah (plus 1% Viognier) from Monterey County. Woody flavors are woven throughout the dense blackberry and peppery spice of the palate.
title: Big Basin 2015 Odeon Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah

description: Fairly light in the glass, this single-vineyard expression offers aromas of candied cherry, caramel and hickory smoke on the nose. It's light in body but with immense amounts of tannic tension, showing flavors of smoked cherry, savory roasted pork and cranberry sauce on the palate.
title: Saarloos & Sons 2015 Broer Windmill Ranch Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

description: Salty, briny oak gives a lift to the bolder richer flavors of baked pear in this lovely vineyard-designate, made in small amounts. Caramel and vanilla accent a nicely lush, yet balanced palate of full flavor and grace.
title: Saxon Brown 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyard Green Acres Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Perfumed in rose and violet, this reserve-worthy red displays deft notes of currant, dark cherry and plum along an exotic mineral-laden lineup of crushed rock and cocoa powder. Plush and broadly expansive in tannin, it persists in a classic, old-world finish of dried herb, sage and clove. Enjoy best 2025 - 2030.
title: Robert Mondavi 2015 The Reserve To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: Savory expressive aromas introduce this wine, which is significantly riper than in the previous vintage. The palate is a generous mix of cherry pastry, cola and baking spices. It spent 17 months in half new French oak barrels.
title: Domaine Serene 2015 Fleur de Lis Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This is 100% whole cluster pressed, aged on skins for 43 days before being aged in half new and half neutral puncheons. Focused aromas of blackberry, black raspberry, clove pod, licorice, orange peel, smoked meat and herb lead to ripe, rich, lip-smacking fruit flavors that trail slightly on the finish. Its best days are in front of it.
title: K Vintners 2015 Cattle King Upland Vineyard Syrah (Snipes Mountain)

description: Spice, licorice, cigar box, lavender and blackberry aromas are at the fore. On the palate, the flavors are ripe and sweet, with the concentration dipping at times. The tannins seem quite clenched and dry at present. Perhaps some time in the bottle will stitch it all together.
title: K Vintners 2015 Klein Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: This has 14% Semillon. Together, the white grapes form a fleshy, floral core of bold full-bodied flavor and lemony oak, the structure impressively complex and lasting in texture.
title: Robert Mondavi 2015 Fume Blanc (Oakville)

description: This is a big-boned, robustly flavored red that offers concentrated tones of dark cherry and raspberry, with bolts of Asian spice. Sizable tannins support the richness of the fruit, coating the palate with aplomb and complexity.
title: JCB 2015 N0 11 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Meaty, big-boned and steeped in both woody oak and tannin, this is a brawny full-bodied wine with ample concentration. The midpalate takes on a succulence of juicy black currant and black cherry, finishing with a leathery accent.
title: Bennett Lane 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Aromas of cherry meats, spice, high-toned green herb, orange peel, citrus and earth are followed by focused, tart, citrusy flavors, with firm tannins providing support. Put it on the dinner table to see it at its best.
title: B. Leighton 2015 Olsen Brothers Vineyard Petit Verdot (Yakima Valley)

description: Coming from a site planted in 1997, the aromas are brooding but still draw you into the glass, with notes of blackberry, dark plum, black raspberry, licorice, ash and whiffs of dried orange peel and smoked meat. The palate is deep and rich, packing a powerful punch with an extended finish following, with Amaro-like bitters. The tannins bring a fair amount of astringency at present. Best after 2022.
title: K Vintners 2015 The Deal Sundance Vineyard Syrah (Wahluke Slope)

description: A two-barrel reserve selection, drawn from the estate-grown Pommard clone grapes, this mixes strawberries, raspberries and hints of dried straw. It was aged 18 months in 50% new French oak, lending flavors of vanilla tea and cut tobacco to the finish.
title: Holmes Gap 2015 Ace High Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine is co-fermented with 3% Viognier, with the fruit coming from the winery's estate. Outrageous aromas of cigar box, freshly peeled orange, smoked meat, wet gravel, sea salt, black pepper, peat and flower are followed by soft, light palate-coating but still deft fruit and savory flavors that sail into the distance. This is an area to watch in the valley.
title: K Vintners 2015 The Beautiful Powerline Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Aromas of grilled asparagus, fire pit, olive tapenade and hickory smoke are followed by pillowy soft savory flavors that glide on the finish, with the tannins bringing a grainy feel, needing some time to smooth out. This young, cobblestone-strewn vineyard is quickly establishing itself as a special site.
title: K Vintners 2015 Powerline Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Shy on the nose at first, this bottling, which is cofermented with 10% Cabernet Franc and 6% Petit Verdot, shows dried dill and roasted fennel bulb on the nose, with a strawberry tone slowly emerging. Oregano and black pepper meet with red fruit, star anise and cinnamon on the palate, which is still young and needs more time to come into its own.
title: Niner 2015 HH Reserve Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This is 100% varietal and made from the best vineyard blocks. Brawny and bright, it has substantial weight and tannin, accented in red and black cherry, plum, coconut and leather. Seasonings of dried herb linger on the long finish.
title: Pride Mountain 2015 Vintner Select Merlot (Sonoma County)

description: This vineyard is located at the winery's homestead property in Upper Mill Creek. Mortared green herb, grilled asparagus and smoked meat aromas are followed by light, elegant cherry and herb flavors that persist on the finish. Lightly gritty tannins back it up. It's all about delicacy, but it brings it in abundance. Best after 2019.
title: K Vintners 2015 Phil Lane Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Aromas of raspberry and cherry jam jump up from the glass. The palate brings a sense of delicacy that delights, with chalky, slightly dry-feeling tannins backing it up. There's no doubt about the warm vintage and appellation that it comes from, with the ripeness dialed up.
title: Substance 2015 Vineyard Collection Me Northridge Vineyard Merlot (Wahluke Slope)

description: Salty briny oak meets big concentrated flavors of black currant, black cherry and leather in this bold brawny red. It is blended with 9% Cabernet Sauvignon, which adds to its tannic power and spicy length.
title: Saddleback 2015 Merlot (Oakville)

description: Aromas of raspberry jam and dried herb lead to a palate that shows a dazzling sense of purity, texture and deftness to the ripe fruit flavors. An herbal streak runs throughout. It's a very pretty interpretation of the variety.
title: Willow 2015 Boushey Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)

description: The aromas are fruit forward, with notes of raspberry and cherry along with cola, herb and spice accents, pushing the boundaries of ripeness. The palate can't quite live up to that promise, coming off as lighter in style with slightly grippy tannins out of the gate. Coffee notes linger on the finish.
title: Substance 2015 Vineyard Collection Stoneridge Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Earthy with tart acidity, this wine is hearty and full bodied, with a depth of concentrated black cherry and pomegranate. It finishes in a dark swath of dark chocolate and coffee.
title: La Crema 2015 Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)

description: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up 45% of this wine, with the balance 28% Merlot and 27% Cabernet Franc, each of which shows itself. Vibrant, appealing aromas of raspberry jam, licorice, cranberry, dried flower, crushed blackberry and herb are followed by tightly wound fruit flavors. The tannins bring a fair amount of grip and dry grit.
title: Substance 2015 Vineyard Collection Bx Klein Vineyard Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up half of this wine, with the balance 33% Merlot and a whopping 17% Petit Verdot. Reticent aromas of cherry and spice are followed by cherry and cranberry flavors. The tannins bring a firm, dry grip.
title: Noviello 2015 Luigi Red (Red Mountain)

description: This is a rare Columbia Valley appellated wine that comes from a vineyard on the Oregon side. Baking-spice, mocha, cherry and tire-rubber aromas are at the fore. Somewhat lighter-seeming fruit flavors follow and paint around the edges. It provides interest but doesn't all work.
title: Adega Northwest 2015 Firethorn Vineyard Trillium Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (OR))

description: This is a thick, richly layered red from the producer's site - one of the cooler sides of the vineyard. Lush on the palate, it has tender elements of black currant, smoked meat, black pepper, licorice and lavender, a complex array of elements that shows room for further evolution. Enjoy 2025 - 2030.
title: Chimney Rock 2015 Tomahawk Vineyard Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: Coming from a mountain vineyard nearly 2,300 feet above the eastern Salinas Valley, this blend of 44% Cabernet Sauvignon, 38% Merlot, 8% Cabernet Franc, 6% Malbec and 4% Petit Verdot offers a taste of a unique terroir. Aromas of red cherry, oregano and cigar box lead into a complex palate of tangy black-plum skin and dried herbs, all framed by strong acid and a light but taut structure.
title: Big Basin 2015 Altitude 2292 Red (Monterey County)

description: This wine is made from some of the smallest, densest berries on the property's northern end, a warm, intense place for grapes. Floral on the nose, it presents chalky tannin, ash and crushed rock-like minerality around a core of red and black cherry as well as plum. It offers substantial concentration and robust richness.
title: Chimney Rock 2015 Clone 4 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: From the Antle and Brosseau vineyards in the Chalone AVA, this 53% Mourvedre, 30% Grenache and 17% Syrah blend offers rich caramel, chocolate, black-cherry and bay leaf aromas on the nose. There's a great display of herbs across the palate, giving depth to the rich black-plum backdrop, framed by rounded acidity and tannic tension.
title: Big Basin 2015 Gabilan Mountains G-S-M (Monterey County)

description: This dark and brooding wine has everything in spades. The color is reddish-black, the aromas are full of new leather, oak dust and black cherry, while the flavors are ripe, generous black cherry, blueberry and dark chocolate. The 40% new American barrels adds spicinesss. There is no lack of the grape variety's famous tannins, but they are fine grained and contribute to a velvety saturated mouthfeel.
title: Amador Cellars 2015 Estate Tempranillo (Amador County)

description: This is intensely flavored in apricot and mango, the aromatics floral and beautiful in jasmine. Fleshy and broad, it lingers in oak and elements of wild vanilla and baking spice.
title: Alpha Omega 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Black plum, turned loam, spice cake and tar aromas show on the nose of this blend of 62% Syrah, 34% Grenache and 4% Mourvedre. It's rich and thick on the palate, with strong black-currant and licorice flavors that are simultaneously delivered with power and finesse.
title: Justin 2015 Trilateral Red (Paso Robles)

description: This is a well-integrated wine from the warmer appellation, the oak and tannin relatively tamed within a rich framework of baked plum, cherry and exuberant acidity. The flavors are robustly concentrated and widely appealing.
title: Raymond 2015 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)

description: A 100% varietal wine from the mountain appellation, this offers aromas of violet and cedar before delving into powerful flavors of cherry, blueberry and graham cracker. Well-developed tannins support the frame, retaining plenty of acidity and underlying succulence. Enjoy 2025 - 2030.
title: Davies 2015 Red Cap Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

description: Less than one-third of a ton per acre came off of this nearly 35-year-old vineyard from this drought-addled vintage, but what made it to bottle is quite amazing. Aromas of earthy thyme, sagebrush, wild black cherry and cocoa are layered and elegant. The palate is rich and thoroughly engaging in flavors of roasted tomato, mulberry and purple flower.
title: Calera 2015 Mills Vineyard Fortieth Anniversary Vintage Pinot Noir (Mt. Harlan)

description: Plush, lengthy and well integrated, this is a complex exotic mix of black licorice, leather, meat and plum. Made from one of the warmest parts of the vineyard, it has robust tannin structure and tension, finishing in a burst of clove and pepper.
title: Chimney Rock 2015 Clone 7 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: Dark in the glass, this Syrah aged entirely in clay amphora is fascinating, starting with aromas of roasted lamb and crushed peppercorns. Firm, mouthcoating tannins frame the extremely intense and rich palate, which carries dark fruit and wet-clay flavors. Drink 2019 - 2030.
title: Zaca Mesa 2015 Amphora Estate Vineyard Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Earthy in forest floor, this mountain wine is grippy and oaky, powerful in its grasp of a drought-affected vintage that offered density and concentration in spades. Stony dusty mineral components override the blue and black fruit that simmers beneath a full-bodied ripeness.
title: Alpha Omega 2015 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)

description: This full-bodied wine is unusually on-point for the varietal and tastes terrific. The cherry and blackberry flavors are nicely focused and the wine has great structure from moderate tannins and good fruit acidity.
designation: Jack Rabbit Flat Fox Creek Vineyards
title: Fiddletown Cellars 2015 Jack Rabbit Flat Fox Creek Vineyards Zinfandel (Amador County)

description: This wine has significant tannin power that presents as grippy and powerful on the palate. Soft underlying aspects of violet, dark cherry and plum are complemented by graphite and toasted oak, all within a full-bodied ripe rich persona. Enjoy 2025 - 2030.
title: Chimney Rock 2015 Ganymede Vineyard Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: Quite gamy and savory on the nose, this select bottling offers aromas of cracked black pepper, roast beef, crushed violet and elderberry. The palate falls in line with meaty, peppery flavors as well as a black currant and black-plum sauce, with hints of cardamom and chai tea.
title: Zaca Mesa 2015 Eight Barrel Syrah Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Woody aromas frame the blackberry-jam and vanilla-cookie scents on the nose of this blend of 43% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Primitivo and 24% Merlot. Concentrated flavors of blackberry and black-plum jam are leveled by pine-needle herbs on the rich palate.
title: Sculpterra 2015 Figurine Red (Paso Robles)

description: Brawny layers of blueberry and blackberry show in this broad and textured wine. Supple yet powerful tannins frame flavors of cedar, sage and cinnamon, which it an attractive, appealing vibe.
title: Mount Veeder 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: There is a strong sense of minerality to the nose of this bottling, with aromas of wet stone, turned loam and moist clay covering up the background fruits. The structure is very tannic on the palate, where elderberry and purple-flower flavors emerge from the soil-like core.
title: Big Basin 2015 Sixty-Two Terraces Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is a powerfully concentrated wine that's balanced by an underlying brightness. The juicy acidity supports flavors of red cherry and plum, while integrated tannins give it a plush feel that's widely appealing.
title: The Calling 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Sanguine in red currant and cherry, this full-bodied wine is juicy, soft and round, with polished tannins and integrated oak. It impresses with its ability to offer varietal character and overall approachability.
title: Rombauer 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Labelled in velvet, the thick dense texture of this wine is equally soft and richly built, with substantial tannin and oak on display. Bright red cherry and cassis are interwoven between the powerful ripeness.
title: Raymond 2015 Reserve Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This is a big bottle made to mark the winery's 25th anniversary. Integrated, rich and well-structured, it merits its purpose, offering dusty mineral notes around a softness of oak, clove, cedar and chocolate toffee.
title: Frank Family 2015 Owner's Red (Rutherford)

description: This is made from two of the producer's properties, Cold Springs and Croquet Estate, both atop the mountain appellation. It shows the power of those sites and a drought-driven vintage. The core is dense and tannic with an intensity of baked plum and dark chocolate.
title: Clif Family 2015 Kit's Killer Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

description: Very concentrated and very tannic, this wine is young and tightly wound, so it will need plenty of time to reach peak enjoyment. The black-pepper, cranberry and espresso flavors are enticing but difficult to get to now. Best after 2025.
title: Parducci 2015 Small Lot Petite Sirah (Mendocino)

description: This big wine strikes a good balance between ripe delicious fruit flavors and the notorious tannic bite of the varietal. Black cherry and blackberry fill the aroma and flavors, while a very firm texture gives them plenty of support.
title: Fiddletown Cellars 2015 Petite Sirah (Amador County)

description: Black cherry and woody cedar aromas show strongly on the nose of this blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc and 25% Merlot. It's quite thick and stiff on the palate, where the wood spice overtakes the dark-cherry fruit.
title: Sculpterra 2015 Maquette Red (Paso Robles)

description: Concentrated blackberry syrup, lilac, caramel and cedar show on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong cigar-box element to the palate, but it works with the rich black-currant flavors, all framed by tense tannins.
title: Martin Ranch 2015 Therese Vineyards Dos Ninas Vineyard Syrah (Santa Clara Valley)

description: This wine delivers substantial bang for the buck, blending a majority of Merlot with sizable amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, and small drops of Petit Verdot and Malbec. Firm tannins grip flavors of sage, cedar and graphite, with smoky blackberry playing on the full-bodied palate.
title: Kirkland Signature 2015 Red (Napa Valley)

description: This bold and full-bodied wine has ripe jammy Port-like aromas, plump blackberry flavors and a rich, almost-sweet, palate impression. It's certainly mouth coating and tooth staining.
title: Riaza 2015 Unorthodox Syrah (Mokelumne River)

description: Tangy and tart in acidity and jolts of forest floor, this wine shows a generosity of body, richness and oak, while remaining reserved in fruit.
title: WindVane 2015 Reserve Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: A very earthy, spicy wine, this delights in red cherry, pomegranate and black tea, the body complex and full bodied with impressive density. Crisp, fresh acidity lies beneath the richness, complementing and refreshing.
title: Saxon Brown 2014 Fighting Brothers Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This carbonically fermented bottling shows plenty of herbal kick to the nose (from sagebrush to wild thyme), which is set against the light, tart red-fruit aromas. The palate is framed by a cranberry and cherry backdrop that allows the herbaceous side to shine, from potpourri to tea leaves. This is a great food wine.
title: Saarloos & Sons 2014 O.G. Windmill Ranch Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

description: In past vintages Dave Jepson has made a pair of Pinots but in 2014 he decided that a single wine from the blend was his best option. This seems mature beyond its years, with a soft entry leading to flavors of spice-cake plums and raisins. Highlights of gingerbread and plum pudding come through, leading to the suggestion that this is best enjoyed now through 2020.
title: Treos 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Floral and spicy in ginger bread and a richness of creme brulee, this is a big bold wine in style and approach. Fully realized flavors of baked pear give it additional power and concentration, as a lingering freshness of lemon zest sizzles on the finish.
title: Entrepreneur 2014 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This monster of a wine is made from a very unusual grape variety for California. It shows a deep dark color, potent, smoky black-pepper aromas and bone-dry black-fruit flavors carried by unflinchingly firm tannins. It's fascinating to taste and imagine how long the wine should age to lose at least some of its impressive grip. Best after 2030.
title: Y Rousseau 2014 Tannat (Mendocino County)

description: This hearty red wine is a blend of 57% Cabernet Sauvignon, 37% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc and 1% Petit Verdot. The palate twists together flavors of cedar and sage with black cherry and blackberry, supported by a full-bodied, powerful structure.
title: Duckhorn 2014 The Discussion Red (Napa Valley)

description: Inviting in rich layers that taste of cinnamon toast, dusty black fruit and clove, this is a powerfully built and nicely layered wine that has tannic structure to spare.
title: Summers 2014 Checkmate Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)

description: Though predominantly Zinfandel, this field blend from a vineyard planted in 1984 by Dick Sias also includes Primitivo, Aleatico, Alicante Bouschet, Carignan, Grenache and Petite Sirah, and is a great taste of the past. Blackberry, thyme and dried mint aromas drop into a palate of black plum, loamy soil, dried herbs and cocoa. This is full bodied and well layered.
title: Joullian 2014 Sias Cuvee Zinfandel (Carmel Valley)

description: A deep red-berry aroma meets with mocha and toasty oak on the richly layered nose of this bottling by the Riboli family. There is solid complexity to the palate, with chalky tannins sitting beside more cocoa, red fruit and light caramel. This is an affordable wine to lay down. Drink now - 2029.
title: Maddalena 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This wine is earthy, dusty and mineral-driven, with a lasting taste of dried herb, cedar and sage. Bright, underlying acidity lifts the midpalate from its full-bodied richness as red currant, cherry and cassis come into the light.
title: Frisson Wines 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Juicy with just a slight touch of reduction, this wine is thick and well-integrated - a small-production offering that reflects well on the appellation. Plum, black cherry and hints of black licorice toy with the nose and palate, finishing in balance and grace.
title: Paratus 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

description: Sanguine notes of red currant and plum meet a light dusting of baking spice and clove in this well-made, well-integrated wine. It shows a heartiness of full-bodied richness and toasted oak.
title: St. Supery 2014 Estate Vineyard Merlot (Rutherford)

description: This wine looks deep and dark, smells like black fruits and tastes concentrated, ripe and nicely dry. It has firm tannins and good acidity to boost the texture and enough depth in the fruit flavors to last on the finish.
title: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Signature Tempranillo (Amador County)

description: Dark-black-plum aromas are fresh but dense on the nose of this bottling, which also offers tarragon, tobacco and bay leaf scents. The eucalyptus streak is strong on the tip of the sip but then warms up into baked blackberry and black-cherry flavors.
title: Balderdash 2014 Brakelight Syrah (Edna Valley)

description: This Cabernet Sauvignon-based blend includes smaller amounts of Malbec, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc, in that order. Together, they offer a robust, oaky and soft expression of mild blue and black fruit, dusted in toasted oak and tobacco.
title: Rodney Strong 2014 Symmetry Meritage (Alexander Valley)

description: From an New York operation located in the Hudson Valley that bills itself as the oldest continuously operating winery in the country, this bottling shows baked cherries, blackberries, molasses and anise on the nose. It's rounded and rich on the palate, where charred red fruits meet with cocoa atop a decently structured texture.
title: Brotherhood 2014 1839 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: This is a brawny, meaty and thick wine made from Cabernet Sauvignon grapes grown on mountains, hillsides and ridges of Alexander Valley and Knights Valley. The tannins grip as smoky oak gives it additional weight and power around huge layers of peppery clove and black currant.
title: Stature 2013 Red (Sonoma County)

description: Dried out aromas of cherry, anise, vanilla, baking spice and cola lead to a palate that shows more of the same. The fruit seems quite desiccated, with the tannins a bit jagged. It seems quite evolved for its age.
title: Tamarack Cellars 2013 20th Anniversary Emerald Release Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Earthy aromas of gravelly minerality, clay and damp wood meet with tart red currants on the nose of this lightly bodied Cab from a historic vineyard. There is a lot of herbal tension to the palate, which is fairly green and framed by tannins that still need smoothing out.
title: Buttonwood Farm 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This wine is a blend of two-thirds Cabernet Sauvignon and one-third Syrah. The aromas bring notes of cherry, raspberry, herb, cafe au lait and pencil eraser. The medium-bodied fruit flavors are fresh and focused, with gritty tannins backing them up.
title: Vital 2016 The Given Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Lots of rocky earth and chaparral scrub aromas meet with mellow black-plum and strawberry fruit on the rustic yet refined nose of this blend of two vineyards. The palate combines peppercorn, elderberry and more dried earth.
title: Saucelito Canyon 2015 Dos Ranchos Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Soft and nicely integrated, this full-bodied wine is robustly built yet sublime in its grasp of firm tannin and fresh acidity. Flavors of raspberry, cherry, mint and an earthy forest floor component complement each other well.
title: Friedeman 2016 UV Lancel Creek Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Long on flavor and complexity, this full-bodied wine bursts with black-cherry, black-tea and redwood-forest aromas, before flooding the palate with delicious, just-ripe fruit flavors that come with a nicely gripping texture due to fine-grained tannins and medium to full body.
title: Black Kite 2016 River Turn Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: The old vines referenced are Pommard clone, own-rooted, and planted in 1976. A complex array of tart fruits run from cranberry to raspberry, juicy and resolving in a light suggestion of Dr. Pepper soda. Aging for 18 months in half new French oak barrels adds highlights of toasted hazelnuts. Drink now through the early 2020s.
title: Dion 2016 Old Vines Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This is an integrated, well-made white, with juicy acidity and a robust ripeness. Grainy apple, pear and lemon flavors provide texture as additional accents of nutmeg, lemongrass and tea intrigue.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Allen Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: Full bodied and very plush in texture, this supersmooth wine starts with aromas of cooked cherries and plums, moves to richer, sweet-seeming strawberries and red cherries on the palate while it coats the tongue and sides of the mouth with an appealing, creamy texture.
title: MacPhail 2016 Toulouse Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Supple red fruit and candied berries meet with a touch of turned loam on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines cocoa, red cherry and a touch of earthy funk with a powerful acidity.
title: Sextant 2016 Estate Merlot (Paso Robles)

description: Soft and oaky, this wine has a fruit-forward tropical edge that finds companionship in sweet notions of vanilla and nougat.
title: Educated Guess 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)

description: Silky in delicate layers of strawberry and light spice, this wine builds power and concentration as it opens in the glass, becoming darker and more brooding in fruit. Baking-spice and black-tea components give it a savory edge that works well in the larger context.
title: MacRostie 2016 Klopp Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From portions of the Burning Creek and Lafond Vineyards, this fruit-forward wine is a solid deal, starting with strong aromas of black cherry, licorice and nutmeg. It's a full-flavored Pinot Noir that currently shows a rather tense structure, carrying flavors of black raspberry, boysenberry and black pepper.
title: Santa Barbara Winery 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is a solid bottling from the upper reaches of the Malibu Coast appellation, showing oak smoke, black cherry and a hint of dried mint on the nose. The palate, which is bolstered with 6% Petite Sirah, 4% Merlot and 2% Cabernet Franc offers flavors of savory meat and roasted cherries, all wrapped in taut tannins that stand firm in the finish.
title: Malibu Rocky Oaks 2016 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Malibu Coast)

description: This wine is 100% varietal, with all of the fruit coming from Stillwater Creek Vineyard. Aromas of char, roasted coffee bean, fresh herb and cherry lead creamy-feeling fruit and barrel flavors, with toast and coffee notes lingering on the finish. The barrel influence seems overweighted for the fruit that's in the bottle, but there are good things going on if it settles in.
title: Sightglass 2016 Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Ripe and lush, this full-bodied wine practically oozes raspberry and sweet cherry flavors. The texture is very smooth and polished too.
title: Berryessa Gap 2016 Zinfandel (Yolo County)

description: Very dark in the glass and a tad wound up even three years in, this bottling graciously opens into aromas of lamb roast, charcoal and cassis. It has commanding presence on the palate, with a rich heavy luxurious mouthfeel that delivers flavors of lavender, rosemary, espresso and more cassis.
title: Alta Colina 2015 Old 900 Syrah (Adelaida District)

description: There's considerable heft, weight and heady-ness to this vintage from Alta Colina, and it requires patience to fully explore. This blend of 52% Grenache, 41% Syrah and 7% Mourvedre offers soft aromas of blackberry, black plum and crushed slate on the focused nose. The palate is full with black-plum and caramel touches, wrapped in tight, young tannins. Drink now through 2030.
title: Alta Colina 2015 Estate G-S-M (Adelaida District)

description: Grippy black cherry and blackberry burst out of the entry of this full-bodied, richly concentrated wine, its palate lush, smooth and big-boned. Dried herb and a floral tease of rose round out the fruit-forward experience.
title: Bennett Lane 2015 Lynch Family Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)

description: Cabernet Sauvignon comprises half of this wine, with the rest equal parts Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Dark chocolate, baking spice, black licorice, graphite, dried herb and cherry aromas are followed by ripe fruit flavors that bring appeal.
title: Noviello 2015 Brava Red (Red Mountain)

description: Comes from this esteemed vineyard on the Wahluke Slope. The aromas rise up, with notes of apple, dried cherry and baking spice, seeming a bit desiccated. Plentiful fruit flavors follow, with the tannins bringing a firm grip, needing some time to loosen.
title: Adega Northwest 2015 Weinbau Vineyard Block 10 Cabernet Sauvignon (Wahluke Slope)

description: From the exciting appellation that is Coombsville, this wine starts with beautiful aromas of violet and clove before opening up on the palate to a generous array of blackberry, plum and black pepper. Full bodied, it shows elegance and a sense of balance that holds up through a lengthy finish.
title: Faust 2015 The Pact Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)

description: This is a powerfully built, age-worthy wine, robustly concentrated and dense in elements of tobacco, gunpowder, turned earth and leather. Sizable tannins give it additional weight and breadth, as well as structure: a sign of the vintage as well as site. Best 2025 - 2030.
title: M by Michael Mondavi 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Dusty rock and mineral characterize this wine throughout its full-bodied concentration of ripe plum and black cherry. Cedar, graphite and oak provide context and additional complexity, rounding out on a finish of dried herb, clove and black pepper.
title: Alpha Omega 2015 Beckstoffer Georges III Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: Structured in plenty of firm juicy acidity, this wine impresses from the get-go, offering softly layered elements of anise, pear and fig. Creamy and lush on the midpalate, it lingers in ginger and lemongrass exoticism, leaving a memorable impression.
title: Pellet Estate 2015 Sun Chase Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: This blends 60% Cabernet Sauvignon with 25% Petit Verdot, 9% Malbec and 6% Merlot. The combination is electrifying, beautifully layered, dusty and flavorful in cassis and plum. With a backbone of structure, it lingers in a memorable jolt of nutmeg oak. Enjoy 2025 - 2030.
title: Round Pond 2015 Proprietary Red (Rutherford)

description: This offers classic flavors of crisp, red currant and cassis, with background notes of dried herb and floral rose. The tannins are sturdy and supportive of the fruit. Toasted oak components are emphasized on the lengthy peppery finish.
title: Animo 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Brawny char and dark chocolate create a stage for jammy black cherry and blackberry to star in this big-boned full-bodied wine. Generous use of oak and substantial tannin give it an oomph of power that persists through a soft rounded finish.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: This massively built Rhone-style wine is chock full of equal parts color, flavor and tannin. It smells like blackberries, black cherries and black pepper, tastes ripe and rich, and feels very firm and tannic in texture.
title: Naggiar 2015 La Bete Noire Estate Reserve Red (Sierra Foothills)

description: Savory spice components of cardamom meet black tea and forest floor in this powerful rich wine. A blend of the best blocks and barrels from several vineyards gives it a complex set of flavors and textures, from delicate and elegant to structured and age-worthy. Best 2020 - 2025.
title: MacRostie 2015 The Loch Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Hearty red-fruit and graham cracker richness mark this well-made wine, blended with 8% Cabernet Sauvignon. A generous tannin structure provides a framework for the ripe weight as the finish explores aspects of sweet tobacco.
title: Whitehall Lane 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: From a Conn Valley vineyard estate and 100% varietal, this wine is tightly wound and full bodied, reflective of the vintage and the warmer climes. It is intensely flavored and dense, grippy in leathery tannin and oak power, with a dusting of dried herb and graphite.
title: Neyers 2015 AME Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Bright and fruity red-currant and baked berry aromas blend with turned earth and mint-chocolate-chip aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate's silky tannins and plush texture carry bright ripe fruit flavors with a hint of anise.
title: Indigene 2015 Ambiente Red (Paso Robles)

description: This full-bodied white has an intensity of oak and baked fruit, which is a combination of apple and pear. Aromas of nutmeg accentuate the richness and warmth of the overall experience.
title: J. McClelland 2015 Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)

description: This is a brawny, lushly made wine, rich in dark cherry and blackberry fruit. Lengthy and structured in nature, it takes on broader notes of milk chocolate, vanilla and nutmeg as it evolves on the finish.
title: Kennedy Family 2014 Vite Centanni Vineyard Estate Grown Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: Gorgeous fruit flavors meet darker clove notes in this exuberant but also well-structured and moderately tannic wine, made from a Rhone grape variety better known as Mourvedre. Good acidity lifts the mouthfeel and keeps it tasting lively through the finish.
title: Riaza 2014 Prospector Monastrell (Calaveras County)

description: This is a grainy, structured and textured white, lifted by bright acidity and crisp flavors of apple, peach and pear. It has concentration of flavor as well as tension, offering length and balance within an elegant framework.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Lewis MacGregor Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The producer's new Nomad collection includes bottlings from every marquee Beckstoffer Cabernet Sauvignon vineyard in the Napa Valley. This is an herbal, dusty, old-world offering, deep in grippy tannins and the youthful vigor of firm acidity. Pencil shavings, red currant and a streak of cocoa play on the palate with bright abandon. Enjoy best from 2026 - 2030.
title: Stewart 2016 Nomad Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Smooth and stony in mineral elements, this is a complex, medium-bodied and structured white. It is well defined in bold flavors of green apple, melon and Meyer lemon.
title: Les Belles Collines 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine comes from the Upper Mill Creek area of the valley and is blended with 8% Viognier. The aromas are perfumed in tones of flowers and freshly peeled oranges, while raspberry and plum notes become more prominent over time. The palate brings an elegant blueberry flavor, with swoon-worthy purity and balance that carries through the long finish.
title: Elephant Seven 2016 Yellow Bird Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Entirely stainless-steel fermented, this is an impressive estate wine, highly aromatic in honeysuckle. Structured and fleshy on the midpalate, it has full-bodied ripeness and a concentration of rich white-peach and apricot flavor.
title: Hess Collection 2016 Small Block Series Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)

description: This full-bodied, ripe and rich wine swells with melon and pineapple flavors and feels soft and lazy in texture. It has low acidity and a buttery thread running through it.
title: Iron Hub 2016 Small Lot Chardonnay (Sierra Foothills)

description: Tart blackberry, cracked pepper, lilac and a touch of balsamic show on the nose of this blend. There are savory char and peppery notes to the palate, which surrounds dark-berry flavors.
title: Cloak & Dagger 2016 Cryptology Red (Paso Robles)

description: Blended with 8% Viognier. The aromas start out surprisingly subdued, with notes of raspberry jam, flower and herb. The flavors are lighter in style, shortening up on the warm finish. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.
title: Elephant Seven 2016 Yellow Bird Vineyard Block 3 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Big, soft and fruity with a touch of confectionery richness, this wine offers intense ripeness and moderate structure.
title: Tamber Bey 2016 Deux Chevaux Vineyard Dijon Chardonnay (Yountville)

description: This full-bodied wine tastes alive and fresh, showing an abundance of fruit flavors, fine concentration and very good balance. Strawberry and raspberry notes are supported by deeper blackberry flavors, moderate tannins and good acidity for a grippy mouthfeel.
title: Bella 2016 Lily Hill Estate Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)

description: If cool-climate Petite Sirah ever becomes a trend, this bottling will lead the pack. Aromas of cracked pepper, tar and hearty black plum lead into a palate where boysenberry is lifted by white pepper, thyme and rosemary. It's zesty and fascinating.
title: Jaffurs 2016 Thompson Vineyard Petite Sirah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Intensely dark in the glass, this blend of 50% Cabernet Franc and 50% Merlot offers aromas of black currant, black cherry and mocha. A crushed-slate flavor makes for impressive minerality on the palate, where a baked-boysenberry flavor is framed by firm tannins yet a soft, mouthcoating texture.
title: Daou 2016 Seventeen Forty Reserve Red (Paso Robles)

description: This expertly blends 87% Cabernet Franc with 13% Merlot. The combination is unbeatable, characterized by graphite, cedar and a touch of reduction. Leathery texture that softens on the midpalate is robustly layered in blueberry and cinnamon.
title: Anderson Conn Valley 2016 Gustaf Cabernet Franc-Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: There is great restraint shown on this bottling of the often oily and dense variety, starting with subtle yellow apple, Meyer lemon peel and melon aromas on the nose. Baked nectarine and yellow-peach flesh show on the sip, yet there is a salty, savory aspect with orange rind and almond touches toward the finish.
title: Alta Colina 2016 Model Citizen Roussanne (Adelaida District)

description: Rounded aromas of yellow melon and orange cream make for a clean and plush nose in this blend of Grenache Blanc, Albarino, Loureiro and Viognier from the Estelle Vineyard. It's lush on the palate at first, and then tightens in structure, offering ripe but grippy flavors of creamy white peach and cherimoya.
title: McClain Cellars 2016 Kiss of Life White (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Baked strawberry is enveloped by wraparound oak in this concentrated full-bodied wine. Exotic aromas of rose accompany the fruit as substantial tannins ride along and tighten the texture.
title: MacRostie 2016 Putnam Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: It's easy to like this generous, fruity and plush-textured wine based on French grape varieties, led by 45% Tannat and followed by Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Raspberry and blackberry aromas and flavors are lightly shaded by spicy oak notes and there is a moderate dose of tannin to balance the jammy fruit character.
title: Y Rousseau 2016 Son of a Butcher Red (California)

description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Wallula (66%), Red Willow (22%) and Destiny Ridge vineyards. Light aromas of blue and black fruit with crushed gravel, spice and green herb accents are followed by soft, silky blue fruit flavors. It shows a pretty sense of styling and balance.
title: Structure 2016 Foundation Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This remarkable wine impresses in quality and price, made in tiny amounts but well worth seeking. A bright, earthy entry of wild strawberry and raspberry fill the full-bodied palate that's grippy in tension and powerful in weight.
title: Thirty-Seven 2015 Grenache (Sonoma Coast)

description: Intense aromas of smoke, black currant and crushed purple flowers make for an impressive entry to this blend of 76% Cabernet Sauvignon, 13% Cabernet Franc and 11% Petit Verdot. The palate combines the tang of plum skin and dimpled berries with flavors of peppercorn, violet and gravelly minerality.
title: Daou 2015 Soul of a Lion Red (Adelaida District)

description: The Daou brothers are intent on making this brand the most expensive and luxurious in Paso Robles. This vintage begins with intense aromas of roasted blackberry, tangy black-plum skin and crushed peppercorn. The palate is expertly layered in flavors of cassis, caramel, gravel, loam, cocoa and a hint of licorice. The tannins are firm but already approachable.
title: Patrimony 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)

description: This wine is juicy, structured and high toned, with elegant flavors of red cherry and cassis. High powered, it has contrasting notions of dried herb, clove and black pepper that play well against the fruit and a gritty oaky texture.
title: Bennett Lane 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This is a tiny production, reserve-tier wine at a fair price, high toned in red plum and savory black olive. Integrated, it offers a sturdy foundation of toasted oak and tannin midway through on the palate before finishing bright.
title: Thirty-Seven 2015 Reserve Merlot (Sonoma County)

description: Black-cherry and blackberry aromas are framed by oak tones and lifted by crushed flowers on the nose of this bottling, which evolves quite quickly as it sits in the glass. Tangy black-plum-skin flavors are tart and tightly wound on the palate, graced with a pinch of pepper on the finish.
title: Santa Barbara Winery 2015 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Dusty tobacco and dark chocolate are buoyed by big expansive tannins in this full-bodied, bulky and brawny wine. Smoky oak and dried herb with cedar round out the profile.
title: Bell 2015 Merlot (Yountville)

description: This immensely concentrated and densely layered wine is impressive for its deep dark color, intense blackberry and dark-chocolate aromas, saturated blueberry flavors and a thick wrapping of fine-grained tannins. Fans of big rich wines will love it now, with a roasted or grilled chunk of meat, and it will age well. Best after 2023.
title: Binz 2015 Oleta Vineyard Petite Sirah (Fiddletown)

description: Smooth and grippy, this wine offers a beautiful undercurrent of balanced bright acidity, which lifts the richness of the fruit to new levels. Blueberry, black cherry and graphite combine with ease around powerful dusty tannin and toasted oak.
title: Alpha Omega 2015 Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: This blends the main variety with 16% Malbec and smaller pinches of Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. The resulting wine is robust and well built, softly structured and punctuated in flavors of bold red cherry and plum. Rich, it shows some restraint and ultimately balance, the fruit integrated with oak and tannin.
title: J. Davies 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)

description: Reduced at first, this wine comes around to reveal soft layers of baked plum, graham cracker and coffee. Full bodied and ripe, it offers a balanced oak nuance and a soft texture that speaks to the varietal character.
title: Grgich Hills 2015 Estate Grown Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Earthy cedar gives this wine a savory character that impresses, as well as a well-integrated core of chalky tannin, moderate oak and black-cherry ripeness. It provides substantial mouthfeel and approachability.
title: V. Sattui 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Toasty black-cherry jam meets smoky oak in this robust, rich varietal wine, blended with a small amount of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Abundantly ripe, it finishes soft and round.
title: Stephanie 2014 Malbec (Napa Valley)

description: Slightly sour boysenberry aromas meet with caramel, fudge and oak on the nose of this blend of Petite Sirah, Syrah and Zinfandel. Oaky flavors dominate the palate, where cooked berries and caramel lean a little bit sweet yet remain pleasurable.
title: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Brutus Private Reserve Red (Temecula Valley)

description: Tightly wound in its youth, this wine is rich and full bodied, with a baked quality to the wild strawberry and black cherry. Meaty and syrupy in thickness, it is layered and voluptuous, with finishing touches of meat and white pepper.
title: Lampyridae 2017 Grenache (Mount Veeder)

description: Cooked berry and cherry aromas meet with slate and turned loam on the nose of this bottling. Dark-berry flavors blend with campfire smoke and more rich earth on the palate.
title: Mer Soleil 2017 Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Mike Landt makes an amazingly deep, ripe Sauvignon Blanc, especially given his cool-climate location. It is rich and textural, with dense fruit flavors of melon, grapefruit and kiwi and a lush and creamy mouthfeel.
title: River's Edge 2017 Vintage Farm Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Elkton Oregon)

description: This red is floral and brimming in stony minerality. Tight-grained tannins wrap around spicy red fruit and savory notions of forest floor and black tea as full-bodied ripeness is balanced by walls of structure and fresh, juicy acidity.
title: MacPhail 2016 Pratt Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Intense and dark berry fruit meet with black pepper, roasted beef and firm oak spice on the nose of this blend of Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Candied blackberry flavors and wood spice are held together by firm, elegant tannins. Drink 2020 - 2031.
title: Longoria 2016 Evidence Red (Santa Barbara County)

description: This has balanced richness in spades, offering a full-bodied, soft embrace of caramel and creme brulee flavors. Bold and beautiful, it will appeal to fans of a fleshy style.
title: Hess Collection 2016 The Lioness Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Blackberry jelly is lifted by wood spice and strong toasted cedar aromas on the nose of this blend of 56% Syrah and 44% Cabernet Sauvignon. Roasted aromas of coffee and charred meat give savory depth to the rounder berry fruit on the palate.
title: Epiphany 2016 Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)

description: Fairly powerful aromas of black cherry and raisin meet with fudge and caramel on the nose of this ripe bottling. It's thick and lavish with chalky tannins on the palate, with rich blackberry jam and black-pepper flavors.
title: McClain Cellars 2016 Sacred Love Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Aromas of red currant paste, wood spice and crushed red flowers show on the nose of this reliable value wine. It's full and lovely on the palate with rich yet tart red cherries and a hint of lavender oil.
title: Now Presenting... 2016 Red (Paso Robles)

description: This is a moderately structured, lushly layered and unabashedly ripe white wine, rich and full-bodied in every way. Tropical mango and pineapple veer into baked flavors of additional concentration and voluptuousness.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Bow Tie Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The aromas are light and a bit difficult to tease out initially, with notes of cedar box, green pepper, spice and raspberry. Light but juicy fruit flavors follow, with the tannins giving a firm, slightly astringent squeeze. It intrigues, but the variety seems difficult to find.
title: Seven Hills 2016 Seven Hills Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Wet stone and black-plum aromas show on the fairly reserved nose of this bottling. The palate is tightly wound and very dry, with only touches of dark fruit and violets coming through the veil at this point.
title: McClain Cellars 2016 Painted Dreams Petit Verdot (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: The aromas offer notes of dried cherry and licorice, with the fruit seeming a bit desiccated. Ripe, full-bodied flavors follow. The fruit seems dried out, but it still provides enjoyment.
title: Seven Hills 2016 McClellan Estate Vineyard Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Jalapeno, green pepper and leafy herb aromas are at the fore, followed by notes of graphite, cherry and spice. Dried-out, slightly medicinal-seeming flavors follow.
title: Seven Hills 2016 Cabernet Franc (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Garden herb, dried cherry, leather and spice lead to somewhat lighter-styled golden raisin flavors backed by quite gritty tannins with medicinal accents. It doesn't all come together, seeming dried out.
title: Seven Hills 2016 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)

description: Loads of white pepper and caraway spice up the backdrop of black-plum paste on the awesome nose of this bottling. There is tons of zippy acidity on the palate, where snappy boysenberry and white-pepper spices deliver immense energy.
title: Zotovich 2016 Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Brawny in supple baked black fruit, this wine is largely concentrated and robust in dense, secondary waves of mocha, black licorice and vanilla. Complex elements of dried herb and sage nip at the palate with ease, complementing the undeniable richness.
title: Jayson 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: A bright floral fragrance of rose rises seamlessly on the nose of this wine, as a full-bodied concentration of black raspberry develops on the palate. Asian spice, forest floor and black tea underline its varietal power and exoticism.
title: MacRostie 2016 Wohler Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From a vineyard that's one of this appellation's closest to the Monterey Bay, this bottling is tightly woven on the nose with lime pith, chalk, Meyer lemon, lily and a hint of apple flesh aromas. It's very taut on the palate, with honeysuckle, apple blossom and Key lime pie flavors.
title: Scheid 2016 Escolle Road Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A smooth black-cherry aroma meets with a touch of red flower on the nose of this Merlot, which is blended with 25% Sangiovese. The broad mouthfeel and tannic tension carry flavors of baking spice and dark fruit.
title: McClain Cellars 2016 Purpose Road Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: With a touch of reduction in its tightly wound youth, this red shows plenty of juicy black cherry to appeal from the get-go - a concentrated effort that's rich and equally generous in tannin. Lavender, black licorice and smoky oak complement the proceedings.
title: B Cellars 2016 Manzana Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The aromas start out light, with notes of blackberry, herb, sagebrush, olive, dried flower and cherry reduction. The palate is balled up in the middle, with the tannins seeming a bit clenched out of the gate, spreading out with a few days open. A warm finish caps it off. Give it a few years in the bottle or an extended decant.
title: Avennia 2016 Le Corbeau Discovery Vineyard Syrah (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: This medium-bodied wine has lots of fruit, light oak spices and a firm, lightly tannic texture. Raspberries and raisins are the key flavors and though almost sweet, they are balanced by good acidity and grippy tannins.
title: Naggiar 2016 Il Nonno Estate Reserve Red (Nevada County)

description: From an estate site in Pope Valley that rises to an elevation of 1,000-feet, this impresses in high-toned raspberry and cassis fruitiness, accompanied by an aromatic note of violet. Well structured and full bodied, it has secondary characteristics of cedar and dried herb, the oak supportive and not in the way. This will do well in the cellar; enjoy best from 2025 - 2030.
title: Gratus 2015 Estate Grown Malbec (Napa Valley)

description: Tar, charred beef, purple flowers, crushed slate and elderberry jam make an attention-grabbing aromatic entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite tart and taut, with peppery spice, rustic elderberry and new leather flavors.
title: Jaffurs 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Perhaps the ripest version to date of this reserve-level wine, sourced (along with the reserve and old-vine bottlings) from the Ridgecrest vineyard, this shows concentrated dark berry and cherry fruit, with full-bodied roundly appealing flavors. There's just enough acid to keep it afloat as it wraps itself in a chocolatey finish.
title: Chehalem 2015 Statement Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: This combines 80% Cabernet Sauvignon with 15% Malbec and 5% Petite Sirah, and the resulting wine is juicy in red currant and cherry. Huge tannins contrast against bright underlying acidity for a satisfying, full-bodied experience in rich ripe fruit.
title: Gratus 2015 Estate Grown Red (Napa Valley)

description: This is the first clonally labeled Cabernet I am aware of in the state. Herb and flower aromas are out front and make an impression. Over time, notes of dark cherry, anise and earth emerge. There's a lovely sense of delicacy to the palate, though the tannins seem dry, unresolved and gruff, with a touch of bitterness. Best after 2022.
title: Seven Hills 2015 Clone 191 Summit View Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Quite tarry on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of sweet black cherry, charcoal and violets. There is a lot of crushed peppercorn and Indian spice on the palate, which gives depth to the very rich and extracted Concord grape flavors.
title: Ferguson Crest 2015 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This wine has a tannic, oaky entry that persists on the midpalate to reveal full-bodied concentration. Crunchy red-fruit takes on a cherry-cola character that's lush and round.
title: Kenwood 2015 Olivet Lane Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a gorgeous, memorable and classically styled wine, grippy in tannin and a leathery texture that's complex and complicated. Black pepper, black cherry and toasted oak give it definition that evolves stunningly in the glass.
title: Alpha Omega 2015 Thomas Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)

description: This wine is 100% varietal, aged in a mixture of French and other European oak (55% new). The aromas offer notes of wood, vanilla, dried cherry and herb. Plentiful, full-bodied cranberry flavors follow. The tannins give an astringent squeeze that distracts.
title: Maryhill 2015 Vineyard Series Art Den Hoed Petite Sirah (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: This is 100% varietal, aged 20 months in a mixture of American and European oak (40% new). It's quite light in color with an orange rim. The aromas offer notes of pencil eraser, licorice, raspberry and graphite. Light, not entirely ripened fruit flavors follow. The variety seems hard to find.
title: Maryhill 2015 Vineyard Series McKinley Springs Vineyard Mourvedre (Horse Heaven Hills)

description: This Oak Knoll wine is bright, integrated, tamed in tannin and juicy. Gorgeous inviting aromatics make an immediate statement, opening the door for a stage of animated blueberry, blackberry and cassis. The texture is complex but supple and smooth.
title: Alpha Omega 2015 Sunshine Valley Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)

description: This bottling, which originates from the Corralitos area, is quite showy on the nose, with black-cherry, raspberry sorbet, vanilla and caramel aromas all prominent. It dries up a bit on the sip, where a chalky texture is wrapped around blackberry, star anise and nutmeg flavors.
title: Left Bend 2015 Gali Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz County)

description: Winemaker Jeff Ames marks his first vintage with this producer, crafting an exceptional, age-worthy wine. The tightly structured palate is youthful, coiling in flavors of black raspberry, cherry pie and supportive oak. Let this one settle a bit; enjoy 2025 - 2030.
title: Tierra Roja 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: Brawny, dense and concentrated in cassis, this is made from 54% Merlot, 45% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Petit Verdot. The Merlot shows well in its soft layers of red cherry and plum, with the Cab accentuating a backbone of graphite, toasted oak and clove. This has years to go; best 2025 - 2030.
title: Round Pond 2015 Proprietary Left Bank Red (Rutherford)

description: This wine has a bright entry of dark and red cherry and a nice grip of structure. Powerful, it provides a silky-smooth texture that's integrated with the tannins and oak, with complex accents of clove, leather and black pepper along the way.
title: Robert John 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)

description: Broadly structured and succulent, this wine offers brawny, well-integrated tannins and juicy undertones of baked plum and black cherry. With 5% Cabernet Franc, it's floral and brimming in dried herb, black pepper and tobacco.
title: Jax 2015 55 Barrels Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Initially reduced and oaky, this estate wine is intense in tar, black plum and gunpowder tones. The palate is big and ripe, with a generous feel and firm, chalky tannins. Enjoy 2025 - 2030.
title: Clif Family 2015 Croquet Vineyard Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

description: This wine from a Zin specialist has soul and spices, combining ripe and rich berry flavors with attractive hints of sage and black pepper. It is full bodied, smooth and lush in texture and offers just a touch of tannin for good structure.
title: Fiddletown Cellars 2015 Indian Creek Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)

description: A great value from the great producer, this includes 5% Touriga, 4% Petite Sirah and 1% of mixed other grapes. Together, they offer juicy cherry notes and a big imprint of toasted tannin, the backbone of oak substantial yet soft and approachable. The finish is all mocha.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This is 100% varietal and from the producer's vineyard, planted to two clones of the variety. Clove, caramel and dusty sage flavors guide a powerful, integrated body of full ripeness, soft texture and lasting richness of graham cracker.
title: Clif Family 2015 Cold Springs Vineyard Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

description: Black-cherry and mace aromas come through on a very ripe and extracted nose for this appellation blend. It's thick on the palate, with concentrated strawberry and raspberry flavors that are cut by dried herbs and framed by chalky tannins and penetrating acidity.
title: Left Bend 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is made from estate-grown Mount Veeder grapes, as well as Oak Knoll fruit. Sanguine in black olive, it has flavors of black currant, eucalyptus and bold, brawny oak. Grippy and gritty in texture, it offers integrated tannin and substantial ripeness.
title: Darioush 2014 Signature Merlot (Napa Valley)

description: Named for the late matriarch of the property, this is a blend of 76% Cabernet Sauvignon, 19% Malbec and 5% Petit Verdot, all of it grown on hillside estate vineyards. It dances around cherry, cassis and rose petal, the core of the wine soft in integrated tannins and oak. Balanced in weight, it is undeniably lovely, complex and beautiful. It will do well in the cellar; enjoy 2024 - 2034.
title: J. Davies 2014 Jamie Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)

description: This is a "wow" wine: brawny, broad and juicy in black fruit. Blended with 5% Merlot and 4% Malbec, the grapes from the coolish appellation, it offers robust oak and tannin within savory notes of cedar, tobacco and toast. This is one worth cellaring; enjoy 2024 - 2029.
title: Darioush 2014 Darius II Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

description: With all five major Bordeaux red varieties represented, this blend is a majority Cabernet Sauvignon. An herbal, broadly defined entry of black cherry, plum and moderate structure define it, as a moderate structure of juicy tannin gives it grip.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2014 Tapestry Reserve Red (Napa Valley)

description: Bright fresh acidity wraps around darker denser flavors of blueberry, black cherry and black currant in this vineyard-designate, which is full bodied in style. It has appealing elements of dried herb and clove.
title: Peter Paul Wines 2014 Giuliani Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: A 100% varietal wine from the cool mountain appellation, this wine is lightly spiced in clove and nutmeg and has a smooth soft elegance on the palate. Red currant, plum and blackberry give it a fruity underbelly that complements the feral aspects and viscosity.
title: Paratus 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)

description: This blends a majority of Cabernet Sauvignon with smaller amounts of Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. It delivers plenty of lush layered black-currant and black-cherry flavors around softened tannin and sweet vanilla oak.
title: Darioush 2014 Caravan Red (Napa Valley)

description: Roasted figs, grilled pork, bacon fat and coffee liqueur provide a deliciously savory profile on the nose of this bottling. Blackberry juice meets with smoke on the palate, where strong tannins uphold the wine's medium weight.
title: Epiphany 2016 Colson Canyon Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: Made from 70% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Syrah, the fruit grown predominantly in Napa County, this wine is burly in cedar, herb, black currant and cassis. The tannin structure impresses in its weight and breadth, able to support the full-bodied concentration and ripeness. It finishes with grace.
title: B Cellars 2016 Blend 25 Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Napa County-Sonoma County)

description: Freshly smashed red-currant and blackberry aromas provide a bright and accessible nose. The palate is layered with tobacco, mint and plum flavors, and there is good acidic zip to the lively feel.
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Flood Family Vineyards Malbec (Santa Barbara County)

description: The savory oak tones are prominent on the nose of this bottling, which also shows cassis and peppercorn on the lavish nose. Ripe flavors of blackberry jam are cut by smoke, bacon fat and more cracked pepper on the palate.
title: Epiphany 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Softly textured and full bodied in richness and ripe concentration, this wine is woody and earthy, with a backbone of black currant, clove, black pepper and sizable grip.
title: Anderson Conn Valley 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Intriguing aromas of smoked meat, iron and herb draw you into the glass. Plump, juicy but still elegant fruit flavors follow. There's a lovely sense of balance and purity that keeps the interest up.
title: Cairdeas 2016 Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)

description: This wine offers notes of game, currant, dried cherry and clove. Intense in ripeness and high in acidity, it is a robust, full-bodied and rich red that is sure to be a crowd pleaser.
title: Jax 2016 3 Barrels Cabernet Franc (Calistoga)

description: A full-bodied combination of 60% Merlot with 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Petit Verdot, this is a grippy plummy wine of serious earthiness. It offers turned earth, compost and forest elements that compel and combine well together.
title: B Cellars 2016 Blend 27 Red (Napa Valley)

description: Roasted wood, light red fruit and leather aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Leathery tannins frame the sip, where the dark red fruit meets with smoky flavors.
title: CrЕ« 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

description: This blends 66% Cabernet Sauvignon with 28% Cabernet Franc, 4% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot. Together, they combine for a soft rounded palate of smoky cherry, currant, clove and cinnamon. A light grip of tannin gives it additional power and statement, with a finish of black pepper. Enjoy 2026 - 2031.
title: Anderson Conn Valley 2016 Eloge Red (Napa Valley)

description: Very few producers make a good domestic Marsanne, and Alta Colina is now near the top of that list. Elegant aromas of white-fleshed fruit and lime rinds meet with honey dust on the nose. The palate is very tense with chalky texture and a lemony edge giving nuance to the broad yellow-apple, chamomile and honey-butter flavors.
title: Alta Colina 2016 Claudia Cuvee Marsanne (Adelaida District)

description: This offers tremendous aromas of coffee and toffee, so inviting in their warmth and richness. A dusty leathery palate follows, structured in ageable firm tannin and robust flavors of black plum. This is worth cellaring; best 2026 - 2031.
title: Anderson Conn Valley 2016 Aurum Red (Napa Valley)

description: Macerated red plum is lifted by clove, allspice and an intriguing marzipan touch on the nose of this wine from a vineyard planted in 2006. The Christmas spice and gingerbread aromas are integrated into the plum and cherry backdrop.
title: Tantara 2016 Tondre Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Dark and brooding aromas of peppercorn-crusted beef steak, teriyaki, blueberry and wood smoke make for a savory entry to this bottling. Intense blueberry, charred meat and cherry-wood flavors show on the palate, which is framed by firm mouthcoating tannins. It's a great barbecue wine.
title: Fess Parker 2016 The Big Easy Red (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is a thick, rich and rounded red, structured in complex notions of dark cherry and cassis. Billowy tannins give it a lift of texture and lightness despite its overall weight and heft. Let this sit a bit; best 2026 - 2031.
title: Anderson Conn Valley 2016 Signature Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This is a savory red, adorned in cedar, dried herb and black pepper. The aromatics are nicely defined in violet. Burly grippy tannins complement a wealth of ripe plum and graphite.
title: Anderson Conn Valley 2016 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This has both lush tannin and tangy acidity, the two complementing each other well along a full-bodied offering of strawberry, forest floor and black tea. Savory on the nose, it remains tart on the palate in a finish of rhubarb.
title: Roadhouse Winery 2016 Green Label Sangiacomo Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a tremendous value for the quality - a youthful tightly wound wine that's still thick and tannic, with a heavy thread of leather, gunpowder and oak. Savory and substantial, it has secondary seasonings of sage and cedar that contrast well against black currant and cherry.
title: Faust 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Smoky oak and a hint of citrus combine in complementary ways in this earthy, rich and full-bodied red. Cherry-cola and vanilla flavors provide a burly fruity experience on the boldly built palate.
title: Roadhouse Winery 2016 Purple Label Silver Pines Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Barnyardy earth and leather combine around spicy, robust tannin and a wealth of full-bodied fruit. Black cherry and strawberry take on ripe bold richness that persist throughout the rich palate.
title: Roadhouse Winery 2016 Black Label Nunes Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Always one of the most immediately delicious and powerful wines in the Daou brothers' portfolio, this blend of 42% Cabernet Sauvignon, 42% Syrah and 16% Petit Verdot shows intense black fruit, roasted coffee and charred meat on the nose. It's luxuriously soft yet firmly framed by polished tannins on the palate, where black plum, espresso and caramel flavors dominate.
title: Daou 2015 Mayote Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Adelaida District)

description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Woodward Canyon Estate, Champoux, Sagemoor and Spring Creek vineyards. Despite seeing just 50% new oak, aromas of baking spice and vanilla are at the fore at present, in front of notes of herb and cherry. The palate brings a suave feel, with a lovely sense of texture, dipping in the middle before coming back together. The oak influence is intense right now. Give it time to settle in. Best after 2023.
title: Woodward Canyon 2015 Artist Series #24 Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)

description: The winery produces two Pinots from estate vineyards planted in the 1970s. This is aged 10 months in half new French oak, and seems to be maturing quickly. Strawberry preserves, vanilla cream and a dash of bitter herbs are in play, with the new oak somewhat restrained. The high alcohol gives it a bit of a burn in the finish.
title: River's Edge 2015 Elkton Vineyard Pinot Noir (Elkton Oregon)
