description: The aromas of licorice, herb, tire rubber, raspberry and cherry bring a sense of delineation. The palate is plump in the middle, less so around the edges. There are a lot of interesting parts, but they don't fit together at present.
title: Seven Hills 2015 Klipsun Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)

description: Thick and richly built with bright red fruit, this has integrated tannin and oak. A touch of grip rides around the edges of the fruit and clove spice, which are nuanced in layers of black licorice, blueberry and cassis. Full bodied, the wine has a wealth of minerality at its core.
title: Alpha Omega 2015 Beckstoffer Las Piedras Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)

description: Crushed black currant, elderberry, mint and damp forest aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a taut texture to the palate, where robust tannins uphold blackberry and purple-flower flavors, all leveled by decent acidity.
title: Cinnabar 2015 Petit Verdot (Paso Robles)

description: Quiet aromatically, this bold, reserve-tier wine includes 8% Petite Sirah. Thick and softly layered in blue fruit, it also offers meaty leather and black pepper amongst waves of rich concentration.
title: Francis Coppola 2015 Reserve Syrah (Dry Creek Valley)

description: From a valley floor vineyard in the warmer northern climes of the valley, this 100% varietal red is broad and generous in black brambly fruit that veers into a rich rounded taste of vanilla. Soft texture makes it approachable and enjoyable in its youth.
title: Davies 2015 Winfield Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)

description: Blending in tiny amounts of Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Malbec, this robustly concentrated red is given nearly two years in French oak, much of it new. It offers leathery sinew, bombastic tannins that should shake out in time, and classic elements of cedar, pencil shavings and currant. This is for fans of power.
title: Melmar Wines 2015 Signature Edition Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: Rich aromas of dark plum, sagebrush, cola and black cherry make for a rather thick and ripe aromatic entry to this appellation blend. It is also thick on the palate, where dark-cherry flavors make for a ripe and structured experience.
title: Cinnabar 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: The aromas are light and hard to tease out, with whiffs of herb and spice. The flavors are light but juicy and ripe, painting around the edges with firm tannins in the middle. Give it time to open.
title: Vino La Monarcha 2015 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Very savory on the nose, this bottling offers charred meat, burned soy and tangy black plums on the umami-driven nose. The palate shows a more floral side, with violets, lilacs and jasmine before leading back toward roasted beef aromas. It is a very complex wine.
title: Dragonette 2014 MJM Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: Petite Sirah isn't known for aging well, and this one is already starting to show a little why, with lots of prune, raisin and coffee-liqueur elements on the nose. The acid pops and tannins firm up on the palate, which is lavish with cooked blackberry fruit.
title: Seven Angels 2014 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

description: Rounded aromas of dark strawberry, black pepper, smoke and vanilla show on the nose of this bottling by the Riboli family. It's smooth and very drinkable on the palate, with flavors of French toast, red plum and dark strawberry jelly.
title: Opaque 2013 Malbec (Paso Robles)

description: Light in the glass, this blend of 61% Grenache Blanc, 32% Viognier and 7% Picpoul offers approachable aromas of ripe apples, poached pear and light smoke. The palate is broad with very ripe flavors of roasted apple and pear, cut by a lime-pith edge.
title: Chronic Cellars 2017 Stone Fox White (Paso Robles)

description: Lovely aromas of candied boysenberry, dark red cherry, crushed lavender, cracked white pepper and dried sage sticks show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard located high above the Ballard Canyon appellation. There is a great freshness on the palate, where flavors of lavender and violet meet with peppery spice, berry fruit and a tarry edge.
title: Beckmen 2016 Purisima Mountain Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)

description: The investment in quality promised by this winery's new owners, O'Neill Vintners & Distillers, seem to be paying off in the recent releases. This blend of 34% Grenache, 34% Syrah and 32% Mourvedre shows aromas of black currant, violet and soil on the rich nose. The palate is intense in flavors of meat and black fruit, yet lifted by a hint of lavender and framed by balanced tannins and acidity.
title: Robert Hall 2016 Cavern Select G-S-M (Paso Robles)

description: Sourced from the region's most historic vineyard, this wine starts with aromas of racy boysenberry, exotic black plum and wood smoke. The palate combines flavors of smoke, snappy berries and red currants with a floral aspect.
title: Robert Hall 2016 Cavern Select Dusi Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

description: Aromas of gun smoke, herb, raspberry, cranberry and fire pit are followed by sweet, well-balanced raspberry jam flavors. There is a lot to like.
title: Casa Smith 2016 Cinghiale Wahluke Slope & Rosebud Vineyards Sangiovese (Wahluke Slope)

description: Raspberry jam aromas are at the fore, followed by notes of spice, ash and cherry. Light, tart, plump-feeling jammy fruit flavors follow. It brings appeal.
title: Casa Smith 2016 Porcospino Northridge Vineyard Primitivo (Wahluke Slope)

description: The smoke, tire rubber and raspberry aromas seem unusual. The candied cranberry and cherry flavors are lighter styled. It's a unique, not entirely successful offering of the variety.
title: Casa Smith 2016 Cervo Northridge Vineyard Barbera (Wahluke Slope)

description: Brawny and rich, this is a stemmy and juicy wine, fruity in dark blueberry and blackberry fruit. Asian spice and cinnamon cola round out the full-bodied ripe experience.
title: Portalupi 2016 Dolinsek Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is 100% varietal and remarkably impressive, true to its grape in earthy aromas of violet and sage. The mountainous appellation contributes girth and breadth, as well as densely layered texture and grip. Around the fullness are beautiful flavors of chocolate, graham cracker and blueberry. This will cellar well; enjoy best 2025 - 2030.
title: Mt. Brave 2015 Cabernet Franc (Mount Veeder)

description: The nose on this blend of 80% Syrah and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon starts with boysenberry, caramel, cocoa and fresh purple-flower aromas. The palate is framed by lush tannins, carrying a black cherry flavor that leads into a coffee and creme brulee finish.
title: Justin 2015 Savant Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: Joyous aromas of black currant are spiced by pepper and charred meat on the nose. There's a violet aspect to the palate that floats above a backdrop of game, singed sage and coffee flavors.
title: Robert Hall 2015 Cavern Select Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)

description: The aromas are reserved out of the gate, with notes of blackberry, smoked meat, green herb and exotic spices all wound up incredibly tightly. Over time, notes of green olive, violet, orange peel and ash emerge. The palate is rich but supple. It shows a bit of astringency at present. Best after 2020.
title: K Vintners 2015 The Hidden Northridge Vineyard Syrah (Wahluke Slope)

description: Dark aromas of blackberry, baked earth, licorice and chaparral scrub show on the nose of this rich and extracted bottling. The palate is also lush and juicy with black-currant and caramel flavors, yet held in check by chalky tannins.
title: Robert Hall 2015 Cavern Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)

description: 42% Mourvedre, 28% Syrah and 16% Grenache make up the majority of this wine, with the balance Counoise, Cinsault, Picpoul and Grenache Blanc. Aromas of overripe-seeming cherry, raspberry, black pepper, herb and spice are followed by tart flavors that show more of the same. The tannins seem clenched.
title: K Vintners 2015 Charlotte Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

description: Lavish oak spices soften and complement the concentrated fruit flavors of this full-bodied, thickly textured wine. It shows hints of wood smoke and baking spices in the aroma and cinnamon and cardamom notes on the palate as a rich layer of fine-grained tannins coats the tongue. It's delicious and stylish.
title: Amador Cellars 2015 Karmere Vineyards Petite Sirah (Amador County)

description: A mountain-grown wine blended with 10% Petit Verdot, this impresses in its ability to offer power and elegance in equal measure. Cinnamon, baked plum and dark cherry ride along a soft, structured and age-worthy wine, which shows a touch of reduction, espresso bean and dusty rock minerality.
title: La Jota Vineyard 2015 Merlot (Howell Mountain)

description: Brightly woven in cassis and black raspberry, this is a blockbuster wine, sumptuous and seductive in enviable structure and complexity. Polished tannins wrap around a rich, balanced core of rounded fruit, with a bite of cedar and oak vying for attention.
title: Alpha Omega 2015 ERA Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This blend is rich in feel, with elongated tannins to support the full body. Elements of lavender and sage accent a core of black licorice and ripe plum on the palate.
title: William Hill Estate 2015 Bench Red (Napa Valley)

description: Rich boysenberry flavors and a hint of sweetness make this wine easy to sip in spite of its full body and rather thick tannins. It delivers blackberry-jam and mocha accents while the broad texture seems to coat the sides of the mouth.
title: Vezer Family Vineyard 2015 Cassie Petite Sirah (Suisun Valley)

description: Rich, tannic and woody, this wine is robust in big black fruit, espresso and toasted oak. It is youthful in dense concentration and structure, a worthy showcase of the variety grown in a wild cool-climate appellation that appears to love it with abandon. Enjoy 2025 - 2030.
title: Mt. Brave 2015 Merlot (Mount Veeder)

description: Blended with 11% Petit Verdot, then aged more than two years in 100% new French oak, this is built for power, exhibiting hugely tannic structure and vanilla oak. Black currant, cedar and dried herb dot the palate before a dense richness of chocolate comes to the fore.
title: Merus 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)

description: This wine opens in cedar and dried herb earthiness and swiftly expands into a world of broad, exuberant red cherry and cassis. It balances its full-bodied power with grace and dusty oak, the tannins relatively tamed.
title: Christophe 2015 Explorer's Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)

description: This is a grippy, dense and powerful red, blended with 5% Petit Verdot. Approachable in its youth, it shows strong flavors of red currant, cherry and coconut, with a lushness that lingers on the finish.
title: Altvs 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)

description: Boysenberry, mocha, tar, roasted meat and mint show on the nose of this bottling from southern California. Rocky tarry flavors arise on the palate, with a slightly primary boysenberry-juice backbone.
title: Hawk Watch Winery 2015 Solo Barrique Syrah (South Coast)

description: Winemaker Genevieve Janssens blends 85% Cabernet Sauvignon from Hendry Ranch with 15% from Detert East Vineyard along the Oakville bench to produce this lovely, memorable and complex wine. Leathery and savory in black pepper, black currant and licorice, it features soft, plush tannins and beautiful aromas of violet that linger throughout.
title: Portfolio 2014 Limited Edition Red (Napa Valley)

description: Sweet and dark aromas of blackberry, dark chocolate, mint and charcoal show on the nose of this bottling. It's quite thick on the palate with strong tannins that cut the extracted black-currant and cigar-box flavors.
title: Clos La Chance 2014 Reserve Malbec (Central Coast)

description: This is a stunningly beautiful wine at this price point, age-worthy and complex, it will stay with you long after it's gone. Opening in cedar, clove and cinnamon, it follows with a dusting of cocoa powder and toasted oak, before it offers a lingering thread of mineral in the form of crushed rock, violet, red and black currant. Structured as it goes, it finishes soft and silky. This is a wine for the cellar as well.
title: Lail 2016 Blueprint Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Cola and Dr. Pepper aromas meet with dark plum and black cherry on the dynamic nose of this bottling. The intense Dr. Pepper flavors also show on the palate, where tense tannins also deliver floral flavors of lilac and rosewater. It's quite an intriguing and full sip.
title: Bolt To Wines 2016 Sidekick by Karin Langer Grenache (Ballard Canyon)

description: This is a substantial blend of 68% Cabernet Sauvignon and 32% Cabernet Franc. Peppery, leathery and meaty, it has plenty of weight on offer and grippy tannins, the fruit leaning into savory black currant and a side helping of tobacco. Let this one sit a bit; enjoy best from 2021 - 2026.
title: B Cellars 2016 Blend 26 Cabernet Sauvignon-Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling smells of concentrated black plum, black currant and violet on the nose. The palate shows Concord grape sauce on roasted beef flavors, along with licorice and tarragon, and grows very tangy by the finish.
title: Cloak & Dagger 2016 The Conspirator Reserve Syrah (Paso Robles)

description: Gamy aromas of lamb roast, rosemary, lavender and white pepper create an excellent cool-climate expression on this bottling by Chris Kiranbay. The palate is overloaded with green peppercorns, thyme and immense herbal and peppery spices deep into the finish.
title: Saint K 2016 Days Gone By Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of flower, fresh and dried herb, wet iron and blue and purple fruit. There's a pretty sense of purity and richness to the tightly wound blue fruit flavors, though they bring a bit of alcoholic heft along with them. Smoked meat notes linger on the finish.
title: Avennia 2016 Arnaut Boushey Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)

description: Coming from a hot appellation in a hot vintage, this wine offers aromas of dark roasted coffee, ham and green herb - a strange mix. Somewhat lighter-styled cranberry and cherry flavors follow.
title: Noviello 2015 Syrah (Red Mountain)

description: Gorgeous floral aromas and a rich, dense palate of saturated black fruits give power and breadth to this full-bodied and firmly textured wine. Aromas of violet, cinnamon and sandalwood make way for very ripe black-cherry and blueberry flavors underlain with firm but very fine-grained tannins.
title: Mirror 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This is a meaty, thick version of the variety from a well-farmed site. It shows a density of tannic structure that wraps around elements of leather, tar, oak and brawny black pepper. The fruit broods appropriately in blackberry and blueberry richness.
title: B Cellars 2016 Kick Ranch Syrah (Sonoma County)

description: This full-bodied wine is bold and straightforward, with just a little oak spiciness and a generous supply of black-fruit flavors and fine-grained tannins. It has a sense of layering and creaminess that keeps it drinkable despite the tannic grip. Best after 2023.
title: Concannon 2016 Captain Joe's Reserve Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)

description: Rarely is Grenache the best grape to lay down in the cellar, but this bottling has the bones and pedigree to qualify. Plump berry, cherry and red-currant fruits have a floral edge on the nose, while the palate is very grippy with tannins that hold the sumac and tart cherry flavors tightly. Drink 2020 - 2026.
title: Jaffurs 2016 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)

description: This big, rigidly structured wine is full in body, firm with tannins, and shows blunt-edged blackberry flavors that are tightly wrapped by the texture.
title: Sobon Estate 2016 ReZerve Petite Sirah (Amador County)

description: A rare wine coming from the Oregon side of the Columbia Valley, its subdued aromas of spice, tire rubber and dried dark fruit are followed by ripe raspberry and cherry flavors and a cranberry-filled finish. It all seems a bit overripe.
title: Adega Northwest 2015 Firethorn Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (OR))

description: This is a peppery, spicy wine that has a leathery, full-bodied feel. Succulent waves of blueberry are velvety smooth on the palate, offering an impressive marriage between richness and balance. The blend is mostly Merlot, with Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot.
title: Kenzo Estate 2015 Murasaki Estate Bottled Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)

description: A woody and herbal nose follows through to the structured, rich palate, along with sage and cedar. Black cherry and currant define the flavors, while toasted oak lends support. The blend is 47% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Merlot, 10% Cabernet Franc, 6% Petit Verdot and 4% Malbec. Enjoy 2025 - 2030.
title: Kenzo Estate 2015 Rindo Estate Bottled Red (Napa Valley)

description: Dried herb, cedar and pencil shavings mark this rich, full-bodied wine that offers earth and plum flavors. Robust and concentrated, it holds its density well, allowing room for the fruit to breathe, all while seasoned in clove and black pepper.
title: Kenzo Estate 2015 Ai Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This blends 79% Cabernet Sauvignon with 16% Merlot, 3% Malbec and 1% each of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. The brawny nose opens in black currant and licorice, paving the way for the bold, rich flavors of lavender, blueberry and graham cracker to come.
title: Pahlmeyer 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)

description: High in acidity and crisp red fruit, this wine contrasts with a bold tannic backbone of powerful concentration and richness. Juicy red cherry and cola persist along a through line of focused flavor.
title: Encanto 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Italian grapes seem to excel in the Temecula Valley's warm climate, and this is no exception. Light in the glass, the Barbera offers mace and nutmeg aromas against a raspberry-liqueur background. The palate blends cola spice with smooth dried red cherry and a long fennel-laced finish.
title: Europa Village 2014 Vienza Barbera (Temecula Valley)

description: Bold and spicy, this high-octane wine starts with salt and pepper aromas, and delivers intense black-pepper and black-cherry flavors on a firm palate bolstered by fine-grained tannins. Winemaker Matt Cline included 11% Petite Sirah, 9% Carignan and 2% Black Malvoisie in the blend.
title: Three 2016 Live Oak Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

description: A juicy midpalate of raspberry and black cherry is met by polished tannin and integrated oak in this well-made wine from a soft, approachable vintage.
title: Bennett Lane 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This is a reduced, tight and robustly ripe wine, grippy in structure and a lasting taste of black pepper and gunpowder. Black-licorice, black-cherry and blackberry flavors round out the experience.
title: Waypoint 2014 Oakville Ranch Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)

description: This wine offers cool-climate characteristics of spice, turned earth and pencil. Its plummy fruit is largely structured around a robust body of power and weight. Aged in both French and American oak, it persists on the finish in a mix of black pepper and sage.
title: Crosby Roamann 2013 Merlot (Oak Knoll District)

description: Violets, lilacs, black fruits and star anise make for a very showy nose on this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Very floral flavors arise on the sip, where grainy tannins carry ripe black-plum-paste flavors.
title: Black Ridge 2013 San Andreas Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Light aromas of cranberry, candied strawberry and dried herbs make for a pleasant and interesting nose on this bottling. The palate combines cinnamon and sumac with red plums and more strawberries, going down much with much less drama than the dark espionage-themed label implies.
title: Cloak & Dagger 2016 The Defector Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

description: This deep and concentrated wine seems to have a story to tell. Hints of rosemary and clove accent dark black-cherry and raspberry flavors that layer through the rich texture and seem to accelerate on the finish. It's an unusually expressive and complex Zinfandel that was aged in 37% new French and American barrels, and contains 14% Petite Sirah plus smaller amounts of Carignan and Alicante.
title: Three 2016 Bigelow Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

description: An exciting focus helps this wine stand out. It is full bodied, dry and well-concentrated, offering fresh black-cherry and cedar aromas, deep fruit flavors accented by light smoky peppery spices and a nicely firm texture that is moderately tannic. The complexity is partly due to 15% Petite Sirah in the blend, and aging in 35% new American and French oak barrels.
title: Three 2016 Evangelho Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

description: A richer style of Syrah, this bottling offer baked black cherry, blueberry sorbet, lilac and baking spice on the nose. The palate is lavish and loaded with black fruits and jasmine flavors, framed by buoyant acidity.
title: Roblar 2016 Estate Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This full-bodied wine has a concentrated berry and cherry essence that makes it easy to sip and enjoy. A touch of raspberry in the aroma and a hint of baking spices on the palate make it all the more tasty.
title: Three 2016 Old Vines Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)

description: Fruity and robust, this big-boned, ripe varietal wine is softly layered in baked strawberry, vanilla and cola. The oak is supportive and smoky.
title: Kokomo 2016 Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)

description: This is a deep and dark take on Merlot, with aromas of fudge, black cherry, wet gravel and cigar box. The palate offers roasted wood and dark prune-like fruits, but impresses mostly with its weight and structure.
title: Broken Earth 2016 Limited Release Merlot (Paso Robles)

description: This wine is woody and herbal on the nose, thick and grippy on the palate, a study in black fruit intensity and sizable tannin.
title: Longwood 2016 Family Reserve Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

description: Elegant black cherry, star anise and mace make for a fresh but spicy nose on this single-vineyard expression in a new Zinfandel project by the Kathryn Hall wine family. Luscious flavors of blackberry sorbet are wrapped in an earthy structure, with layers of rosemary and roasted beef arising through the sip. The acid-washed finished is laced with pepper.
title: Baca 2016 Double Dutch Dusi Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

description: This is a meaty and thick wine, brimming in blueberry, violet and licorice. Full bodied and intensely ripe, it presents as smooth and richly woven on the palate.
title: Flanagan 2016 Syrah (Bennett Valley)

description: Dark and thick in appearance, this estate blend from winemaker Adam Henkel and proprietor Roger Bower shows a tremendous cassis aroma, with splashes of smoke, dried purple flowers and baking spice. The palate begins with a lavish entry of polished tannins that still have some teeth, providing tension that carries the dark fruit flavors deep into the finish.
title: Crown Point 2015 Estate Selection Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: This winery is focused on setting a new benchmark for what Cabernet Sauvignon from Santa Barbara can be, and this bottling is its best yet. Beautifully layered aromas of black cherry, baking spice, star anise and crushed slate lead into a roasted palate of black plum and chai spices, with acid that carries into the finish.
title: Crown Point 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: Tart tangy acidity veers into a disjointed quality that's sour on the palate in this hearty wine that veers on overripe. Bulky oak masks flavors of cherry, plum and dried herb.
title: Muscardini 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyards Merlot (Sonoma Valley)

description: From the wilds of the appellation and blended with 16% Merlot and 9% Cabernet Franc, this wine is dense, layered and soft - a robust expression of chocolate, caramel and juicy blackberry. The oak is well integrated and supportive of polished powerful tannins.
title: Sill Family 2015 Tres Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)

description: Boysenberry, dried lavender and dark-soil aromas show compellingly in this bottling, which is darkened by 15% Petite Sirah. The acid-driven sip offers tart and dark berries, proving very fresh and poppy on the palate.
title: Sculpterra 2015 Estate Mourvedre (Paso Robles)

description: This is a brawny and broad reserve-level wine that's grippy and dusty in tannins. Powerful red fruit matches the rich concentration, the acidity textured and well-integrated to offer complementary brightness in contrast to the big flavor.
title: Kokomo 2015 Ruth's Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)

description: Concentrated red-cherry aromas meet with caramel, baking spice and vanilla brioche on the nose of this bottling. Ripe red-fruit flavors are lifted by red licorice and more caramel on the palate, which rides through chunky tannins and finishes on vanilla.
title: Wilson Creek 2015 Winemaker's Reserve Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)

description: Roasted black cherries, toasted wood, a pinch of pepper and the slightest hint of green herbs show on the nose of this bottling. The entry to the palate is very smooth with dark fruits, but there's also a hint of Cab Franc's herbal side, with a bit of mint. The finish is oak dominant.
title: Grassini 2014 Cabernet Franc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)

description: With 5% Merlot blended in, this beastly wine boasts bright tones of cassis and currant, with lingering accents of coconut and vanilla. Big, dense and concentrated, it has a ton of structure, grippy tannin and oak.
title: Roots Run Deep Winery 2014 The Valedictorian Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)

description: Rich and roasty on the nose, this bottling offers charred blackberry, peppercorns, tar, coffee and grape seed on the nose. The palate is rounded and smoky as well, with grilled black-plum and fig flavors lifted by pepper dust and well integrate purple flowers. This feels lavish but high-toned due strong acid.
title: Bolt To Wines 2016 Sidekick By Karin Langer Syrah (Ballard Canyon)

description: It's a bit puzzling how such ripeness and high alcohol can be achieved in this cool climate AVA, but it's a house signature across the entire portfolio. This old-vine fruit brings strawberry and cherry flavors with brambly herbs. The tannins are firm and aging in 50% new French oak has added flavors of toasted hazelnuts. The high alcohol gives it a bit of a burn in the finish.
title: River's Edge 2015 Black Oak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Elkton Oregon)

description: This is a big bold wine, layered in concentrated flavors of cassis and red currant that present as sanguine and woody. Gritty, sizable tannins add intensity and boldness to the hugely ripe style of the wine.
title: Bennett Lane 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Blackberry-sorbet, teriyaki, candied-purple-flower and dark-chocolate-syrup aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which is starting to show a touch of age already. Framed by chalky tannins, the palate combines tangy black-plum fruit with roasted coffee, caramel and peppery spice.
title: Westerly 2014 Cote Blonde Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This is a reduced, thick and richly intense wine from the mountain appellation. It is robust in black fruit and grippy tannin. The fruit takes on a baked quality that works within its context of savory tobacco, clove and black pepper.
title: Waypoint 2014 Tierra Buena Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)

description: Extraordinarily deep and resonant in a black fruit flavor, this is a full-bodied wine that has great focus and a moderate layer of tannins to offer grip. Black berry, plum and cherry flavors all contribute to the palate and keep reverberating on the finish.
title: Shannon Ridge 2017 High Elevation Collection Zinfandel (Lake County)

description: From another great site farmed by the famous Beckstoffer, this is grainy, textured and robustly ripe. Powerfully built to age and impress, it offers a wealth of lush, layered blue fruit and black licorice, as well as impressive structure. Enjoy 2026 - 2031.
title: Boich 2016 Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Aromas of dark red-cherry paste, star anise, mace, tar and rose show on the nose of this bottling. There's a rocky, loamy kick to the palate, followed by rounded plum, jasmine tea and strawberry flavors.
title: Wilson Creek 2016 Winemaker's Select Cinsault (Temecula Valley)

description: This is a monster wine that goes for broke in terms of big bold flavors, full body and massive tannins. The color is black almost to the rim, the aromas are peppery and espresso-like, while the flavors are full of black fruit but also tightly strapped in by tannins. The wine could open up with extended aging, so it's best to drink after 2025.
title: Lava Cap 2015 Reserve Petite Sirah (El Dorado)

description: Elegantly woven aromas of purple flowers, blackberry syrup and charred meats make for a rich aromatic entry to this bottling. The flavors are more reserved, showing dark fruit and baking spice, all wrapped in strong acidity with potential to be even more delicious.
title: Seven Angels 2015 Syrah (Paso Robles)

description: This full-bodied elevated-alcohol wine offers an enticing salt and pepper aroma followed by meaty wood-smoke accents that complement the underlying blackberry flavors. It matches the grapey fruitiness of the wine with oak accents and a just-firm enough texture.
title: Wood Family Vineyards 2016 Big Wood Zinfandel (Livermore Valley)

description: Caramel, chocolate and violet paste make for a very ripe aroma set on the nose of this bottling. It's thick on the palate, with heavy blackberry and fudge flavors, framed by firm tannins.
title: Seven Angels 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

description: Light in the glass for a dessert wine, this unique bottling of late harvest Pinot Noir offers raisin, sandalwood and cedar on the nose. The palate is ripe and pruney with flavors of sour raisin and smoked cedar.
title: Byington 2014 Euphoria Late Harvest Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This fortified rose is in its own class. With 110 g/L of residual sugar and 18.5% alcohol, this is close to a Port in its overall makeup. It has concentrated flavors of marzipan, candied fruits, orange marmalade and rock candy. Drink now and over the next five years.
title: Bjornson 2016 Ratafia Rose (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: As one of the more expressive dessert wines from the region, this bottling offers aromas of candied honeysuckle, tuberose, plumeria and lime balm on the nose. The unctuous and thick palate is balanced by a slick acidity, allowing honey, flowers and citrus flavors to make for an ambrosial experience.
title: Williams Selyem 2016 Vista Verde Vineyard Late Harvest Gewurztraminer (San Benito County)

description: Dark and hearty aromas of blackberry syrup, clove, allspice and prune show on the intense nose of this cigar-perfect Port. A black plum flavor grips the palate as espresso and raisin tones emerge, proving the overall package sweet yet spicy.
title: Williams Selyem 2012 Vista Verde Vineyard Port (San Benito County)
